Agentic AI: The Next Frontier of Cloud Intelligence (sponsored by Atos)
Agentic AI: The Next Frontier of Cloud Intelligence (sponsored by Atos)

speakers.jobTitle: Head of Data and AI, N.A.
speakers.globalJobtitle: Head of Data and AI, N.A.

title: Agentic Analytics in Action (sponsored by ZS)
abstract: Analytics and data science are at an inflection point. The first wave of agentic analytics—HITL (human-in-the-loop), goal-driven agentic AI systems that reason, plan, execute and learn across data and models—is coming to life, delivering massive value by accelerating decision velocity in organizations. In this session, ZS MAX.AI presents real-world examples of organizations using agentic forecasting, segmentation, content intelligence, on-demand customer analytics and more. We will explore the power of AWS to deploy these new-age agentic analytics systems to unlock value through specific use cases and tackle key challenges including enterprise enablement, scaling and domain customization. This presentation is brought to you by ZS, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Agentic Analytics in Action (sponsored by ZS)

title: Agentic architecting: From prototype to production-ready systems
abstract: Learn how agentic architecting transforms prototypes into production-ready systems by incorporating essential elements like security, monitoring, and CI/CD. Explore how AI-powered agents leverage AWS best practices to generate and optimize AWS CDK infrastructure and application code. Through practical examples, discover patterns for automated security improvements, monitoring implementation, and pipeline creation. This session demonstrates how to maintain AWS Well-Architected principles while accelerating development, enabling teams to focus on business logic without compromising architectural quality.

title: Agentic Code Generation for Industrial Analytics and Predictive Maintenance
abstract: Plant floor personnel face daily challenges monitoring critical equipment in real-time. While they possess deep operational expertise, they depend on IT teams for monitoring solutions and complex data analysis - creating delays and inefficiencies. Through live coding demonstrations, this session shows how Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Code Interpreter and Strands Agents enable operations teams to ask 'Analyze our motor's vibration patterns for maintenance scheduling' and watch the system generate and execute Python code using pandas, scipy, and scikit-learn for predictive analytics. We'll demonstrate IoT SiteWise data retrieval, AI-generated analytics, and MCP tools for work order creation - transforming natural language into executable machine learning that closes the operational loop without requiring data science expertise.

title: Agentic Data Fabric: Powering Autonomous AI with Trusted Data (sponsored by Reltio)
abstract: Agentic AI demands more than good models—it needs great data. In this session, learn how Reltio’s agentic data fabric, powered by Amazon Bedrock, delivers real-time, trusted data to autonomous agents. See how Reltio AgentFlow™ and the Match Resolver agent, developed in collaboration with AWS GenAI Innovation Center, drive real-world results, reducing manual costs by up to 70%. You’ll leave with a clear view of what makes data “agentic” and how to start deploying agents that act—not just suggest. This presentation is brought to you by Reltio, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Agentic Data Fabric: Powering Autonomous AI with Trusted Data (sponsored by Reltio)

title: Agentic KYC: Autonomous customer screening for financial institutions
abstract: Financial institutions traditionally rely on time-consuming, manual review processes for Know Your Customer (KYC) compliance. Discover how autonomous AI agents can revolutionize KYC processes throughout the customer lifecycle, from onboarding to ongoing monitoring, by simultaneously orchestrating document verification, sanctions screening, and risk assessment. Explore practical implementation patterns for a multi-agent system using Amazon Bedrock Agents, Amazon Bedrock Data Automation, and AWS Step Functions to reduce processing time from days to hours while ensuring regulatory compliance. Dive deep into best practices for agentic AI system architectures that establish decision audit trails and explain autonomous compliance decisions to regulators.

title: Agentic Smart City Showdown: EKS Edge to Cloud Playtime  (sponsored by Intel)
abstract: Join the battle against frustrating urban congestion and emergency delays with Agentic AI and Edge to Cloud. Compete in a hands-on simulation, managing intersections and optimizing routes using AWS technologies like EKS (powered by the latest Intel and Amazon EC2 Instances) and Greengrass. Experience real-time data aggregation and autonomous decision-making to improve traffic flow and emergency response. Win exciting prizes while building the foundation for smarter, safer cities.  Bring your own device. This presentation is brought to you by Intel, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Agentic Smart City Showdown: EKS Edge to Cloud Playtime  (sponsored by Intel)
Agentic Smart City Showdown: EKS Edge to Cloud Playtime  (sponsored by Intel)

title: Agentic video summarization for autonomous content creation at scale
abstract: Master the creation of intelligent video summarization systems using AWS agent-based architecture. Video summarization requires sophisticated analysis of visual scenes, audio cues, dialogue, and temporal context to identify compelling segments. In this session, learn to build flexible AI agents that orchestrate multimodal analysis modules, automatically adapting to different content types from news to sports. Practice implementing dynamic workflows that analyze visual, audio, and contextual elements to generate compelling summaries. Experience how this agentic AI solution eliminates rigid pipelines while enabling scalable, personalized content creation.

title: Agentic Workflows: How Salesforce Manages 1000+ Clusters
abstract: As Kubernetes environments grow increasingly complex, platform teams struggle with the escalating challenges of managing multi-tenant clusters efficiently. This session presents a groundbreaking approach to Kubernetes operations, leveraging generative AI and multi-agent collaboration to create a self-healing, intelligent cluster management system. Drawing from real-world implementations, the session will demonstrate how Salesforce were able to manage and troubleshoot over 1,000 Kubernetes clusters using intelligent agents, dramatically reducing mean time to identify (MTTI) and mean time to resolve (MTTR).

title: Agent in an hour: Build an agentic app with Strands Agents and MCP
abstract: In this fast-paced session, create a fully functional AI agent that transforms the customer experience. Using banking as our example, we'll explore agentic AI with Strands Agents, delving into tool use, Model Context Protocol (MCP), and system prompt design. Through this process, you'll develop an innovative customer experience that leverages banking tools to manage accounts, credit cards, and loans. You’ll work with Amazon Q Developer and prebuilt banking modules to fast-track development time. No matter your background, leave with a working agent and new understanding of how to create and configure AI-driven systems.

title: Agents Assemble! The Power of AI Tools That Work Together (sponsored by New Relic)
abstract:
Most of us are familiar with generative AI (think: ChatGPT), but we’re still constantly switching between multiple tools to finish a project. Imagine AI assistants that are able to not just execute tasks, but also collaborate with each other. In this session, we’ll pull back the curtain on this development in AI, called agentic AI -- systems that can autonomously plan, reason, and act to achieve specific goals.
We’ll explore how AI agents communicate, making decisions and sharing data. Learn how agentic systems solve real problems, from debugging complex applications to automating entire development workflows. This presentation is brought to you by New Relic, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Agents Assemble! The Power of AI Tools That Work Together (sponsored by New Relic)

title: Agents for Energy : Accelerate renewable asset planning with agentic workflows
abstract:
Join us in this hands-on workshop to learn how to build multi-agent workflows on AWS to enhance renewable energy site design with AI Agents generating wind-farm layouts and evaluating energy yield for early-stage projects.
You will be building AI agents with Strands Agents SDK, creating local and remote tools via Model Context Protocol (MCP), and deploying your solution on Amazon Bedrock AgentCore.

title: Agents meet SaaS operations: A natural fit
abstract: Agents provide the opportunity to introduce SaaSops capabilities which are best-of-breed but were historically costly or complicated to implement. Providing a customized on-boarding experience, profiling how tenants are consuming resources, handling noisy neighbours, right-sizing and migrating tenants between tiers - these are amongst a long list of tenant-contextual factors that improve your SaaS operations and build business value. This builder session will look at how agents provide builders with new operational tools and strategies that can enrich their operational efficiency, insights, and effectiveness. We’ll explore how agents can be added to a production SaaS environment to provide a better customer experience and take your SaaS operations to the next level!

title: Agents that remember: Implementing context with AgentCore Memory
abstract: Stateful agents can deliver smarter, more personalized interactions, but implementing memory in production is no easy task. In this session, you'll learn to build context-aware agents using AgentCore Memory. Learn to manage short-term and long-term memory securely, structure agent interactions around user history, and increase capacity. We’ll share real-world strategies for improving agent performance through recall, preference tracking, and adaptive behavior—all while maintaining strict data boundaries and access controls.

title: Agents & Tool Use at the Frontier: Building Autonomous Systems w/ Claude on AWS (sponsored by Anthropic)
abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) can now work autonomously for hours, not minutes. Discover how Claude 4's breakthrough capabilities - parallel tool execution, Model Context Protocol (MCP), and extended thinking with tool use - enable agents that operate independently for hours on complex tasks. Learn advanced techniques for orchestrating multi-tool workflows, implementing checkpoint systems for long-running operations, and leveraging cost savings through extended caching. Learn how frameworks like Agents for Amazon Bedrock are pushing the boundaries of AI capabilities. Join us to explore the forefront of AI-driven automation and elevate your LLM skills. This presentation is brought to you by Anthropic, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Agents & Tool Use at the Frontier: Building Autonomous Systems w/ Claude on AWS (sponsored by Anthropic)

title: AgentVision: Multi-Agent Frameworks for Esports Video Understanding
abstract: AgentVision leverages multi-agent systems to transform esports video content through automated analysis and processing. The architectural approach combines computer vision and coordinated AI agents to identify key gameplay moments, generate highlights, and create commentary for virtual competitions. This interactive session explores system design patterns for reducing processing time while maintaining content quality, demonstrating how intelligent systems convert raw gameplay into structured narratives.

title: Agile governance: Deploy AWS Control Tower in your current environment
abstract: How do you extend governance over your AWS environment in production without disrupting existing workloads? AWS Control Tower is the place to set up a well-architected, multi-account environment to govern your AWS workloads, and works hand in hand with AWS Organizations. In this chalk talk, explore proven approaches for enabling AWS Control Tower while preserving operational continuity. Learn to integrate AWS Control Tower with AWS CloudTrail, AWS Config and other foundational services you already use. Walk away with practical strategies to enhance your multi-account governance.

title: AI Agent Development with Strands Agents SDK
abstract: Dive into the world of AI agent development with this practical bootcamp on the Strands Agents SDK. Master the art of building secure, and scalable production-grade AI agents. From basic configurations to orchestrating multiple agents working together, discover how to create both conversational and task-specific agents with built-in observability and safety features. Ideal for developers seeking to deploy enterprise-ready AI solutions with full tracing and security controls.

title: AI agents at the edge: Build for offline, scale in cloud
abstract: This session demonstrates building Generative AI agents that operate fully offline using the AWS Strands Agents SDK. The presentation covers deploying lightweight local models with Ollama and integrating custom tools for remote manufacturing, field operations, and data sovereignty scenarios. Explore how these edge-deployed agents seamlessly scale to leverage cloud capabilities, transitioning to powerful models like Claude on Amazon Bedrock when connectivity is available. The session provides practical patterns for combining local processing with cloud AI to create resilient, location-independent solutions.

title: AI Agents at Work: Real-World Platforms Driving Business Innovation
abstract: Explore how Coupang Ads and Woowa Brothers deployed production-scale AI agent platforms to drive measurable business impact. Coupang Ads built an AI-first advertising ecosystem on Amazon Bedrock, integrating intelligent seller portals, conversational assistants, and automated ad video generation using Nova models to transform advertising performance. Woowa Brothers evolved from search to action-enabled multi-agent platform, achieving 20% enterprise-wide adoption in year one. Powered by a RAG·MCP platform, it features automated system troubleshooting and advanced agents for enterprise knowledge and data discovery, including Text-to-SQL. Learn practical architectures and strategies for building and operating production-proven AI agent platforms that deliver real business results."

title: AI agents for cloud ops: Automating infrastructure management
abstract: Security teams face alert overload and compliance complexity. This code talk shows how to build AI-driven automation that transforms security operations. Through live coding demonstrations, we'll develop intelligent agents that process security events, analyze threats, and orchestrate automated responses. You'll learn to implement real-time detection systems, incident management workflows, and smart remediation patterns. Walk away with reusable code and architectural approaches for creating autonomous security systems that reduce noise and accelerate response times.

title: AI Agents for Databases: Discover, Recommend, Optimize
abstract: What if your databases could help identify and diagnose problems before they impact production? This session demonstrates how to implement AI agents that monitor and analyze AWS database services, including Amazon RDS, Amazon Aurora, and Amazon Redshift. The presentation covers building intelligent agents that detect performance bottlenecks, surface query pattern issues, and suggest optimization strategies. Through practical examples, learn how to create systems that enhance database monitoring with AI-driven insights, enabling more informed and timely responses to common challenges across AWS database platforms.

title: AI Agents for deploying telco network workloads on AWS: MCP-powered Framework
abstract: In this hands-on session, learn how Agentic-AI and Model-Context Protocol transform telco network deployments. AI agents convert network specifications into infrastructure-as-code and integrate with GitOps pipelines for automated deployment. Built on Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Q Developer, EKS, and CloudWatch, the system allows operators to use natural language for generating production-ready infrastructure code. This solution reduces errors, speeds up deployments, and maintains compliance across Core, IMS, and O-RAN applications.

title: AI Agents framework for 5G RAN network operations powered by AWS
abstract: Build agentic AI and LLM-driven frameworks on AWS to operate and optimize 5G RAN networks' speed, cost, and quality. These agents integrate with tools like Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to analyze network metrics and autonomously make intelligent optimization decisions, advancing zero-touch network operations. The AI agents and tools implementation can leverage Strands and FastMCP SDK, with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore providing secure scalable deployment of these AI agents and tools. In this chalk talk, you will learn how this approach enables agentic, automated data-driven network optimization while maintaining operational security and reliability at scale.

title: AI agents in action: Architecting the future of applications
abstract: Explore how agentic AI is transforming cloud-native application architecture, unlocking faster innovation cycles and entirely new application patterns. Learn how new AWS capabilities empower builders to design secure, reasoning-driven agents that orchestrate data, code, and tools at scale, with an emphasis on governance, reliability, and cost efficiency. Discover how AWS customers are deploying production-ready agents today, and learn best practices to help you architect agentic applications that autonomously adapt, optimize, and act in real-time.

title: AI Agents in Concert: Building Self-Healing Networks with AWS & Ericsson
abstract: Traditional network automation can't keep pace with today's dynamic, multidimensional telecom networks. This session demonstrates how AWS and Ericsson are revolutionizing networks through cognitive technologies and an ecosystem of specialized AI agents working in concert. Learn how the combination of AWS's advanced AI services like AWS Bedrock together with Ericsson's rApp portfolio transforms data into intelligent decisions, bringing zero-touch networks within reach. Through real-world examples, discover how leading operators are using AI agents to automatically optimize networks' speed, cost, and quality.

title: AI Agents in Manufacturing: Building Intelligent Data Workflows
abstract: Manufacturing organizations often struggle with data silos and lengthy analysis cycles that delay decision-making. This session introduces Agentic Data Exploration using Amazon Bedrock Agents to automate analysis across various data sources. We'll explore how multi-agent workflows can seamlessly integrate structured databases, analytics exports, unstructured text, multimedia, and APIs for near real-time insights. Learn practical implementation patterns for orchestrating specialized AI agents in distributed problem solving scenarios. We will demonstrate how to reduce analysis timeframes from months to minutes while maintaining governance standards, ultimately accelerating operational decision-making in manufacturing environments.

title: AI Agents – the new face of privileged machine identities  (sponsored by CyberArk)
abstract: AI agents are no longer theoretical—they’re already executing tasks at machine speed with privileged access to enterprise systems. Treating these agents as privileged machine identities is critical to prevent credential sprawl, privilege escalation, and blind spots in cloud environments. This lightning talk will show how CyberArk extends identity security and just-in-time privilege controls to AI agents, enabling organizations to secure autonomous workflows without slowing innovation. This presentation is brought to you by CyberArk, an AWS Partner.

session.title: AI Agents – the new face of privileged machine identities  (sponsored by CyberArk)

title: AI Agents with Amazon Nova Sonic: Vonage for Financial Services (sponsored by Vonage, Part of Ericsson)
abstract: Financial Services has been at the forefront of speech and self service technologies for many decades. Yet it remains challenging to keep up with increasing business demands for digital automation while expanding customer value and relevance. Amazon Nova Sonic provides a new level of AI efficiency with its sophisticated speech-to-speech and flexible knowledge base architecture, built on powerful AI foundational models. This talk explores new use cases in banking, mortgage, and wealth management with Vonage’s integration of Nova Sonic AI Agents into contact center self-service, mobile apps, web experiences, video sessions, and API-powered CX of all kinds. This presentation is brought to you by Vonage, Part of Ericsson, an AWS Partner.

title: AI and HCP Engagement: Powering Smarter Life Sciences Field Operations
abstract: Revolutionize healthcare provider engagement with cutting-edge AI solutions powered by AWS. This innovative chalk talk unveils how intelligent agents can transform medical sales operations, automating content creation, decoding interaction patterns, and delivering real-time insights to sales teams. Discover robust architectural patterns for constructing secure, compliant systems that streamline provider education and optimize engagement tracking. Learn how to enhance sales productivity through automated workflow orchestration and intelligent content management. Join us to explore the future of life sciences sales, where AI-driven solutions empower your team to forge stronger provider relationships, improve educational outreach, and drive business growth.

title: AI-assisted quantum software development using Amazon Braket and Amazon Bedrock
abstract: AI coding assistants are changing the way how developers are building software across industries. In this session, we explore how generative AI accelerates quantum innovation. Learn how Amazon Braket, Amazon Bedrock, and Amazon Q can be combined to auto-generate quantum circuits, optimize variational algorithms like VQE, and scale hybrid workflows. We’ll walk through a live demo of using AI to create and deploy a quantum-classical hybrid job on AWS using PennyLane and Braket. Join us to see how AI and quantum computing are converging to tackle tomorrow’s toughest computational problems.

title: AI, Cloud & Public Sector Transformation: PwC & AWS Driving Change Now (sponsored by PwC)
abstract: Join this dynamic session to see how PwC and AWS are redefining public sector service with cloud and AI. Medway NHS Foundation Trust has deployed an AI-powered contact solution that streamlines patient inquiries, bookings, and follow-ups, slashing wait times and easing staff workloads, while upholding data security and NHS compliance. Meanwhile, Birmingham City Council, in partnership with PwC and AWS, migrated legacy services to a scalable cloud platform, boosting service delivery, resilience, and cross department collaboration. Attendees will explore governance, risk management, cyber security, and disaster recovery, plus tangible wins: reduced on-prem dependence and faster, data driven decision making for smarter outcomes. This presentation is brought to you by PwC, an AWS Partner.

session.title: AI, Cloud & Public Sector Transformation: PwC & AWS Driving Change Now (sponsored by PwC)

title: AI Code to Production: Context Matters
abstract: Why does AI-generated code break in production? Missing context. This interactive Code Talk transforms basic AI outputs into robust AWS solutions through strategic context injection. Watch live coding evolve generic "create an API" prompts into production-ready serverless architecture. Discover how business context, technical constraints, and AWS best practices dramatically improve AI results. Learn how development teams are shifting from code reviewers to context architects. Leave with actionable frameworks for prompt engineering, quality gates, and team dynamics that transform AI from development liability into strategic AWS advantage. Stop fighting AI-generated code—start directing it.

title: AI driven application modernization at scale (sponsored by Pega)
abstract: Learn how to transform complex legacy workloads—like Java, ERP, and mainframe systems—into agile, cloud-ready applications using Pega Blueprint and GenAI. This session explores how to overcome modernization challenges such as technical debt, integration risks, and workflow transformation. Discover how AI-powered design agents and model-driven architectures accelerate transformation while preserving business continuity and data integrity. Whether you are tackling contact center, field services, or core banking modernization, this session equips you with practical strategies to reimagine legacy systems and unlock enterprise agility. This presentation is brought to you by Pega, an AWS Partner.

session.title: AI driven application modernization at scale (sponsored by Pega)
AI driven application modernization at scale (sponsored by Pega)

title: AI-driven architecture: Designing distributed systems at scale
abstract: Discover architectural patterns for leveraging AI in complex distributed systems design and development. Learn end-to-end approaches for integrating AI into software architecture while maintaining system quality. Explore practical implementations of Event-Driven Architecture, Event-Sourcing, CQRS, Clean Architecture, and Test-Driven Development in AI-enhanced systems. This session provides concrete strategies for architecting production-grade distributed systems that effectively combine modern architectural patterns with AI capabilities.

title: AI-Driven Operations: Scaling Observability and Cost Optimization
abstract: Discover how Kakao and Samsung transformed operations with AI on AWS. Kakao achieved 400x faster observability for 50 million daily users using EKS with ClickHouse and AI-driven analytics, processing billions of log events and reducing query times from hours to seconds while enabling proactive anomaly detection. Samsung revolutionized cloud cost management with autonomous multi-agent systems using Strands SDK and Bedrock AgentCore, achieving hundreds of thousands of dollars in savings through real-time collaboration and automatic optimization. Learn practical architectures and blueprints for deploying enterprise-scale AI automation that delivers measurable business impact across observability and cost management.

title: AI-Driven Research: Automating Workflows with AWS HealthOmics
abstract: This hands-on session demonstrates the integration of AI-powered automation with AWS HealthOmics for optimizing genomic and bioinformatics workflows. Participants will use Claude Sonnet and Q Developer CLI to automate workflow processes while leveraging context-aware AI agents and Run Analyzer metrics for data-driven improvements. The workshop covers implementing multi-agent AI systems using AWS HealthOmics, SageMaker, Bedrock, and Kiro to accelerate biomarker detection and clinical research. Through practical exercises, attendees will learn to develop automated, scalable bioinformatics pipelines that reduce manual overhead and enhance reliability in processing large-scale biomedical data.

title: AI-driven scaling in Amazon Redshift Serverless
abstract: For data engineers and architects managing both predictable and unpredictable workloads, AI-driven scaling and optimization in Amazon Redshift Serverless brings intelligent scaling without manual tuning. This session covers how, AI-driven scaling and optimization handles large ETL pipelines, bursty dashboard traffic, and shifting data volumes—automatically. We’ll break down the architecture, design choices, and predictive models behind it, then whiteboard real-world scenarios showing how the AI-driven scaling and optimization optimizes for both performance and cost.

title: AI-Driven Testing: Scaling Automation with KaneAI and HyperExecute (sponsored by LambdaTest)
abstract: Discover how KaneAI and HyperExecute redefine modern AI-native testing workflows for QA, developers, and DevOps teams. Go from natural language to executable automated tests with seamless integration into the AWS ecosystem. Unlock blazing-fast execution speeds—up to 70% faster than legacy automation grids—while LambdaTest delivers a unified, AI-first testing platform. Accelerate release velocity by 64%, achieve over 90% stability, and cut audit preparation time by 70%. Embrace conversational test authoring, resilient execution, and audit-ready traceability—all deeply embedded within your CI/CD pipelines for a truly AI-native workflow.  This presentation is brought to you by LambdaTest, an AWS Partner.

title: AI-First Contact Centers: Reinventing Scale with AWS and Partners (sponsored by PwC)
abstract: Discover how PepsiCo, with PwC’s AI-driven approach, partnered with AWS and Salesforce to transform its customer engagement model. Together, they designed an AI-first framework that unifies operations, streamlines interactions, and automates the majority of customer touchpoints. Powered by AWS AI/ML services and Agentic AI workflows, the solution enables predictive ordering, personalized promotions, and faster issue resolution. This session explores the partnership model and key lessons learned—providing a clear roadmap for scaling AI-enabled, omnichannel experiences that boost both efficiency and customer loyalty. This presentation is brought to you by PwC, an AWS Partner.

session.title: AI-First Contact Centers: Reinventing Scale with AWS and Partners (sponsored by PwC)
AI-First Contact Centers: Reinventing Scale with AWS and Partners (sponsored by PwC)

title: AI in Action: How Companies Unlock Global Value & Fuel Growth
abstract: AI in Action: How Companies Unlock Global Value & Fuel Growth

title: AI in the Cloud: Surveillance, Sabotage, and Security (sponsored by Trend Micro)
abstract: Your AI-powered cloud is humming with activity, running advanced AI applications, but so are your adversaries. Last year we introduced the security for AI blueprint; now it is time to step into the role of operative. Hidden in the layers of data and code are covert risks, adversarial models, poisoned pipelines, and stealthy attacks. In this session, we will decode the enemy’s playbook and arm you with actionable intelligence to stay ahead. Learn how to expose blind spots, neutralize threats, and carry out your mission of keeping your AI-driven cloud secure, no matter how advanced the opposition becomes. This presentation is brought to you by Trend Micro, an AWS Partner.

session.title: AI in the Cloud: Surveillance, Sabotage, and Security (sponsored by Trend Micro)

title: AI model benchmarking with Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Bedrock & AWS IoT Greengrass
abstract: Deploying AI models to edge devices poses unique challenges in balancing hardware requirements, power consumption, and model performance. Through practical examples using Amazon SageMaker distributed training and AWS IoT Greengrass, discover approaches for automated model deployment, validation, and performance monitoring across edge devices. Learn how Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock can supplement lightweight on-device models with large foundational models. Explore techniques for aggregating results in a Jupyter-based dashboard for rapid prototyping and optimization, and coordinating edge device models with Amazon Bedrock foundational models for aggregating data and in-depth analysis. This session provides strategies for architecting scalable AI pipelines optimized for edge deployments.

title: AI Native Development: Strategies and Impact across Amazon and AWS
abstract: Amazon and AWS have evolved beyond AI-assisted development to embrace AI Native practices, integrating AI as a partner throughout the software development lifecycle. Learn how their teams leverage AWS foundational tools including Amazon Q Developer, Kiro, and Amazon Bedrock. Discover effective Prompt Driven Development methodologies and grassroots adoption strategies from early champions. See how Amazon enables teams to provide AI with right context through strategic use of MCP, RAG and custom models trained on Amazon technical knowledge. Understand the culture transformation required across multi-thousand person organizations, where every role must evolve. Gain actionable insights to accelerate your AI Native journey.

title: AI-Native Era of Observability: How You Can Get Started Today (sponsored by Coralogix)
abstract: Observability is entering an AI-native era where manual queries and endless dashboards are replaced by instant insights, root cause detection, and guided recommendations. In this session, you’ll learn how AI-native observability reduces MTTR, reveals root causes instantly, and empowers business and engineering teams alike. Ariel Assaraf, CEO of Coralogix, and Liran Hason, VP of AI, will share their vision for the future of observability and how Coralogix is leading the shift with Olly, the first AI-native observability agent built to turn telemetry into real-time clarity and impact. This presentation is brought to you by Coralogix, an AWS Partner.

title: AI Pioneers: Shipping Transformative GenAI Architectures to Production
abstract: Join our session to discover production-ready generative architectures AI pioneers leverage to ship tomorrow’s customer experiences and transform industries with lean teams, constrained budgets but accelerated timelines. You’ll learn how to apply the platform mindset and AWS Generative AI services - Amazon Q, Amazon Bedrock, and Amazon SageMaker and integrate them with other AWS services to deliver both agentic and non-agentic workloads at scale that stay secure, cost-efficient, and aligned with responsible-AI guardrails. Leave with actionable patterns and inspiration that you can use in your own organizations to scale Generative AI workloads.

title: AI-Powered Content Compliance: Media Rating Automation with Nova
abstract: Transform your content compliance workflow with Amazon Nova's cutting-edge AI solution. This presentation demonstrates how media organizations can automate multi-system rating analysis, dramatically reducing manual review time and operational costs. Learn to implement intelligent compliance workflows that leverage agentic AI to ensure accuracy while accelerating content delivery pipelines. We'll explore real-world applications, ROI benefits, and integration strategies that turn traditional compliance bottlenecks into strategic advantages. Discover how Nova's automated rating system adapts to multiple regulatory frameworks while maintaining consistent accuracy across diverse content types.

title: AI-powered co-sell: Unlock partner success with AWS Partner Central
abstract: Discover how to supercharge your co-selling efforts with enhancements available in AWS Partner Central. This session showcases new AI-enhanced features and APIs that streamline partner collaboration and deal registration. Learn to leverage secure access to APIs, access real-time insights, and automate workflows to accelerate your go-to-market strategy. Whether you're a seasoned AWS Partner or just getting started, you'll walk away with actionable steps to maximize Partner benefits and drive revenue growth with AWS through Partner Central.

title: AI-Powered Enterprise Architecture with ServiceNow & AWS (sponsored by ServiceNow)
abstract: Enterprises face a core challenge: translating architectural vision into resilient cloud reality. See how integrating ServiceNow's Enterprise Architecture Workspace with the AWS Well-Architected Tool transforms traditional design processes.Through elegant "shift-left" methodologies, architects gain contextual insights that seamlessly blend enterprise modeling with cloud best practices. We'll demonstrate how this enables proactive risk identification, reduces architectural debt, and accelerates deployment velocity. Discover how organizations leverage this powerful combo to achieve architectural excellence—delivering robust, compliant AWS environments that align vision with operational reality while optimizing performance and cost efficiency. This presentation is brought to you by ServiceNow, an AWS Partner.

session.title: AI-Powered Enterprise Architecture with ServiceNow & AWS (sponsored by ServiceNow)

title: AI-powered FinOps: Agent-based cloud cost management
abstract: AI is transforming FinOps practices in complex multi-account cloud environments. This chalk talk explores building intelligent agents that tackle fragmented cost data and optimization processes. Learn to architect solutions using Amazon OpenSearch for data aggregation and Amazon Bedrock for contextual reasoning, enabling autonomous cost analysis and recommendations. Examine proven implementation patterns for data ingestion workflows, financial prompt engineering, and human-in-the-loop processes. Discover how to design secure, scalable FinOps solutions that continuously optimize costs while maintaining performance and compliance.

title: AI-Powered Observability & Observability for AI: The Two Sides of the Coin (sponsored by ManageEngine)
abstract: AI is transforming how we monitor and manage complex systems. But, while AI can predict, prevent, and even fix problems, it can also fail quietly. This session explores both sides of the coin: AI-powered observability, where AI augments human capability to detect and resolve issues faster, and observability for AI, where we ensure AI itself remains accurate, fair, and reliable. Through real-world scenarios and practical approaches, we’ll show how to build systems that watch over everything, including the AI that’s watching over us. This presentation is brought to you by ManageEngine, an AWS Partner.

title: AI powered PostgreSQL: Incident detection & MCP integration
abstract: In this hands-on workshop, discover how to leverage generative AI to transform PostgreSQL database management through an integrated solution combining incident detection and response (IDR) with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for performance optimization. Build a comprehensive system utilizing Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition with pgvector that creates a robust vector store from diverse data sources including database documentation, runbooks, and incident records. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: AI-powered resilience testing and disaster recovery
abstract: Not all disaster recovery strategies can address the complex, dynamic nature of modern cloud infrastructures, leading to gaps in system resilience and compliance adherence. Discover how to enhance resilience and disaster recovery on AWS empowered by AI. This approach bridges infrastructure insights and application-level testing, enabling more effective disaster recovery preparation. You will learn how to leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) with AWS Resilience Hub and AWS Systems Manager to modernize testing, analyze infrastructure, and generate targeted AWS Fault Injection Service experiments and recovery runbooks. Walk away with practical examples of automated test generation with templates and learn to design prompts.

title: AI-powered retail transformation with Just Walk Out technology
abstract: Just Walk Out technology leverages multimodal AI and machine learning algorithms built from the ground up as a comprehensive solution to transform traditional retail operations and checkout into frictionless experiences. This session highlights our innovation approach with enterprise-scale customers, showcasing how partnerships drive mutual growth while creating frictionless shopping and foodservice experiences. Learn how we've evolved our AI, machine learning, and hardware capabilities across multiple technology iterations to scale sophisticated retail operations and deliver measurable business outcomes across retail and foodservice environments

title: AI-powered SaaS Observability using OpenSearch
abstract: SaaS providers struggle with observability at scale, balancing costs, combining cross-tenant and single-tenant data, and surfacing actionable insights. In this code talk, learn how to build next-generation observability for your SaaS platform using semantic search, agent-led search, and other AI-powered techniques. We’ll dive deep on index mappings, ingestion flows, and query patterns, live coding a solution using Amazon OpenSearch Service.

title: AI-powered troubleshooting: From chaos to Well-Architected
abstract: In this Builders session, you will tackle a complex scenario at Unicorn Rentals, where performance issues plague a struggling application. Using Amazon Q on both console and CLI, you will troubleshoot and optimize a poorly designed architecture featuring scaling bottlenecks and database inefficiencies. Learn how to apply Well-Architected principles to enhance performance, security, and cost efficiency while maintaining service availability under pressure. You'll experience the perfect blend of technical problem-solving and practical learning as you transform Unicorn Rentals' infrastructure from architectural nightmare to cloud exemplar. This challenge emphasizes AI-assisted troubleshooting while testing your AWS optimization skills in an engaging, hands-on environment.

title: AI-powered Well-Architected reviews: Building automated governance
abstract: Build an intelligent system that automates AWS Well-Architected Framework reviews using generative AI. Learn to create solutions that evaluate cloud architectures against Well-Architected pillars while incorporating organization-specific requirements. Practice implementing automated analysis of architecture, IaC templates, and documentation using AWS AI services and GitHub integration. Master the use of Model Context Protocol servers to enhance AI understanding of architectural context, transforming manual reviews into scalable, automated processes.

title: AI That Remembers: Building Memory Systems for AI Agents
abstract: Step into the role of a Lead Investigator in this immersive technical workshop, where you'll build AI agents powered by advanced memory systems. Participants will learn to use Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to orchestrate agent workflows, enhanced with four critical types of memory: episodic, semantic, procedural, and conversational. Using Amazon Bedrock, you will design and implement capabilities that allow your investigator agent to recall past cases, connect patterns across data, follow established investigative procedures, and hold context-rich conversations. This session is tailored for architects and engineers, equipping you with the practical skills & techniques to develop intelligent, memory-enabled AI agents. You will learn how to deliver faster insights and more responsive solutions for high-stakes, real-world applications used by your customers across industries

title: AI transforms development: Lessons from CircleCI's journey with AWS (sponsored by CircleCI)
abstract: AI is changing how developers write code, but most organizations struggle to adapt their development practices accordingly. CircleCI has navigated this transformation firsthand—from ChatGPT adoption to deploying autonomous AI agents powered by Amazon Bedrock. Discover practical lessons from CircleCI's AI journey and why traditional development practices like pull requests may not scale with AI-generated code. Explore how successful teams adapt their software delivery pipelines, testing strategies, and feedback loops to maximize AI's potential while maintaining code quality. Walk away with actionable strategies for transforming your development workflow, understanding where AI excels today vs. where it still needs human guidance. This presentation is brought to you by CircleCI, an AWS Partner.

title: AI vs AI: Detecting fake content with AI agents
abstract: In this hands-on session, you’ll build an AI agent powered by Amazon Nova models using Bedrock to identify fake or malicious AI-generated content across text, video, and audio. Learn to apply tools orchestration, moderation APIs, and multi-modal evaluation techniques.

title: A leaders guide to accelerating large-scale migration
abstract: In this session, hear about a simplified and streamlined approach to cloud migration based on real-world experience leading successful all-in migrations to AWS and guiding hundreds of other organizations on their enterprise migration journeys. Get insight that seeks to challenge conventional wisdom, and hear about what’s been proven to work as well as some common pitfalls to avoid. Learn how you can help get employees invested, create forcing functions for innovation, and build accountability, while managing uncertainty and achieving a faster, cheaper, and more efficient migration process. The time to migrate is now.

title: A leaders guide to achieving compliance through software excellence
abstract: Traditional software development often resembles a manufacturing assembly line, where code passes from one developer to the next, creating idle time and fragmented documentation that fails to meet modern compliance demands. Modern application development offers a better way to simultaneously enhance productivity and satisfy regulatory requirements. Through integrated tooling and practices—including Git version control and automated testing—organizations can maximize developer productivity while naturally producing documentary proof that serves as compliance evidence. This session features real-world examples from leaders who have successfully leveraged these practices to meet critical compliance standards (FDA 21 CFR Part 11, ISO 13485, GMP Annex 11).

title: A leaders guide to advanced mental models and mechanisms
abstract: To build a lasting, performant corporate culture, you need not only strong mental models to guide your employees and help them make decisions but also the right mechanisms to operationalize company values and mental models—and to help them persist. This session examines why organizational culture erodes over time, dives into the organizational artifacts that reinforce existing cultural patterns, and shares some of the best practices that help create strong mechanisms, using examples from Amazon’s own journey.

title: A leaders guide to advanced team structures in an agentic world
abstract: As AI agents transform the workplace, organizations must adapt their structures and methodologies to harness new opportunities. The probabilistic nature of AI requires continuous iteration and intelligent oversight, creating new ways of working across business functions. To thrive, organizations must combine clear capability assessment with agile planning while leveraging their unique domain expertise and data assets. This keynote explores how leadership is evolving to meet these needs, covering new organizational models and roles that coordinate human-AI hybrid teams. Leaders will learn strategies for balancing rapid decision-making with strategic oversight, finding the optimal mix of centralized guidance and decentralized innovation.

title: A leaders guide to agentic AI
abstract: In a landscape of rapid AI evolution and daily headlines, senior leaders need clarity on what Agentic AI means for their business. This session cuts through the noise to provide a practical understanding of autonomous AI agents and their strategic implications for your organization. We will demystify Agentic AI and focus on what matters most to leaders. We will share how both management and architecture models will need to evolve to get value out of the autonomous AI systems.

title: A leaders guide to AI powered FinOps
abstract: The convergence of FinOps principles and generative AI is providing  organizations new ways they better manage cloud spending and investment strategises.  This session will discuss how organizations  are  successfully  deploying  generative AI to automate anomaly detection, enhance resource allocation, and convert complex cloud financial data into actionable insights. Attendees will learn practical strategies for implementing AI-driven FinOps practices, measuring ROI on generative AI investments, and developing a comprehensive roadmap for intelligent cloud cost management.

title: A leaders guide to AI strategy and implementation
abstract: As generative and agentic AI transform business models, leaders must architect new operating models that bridge technology capabilities with business value. This advanced session reveals proven approaches for scaling AI from experiments to enterprise-wide value creation. Learn to shape AI-driven business strategies, design advanced decision systems, and build governance frameworks that accelerate adoption while managing risk. Leaders will leave with practical guidance to orchestrate AI capabilities and organizational transformation, execute their vision, drive innovation, and deliver quantifiable returns through scaled AI deployment.

title: A leaders guide to cloud-native application modernization
abstract: Legacy applications run mission-critical processes, but increasingly limit innovation and organizational agility through outdated architectures. This session equips leaders with frameworks to refactor applications into cloud-native solutions while preserving business operations. Successful modernization requires answering strategic questions: why modernize, at what cost, how to modernize, what risks exist, and when to act. Learn how to define scope, prioritize features, and reskill teams through proven organizational models. Discover adaptive governance that replace traditional project management to deliver incremental value while managing inherent modernization risks. Leaders will explore how generative AI accelerates application analysis and migration, reducing modernization timelines.

title: A leaders guide to data strategy in the era of agentic AI
abstract: In Formula 1, victories depend on turning millions of data points into winning decisions. Organizations can apply this same precision to unlock value from underutilized data assets. Drawing from F1's model, we present a three-part framework for data excellence: customer-focused decisions, dynamic people- powered strategies, and market-responsive structures. Learn practical approaches to evolve your data strategy into a business advantage in the AI era.

title: A leaders guide to emerging technologies: From insight to rapid action
abstract: In an era of rapid technological advancement, IT leaders often struggle to quickly address executive inquiries about emerging technologies like Agentic AI, quantum computing, crypto, edge systems, and more. This session presents a systematic approach for developing a dynamic technology radar that continuously monitors innovations relevant to your business objectives, transforming reactive responses into proactive technology leadership. Through real-world examples and actionable insights, learn to implement a 90-day plan to anticipate disruptions and elevate your role as a strategic technology advisor.

title: A leaders guide to navigating multicloud strategies and decisions
abstract: As organizations seek to accelerate their cloud migration and transformation, some find themselves in situations where they have to manage IT operations in a multicloud environment, or simply decide whether and how to adopt a multicloud strategy in the first place. Leaders must consider how operating multiple cloud environments impacts business outcomes and their ability to innovate.  In this session, the AWS Enterprise Strategy team will share unique insights and prescriptive guidance for successfully navigating multicloud decisions and difficulties gleaned from thousands of engagements with leading organizations and extensive research into how multicloud impacts cloud adoption and transformation.

title: All Power, No Pain: Scale Agentic AI Apps in an Open Lakehouse (sponsored by Qlik)
abstract: Harness the power of Agentic AI without the data headaches. In this session, you’ll get a practical blueprint for building trusted, scalable AI applications using Apache Iceberg-based open lakehouse architectures. Learn how to fuel your lakehouse with real-time data, ensure data quality for accuracy, and provide a solid data foundation for your AI agents. See how to design systems where agents can seamlessly access data, leverage vector and relational data for enhanced reasoning, and execute complex workflows without bottlenecks. You’ll walk away ready to confidently deploy and scale data for your own agentic AI applications. This presentation is brought to you by Qlik, an AWS Partner.

session.title: All Power, No Pain: Scale Agentic AI Apps in an Open Lakehouse (sponsored by Qlik)

title: Amazon AI Shopping Assistant: Key Learnings from Customer Interactions
abstract: Join us to explore key insights from launching and scaling Rufus, Amazon's AI-powered shopping assistant. We'll share practical lessons learned while evolving from initial deployment to supporting millions of customer interactions worldwide. Discover how we optimized inference performance, processed multimodal data, and distributed global traffic loads. Learn what worked, what didn't, and how we adapted our approach across critical areas to deliver an exceptional shopping experience.

title: Amazon Aurora DSQL: A developer's perspective
abstract: In this live coding session, we'll show you how to work with Amazon Aurora DSQL from a developer's perspective. We'll develop a sample application to highlight some of the ways developing for Aurora DSQL is different than PostgreSQL. We'll cover authentication and connection management, optimistic concurrency transaction patterns, primary key selection, analyzing query performance, and best practices.

title: Amazon Aurora HA and DR design patterns for global resilience
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a serverless relational database with unparalleled high performance and availability at global scale for PostgreSQL, MySQL, and DSQL. Aurora provides managed high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) capabilities in and across AWS Regions. In this session, explore the Aurora HA and DR capabilities and discover design patterns that enable the development of resilient applications. Learn how to establish in-Region and cross-Region HA and DR using Aurora features including Multi-AZ deployments and Aurora Global Database, and how Aurora DSQL multi-Region clusters provides the highest level of availability and application resilience.

title: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore & MCP for Automated Telecom Service Assurance
abstract: This Agentic AI system leverages Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, Strand Agents, and MCP to automate telecom service assurance through multi-agent collaboration. AgentCore's primitives—memory persistence, orchestration of multi-step tasks, gateway integration, tools and security—enable AI agents to autonomously manage network operations using service data. The system, trained on historical tickets and network metrics, autonomously detects anomalies, diagnoses issues, and orchestrates remediation with minimal human intervention. Implementation results show 30% faster ticket resolution, 40% ticket reduction, and 3% lower customer churn, addressing critical industry challenges where network issues cause 50% of service calls and contribute to 15% of customer churn.

title: Amazon Bedrock Agents: Features and Design Patterns
abstract: In this breakout session, you’ll dive deep into features and design patterns of AI agents using Amazon Bedrock’s comprehensive suite of tools. Learn about Bedrock Flows, design agents with knowledge bases and guardrails, and about creating inline agents for dynamic configurations. Explore multi-agent collaboration patterns and leverage AgentCore’s modular services for secure, scalable AI solutions.

title: Amazon Braket: Get hands-on with quantum computing
abstract: Amazon Braket provides access to quantum computing hardware and simulators to speed up scientific research and software development for quantum computing. Join this workshop to implement your first quantum algorithm and gain hands-on experience with running quantum circuits on gate-based devices and simulators. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Amazon Braket Hubs - Accelerating R&D in national quantum initiatives
abstract: Quantum computers are used to accelerate research and scientific discovery in academia. Around the world, national and regional quantum initatives are creating local quantum computing research hubs, with the goal to foster vibrant ecosystems of researchers, startups, and enterprises to accelerate the development and application of quantum technology. In this talk you will hear how AWS is working with quantum computing hubs to develop secure and scalable research environments and provide access to state-of-the-art quantum technologies.

title: Amazon DocumentDB for expert practitioners
abstract: As a fully managed database service for native document data model enterprise workloads, Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) removes the undifferentiated heavy lifting of operating a database so that you can focus your time on delivering value for your customers. In this chalk talk, dive deep into the implementation details and trade-offs of features to improve compression and performance while lowering cost for various workloads.

title: Amazon ECS observability patterns and design decisions
abstract: Join us for an interactive discussion on observability solutions for Amazon ECS workloads. We'll walk through implementation patterns for ECS tasks, demonstrate getting insights from logs, and building custom dashboards. Learn how to integrate AWS X-Ray, CloudWatch Container Insights, and Amazon CloudWatch generative AI features to achieve deep visibility into your applications. We'll cover key design decisions including metric collection strategies, log correlation, trace sampling, and alerting. Bring your specific use cases as we'll workshop real-world scenarios, discuss trade-offs between different observability approaches, and share architectural best practices for debugging, tracking deployments, and optimizing resource utilization in ECS.

title: Amazon EFS data resiliency: From strategy to implementation
abstract: Discover comprehensive strategies for achieving robust data resilience in your Amazon EFS environment. This session covers the entire lifecycle of data protection, from initial planning to real-world implementation. Learn best practices for backup management, disaster recovery, and cross-region replication. We'll demonstrate how to architect your EFS deployments for maximum availability while optimizing costs and performance. Walk away with actionable insights on meeting recovery objectives and leveraging native AWS tools alongside third-party solutions for a bulletproof EFS data strategy.

title: Amazon EKS advanced storage best practices with Amazon FSx for OpenZFS
abstract: This advanced builders session on Amazon EKS storage fundamentals, helping experienced practitioners master the integration of Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) with Amazon FSx for OpenZFS for high-performance, scalable container deployments. Participants will gain expert-level knowledge and practical experience implementing production-grade Kubernetes clusters with sophisticated persistent storage solutions.

title: Amazon EKS: Infrastructure as code, GitOps, or CI/CD
abstract: Explore diverse architectures for deploying workloads on Amazon EKS with Amazon ECR. Learn about secure software supply chain automation options including CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (using Terraform and CDK), and GitOps patterns with Argo CD. Understand how these approaches complement each other from developer, architect, and operations perspectives. Get insights on selecting the right deployment strategy based on team structure and skillsets, and discover how to effectively combine DevOps and GitOps patterns to match your organization's needs. Gain practical knowledge on implementing these strategies to enhance your development workflow, improve collaboration, and accelerate your software delivery.

title: Amazon EVS deep dive: Advanced networking and storage architecture
abstract: Amazon Elastic VMware Service (Amazon EVS) provides you with choice, flexibility, and control as your build your virtualization stack in the cloud. If you're ready to learn advanced patterns, tips, and tricks for you environments, join this deep dive to help you master architecture patterns as you build your EVS environments. We'll explore network architecture patterns in-depth, explaining inter-VPC communication approaches, and advanced networking strategies. We'll also cover advanced storage architecture patterns to help you scale and optimize performance and costs.

title: Amazon EVS deep dive: Strategic migration planning
abstract: Join this interactive technical session to learn how you can start running your VMware workloads on AWS with Amazon Elastic VMware Service (Amazon EVS). Discover how to strategically plan and architect EVS environments to set the foundation for a successful migration. We'll dive into technical prerequisites, capacity planning strategies, and host placement options. We'll share best practices in integrating your preferred storage, backup, and disaster recovery solutions to Amazon EVS, along with how you can leverage other AWS services to make the most out of running your VMware workloads in the cloud.

title: Amazon FSx Intelligent-Tiering: Technical deep dive and best practices
abstract: Discover how FSx Intelligent-Tiering delivers fully elastic file storage with automatic cost savings. In this session, we'll explore the architecture behind automated data movement, performance, and elastic storage scaling capabilities. You'll see how file systems automatically adapt to changing workloads while maintaining high performance with sub-millisecond latencies and millions of IOPS. We'll examine caching mechanisms and the relationship between file system I/O and request operations. You'll learn how to monitor performance using CloudWatch metrics and implement SSD caching for performance-intensive workloads.

title: Amazon Keyspaces live migration best practices with HBO Max
abstract: Amazon Keyspaces (for Apache Cassandra) is a globally scalable, serverless database service with a 99.999% availability SLA. In this session, learn how the HBO Max team delivers seamless playback for over 120 million viewers across 77 countries, managing tens of billions of records and millions of requests per minute during global events like the Olympics and premieres such as House of the Dragon. Discover how the team built a multi-region architecture with Keyspaces, implemented a dual-writes architecture and a custom data-loading tool to migrate from Apache Cassandra with zero downtime, and eliminated infrastructure management while reducing costs by 40% using flexible capacity modes.

title: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams under the hood
abstract: Discover how AWS is changing data streaming with Amazon Kinesis Data Streams for infrastructure and operations. This session will explore recent innovations in how Kinesis Data Streams enables you to build robust, scalable data streaming applications that can handle millions of events per second. Join this session to see how you can leverage Amazon Kinesis Data Streams to build scalable, resilient data streaming applications for faster insights and improved decision-making.

title: Amazon Linux: latest features and AWS optimizations
abstract: Amazon Linux is the most popular operating system on AWS. In this session, you will learn about the latest updates such as Amazon Linux Desktop, Kernel 6.12, FIPS, and package updates. We will share the roadmap and lifecycle updates so that you can prepare for upgrades and migrations.

title: Amazon Q Apps: Power RCM, Member Engagement, & Drug Safety Management
abstract: Join us as we explore how Amazon Q Apps, a feature of Amazon Q Business, can help knowledge workers streamline critical tasks across healthcare and life sciences organizations. In this workshop, you'll discover how Amazon Q Apps transforms healthcare operations across multiple domains: converting fragmented revenue cycle data into intelligent intervention engines; streamlining how payers identify high-utilization members; and revolutionizing pharmacovigilance by detecting safety signals earlier than conventional systems. Through guided exercises, you'll learn how Amazon Q Apps turns healthcare insights into automated, measurable business outcomes, providing you with actionable ways to implement these solutions in your organization.

title: Amazon Q Developer CLI, a lightning-fast coding experience
abstract: Join us for an interactive session exploring the agentic capabilities of the Amazon Q Developer CLI. Learn how to leverage custom agents that uses the information across native and MCP server-based tools to read and write files locally, call AWS APIs, run bash commands, and write code, all while adapting to your feedback in real-time. We'll cover best practices for agentic development, and real-world use cases for implementing Amazon Q Developer CLI into your existing workflows.

title: Amazon S3 performance: Architecture, design, and optimization
abstract: Go behind the scenes of Amazon S3 performance architecture while learning practical optimization strategies. We'll explore how S3's internal systems manage massive throughput, handle concurrent requests, and balance loads across its distributed infrastructure. Dive deep into the technical foundations - from request routing and partitioning strategies to caching mechanisms - that enable S3 to power demanding workloads like real-time analytics and ML training. You'll learn how to leverage this architectural understanding to make informed storage class selections, implement performance-enhancing patterns, and design applications that maximize S3's capabilities.

title: Amazon S3 security and access control best practices
abstract: Building a robust data security strategy begins with choosing the right storage foundation. Amazon S3 provides security settings and granular access controls to suit any workload. In this session, learn about the fundamentals of S3 security and dive deep into the latest enhancements in usability and functionality. Explore options for access control, encryption, monitoring, auditing, and remediation. Discover best practices for data security and access control in S3.

services: Amazon Simple Storage Service Glacier (Amazon S3 Glacier)

title: Amazon S3 security: Implementing controls, policies & audit systems
abstract: Amazon S3 provides security settings and granular access controls to suit virtually any workload. In this workshop, learn how to manage access and define scalable user and resource-based policies using Amazon S3 access management tools. Learn techniques for monitoring and auditing data to find out who is accessing what data, from where, and when. Through practical scenarios, learn how to apply various S3 security tools and capabilities to meet diverse security requirements. Gain expertise in implementing robust security measures, from basic access controls to advanced audit systems, suitable for any workload complexity.

title: Amazon S3 Tables architecture, use cases, and best practices
abstract: Explore Amazon S3 Tables architecture and latest features that improve data lake performance. Learn proven optimization strategies, automated maintenance capabilities, and simplified security controls that reduce operational overhead while scaling efficiently. Discover how Indeed is actively modernizing their data infrastructure through an ambitious migration of 80 petabytes from Hive to S3 Tables, achieving significant performance gains and cost reductions. Through real-world use cases and architectural deep-dives, understand how S3 Tables transforms analytics workloads from petabyte-scale processing to real-time dashboards and complex ETL pipelines. You'll gain practical knowledge for table design, cost optimization, and performance tuning to accelerate query speeds and reduce infrastructure costs in your data architecture.

title: Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio for Public Sector
abstract: This hands-on workshop lets participants explore three real-world public sector use cases-Healthcare, Education, and Government—using Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. Participants will choose one of the three scenarios, work with domain-specific datasets, and build a machine learning model using Amazon SageMaker, AWS Glue, Amazon Athena, Amazon Q, and Amazon Bedrock. Activities include setting up a SageMaker domain, querying and processing data, assigning permissions using AWS Lake Formation, and generating insights. The workshop includes three personas: administrator,  data scientist (publishing data), and an ML engineer (building the model). Amazon Q will be used throughout the workshop as an assistant for participants.

title: Amazon's finops: Cloud cost lessons from a global e-commerce giant
abstract: Get an insider's view of FinOps at Amazon from the AWS Cloud Economics team. Drawing from experience supporting thousands of internal teams, we'll share battle-tested strategies for building a cost-aware culture and scaling cloud financial management. Learn how Amazon approaches cost allocation, leverages AWS tools, and drives optimization across its complex enterprise. You'll leave with practical approaches and proven best practices that can be applied to organizations of any size.

title: A modern approach to application migration with Amazon VPC Lattice
abstract: Modernizing legacy apps? It doesn't have to be a "big bang". Discover how to use Amazon VPC Lattice and AWS services to drive a smooth, step-by-step migration. Learn proven patterns for breaking down monoliths into microservices without disrupting your business. Through real-world examples, we will  explore secure communication, multi-account setups. We will show how IP overlap is easily handled, and may even be an asset for Amazon EKS cluster upgrades.

title: An Alliance for Our Times: Building the Next Frontier of Cancer Research (sponsored by Deloitte)
abstract: To better harness data that exists today to advance cancer prevention, treatment, and cure. It requires deep collaboration among scientists, technologists, integrators, philanthropists, and business interests. And the thoughtful and ethical application of AI solutions to unlock greater insights and efficiencies in a safe and secure data environment. Enter the Cancer AI Alliance collaboration across four major cancer centers, and major technology collaborators including AWS and Deloitte. In this session, we will explore real-world application of the Alliance’s federated learning platform + AI models, considerations for scaling the platform, and crowdsourcing ideas for further disruptions driven by AI across life sciences and healthcare. This presentation is brought to you by Deloitte, an AWS Partner.

session.title: An Alliance for Our Times: Building the Next Frontier of Cancer Research (sponsored by Deloitte)
An Alliance for Our Times: Building the Next Frontier of Cancer Research (sponsored by Deloitte)
