title: Analyze blockchain data with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
abstract: In this session, learn how to leverage Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and large language models (LLMs) for blockchain data analysis through natural language prompts. With guidance from AWS experts on Web3, you will create an AI-powered interface that queries blockchain data across major networks, leveraging datasets from the AWS Public Blockchain Data initiative. This hands-on builders’ session will equip you with practical knowledge to combine generative AI and Web3 technologies, enabling you to explore on-chain transactions, digital assets, and smart contracts through intuitive prompt-driven interactions. You must bring a laptop to participate.

title: Anatomy of a Ransomware Attack: A Live Simulation, Sponsored by Rubrik (sponsored by Rubrik)
abstract: Your first experience with ransomware shouldn’t be when it’s happening to you. Join us for a unique, immersive simulation of a ransomware attack targeting a modern enterprise built on AWS. Part live performance, part real-world crisis reenactment, this session puts you in the middle of the action as the attack unfolds. See firsthand what it takes to respond and recover when your business is on the line. Leave with newfound confidence and a clear perspective on how to prepare for, respond to, and rapidly recover from a real-world cyberattack. This presentation is brought to you by Rubrik, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Anatomy of a Ransomware Attack: A Live Simulation, Sponsored by Rubrik (sponsored by Rubrik)

title: A new dawn for operations: More intelligent, secure, and efficient
abstract: The recent shifts in technology have created both opportunities and challenges, with organizations asking: how can we leverage generative AI to improve operational efficiency, manage workloads across AWS, multicloud, and hybrid environments, and improve security? Join us to discover the latest operations innovations, designed with cutting-edge technologies, to help you enhance application performance, reduce costs, automate governance and compliance, strengthen security posture, and achieve greater resilience across environments. Through demos and customer spotlights, learn how you can transform your operations to become more intelligent, secure, and efficient.

title: An insider’s look into architecture choices for Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: To overcome the performance and scale limitations of relational databases, AWS built Amazon DynamoDB to deliver consistent single-digit millisecond performance at any scale for the most demanding applications on the planet. In this session, learn about the architecture choices for Amazon DynamoDB. Gain a better understanding of when to use DynamoDB and why DynamoDB is used by over one million AWS customers, and powers hundreds of applications that exceed half a million requests per second. Leave with a new perspective on how to design your own applications.

title: Another Axiom: Migrating the backend for hit game Gorilla Tag to AWS
abstract: Learn how leading VR gaming studio Another Axiom modernized their backend infrastructure by building a custom backend platform with AWS. Follow their journey from a patchwork of legacy vendor systems to a scalable, future-proof solution that powers all their games. Explore how they optimized performance, costs, and observability, with Amazon Fargate and AWS Graviton Processors, Amazon Aurora, and CloudWatch APM. This talk explores architectural decisions, performance bottlenecks, and cost optimization techniques that enabled seamless scaling while maintaining an immersive experience for 100k+ peak concurrent players.

title: Anthology boosts contact center efficiency with AI
abstract: AI is helping customer experience teams improve productivity through automation of repetitive tasks, call summarization, and proactively surfacing relevant customer information. Learn how AI-powered Amazon Connect is driving significant improvements for end-customer self-service, agents, and supervisors. Hear from Anthology — a leader in Education Technology — as they share implementation journeys and recent successes, diving into how AI-powered analytics helped improve the efficiency and impact of their self-service experiences and human agent coaching.

title: Anti-Money Laundering Multi-agent Orchestration with AWS Strands
abstract: Learn how to build a production-ready, serverless Anti-Money Laundering (AML) system using AWS Strands SDK and Anthropic's Claude model in Amazon Bedrock. The architecture features eight specialized agents (Perception, Context, News, Reasoning, Risk, Action, Audit, Learning) orchestrated for intelligent financial crime detection. Through live demonstrations, see semantic reasoning beyond rule-based detection, real-time API integration, and cost-effective serverless deployment using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Deployment. Experience high-risk transaction processing, Strands SDK integration with Claude's semantic analysis, and complete multi-agent coordination. Gain realtime understanding on building LLM-powered compliance systems with explainable AI decisions and regulatory compliance.

title: An unexpected journey building AWS MCP Servers
abstract: This session explores the evolution from generic AI coding assistants to AWS-intelligent development tools through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Attendees will learn how MCP transforms AI assistants by injecting AWS-specific context, best practices, and service knowledge directly into development workflows. We'll demonstrate using 25+ open-source AWS MCP servers that provide real-time access to CDK patterns, cost analysis, Amazon Bedrock capabilities, and infrastructure guidance. Through live demos and examples, you'll discover how to configure and leverage existing MCP servers that understand AWS services. Leave with practical skills to enhance your AI assistants for accelerated serverless and AI application development.

title: API Gateway Authorization Strategies
abstract: In this session, we will dive into various API Gateway authorization strategies, including Cognito User Pools, Amazon Verified Permissions, Lambda Custom Authorizers, IAM Authorizers, and machine-to-machine scenarios. Through hands-on examples, you'll learn how to implement each strategy and understand their trade-offs. By the end, you'll have an understanding of when to use each authorizer type, empowering you to secure your APIs more effectively while minimizing complexity. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: API Gateway Unleashed: A Hands-on Journey to API Excellence
abstract: In this hands-on workshop, gain essential skills to create, deploy, and manage APIs efficiently. Learn high-level concepts like message transformation, request validation, and security. Master deploying APIs using Infrastructure as Code and integrating with AWS Serverless services. Dive into monitoring and debugging to ensure your APIs perform optimally. Additionally, explore building and testing WebSocket backends. This session will equip you with the knowledge to streamline your application development and enhance API management. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Apollo Tyres Accelerates Engineering Workflows with HPC on AWS
abstract: Apollo Tyres transformed their engineering workflows by migrating to AWS High Performance Computing (HPC). This move integrated simulation applications with design tools, improving performance by up to 59% and reducing costs by over 60%. The company built their infrastructure using AWS ParallelCluster, Amazon DCV for seamless remote workstation access, and FSx for ONTAP storage. Their implementation includes the Tachyon platform for self-service job management, enabling engineers to submit and monitor simulation jobs efficiently. The session covers architecture decisions, instance selection strategies, and practical solutions for common migration challenges including network latency and storage optimization.

title: Application modernization challenge
abstract: Showcase your modernization skills in this hands-on workshop. Following AWS's modernization pathways, you'll decompose monoliths into microservices using AWS Lambda, transition to managed databases, containerize workloads with Amazon ECS and EKS, and implement DevOps practices using AWS CI/CD tools. Leveraging AWS's 'Move to AI' pathway, you'll learn how to integrate Amazon Bedrock and foundation models to build modern applications. In this team-based event, score points by completing modernization challenges in provided AWS accounts while using Amazon Q Developer to accelerate your efforts. Laptop required for participation.

title: Application networking simplified: From basics to best practices
abstract: Modern applications present complex challenges in managing secure communication across distributed architectures. In this session, get hands-on experience exploring Amazon VPC Lattice and implementing fine-grained authorization controls and efficient connectivity patterns. Learn to implement and configure both service-to-service and service-to-resource communications while working with resource gateways and configurations using Amazon VPC Lattice and AWS PrivateLink. This experience provides a comprehensive understanding of how to architect secure, scalable application connectivity solutions.

title: Application network monitoring: Troubleshooting with VPC Lattice
abstract: Explore modern application networking observability on AWS through comprehensive monitoring and troubleshooting capabilities. This session demonstrates how Amazon VPC Lattice access logs empower both network/platform teams and developers with enhanced visibility into distributed applications. Through practical examples and real-world scenarios, learn essential techniques for implementing end-to-end monitoring, rapidly detecting and resolving network issues, and optimizing application performance. Don’t forget to bring questions!

title: Application performance monitoring: From design to implementation
abstract: Modern applications are complex, spanning microservices, containers, and serverless functions. This makes monitoring and troubleshooting a real challenge. In this chalk talk, we will explore real-world application performance monitoring (APM) challenges and how to solve them using Amazon CloudWatch. Join us for a collaborative session where we dive deep into architecture designs, identify common pitfalls, and show you how to gain deep visibility into distributed systems. Walk away with practical strategies to build robust monitoring and quickly resolve performance issues in your applications.

title: Applied data modeling with Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: In this builders’ session, learn how to turn a new business idea into a fully functional data model in Amazon DynamoDB. Discover how to translate business requirements into access patterns and access patterns into a fully optimized schema design. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Apply Amazon’s DevOps culture to your team
abstract: In this chalk talk, learn how Amazon helps its developers rapidly release and iterate software while maintaining industry-leading standards on security, reliability, and performance. Learn about the culture of two-pizza teams and how to maintain a culture of DevOps in a large enterprise. Also, discover how to help build such a culture at your own organization.

title: Applying AI for FinOps and FinOps for AI
abstract: Explore the intersection of AI and FinOps in this advanced session. First, discover how Amazon Q can simplify AWS cost management by analyzing trends, explaining spend, and recommending optimizations like rightsizing and Savings Plans. Then, dive into FinOps for AI- learn how to track and control generative AI costs across Amazon EC2, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Bedrock, and more. We'll share architecture patterns, cost-saving strategies, and real-world examples to help you build scalable, production-ready AI solutions while staying on budget. Whether you're optimizing existing workloads or launching new AI initiatives, you'll leave with practical tools to maximize value.

title: Approaches to layered security on Amazon VPC
abstract: In this workshop, discover proven methodologies that will help you build a secure Amazon VPC. Using a hands-on approach, you will explore Amazon VPC features such as subnets, security groups, flow logs, and routing. Next, you will learn how to add additional layers of security to your VPC. This includes securing ingress and egress VPC traffic using services like Amazon Route 53 Resolver DNS Firewall, AWS Network Firewall, Amazon VPC Traffic Mirroring, AWS WAF, and more. You must bring your laptop to participate, so don't leave home without it.

title: A practical guide for meeting regulatory resilience requirements
abstract: Organizations worldwide must demonstrate their operational resilience to meet regulatory requirements like DORA, NIS2, and RegSCI. These regulations are aimed at ensuring organizations have incident detection and disaster recovery plans to prevent disruptions and maintain business continuity. In this chalk talk, you'll learn how to use AWS services to assess and prove your compliance in regulated industries like financial services and healthcare. We'll explore practical applications of the D-CAT tool, AWS Fault Injection Service experiment reports, resilience assessments in AWS Resilience Hub, and live dashboards in Amazon Application Recovery Controller  to help you evaluate and document your regulatory readiness.

title: A practical guide to Amazon S3 data protection and recovery
abstract: Learn step-by-step methods to protect your critical Amazon S3 data against accidental deletion, ransomware, and corruption. This chalk talk provides hands-on guidance for implementing essential safeguards through S3 Versioning, Cross-Region Replication, and Object Lock configurations. You’ll get practical examples to immediately strengthen your data protection strategy, from lifecycle policies to advanced immutability controls, and learn how you can achieve rapid recoverability from any scenario at any scale. Whether you’re meeting compliance requirements or ensuring business continuity, you’ll leave with actionable steps to build a robust defense for your S3 environment.

title: A practical guide to implement cost-effective governance controls
abstract: This chalk talk shows you how to reduce operational costs while maintaining robust security and compliance monitoring. Learn proven strategies to optimize your implementations without compromising governance. Through real-world scenarios, discover how organizations successfully reduced monitoring costs while meeting compliance requirements using services like AWS Config and AWS CloudTrail. Walk away with actionable best practices for building cost-effective, scalable architectures. Bring your questions!

title: A practical guide to modern web architecture  (sponsored by Contentful)
abstract: For years, the balance between frontend and backend innovation has shaped the evolution of the web. Today, both are undergoing dramatic transformation. On the front end, adaptive content, predictive navigation, and real-time personalization are enabling teams to deliver measurable business outcomes faster than ever. On the back end, AI-driven generative experiences and GEO are redefining discoverability and rendering traditional SEO tactics obsolete. Learn how Contentful structures content to seamlessly flow through high-performance edge runtimes (like Vercel) and power personalized, context-aware user experiences. Leave with actionable best practices and operational playbooks that will bring you into the next era of web delivery. This presentation is brought to you by Contentful, an AWS Partner.

title: A practitioner’s guide to data for agentic AI
abstract: In this session, gain the skills needed to deploy end-to-end agentic AI applications using your most valuable data. This session focuses on data management using processes like Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), and provides concepts that apply to other methods of customizing agentic AI applications. Discover best practice architectures using AWS database services like Amazon Aurora and OpenSearch Service, along with analytical, data processing and streaming experiences found in SageMaker Unified Studio. Learn data lake, governance, and data quality concepts and how Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Bedrock Knowledge Bases, and other features tie solution components together.

title: Architect for Zero Trust in AWS
abstract: Discover how to implement comprehensive zero trust architectures in AWS using native services and best practices. This technical session explores identity-centric security, microsegmentation strategies, and least-privilege access patterns across applications, networks, and data. Learn to leverage AWS IAM, Security Hub, Network Firewall, and CloudWatch to create defense-in-depth security architectures. We’ll demonstrate practical implementations of zero trust principles including continuous verification, explicit permission management, and real-time threat detection. Perfect for security architects and cloud engineers looking to build modern security architectures that assume breach and verify explicitly. Leave with actionable blueprints for implementing zero trust across your AWS environment.

title: Architecting Agentic AI for Supply Chain: Data-to-Decision Patterns
abstract: Supply chains across industries face challenges with inconsistent data and complex decision workflows. This session covers designing agentic AI workflows that autonomously interpret operational data—such as sales and inventory—to drive key decisions like restocking and pricing. Learn how to prepare data with Amazon SageMaker, build reasoning agents using Bedrock, and orchestrate workflows with AgentCore. We discuss managing uncertain AI outputs through fallback logic and human-in-the-loop reviews. Through discussion, you'll uncover best practices for building scalable, reliable agentic automation driven by trusted data in supply chain operations. Leave with architectural patterns that balance automation with appropriate human oversight.

title: Architecting agentic systems: Self-evolving patterns with AWS AI
abstract: Learn to architect self-evolving systems using agentic AI that align with AWS Well-Architected principles. Explore patterns for implementing autonomous monitoring and self-healing capabilities with Amazon Bedrock Agents. Discover approaches for AI-driven security controls, automated recovery mechanisms, and efficient resource management. Through practical examples, examine architectural patterns that enable continuous system adaptation and improvement. This session provides concrete strategies for building cloud systems that evolve to meet changing requirements while maintaining operational excellence.

title: Architecting AI solutions for mission-critical systems with UK MetOffice
abstract: Explore how organizations can transform mission-critical operations using generative AI through the lens of the UK Met Office's journey. This session provides an in-depth look at a dual-model approach using Large Language Models (LLMs) and Vision Language Models (VLMs), achieving 62% and 52% accuracy respectively. Examine architectural patterns for complex data processing using Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, and AWS CDK, with insights into fine-tuning Amazon Nova models for precise maritime forecasting. Discover how cloud-native, serverless architectures can modernize traditional systems while maintaining reliability.

title: Architecting application flows and automations in Amazon Q Apps
abstract: Join us to explore Amazon Q Business and Q Apps, power features that transform business process automation and app development. Learn how Amazon Q Apps low-code/no-code platform enables rapid creation of enterprise applications without extensive coding We'll cover implementation strategies across business functions, from HR to operations, showing how these tools drive digital transformation and operational efficiency. Master building generative AI applications to gain competitive advantage in today's dynamic business landscape.

title: Architecting circular systems with generative AI on AWS
abstract: Discover how you can combine generative AI and generative design on AWS to accelerate circular economy initiatives. In this chalk talk, we’ll walk through how services like Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker and AWS Lambda can rapidly prototype reuse scenarios, create synthetic data, simulate material lifecycles, and optimize designs for sustainability constraints. We’ll whiteboard an evolving architecture that integrates real-time environmental data and domain knowledge to continuously evaluate circular opportunities - from energy recapture and zero-waste manufacturing to remanufacturing and sustainable packaging. Learn how generative design simulates thousands of alternatives and generative AI turns insights into scalable, actionable solutions.

title: Architecting Compliant GenAI Systems for Healthcare Workflows
abstract: Healthcare organizations need to streamline clinical workflows without compromising accuracy or compliance. Manual verification of ICD-10 codes leads to costly, inefficient radiology billing processes. This code talk demonstrates how a leading medical university implemented hybrid generative AI to automate clinical coding. Through code examples, learn to use Amazon Bedrock for AI predictions with custom rule-based validation engines to eliminate hallucinations. Explore architectures combining domain-specific knowledge bases, HIPAA-compliant checkpoints, and scalable monitoring. Discover best practices for scaling infrastructure, managing model drift, and integrating human validation. Leave with practical knowledge for deploying generative AI in billing-critical healthcare workflows where precision and compliance drive success.

title: Architecting Distributed Micro-frontends with Serverless
abstract: Frontend development at scale presents significant deployment and team coordination challenges. Modern micro-frontend architecture combined with serverless backends offers a solution for breaking down monolithic applications into independently deployable components. This session demonstrates a complete e-commerce implementation where distributed teams manage discrete frontend and backend components. The demonstration covers real-time inventory management, automated order processing, and AI-powered customer interactions, showcasing practical patterns for building and deploying scalable frontend architectures.

title: Architecting enterprise-scale governance beyond AWS Control Tower
abstract: Discover advanced governance strategies that build upon AWS Control Tower for enterprise-scale environments. Explore architectural patterns for multi-account structures and governance frameworks that streamline account provisioning processes. Evaluate trade-offs between security, cost management, and operational standardization across evolving cloud landscapes. Learn to architect governance solutions for both greenfield deployments and expanding infrastructures, emphasizing continuous improvement. Gain insights into building Well-Architected foundations that ensure compliance while enabling innovation through automated guardrails and self-service capabilities.

title: Architecting Firewalls on AWS: A Layered Defense Strategy
abstract: Firewalls are essential for cloud security, but which one is right for your workload? In this chalk talk, you’ll learn about firewall services available on AWS, including web application firewalls, network firewalls, and DNS firewalls. Explore architecture patterns that combine multiple firewall products for comprehensive protection. Bring your architecture and let’s discuss how these services can improve your security posture.

title: Architecting for data protection and compliance with Amazon ECS
abstract: Many organizations running containerized workloads need to ensure that they are meeting stringent data protection and compliance requirements, including those pertaining to the HIPAA Privacy and Security Rules for securing protected health information (PHI). This builders' session focuses on how you can use Amazon ECS and other AWS services to run container applications containing PHI. Learn best practices with Amazon ECS, Amazon ECR, AWS Fargate, Amazon GuardDuty, and more.

title: Architecting for data protection and compliance with AWS Backup
abstract: Join to discuss proven architecture patterns for building ransomware-resilient AWS Backup solutions. We will explore immutability with Vault Lock and logically air-gapped vaults, and dive deep into KMS best practices: when to use AWS-owned and Customer Managed Keys, how to rotate keys without breaking restores, how to configure key policies for least privilege, and how to implement cross-account trust for backup copies. We’ll discuss multi-account, multi-region backup topologies, automated recovery testing for DR validation, and designing for GDPR and regulatory compliance. You will leave with practical patterns to implement secure, scalable, audit-ready backup architectures aligned with industry best practices.

title: Architecting for Digital Sovereignty: From Foundation to Practice
abstract: Join this chalk talk that bridges security fundamentals with practical architecture strategies for implementing digital sovereignty in the cloud. Through real-world examples from the United Arab Emirates Cybersecurity Council and the upcoming AWS European Sovereign Cloud, we'll explore how organizations can use AWS sovereignty features effectively. We'll cover practical architectural patterns for data residency, operational control, and security measures that help customers maintain full control of their data. Perfect for cloud architects and security teams, this session will show you how to design solutions that balance sovereignty requirements with cloud advantages, illustrated with examples from government and enterprise deployments.

title: Architecting for hypergrowth: Scaling to 200 million users with Skyscanner
abstract: Building systems that scale from thousands to millions of users requires strategic architectural decisions at each growth stage. Learn proven approaches for scaling infrastructure through Skyscanner's transformation from data center to global cloud architecture. Explore key decision points for scaling up versus out, implementing effective caching strategies, and evolving monoliths into services. Through Skyscanner's implementation of cellular architecture on Amazon EKS, discover how to architect systems that maintain performance and reliability while scaling to hundreds of millions of users.

title: Architecting for sustainable IT at scale
abstract: Explore how organizations can build and scale applications on AWS with sustainability in mind. This session covers architectural principles for carbon-efficient cloud workloads, including right-sizing resources, leveraging AWS Graviton-based instances, and adopting managed services. Learn how to measure and optimize the sustainability of your workloads using the AWS Customer Carbon Footprint Tool and CloudWatch.

title: Architecting Intelligent Supply Chains with Multi-Agent Orchestration
abstract: Discover how to build an intelligent supply chain orchestration system using Amazon Bedrock and Strands Agents SDK. In this chalk talk, we'll dive deep into designing a multi-agent system that automatically responds to supply chain disruptions. Learn how specialized agents for logistics, inventory and transportation work together to generate and execute optimal responses to supply chain challenges. We'll explore real-world scenarios, demonstrate chain-of-thought reasoning, and show integration with AWS Supply Chain and third-party systems.

title: Architecting large-scale migrations at the NSA, Fannie Mae, and DCSA
abstract: Join this deep dive exploring the architecture and implementation strategies behind three massive public sector cloud migrations. This session covers how to architect and execute complex migrations to AWS, focusing on the technical challenges, solutions, and infrastructure decisions to drive success, lower costs, and set the foundation for emerging technologies like GenAI. Speakers will share insights from NSA’s secure migration approach and how they maintained operations throughout the process. Additionally, we’ll examine the technical design behind Fannie Mae’s cloud-native financial forecasting platform, which processes 30 billion loan activities. Finally, DCSA will discuss how they used AWS Countdown for real-time migration with zero downtime.

title: Architecting multi-agent systems: Patterns in financial services
abstract: The evolution of generative AI has unleashed multi-agent systems capable of tackling complex financial tasks through distributed intelligence. This chalk talk explores how these systems revolutionize financial services workflows through collaborative problem-solving patterns—Sequential, Graph (Start, Hierarchical), Swarm (Mesh, Parallel), Loop, and composite patterns—applied to autonomous claims adjudication, automated financial research, and intelligent loan processing. We'll walk through how to design multi-agent architectures using Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, enhancing decision-making capabilities, and addressing complex financial workflows. Gain practical knowledge to design efficient and scalable AI solutions using the proper reasoning-paradigm and collaboration pattern fundamental for multi-agent architectures.

title: Architecting multicloud solutions from data mesh to generative AI
abstract: As organizations operate across multiple cloud providers, they often struggle to unlock the full potential of generative and agentic AI capabilities with data spread across cloud providers. Some of the challenges include federating data access, orchestrating model deployments across cloud providers, and implementing guardrails around generative AI. In this session, we will dive deep into practical approaches to multicloud data strategy, such as data mesh architecture and materialized views. You will learn effective strategies you can use to securely deploy and manage generative AI applications leveraging services and models across cloud providers.

title: Architecting multi-Region expansion for mission-critical workloads
abstract: Expanding mission-critical applications across AWS Regions demands meticulous architectural planning, especially with strict SLA requirements. This chalk talk explores key design considerations for multi-Region expansion: evaluating service availability, implementing secure cross-region connectivity, and ensuring reliable operations. Through collaborative scenario-based exercises, learn to map out evaluation methods, network patterns, and operational procedures. Gain actionable architectural techniques for regional expansion projects that maintain high availability and performance for mission-critical workloads.

title: Architecting networks for AI workloads on AWS
abstract: Join this advanced session to understand how AWS builds networks that power large-scale AI operations. In this session, we'll examine the unique networking requirements of distributed training workloads, GPU-to-GPU communication patterns, and their performance implications. Discover the architecture behind the AWS network supporting massive GPU clusters, and learn practical approaches for designing both training and inference network implementations.

title: Architecting real-time data pipeline modernization with Generative AI
abstract: Join this interactive chalk talk to explore architectures for modernizing batch data pipelines into real-time streaming solutions using AWS services and genAI capabilities. Through collaborative whiteboarding, we'll design solutions for converting ETL jobs to streaming workflows, implementing intelligent data quality checks with Amazon Bedrock, and handling real-time transformations. Together, we'll examine key decisions between AWS streaming services, optimize performance and costs, and maintain data consistency during migration. Learn how to leverage Amazon Kinesis, AWS Glue, and Amazon Bedrock while addressing schema evolution and data governance. We'll tackle real-world scenarios and best practices for robust, scalable streaming architectures.

title: Architecting Real-time Sign Language Systems with AI Agents
abstract: This session demonstrates how to create sign language translation systems using Strands Agents, Amazon Bedrock Code, and the Alexa AI Multi-Agent SDK. The presentation covers two key implementations: broadcast content transformation into real-time sign language avatars and interactive conversational agents enabling two-way sign language communication with voice systems. Technical deep-dives explore AWS' agentic infrastructure for compute management, observability, and secure multi-agent orchestration. Live demonstrations showcase practical applications enabling deaf and hard-of-hearing users to interact with Alexa+ through sign language, demonstrating accessible AI technology in action.

title: Architecting reliable deployments: Amazon.com's blue/green patterns
abstract: Explore how Amazon.com evolved its software delivery lifecycle using AWS services to enhance resilience after the 2017 service disruption. Learn architectural patterns for blue/green deployments using cloud-native storage and content delivery systems. Discover approaches for implementing automated safety checks, capacity management, and system partitioning for rapid recovery. Through Amazon.com's real-world implementation, examine patterns for managing large-scale deployments while maintaining high availability. This session provides practical strategies for architecting reliable deployment systems at scale.

title: Architecting resilient global networks with Project Kuiper
abstract: Project Kuiper's Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellite constellation transforms how organizations architect global connectivity solutions. Explore how Kuiper's advanced network—featuring antennas, space lasers, ground gateways, and intelligent routing—integrates with AWS services for robust, low-latency solutions. Learn architectural patterns for enhancing application resilience, implementing secure remote data transfer, and optimizing edge computing performance. Discover real-world solutions for critical challenges such as maintaining connectivity during disasters, securing remote operations, and extending compute to the network edge, enabling global reach and improved reliability.

title: Architecting resilient multicloud operations, feat. Monzo Bank
abstract: When organizations choose a multicloud strategy to address their resilience needs, they often face challenges in areas such as data consistency, service isolation, and long term testing and maintenance. Join this session to learn about Monzo Bank's resilience journey in implementing a strategic multicloud architecture that offers a practical and efficient approach to operational resilience. We'll dive deep into Monzo's Stand-in Platform, which runs critical banking services on a different cloud provider alongside their primary AWS infrastructure. You'll learn practical patterns for maintaining service availability, managing data consistency trade-offs, and implementing resilient multicloud architectures.

title: Architecting Security at Scale with AWS Cloud Governance
abstract: Implementing consistent cloud governance and security capabilities across a growing AWS estate challenges many organizations, often leading to fragmented controls and security gaps. Learn how to develop and implement a comprehensive governance strategy that scales with your business needs as well as your security requirements. Using ransomware protection as a practical example, we'll explore how to architect a multi-account environment that balances security with operational flexibility. Discover how AWS Control Tower, IAM Identity Center, AWS Organizations, AWS Config, Amazon GuardDuty and AWS Backup work together to implement security controls at scale. Walk away with actionable insights on designing and deploying a secure foundation that not only protects against modern threats but maintains the agility your business demands.

title: Architecting Solution Patterns for GPU-Accelerated HPC and AI/ML
abstract: In this interactive chalk talk, we'll delve into architectural patterns for GPU-accelerated High-Performance Computing (HPC) and AI/ML workloads. We'll explore real-world solution architectures and examine the technical considerations for deploying workloads across various scenarios. We'll analyze EC2 GPU instance families and their optimal use cases, discuss architectural trade-offs, and explore cost optimization strategies using different provisioning models. By the end of this session, you'll have a deeper understanding of how to design resilient, scalable, and cost-effective GPU-accelerated solutions on AWS. Come prepared to engage in technical discussions and bring your architectural challenges as we collaboratively explore GPU computing solutions.

title: Architecting the future: Amazon SageMaker as a data and AI platform
abstract: Learn how organizations are modernizing their data architectures using the next generation of Amazon SageMaker to create AI-ready data platforms. This session covers how to design and build modern data architectures that enable both innovation and control, examining real-world patterns for data lake consolidation, cross-account governance, and AI integration. This session is ideal for enterprise architects and technical leaders planning large-scale architectural transformations to support their AI/ML initiatives.

title: Architecting Trusted GenAI and Agentic Experiences in Financial Services (sponsored by Coveo)
abstract: Generative AI is reshaping financial services, but success depends on building  solutions securely and at scale. In this session, learn how leading banks and insurers use AWS Bedrock and Coveo to deliver enterprise-ready GenAI that is accurate, compliant, and permission-aware. Discover how organizations cut support volumes, boost employee productivity, and unlock millions in savings by integrating GenAI across complex ecosystems with millions of documents. We’ll share best practices for embedding GenAI into customer and employee experiences, governance, and how to move beyond pilots to production with speed, trust, and measurable impact. This presentation is brought to you by Coveo, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Architecting Trusted GenAI and Agentic Experiences in Financial Services (sponsored by Coveo)

title: Architecting vector-driven AI applications with Amazon S3 Vectors
abstract: Vector search is the engine behind intelligent AI, transforming data into meaning-driven insights that power smarter search, recommendations, and generative experiences. In this session, discover how to combine cost-optimized, fully elastic vector storage delivered by Amazon S3 Vectors with multimodal embedding models in Amazon Bedrock to extract and index visual and audio semantics at scale. Learn how to leverage S3 Vectors with popular AWS AI services to power AI-driven applications that can efficiently search through large vector datasets. Whether you’re building media search applications or search-enabled AI, you’ll learn the foundation to get started.

title: Architect open source observability for distributed environments
abstract: Managing observability across distributed and multicloud environments remains a significant challenge for many organizations. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll explore how AWS fully managed open source observability services can solve your most pressing observability problems. We'll showcase reference architectures for high-cardinality metrics, log analytics, and distributed tracing. Bring your specific use cases as we whiteboard solutions for handling large-scale metrics collection, unified alerting strategies, and correlating telemetry across your infrastructure. Leave with practical approaches to implement a comprehensive observability strategy tailored to your environment.

title: Architect petabyte-scale observability with OpenSearch and Amazon Q
abstract: Organizations face increasing challenges to manage logging at massive scale while meeting strict compliance and cost requirements. Drawing from deployments in financial services, this chalk talk will demonstrate proven architectural patterns and optimization techniques that differentiate successful implementations from costly failures. Learn how to build a unified observability pipeline using OpenTelemetry agents, Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion, and OpenSearch UI that seamlessly integrates with existing enterprise systems. Discover how Amazon Q enables rapid pattern identification, compliance monitoring, and automated insight extraction, empowering developers to build advanced logging solutions that meet enterprise requirements.

title: Architectural blueprints for your lakehouse in Amazon SageMaker
abstract: The lakehouse architecture of Amazon SageMaker addresses key enterprise challenges around interoperability and consistent access controls across all data systems. This interactive session will dive deep into different use-cases and specific architectural patterns with the lakehouse in Amazon SageMaker, highlighting the benefits, and providing architectural guidance for enterprise-wide platform design on AWS to meet your analytics and generative AI requirements.

title: Architectural patterns for Embedded Analytics in Amazon QuickSight
abstract: Join our interactive session on embedding QuickSight into your applications. We'll collaboratively explore architectural patterns for scalable, secure analytics solutions focusing on data monetization. Together, we'll sketch integration approaches covering authentication, multi-tenancy, and data security frameworks. Learn strategies for optimizing dashboard performance, implementing row-level security, and managing custom permissions. We'll address white-labeling and branding while solving real-world integration challenges. Ideal for architects and developers building embedded analytics solutions.

title: Architectural patterns for real-time data analytics on AWS
abstract: Streaming data pipelines make it possible to access and extract value from your data before it loses its shelf life, and customers today are increasingly looking for scalable, efficient and cost-effective ways of building real-time data pipelines that can provide immediate data availability in the desired format and in the desired data store. Join this chalk-talk to dive into the AWS streaming options and proven architecture patterns for managing high-velocity data ingestion and data processing for timely and actionable outcomes across diverse real-time workloads for data warehousing, search analytics and generative AI applications.

services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)

title: Architecture diagrams with generative AI: Leveraging AI agents
abstract: Master the use of generative AI-powered software agents for creating and analyzing architecture diagrams and technical documentation. Learn to work with various diagram formats, from images to diagram-as-code representations. Explore chat-based workflows that leverage Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers for enhanced capabilities. Practice integrating custom context rules, example diagrams, and enterprise knowledge sources. Gain hands-on experience building effective architect profiles for AI-powered documentation workflows.

title: Architecture lessons: Three failures and how to prevent them
abstract: Some of the best lessons come from failures - but it’s better to learn from someone else’s. In this session we will dissect three real-world AWS architecture failures, exploring what went wrong, the business impact, and how they were fixed. You’ll learn the patterns and anti-patterns behind each case, and walk away with actionable insights to avoid similar pitfalls in your own mission-critical workloads.

title: Architecture patterns for MLOps on Amazon EKS
abstract: Amazon EKS helps organizations tackle machine learning operations (MLOps) challenges by providing a highly secure, reliable, scalable, and flexible Kubernetes environment in the cloud. In this chalk talk, explore architecture patterns for training, fine tuning, and serving machine learning models using Amazon EKS, Amazon EC2, and AWS storage services.

title: Architectures for Hybrid Quantum-Classical Workflows at Scale
abstract: Quantum computers are expected to solve some of today’s most demanding computational problems by working in tandem with classical computers. The breadth of AWS services and advanced compute capabilites provide customers with the flexibility to architect a wide range of purpose-built solutions for their quantum computing workflows. In this chalk talk, we'll explore several architectures enabling hybrid quantum-classical computing at scale, integrating Amazon Braket with AWS Batch, AWS ParallelCluster, and AWS Parallel Computing Service. We'll discuss use cases that leverage GPU-accelerated Amazon EC2 instances and the NVIDIA CUDA-Q platform facilitating the integration of CPUs, GPUs, and quantum processing units.

title: Are your APIs ready for AI agents? (sponsored by Postman)
abstract: In an era where AI agents are reshaping how decisions are made and work gets done, your APIs can either be your competitive edge or a liability.  In this session, Postman CTO and Co-Founder Ankit Sobti will reveal the steps you need to take to modernize your API ecosystem and maximize AI readiness. You’ll also hear directly from industry leaders how they’re preparing their APIs for intelligent agents, bringing their API programs up to date, and working with Postman as part of this transformation. This presentation is brought to you by Postman, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Are your APIs ready for AI agents? (sponsored by Postman)

title: Ask AWS: Your ransomware questions answered
abstract: Get answers to your most critical ransomware questions in this interactive Q&A session. Learn how AWS security features and best practices can help you detect, respond to, and recover from ransomware threats. Our experts will share practical guidance on identifying early warning signs, implementing effective incident response, and strengthening your overall ransomware resilience. Bring your toughest questions about emerging ransomware tactics and cloud protection strategies. Walk away with actionable insights to help secure your data and operations using AWS security capabilities.

title: Ask Me Anything About AWS Networking
abstract: Whether you're just getting started or knee-deep in Amazon VPCs, this open-format chalk talk is your chance to ask anything about AWS Networking. From core services like Amazon VPC, Amazon Route 53, and AWS Transit Gateway to newer innovations like Amazon VPC Lattice and AWS Cloud WAN, we'll explore best practices, common pitfalls, design patterns, and cost optimization techniques. Expect whiteboard diagrams, real-world examples, and honest insights from the field. No slides, no fluff - just your questions and straight answers. Bring your curiosity.

title: Assembling the Complete AI Stack: Optimizing Your AI Hardware on AWS
abstract: Supercharge your AI Infrastructure by leveraging AWS broadest and deepest compute services. In this chalk talk, we'll guide you through optimizing each stage of your AI pipeline, from data processing to AI/ML workload to user applications, for maximum cost-efficiency, scalability, and performance. Learn how to select the ideal processors, accelerators, storage solutions, and pricing models for your workloads. Explore real world scenarios such as optimizing Graviton-based vector databases, choosing between GPUs and AWS accelerators, and building scalable data platforms. Walk away with confidence in understanding the essentials of creating high-performance, cost-effective AI infrastructure using AWS Compute services.

title: A strategic guide to AWS compute options for your AI/ML workload
abstract: AWS offers high performaing GPU instances for AI workload, including g6 optimized for vision workloads, g5 and g6e optimized for LLM inference, p4 and p5 optimized for model training, and the latest p6 optimized for large scale training and inference. Choosing the right GPUs is important for the performance, cost, and scalability of any AI project. In this talk, we will dive deeper into the architectural differentiators, including TFLOPs, memory capacity and bandwidth, the role of specialized cores, and the impact of data precision on both training and inference. You will learn practical frameworks for matching GPUs to specific tasks.

title: AstraZeneca's AI-powered Drug Discovery with Snowflake & AWS (sponsored by Snowflake)
abstract: The urgency of AI in pharmaceuticals is accelerating life-saving innovation. Hear how AstraZeneca is partnering with Snowflake, AWS, and others to achieve its ambitious goal of 20 new medicines by 2030. By building a modern, AI-ready data foundation on Snowflake’s Data Cloud, AstraZeneca has accelerated data product creation from six months to just four days. This has fueled groundbreaking scientific research and enabled the development of AI-powered solutions, such as a project to improve lung disease survival rates from 30% to 90%. Learn how this collaboration is harnessing the power of data and AI to discover tomorrow’s scientific breakthroughs, today. This presentation is brought to you by Snowflake, an AWS Partner.

title: A tale of two transactions
abstract: If you are curious how transactions are processed differently in Amazon Aurora DSQL versus Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL, join Marc Brooker, AWS VP and Distinguished Engineer, as he dives into how transactions are processed in these two databases – right down to the code level. You’ll understand how each database handles multiple transactions accessing or changing the data at the same time, why they use different approaches, and what that means for your architectures. You’ll leave with a deep intuition for what makes database workloads scale and ability to think about how to apply those lessons to your architectures and code.

title: Autodesk's ML Inference Optimization: Leveraging AWS AI Chips
abstract: Learn how Autodesk partnered with AWS Generative AI Innovation Center to optimize spatial GenAI models using Inferentia and Trainium chips. This collaboration reduced latency by 45% and improved price-per-inference by 62% across workflows generating 3D objects and CAD sketch constraints. Explore Autodesk's migration journey, including strategies for implementing custom kernels via the Neuron Kernel Interface. Discover the sustainability benefits and economic advantages of adopting custom silicon, from reduced carbon emissions to optimized infrastructure costs.

title: AutoGluon: Build Production ML Apps from Zero to Hero
abstract: Transform your ML development journey with AutoGluon, AWS's open source AutoML framework that delivers state-of-the-art performance for tabular, time series, and multimodal tasks. In this hands-on workshop, discover how to leverage pre-trained foundational models to achieve superior results with just 3 lines of code. Whether you're starting from zero or fine-tuning existing models, AutoGluon's flexible APIs adapt to your computational resources while maintaining high accuracy. Learn to build, train, and deploy production-ready ML models using AutoGluon's intuitive interface. Join us to experience the future of automated machine learning and elevate your ML applications from prototype to production in record time,

title: Automate analysis and extract intelligence from financial datasets
abstract: Join this workshop to develop a unified platform for data, analytics, AI/ML and generative AI-powered solutions using Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. We'll guide you through how to implement batch and streaming pipelines to seamlessly integrate AWS-hosted and third-party data sources. Gain hands-on experience with zero-ETL integration and AWS analytics services such as AWS Glue and Amazon EMR. Extract valuable insights and deploy analytics from financial datasets using Amazon Redshift. Leave equipped with practical skills to effectively build AI-powered applications that automate financial analysis and leverage Amazon Bedrock agents.

title: Automate cloud operations with AI agents
abstract: Join this technical workshop to build automated cloud operations solutions using AI agents. Get hands-on experience implementing Amazon CloudWatch investigations and Amazon Bedrock Agents for streamlined debugging and intelligent analysis. Practice using synthetic monitoring and traffic analysis tools while working through real-world operational scenarios. Learn to reduce incident resolution times through practical exercises.

title: Automate customer experiences with Amazon Connect
abstract: Learn how to leverage Amazon Connect's rules engine to automate customer experiences, from simple tasks to complex decision workflows. This interactive session demonstrates practical strategies for implementing rules-based solutions that enhance service efficiency and scalability. You'll gain hands-on experience creating automated workflows that deliver exceptional customer service while reducing operational complexity.

title: Automate data protection at scale with AWS Backup and AWS Control Tower
abstract: A robust data protection strategy is critical for business continuity, improving data governance, resilience, and security posture. Join this code talk to learn how to implement infrastructure as code for core backup and recovery operations, restore testing, and compliance auditing. You'll discover techniques for monitoring and reporting data protection status. The session also covers integrating AWS Backup with Control Tower, demonstrating how centralized governance capabilities enhance backup compliance and security across your AWS environment, thus enabling large enterprises' ability to offload un-differentiated heavy lifting to the integration.

title: Automated cloud security remediation with agentic workflows (sponsored by Dynatrace)
abstract: Today’s platform teams and SREs need to shift from a reactive operations approach to autonomous, agent-based cloud ops. In this session, you’ll learn how to build an automated, agent-driven remediation workflow by combining AWS Security Hub findings with Dynatrace Davis® AI and the MCP server. We’ll walk through a step-by-step pipeline, from detection to automated fix, where automation handles the heavy lifting and only minor steps require human interaction. Additionally, discover how AI-generated remediation assets, context-aware ticketing, and post-fix validation come together to significantly reduce MTTR and streamline DevSecOps. This presentation is brought to you by Dynatrace, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Improve DevEx for GenAI Deployments: Dynatrace + Amazon Bedrock (sponsored by Dynatrace)
Automated cloud security remediation with agentic workflows (sponsored by Dynatrace)
Improve DevEx for GenAI Deployments: Dynatrace + Amazon Bedrock (sponsored by Dynatrace)
Automated cloud security remediation with agentic workflows (sponsored by Dynatrace)

title: Automate disaster recovery playbooks using generative AI
abstract:
Discover how to strengthen your mission-critical workloads with automated disaster recovery planning using Amazon Bedrock, AWS Resilience Hub, and AWS Systems Manager. This session demonstrates practical techniques for generating and validating recovery runbooks. Learn how to craft effective prompts that produce architecture-aware recovery plans with comprehensive testing capabilities.

You'll gain insights into modernizing your disaster recovery strategy with automation, helping to reduce risk and improve operational resilience.

title: Automated Security Remediation with AWS Step Functions
abstract: Transform manual security operations into automated workflows using AWS Step Functions and AWS Security Hub. This hands-on session demonstrates how to orchestrate sophisticated security remediation pipelines with AWS Step Functions' visual workflow designer. Build an automated system that detects and fixes Amazon EC2 security group violations, complete with approval workflows and notifications. Learn to design security workflows, integrate AWS Step Functions with AWS Security Hub and AWS Lambda, implement error handling, and create approval gates for sensitive operations. Gain practical skills to immediately enhance your cloud security posture.

title: Automate insights and drive innovation with cloud and AI solutions
abstract: Discover how leading companies are leveraging AWS to transform their operations through cloud and AI innovation. Join to learn how Mondelez built a fully automated, secure cloud platform, that supports its SAP RISE migration, enables new artificial intelligence (AI) initiatives and edge computing deployments, while lowering cloud spend by 40 percent. Explore how W.W. Grainger revolutionized cost governance using Management Control Plane (MCP) and AI Agents to deliver automated, actionable insights to business leaders. You’ll leave understanding how you can use AWS infrastructure to empower employees, innovate quickly and securely, and optimize costs.

title: Automate Inventory Rebalancing on AWS with Agentic AI
abstract: Learn how to build and deploy an inventory-rebalancing AI agent using Amazon Bedrock, AWS Lambda, and Amazon EventBridge. This hands-on builders' session guides you through creating an AI agent that monitors inventory levels and autonomously executes rebalancing decisions based on real-time data. You will implement core agent decision-making logic, configure inventory monitoring rules, set up automated rebalancing actions, and test the system in a simulated supply chain environment. You'll leave the session with working sample code and practical knowledge in building AI-powered supply chain solutions.

title: Automate Java application upgrade with generative AI
abstract: AWS Generative AI Services helps automate end-to-end process of upgrading and transforming Java applications. Reduce the time and costs associated with modernizing applications, unlock previously cost-prohibitive and cumbersome modernization opportunities, and save customers months or even years of effort. By automating undifferentiated upgrade and modernization tasks, customers can enhance application performance and security and accelerate innovation. Join this workshop to learn how to take your Java application modernization to the next level.

title: Automate Java app upgrades & accelerate innovation with generative AI
abstract: AWS Generative AI Services helps automate end-to-end process of upgrading and transforming Java applications. Reduce the time and costs associated with modernizing applications, unlock previously cost-prohibitive and cumbersome modernization opportunities, and save customers months or even years of effort. By automating undifferentiated upgrade and modernization tasks, customers can enhance application performance and security and accelerate innovation. Join this chalk talk to learn how to take your application modernization to the next level.

title: Automate Review Analysis with Nova Act and Generative AI
abstract: Transform how you handle customer feedback in this hands-on builder session. Learn to scrape reviews from websites using Amazon Nova Act's browser automation capabilities, then analyze sentiment patterns with Bedrock's generative AI models. By session end, you'll have built a working proof-of-concept that can extract actionable insights from reviews, identify trends, and generate summaries without complex coding. Perfect for developers seeking practical AI solutions for real business challenges.

title: Automate SAP supply chain exceptions with generative AI
abstract: Managing exceptions in SAP business workflows remains a labor-intensive burden, often requiring dedicated staff whose time could be better spent on strategic initiatives.  In this workshop, discover how to use AWS agentic AI capabilities to automate exception handling for SAP based supply chain processes. You will create an Amazon Bedrock based AI agent to query structured SAP Supply Chain Data via SAP ODATA. Then, you will connect Amazon Bedrock to S3 to upload a unstructured document containing a set of standard operating procedures teaching the agent to learn how to handle exceptions within the SAP supply chain process.

title: Automate vulnerability remediation for containers running in AWS
abstract: Containers running in production can still be impacted by newly discovered security vulnerabilities. Take control by adopting a solution that automatically redeploys secure containers within minutes of vulnerability detection. In this session, explore how to build a self-healing container pipeline that gets triggered when Amazon Inspector finds vulnerabilities in your container images. Dive deep into implementing event-driven mitigation of security issues with zero-downtime. Walk away with actionable strategies to automate security controls, maintain compliance, and scale container security best practices across your organization. Bring your questions about container security automation and real-world deployment scenarios.

title: Automate your code transformations at scale
abstract: This hands-on session will enable you to automate a wide range of code maintenance and evolution tasks. Attendees will learn real-world use cases demonstrating significant time and cost savings compared to manual approaches. Whether you're looking to streamline API upgrades, migrate frameworks, or enforce coding standards, this session will provide a glimpse into the future of scalable, automated code transformations.

title: Automate your software tasks with agent hooks
abstract: As projects grow, documentation, testing, refactoring for readability, and application performance becomes more critical. In this session learn how you can delegate many of these tasks using Kiro’s agent hooks, which trigger automatically and work in the background, so you can ship quality code every time.

title: Automating Amazon Fulfillment Center Operations with Generative AI
abstract: Discover how Amazon improved fulfillment center launches by building a computer vision solution using Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Nova models. Learn how we achieved 99% accuracy in processing 200,000+ equipment verifications per site. In this session, we discuss architectural decisions that enabled scaling image processing across 150+ fulfillment launches, practical approaches for prompt engineering to improve accuracy, and how we optimized batch processing to keep costs under $0.0001 per image.

title: Automating and optimizing EC2 Mac instances for Apple development
abstract: Amazon EC2 Mac instances allow you to run on-demand macOS workloads for Apple application development in the cloud. Join this hands-on workshop to explore best practices for automating the provisioning, configuration, and scaling of your EC2 Mac instances. Learn how to prepare an Amazon Machine Image (AMI), replace the root volume for faster updates, and manage System Integrity Protection (SIP) for low-level customization.

title: Automating Certificate Management with Exportable Public Certificates
abstract: Discover how to automate TLS certificate management using AWS Certificate Manager's exportable public certificates. We'll demonstrate an end-to-end automation framework utilizing AWS services like EventBridge, Lambda, Step Functions, and Systems Manager for certificate issuance, export, distribution, and renewal across diverse environments. Learn to implement automated deployment workflows, set up monitoring and notifications for certificate lifecycle events, and ensure seamless updates across EC2 instances, on-premises servers, and multi-cloud setups. By attending, you'll gain the skills to eliminate manual certificate management tasks and minimize the risk of certificate-related outages in your organization.

title: Automating compliance and auditing at scale
abstract: As organizations scale their cloud operations, manual compliance becomes unsustainable. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to build automated compliance controls using AWS Config, Systems Manager, and Audit Manager at scale. Learn to implement automated security assessments and remediation workflows while leveraging Amazon Q CLI and CloudTrail Lake for intelligent investigation. Experience how AWS services transform manual compliance into continuous automated assessment.

title: Automating enterprise-scale code modernization with agentic AI
abstract: Discover how AI agents are revolutionizing enterprise-scale code modernization initiatives. This session demonstrates how to accelerate your modernization journey through agentic AI-driven code transformations. You'll learn practical strategies for defining custom code transformations, setting up transformation campaigns, managing multi-repository migrations, and measuring success. Featured customer success journeys from QAD and other industry leaders will showcase language migrations and framework upgrades, providing actionable insights for your own modernization projects.

title: Automating IAM policy validation and analysis using GitHub Actions
abstract: In this code talk, we'll demonstrate how to automate the validation and analysis of AWS IAM policies using GitHub Actions and IAM Access Analyzer. Through live coding examples, you'll see how policy validation and analysis, powered by automated reasoning, can minimise deployment of unwanted IAM policies. While security teams oversee organizational security posture, developers create applications needing permissions. Watch as we code the solution for enabling developer speed with security through delegated IAM policy authoring. Through interactive demonstrations, you'll learn how cfn-policy-validator and GitHub Actions can automatically validate and analyze IAM policies to uphold security when permitting developers policy authoring abilities. Follow along with the code as we show you how to enable developer speed without compromising security posture.

title: Automating LLM evaluation at scale: MLOps for continuous improvement
abstract: As AI development proliferates across enterprise environments, efficiently evaluating large language models (LLMs) at scale has become a core challenge for MLOps engineers. This workshop guides participants through building automated LLM evaluation and monitoring pipelines using Amazon SageMaker Pipelines and Amazon CloudWatch. Attendees will implement real-time model output assessment, anomaly detection, and continuous optimization. Through hands-on labs, you’ll master best practices for operationalizing and iteratively improving LLMs in production environments.

title: Automating LLM Fine-Tuning with Multi-Agentic Orchestration
abstract: Domain-specific LLM fine-tuning traditionally demands extensive manual effort. This session explores an innovative multi-agent system built on AWS that continuously improves model performance with minimal human intervention. The solution leverages Amazon Bedrock and SageMaker to implement specialized agents that evaluate model responses, detect error patterns, generate targeted training data, and ensure quality control. This automated pipeline reduced fine-tuning cycles from weeks to days while delivering measurable improvements in model accuracy and consistency. Learn how this scalable architecture enables organizations to rapidly adapt foundation models to specialized domains across multiple industries.

title: Automating LLM fine-tuning with multi-agentic orchestration
abstract: Domain-specific LLM fine-tuning traditionally demands extensive manual effort. This session explores an innovative multi-agent system built on AWS that continuously improves model performance with minimal human intervention. The solution leverages Amazon Bedrock and SageMaker to implement specialized agents that evaluate model responses, detect error patterns, generate targeted training data, and ensure quality control. This automated pipeline reduced fine-tuning cycles from weeks to days while delivering measurable improvements in model accuracy and consistency. Learn how this scalable architecture enables organizations to rapidly adapt foundation models to specialized domains across multiple industries.

title: Automating Suricata rules for AWS network firewall
abstract: Writing and updating Suricata rules for AWS Network Firewall shouldn’t be the blocker to achieving your security goals. In this session, I’ll share how we built a lightweight pipeline that transforms raw inputs, like ports, protocols, domains, and IPs, into production-ready suricata rules using Amazon EventBridge Pipes, AWS Lambda, and Amazon S3. You’ll learn how we used built-in filtering and transformation to streamline rule generation and updates, reduce operational overhead, and make Suricata more accessible for security teams. This is a story of event-driven design and practical automation that brings powerful network controls into reality.

title: Auto ML Pipeline for Custom Telco Language Models in Amazon Connect
abstract: Participants will work with an autonomous system that enhances customer service using AI models specialized in telecom terminology and issues. It leverages AWS Trainium chips and SageMaker to fine-tune Llama models with real customer data. The workflow uses AWS Glue for data cataloging and integrates customized models into Amazon Bedrock. These enhanced AI agents connect with Amazon Connect via Lambda functions to provide accurate telecom-specific responses and intent classification. Nova Sonic manages automated callbacks, while the system continuously learns from new data to improve customer service experiences.

title: Automotive Supply Chain Optimization using AI
abstract: Discover how cutting-edge AI technology is advancing supply chain management in 2025. This lecture style session demonstrates how AI-powered analytics can decode complex patterns in backlog fluctuations, dwell times, and transit metrics across your supply chain network in near real-time. Partners will learn how to leverage these advanced capabilities to deliver unprecedented visibility and predictability to their customers' supply chain operations. By implementing these solutions, you can help your customers achieve significant improvements in operational efficiency, reduce costs, and maintain a competitive edge in today's dynamic marketplace.

services: Amazon Q in AWS Supply Chain

title: Autonomous agents powered by streaming data and Retrieval Augmented Generation
abstract: Unlock the potential of intelligent autonomous agents that combine real-time streaming data with Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) for dynamic decision-making. You will learn how to use streaming technologies like Amazon Kinesis, Amazon MSK, and Managed Service for Apache Flink create a robust pipeline to transform raw events into actionable insights. This session will show you how autonomous agents leverage these real-time insights with RAG architecture powered by OpenSearch, enabling immediate, context-aware responses to changing conditions. This practical architecture drives real-world value in critical scenarios like predictive maintenance, automated incident response, and intelligent customer service automation, with improved accuracy and reduced latency.

title: Autonomous DBOps: Agentic AI for maintaining databases
abstract: Maintaining performance for Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS often requires manual effort, such as tuning queries, managing indexes, and handling alerts. In this builders' session, learn how to leverage agentic AI solutions implementing LLM-powered autonomous agents to monitor, diagnose, and optimize relational databases in real time. We will demonstrate how AI agents can analyze slow query logs, recommend or apply tuning actions, and trigger intelligent alerts using Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Cloudwatch, AWS Lambda, and Amazon Systems Manager. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Autonomous Enterprise: Redefining the Future of Business with AI (sponsored by Digitate)
abstract: Global businesses with complex technology landscapes are rapidly embracing GenAI, Agentic AI, and cloud-native technologies. Operations are shifting from traditional SLAs to XLAs and SRE models, and are facing increasing pressure to operate faster, smarter, and more efficiently. In this session, Digitate will explore how AI-driven automation is transforming business operations into Autonomous Enterprises that learn, adapt, and make decisions with minimal human intervention. Real-world examples will uncover how businesses can harness intelligence at scale, reduce operational complexity, and unlock new avenues for growth and innovation. This presentation is brought to you by Digitate, an AWS Partner.

title: Autonomous Live-Ops: AI Agents for Dynamic Gaming Experiences
abstract: To: Learn how to automate live-ops using AI agents that analyze player behavior and generate dynamic recommendations in real-time. We’ll demonstrate configuring Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to orchestrate intelligent agents that analyze engagement metrics and provides real-time segmentation and campaign recommendations . Attendees will build a working prototype that acts as a foundation for building an autonomous live-ops workflow that provides impactful insights while reducing the overhead of managing traditional live-ops platforms. This hands-on workshop showcases the newly launched Bedrock AgentCore service with interchangeable AI models, perfect for live-ops engineers seeking to reduce manual operations while increasing player retention and engagement.

title: Autonomous Web3 agents on AWS
abstract: In this code talk, we will demonstrate how to leverage Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Strands Agents SDK to build a crypto AI agent that can query real-time and historical blockchain data to perform analysis, execute on-chain transactions using integrated wallets, and more. Learn how to build an agent programmatically that can retrieve data from topic-specific knowledge bases, query historical public blockchain data provided by Open Data on AWS, query for real-time data, and sign blockchain transactions with AWS KMS

title: Autonomy in Defense: Scaling Innovation for Mission Outcomes
abstract: Mission autonomy isn’t a future vision—it’s happening now. Join this session to explore the real-world journey to autonomous operations using AWS’s four-phase mission autonomy flywheel: from digital engineering and secure edge deployment to real-time AI-driven operations and post-mission optimization. Featuring a special guest from the U.S. Submarine Forces, you’ll hear firsthand how AWS is enabling autonomy at the tactical edge—underwater, under pressure, and at speed. Walk away with reference architectures, implementation strategies, and lessons learned on scaling autonomy across domains to accelerate decision-making and mission outcomes.

title: Autoscale EC2 Instances with Amazon EventBridge
abstract: This lab demonstrates automated EC2 instance management using Amazon EventBridge and Lambda. Learn to create EventBridge rules that trigger Lambda functions in response to Auto Scaling events and scheduled maintenance. Practice configuring cron-based schedules for instance reboots, monitoring Auto Scaling activities through CloudWatch logs, and testing event-driven automation. Ideal for DevOps engineers implementing automated infrastructure management.

title: AWS Agent for SAP Invoice Automation
abstract: This session covers the application of an agentic workflow, leveraging Amazon Bedrock Agent and Amazon Nova, to optimize a common SAP process: vendor invoice processing. Traditional SAP invoice handling often involves manual data entry, error-prone matching, and approval bottlenecks. By integrating Amazon Textract for intelligent document processing and Bedrock's large language models for reasoning, an agentic solution can automate data extraction, verification, discrepancy handling, and approval routing. This results in reduced manual effort, improved accuracy, faster processing times, lower costs, and enhanced visibility within the SAP environment, ultimately fostering stronger vendor relationships.

title: AWS and Oracle: Transforming Healthcare (sponsored by Oracle)
abstract: Explore how AWS and Oracle Database@AWS combine their strengths to accelerate digital transformation for  healthcare providers, payers, and life sciences organizations. Learn how AWS’s global infrastructure, AI/ML services, and analytics capabilities seamlessly integrate with Oracle’s industry-leading databases and applications—directly within AWS.  We’ll highlight real-world examples of how this joint power helps healthcare organizations improve patient outcomes, reduce costs, modernize operations, and unlock new possibilities in research and personalized medicine. This presentation is brought to you by Oracle, an AWS Partner.

organizations improve patient outcomes, reduce costs, modernize operations, and unlock new possibilities in research and personalized medicine. This presentation is brought to you by Oracle, an AWS Partner.
