title: AWS Backup clean room recovery: Comprehensive resilience framework
abstract: In this technical deep-dive session, discover how AWS Backup provides a comprehensive data resilience framework for organizations facing evolving cyber threats. Learn how AWS Backup's key features, including automated restore testing, index search capabilities, and logical air-gapped vaults, can be leveraged in multi-account strategies to enhance backup isolation and recovery. Learn to design robust architectures that utilize these AWS Backup capabilities to create a secure, isolated environment for backup recovery, mimicking the concept of a "clean room" in traditional disaster recovery scenarios.

title: AWS Backup unlocked: strategies for at-scale data protection
abstract: Many organizations have barely scratched the surface of what's possible with AWS Backup at enterprise scale. This chalk talk delves into advanced strategies for building comprehensive data protection that spans your entire AWS estate. We'll navigate the data protection journey—from baseline automated backups to sophisticated air-gapped solutions with automated restore testing. Discover how to leverage AWS Organizations for centralized control, implement logical air-gaps for cyber resilience, and ensure compliance across accounts and regions. Whether you're looking to scale your AWS Backup implementation or architect cutting-edge solutions, you'll gain expert insights to transform your data protection practice. Join us to master techniques that elevate your organization's security posture using AWS Backup.

title: AWS Cloud Technical Essentials
abstract: The bootcamp session covers the fundamental AWS concepts related to compute, database, storage, networking, monitoring, and security. You will start working in AWS through hands-on course experiences. The course covers the concepts necessary to increase your understanding of AWS services, so that you can make informed decisions about solutions that meet business requirements. Throughout the course, you will gain information on how to build, compare, and apply highly available, fault tolerant, scalable, and cost-effective cloud solutions.

title: AWS Cloud WAN MCP Server: Transform network operations with GenAI
abstract: Ready to experience the power of debugging network issues through natural language queries? Discover how AWS Cloud WAN's Model Context Protocol (MCP) server leverages Generative AI to redefine network operations. In this session, learn how to use common, complex scenarios including trace network paths using natural language queries, analyzing AWS Cloud WAN Core Network policies through simple prompts, and troubleshoot global routing with AI-assisted intelligent analysis. Perfect for network professionals who want to explore streamlining their AWS infrastructure management while embracing the future of AI-powered networking tools.

title: AWS detection and response innovations that drive security outcomes
abstract: Discover how the latest AWS detection and response capabilities can help secure your cloud environment more effectively. Learn practical ways to achieve integrated security outcomes through enhanced threat detection, automated vulnerability management, and streamlined response—all at scale. We'll show you how to use AWS security services to protect workloads and data, centralize security monitoring, manage security posture continuously, and unify security data, while leveraging generative AI for security operations. Walk away with actionable insights for integrating AWS detection and response services to strengthen and simplify security across your AWS environment.

title: AWS disaster recovery strategies
abstract: Prepare for the unexpected in this disaster recovery (DR) builders session. We'll work on an application to implement the DR strategy that aligns to the recovery objectives of your business: Backup and restore, pilot light, warm standby, or AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery (AWS DRS). We'll cover services such as Amazon Aurora, Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, AWS CloudFront, AWS DRS, AWS Fault Injection Service, and AWS Backup. We will also explore ways to test and validate your chosen approach. You'll leave with practical insights for building the right DR strategy for your business.

title: AWS Escape Room: Exam Prep for AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate
abstract: Prepare for AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate by playing this 3D virtual escape room game. Using an avatar, you will enter a narrative-driven world, & solve a series of interactive puzzles, exam-style questions, & hands-on labs to leave locked rooms. Compete against others to escape first! These are the requirements to participate:   Device: Laptop or PC. Mobile devices not supported.  OS: 64Bit operating system (Windows, macOS and Linux) Browser: Chrome, Firefox, Edge - mobile browsers are not supported. Storage: 1GB available space Network: Broadband internet connection (VPN connection not recommended) Graphics: Integrated or dedicated 3D graphics Resolution:1920 x 1080 resolution Input: Keyboard & Mouse are required to play Headphones: Optional but recommended Recommendations: Close all 3D graphics or CPU intensive applications. Connect headphones for full effects.

title: AWS Escape Room: Exam Prep for AWS Certified AI Practitioner [Exam Prep]
abstract: Prepare for AWS Certified AI Practitioner by playing this 3D virtual escape room game. During this session, you will select an avatar, enter a narrative-driven world, & solve a series of interactive puzzles, exam-style questions, & hands-on labs to leave locked rooms. Compete against others to escape first!  These are the requirements to participate: Device: Laptop or PC. Mobile devices not supported. Connect headphones for sound effects.

Connect headphones for full effect.

title: AWS European Sovereign Cloud: From concept to reality
abstract: Join AWS experts Colm and Addy for an in-depth look at the AWS European Sovereign Cloud. Explore this new, independent infrastructure's dedicated architecture, EU-based operations, operational controls coupled with governance and legal framework that powers this cloud. Learn how this cloud solution is built, operated, and secured entirely within Europe.

title: AWS European Sovereign Cloud: Your 20-Minute Essential Guide
abstract: Discover AWS's European Sovereign Cloud, designed to meet the evolving data sovereignty requirements and regulatory landscape of the European Union. In this concise 20-minute session, we'll explore the key features, architectural principles, and unique value propositions of this purpose-built cloud solution. Learn how AWS addresses data residency, operational autonomy, and compliance requirements while maintaining the same level of security, reliability, and innovation you expect from AWS. Whether you're a business leader, architect, or compliance professional operating in Europe, this session will equip you with essential knowledge to navigate the future of sovereign cloud computing.

title: AWS for healthcare analytics: accelerating time to insights
abstract: In today's data-driven healthcare landscape, organizations must rapidly transform diverse data sources into actionable insights that improve patient outcomes and accelerate operational efficiency. This session showcases how AWS' integrated analytics capabilities can deliver unmatched price-performance for every analytics workload, from data processing and SQL analytics to streaming and business intelligence. Through real-world healthcare examples, learn how AWS' built-in governance and scalability enable organizations to build secure, efficient analytics pipelines that accelerate time-to-insight. Ideal for data practitioners, IT decision-makers, and executives evaluating enterprise analytics platforms to drive their data-driven transformation.

title: AWS for VMware migrations: Successes, roadmaps, & strategies
abstract: Are you looking to migrate your VMware on-premises environment to AWS and seeking how other IT leaders completed their migration? This session brings together migration trailblazers who’ve been there. Hear firsthand how different global organizations accelerated their cloud journeys, from planning to execution. Speakers share the trusted tools, strategies, and lessons that streamlined their transitions, helping you get insights to guide your own migration. Plus, get a glimpse into their modernization roadmaps and innovation strategies. Whether you’re just starting or overcoming hurdles, you’ll gain actionable insights to drive your own cloud transformation.

title: AWS fundamentals for the accidental SQL Server database administrator
abstract: With over 200 fully featured services on AWS, it can be challenging for database administrators to ramp up. In this chalk talk, learn how to map DBA tasks to cloud architect roles. Learn about networking, security, high availability, and disaster recovery for SQL Server versions up to 2025. Discover how to use generative AI services like Amazon Q Business and Amazon Q Developer with your deployments and queries. Learn to choose the right services, secure and cost-optimize workloads. Come prepared with your questions.

title: AWS GameDay: Agentic AI ft. Dynatrace
abstract: Join us for an immersive and collaborative learning exercise to develop practical skills in implementing AI-assisted solutions on AWS. Dive into a live AWS environment where you will enhance various workloads with cutting-edge AI capabilities. You will leverage and build skills in Amazon Bedrock, foundation models, AI agents, intelligent automation, and ML-powered operations. Face challenges that blend traditional cloud architecture with the power of AI! Whether you are an AI enthusiast or just getting started and looking to build your AI skillset, this GameDay will put your AI skills to the ultimate test. This session features integrated use cases with Dynatrace.

title: AWS GameDay: AI-Assisted Developer Experience ft. New Relic
abstract: Join us for an immersive and collaborative learning exercise to develop practical skills in AI-assisted developer tooling from AWS. Dive into a live AWS environment where you will 10x your engineering skills with AI as you onboard as a new software engineer at a fictional startup. You will leverage and build skills while working with AI-powered coding assistants and other tools as you plan prompts, surface specs, review requirements, and tackle tasks to vibe code your way to the top of the leaderboard. Race against time to transform old codebases, automate ops, and even ship straight to prod! Whether you are a seasoned coder or just starting your cloud journey, this GameDay will put your dev skills to the ultimate test. This session features integrated use cases with New Relic.

title: AWS GameDay: Cloud Architecture ft. Datadog
abstract: Join us for an immersive and collaborative learning exercise to develop practical skills in advanced cloud architecture on AWS. Dive into a live AWS environment to design and implement solutions that balance performance, cost, reliability, and operational excellence. And, of course, you will flex your Well Architected muscles to lift all six pillars of the Well Architected Framework. Tackle complex scenarios that push your architectural decision-making to the limit! Whether you are a seasoned architect or an aspiring cloud professional, this GameDay will challenge your ability to create resilient, efficient cloud solutions when it counts. This session features integrated use cases with Datadog.

title: AWS GameDay: Security ft. SentinelOne
abstract: Join us for an immersive and collaborative learning exercise to develop practical skills in cloud security on AWS. Defend your cloud infrastructure in a real AWS environment as you navigate this high-stakes security challenge. You will leverage and build skills in detection and response, zero-trust architectures, and ensure compliance while maintaining operational stability. Face off against real-world security scenarios with sophisticated attack patterns — where the attacks may even originate from other teams participating in the GameDay! Whether you are a seasoned security professional or brand new to the world of security, this GameDay will sharpen your cloud security skills. This session features integrated use cases with SentinelOne.

title: AWS GameDay - Winning the DDos Game
abstract: Compete in a team-based environment where you will face real-time threats aimed at your web application. Your team will use the latest capabilities in AWS WAF and AWS Shield to mitigate distributed HTTP floods, web exploits, and malicious bots that disrupt the experience of your customers. This event offers a risk-free environment where teamwork is paramount as you work together under pressure. Watch a real-time scoreboard as your team works through each level of the game. The most effective team will earn a prize at the end!

title: AWS & GenAI Power CDG's Telecom Software Modernization Journey
abstract: Learn how AWS transformed a telecommunications software business in an era where reliable broadband connectivity is essential to daily life. Through AWS Enterprise Support and the Partner Program, Communications Data Group (CDG) achieved 100% year-over-year growth while modernizing solutions for telecom operators. AWS's 24/7 technical support and expertise in cloud architecture, generative AI, and business intelligence enabled CDG's next-generation platform. The session shows how CDG improved efficiency, demonstrating how AWS helps providers scale, manage costs, and enhance customer experiences.

title: AWS Generative AI Innovation Center driving enterprise success with AWS Partners
abstract: This session reveals proven pathways to generative AI and agentic AI success, drawn from the AWS Generative AI Innovation Center's experience with thousands of customer implementations. As organizations move beyond initial AI experiments to broad-scale deployment, they face critical challenges in customizing models with proprietary data, managing costs, and scaling autonomous agents across the enterprise. We'll showcase how the AWS Generative AI Innovation Center's production-first methodology and Partner Innovation Alliance (PIA) create opportunities with partners to build joint solutions. In particular, we will discuss the VALUE (Velocity Acceleration for Leveraging Unified Enterprise-AI) framework, which helps organizations overcome these challenges and achieve measurable business outcomes.

title: AWS Global Startup Program - how to accelerate your GTM success
abstract: Discover how to leverage the AWS Global Startup Program to accelerate your success partnering with AWS. If you are a startup ISV and looking to reach more AWS customers, join this session to learn best practices and strategies to accelerate your results partnering with AWS.

title: AWS Graviton: The best price performance for your AWS workloads
abstract: AWS Graviton-based Amazon EC2 instances provide the best price performance for workloads in Amazon EC2. In this session, dive deep into the AWS Graviton processor and learn about its workload performance, energy efficiency, and software offerings. Learn about common use cases, best practices to optimize your workloads across various applications, customer success stories, and how you can accelerate your AWS Graviton journey.

title: AWS infrastructure as code: A year in review
abstract: AWS provides services that enable the creation, deployment and maintenance of application infrastructure in a programmatic, descriptive, and declarative way. These services provide rigor, clarity, and reliability to application development. Join this session to learn about the new features and improvements for AWS infrastructure as code with AWS CloudFormation and AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) and discover how they can benefit your team.

title: AWS Jam: DevOps & Modernization - Sponsored by LaunchDarkly
abstract: Are you looking to enhance your AWS DevOps and modernization skills? We’ll provide hands-on environments where you can improve applications and implement DevOps best practices. What are the limitations of the current solution? How can you use multiple AWS services to modernize your architectures? Whether you're new to AWS or a seasoned Cloud Ninja, this Jam is your chance to demonstrate your skills and learn new ones. Structured for all experience levels, our sessions include guided exercises, helpful clues, and support from AWS experts to boost your application modernization and DevOps knowledge. Team up, compete with others, climb the leaderboard, and win prizes based on speed and accuracy. With expert guidance every step of the way, all you need is a computer, a desire to learn, and a competitive spirit.

title: AWS Jam: Generative AI - Sponsored by Nvidia
abstract: Having the right data is just the start—knowing how to use AWS services to unlock the power of Generative AI is the real challenge. In this hands-on Jam, you’ll team up to solve real-world Gen AI and Agentic AI scenarios using tools like Amazon Bedrock and SageMaker AI. Whether you’re exploring prompt engineering or building with foundation models, challenges are designed for all skill levels. Compete against other teams, climb the leaderboard, and win prizes based on speed and accuracy. AWS experts will be available to guide you, and helpful clues will keep you moving forward. All you need is a computer, a desire to learn, and a little competitive spirit to take on this Gen AI challenge.

title: AWS Jam: Security- Sponsored by PaloAlto Networks and Fortinet
abstract: In this session, we’ll provide incident response scenarios where you can build new skills and sharpen existing ones by working through simulated security incidents. Can you identify what caused the breach? What would you do differently? How can you use AWS services to architect and prevent incidents from happening again? Whether you're new to AWS, new to security, or experienced in both, this session is for you. Our guided exercises and AWS experts will support learners of all levels. Team up, compete against others, climb the leaderboard, and win prizes based on speed and accuracy. With expert guidance and helpful clues along the way, all you need is a computer, a desire to learn, and a competitive spirit to take on the challenge.

title: AWS KMS over the decade: How architecture evolved to earn customer trust
abstract: Data privacy and sovereignty requirements continue to drive cloud security innovation. This deep dive session traces AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) evolution since inception; from solving fundamental key management challenges to supporting complex regulatory and compliance requirements. Learn about the AWS KMS architecture, operational processes, and technical controls that are in place and how it all comes together to help ensure customer trust. Gain insights into AWS European Sovereign Cloud and how its utilization of partitions and its corporate governance model provide you with stronger security assurance and sovereignty needs.

title: AWS Lambda performance tuning: Best practices and guidance
abstract: In this session, you learn about opportunities to optimize your Serverless applications built with AWS Lambda. We'll discuss optimizations in the function configuration and within your function code. This session also covers how you can best measure and tune your function's performance by configuring memory to get the right application performance. You also hear best practices for initialization logic and reuse to enable fast startup and fast execution of your functions.

title: AWS Marketplace growth through product-led growth and international expansion
abstract: Discover how to accelerate your product-led growth (PLG) strategy and expand globally through AWS Marketplace. This session provides practical insights into optimizing digital customer acquisition, streamlining the buying experience, and localizing purchasing experiences. Learn to leverage AWS Marketplace capabilities to drive self-service subscriptions, shorten sales cycles, and obtain global operational fluidity. We'll cover best practices for listing optimization, pricing strategies, and key actionable insights to help with your international reach.

title: AWS Marketplace seller workshop: Publish, update, and manage products
abstract: In this workshop, choose between hands-on labs for new sellers just starting or labs for experienced sellers looking to optimize their operations in AWS Marketplace. Sellers just starting out can explore publishing AI agents, virtual machines, containers, or SaaS-based products. Established sellers can learn about API-enabled automation for their delivery pipelines and other integrations with AWS Marketplace. The part of the workshop intended for established sellers requires a registered seller account with an existing published product. For new or interested sellers, an active AWS account is required. This workshop is intended for AWS Partners. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: AWS migration journey: 2025 itinerary for Microsoft workloads
abstract: Ready to take your Microsoft migration journey to the next level in a world of AI-based tools? Join us for a session that showcases migration tools, mechanisms, and best practices supporting your Microsoft ecosystem. Whether you're migrating Active Directory, File Servers, Application Servers, or SQL databases, discover how to transform your landscape with precision and confidence on AWS. Learn firsthand how these services and solutions streamline complex migrations, reduce manual effort, and accelerate your migration journey.

title: AWS migration planning: From discovery to delivery
abstract: Navigate the complexities of enterprise cloud migration with insights gained from thousands of successful AWS transformations. This technical deep-dive examines critical planning phases: from initial discovery and environment assessment to building robust migration plans. Explore AWS Transform's capabilities for accelerated analysis while building comprehensive technical and business strategies. Learn the art of creating executable migration plans backed by real-world examples and proven methodologies.

title: AWS Networking Fundamentals: Connect, secure and scale
abstract: Dive into AWS networking foundations, starting with the fundamentals of Amazon VPC in a single Region. Learn essential skills for IPv4 and IPv6 selection, subnetting, routing, DNS, and security before scaling to global, multi-Region architectures. In this session, explore various VPC connectivity methods, hybrid network integration, and secure traffic management techniques. Discover how to implement private remote access for cloud resources and optimize service-to-service communication while building zero trust architectures. Whether new to AWS or wanting to expand networking building blocks, this session delivers practical insights into best practices and proven architecture patterns for establishing global connectivity.

title: AWS & Salesforce: A Zero Copy Customer Success Story (sponsored by Salesforce)
abstract: Learn how our joint customer uses Amazon Redshift and Salesforce Data Cloud with Zero Copy to unlock data, without having to physically move it, and power customer experiences. This presentation is brought to you by Salesforce, an AWS Partner.

title: AWS SAM Beyond the Basics - Powered by Amazon Q Developer
abstract: Join us for an interactive chalk talk where we'll collaboratively uncover the lesser-known capabilities of AWS SAM for local serverless development, enhanced by Amazon Q Developer. Together, we'll explore how SAM can revolutionize your local development workflow beyond its well-known deployment features. Through group discussion and live diagramming, we'll explore advanced techniques for testing Lambda functions, API Gateway, and event sources locally without cloud deployment. You'll discover how Amazon Q Developer integration can accelerate development cycles and enable sophisticated local debugging. Bring your questions and challenges as we collectively explore ways to reduce development time and cloud costs while building more robust serverless applications.

title: AWS Serverless developer experience workshop
abstract: The AWS Serverless Developer Experience (SDE) workshop is a hands-on workshop that immerses developers in building serverless solutions using AWS SAM. It covers composing serverless applications, event-driven architecture principles, serverless observability, open-source tools, and deployment automation, and is available in Python, Typescript, Java, or .NET runtime. The workshop aims to accelerate your serverless maturity through a real-world use case, challenging you to understand the “why” behind the design decisions, and their implementation, as you complete the solution and apply Serverless best practices.

title: AWS Skill Builder: Product Launches and New Features
abstract: Discover how AWS Skill Builder is transforming AWS Cloud learning! Learn about the new features we are launching as part of Skill Builder Next.

title: AWS Solutions Library: Accelerating innovation with proven patterns
abstract: The AWS Solutions Library provides proven architectural patterns for rapid innovation. This workshop demonstrates how to integrate multiple AWS Solutions to enhance application performance, reliability, and observability. Through hands-on exercises, learn to combine and customize pre-built solutions for enterprise-scale systems. Discover architectural strategies for leveraging the AWS Solutions Library to accelerate solution delivery while maintaining operational excellence. Gain practical experience implementing production-ready patterns from the AWS Solutions Library.

title: AWS storage beyond data boundaries: Building the data foundation
abstract: AWS storage services have evolved into the data foundation powering virtually any modern workload from massive data lakes to cutting-edge generative AI applications. This session unveils breakthrough innovations like S3 Tables for analytics optimization, S3 Vectors for AI/ML acceleration, and seamless SAN migration pathways that eliminate traditional infrastructure constraints. Discover how customers are building the world's largest data repositories while simultaneously running real-time analytics, training sophisticated AI models, and running mission-critical applications all on virtually unlimited scale, high performance, and elastic storage services. Learn how these storage services transform data from static storage into dynamic, intelligent data that adapts and scales with innovation.

title: AWS Tools: Automate Simulation jobs Recovery & maximize Cost Savings
abstract:
Discover how to harness the power of AWS Spot instances for HPC workloads while achieving cost savings compared to On-Demand pricing. 
 This session demonstrates innovative automation techniques for managing long-running simulations through checkpoint-restore capabilities, ensuring your scientific research stays on track despite potential spot interruptions. 
 We'll showcase practical implementations using smart job navigator solution that allows stateful jobs to survive Spot interruptions, helping you accelerate research outcomes while optimizing budget efficiency.

title: AWS wherever you need it: From the cloud to the edge
abstract: While most workloads can be migrated to the cloud, some remain on-premises or at the edge due to low latency, local data processing, or digital sovereignty needs. In this session, learn how AWS services like AWS Outposts, AWS Local Zones, AWS Dedicated Local Zones, and AWS IoT support hybrid cloud and edge computing workloads such as multiplayer gaming, high-frequency trading, medical imaging, smart manufacturing, and generative AI applications with data residency requirements.

title: Balance cost, performance & reliability for AI at enterprise scale
abstract: Deploying generative AI at enterprise scale requires balancing performance, cost, and reliability across diverse business purposes and use cases. Amazon Bedrock offers a comprehensive inference portfolio with On-Demand with Cross-Region Inference for elastic scaling, Provisioned Throughput for guaranteed performance, and Batch inference for cost-effective bulk processing. This interactive session covers the tools and approaches needed to architect hybrid inference strategies that combine capabilities including Amazon Bedrock Guardrails, enabling enterprises to maximize price-performance ratios as gen AI workloads scale.

title: Balance performance and cost on AWS with intelligent optimization (sponsored by IBM)
abstract: Ensure applications get what they need to perform across Kubernetes clusters and AWS services. This presentation is brought to you by IBM, an AWS Partner.

title: Balancing Agility and Compliance feat. The Digital Agency of Japan
abstract: Regulated industries face the challenge of innovating with agility while addressing stringent security and compliance requirements in the cloud. In this session, learn how the Japanese government successfully implemented a centralized governance model for cloud adoption across 30 ministries and 1,700 local government, enabling over 5,000 accounts to be managed seamlessly. With AWS Cloud Governance services like AWS Control Tower, AWS Config, and AWS Security Hub, regulated and public sector industries can streamline operations, enhance governance, and meet evolving compliance requirements to strike a balance between central control and local autonomy.

title: Balancing AI Innovation and Security: Novo Nordisk Agentic AI Framework
abstract: In the highly regulated life sciences industry, Novo Nordisk's Product Supply division pioneered a breakthrough framework for secure enterprise AI deployment. In this session, you’ll learn how the company built and scaled a solution that combines Model Context Protocol (MCP) with AI agents, featuring robust sandboxing and automated security controls. Explore how this innovative approach not only ensures compliance with strict pharmaceutical requirements but also accelerates AI adoption across manufacturing operations.

title: BCC: Hybrid architecture for generative AI to meet regulatory needs
abstract: Bank CenterCredit (BCC), a leading bank in Kazakhstan developed the first secure, scalable hybrid architecture tailored to meet Kazakhstan’s financial data regulations in Central Asia. Leveraging AWS Outposts and AWS KMS, the bank enabled local data storage with encrypted processing in the cloud. This architecture created solid foundation for multiple Generative AI delivered with Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock. Use cases include custom speech recognition model in Russian, Kazakh, and mixed languages, investments news summarization, and an HR chatbot. These AI solutions enabled regulatory compliance, cost savings, and operational efficiency—positioning BCC for continued innovation and growth.

title: Behind the curtain: Generative AI observability in financial services
abstract: Financial institutions deploying generative AI seek to effectively track model behavior, detect reasoning failures, and maintain regulatory compliance. In this chalk talk, we'll explore real-time observability techniques for generative AI workloads in regulated industries. You'll learn how to monitor prompt drift, hallucinations, grounding failures, and output volatility using Amazon Bedrock with Amazon CloudWatch and custom AWS Lambda logs. We'll walk through a solution that traces model behavior, visualizes anomalies, and enables prompt-level debugging—helping you meet audit, trust, and performance requirements for financial services deployments.

title: Behind the scenes: How AWS drives operational excellence & reliability
abstract: How does AWS maintain operational excellence at a global scale? In this technical deep dive, we’ll take you behind the scenes on how AWS services are operated. We’ll dive deep into how we instrument and monitor our services, and how we leverage Amazon CloudWatch and Amazon OpenSearch, including their latest features, in our daily operations. Through real operational stories and hands-on demonstrations with sample applications, you’ll learn the patterns and practices that help AWS teams maintain reliability. You’ll learn best practices for implementing scalable observability, drawn from our experience operating some of AWS’s most widely used services for more than a decade.

title: Best practices for agentic data engineering with AWS Analytics MCP Servers
abstract: In this session, we'll introduce the Data Processing and Amazon Redshift MCP Servers, open-source tools that leverage the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to simplify the development of agentic workflows with AWS Analytics Services. You'll learn how to implement these MCP servers and use the AWS Strands SDK to build AI agents that understand your data processing and data warehouse environments and guide you through complex analytics workflows using natural language interactions.

title: Best practices for building Apache Iceberg based lakehouse architectures on AWS
abstract: Discover advanced strategies for implementing Apache Iceberg on AWS, focusing on Amazon S3 Tables and integration of Iceberg Rest Catalog with the lakehouse in Amazon SageMaker. We'll cover performance optimization techniques for Amazon Athena and Amazon Redshift queries, real-time processing using Apache Spark, and integration with Amazon EMR, AWS Glue, and Trino. Explore practical implementations of zero-ETL, change data capture (CDC) patterns, and medallion architecture. Gain hands-on expertise in implementing enterprise-grade lakehouse solutions with Iceberg on AWS.

title: Best Practices for CI/CD & Deployment Automation in Amazon QuickSight
abstract: Join us to learn Amazon QuickSight deployments in this session focused on CI/CD pipelines and automation strategies. Learn proven approaches for configuration management, infrastructure as code, and reliable release processes across all environments. We'll demonstrate version control strategies, validation checks, and monitoring solutions while covering dependency management and rollback mechanisms. Perfect for DevOps engineers and architects, you'll gain practical templates and insights for building scalable deployment workflows with popular CI/CD tools.

title: Best practices for cost optimization with AWS Backup
abstract: AWS Backup enables you to protect application data at exabyte scale across more than 20 AWS services, including Amazon S3 and Amazon EBS. While implementing data protection is imperative in 2025, effectively balancing your total cost of ownership (TCO) with business and regulatory requirements requires a tailored approach. In this chalk talk, learn how to optimize AWS Backup costs while meeting business requirements for recovery point objective (RPO) and recovery time objective (RTO). We'll walk through cost optimization examples and best practices learned from AWS customers, including how to use AWS Backup reporting and monitoring features for cost optimization.

title: Best practices for deploying critical applications with Amazon EBS
abstract: Millions of customers run their performance-intensive enterprise applications and databases on AWS. In this workshop, explore the step-by-step process of deploying a high-performance application on Amazon EC2 and Amazon EBS for optimized availability, resiliency, and cost performance. Discover how to select the ideal Amazon EC2 instance types and Amazon EBS volume types for various workloads. Learn about on-demand storage flexibility and performance using Elastic Volumes. Monitor and improve the operational performance and resource optimization of Amazon EBS using Amazon CloudWatch metrics. Build resilience and fault tolerance using AWS Fault Injection Simulator.

title: Best practices for maximizing S3 File Gateway performance
abstract: Dive deep into advanced performance optimization techniques for S3 File Gateway in this expert-level discussion. Examine automated deployment patterns using Infrastructure as Code with Terraform, covering complex hybrid environment configurations. Share your challenges as we analyze critical performance factors including cache architecture, network design patterns, and sophisticated monitoring approaches. Explore architectural decisions that impact throughput, drawing from real customer implementations and latest best practices. This technical session covers advanced event-driven architectures, system limitations, and strategies for building highly optimized hybrid storage solutions. Bring your complex S3 File Gateway scenarios for collaborative problem-solving.

title: Best practices for migrating and operating Db2 databases on Amazon RDS
abstract: Whether you’re evaluating migration paths for your Db2 databases or are interested in efficiently operating your already migrated Db2 databases on Amazon RDS, we’ve got you covered. In this chalk talk, learn about migration paths, including those with minimal downtime, for Db2 databases running on various platforms including Linux, Unix, Windows, AIX, and z/OS. Explore real-world examples to learn best practices that help ensure high availability, optimize performance, and meet your compliance needs. Bring your questions and challenges—this interactive talk offers you the opportunity to hear directly from AWS experts and collaborate with your peers.

services: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for Db2

title: Best Practices for moving, innovating & extending SAP Cloud ERP (sponsored by SAP)
abstract: SAP will share their best practices for moving to SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Suite with the Integrated Toolchain.  Hear best practices around transformation to reach a persistent innovative state while keeping the core clean SAP Cloud ERP, Business Suite and SAP Business Technology Platform.  Also hear real-world success stories from AWS and SAP customers. This presentation is brought to you by SAP, an AWS Partner.

title: Best practices for optimizing financial services application latency
abstract: Optimizing latency in complex financial services software systems requires in-depth analysis and a comprehensive understanding of both infrastructure and software stacks. In this chalk talk, learn how to efficiently run latency sensitive workloads in AWS, leveraging core banking as an example. Explore ways to optimize communication protocols and network performance using generative AI and practical mental models. Join us for step-by-step architecture decisions and live demos showcasing system performance enhancements with the right AWS services. Walk away with actionable insights and ready-to-use optimization checklists to enhance the user experience, drive customer satisfaction, and improve your return on investment.

title: Best practices for performing custom code transformation with agentic AI
abstract: Learn how to build, test, and validate custom code transformation with agentic AI. Through practical examples, we'll cover defining effective transformation rules, testing strategies to refine your agents, and validation methods to ensure reliable code conversion. This session will help architects and developers create robust transformation agents for their application modernization projects. You'll leave with actionable best practices for handling complex code conversions and maintaining transformation quality at scale.

title: Best practices for serverless developers
abstract: Do you want to take advantage of the full power of serverless architectures for your production workloads? Are you wondering how events can help your applications scale? Have you been trying to tune your applications for higher performance and lower cost? This session provides architectural best practices, optimizations, and useful shortcuts that experts can use to build secure, high-scale, and high-performance serverless applications.

title: Best practices to simplify resilience at scale for Gen AI data & apps (sponsored by Commvault)
abstract: This session explores critical challenges in maintaining resilient data lakes and applications capable of handling the demands of AI workloads—from ingesting massive datasets to managing frequent updates during model training. We'll examine common failure points, including data corruption, application interruptions, and recovery complexities. Learn how modern data protection platforms like Clumio provide automated safeguards for cloud-native applications and data lakes, ensuring business continuity and the rapid recovery capabilities essential for AI. Attendees will discover strategies for implementing resilience, automating protection policies, and enabling near-instant recovery. This presentation is brought to you by Commvault, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Best practices to simplify resilience at scale for Gen AI data & apps (sponsored by Commvault)
Best practices to simplify resilience at scale for Gen AI data & apps (sponsored by Commvault)

title: Better, faster, cheaper: How Valkey is revolutionizing caching
abstract: In this session, discover how the powerful combination of open source Valkey and Amazon ElastiCache is transforming the landscape of distributed caching. Explore recent innovations such as probabilistic data structures like bloom filters, a memory efficient dictionary that reduces memory usage by up to 40%, and a multi-threaded architecture that enables instantaneous scaling by up to 230%. We'll reveal the infrastructure that enables ElastiCache to seamlessly patch hundreds of thousands of customers while maintaining high availability, even for extreme workloads like Prime Day's trillion requests per minute.

title: Beyond a Chatbot: How to Build Intelligent Agent Memory (sponsored by MongoDB)
abstract: Stateless LLMs just aren't enough. It's time to build applications that learn, remember, and evolve. This session dives deep into the architecture of sophisticated agent memory systems. We’ll show you how to move from simple context windows to a unified memory provider that enables true intelligence. You'll learn about different types of memory—episodic, semantic, and procedural—and how MongoDB becomes the single data platform for all of them. This presentation is brought to you by MongoDB, an AWS Partner.

title: Beyond Backup: Advancing Cloud Resiliency with Shared Responsibility (sponsored by Cohesity)
abstract: Under the shared responsibility model, you are responsible for security and protection of your cloud data – and that requires developing and maintaining a mature cyber resilience capability for  your workloads. In this session, we’ll share how Cohesity’s AI-powered platform extends AWS-native protections to protect critical workloads, automate policy enforcement, and reduce recovery times. You’ll learn how to isolate backups from production accounts, detect attacks, and orchestrate near‑instant recovery across regions and clouds. Walk away with a blueprint for achieving resilience at a lower TCO than “backup‑only” approaches. This presentation is brought to you by Cohesity, an AWS Partner.

title: Beyond Batch: Modernize with Event-Driven Architecture & Serverless
abstract: Legacy systems typically employ a batch processing model, where transactions are retrieved from logs or databases at scheduled times and processed. This builders session introduces event-driven patterns as a solution, enabling near real-time processing and removing the constraints of end-of-batch processing. Through practical analysis and real-world considerations, you'll gain the insights needed to eliminate batch processing and move towards event driven systems at scale. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Beyond EHR: Leveraging AWS for Maximum Clinical and Operational Impact
abstract: Successful EHR hosting on AWS has become standard practice, as evidenced by AWS' 2025 Best in KLAS rating for public cloud. This session features two innovative health systems demonstrating how they've moved beyond basic EHR implementation to create competitive advantages with AWS. Leaders will share strategies for moving past "lift-and-shift" to drive meaningful innovation by leveraging cloud-native solutions, extending EHR functionality, and developing unique patient and provider experiences. Through real-world examples, attendees will learn practical approaches to healthcare innovation, value creation frameworks, and implementation insights. Designed for technology leaders, digital strategists, and clinical innovation teams seeking to differentiate their organizations.

title: Beyond Fine-Tuning: Agentic AI for HFT Quantitative Analytics
abstract: Capital markets face a critical challenge: traditional LLMs generate skewed sentiment when analyzing combined dynamic market data and historical pricing for quantitative strategies. This session demonstrates a production agentic architecture that enables users to launch immediately without the time-consuming process of fine-tuning models. By eliminating the tedious work of creating labeled datasets, teams can quickly implement reliable investment analytics and start seeing positive results right away. Our solution leverages Claude 3.7 for task planning, MCP for historical data collection, and DeepSeek R1 reasoning in SageMaker. Using Bedrock multi-model capabilities and Q CLI, this Level 300 session includes demos and architectural patterns.

title: Beyond microservices: Event-driven patterns for modern applications
abstract: Modern applications demand resilient, scalable event-driven architectures. This chalk talk explores proven patterns for processing billions of events daily using Amazon EventBridge, AWS Lambda, and microservices. Learn practical strategies for decomposing monoliths using strangler and leave/layer patterns while maintaining system reliability. Examine approaches to schema evolution, event versioning, dead letter queue management, and observability. Discover how organizations achieve loose coupling, improved fault tolerance, and faster feature delivery through event-driven patterns that scale seamlessly from thousands to billions of events.

title: Beyond Multi-Cloud Chaos: The Unified Cloud Mesh Architecture (sponsored by HAProxy Technologies)
abstract: Deploying applications across multiple regions, clouds, and Kubernetes clusters creates fragmented, insecure infrastructure. This complicates governance by forcing separate policies for north-south and east-west traffic. This session introduces the "cloud mesh," a unified fabric that simplifies governance and visibility across hybrid environments. Learn how this strategy provides holistic control over all traffic, from the edge to your backend services. Secure your applications with consistent WAF and API protection at the perimeter while locking down internal communication with private, zero-trust pathways. Discover how to centrally orchestrate security policies and transform your multi-cloud deployments into a single, secure platform. This presentation is brought to you by HAProxy Technologies, an AWS Partner.

title: Beyond Posture Management: Stopping Data Breaches in AWS (sponsored by Varonis)
abstract:
Bad actors don't break in; they log in. Today, 86% of data breaches involve stolen credentials. When attackers have legitimate credentials, posture management (DSPM /CSPM) isn't enough. 
 
How do you stop a malicious insider or a bad actor with stolen credentials from exfiltrating AWS data?
 
In this talk, learn how data-centric threat detection can stop breaches that by pass posture controls, including ransomware, phishing, and malicious insiders.
 
Learn how Varonis safeguards against identity-based attacks, detects active attacks with user entity behavior analytics (UEBA), provides a full forensics log for investigations and compliance, and augments AWS GuardDuty with data-centric threat detections. This presentation is brought to you by Varonis, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Beyond Posture Management: Stopping Data Breaches in AWS (sponsored by Varonis)

title: Beyond SFTP and NFS: Automate enterprise file transfers at scale
abstract: Modern enterprises need flexible file transfer strategies addressing one-time migrations, recurring workflows, and processing-intensive transfers. This session explores comprehensive solutions using AWS Transfer Family and DataSync across these three scenarios. Learn to segment requirements and select appropriate services through real customer stories. We'll cover migration patterns for moving data from on-premises and other clouds, establishing secure recurring workflows, and integrating processing capabilities. Walk away with practical guidance on service selection, reference architectures, and best practices for building unified data movement strategies that scale with your business needs.

title: Beyond short interactions: Building long running agents with AgentCore
abstract: In this chalk talk, we'll explore how to build AI agents that perform long-running and complex interactions like multi-day research projects. We’ll show you how to use AgentCore Runtime & Memory to build agents that can pause and resume tasks, maintain state across hours or days, and handle complex workflows. You’ll learn how to structure agents that can effectively utilize different types of memory—semantic, episodic, and procedural—while maintaining state across long-running interactions. We’ll discuss how to apply these techniques to use cases like research agents and support ticket resolution.

title: Beyond the Console: Building Powerful AWS Operational Dashboards
abstract: While each AWS service provides a management console, you sometimes need more operational information to determine whether the service is acting as you expect and your services or workloads are running efficiently. This session will detail how you can take advantage of service events or custom metrics to build an operational dashboard using AWS Batch as an example.

title: Beyond the Hype: Delivering Measurable ROI with Generative AI on AWS (sponsored by CDW)
abstract: With 96% of organizations increasing AI investments but only 36% successfully deploying to production, where's the disconnect? Dr. Ryan Ries, Chief AI and Data Scientist at Mission will showcase the GenAI implementations that are delivering real ROI in 2025. Learn which specific use cases are yielding the greatest returns across different industries and how to identify similar high-value opportunities within your own organization. Leave with actionable strategies to move your AWS GenAI initiatives from experimental to measurable value, based on proven approaches that have reduced costs, improved efficiency, and enhanced customer experiences. This presentation is brought to you by CDW, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Beyond the Hype: Delivering Measurable ROI with Generative AI on AWS (sponsored by CDW)

title: Beyond traditional computing: How WorkSpaces powers the future workplace
abstract: In this session, we will share how WorkSpaces provides the essential foundation for the future of the workplace in which the desktop evolves to support modern web-applications, native applications, and an AI workforce. We will cover what is new in running desktops and applications in the cloud to benefit the evolving digital workplace. You will hear from our customers how removing the need to manage physical infrastructure and creating workload isolation helped them save costs and improve security. We will further discuss how agentic AI can streamline the setup of your WorkSpaces environment, saving you time and money.

title: Beyond Vector Search: Ultra-Resilient GenAI Apps with AWS Bedrock (sponsored by YugabyteDB)
abstract:
As AI moves from proof-of-concept to production, standalone vector databases face limits in synchronization, ACID compliance, and resilience. This session shows how PostgreSQL-compatible distributed databases address these issues while keeping a familiar developer experience. Topics include: Using AWS Bedrock with Distributed SQL, why standalone vector databases create production friction, scaling RAG architectures with pgvector across regions, Multi-agent patterns in modern AI, and delivering ultra-resilience for peak traffic, grey failures, and disasters. 
AWS users will gain practical strategies for building GenAI applications that scale globally while delivering the reliability, consistency, and performance enterprise systems demand. This presentation is brought to you by YugabyteDB, an AWS Partner.

title: Beyond vibe testing: Productionalizing mission-driven genAI workloads
abstract: Many organizations don’t have good criteria for moving their generative AI workloads from development to production, despite the fact that these capabilities can drive meaningful impact within social and environmental missions. They are effectively testing based on vibes, or their emotional reaction to a foundation model’s outputs, instead of real testing criteria. In this session, we’ll talk about how to create gold standard data, how to validate model outputs, and come up with quantitative criteria so you can confidently move workloads to production. You’ll leave with the tools and know-how so you can confidently break free from vibe testing.

title: Binge-worthy: Netflix's journey to Amazon Aurora at scale
abstract: In this session, learn how Netflix successfully orchestrated the migration of terabytes of mission-critical data across 100+ clusters to Amazon Aurora while ensuring continuous service for millions of global subscribers. Through a detailed examination of their innovative approach combining AWS Database Migration Service and Netflix's proprietary Data Streaming Platform, explore how they achieved near-zero downtime and maintained data integrity throughout this complex transition. Technical leaders will gain actionable insights into architecting similar migrations, managing risks, and leveraging AWS tools effectively. Join us to learn how Netflix's experience can inform your own database modernization strategy.

title: Blueprint to code: Mastering spec-driven development
abstract: Join us for an engaging session exploring Kiro, the AI IDE that brings structure to your AI coding workflows. We'll cover how Kiro transforms simple prompts into structured requirements, and implementable tasks while automating routine tasks like generating documentation, and creating unit tests. We'll discuss how to effectively use Kiro's features like multimodal inputs and automated workflows to build production-ready applications more efficiently.

title: Boomi Agentstudio- Govern Your AI Agents with Agent Control Tower (sponsored by Boomi)
abstract: Elevate your enterprise AI strategy. In this session, we'll dive into the Boomi Agentstudio, integrated with Amazon Bedrock and Q Business Index, for building, orchestrating, and governing AI agents. We'll show you how to leverage Bedrock services with Boomi to create AI agents that have the business context and multi-system access they need to deliver ROI throughout your business, while ensuring you have complete control via Boomi Agent Control Tower. Discover how to unlock hyperproductivity with Boomi and AWS—accelerating business processes with AI agents that drive action and measurable value. This presentation is brought to you by Boomi, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Boomi Agentstudio- Govern Your AI Agents with Agent Control Tower (sponsored by Boomi)

title: Boost Amazon EKS Efficiency: EKS Auto Mode, Graviton, and EC2 Spot
abstract: Achieving optimal compute efficiency is a key goal for modern cloud architectures. In this chalk talk, discover how Amazon EKS Auto Mode revolutionizes Kubernetes operations by eliminating infrastructure management. Learn how to optimize costs using Graviton and EC2 Spot with EKS Auto Mode. Through practical examples and insights, you'll learn how to use these technologies to achieve a more efficient, scalable, and cost-effective EKS environment.

title: Boost database performance & availability with Amazon FSx for OpenZFS
abstract: Struggling with performance, scalability, availability, and cost-efficiency in your self-managed databases? Discover how Amazon FSx for OpenZFS can transform your data platform. Learn to create cloud-scale dev/test environments for Oracle, leveraging snapshots and cloning features to accelerate iterations and enhance collaboration. This chalk talk covers high availability and failover mechanisms for Single-AZ and Multi-AZ configurations, including automatic failover and data replication, to maintain seamless operations during events. Gain insights from customer use cases and learn best practices for architecting reliable, high-performance storage solutions on AWS, with practical strategies and real-world examples.

title: Boost employee productivity with Amazon Q Business
abstract: In this session, learn how Amazon Q Business can help you quickly build a generative AI–powered assistant that can answer questions, provide summaries, generate content, and complete tasks based on data and information in your enterprise systems across a variety of use cases. With security and privacy as central considerations, Amazon Q can respect existing identities, roles, and permissions and allows you to restrict sensitive topics, block keywords, and filter out inappropriate questions and answers.

title: Boost performance and reduce costs in Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS
abstract: In this session, explore Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS cost components and learn important best practices that can help you improve the performance of your relational database workloads while reducing spend on cost components such as compute, storage, backup, and I/O. Learn about the latest performance monitoring features, which provide insights on how to efficiently track and optimize database performance at scale and help ensure that you’re maximizing efficiency while keeping costs under control.

title: Break down AI barriers with AWS Wickr and Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Discover how AWS Wickr is breaking down barriers to AI adoption by enabling seamless access to powerful Amazon Bedrock models. This session demonstrates how organizations can leverage end-to-end encrypted Wickr bots to interact with advanced AI capabilities—without requiring AWS console access or technical expertise. Through live demonstrations, learn how diverse teams across industries are using Wickr to democratize AI access while maintaining security and compliance. Explore real-world applications, from image recognition to natural language processing, and gain practical insights on implementing AI-powered Wickr bots in your organization. Join us to see how Wickr is making enterprise AI as simple as sending a message.

title: Break down monoliths, modernizing applications on Amazon ECS
abstract: Join this interactive chalk talk to solve a common challenge where monolithic applications take months to deploy new features and scaling becomes increasingly difficult. We'll start with a real scenario, an application running on servers with a shared database. Together, we'll design the modernization path using Amazon ECS and Well Architected Framework principles. You'll explore servers vs serverless trade-offs, CI/CD automation, blue/green deployment strategies, and how GenAI can accelerate your modernization journey. After this session, you'll walk away with a roadmap to modernize your application. Bring your curiosity and help us build the architecture live!

title: Breakdown to Breakthrough: Crafting AI-Powered Smart Machine Support
abstract: Join us for an essential interactive session addressing a universal challenge in smart machines - equipment maintenance and support. Through collaborative whiteboarding with AWS industry experts, discover architectural patterns that combine IoT data with Amazon Bedrock to build next-generation maintenance support systems. Learn how to help your customers transform operations by creating intelligent assistants that integrate real-time telemetry, maintenance documentation, parts catalogs, and historical service records into unified solutions.

title: Breaking AWS networks on purpose to build resilience
abstract: Most AWS networks only get tested during an outage or incident. This session shows how proactively breaking AWS networks helps ensure resilience. Learn techniques for controlled failure injection, monitoring, and recovery in complex environments. See practical examples of chaos engineering for networking that reveal weak points before they become real problems.

title: Breaking data silos with the lakehouse architecture
abstract: Struggling with fragmented data across multiple platforms? Join us for an interactive session where we'll explore strategies for breaking data silos and achieving interoperability between AWS and external data sources such as data in SAP, Google BigQuery, Snowflake, and Oracle. We'll dive deep into best practices for creating a unified, open, and secure data lakehouse architecture, fully compatible with Apache Iceberg. Through live demos, you'll gain practical insights into overcoming common challenges in cross-platform data access and automating critical housekeeping tasks like data compaction, metadata management, and performance optimization. Whether you're dealing with databases, SaaS applications, or multi-cloud scenarios, you'll leave equipped with strategies to accelerate time to insights.

title: Breaking Down Silos: Multi-Agent Architecture for Media Operations
abstract: Media organizations struggle to monetize content archives due to fragmented workflows across search, rights verification, and distribution. This chalk talk demonstrates an agentic media lake platform enabling natural language asset discovery, automated rights verification, and distribution through coordinated agent workflows. Unlike rigid pipelines, our multi-agent architecture orchestrates dynamic workflows where specialized agents handle search, rights clearance, format optimization, and platform-specific distribution. We�ll explore agent-to-agent communication for adaptive decision-making as agents coordinate workflows and adjust strategies throughout the content lifecycle. This showcases how conversational AI transforms the journey from �finding content� to �generating revenue� into an intuitive interaction that accelerates monetization.

title: Breaking the legacy barrier: How AI is revolutionizing modernization
abstract: Enterprises are trapped by legacy monoliths that drain billions in maintenance while stifling innovation. Traditional event storming relies on fragmented human memory and disappearing institutional knowledge. Learn how Large Language Models can now reverse-engineer entire codebases, automatically generating comprehensive event storming boards that capture hidden business rules and forgotten workflows in legacy applications. This AI-driven approach transforms months of code archaeology into days of systematic analysis. Organizations can modernize confidently, with early adopters reporting faster modernization with less timeline and fewer post-migration defects. Experience how AI precision is revolutionizing enterprise modernization.

title: Break through AI performance and cost barriers with AWS Trainium
abstract: Generative AI deployments face challenges with high computing costs and complex scaling requirements. AWS Trainium2 and Inferentia2 chips deliver compelling price-performance for both training and inference workloads. In this session, discover innovations that enable efficient scaling of advanced AI workloads, from training and serving MoE models to deploying agentic systems with reasoning capabilities. Learn how customers are achieving exceptional performance while significantly reducing costs.

title: Bridging the POC to production gap: An introduction to AgentCore
abstract: Going from a pilot to a secure, scalable, and reliable agent system requires more than great prompts. In this introductory session, we'll show how AgentCore helps teams move from proof-of-concept to production using enterprise-grade services, including Runtime, Gateway, Identity, Memory, Observability, Code Interpreter, Browser, and AWS Marketplace for Agents and tools. Learn how these services simplify development, reduce operational burden, and improve time-to-value so teams can iterate faster, build securely, and launch confidently. We'll cover foundational capabilities like enterprise readiness, tool integration, and performance at scale, providing a blueprint for success no matter where you are in your journey.

title: Bring the power of Amazon EKS to your on-premises applications
abstract: Amazon EKS Hybrid Nodes represents a transformative approach to Kubernetes management, enabling organizations to seamlessly bridge their on-premises, edge and cloud environments. Join this Builders session to learn how EKS Hybrid Nodes creates a unified Kubernetes experience that addresses data residency, latency, and compliance requirements without compromise. Through practical demonstrations, we'll explore secure connectivity configurations, workload migration strategies, and seamless integration with AWS services. Discover how to maintain operational consistency across environments while reducing the complexity of managing hybrid infrastructure.

title: Bring unified analytics to your data warehouse with the lakehouse architecture
abstract: Join this interactive session to explore how to unify your data warehouse analytics with modern lakehouse capabilities, to accelerate your analytics and AI initiatives. We'll navigate through the complete architectural journey, from namespace hierarchy to zero-ETL integration patterns, demonstrating how to transform your data infrastructure through Redshift integration patterns, interoperability with the ability to read and write to RMS, simplified data sharing mechanisms, and real-world architectural patterns.

title: Bronto: Logs at Scale Without Compromise (sponsored by Bronto)
abstract: Bronto redefines what's possible with logs. Subsecond search across massive volumes of data unlocks use cases that once seemed out of reach, without legacy platform pricing. We'll unpack the unique architecture behind Bronto (Indexless search, log-based metrics, high efficiency compression, and more) and share how our customers achieve visibility without compromise, leveraging AI powered features. This presentation is brought to you by Bronto, an AWS Partner.

title: Browser Power: Building MCP Tools That Do Real Work (sponsored by Cloudflare)
abstract: Most AI tools just retrieve info—but what if they could actually do things, like book a tennis court, fill out a form, or navigate a UI? In this talk, we’ll go beyond APIs and show how to build browser-powered MCP tools that complete real tasks. I’ll demo an MCP server on Cloudflare Workers using browser rendering to log in, solve CAPTCHAs, handle 2FA, and book a court. We’ll cover the anatomy of effective tools, lessons learned (including tool poisoning), and what makes a “real tool” vs. a brittle script—so you can design safe, composable, and useful tools in the wild. This presentation is brought to you by Cloudflare, an AWS Partner.

title: Build a chat app for smart home appliances
abstract: Smart appliances are no longer just connected. They can now communicate. In this session, learn how to build a chat application that gives home appliances human-like personalities through generative AI. See how to combine natural language interfaces with device data to create interactive and engaging experiences. Explore architecture options, integration patterns, and design choices that make appliances more relatable to end users. Leave with practical guidance for developing conversational applications that blend smart home technology with AI-powered interactions.

title: Build a collaborative agentic AI solution with Aurora & Bedrock Agents
abstract: Multi-agent collaboration unlocks new levels of reasoning, specialization, and task orchestration in generative AI systems. In this hands-on workshop, learn how to harness Model Context Protocol (MCP) with AWS agentic AI services and Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition to build a collaborative AI system. You’ll create a supervisor agent that coordinates multiple sub-agents, each focused on specialized tasks such as data retrieval, analysis, or decision-making, powered by real-time, secure context from Aurora. You will build a working prototype that showcases how intelligent agents can collaborate to solve complex problems with grounded enterprise data. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Build a cost-effective RAG-based gen AI application with Amazon Aurora
abstract: In this chalk talk, explore key design principles for building cost-effective generative AI applications. Learn about model choice and optimization, chunking, caching and prompt engineering techniques, focusing on strategies to optimize the Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture. Additionally, learn how to optimize data storage, query, and retrieval with Amazon Aurora. Discover effective monitoring and cost-tracking approaches to optimize both performance and cost as you build and scale RAG-based generative AI workloads.

title: Build Advanced AI-powered Search with OpenSearch MCP and Vectors
abstract: Learn how to improve search applications using Amazon OpenSearch Service. We'll explore implementing advanced architectural patterns using Model Context Protocol (MCP) and hybrid search features like Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF). Discover how to move from traditional RAG solutions to advanced implementations combining OpenSearch's vector engine, keyword search, and neural search capabilities. Developers and architects will learn to implement hybrid search capabilities, configure intelligent query routing, and optimize relevance ranking through automation. We'll demonstrate how to build search applications that deliver higher accuracy and improved user experiences by combining different search methodologies. Whether enhancing e-commerce search, building enterprise solutions, or implementing AI-powered applications, you'll learn to modernize search applications at scale with OpenSearch.

title: Build Advanced Enterprise Search with Vector, Hybrid, and AI Techniques
abstract: Discover how global enterprises are revolutionizing search experiences using Amazon OpenSearch Service. Learn how vector search combined with hybrid optimization transforms business operations through examples of leading enterprises who have transformed their content discovery and retrieval processes, achieving significant improvements in search accuracy and performance. Learn how Canva processes 1.2 million daily requests while Adobe leverages vector search for improved retrieval accuracy. We'll dive deep into OpenSearch vector capabilities, reciprocal rank fusion (RRF), and AI-powered relevance optimization. You'll learn how to build scalable, high-performance search solutions that combine traditional search with advanced AI capabilities.

title: Build a GenAI Race Tracker With Confluent & AWS Bedrock in <60 Min  (sponsored by Confluent)
abstract: Join a hands-on session that’s perfect for developers and architects interested in streaming, AI, and modern cloud systems. During this workshop, you’ll build a real-time race tracking application powered by generative AI. Learn to ingest and process live telemetry data streams using Apache Kafka and Apache Flink protocol on Confluent Cloud. And you’ll see AWS Bedrock’s foundation models generate dynamic race commentary, summaries, and driver insights in real time. You’ll also build a responsive Node.js app to visualize and interact with race data, while exploring scalable, event-driven architectures with cloud-native tools. Bonus: participate and win cool racing gears! This presentation is brought to you by Confluent, an AWS Partner.

title: Build agentic AI features for monolithic applications
abstract: Monolithic applications present unique challenges when extending functionality and adopting to genAI capabilities. In this builder's session, you'll learn how to create autonomous agents that can reason, generate, and securely execute code in a sandbox environment and seamlessly integrate agentic AI-powered features into existing "black box" applications using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. We'll explore implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for enhanced AI model interactions to connect agents with enterprise systems and APIs. You'll gain practical experience building secure integration patterns that enable your legacy systems to interact with modern AI capabilities without compromising stability or security.

title: Build agentic AI–powered search with Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS
abstract: The integration of embeddings generated from LLMs with Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition and Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL offers a powerful and efficient solution for optimizing product catalog similarity search experience. By leveraging foundation models and vector embeddings, businesses can enhance speed and accuracy of responses using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), enable agentic AI capabilities such as reasoning and tool use, and apply Model Context Protocol (MCP) to manage context and prompt structure, which drives more personalized, intelligent user experiences. In this workshop, build your own agentic AI applications with Amazon Bedrock, using Aurora PostgreSQL as your vector database.

title: Build Agentic AI Solutions for Industrial Predictive Maintenance
abstract: This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to leverage Amazon Bedrock and Agentic AI to transform industrial maintenance from reactive to predictive. Participants will learn how to implement a predictive maintenance solution by bulk importing historical operational logs into AWS IoT SiteWise, performing deep pattern analysis with Amazon Nova on Amazon Bedrock based on anomalies raised by AWS IoT SiteWise, and deploy real-time monitoring and alert systems.

title: Build agentic observability workflows with models from AWS Marketplace
abstract: In this session, discover how to create an AI agent that takes a single user prompt, finds anomalies using observability and monitoring tools, and takes proper actions on your behalf. Using solutions available in AWS Marketplace, you can incorporate leading generative AI models into your agentic AI workflows while maintaining privacy. Deploy third-party models in your AWS account, ensuring that prompts, data, and model responses stay within the boundaries of your account and are not shared with model providers. This is important for business use cases where competitive or confidential information may be used with models.

title: Build Agentic Voice Chat with Nova Sonic, AgentCore, MCP, and more
abstract: In this hands-on builder session, you’ll work with an AWS expert to create an agentic voice chat application using Nova Sonic, integrated with AWS AgentCore, Strands, RAG workflows, and the MCP framework for multi-agent architecture. Follow step-by-step guidance to set up models, connect external knowledge bases with RAG for richer context, integrate multi-turn agentic workflows, and deploy a scalable voice chat app optimized for cost, latency, and accuracy. Bring your laptop and explore the tools and frameworks driving next-gen conversational AI.

title: Build agentic workflows on AWS with third-party agents and tools
abstract: Learn to architect and enhance AI development workflows on AWS with powerful third-party agents and tools from AWS Marketplace using AgentCore Gateway and Runtime. This session walks through real-world use cases for third-party agents and how to efficiently source and deploy AI development tools the moment you need them. Through architecture diagrams and live demonstrations, we'll explore how to import tools via Gateway, establish connections with Claude Desktop and Amazon Q developer environments, and deploy tools in Runtime. Learn architectural best practices and see implementation patterns that showcase the power of integrating third-party products into your AWS workflows.

title: Build agentic workflows using third-party AI agents & tools
abstract: Discover how to fast track your AI initiatives using pre-built AI agents and agent development tools from software vendors in AWS Marketplace. This chalk talk will demonstrate how to utilize specialized AI agents for common use cases and access curated tools to build custom solutions on your preferred frameworks. Learn about the API-based deployment method with MCP and A2A support, enabling seamless agent integration and communication. We'll showcase deployment options through Genesis Runtime and containers, all while maintaining enterprise-grade security. Join us to explore how AWS Marketplace can accelerate your AI agent development while leveraging trusted AWS infrastructure.

title: Build agentic workflows with Aurora and MCP
abstract: Explore how to build an agentic AI application using Amazon Aurora and Model Context Protocol (MCP). This session introduces design patterns for agents powered by Amazon Bedrock that retrieve live relational data from Amazon Aurora to drive autonomous workflows. Learn how to build solutions using MCP servers to enable contextual memory, handle multi-turn queries, and securely connect LLM agents to Aurora clusters. Discover architecture blueprints that combine structured data with LLMs and orchestrate multi-agent workflows with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, LangGraph and Strands Agents. Ideal for builders creating real-time, intelligent systems that operate directly on relational data.

title: Build agentic workflows with Small Language Models and SageMaker AI
abstract: Leverage open-source models such as Qwen3 to build AI agents with frameworks like Langraph and Strands. Create autonomous agents that reason, plan, and execute complex tasks through advanced prompt engineering and state management. Get hands-on experience with tool calling and MCP integration patterns to manage context between different tools, enabling seamless multi-step workflows. Learn to use Bedrock AgentCore to deploy agents for real-time use cases with security, observability and scale. Integrating with LLMs deployed in SageMaker AI, Bedrock AgentCore, and open-source frameworks, learn to build production-ready AI agents that deliver measurable business value while maintaining security, scalability, and cost efficiency.

title: Build agents & tools for Bedrock AgentCore and sell in AWS Marketplace
abstract: Learn how to create AI agents and tools for Bedrock AgentCore and make them available to reach new customers in AWS Marketplace. This session provides comprehensive guidance on optimizing your AI agents for Bedrock AgentCore, as well as exploring the interconnectivity possibilities between agents and third-party tools through AgentCore Gateway. You'll also gain valuable insights into the specific build requirements needed to successfully list your agents in AWS Marketplace, enabling you to expand your reach to potential customers.

title: Build agents with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore & Strands Agents
abstract: Learn how to build and deploy production-grade AI agents using Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases, AgentCore Runtime, and the Strands Agents framework. This workshop demonstrates how to enhance foundation models with enterprise data sources using RAG, implement secure agent deployment patterns, and leverage Strands for agent orchestration.
