You'll gain hands-on experience connecting to tools through AgentCore Gateway, managing agent memory and identity, and monitoring agent behavior through comprehensive observability—all while maintaining enterprise-grade security and scalability.

title: Build AI agents: A scalable framework using Strands and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
abstract: Join this interactive session to explore architectural patterns for building enterprise-ready AI agents using Strands and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Through collaborative whiteboarding, discover how to design a flexible, scalable framework for AI agents that can be applied across various industries, demonstrated through retail use cases like intelligent product recommendations and automated customer service. We’ll showcase how Strands multiagent architecture enables highly composable and extensible solutions, while AgentCore Gateway provides runtime, identity, and more. Learn implementation strategies for connecting language models through Amazon Bedrock with your tools and systems, emphasizing patterns that can be adapted to different business contexts.

title: Build AI Agents in Java with Spring AI
abstract: Spring AI provides Java developers with vendor-agnostic APIs for building intelligent applications. This session demonstrates key Spring AI capabilities including Retrieval-Augmented Generation for enhanced context-aware responses, conversation state management, and system integration through tool calling. The presentation explores how Spring AI implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) standard through the official Java SDK, streamlining AI system communications. The session concludes with practical examples of Spring AI integration with AWS services, showcasing patterns for production-ready AI applications.

title: Build AI Agents Ready for Enterprise [AWS Partners only]
abstract: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Learn to create production-ready AI agents using the Strands SDK and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Discover how to leverage enterprise-grade features for building secure and scalable AI solutions. Practice implementing agent development patterns that take advantage of AgentCore's comprehensive infrastructure capabilities. Experience hands-on development combining Strands' flexible framework with AgentCore's robust enterprise features. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Build AI apps faster and at scale using Amazon Bedrock APIs
abstract: Discover how Amazon Bedrock delivers a frictionless developer experience for building generative AI applications. Learn how to get started quickly and build prototypes using Bedrock API keys, eliminating the need for complex infrastructure setup. See how Bedrock's Unified API gives you consistent, secure access to 200+ foundation models from leading providers, with rich SDKs and language support that integrate seamlessly into your stack. Whether you're building chatbots, copilots, or multimodal experiences, this session will show you how Bedrock lets you focus on innovation instead of infrastructure.

title: Build AI Assistants Using Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases
abstract: This lab explores building an AI shopping assistant using Amazon Bedrock Agents, Knowledge Bases, and Guardrails. Using a pre-built lawn maintenance products dataset, learn to integrate knowledge bases with agents, implement guardrails for safe interactions, and utilize agent functions for calculations and pricing. Practice developing applications with Jupyter notebooks and analyze agent behavior through trace analysis. Ideal for developers implementing secure, knowledge-driven AI assistants.

title: Build AI Commerce Media Agents: Audience Discovery & Campaign Performance
abstract: As agentic AI emerges as a transformative technology, organizations face challenges integrating it effectively within existing retail and commerce media workflows traditionally powered by machine learning (ML). In this hands-on builder session, you’ll create a multi-agent solution for automating campaign audience definition and A/B testing to model customer 'what-if' scenarios for commerce media, advertising, and marketing use cases. Through practical exercises, you'll learn how to enhance traditional ML with agents to discover new segments and improve recommendations, potentially enhancing audience intelligence and improving return on ad spend (ROAS).

title: Build AI-powered developer experiences with MCP on ECS, EKS and Lambda
abstract: AI coding agents are transforming how developers build and operate modern cloud-native applications. From tools such as Kiro, Q developer, and Cline, developers are embracing AI to move faster and scale smarter. This session explores how Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers for AWS services like ECS, EKS and Lambda provide real-time, contextual code assistance to AI-powered coding agents. Learn how MCP servers help developers streamline code generation, deployment, and debugging by embedding infrastructure awareness directly into the AI assistant. Discover how teams are using MCP to boost productivity, reduce complexity, and build more reliable serverless and containerized applications at scale.

title: Build AI-powered Embedded Analytics with Amazon QuickSight
abstract: Get hands-on experience embedding QuickSight dashboards and Amazon Q capabilities into your applications. Learn to integrate generative AI features and custom branding into your solutions. Work through real scenarios including multi-tenant data isolation, programmatic dashboard generation, and AI-powered insights for your end users. Explore the QuickSight Embedding SDK and best practices for scaling embedded analytics.

title: Build AI your way with Amazon Nova customization
abstract: AI delivers the most value when it deeply understands your business. Whether you're enhancing the customer experience of your AI applications, or building agents that handle diverse tasks - Amazon Nova gives you tools to adapt the model to your specific needs. Learn how to combine the power of your organization's data for aligning model responses to your preferred tone and behavior, or training it on your unique workflows and business knowledge. Hear from Terra Security how they incorporated proprietary security data with built-in guardrails, dynamic refusal capabilities, and model retraining to ensure ongoing effectiveness in security operations.

title: Build a multi-agent financial research assistant with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Organizations across industries must synthesize insights from diverse, complex data sources. In this workshop, build a financial research assistant using Amazon Bedrock’s multi-agent capabilities. You'll learn to design agentic workflows with Model Context Protocol (MCP) and multi-agent communication that orchestrate specialized agents for complex research tasks. Implement MCP-coordinated agents to process real-time market data feeds, regulatory filings, and unstructured analyst reports while integrating with Amazon RDS, Amazon S3, and external financial data providers. Your multi-agent assistant will demonstrate automated financial research workflows that maintain accuracy, compliance, and data security.

services: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for Db2

title: Build a multi-agent role-playing Game Master with Strands Agents
abstract: The game master (GM) plays a central role in tabletop role-playing games, weaving together player stories, controlling NPCs, and managing rules. AI can wonderfully support GMs with rule checking, scenario improvisation, and on-the-fly content creation. Developers will explore building a multi-agentic AI game master using Strands Agents, implementing specialized agents for different GM tasks that communicate via Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocols and Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration for tools.

title: Build a multi-Region, active-active rewards app with Aurora DSQL
abstract: In this workshop, get hands-on experience with Amazon Aurora DSQL, a serverless distributed SQL database that delivers active-active high availability. Learn how to build a retail rewards points application with active-active resiliency across multiple Availability Zones and two Regions. Explore how ACID transactions and active-active replication work in Aurora DSQL. Discover best practices for data model and application design and more. You must bring a laptop to participate.

title: Build an adaptive compute grid with Amazon ECS and AWS Lambda
abstract: In this talk, we will delve into the intricacies of building a compute grid using Amazon ECS. We'll explore how to create a scalable, efficient, and flexible infrastructure capable of handling the demanding yet spiky workloads . The discussion will highlight ECS capacity providers and cluster auto scaling to optimize resource allocation, along with its integrations with AWS Step Functions, Amazon SQS, and AWS Batch for orchestrating complex workflows. We’ll discuss common patterns to create a robust, cost-effective compute infrastructure.

title: Build an Agent Factory: An Agent that can Create any Agent On-Demand
abstract: Watch us live-code an intelligent agent factory that creates specialized business agents on-demand through natural language. Using Amazon Bedrock, and open source frameworks like MCP and Strands, we'll build a system where users describe their needs ('I need an HR onboarding agent and a Business Analyst Agent') and get working agents deployed securely through AgentCore in minutes. You'll see real-time debugging, architecture decisions, and integration challenges as we demonstrate agent orchestration, tool binding, and multi-modal capabilities. Leave with production-ready patterns for building scalable agentic AI platforms.

title: Build an Agentic SaaS App in 5 Steps: From Idea to Revenue (sponsored by Pega)
abstract: AI and agents are disrupting SaaS, but this session will show you how to turn disruption into growth. In just five steps, we’ll demonstrate how to build an enterprise-grade agentic workflow solution that executes an advanced, regulated process and can be deployed to thousands of B2B clients. We’ll design it with a blueprint, make it real on AWS with built-in security, make it functional with live data, make it accessible through a chatbot and web interface, and finally grow revenue by deploying at scale. Learn how agentic apps unlock SaaS expansion with limited resources. This presentation is brought to you by Pega, an AWS Partner.

title: Build an agentic SAP order management solution
abstract: Use AI to transform manual  SAP order management into adaptive, scalable agentic workflows. Using Amazon Bedrock, you'll first build an agent to monitor ServiceNow for part replenishment requests. Next, you'll develop another agent that converts these tickets into Purchase Requisitions (PR). A web controller agent will then be created to handle PR distribution across your supplier network. Finally, you will create an agent that generates Purchase Orders (PO) based on supplier quotations and predetermined guidelines. You'll walk away with practical experience creating multi-agent workflows that effectively orchestrate business functions across enterprise applications.

title: Build an AI-powered enterprise search with Amazon OpenSearch service
abstract: Transform your enterprise search capabilities with Amazon OpenSearch, Bedrock, and Amazon SageMaker AI. Learn to build sophisticated search solutions that leverage vector capabilities, semantic search, and foundation models without complex ML infrastructure management. You'll create end-to-end search pipelines that combine traditional keyword search with AI-powered features including multi-modal content processing, and contextual summarization. Experience building real-world applications like document retrieval systems and conversational agents using the Agentic RAG framework.

title: Build an AI-ready data foundation
abstract: An unparalleled level of interest in generative AI and agentic AI is driving organizations to rethink their data strategy. While there is a need for data foundation constructs such as data pipelines, data architectures, data stores and data governance to evolve, there are business elements that need to stay constant like cost-efficiency and  effectively collaborating across data estates. In this session we will cover how building your data foundation on AWS provides the tools and the building blocks to balance both needs, and empower organizations to grow their data strategy for building AI-ready applications.

title: Build and automate policy as code
abstract: Move beyond manual infrastructure reviews by implementing automated policy controls for AWS CloudFormation and Terraform deployments. In this hands-on session, you will build a complete policy as code pipelines, learn to implement security checks, pre-commit hooks, and implement custom organizational rules that catch issues early. Through guided exercises, you will understand shift-left security practices and create automated feedback loops that enhance infrastructure governance.

title: Build and deploy AI agents using Kiro and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
abstract: Model Context Protocol (MCP) provides the foundation for building AI agents and code assistants that connect to your data, infrastructure, and services. Whether developing enterprise customer service AI or code that runs on AWS, MCP brings together intelligence and integration. The session demonstrates how Kiro accelerates MCP server and agent development, while exploring Amazon Bedrock AgentCore for AWS deployment. Developers will learn MCP implementation patterns and gain practical experience building and deploying production-ready MCP servers and clients.

title: Build and Deploy AI Agents with Cloudera Agent Studio (sponsored by Cloudera)
abstract: Join us for an exclusive workshop where you’ll learn how to design, build, and deploy AI agents using Cloudera Agent Studio. This immersive session will take you from building your first agent in just 10 minutes to creating advanced workflows, including sequential-agent processes and multi-agent squads. Along the way, you’ll gain hands-on experience with different workflow architectures—ranging from single-agent crews to hierarchical setups—and learn how to customize agents and tools for real-world business use cases. With a mix of guided labs covering core concepts and practical applications, this workshop is your opportunity to strengthen your AI skills and explore the future of agentic workflows with Cloudera. This presentation is brought to you by Cloudera, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Build and Deploy AI Agents with Cloudera Agent Studio (sponsored by Cloudera)

title: Build and Deploy Highly Available Event Processing with Containers
abstract: Building reliable, scalable queue processing systems in containerized environments requires careful consideration of retry logic, scaling behaviors, and deployment strategies. This session demonstrates best practices for implementing safe retries, dead-letter queue handling, and auto-scaling techniques to efficiently match demand using Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS). Attendees learn how to prevent premature termination during scaling events using task protection, and implement blue-green deployments with hooks for safe, consistent updates. These patterns ensure reliable queue processing operations at scale.

title: Build and operate resilient and performant distributed applications
abstract: This workshop explores how to design and implement applications for multi-geo operations while meeting data residency and performance requirements. You will learn how to design fault-tolerant, latency-sensitive applications across distributed locations with limited hardware resources. You will also explore distributed hybrid architectures, edge networking implementations, and traffic management solutions that balance regulatory requirements with high availability needs. Learn practical strategies for optimizing performance while maintaining data sovereignty across distributed locations.

title: Build and optimize edge architecture for resiliency with AI
abstract: This live coding session explores how to automate edge infrastructure operations with AI. Discover how to build truly resilient architectures with the latest AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones APIs. We'll walk through real-world code examples for querying Outposts hardware inventory, implementing intelligent resource placement, and automating failover configurations. You’ll learn how Amazon Bedrock can analyze architecture patterns and generate Infrastructure as Code (IaC) recommendations for optimal component distribution. Walk away with practical techniques for API integration, automated health checks, and dynamic resource allocation, plus working code samples and deployment templates for building adaptive, highly available edge solutions.

title: Build an end-to-end fraud detection system with Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio
abstract: Experience the seamless integration of Amazon EMR, Amazon Athena and AWS Glue with Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio to create a sophisticated fraud detection system. Learn how to leverage serverless compute for complex financial workloads while ensuring operational efficiency and security. Specifically designed for financial service organizations, join this session to build an end-to-end fraud analytics data pipeline with Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio.

title: Build an S3 time machine: Implementing advanced point-in-time recovery
abstract: Build a robust point-in-time recovery (PITR) solution to protect your Amazon S3 data from ransomware and account takeover attacks. This hands-on workshop guides you through implementing your own S3 time machine using managed services including S3 Metadata, S3 Tables, cross-account replication, and S3 Batch Operations. Learn to restore objects to any historical point, leveraging near real-time recovery point objective (RPO) and cross-account recovery capabilities. This solution enables full data recovery even if the source account is completely compromised. Gain practical experience in building a resilient backup system that surpasses standard S3 versioning.

title: Build an SAP ABAP application and generate unit test cases with generative AI
abstract: Use AWS coding assistants to generate a fully functioning SAP ABAP program.  In this session, you will learn to how AWS developer tools can help SAP developers build and deliver new features faster.  Learn how business requirements can automatically create ABAP code along with unit test cases and technical documentation.  (Workshop is suitable for those with beginner knowledge of ABAP.)

title: Build a secure and regulated data foundation for AI
abstract: Many organizations face challenges to build integrated data and AI foundations that meet strict governance requirements while enabling data sharing across internal teams and external organizations. In this chalk talk, learn how to architect an unified data platform using Amazon SageMaker that connects data providers with consumers securely. Through interactive white-boarding, explore architectural patterns for data marketplaces, governance controls, and compliance frameworks. Gain practical insights into implementing these solutions while maintaining security in highly regulated environments.

title: Build a stablecoin payment processor using AWS serverless services
abstract: In this session, build a stablecoin payment processing system using AWS serverless architecture. Through hands-on labs, implement digital asset workflows using AWS Lambda functions, secure critical transaction data with AWS Key Management Service, and design scalable Amazon DynamoDB data models for high-volume payment processing. You will implement robust and scalable mechanisms for handling blockchain events and create automated settlement processes. Also learn how to leverage built-in metrics from Lambda and DynamoDB to monitor invoice creation and payment confirmations. Prerequisites include experience with AWS serverless services and basic blockchain concepts. You must bring a laptop to participate.

title: Build a web-scale application with purpose-built databases & analytics
abstract: In this workshop, learn to build modern web applications at scale using purpose-built databases. Discover how to apply development patterns using Amazon Aurora, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon ElastiCache, Amazon Neptune, and Amazon OpenSearch Service to build a fully functional and scalable ecommerce bookstore application, and dive deep into best practices along the way. Basic familiarity with AWS concepts and services such as AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), Amazon VPC, networking, and storage services are recommended. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Build a well-architected foundation for scaling generative AI and agentic apps
abstract:
You've seen the potential of agentic AI through proof-of-concepts, and you're ready to build a foundation that can support all AI applications across your organization. Enter the complexities: model access and management, tool discovery, memory and state handling, observability, plus deployment and operations at scale!
In this session we'll demonstrate how to build a well-architected foundation that seamlessly integrates model access, orchestration workflows, agents, tools and domain-specific data pipelines while maintaining enterprise-grade observability and governance controls. We'll examine components of a production-ready generative AI and agentic system and dive deep into the architectural patterns that separates successful deployments from failed experiments.

title: Build Business Intelligence Solutions Using Amazon QuickSight
abstract: In this interactive workshop, learn to harness Amazon Q in QuickSight capabilities to accelerate your analytics workflow. Practice building dashboards using natural language, generate automated data stories, and create executive summaries that surface key insights. Learn to model complex business problems and perform what-if analysis through natural conversation with Scenario capability. Work with both structured and unstructured data sources to answer sophisticated business questions through the Q&A experience.

title: Build data pipelines in minutes with the SageMaker Visual experience
abstract: Explore the new visual builders in Amazon SageMaker. Learn how to use the drag-and-drop interface to quickly assemble and orchestrate your end-to-end data integration workflows without writing complex code. See how visual builders can boost productivity by reducing time spent on maintenance and infrastructure setup. Discover how to seamlessly move between visual and code-based interfaces, and learn best practices for creating reusable workflow templates. Join this chalk talk to understand how visual workflows can accelerate your ETL and ML development lifecycle. Participate in live demos and ask questions of SageMaker experts.

title: Build data resilient application architectures using AWS Storage
abstract: Data powers your workloads, where downtime and data loss aren't just operational concerns anymore - they're existential business threats, where organizations are looking to build resilient data architectures to mitigate operational and cyber risks. Data resiliency is the ability for an organization to continue business operations when unexpected disruptions impact data availability. In this chalk talk, learn how to architect for data resiliency using Amazon S3, Amazon EBS, Amazon FSx, Amazon EFS, and AWS Backup. We'll explore design patterns that leverage high-availability, multi-region replication, immutable backups, and air-gapped data bunker capability, to achieve your desired data resiliency posture.

title: Build, deploy, and operate agentic architectures on AWS Serverless
abstract: Discover how to architect scalable, production-ready agentic AI applications on AWS that deliver autonomous, multi-agent solutions for complex business challenges. Many organizations struggle with designing AI agents for real-world complexity, from managing context effectively to ensuring secure, scalable deployments. This session covers proven architectural patterns for single and multi-agent systems, applying monolith-to-microservices principles and domain-driven design to avoid common pitfalls. You'll explore practical implementations using API Gateway, Lambda, Fargate, and AgentCore Runtime with security best practices. Join us to transform your agentic AI understanding from experimental prototypes to production-ready systems.

title: Build effective logging strategies for operational insights
abstract: Effective log management requires proven patterns and practices to extract meaningful insights from vast amounts of data. In this session, explore best practices for correlating data across multiple sources, detecting anomalies, and generating metrics that drive decision-making processes. Join us for this essential exploration of modern log management and discover how to transform your organization's approach to data insights, security monitoring, and operational intelligence.

title: Build Fast Multi-Agent AI Systems Using Amplify and Bedrock Together
abstract: Empower your SMB to create sophisticated multi-agent AI systems without enterprise resources. This workshop guides you through building a complete application that orchestrates multiple Amazon Bedrock Agents using AWS Amplify Gen 2 and AWS AppSync's real-time features. You'll construct a travel planning system where specialized AI agents collaborate to deliver personalized recommendations based on user inputs and preferences. Learn to implement agent-to-agent communication, coordinate complex workflows, and integrate everything into a polished full-stack application. Leave with working code and architecture patterns that demonstrate how you can rapidly deploy advanced AI capabilities for your usecase.

title: Build fast, scalable infrastructure for AI/ML with AWS storage
abstract: High-performance storage is essential for efficient and cost-effective machine learning (ML) and large language model (LLM) training for generative AI. This workshop focuses on optimizing storage solutions for intensive GPU and AWS Trainium workloads. Learn how Amazon S3 and Amazon FSx for Lustre offer scalability and compute acceleration, from rapid data access to multi-petabyte scales. Gain hands-on experience integrating storage services with Amazon SageMaker AI and monitoring performance using Amazon CloudWatch. Explore best practices for achieving optimal performance in your AI/ML workflows.

title: Build, fine-tune & deploy AI models with SageMaker HyperPod CLI & SDK
abstract: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod helps build, train and deploy AI models at scale. You can spin-up preferred IDE on HyperPod to develop their models and run experiments, then scale to thousands of accelerators to run distributed training and finally deploy models for real-time or batch inference. With HyperPod task governance capabilities, you can optimize the utilization of the cluster resources. In this talk, we will show how interaction with HyperPod clusters is simplified via the SageMaker HyperPod CLI and SDK, which streamlined end-to-end model development, from training, fine-tuning to deployment. We'll show HyperPod CLI/SDK capabilities with live coding and troubleshooting.

title: Build First Retail AI Agent: Customer Service Excellence with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Build your first AI-powered retail customer service agent using Amazon Bedrock! In this hands-on workshop, create a primary customer service agent that seamlessly orchestrates specialized sub-agents handling tasks like Order tracking, Returns and Personalized product. Starting from scratch, you'll configure your main agent, add capabilities through sub-agents, and connect to a retail knowledge base. Experience the power of multi-agent collaboration in handling complex customer interactions while maintaining natural conversation flow. recommendation.

title: Build full-stack observability from applications to databases
abstract: Modern cloud applications require visibility across the entire stack - from user transactions to database queries. In this hands-on workshop, implement comprehensive observability using Amazon CloudWatch Application Signals and Database Insights. Learn to trace requests as they flow through your applications, correlate them with database performance metrics, and quickly identify bottlenecks. Get experience using CloudWatch to monitor application traces, metrics, and logs on unified dashboards, and to analyze Aurora database performance with SQL. Learn to set up automated instrumentation and custom dashboards that connect application and database telemetry.

title: Build GenAI Apps with Anywhere Data
abstract: Have data silos across hybrid and multicloud environments been restricting your AI innovation? New to AWS and want to build generative AI applications without rebuilding your data architecture? This chalk talk demonstrates how organizations beginning their AWS journey can quickly start using Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio while leveraging data from anywhere - your data centers, other clouds, or SaaS platforms. Learn practical approaches to connect existing data sources to Amazon Bedrock and SageMaker, implement cross-environment governance, and maintain security controls. We'll explore best practices and architectural patterns for successful first steps in AI adoption while preserving investments.

title: Build GenAI-Powered Workflows with Step Functions and AWS AI Services
abstract: Join this hands-on builders session to discover how to orchestrate sophisticated AI/ML workflows by combining the power of AWS Step Functions with cutting-edge AI services. In this immersive session, you'll learn to build some advanced workflows that leverage multiple AWS AI services including Bedrock, Amazon Comprehend, and Amazon Polly, all orchestrated seamlessly through Step Functions. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Build generative AI security runbooks with Amazon Bedrock [AWS Partners only]
abstract: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Learn how to enhance security operations using generative AI-powered runbooks with Amazon Bedrock. Create intelligent workflows that analyze AWS Security Hub findings and provide contextual remediation guidance. Through hands-on exercises, build AI agents that leverage AWS documentation and implement natural language interfaces for security investigations. Learn how to configure knowledge bases with organization-specific content and implement appropriate guardrails. You will leave having built a practical solution for streamlining security operations using generative AI. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Build generative and agentic AI applications on-premises and at the edge
abstract: As customers scale generative AI and agentic AI implementations from pilots to production, they need to balance speed of innovation with data sovereignty requirements, low-latency edge processing needs, and space, power, and cost efficiency. This session explores how to build generative and agentic AI solutions using AWS Local Zones, AWS Outposts, and AWS Dedicated Local Zones. Discover architectural patterns and best practices for deploying foundation models across distributed locations. Learn how to implement Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with locally stored data. Gain insights into strategies for model selection and optimization.

title: Build, govern, and share Amazon QuickSight dashboards with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: Learn how to go from finding data in Amazon SageMaker Catalog to building shareable dashboards in Amazon QuickSight in a single, secure workflow. This session shows how the integration between the next generation of Amazon SageMaker and Amazon QuickSight brings business intelligence dashboard governance into the same environment where you discover and prepare data. See how to manage access, ensure compliance, and share trusted insights across teams without moving data between systems.

title: Build high performance Apache Iceberg data lakes with Amazon S3 Tables
abstract: Master the art of building high-performance Apache Iceberg data lakes for real-world use cases using Amazon S3 tables. Learn best practices for designing Iceberg schemas, optimizing partition strategies, automating maintenance including compaction and snapshot management and implementing tooling for monitoring and operations. Apply powerful Iceberg features like schema evolution and time travel queries to practical scenarios helping you build efficient, scalable data lakes that meet your organization's analytical needs.

title: Build high-performance inference APIs with Lambda SnapStart
abstract: Master production-grade LLM deployment using AWS Lambda SnapStart and FastAPI to achieve sub-2-second cold starts and handle 1000+ concurrent requests without pre-provisioning. Explore advanced techniques including memory-optimized model loading with memfd, parallel S3 downloads, custom Lambda layers with OpenBLAS acceleration, and streaming responses via Lambda Function URLs. Through live demonstrations and code walkthroughs, discover practical patterns for balancing performance, cost, and developer experience when deploying LLMs at scale. Walk away with immediately applicable strategies to quickly take your ML inference applications from development to production.

title: Build Humanoid Intelligence: Advancing Physical AI with AWS and NVIDIA
abstract: Simulation-based reinforcement learning advances Physical AI by enabling rapid policy learning for complex tasks. NVIDIA Isaac Lab offers a reinforcement learning environment to train and test policies in realistic virtual environments using physics-based simulation. In this session we’ll dive deeper into NVIDIA Isaac Lab, AWS Batch, and Amazon EC2 instances powered by NVIDIA GPUs and highlight the advantages of simulation on AWS. You’ll explore imitation learning and distributed training for Humanoid policies across multiple nodes with multiple NVIDIA GPUs and the simulation-to-real transition, sharing strategies for effectively translating simulation learning to the real world for large scale automation.

title: Build Hybrid Serverless Architectures with AWS and On-premises Systems
abstract: Organizations across finance, public sector, and manufacturing often have critical business logic locked in on-premises systems while seeking cloud adoption. This session explores practical patterns for implementing hybrid serverless architectures that bridge AWS services with on-premises systems. Through real-world examples, we'll demonstrate how to design hybrid solutions using AWS Lambda and Amazon API Gateway, implement unified API layers, and build resilient messaging patterns using Amazon EventBridge, Amazon SQS, and Amazon SNS with on-premises message brokers.

title: Building A2A-enabled applications with Strands Agents
abstract: Learn about the future of multi-agent collaboration by building Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol-enabled applications using AWS Strands Agents SDK. This technical session demonstrates how to implement standardized agent communication patterns that enable Strands agents to discover, coordinate, and collaborate with agents built on any framework. Attendees will learn to build interoperable agent systems using Strands' A2A integration capabilities, implementing the AgentExecutor interface for seamless cross-framework communication. The session covers practical implementation of agent discovery mechanisms, task delegation patterns, and event-driven coordination using A2A's standardized protocol alongside Strands' model-driven agent architecture.

title: Building a Cloud-Native Risk Decisioning Platform for Resilience (sponsored by PwC)
abstract: Capital One’s FUSE platform represents a leap in risk management—built natively on AWS to deliver real-time decisioning, regulatory compliance, &  enterprise resilience. While many financial institutions are just beginning to move from on-prem to cloud, FUSE is already ahead, helping Capital One exceed regulatory expectations &  enabling its merger with Discover. In this session, leaders Solomon Francis &  Matt Davis share how they built FUSE from the ground up on AWS using Bedrock, SageMaker, & S3. FUSE demonstrates how a cloud-native platform can future-proof financial institutions against rising risk & compliance demands. This session offers practical lessons in designing & building risk platform in AWS. This presentation is brought to you by PwC, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Building a Cloud-Native Risk Decisioning Platform for Resilience (sponsored by PwC)
Building a Cloud-Native Risk Decisioning Platform for Resilience (sponsored by PwC)

title: Building a culture of API Excellence
abstract: Effective API discovery and reuse remain significant challenges in many organizations, often resulting in redundant development and underutilized APIs. This session examines how leading organizations have implemented API cataloging to transform their development culture. Discover practical approaches to API cataloging that drive both internal collaboration and external adoption. Through real-world examples, learn how to implement an API-first culture that maximizes the value of your API investments.

title: Building adaptive AI agents: Enterprise patterns that scale
abstract: Early architectural decisions can significantly impact AI agent flexibility across industries. This hands-on workshop demonstrates building production-ready systems using AWS Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore with Model Context Protocol. Learn to create secure, enterprise-grade agent architectures that adapt across industries. Through practical exercises, master multi-agent orchestration, scalable configurations, and UI implementation patterns. Discover how to design flexible backends that power diverse industry solutions while maintaining security and performance at scale.

title: Building a GenAI-Powered Compliance Bot to Secure Networks on AWS
abstract: In this hands-on session, participants will be provided with a pre-built, intentionally insecure AWS environment featuring misconfigured VPCs, permissive IAM and NACL rules, public subnets, and improper AWS PrivateLink usage. Leveraging a GenAI-powered compliance bot, you’ll continuously monitor network configurations and traffic, validate AWS PrivateLink and service connectivity, enforce strict IAM and NACL policies, and in alignment to zero trust and AWS security best practices. Through real-time analysis and automated remediation, you’ll gain practical experience in maintaining a robust and compliant AWS network using continuous monitoring, alerting, and AI-driven insights.

title: Building Agentic AI: Amazon Nova Act and Strands Agents in Practice
abstract: Explore practical applications of Agentic AI through two real-world case studies. First, dive into a Hong Kong weather agent built with Amazon Nova Act, featuring conversation flow design and meteorological data integration. Watch a live demo showcasing natural language interaction for weather information retrieval and trend analysis. Next, discover a mathematics teaching AI agent developed using the Strands Agents framework, demonstrating personalized math video creation through automatic content generation. Both cases include comprehensive code demonstrations, providing developers with concrete references for AI agent application development on AWS.

title: Building agentic AI applications on Amazon Bedrock using C# and .NET
abstract: Discover the full potential of agentic AI in your .NET applications using automated multistep reasoning provided by Amazon Bedrock Agents. Learn how to securely create sophisticated AI agents in .NET that provide access to company systems, APIs, and data sources in real-time. We'll demonstrate practical patterns for building intelligent agents that leverage your existing .NET investments while harnessing Amazon's powerful AI capabilities. By the end of this session, you'll gain the necessary knowledge and confidence to build .NET Agentic AI applications that make intelligent decisions with your data, delivering immediate value to your organization.

title: Building Agentic AI architectures with AWS Serverless
abstract: Discover how serverless architectures unlock the full potential of AI agents in production systems. In this hands-on session, you'll learn practical patterns for deploying AI agents that can scale automatically and optimize costs. We'll explore both event-driven and synchronous implementations, showing how serverless elegantly handles the complex challenges of agent orchestration and state management. Through guided exercises, you'll build production-ready architectures that demonstrate how to rapidly deploy AI agents, manage their interactions, and optimize their performance. Leave with battle-tested patterns for building scalable, cost-effective AI agent systems on AWS.

title: Building agentic AI platform engineering solutions with open source
abstract: Join us for this session as we share our vision for driving innovation through open source agentic AI, and enhancing work-life quality for platform engineers worldwide. We'll explore real-world examples of how platform teams can apply autonomous agentic AI to their organizations, integrating AWS services alongside other open source projects such as Kubernetes, ArgoCD, Backstage and more.

title: Building Agentic AI Systems with AWS and Agent Mesh (sponsored by Solace)
abstract: Join this hands-on workshop to learn how to build powerful agentic AI systems using Solace Agent Mesh—an open-source, modular framework designed for enterprise-grade agent orchestration. You’ll work with an agent-agnostic framework to integrate AWS Bedrock agents, flows, MCP servers, and custom agents, all while leveraging a robust event-driven architecture. Discover how to implement three core agentic patterns—conversational, event-triggered, and agentic automation—in real-world scenarios. This session will give you the skills to accelerate AI innovation in production-grade environments. Solace is the leader in event-driven integration, trusted by hundreds of global leaders including Airbus, Barclays, Danone, NASA, and Unilever. This presentation is brought to you by Solace, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Building Agentic AI Systems with AWS and Agent Mesh (sponsored by Solace)
Building Agentic AI Systems with AWS and Agent Mesh (sponsored by Solace)

title: Building Agentic Enterprise Workflows with Informatica & AWS (sponsored by Informatica)
abstract: Agentic workflows – where AI agents autonomously handle complex tasks – to enhance enterprise productivity. However, their success hinges on access to high-quality, trusted, and well-governed data. This session explores how enterprise-grade data management with Informatica and AWS provides the foundation for reliable agentic workflows. You will learn how to use Informatica’s CLAIRE AI Agents to automate data management tasks that power agentic workflows in the enterprise through MCP and multi-agent collaboration. Through an architectural blueprint, experience a demonstration of how you can integrate semantic context via metadata-driven discovery, automated data quality and MDM with context-rich trusted data. This presentation is brought to you by Informatica, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Building Agentic Enterprise Workflows with Informatica & AWS (sponsored by Informatica)
Building Agentic Enterprise Workflows with Informatica & AWS (sponsored by Informatica)

title: Building agentic memory layers on AWS managed databases
abstract: Scaling agentic AI and generative AI workloads requires multiple memory components to effectively support chat or multi-agent use cases. In this session, learn why different types of short-term and long-term memory components, such as semantic, episodic, or procedural memory layers are required. Discover how to build these memory layers with Amazon Aurora, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon ElastiCache for Valkey and best practices to consider in your solution. Attendees implementing agentic AI or generative AI (with RAG) workloads on AWS will gain a better understanding of design considerations for AI memory components and how AWS services can simplify their solutions.

title: Building Agentic Smart home with Generative AI
abstract:
Participants will explore how to build intelligent, agent-driven smart home experiences using industry-standard Generative AI frameworks and managed integrations for AWS IoT Device Management. You'll learn step-by-step how to integrate IoT devices, real-time databases, and multimodal AI capabilities into seamless, responsive home automation systems.
Workshop Objectives: Understand Generative AI concepts and how they apply to smart home ecosystems, learn to deploy intelligent agents capable of reasoning and autonomous action, leverage AWS services, such as AWS loT Rekognition, and create an integrated architecture combining loT data, Generative AI and user intrations.

title: Building agentic systems with Hugging Face and AWS AI chips
abstract: Unlock the next generation of AI capabilities with Hugging Face on AWS AI chips. In this chalk talk, explore implementing Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) models, reasoning systems, and multi-step AI workflows. Learn practical techniques for deploying sophisticated agent-based applications. We'll demonstrate how to leverage AWS Trainium and Inferentia to efficiently run and scale these advanced architectures while optimizing for both performance and cost.

title: Building agentic workflows for augmented observability
abstract: Drowning in observability data but starving for insights? In this live, interactive coding session, we'll build an AI agent that transforms raw telemetry into actionable intelligence. We'll build a system that correlates metrics, logs, and traces from Amazon CloudWatch. Our agent will analyze patterns, create relevant monitoring artifacts, and provide natural language explanations of complex issues. We'll show how to productionize the agent to autonomously respond to operational events, creating a proactive observability workflow. Join us to explore the future of AI-augmented observability.

title: Building AI Agents with Serverless, Strands, and MCP
abstract: Join this session to master the art of building AI agents on AWS. Witness the evolution of generative AI (GenAI) that has enabled agentic systems to surpass traditional language models, and learn the fundamental principles that define an AI agent. Dive into the process of leveraging AWS serverless compute, the Strands Agents SDK, and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to create these dynamic, adaptable agents. Observe the implementation of key capabilities like context awareness, authentication, security, and observability. Explore techniques to extend agent functionality with local tools, and unlock unprecedented integration by connecting to remote MCP servers. Walk away with the skills to elevate your intelligent applications with the transformative power of AWS-powered AI agents.

title: Building AI-Powered operational insights and automated remediation
abstract: Operational monitoring often requires manual intervention, leading to delayed response times. Join this session to build an AI-powered solution that combines Amazon Q, Amazon OpenSearch Service, and AWS Systems Manager to deliver advanced operational insights and automated remediation. You'll work with Amazon Q via MCP Server to construct queries and implement AI integration with your operational data. Learn to configure OpenSearch for efficient data ingestion using zETL with Amazon S3, enabling near real-time anomaly detection. Conclude with setting up automated remediation actions and creating a comprehensive dashboard to visualize critical insights.

title: Building an Agentic AI-powered Knowledge Assistant for Engineering R&D
abstract: Learn how an Agentic AI-powered Engineering Knowledge Assistant is revolutionizing the way teams interact with organizational expertise to search and summarize information as well as execute tasks and actions. This innovative solution combines industry knowledge with company-specific insights, featuring multi-modal interactions that provide instant access to knowledge base, best practices, and decision support. The assistant delivers contextual recommendations and insights to support diverse stakeholders - from designers and R&D analysts to manufacturing teams - helping them navigate complex engineering information with unprecedented efficiency. Join us to explore practical applications, implementation strategies, and the future of AI-augmented engineering workflows.

title: Building an AI-Powered security guardian for your Cognito applications
abstract: Elevate your application security with an intelligent AI-Powered security guardian to protect your Amazon Cognito-authenticated applications. In this interactive session, we'll explore identity best practices and building an AI agent using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to help verify best practices, perform detective analysis, and take automated preventative actions to mitigate risks. We'll talk through how an AI agent can perform dynamic WAF rule adjustments, modify authentication flows, and perform security operations center (SOC) actions. Bring your questions and scenarios as we deep dive into how to implement AI-driven security controls for your Cognito protected applications.

title: Building an AI-powered waste classification using Amazon Nova & IoT
abstract: AWS Chile revolutionized waste management by developing an intelligent classification system using Amazon Nova, IoT, and serverless architecture. This revolutionary solution processes waste items in under 3 seconds with 95% accuracy, while keeping implementation costs below $300 USD and operational costs under $3 per 1,000 images. Explore the technical architecture integrating edge computing, computer vision, and AI to create a real-time classification system that improved recycling efficiency by 52%, preventing 644.7 kg of CO2 emissions in six months. Learn to implement this cost-effective solution in your organization using AWS, and understand key challenges and lessons learned from this sustainability initiative.

title: Building and managing conversational AI at scale: lessons from Alexa+
abstract: This technical session dives deep into building production-grade conversational AI systems at scale through the lens of Alexa+'s architecture. Learn how to implement real-time inference, manage strict latency requirements, and deploy AI guardrails using AWS services like using a comprehensive suite of AWS services including Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Lambda, Amazon ECS, Amazon DynamoDB, and CloudWatch. We'll explore architecture patterns for processing millions of conversations daily while maintaining high accuracy and safety, demonstrating how to apply Well-Architected principles to build robust, scalable conversational AI systems.

title: Building and operating an effective architecture review board
abstract: Establishing an effective architecture review board (ARB) is crucial for realizing the benefits of architectural governance. This chalk talk explores the components of an efficient architecture review process, from addressing stakeholder needs to integrating with project execution. Learn strategies to reduce costs, minimize security events, and diminish technical debt through a well-defined ARB. Discover actionable steps to establish an enterprise-wide ARB that streamlines architectural decision-making and aligns with business objectives while maintaining technical excellence.

title: Building and testing resilient multi-AZ applications
abstract: Gain hands-on experience building and testing resilient multi-AZ applications. Learn to use Amazon CloudWatch dashboards, insights rules, and composite alarms for comprehensive health monitoring. Practice injecting randomized faults with AWS Fault Injection Service to simulate various single-AZ impairments. Master zonal deployments using AWS CodeDeploy and experience realistic failure scenarios. Explore Amazon Application Recovery Controller's zonal shift capabilities to recover from failures and maintain customer experience. This workshop provides practical skills for architecting and operating highly available systems on AWS.

title: Building and tracing AI agents with Amazon SageMaker and Strands
abstract: AI agents are moving from research prototypes to real-world applications powering copilots, automation flows, and customer-facing assistants. But building agents that are reliable, observable, and scalable is still challenging.  In this session, you’ll learn how to design and scale agentic workflows using Amazon SageMaker AI and the Strands SDK. We’ll show how managed MLflow enables step-level tracing, prompt and tool evaluation, and offline comparisons of agent strategies, while SageMaker Pipelines helps standardize testing and deployment. You will walk away with patterns and practices for building AI agents that are observable, trustworthy, and scalable in production.

title: Building and validating cloud controls with generative AI
abstract: Managing controls and compliance across AWS environments traditionally requires significant manual effort and expertise. This technical session demonstrates how to leverage generative AI to automate and enhance compliance monitoring and validation processes. Learn how GenAI can accelerate AWS account customization through AWS Control Tower, author AWS Config rules, and analyze AWS CloudTrail logs. Leave this session with practical examples and patterns for using GenAI to reduce the complexity of governance while strengthening your compliance and security posture.

title: Building an operational data lake using S3 Tables and SageMaker
abstract: Explore architectural patterns for building a fully managed, ACID-compliant data platform using Apache Iceberg and S3 Tables. Join AWS experts to discuss integrating S3 Tables with AWS analytics services - from Amazon Athena and Redshift to EMR and QuickSight. Examine cross-account access strategies using AWS Lake Formation and dive into implementation patterns for lakehouse architecture in Amazon SageMaker using Glue Iceberg REST endpoints. Compare direct access approaches using S3 Tables Iceberg REST endpoints and the Amazon S3 Tables Catalog. Share your data platform challenges and design considerations for democratizing data access.

title: Building a robust container security  pipeline
abstract: In this hands-on session, learn to implement comprehensive container pipeline security from code to production. Configure pre-commit hooks and IDE scanning, establish automated CI/CD security checks, and ensure artifact integrity using AWS Signer for container images. Through guided exercises, practice SBOM extraction, vulnerability scanning, and runtime policy implementation. You'll gain practical experience building a secure container pipeline that meets compliance requirements without sacrificing development speed. Ideal for DevOps engineers and security professionals focused on software supply chain security.

title: Building at global scale: Engineering AWS expansion
abstract: Explore how AWS continually expands its global infrastructure through sophisticated software engineering. This session reveals the evolution of AWS's approach to building new infrastructure, from manual processes to today's automated systems. Examine how changing global landscapes and business needs have shaped our strategies. Learn about the design patterns, testing frameworks, and operational practices that enable AWS to accelerate regional expansion while maintaining high security and reliability across our global infrastructure. Gain insights into architecting for massive scale and global distribution.

title: Building better AI agents by applying context engineering (sponsored by Redis)
abstract: AI is the new competitive frontier, but success depends on more than deploying an AI agent. True enterprise value comes from giving agents the ability to ground their answers, remember past interactions, and respond instantly at scale. This session explores how Redis delivers the context layer that makes agentic AI reliable, efficient, and enterprise-ready. We’ll highlight use cases from financial services, retail, and healthcare, and show how this architecture accelerates time-to-value and builds sustainable competitive advantage. This presentation is brought to you by Redis, an AWS Partner.

title: Building Context-Rich Data Agents for SaaS with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Are your customers asking for conversational data exploration in your SaaS platform? Learn how to build scalable, multi-tenant data analysis agents using Amazon Bedrock and Strands Agents framework. This chalk talk demonstrates enforcing data isolation across customers, generating accurate SQL from natural language, and deriving insights from multiple structured data sources. Discover how Bedrock AgentCore's capabilities support resilient, context-rich AI agents purpose-built for modern SaaS applications.

title: Building Cornell's AI Future: AWS Innovation at Enterprise Scale
abstract: Join us to explore how Cornell University is reshaping higher education through strategic AI adoption and data transformation. Learn how Cornell’s AI Innovation Lab, in partnership with AWS, evaluates and implements 20+ AI use cases each semester using a “minimum lovable product” approach. We’ll showcase SandboxAI, a secure campus-wide platform built on AWS serverless architecture and integrated with Amazon Bedrock. Also discover how migrating analytics to Amazon Redshift unlocked significant cost savings and performance gains, directly fueling Cornell’s AI initiatives and broader institutional goals. Cornell’s journey offers a blueprint for innovation, efficiency, and governance at scale.

title: Building cost-effective data lakes with Apache Iceberg and Amazon S3
abstract: Optimize the cost-effectiveness of Apache Iceberg data lakes on Amazon S3 through expert-level implementation strategies for both self-managed Iceberg and S3 Tables deployments. Through real-world examples, we’ll dive deep into practical approaches to table maintenance, including metadata optimization, data compaction, and schema design. Learn to implement cost-effective data retention policies using S3 Lifecycle configurations and tiered storage management. This session delivers actionable insights for operating Iceberg data lakes efficiently at scale, helping you balance performance with cost optimization.

title: Building cost-optimized, resilient apps with Amazon EKS and EFS
abstract: Learn how  to architect highly resilient, cost-effective modern applications using  Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) and Amazon Elastic File System (EFS).  This technical session demonstrates best practices for deploying stateful  applications on EKS while leveraging EFS for persistent storage needs.  Through real-world examples and live demonstrations, discover how to  implement auto-scaling, optimize cluster resources, and establish reliable  data persistence patterns. We'll explore cost optimization strategies  including Spot instances, right-sizing workloads, and efficient storage  management. Walk away with actionable insights to build and maintain  production-grade Kubernetes applications that balance performance,  reliability, and cost efficiency.

title: Building custom agents for intelligent AWS patch automation
abstract: Organizations face mounting challenges from manual patching, fragmented compliance, and limited visibility. In this code talk, we'll build an agentic solution with Strands Agents SDK and AWS services to transform patch management. We’ll walk through turning operational requirements into interactive, production-ready agent workflows—driving automated remediation and rapid vulnerability checks. Attendees will leave equipped with implementation patterns, code samples, and best practices to streamline operations, and strengthen security.

title: Building Customer Trust with AI Agents: Transform Your MSP Operations
abstract: As Managed Service Providers (MSPs) evolve to meet the growing demand for proactive cloud management, AI agents are becoming essential collaborators in service delivery. Through live demonstrations, you'll learn how to build and deploy incident response and infrastructure monitoring agents using AWS's agentic AI capabilities. Follow along as we will walk through the code required to create AI agents with Strands and integrate them with AWS services and third-party solutions through MCP servers to create comprehensive agentic workflows. This hands-on session will equip you with the technical knowledge to enhance your MSP services through practical AI agent implementation.

title: Building Customizable AI Agents: A Fast-Track Guide for ISVs
abstract: ISVs need to innovate quickly by building customizable AI agents for their customers. While open-source frameworks like LangGraph, CrewAI, and Strands Agents provide powerful capabilities, implementing enterprise-grade features like multi-tenant authentication, observability, and memory management remains challenging. This hands-on lab teaches ISV technical leaders and developers how to rapidly create a robust agent platform with minimal code, accelerating time-to-market for AI solutions.

title: Building Data Products and AI for Electric Vehicles
abstract: Learn how to unlock value from connected electric vehicle (EV) data through advanced data products and AI systems. This session demonstrates a comprehensive framework for processing EV-generated data using digital twin technology. We will explore how combining traditional and generative AI enables improved driver experiences and predictive maintenance capabilities. The session covers implementing robust security and privacy standards essential for building scalable data products. Automotive manufacturers, fleet operators, and technology partners will gain practical insights for maximizing the value of their connected EV data while delivering enhanced experiences for drivers and operators.

title: Building EDAs with Apache Kafka and Amazon EventBridge
abstract: In this chalk talk, explore the convergence of event-driven architectures (EDAs) and real-time event streaming to meet modern business needs. Learn about Amazon EventBridge, Apache Kafka, and their roles in facilitating real-time decision-making, business velocity, and operational autonomy. Discover how combining EventBridge and Kafka unlocks rapid event-driven processes. See how Amazon MSK, EventBridge, and Kafka connectors empower building scalable, resilient EDAs. Leave with insights into leveraging this powerful combination.

title: Building enhanced container threat protection for improved security posture
abstract: This hands-on session explores advanced container threat detection for Amazon ECS and EKS using AWS security services. Learn to implement comprehensive security controls with Amazon GuardDuty's log and runtime protection capabilities. Discover how GuardDuty uses machine learning and AI to analyze billions of events, identifying potential threats and anomalies in real-time. Explore GuardDuty's AI-based Extended Threat Detection, which uses advanced correlation algorithms and behavioral analytics to detect complex, multi-stage attacks. Gain insights on centralizing threats and best practices using detective controls with AWS Security Hub to enhance your overall security posture.

title: Building enterprise-grade Agentic AI factory
abstract: Learn to build enterprise-scale AI systems using the new Agentic AI Factory framework, a comprehensive toolkit with pre-built agent blueprints and proven integration patterns. This deep-dive session demonstrates how to orchestrate multiple AI agents with AWS Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock, implement secure communications via A2A and MCP protocols, and leverage the framework's knowledge management systems. Through practical demonstrations and architectural discussions, you will gain actionable insights to rapidly develop and deploy production-ready agentic AI solutions, transforming ideas into enterprise-grade systems using our proven framework and toolkit.

title: Building Enterprise-Ready Agentic Speech AI Pipelines on AWS (sponsored by NVIDIA)
abstract: Enterprises in financial services, healthcare, and customer service are rapidly adopting agentic AI and voice agents to transform how they serve customers, from secure transcription and summarization to intelligent voice agents. In this panel, NVIDIA and partners share lessons learned from deploying GPU-accelerated speech AI pipelines in production. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.

title: Building event-driven applications with AWS Streaming and Messaging
abstract: Dive deep into AWS messaging services in this hands-on workshop where you'll build a real-world, event-driven application. Learn to architect sophisticated event-driven systems using Amazon SQS, SNS, MSK, and Amazon MQ. Through guided exercises, implement critical features including fan-out architectures, FIFO queues, and hybrid patterns while optimizing for security, cost, and performance. Gain practical insights into how architectural decisions impact scalability, latency, and operational complexity in production systems.

services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)

title: Building event-driven architectures using Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate
abstract: Event-driven architecture (EDA) enables organizations to build highly flexible and resilient systems, and customers are leveraging serverless containers to run EDA workloads due to its ease of use, scalability, and deep integrations with AWS serverless services. This session explores practical aspects of implementing EDA on Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate, focusing on patterns for consuming events in containerized environments using AWS Step Functions, Amazon SQS, and Amazon EventBridge. Learn how to build scalable, fault-tolerant, and event-driven solutions that can adapt to changing business requirements.

title: Building event-driven architectures
abstract: Many organizations choose to build event-driven application architectures in which events trigger decoupled services. This pattern can help development teams operate more independently to release new features faster and make their applications more scalable. In this workshop, learn about the basics of event-driven design using examples involving Amazon SNS, Amazon SQS, AWS Lambda, Amazon EventBridge, and more. Find out how to choose the right AWS service for the job and how you can optimize cost and performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Building Fast, Cost-Efficient, Sovereign Inference Platforms on AWS w/Intel CPUs (sponsored by Intel)
abstract: Generative AI is transforming industries—but misconceptions around cost, performance, and infrastructure often slow adoption. In this session, Intel demystifies GenAI deployment on AWS by showcasing real-world use cases how AI practitioners can gain better control of data privacy and lower total costs with open-source alternatives. Learn how Intel’s optimized instances with CPU-first innovations are enabling scalable, cost-effective GenAI inference pipelines on AWS services like SageMaker, and EC2. Whether you're a startup developer or an enterprise architect, discover how Intel is helping customers unlock GenAI’s full potential. This presentation is brought to you by Intel, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Building Fast, Cost-Efficient, Sovereign Inference Platforms on AWS w/Intel CPUs (sponsored by Intel)

title: Building fast with automated reasoning at Amazon S3 scale
abstract: S3 has a long history of using automated reasoning, but a core challenge has been applying these techniques to large systems while maintaining development velocity. Over time, we've learned to balance cutting-edge science with engineering velocity to accelerate development. We'll share diverse techniques for validating critical storage components, from black-box model-based validation using formal API specifications, to white-box verification with specialized concurrency checkers for ensuring transaction serializability and crash consistency. You'll learn how S3 engineers and scientists are advancing systems verification with new tools and ideas that you can apply to your own systems.

title: Building Fault-Tolerant Systems with AWS Messaging Services
abstract: Cloud application reliability is essential for modern business success. In this session, explore how AWS messaging services enhance system resilience through fault-tolerant design patterns. We'll examine four proven architectural approaches that strengthen your cloud infrastructure and maintain continuous service delivery. Through practical demonstrations, learn how to implement these patterns using AWS services to build loosely coupled, scalable systems that handle disruptions effectively. Discover techniques to create architectures that not only withstand challenges but excel under scale, ensuring consistent customer experiences.

title: Building for Efficiency & Reliability with Performance Testing on AWS
abstract: Learn how to run and leverage performance testing on AWS to drive cost optimization, validate system behavior, identify bottlenecks, and significantly improve reliability, while informing architectural decisions and optimal instance type selection for your workloads. You'll discover methods for pinpointing performance thresholds across different traffic patterns and understanding system reliability when stressed beyond normal parameters. Dive deep into techniques for measuring critical percentiles and determining breaking points as demand fluctuates, ultimately architecting for improved efficiency and building confidence in your system's resilience at scale.

title: Building for high availability using Amazon ElastiCache
abstract: Caching can dramatically improve the performance of your application, and the cache can often become a critical component of data architecture. In this chalk talk, learn how to build a highly available Amazon ElastiCache solution. Along the way discover advanced patterns and techniques to optimize for multi-AZ configurations, capacity planning, and client tuning. Also learn how you can deploy a multi-Region solution using Amazon ElastiCache Global Datastore.

title: Building GenAI applications with AI Agents that reason, decide and act
abstract: This hands-on workshop teaches you how to build AI agents using Amazon Bedrock, AWS Step Functions, and AWS Lambda. You will learn to design and develop agents that make decisions and act independently. The session covers key concepts in Agentic AI, from setup to deployment, with practical exercises throughout. This workshop is ideal for developers, architects, engineers, and data scientists who want to develop Agentic AI solutions on AWS.

title: Building generative AI-powered full-stack applications
abstract: Accelerate full-stack development from months to days while maintaining enterprise-grade quality. Learn to leverage AWS Amplify Gen 2's code-first approach for streamlining complex multi-component development. Build a generative AI-powered digital training platform integrating Cloudscape design components and Amazon Bedrock capabilities. Create dynamic content generation systems and AI-powered chat assistants that enhance user experience. Discover how Amazon Q Developer provides intelligent assistance throughout the development lifecycle, from architecture design to deployment.

title: Building governed agents: Human-in-the-loop with AgentCore and Strands
abstract: Discover how to deploy AI agents that act intelligently and responsibly in production environments. This session explores designing agents with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Strands that adhere to SOPs and business requirements while incorporating human oversight. Learn strategies for embedding policies, compliance rules, and operational safeguards into agents, alongside implementing human-in-the-loop workflows for critical decisions. We'll demonstrate intelligent escalation patterns blending automated efficiency with human judgment and share best practices for determining autonomous actions versus human expertise. Explore how to balance flexibility, control, and oversight, enabling agents to innovate within guardrails while maintaining trust and accountability for enterprise deployment.

title: Building High-Performance, Secure Networks for Hybrid and Multicloud (sponsored by Equinix)
abstract: Enterprise data is and AI workloads are more distributed, and more valuable —and more mobile—than ever. Training AI models, running inference at scale, migrating workloads, or sharing datasets across hybrid and multicloud environments, requires a network built for security, performance, flexibility, and cost control. In this session, we’ll share best practices for building hybrid and multicloud architectures that ensure your data is in the right place, at the right time—without unnecessary risk. You’ll walk away with actionable proven design patterns to accelerate Distributed AI innovation while protecting your competitive edge. This presentation is brought to you by Equinix, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Building High-Performance, Secure Networks for Hybrid and Multicloud (sponsored by Equinix)

title: Building high-quality data products for AI Agents
abstract: AI agents are only as effective as the data they rely on. This chalk talk focuses on how to build and manage high-quality data products and contextual information for use by AI agents. You'll learn how to deliver accurate, up-to-date, and well-governed data for AI systems, including context engineering, RAG strategies, fine-tuning dataset curation, and automated quality checks. We'll cover how to manage AI context, handle data drift, and perform classical data management activities in the Agentic AI world.

title: Building intelligent agentic workflows with Amazon Nova
abstract: Discover how Amazon Nova's reasoning capabilities support traditional chatbots through advanced tool support and performance optimization. In this hands-on session, you'll learn to architect three types of AI agents using Nova models: contextually-aware chat assistants, process-driven task agents, and sophisticated research agents that conduct iterative investigations. We'll explore how different Nova models align with different agent complexities, while leveraging built-in features like prompt caching and web search tools. You'll also learn to integrate open-source frameworks such as Model Context Protocol (MCP) to create extensible agent architectures. Leave equipped to build production-ready, cost-efficient AI agents that deliver reliable, intelligent automation.

title: Building Intelligent Healthcare Systems: FHIR, AI, and AWS HealthLake
abstract: This hands-on technical workshop demonstrates building production-ready healthcare AI systems using AWS services. Participants will develop an end-to-end pipeline that converts medical documents into queryable insights while maintaining HIPAA compliance. The session covers Bedrock Data Automation for medical document processing, FHIR-compliant data transformation, and AWS HealthLake integration. Attendees will implement Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers enabling natural language queries of healthcare data. Participants receive complete implementation resources including templates, code, and architectural diagrams. The solution accelerates healthcare AI development from months to weeks, while ensuring compliance and security, bridging the gap between raw medical data and actionable healthcare analytics.

title: Building interactive web based applications on Serverless
abstract: Build a complete interactive web application from scratch in this hands-on builder session. Working alongside an AWS expert, you'll create a modern web app using AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and Amazon DynamoDB. Through guided exercises, implement real-time features like live updates and user authentication, while learning how serverless architecture enables automatic scaling and cost optimization. You'll leave with working code demonstrating practical patterns for user interfaces, API design, and data persistence - plus the confidence to build your own web applications.

title: Building LLMs with Amazon SageMaker HyperPod and AWS Trainium
abstract: AWS Trainium is purpose built to deliver better price performance for LLM training workloads, while Amazon SageMaker HyperPod makes it easy to scale model development tasks such as training, fine-tuning, or inference across a cluster of hundreds or thousands of AI accelerators. In this session we will demo the distributed training of the Qwen3 text model on Trainium-based instances using SageMaker HyperPod and Neuron SDK which has native support for PyTorch. You will learn the training process on Trainium chips, as well as tools to observe and monitor the cluster condition.

title: Building multi-agent AI SRE: from root cause to vibe debugging (sponsored by Resolve AI)
abstract: Behind the promise of AI SRE lies a complex problem: how do you build multi-agent systems that reason across the full production context across code, infrastructure, observability signals, and tribal knowledge, to deliver answers, not just data? In this session, dive into what it takes to architect AI that performs autonomous root cause in minutes and enables intuitive vibe debugging for everyday engineering. Learn how to abstract away the complexity for engineers, and how enterprises are adopting Resolve AI to accelerate decision-making, reduce toil, and move beyond the limits of traditional observability and the new challenges created by coding agents. This presentation is brought to you by Resolve AI, an AWS Partner.

title: Building multi-Region financial transaction systems with Aurora DSQL
abstract: Financial institutions require operational reliability and international connectivity to process millions of daily transactions across time zones. But maintaining global consistency, data integrity, and availability is complex. Learn how to deploy a robust multi-region financial transaction processing system with Amazon Aurora Distributed SQL. We’ll walk through how to set up active-active architectures that leverage Amazon Aurora's distributed features to ensure high availability, data consistency, and minimal latency globally. Attendees will gain hands-on experience setting up multi-region deployments, managing distributed transaction consistency, and optimizing global performance. You'll walk away with the knowledge to reliably manage global transactions at scale.

title: Building Multi-tenant Data Pipelines for Agentic SaaS experiences
abstract: Building secure, performant data pipelines while maintaining tenant isolation remains a critical challenge for SaaS providers developing Agentic AI experiences. Our solution, leveraging Amazon MSK, AWS Glue, and Apache Iceberg, implements data pipeline at scale to power SaaS Agentic platforms serving thousands of customer tenants. Join us to learn the architectural patterns, optimization techniques, and security controls that can help ISVs build scalable, multi-tenant data pipelines for their next-gen Agentic platforms.

services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)
