title: Building Multi-tenant global ML SaaS platform
abstract: Get insight into how Qlik built a multi-tenant ML SaaS that processes 100,000 GPU-intensive training jobs monthly with 99.99% reliability. Learn about Qlik's proven patterns for scaling ML operations across global regions while optimizing costs through dynamic resource allocation. We'll share the architectural decisions that enabled supporting 2,500 organizations and 167,000 trained models. Essential knowledge for ISVs transforming ML capabilities into scalable SaaS solutions.

title: Building multi-tenant SaaS applications with Amazon ECS
abstract: In this workshop you will learn how Amazon ECS simplifies critical SaaS operations and tenant management. Get hands on with essential SaaS components such as tenant onboarding, user management, and admin portals. Learn how to implement compute and tenant isolation with Amazon ECS, as well as how to efficiently route requests, and implement security measures at scale. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Building .NET AI Applications with Semantic Kernel and Amazon Bedrock
abstract: This code-first session demonstrates how to transform .NET applications into powerful AI solutions using Semantic Kernel and Amazon Bedrock. The presentation explores the Semantic Kernel framework and its integration with Amazon Bedrock's AI capabilities, including flexible foundation model selection and multi-turn conversational abilities. Learn how to leverage Amazon Bedrock for extensible tool usage in AI applications. Through practical examples, the session covers techniques for enhancing existing applications and building new AI-powered solutions in .NET, providing developers with actionable skills for AI integration.

title: Building on AWS resilience: Innovations for critical success
abstract: Essential services that power global economies and critical infrastructure demand exceptional resilience. Through nearly two decades of focused innovation, AWS has developed core engineering practices and operational approaches that power critical workloads worldwide. Explore how AWS's architectural innovations and organizational practices help customers build robust services that maintain resilience during severe disruptions. Learn how AWS's continued investment in resilience provides the foundation for delivering essential services across governments, economies, and critical infrastructure.

title: Building operational resilience in workloads using generative AI
abstract: Building operational resilience requires proactive identification and mitigation of risks. In this workshop, use AWS managed generative AI services in real-world scenarios to learn how to assess readiness, proactively improve your architecture, react quickly to events, troubleshoot issues, and implement effective observability practices. Also use AWS Countdown and the AWS Well-Architected Framework as the entry point reference frameworks to use generative AI services for operation. Through hands-on activities, learn strategies for debugging issues, detecting anomalies and incidents, and optimizing architectures to improve the resilience of your workloads. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Building Pipelines for Analytics, ML and AI in Amazon Sagemaker Unified Studio
abstract: Learn how to create end-to-end pipelines to power data and AI applications in Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. We will cover how to implement both batch and streaming pipelines to integrate various data sources, optimizing data movement with modern ETL techniques. This session will equip you with the knowledge to develop comprehensive data and AI solutions using the next generation of Amazon SageMaker, from initial data processing through to model deployment.

title: Building Predictable AI Agents with Pega and AWS Bedrock (sponsored by Pega)
abstract: Transform the back-office from a cost center into a competitive advantage with Pega Predictable AI Agents, powered by AWS Bedrock and orchestrated through Pega GenAI Blueprint. Learn how companies like Rabobank are automating their middle-to-back-office operations, achieving scalable transformation and accelerated pace of change while maintaining operational excellence across their enterprise. This presentation is brought to you by Pega, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Building Predictable AI Agents with Pega and AWS Bedrock (sponsored by Pega)

title: Building privacy-aware generative AI applications in financial services
abstract: Financial institutions need to share sensitive documents across diverse roles while maintaining security and compliance. This includes junior analysts requesting summaries and compliance officers requiring complete audit trails. In this chalk talk, we'll architect a privacy-aware generative AI solution using Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Cognito, and Amazon Verified Permissions. Explore how Cedar policies and identity context enable dynamic content tailoring, ranging from redacted summaries to full access, while maintaining single-source documents. Discover design patterns for secure, personalized document sharing that scales across asset management, research, and audit workflows.

title: Building Production Agent Swarms: Mastering Industrial AI
abstract: AI systems are evolving beyond multi-modal understanding into autonomous collaboration and problem-solving for industry-specific challenges. This technical session demonstrates how to build and orchestrate multi-agent systems that leverage industry expertise with LLMs. Topics include agent orchestration framework customization, advanced RAG patterns for domain knowledge, collaborative decision-making mechanisms, and production-scale observability. Drawing from real implementations, the session covers critical architecture decisions, common pitfalls, and proven solutions. Participants will gain practical patterns and code examples for building next-generation AI systems with memory, planning, and industry-specific collaboration capabilities.

title: Building production AI agents for cloud application resilience on AWS
abstract: Cloud-native applications demand intelligent, automated solutions for fault management and resilience. This session presents a production-proven multi-agent system built on AWS that diagnoses issues, predicts failures, and automates recovery in cloud environments. Learn how specialized AI agents collaborate to perform root cause analysis, classify faults, and orchestrate complex workflows. The presentation covers implementing distributed reasoning, maintaining context across processes, and enabling predictive maintenance. Explore real-world techniques for prompt engineering, function calling, and system integration. Gain actionable insights from building and operating AI-driven fault management at scale.

title: Building Production-Grade Workflow Patterns with AWS Step Functions
abstract: Take your AWS Step Functions expertise to the next level with advanced architectural patterns and best practices. Join this session to dive deep into when and how to effectively use Map states, Parallel states, and nested workflows in production environments. Learn how to leverage features such as JSONata support, variables, and private API endpoint connections to build secure, high-performance workflows while optimizing costs. Through real-world production scenarios, discover proven patterns for building resilient serverless applications that scale.

title: Building production-ready Agentic AI architectures with AWS Serverless
abstract: Agentic AI is transforming enterprise applications, but taking it from prototype to production requires more than just prompting. Join this chalk talk to discuss pragmatic, scalable patterns for building agentic AI systems using AWS Serverless services like Lambda, ECS Fargate, and API Gateway. You'll learn how to architect and operate distributed agent-based systems, including patterns for running Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Together, we’ll walk through end-to-end architecture using the Strands Agents SDK, covering best practices for security, observability, and governance. Bring your questions — and leave with concrete patterns you can apply in your organization right away.

title: Building Production-Ready AI Applications with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Join this chalk talk to learn proven patterns and best practices for moving AI applications from proof-of-concept to production using Amazon Bedrock. We'll dive deep into architecting secure, scalable AI solutions that meet enterprise requirements. Discover how to optimize performance, manage costs, and implement robust security controls to protect against AI-specific threats like prompt injection. Perfect for partners building AI consulting practices or software products, this interactive session will equip you with practical strategies for deploying production-grade AI applications. Bring your challenges and learn from real-world examples of successful enterprise AI implementations using AWS security services.

title: Building Production-Ready Data Systems for AI Applications
abstract: Join us to experience how the next generation of Amazon SageMaker powers data and analytics to enable intelligent business transformations with AI solutions. Using a real-world scenario, participants will step into the roles of different data professionals to solve real business challenges, from initial data preparation to deploying an AI-powered, targeted business campaign. Using SageMaker Unified Studio, you'll learn to build robust data foundations, implement governance, manage vector databases, and leverage integrated ML capabilities in a unified and secure environment. This hands-on session emphasizes practical application, demonstrating how to create measurable business value through data-driven, AI-enabled solutions.

title: Building Prudential’s microagent platform with MCP and A2A on AWS
abstract: Enterprises are exploring ways to scale their AI agent implementations beyond initial use cases. Learn how Prudential Financial is moving beyond single-purpose deployments with a scalable, microagent architecture powered by Amazon Bedrock and MCP agent-to-agent (A2A) communication. Prudential will share how their financial advisor assistant became the foundation for an enterprise multi-agent system, supporting diverse scenarios through modular design, independent scaling, and seamless deployment on AWS. Whether you’re exploring AI agents for specific business needs or building a foundation for enterprise-wide adoption, walk away with patterns and best practices for scaling AI agents.

title: Building Quantum-Safe Systems with Post-Quantum Cryptography on AWS
abstract: Learn how to prepare your systems for the quantum computing era using AWS's latest post-quantum cryptography capabilities. In this hands-on workshop, you'll implement quantum-safe key management using AWS KMS with ML-DSA and ML-KEM, deploy quantum-resistant certificates using AWS Private Certificate Authority, and analyze hybrid post-quantum TLS handshakes. Through practical exercises, you'll benchmark post-quantum algorithms against classical ones and implement secure file transfers using quantum-safe protocols. Leave with concrete experience in implementing post-quantum cryptography using AWS services and understanding performance implications for your applications.

title: Building rate-limited solutions on AWS
abstract: Does your scalable service overwhelm backends that can't keep up? Do you need to integrate with rate-limited third-party APIs? Attend this chalk talk to learn some of the best ways to build rate limiting into your systems for improved reliability. After a quick overview of AWS rate limiting tools, dive into the details of three different implementations. Leave with practical strategies to prevent downstream bottlenecks from impacting your application's performance.

title: Building Real-Time Container Security with AWS Native Tools
abstract: Real-time threat detection is critical for container security. This technical session demonstrates how to build a comprehensive security monitoring solution using Amazon GuardDuty, AWS Security Hub, and Amazon Inspector. Through live coding demonstrations, participants will learn to implement automated detection pipelines that correlate findings across AWS security services to identify and respond to container threats, including supply chain compromises and runtime breakouts. Participants will implement defense-in-depth monitoring through AWS IAM Access Analyzer, AWS CloudTrail event monitoring, and vulnerability scanning integration, with working code samples and  templates for containerized infrastructure.

title: Building reliable operations, feat. Fannie Mae
abstract: Managing incidents effectively across complex infrastructure remains a challenge for many organizations. In this session, learn proven practices for building reliable operations and reducing Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) through effective incident management. We'll showcase how Fannie Mae transformed their operations by building a cross-region observability platform on AWS, enabling them to automate incident response and improve reliability across their hybrid environment. Walk away with practical strategies for implementing automated incident management, establishing effective on-call processes, and leveraging AWS services to enhance operational reliability within your organization.

title: Building resilience against ransomware using AWS Backup
abstract: To counter evolving cyber threats, organizations must fortify their backup infrastructure for recovery resilience, aligned with NIST CSF 2.0. This session explores three critical pillars: immutability with isolation, integrity validation, and predictable availability. AWS Backup enables these through Vault Lock for tamper-proof backups, restore testing for integrity assurance, and integration with partner solutions for enhanced forensic analysis. Learn how to strengthen accessibility by isolating authentication boundaries to protect recovery mechanisms from compromised credentials. Discover practical strategies to align these pillars with NIST CSF 2.0, ensuring robust recovery resilience and business continuity.

title: Building resilient architectures with observability
abstract: When critical systems fail, every minute of downtime costs money and trust. Transform an application into a resilient, observable system in this hands-on workshop. Enhance resilience through chaos engineering, inject faults with AWS Fault Injection Service to simulate Availability Zones failures, network issues, and deployment problems. Learn to leverage Amazon CloudWatch and Amazon Application Recovery Controller to detect, diagnose, and automatically recover from failures. Leave with practical experience in building applications that remain observable and resilient under real-world conditions.

title: Building resilient block storage through chaos engineering and observability
abstract: Modern resilience engineering requires validating how storage systems behave under disruptions. In this session, learn how to use AWS Fault Injection Service (AWS FIS) to inject EBS-specific faults, such as volume latency, detachment, or I/O degradation, and observe system behavior under pressure. Dive into real-world strategies for designing observability into the storage layer using Amazon EBS and Amazon CloudWatch metrics. See how advanced teams are codifying recovery expectations, triggering automated failovers, and continuously testing system durability in production-like environments.

title: Building resilient clients: Architecture patterns from Amazon.com
abstract: Discover architectural patterns for building resilient frontend applications, drawn from Amazon.com's production experience at massive scale. Learn how Amazon.com architects frontend systems to maintain reliability during peak events through fault injection testing, caching strategies, and graceful degradation patterns. Explore implementations of circuit breakers, deployment safety, and comprehensive monitoring for operational excellence. This technical session provides practical patterns for architecting robust client applications that scale, aligned with AWS Well-Architected Framework principles.

title: Building resilient data protection with Amazon EBS Snapshots
abstract: Design advanced data protection strategies using Amazon EBS Snapshots in this expert-level builders session. Architect automated, application-consistent snapshot workflows leveraging Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager with robust security controls and encryption. Configure Amazon EBS Provisioned Rate for Volume Initialization to enhance resilience, reducing recovery time and enabling concurrent initialization of hundreds of EBS volumes and EC2 instances. Build sophisticated safeguards against accidental deletions and ransomware attacks while strengthening your compliance posture. This session includes complex scenarios and hands-on development of best practices for enterprise-grade data resilience.

title: Building resilient deployment pipelines with Amazon ECS
abstract: When running containerized applications on Amazon ECS, operations teams need to ensure that new software releases are rolled out safely, with the ability to try out new releases, and to quickly rollback to a previous known stable state. Join this workshop to gain hands on experience with Amazon ECS deployment strategies, diving deep into the different approaches, and learning how they can be automated as part of a CI/CD pipeline. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Building resilient multi-Region applications with Capital One
abstract: Organizations face significant challenges achieving predictable recovery times and maintaining consistency in multi-Region applications at scale. Learn how Capital One uses Application Recovery Controller (ARC), Aurora DSQL, and DynamoDB Multi-Region Strong Consistency to create resilient architectures with bounded recovery targets. Through real-world implementation patterns, discover how ARC Region switch controls and AWS Fault Injection Service transform maintenance and testing approaches. This expert-level session provides practical strategies for architecting multi-Region applications that deliver predictable recovery and consistent operations.

title: Building Resilient Multi-Tenant Messaging with Amazon SQS
abstract: Multi-tenant messaging systems face challenges like noisy neighbors and unexpected workloads that impact reliability. This chalk talk explores how Amazon SQS helps maintain fairness, isolation, and consistent performance across tenants. Discover practical strategies including dead-letter queues, retry handling, and monitoring demonstrated through SaaS and microservices scenarios. Join us to learn best practices for building resilient, scalable Amazon SQS architectures that deliver reliable message processing for all tenants.

title: Building resilient Serverless applications with chaos engineering
abstract: Chaos engineering helps build confidence in system resilience, but how do you apply it to serverless architectures? In this intermediate-level session, learn practical techniques for implementing chaos experiments on AWS Lambda functions to identify and address failure points before they impact your users. We'll demonstrate how to inject latency, errors, and resource constraints into your serverless environment using both custom approaches and AWS Fault Injection Service (FIS). You'll leave with actionable knowledge to create automated, repeatable chaos experiments for your production serverless applications. You'll also learn key metrics to measure the effectiveness of your resilience testing.

title: Building Scalable Agentic AI Solutions with AWS (sponsored by Capital One)
abstract: As businesses move from AI experiments to scalable customer facing AI solutions, Capital One’s Multi-Agentic Conversational AI Workflow highlights what it takes to build next-generation agentic AI frameworks. In this session, you’ll learn how AWS services like Sagemaker, combined with a modern data ecosystem and state-of-the-art AI stack, helped Capital One create a leading-edge multi-agentic AI workflow that meets the needs of various users and customers in complex business environments. The team will share real world benefits and challenges of training and hosting customized LLMs, and advantages of AWS services, including quicker time to market and sophisticated inference optimizations.  This presentation is brought to you by Capital One, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Building Scalable Agentic AI Solutions with AWS (sponsored by Capital One)

title: Building scalable applications with text and multimodal understanding
abstract: Discover how Amazon Nova models bring text and multimodal understanding to your applications. Learn how Nova interprets across modalities to deliver responses for diverse use cases, from automating content analysis to enhancing search and discovery—leading to deeper insights and delightful customer experiences.

title: Building Scalable, Secure Secrets Management on AWS
abstract: Unlock the vault of industry-leading practices for protecting your crown jewels using AWS Secrets Manager's cutting-edge features. In this hands-on session, you'll architect an enterprise-grade secrets management solution combining automated rotation, intelligent caching, and cross-region replication. Through real-world scenarios, master the art of crafting robust security controls using AWS KMS, Lambda, IAM, and Config. Learn to implement compliance guardrails that scale with your applications while reducing operational overhead. Transform your security posture with battle-tested patterns that meet enterprise compliance requirements in the cloud age.

title: Building Scalable, Self-Orchestrating AI Workflows with A2A and MCP
abstract: Learn how to build scalable, autonomous AI workflows using the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol and Model Context Protocol (MCP). This session demonstrates how to design specialized agents that dynamically discover each other's capabilities and collaborate on complex tasks across platforms and implementations. Using MCP for standardized context integration, you'll build horizontally scalable, serverless agents with AWS Lambda, Amazon Bedrock, and Momento Cache. You'll also learn how A2A enables secure agent collaboration with built-in observability. Through real-world examples and best practices, you'll leave equipped to design, deploy, and scale interoperable AI systems in production.

title: Building Secure agents with Q Index [AWS Partners only]
abstract: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Learn to enhance enterprise AI capabilities using Amazon Q Index to unify and contextualize distributed data sources securely. Through hands-on exercises, build intelligent agents that leverage Q Index to securely access organizational data. Dive deep into Strands Agent implementation for task orchestration and explore Model Context Protocol (MCP) for distributed AI workloads. Gain practical experience with Bedrock AgentCore for secure agent development and deployment. Discover strategies for intelligent data contextualization and automated reasoning to drive meaningful business outcomes while maintaining enterprise security. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Building Secure and Responsible Gen AI with GuardRails for Amazon Bedrock
abstract: This lab provides hands-on training in building a secure generative AI chatbot using Amazon Bedrock. Learn how to leverage Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to generate contextually relevant responses. They will implement guardrails to filter and control the chatbot's content generation. Additionally, you will explore essential security features like access control and logging to ensure the Bedrock configuration adheres to security best practices. After completing this lab, you will acquire skills to develop secure and compliant generative AI applications aligning with organizational requirements and ethical guidelines.

title: Building secure and scalable lakehouses for the future
abstract: Join this interactive session to learn strategies for building secure and scalable data lakehouse architectures. You will get practical experience in implementing different lakehouse patterns using AWS Lake Formation as a single control plane for managing permissions across multiple data stores. Implement Attribute-based Access Control (ABAC) and Tag-based Access Control (TBAC) to efficiently scale permissions, create unified governance policies, and set up cross-platform access controls. Gain hands-on experience with real-world lakehouse scenarios that demonstrate how to scale data access management across your organization.

title: Building Secure-by-Design Environments with AWS Capabilities (sponsored by Native)
abstract: Cloud providers deliver powerful security capabilities, yet most organizations struggle to fully leverage them. In this session, we’ll explore how to harness the latest AWS native security controls to build secure-by-design environments, shifting from detection to prevention. Drawing on real-world experience with AWS customers, including some of the largest enterprises, we’ll cover best practices for enforcing preventive policies such as SCPs and RCPs, reducing complexity, and operationalizing native controls. Attendees will leave with actionable insights to maximize the value of AWS investments, and accelerate adoption of a prevention-first model—while also seeing how these approaches can be standardized across providers. This presentation is brought to you by Native, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Building Secure-by-Design Environments with AWS Capabilities (sponsored by Native)

title: Building secure serverless applications
abstract: In this workshop, learn techniques to secure a serverless application built with AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and Amazon Aurora. Discover AWS services and features that you can use to improve the security of a serverless application in five domains: identity and access management, infrastructure, data, code, and logging and monitoring. Finally, explore new features including integrations with Amazon Inspector and Amazon GuardDuty. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Building, Securing, and Monitoring Kiu: A Global Community AI Agent
abstract: Kiu, an AI agent built with Amazon Bedrock, connects 150+ AWS User Groups across 25+ countries. This session demonstrates how a community idea scaled into a global developer tool using the open-source Strands Agents framework. The presentation covers practical RAG implementation, multi-language support, and production deployment strategies. Through real-world examples, the session explores security hardening with guardrails and IAM controls, along with comprehensive observability patterns using AWS X-Ray. Attendees gain access to proven architecture patterns and strategies for building secure, observable AI systems that scale across global communities.

title: Building Self-Healing IT Systems with Agentic AI
abstract: Master the art of creating intelligent IT remediation systems using AI agents and Amazon CloudWatch Investigations. In this hands-on builder session, learn to develop AI agents that assist in identifying and suggesting resolutions for common IT issues, reducing system downtime and support costs. You’ll implement practical solutions for assisted troubleshooting, configure MCP servers for system monitoring, and build resilient systems with AI-guided remediation capabilities. Perfect for companies with limited technical staff, you’ll leave with ideas to reduce IT burden and improve system reliability. Designed for developers and technical leads looking to enhance IT operations through AI assistance.

title: Building serverless AI Agents in Java with Spring AI
abstract: In this hands-on builders session, dive into the world of AI agents using Java and the Spring AI framework on AWS. You'll build a Serverless AI agent from the ground up, integrating with various Amazon Bedrock models, implementing chat memory, RAG and Model Context Protocol (MCP) support. By the end, you'll deploy a fully functional AI agent to Amazon ECS and AWS Lambda and explore the capabilities via an interactive UI. Join us to get started integrating Serverless AI Agents into your Java applications while maintaining production-grade reliability and scalability. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Building Serverless applications with Terraform workshop
abstract: This workshop targets developers, architects, and DevOps professionals eager to master the integration of serverless technology with the infrastructure as code (IaC) approach using Terraform on AWS. Designed to facilitate hands-on learning, the workshop provides a comprehensive introduction to Terraform, an IaC tool that allows for the efficient definition, deployment, and maintenance of serverless architectures. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Building Serverless distributed data processing workloads
abstract: Enterprises today face an ever-increasing need to process large-scale data to meet their business goals and unlock new value. In this workshop, learn how serverless technologies like AWS Step Functions and AWS Lambda can help you simplify management and scaling, offload undifferentiated tasks, and address the challenges associated with distributed  data processing workloads. Also, discover use cases, best practices, and resources that can help you accelerate your data processing journey. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Building serverless vector applications with Amazon S3 Vectors
abstract: Vector embeddings are transforming how organizations build and scale AI, powering everything from semantic search to generative applications. In this session, dive deep into the unique architecture of Amazon S3 Vectors and learn how to build cost-effective vector search applications at scale. We'll whiteboard the technical differences between S3 Vectors and specialized vector databases, discuss the specialized indexing approach that delivers query performance at significantly lower costs, and explore integration patterns with popular AWS AI services including Amazon Bedrock and Amazon OpenSearch Service. Come with your architecture questions, and we'll work through real-world scenarios together.

title: Building smarter AI coding assistants: real-world implementation guide
abstract: Your AI coding assistant generates impressive code at lightning speed, but production deployments reveal the harsh reality - perfect authentication that ignores existing workflows, elegant APIs that break integration patterns. Join the Agentic AI ProServe Experience team to explore solutions to this "blindfolded coding agent" challenge. Through live coding with Amazon Q and Kiro, learn how to organize knowledge for maximum effectiveness: foundational principles, systematic workflows, automated quality gates, and real-time data access. Watch us build these knowledge artifacts live, incorporating lessons from real customer scenarios.

title: Building Sovereign Cloud Environments
abstract: As organizations scale their operations globally, they need to meet evolving data residency, security, compliance, and business continuity requirements. This session explores how AWS Control Tower and Landing Zone Accelerator on AWS support key sovereignty requirements, including country-specific compliance frameworks, regional service selection, automated controls for data movement, and cross-border transfers. Through real-world examples, the session demonstrates how organizations can leverage AWS to implement country-specific security controls, maintain operational consistency across multi-region deployments, accelerate cloud compliance, and deploy automated security and compliance at scale.

title: Building sovereign LLMs: Best practice from national-scale deployments
abstract: As governments around the world accelerate efforts to build sovereign large language models (LLMs), challenges around architecture, scalability, and localization are front and center. This chalk talk dives into best practices for training, fine-tuning, and deploying domain-specific models at scale. We'll explore how national AI initiatives are leveraging AWS services to build models tailored to local language and regulatory requirements, with a focus on language specialization, data sovereignty, and responsible AI. Reference use cases from public-sector LLM projects will be discussed to highlight practical strategies and lessons learned.

title: Building The Enterprise Data Success Framework
abstract: This strategic session introduces enterprise leaders to modern data-sharing architectures within the AWS ecosystem. Through carefully curated examples and architectural discussions, participants will explore proven approaches for transforming organizational data practices. The session examines key elements of successful data democratization, including governance frameworks, security controls, and scalable infrastructure patterns. Designed for business and technology leaders new to cloud platforms, this blueprint provides actionable insights for implementing effective cross-organizational data sharing while maintaining enterprise-grade security and compliance.

title: Building the Future Trading Platform leveraging AI and AWS (sponsored by Cognizant)
abstract: LPL Financial is one of the fastest growing Broker Dealers, with an aim to grow their client base exponentially leading them to build a future ready Trading Platform. To build a futuristic Trading platform, know how can they integrate advanced technologies like artificial intelligence (AI), leverage microservices and cloud infrastructure, and plan for disruptive innovations. A modular, globally-focused Trading Platform that simplifies complex workflows will be critical to staying competitive in this Era of AI. The platform building adopts futuristics vision ensuring Scalability, Stability and resilience. This presentation is brought to you by Cognizant, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Building the Future Trading Platform leveraging AI and AWS (sponsored by Cognizant)

title: Building tomorrow's AI applications at scale with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: 2025 has been the breakout year for autonomous AI systems, with "vibe coding" and specialized assistants disrupting trillion-dollar industries. Amazon Bedrock empowers startups to rapidly prototype intelligent applications and seamlessly scale from proof-of-concept to production systems serving millions. We will share architectural patterns and startup-friendly resources, featuring live demos from a cutting-edge coding startup showcasing their complete journey—from rapid MVP development to handling production traffic at scale, including specific Bedrock capabilities, cost optimization strategies, and startup support programs that enabled their multi-model AI vision without enterprise-level infrastructure investments.

title: Building Trust in AI Agents: Automated Evaluation at Scale
abstract: Transform Agent and RAG evaluation from manual spot-checks to automated CI/CD workflows with Haystack's orchestration framework. Learn how to build robust evaluation pipelines that assess Agent capabilities across reasoning, tool use, and task completion, while supporting statistical metrics and LLM-based judgment. We'll demonstrate implementing error-resilient workflows that leverage interaction traces, and handle non-deterministic evaluation methods. Perfect for teams deploying AI agents who need automated quality assurance pipelines to maintain production reliability and catch potential failure modes.

title: Building vertical AI agent blueprints in financial services
abstract: Financial institutions seek to build specialized AI agents for tasks ranging from fraud detection to algorithmic trading, while maintaining regulatory compliance. In this chalk talk, we'll collaboratively design agent architectures using AWS’s AI capabilities and Amazon Bedrock. We'll walk through patterns for vertical financial agents and horizontal cross-domain capabilities, exploring how LangGraph, CrewAI, and Strands Agents enable sophisticated workflow orchestration. This session provides blueprints for accelerating AI implementation in financial services through reusable, production-ready agent patterns that deliver measurable business outcomes.

title: Building Well-Architected agentic AI applications
abstract: The rapid evolution of generative AI agent development demands robust architectural practices for security and compliance. This chalk talk explores proven patterns for architecting secure, efficient AI agents using the AWS Well-Architected Generative AI Lens. Through collaborative discussion and whiteboarding, examine architectural governance and best practices for production environments. Learn to design agent architectures incorporating guardrails, monitoring systems, access controls, and sustainable deployment practices. Gain actionable insights for building secure, efficient, and cost-effective agentic AI applications that scale.

title: Building Well-Architected solutions: A generative AI approach
abstract: Learn how generative AI transforms solution architecture through AI-driven design of Well-Architected solutions. Master techniques for creating cloud architectures that align with the six Well-Architected pillars through AI assistance. Explore practical approaches to rapidly prototype, validate, and optimize architectural decisions at scale. Through hands-on exercises, discover how generative AI accelerates the creation of resilient, secure, and cost-effective architectures. Experience real-time demonstrations of AI-powered architectural design and optimization.

title: Building with Elastic MCP and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore (sponsored by Elastic)
abstract: Agentic AI is here and is set to revolutionize how we autonomously complete tasks and accelerate application development. Elastic, in collaboration with AWS, is at the forefront of this emerging technology. This session will cover how developers can accelerate the creation of AI agents using native Elastic tools like semantic search, hybrid search, and ES|QL and create an intelligent query layer exposed through MCP. We’ll cover the underlying vector database capabilities that power these tools, best practices for agent prompt design, evaluating agent performance beyond traditional metrics, and how developers can use Elasticsearch with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. This presentation is brought to you by Elastic, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Building with Elastic MCP and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore (sponsored by Elastic)

title: Building workflows of your choosing: agents, copilots, and everything in between (sponsored by Tines)
abstract: Agents in Tines are powerful enablers you build in the context of your workflows. We believe that agentic workflows are part of the future, but not the whole picture. Come by this session to see how to blend agentic, deterministic, and human-in-the-loop workflows for your infrastructure management and AI governance needs. Reduce the friction involved in managing AI at scale with AWS for your infrastructure and Tines for your AI orchestration. This presentation is brought to you by Tines, an AWS Partner.

title: Building your data protection strategy with governance controls
abstract: Organizations face significant operational challenges when managing data perimeters and enforcing consistent security configurations across multiple AWS accounts. This interactive session explores an effective data protection strategy using governance policies and controls. We'll work through real-world scenarios demonstrating how to prevent unauthorized access, enforce security policies, and maintain consistent resource configurations at scale. Discover how authorization and management policies work together to create automated controls for your organization's data.

title: Building your first event driven application
abstract: Create a real-world event-driven retail system in this hands-on builders' session using Amazon EventBridge, AWS Lambda, and Amazon DynamoDB. Learn how asynchronous event patterns help you build faster and more scalable retail applications. Through guided exercises, you'll discover how event-driven architectures allow systems to handle multiple operations concurrently while maintaining loose coupling between services. By the end of this session, you'll have hands-on experience building event-driven architectures that you can apply to your own projects. You must bring your laptop to participate

title: Build Intelligent Media Workflows with Agentic AI
abstract: This workshop demonstrates how to enhance video processing workflows using agentic AI on AWS. Building upon last year's video understanding workshop, we'll show how to transform traditional orchestration steps into intelligent, agent-driven processes using Strands Agent SDK and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Participants will learn to implement agentic systems that improve metadata generation and content analysis for both video on-demand (VOD) and live scenarios, and how to apply intelligent workflows to archived content. Through hands-on exercises, attendees will gain experience in building agentic systems that improve content discovery, automate media operations, and enable new monetization opportunities.

title: Build, manage and govern AI agents from one place (sponsored by IBM)
abstract: Orchestrate multi-agent systems that work across AI platforms and automate complex workflows. This presentation is brought to you by IBM, an AWS Partner.

title: Build Media Workflows with Natural Language Using Strands Agents SDK
abstract: In this hands-on session you will develop a flexible media workflow creation tool using the Strands SDK and AWS Elemental Media Services. Attendees will learn how the creation, management, and troubleshooting of complex media workflows can be streamlined leveraging Strands Agents and Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. You will walk away with hands on experience developing a tool capable of generating optimized deployment configurations of production-ready solutions for use in streaming media. Perfect for media professionals and systems architects, this session will show you how you can leverage agentic AI to orchestrate and manage complex media workflows at scale.

title: Build modern applications with Amazon Aurora DSQL
abstract: As organizations modernize applications for scalability and agility, database architecture becomes crucial. This session explores Amazon Aurora DSQL, a serverless, distributed SQL database for next-generation workloads. Learn to build modern serverless applications using Amazon Aurora DSQL with Amazon API Gateway and AWS Lambda. Examine performance characteristics, scaling behavior, and cost considerations, along with current limitations. Gain insights on choosing Amazon Aurora DSQL for modernization efforts, comparing it to alternatives like Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon Aurora Serverless v2.

title: Build modern data applications with the lakehouse architecture on AWS
abstract: Transform your organization's data landscape and eliminate silos in this hands-on workshop with Amazon SageMaker lakehouse architecture. Learn to unify data management across data lakes, data warehouses, and federated data sources with zero-ETL integrations. Through practical exercises, discover how to create a single source of truth while maintaining security and governance across your entire data estate. You'll implement real-time analytics, optimize query performance, and design scalable architectures. Perfect for data engineers, ML practitioners, and solution architects looking to modernize their data infrastructure.

title: Build more effective agents through model customization
abstract: ​Agentic applications interpret inputs and take actions within a customer’s enterprise environment, and model customization enables agents that understand the business and provides responses or actions that are appropriate for the use case. In this session, we will cover recent advancements like Nova customization on SageMaker AI and on-demand inferences on custom models, which lower the cost and effort needed for model customization. Explore customization techniques available through available recipes, walk through how you can enjoy the same low on-demand inference prices with your custom models, and learn how custom Nova models improve the price-performance for agentic use cases.

title: Build Multi-Agent Collaboration using Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Learn to implement collaborative AI systems using Amazon Bedrock's multi-agent architecture. Create specialized agents and a supervisor agent to orchestrate complex tasks.  Build an intelligent system that can effectively distribute workloads, manage parallel processing, and coordinate between specialized agents for enhanced problem-solving capabilities. Ideal for developers building Agentic AI applications requiring coordinated agent interactions.

title: Build multi-modal AI agents with Strands Agents and Amazon S3 Vectors
abstract: The open-source Strands Agents SDK enables building production-ready, multi-agent AI systems in a few lines of code. The session demonstrates creating custom tools for video content analysis and converting them into Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Live code examples show how to implement scalable chat memory with Amazon S3 Vectors, from local development to enterprise production. Developers will learn how agents maintain context across conversations and provide personalized responses through efficient memory storage and retrieval.

title: Build observable AI agents with Strands, AgentCore, and Datadog (sponsored by Datadog)
abstract: Operational visibility is essential for running AI agents in production. It turns opaque LLM behavior into measurable, improvable workflows. In this session, we’ll walk through building a Strands-based agent, deploying it on Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, and processing telemetry with Datadog LLM Observability. You’ll see end-to-end traces across prompts, tool calls, and multi-agent interactions; improve response quality; tune performance and cost; and apply security and privacy guardrails. Leave with best practices and a runnable reference for production. This presentation is brought to you by Datadog, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Build observable AI agents with Strands, AgentCore, and Datadog (sponsored by Datadog)

title: Build Once, Run Everywhere: Multi-Architecture in Your CI/CD Pipelines
abstract: Building your containers to run on both x86 and AWS Graviton can help you optimize costs, improve performance, reduce your carbon footprint, and support local development on newer laptops. In this chalk talk, we'll take a web application built for x86, understand what it takes to run it on Graviton, then build a multi-architecture container image that allows you to run on the platform of your choice. We will demonstrate how to integrate that process in popular CI/CD systems like ArgoCD, GitLab, and GitHub.

title: Build production-ready AI solutions with Claude in Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Interested in enterprise-grade AI development? Using Claude via Amazon Bedrock and other AWS AI services, you will learn to design, implement, and scale Bedrock-powered applications following AWS best practices for security, reliability, and cost optimization. This hands-on session explores Bedrock API integration, prompt engineering, robust architectures, context management, throttling limits, performance optimization, and monitoring with CloudWatch. From prototyping to production deployment, you'll gain practical skills building real-world AI solutions leveraging Bedrock's managed foundation models that meet enterprise requirements. Ideal for developers, solutions architects, and technical decision-makers who have a basic knowledge of Python and are familiar with the AWS console.

title: Build production-ready Generative AI Applications on AWS
abstract: Learn to build enterprise-scale generative AI applications focused on delivering business value. Learn essential practices for data governance, security, and scalability while implementing production-ready AI solutions. Gain practical experience with deployment frameworks, observability tools, and strategic approaches to accelerate AI adoption in enterprise environments.

title: Build protection and optimize costs using Amazon EBS Snapshots
abstract: Learn to protect Amazon EBS volumes while reducing long-term data retention costs using EBS Snapshots. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to script data protection workflows using EBS direct APIs for faster, more cost-effective backups. Explore the EBS Snapshots Archive tier which can achieve up to 75% savings in snapshot storage costs. Through guided exercises, configure encryption, access controls, and data security management for your EBS resources. Build practical strategies for balancing protection and cost optimization in your storage environment.

title: Build ransomware data recovery with AWS Backup logically air-gapped vaults
abstract: This workshop showcases the advanced data protection capabilities of AWS Backup, focusing on AWS Backup logically air-gapped vaults, AWS Backup restore testing, and AWS Backup Audit Manager. Work through the entire backup lifecycle while implementing robust, compliant backup strategies. Through hands-on exercises, learn to deploy AWS Backup's advanced features to build resilient backup and recovery solutions centered around three pillars: immutability with isolation, integrity validation, and predictable availability.

title: Build real-time applications AWS Amplify
abstract: Learn how to create applications that use real-time updates to improve user engagement. In this workshop, you will build a multiplayer game with real-time updates and a live leaderboard. Use AWS Amplify to connect an application frontend to a serverless backend. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Build real-time full-stack Generative AI applications
abstract: Generative AI is transforming user experiences with real-time, context-aware applications. This session shows how to build full-stack Generative AI apps that combine modern web front ends with scalable, serverless backends. Through live demos and code, learn how to deliver grounded AI responses, maintain conversational context, and enable real-time interactivity. Explore practical design patterns and architecture strategies that support responsible AI practices like transparency and monitoring. The session provides patterns for deploying intelligent, responsive applications at scale.

title: Build reliable agents: Real-time insights with AgentCore Observability
abstract: Build customer trust by implementing comprehensive monitoring and debugging for your AI applications. In this hands-on session, you will be able to work with AWS experts to gain complete visibility into agent behavior, track key performance metrics, and quickly identify and resolve issues using OpenTelemetry-based tracing and CloudWatch dashboards. Learn to implement production-grade observability that helps maintain high reliability and performance standards. Through hands-on exercises, master rich metadata tagging and trace filtering techniques. Leave with the practical knowledge to confidently operate, debug, and maintain AI agents in production, ensuring consistent quality and reliability for your users.

title: Build resilient distributed systems through comprehensive testing
abstract: Resilience testing in distributed systems is often perceived as too costly for early development stages. Drawing from AWS service experience, this technical session demonstrates how to establish and validate high resilience standards from day one. Developers will learn fault injection techniques, load testing strategies, and full-scale system testing methodologies. The presentation covers conducting resilience threat analysis, establishing system invariants, and defining performance contracts. Real-world examples of multi-region failures and experiments provide actionable insights for building highly resilient services that maintain durability, correctness, and availability.

title: Build Resilient SaaS: Multi-Account Resilience Testing Patterns
abstract: Enterprise SaaS providers face increasing pressure to maintain high availability while preventing failures from spreading across tenant boundaries. Learn how leading ISVs use AWS Fault Injection Service to validate their multi-tenant architecture's resilience through controlled reslience testing experiments. We'll explore real-world examples from Security and HR tech providers who test cross-account failure scenarios while maintaining strict tenant isolation. Discover patterns for implementing resilience testing that strengthen your SaaS architecture without risking customer availability.

title: Build safe and resilient deployment pipelines for Amazon ECS
abstract: Learn how to build production ready CI/CD pipelines for Amazon ECS that prioritize safety and resilience through this interactive lightning talk. We'll showcase rolling deployment strategies that minimize service disruption and blue green deployments that enable zero downtime releases with instant rollback capabilities. You'll learn practical ways to build deployment safeguards, automate rollbacks, and monitor releases to ensures, your containerized applications deploy safely.

title: Build, Scale, and Optimize Agentic AI on CPUs with AWS Graviton
abstract: Do you want to build production-grade scalable and cost efficient Agentic AI applications? You can leverage Graviton's performance, cost efficiency, and sustainability for deploying up to 80% of an AI/ML pipeline. In this workshop, you�ll use EKS and Karpenter to deploy an end-to-end Agentic AI application all on Graviton. Start by setting up LLM Inference services followed by building Strands SDK based multi-agent AI systems. Next, learn how to leverage Graviton's price performance for MCP Servers and VectorDB. Finally, you�ll build a simple chat application that interacts with the end-to-end system and highlights the advantages of Graviton.

title: Build secure and scalable agentic AI workflows on Amazon ECS
abstract: Ever wondered how to take your AI agents from experimental notebooks to production? Join us to discover how Amazon ECS and AWS Fargate can transform autonomous AI workflows into resilient, production-grade applications. We'll dive into proven patterns for deploying frameworks like LangGraph and Strands, showing you how to leverage ECS's native capabilities for environment isolation, load balancing, and auto-scaling. You'll learn established patterns for integrating with Amazon Bedrock and understand key architecture decisions that matter. Whether you're a developer or architect, you'll walk away with practical insights for building scalable AI agent infrastructure.

title: Build self-healing supply chains with agentic AI
abstract: Agentic AI enables new possibilities for automating business processes captured in unstructured data. Join this session to learn how you can turn SOP documents and other organizational learnings into automated workflows and see the time savings and productivity increases this can help you can achieve. We’ll show you the way to self-healing operations in your supply chain using agentic technology, so you can thrive in today’s chaotic business environment and overcome the challenges thrown at you every day.

title: Build serverless chatbots using Amazon ElastiCache & Aurora PostgreSQL
abstract: In this session, learn how to build a serverless-first chatbot application by leveraging Amazon Aurora as a vector store and Amazon ElastiCache Serverless for Valkey to manage chat history. Discover how to harness these services to create contextually aware, scalable chatbots that retain conversational memory across interactions. Explore architectural patterns, implementation strategies, and real-world use cases. Along the way, gain insights into optimizing query latency, performance, and cost-effectiveness across the stack. Whether you’re a developer, architect, or decision-maker, this session equips you with the practical knowledge to build modern, serverless-powered chatbot applications using generative AI.

title: Build Streaming Analytics Dashboards in Minutes with Amazon Q Developer
abstract: Transform video streaming observability using Amazon Q Developer to auto-generate sophisticated analytics dashboards. In this hands-on session, you'll use natural language prompts to create an Amazon Cloud Development Kit (CDK) application that processes Amazon CloudFront logs through Amazon Kinesis and Amazon Athena, visualizing the data in Amazon Managed Grafana. Deploy a complete solution that tracks ASN distribution, device types, and common media client data (CMCD) as well as quality of experience (QoE) metrics. You'll leave with practical experience in building automated streaming analytics and a working dashboard you can adapt for your own needs.

title: Build trust in AI with end-to-end data lineage in Amazon SageMaker Catalog
abstract: Before you can trust data for AI and analytics, you need to know where it came from, how it was transformed, and how it’s being used. In this session, learn how Amazon SageMaker Catalog provides automated data lineage that gives visibility into a dataset’s full journey across AWS services as well as non-AWS OpenLineage-compatible events. See how lineage helps data producers, analysts, and data scientists evaluate data quality, trace dependencies, and make informed decisions with confidence. We’ll walk through practical examples of how lineage accelerates collaboration, supports governance, and ensures teams are always working with the right data.

title: Build trust in your data with Amazon SageMaker Catalog
abstract: In this hands-on workshop, discover how to leverage Amazon SageMaker Catalog to establish robust data governance with quality data and lineage tracking for your organization. Gain practical experience in setting up data quality jobs, implementing automated validation processes, and exploring comprehensive data cataloging features. Work with datasets in Amazon Redshift and AWS Glue, integrating various data sources and data processing engines like dbt and Apache Airflow for a holistic view of your data ecosystem and its origins. Leave equipped to maintain high data quality standards and improved data understanding across your organization.

title: Build trustworthy AI applications with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails
abstract: Discover how Automated Reasoning checks in Amazon Bedrock Guardrails enhance the trustworthiness of AI applications. In this workshop, we will showcase the synergy between automated reasoning and generative AI to create highly reliable systems, delivering up to 99% verification accuracy. Through hands-on exercises, learn to use the Automated Reasoning checks console and APIs to create and refine policies, then use them to validate your AI application outputs. Dive into a customer support assistant use case that combines various Amazon Bedrock features, including Knowledge Bases, Flows, and Guardrails, to deliver robust and trustworthy solutions.

title: Build ultra-low latency ad workloads with unmatched cost-performance
abstract: With the growth of digital media, including streaming video and retail media, customers that operate advertising platforms need to buy, sell, deliver, and measure millions of ad transactions per second while meeting stringent latency requirements. In this workshop, you will learn how to run ultra-low latency advertising workloads, transact with partners across a global community, and optimize against increasingly fragmented data signals and media channels. Push the boundaries of advertising platforms with AWS Graviton Processors, Amazon Elastic Container Service, and Amazon EC2 Spot Instances while optimizing cost-performance.

title: Build useful, reliable agents with Amazon Nova
abstract: Some of the most important enterprise work still happens in the browser—reviewing data in partner portals, filling out internal forms, navigating supplier websites, or gathering insights from online dashboards. These tasks are often manual, repetitive, and hard to scale. In this session, you’ll learn how to use Nova for web browser automation to enable systems to interact with websites just like a human by completing complex tasks like multi-element form filling. You’ll hear about how early enterprise customers are turning time-consuming processes into streamlined, reliable agent workflows to accelerate service delivery.

title: Build Virtual Engineering Workbenches for SDV with AWS Marketplace
abstract: Experience how a curated collection of AWS Marketplace solutions can reduce automotive software development cycles by up to 80%. In this hands-on workshop, learn to leverage a new AWS solution guidance that combines validated development tools, virtual targets, and pre-configured environments from AWS Marketplace to accelerate software-defined vehicle (SDV) development. Using in-vehicle infotainment (IVI) as an example, you'll create a virtual engineering workbench that integrates GenAI-powered tools, automated build pipelines, and partner solutions available through AWS Marketplace. Learn best practices for selecting, deploying, and combining marketplace offerings to create a seamless development environment.

title: Build your agentic operating system with Slack (sponsored by Slack from Salesforce)
abstract: Learn how to build your agentic operating system with Slack. Integrate your tech stack by bringing in your apps, data, and agents into one conversational interface with 2600+ apps on the Slack Marketplace and build your own Slack apps. In this session, you’ll see how to create your own Slack app using the Slack CLI and our APIs. This presentation is brought to you by Slack from Salesforce, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Build your agentic operating system with Slack (sponsored by Slack from Salesforce)

title: Build your own AI-Driven Industrial Automation System with Agentic AI
abstract: In this session, learn to build an Agentic AI system using MCP server and tools for industrial automation. You'll develop an AI solution that interprets Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs), generates code for platforms like Siemens TIA and Beckhoff TwinCAT, and manages deployments across your automation infrastructure. Using AWS IoT SiteWise, your system will to automatically connect to PLCs for data management. The system will handle virtual commissioning and managing hybrid scenarios, and will automatically update P&ID diagrams, PLC code, and hardware configurations. Through hands-on exercises, you'll develop a functional Agentic workflow ready for immediate implementation in industrial environments.

title: Build your own GenAI app on Amazon EKS with Amazon FSx and accelerated compute
abstract: Dive into the world of GenAI in this workshop where you will build a GenAI chatbot that you can use for Q&A and documentation summarization. You will deploy an AWS GenAI stack using AWS Inferentia for accelerated compute, Amazon FSx for Lustre for model caching, and Amazon EKS for orchestration. This GenAI stack will power the vLLM inference engine and open source Large Language Model that you will deploy. This session will equip you with the knowledge to build self-hosted GenAI workflows optimized for performance, scalability and operational efficiency. Kubernetes experience is recommended, and participants need a laptop for this session.

title: Build your own high performance kernel on AWS Trainium with NKI
abstract: Dive deep into AWS Trainium's Neuron Kernel Interface (NKI) and unlock its potential for high-performance machine learning. This session explores hardware foundations, kernel basics, and advanced techniques for optimizing ML workloads. Learn to leverage profiling tools, benchmarking strategies, and distributed computing capabilities and gain insights from real-world applications. Whether you're a ML engineer, researcher, or performance enthusiast, discover how to harness Trainium's power for your next-gen AI projects.

title: BYOK: The Key to Meeting Enterprise SaaS Security Demands
abstract: Software providers face increasing pressure from enterprise customers demanding greater control over their data protection and sovereignty. This session demonstrates how ISVs can leverage AWS KMS and client-side encryption to implement robust customer-managed key capabilities. We'll explore architectural patterns, implementation challenges, and best practices that help software providers meet enterprise security requirements while maintaining operational efficiency. Cloud architects and security professionals at software providers (ISVs) will learn how to enhance their platform's security posture and create a competitive advantage in the enterprise market.

title: Byte to insight: Maximize value from your logs with Amazon CloudWatch
abstract: Businesses often struggle with too many logs and not enough actionable insights. In this session, we'll explore the full log data lifecycle, from ingestion to insights, and uncover concrete strategies to extract maximum value using the latest Amazon CloudWatch Logs capabilities. Learn practical techniques to optimize log data for cost-effectiveness and business impact. This isn't the CloudWatch of yesteryear - it's a transformed, customer-centric observability platform that can revolutionize how you manage and leverage log data.

title: Cache me if you can, Valkey edition
abstract:
This hands-on workshop explores practical caching with Valkey through three key use cases: database query optimization, session management, and real-time leaderboards. Participants will learn to cache expensive database operations, external API calls, and JSON configurations while building scalable session storage and dynamic leaderboards.
Beyond implementation, the workshop emphasizes critical caching challenges including cache invalidation, stampede prevention, memory management, and data consistency. Attendees will experience common pitfalls firsthand and learn proven strategies for cache warming, TTL optimization, and production monitoring.
Participants leave with working code examples, architectural patterns, and clear understanding of caching trade-offs they can immediately apply to their applications.

title: Caesars personalizes guest service at scale with AI-powered Amazon Connect
abstract: Customers today expect personalized and relevant service at every touchpoint in their journey. Hear from Caesars Entertainment about how their Digital Concierge leverages Amazon Connect to gain a 360-degree customer view — utilizing advanced analytics and AI-driven capabilities to centralize digital outbound campaigns, empower agents with unified experiences, and proactively engage customers. Walk away with insights on how to turn casual customers into passionate advocates through personalized interactions and streamlined operations.

title: Call the Amazon Q Business ChatSync API from a custom web application
abstract: Join this Builders session to learn more about the Amazon Q Business ChatSync API. Hear how to configure Amazon Cognito as a trusted token issuer, and then how your application can obtain an STS token to assume a role that calls the ChatSync API. Watch a demonstration of how a server-side Python script can call the ChatSync API when triggered by events in your front-end application, such as on page loads. And finish by understanding how a front-end application can upload a PDF to a server-side Python script that calls the ChatSync API to return a document summary.

title: Can your model keep a secret? How to measure the privacy of your model
abstract: Understand the fundamentals of data privacy for generative and traditional AI systems in this expert-level chalk talk. Get acquainted with formal notions of differential privacy, its interpretations in terms of keeping your training data safe, and how this can be achieved practically. Learn a basic taxonomy of privacy breaches and what these mean in practice.  Explore how to audit the privacy of generative models efficiently and quickly. Leave with practical guidelines, code, and references on how to measure privacy risks on an ongoing basis.

title: Capability-first architecture: Bridging business intent to technology
abstract: With 200+ AWS services and a growing ecosystem of third-party solutions, making the right architectural choices can feel overwhelming. This session introduces a capability-first approach for moving from business goals to technology choices in a structured manner. Through practical examples, learn how this methodology narrows the solution space and keeps architectures adaptable to change. Discover how to make strategic, capability-aligned decisions that scale with your business, whether designing new solutions or refactoring legacy systems.

title: Capital One: Building resilient systems by engineering for five nines
abstract: 99.999% availability—less than five minutes of downtime per year—is the gold standard for mission-critical applications. This session dives deep into architectural strategies to achieve such availability using AWS. We'll explore fault-tolerant patterns such as multi-Region deployments, active-active failover, circuit breakers, bulkheads, chaos testing, and event-driven designs. Learn how services like Amazon S3, Amazon DynamoDB Global Tables, and AWS Lambda can eliminate single points of failure. We’ll cover SLAs, SLOs, and engineering observability and automation to detect and respond to failures within milliseconds. Case studies and practical design guidance make this session ideal for architects and engineers building for extreme reliability.

title: CCC Intelligent Solutions Achieves Major Savings with Oracle to AWS PostgreSQL (sponsored by Cognizant)
abstract: CCC Intelligent Solutions (CCC), a leading digital solutions provider for the insurance and automotive industries, successfully migrated their critical databases from Oracle to PostgreSQL, leveraging AWS RDS and Aurora PostgreSQL. This strategic move eliminated Perpetual Unlimited License Agreement (PULA) cost and generated additional savings on a monthly basis. The migration involved massive, highly transactional databases, with one critical database reaching 170TB in size. The 15-month project involved massive, highly transactional databases (more than 15 Oracle databases), including a critical 170TB database supporting 80% of their workloads. This presentation is brought to you by Cognizant, an AWS Partner.

session.title: CCC Intelligent Solutions Achieves Major Savings with Oracle to AWS PostgreSQL (sponsored by Cognizant)

title: Cell-based architectures: From connected vehicles to enterprise systems
abstract: Connected vehicle platforms demonstrate how cell-based architectures solve challenges of massive device access, data surges, and latency-sensitive workloads. Learn how this architectural pattern extends beyond automotive to transform smart cameras, monitoring systems, solar management, and SaaS platforms. Through practical examples using AWS IoT Core, Amazon MSK, Amazon EKS with Graviton, Amazon Aurora, and Amazon MemoryDB for Redis, discover how to implement fault isolation, scalable deployments, and localized edge services. This session provides architectural patterns for building resilient connected systems that maintain performance at scale across diverse industries.

title: Centralize Multicloud Management using AWS
abstract: Operating in a multicloud environment can introduce operational complexity. In this session, learn to streamline operations with AWS Systems Manager, which allows for easier instance management across all environments. Gain insights into performance with Amazon CloudWatch and Amazon Managed Grafana, which delivers a unified dashboard of metrics and logs from any data source. With these services, you can simplify day-to-day tasks, maintain control, and optimize resources; whether your workloads span AWS, on-premises, or multiple clouds. Take the complexity out of multicloud and focus on what really matters—running your business.

title: Chaos & Continuity: Using Gen AI to improve humanitarian workload resilience
abstract: Almost everyone has experienced a bad IT day, where systems failed in unpredictable ways, but for organizations operating in humanitarian crisis contexts continuity is mission critical. Amazon’s CTO, Werner Vogels, has said: “Everything fails, all the time, so plan for failure and nothing fails”. Building resilient systems can be hard, and understanding the ways a system might fail can be challenging. However, generative AI can help in identifying gaps in your resilience posture. In this chalk talk, builders will see how they can leverage generative AI to better prepare for tomorrow’s disaster. You’ll leave with the tools, skills, and knowledge so your workloads are unaffected by future failures.

title: Chaos detective: Deploy generative AI-powered troubleshooting agents
abstract: When chaos strikes your cloud infrastructure, rapid incident response becomes critical for financial institutions. In this chalk talk, learn how to create a generative AI-powered troubleshooting agent that investigates and diagnoses system failures in real-time. Together, we'll design patterns using Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock to interpret observability metrics and logs during critical incidents. Explore architectural approaches for prompt engineering, agent design, and system resilience. Leave with proven patterns for building GenAI agents that transform infrastructure troubleshooting—from initial detection through automated resolution.

title: Chaos engineering workshop
abstract: This workshop introduces AWS Fault Injection Service (FIS) for running resilience experiments, also known as chaos engineering. You'll learn how to inject faults and apply test scenarios, such as power interruptions and cross-Region connectivity issues, to see how they affect the behavior of services like Amazon EKS, Amazon ECS, AWS Fargate, Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, and Amazon RDS. You'll also learn how to produce experiment reports required for compliance in regulated industries. You'll also learn how to use Amazon CloudWatch, AWS X-Ray, and Amazon CloudWatch RUM to gain key insights from your experiments.

title: Choose your own modernization adventure: From legacy to cloud-native
abstract: Unsure where to start modernizing your infrastructure and applications? This hands-on workshop guides you through the complete modernization journey—from application discovery and dependency mapping to selecting the right modernization path. Learn about migrating to EC2, containerizing with Amazon ECS/EKS for both Windows and Linux environments, and refactoring .NET code for Linux deployment. Discover how agentic AI accelerates code refactoring and infrastructure migration while implementing cloud-native best practices and infrastructure-as-code principles. Explore real-world scenarios to make informed modernization decisions. Bring your laptop for an interactive experience that will equip you with practical skills for your modernization initiatives.

title: Choosing the right AWS network connectivity option for your use case
abstract: Learn when to choose AWS Transit Gateway vs Cloud WAN for network connectivity, AWS Direct Connect vs Site-to-Site VPN for hybrid connections, and traditional networking vs application networking services like Amazon VPC Lattice. Make your decisions based on scale, complexity, security, and cost considerations. Through real-world scenarios, learn to match connectivity patterns to the right AWS service—whether you're connecting VPCs in single or multiple Regions, on-premises networks, or microservices. Walk away with practical architectural patterns to optimize your network connectivity strategy.

title: Choosing the right AWS storage service
abstract: AWS offers a range of storage services designed for different use cases - from migrating applications and backing up data to integrating cloud storage with on-premises applications, building data lakes, and developing cloud-native applications. Join this chalk talk to evaluate storage options and avoid service mismatches that can create unnecessary complexity. Work with AWS experts to understand which storage service best aligns with your workloads and application requirements, providing the flexibility to scale as needed. Leave with clear guidance on selecting the right AWS storage service for various scenarios and situations.

title: Claude 4 on AWS: Architecting Enterprise AI at Scale (sponsored by Anthropic)
abstract: Discover how the Claude 4 model family transforms enterprise AI on AWS via Amazon Bedrock. This technical deep dive covers breakthrough capabilities in complex reasoning and production deployments. Learn how to architect reliable agentic workflows with Claude's enhanced tool use, achieve 70% workflow reduction with Claude-powered agents, architect Claude with AWS services for production workloads, optimize across the Claude 4 model family and from real customer cases. Get blueprints, code samples, and frameworks to accelerate AI initiatives. For AI/ML engineers, architects, and leaders scaling Claude on AWS. This presentation is brought to you by Anthropic, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Claude 4 on AWS: Architecting Enterprise AI at Scale (sponsored by Anthropic)

title: Climbing the AI Mountain With Your Security Team
abstract: Navigate the intersection of AI and security culture in this practical session. Learn how security teams can effectively embrace AI innovation through incremental steps and validation techniques. Using real-world examples, we'll demonstrate how security practitioners can adapt their skills to AI challenges regardless of their level of specialized expertise and share strategies for building security-aware AI practices. From understanding generative and agentic AI-specific security risks to creating engaging team exercises, discover how to transform security from a potential bottleneck into an enabler of responsible AI innovation. Attendees will leave with actionable insights for building a security-first approach to AI adoption.

title: Clinical Trials: AbbVie's Enterprise AI-Powered Document Creation Platform GAIA (sponsored by Accenture)
abstract: AbbVie's GAIA Platform is a novel enterprise document authoring solution. Beginning in R&D, GAIA is successfully generating clinical documents, reducing manual writing effort by up to 80%.  GAIA is fully integrated to data sources and applies AI to produce high-quality, accurate, human-in-the-loop, GxP-ready outputs with a single click. AbbVie leaders will share their journey, discussing the evolution from traditional AI to the use of genAI and agents. The presentation will highlight the impact of these advancements on AbbVie's goal to accelerate the end-to-end clinical process. This presentation is brought to you by Accenture, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Clinical Trials: AbbVie's Enterprise AI-Powered Document Creation Platform GAIA (sponsored by Accenture)
Clinical Trials: AbbVie's Enterprise AI-Powered Document Creation Platform GAIA (sponsored by Accenture)
Clinical Trials: AbbVie's Enterprise AI-Powered Document Creation Platform GAIA (sponsored by Accenture)
