title: Closing the gap between speed and safety: shipping faster at scale (sponsored by LaunchDarkly)
abstract: AI has enabled teams to ship software at an unprecedented rate, but safety around release practices hasn’t kept up. In this session, LaunchDarkly CEO Edith Harbaugh will explore how modern teams can use automated guardrails like progressive rollouts, real-time observability, and instant rollbacks to reduce release risks while shipping faster at scale. We’ll also highlight how these controls apply to AI-powered applications, where speed and safety are both critical. Edith will be joined by select LaunchDarkly customers to share how they’ve built cultures of velocity and confidence in software and AI delivery. This presentation is brought to you by LaunchDarkly, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Closing the gap between speed and safety: shipping faster at scale (sponsored by LaunchDarkly)

title: Cloud Application Security in the AI Era: Lessons from Adobe and Fortinet (sponsored by Fortinet)
abstract: AI and AI-based workloads are the new transformational effort and securing these modern web applications in the cloud requires a lot more than security gates.  In this session, Adobe and Fortinet share strategies and experience protecting AI-enabled applications, web APIs, and data.  Attendees will learn from Adobe’s cloud security experience, explore practical examples, and receive actionable guidance to strengthen their own cloud security posture. The session combines co-presented insights with audience Q&A for an engaging, interactive experience. This presentation is brought to you by Fortinet, an AWS Partner.

title: Cloud Foundations Accelerator
abstract: This session explores critical capabilities every new AWS customer should start with. We'll cover key services and best practices for security, cost management, and operational efficiency that complement Control Tower. Perfect for a new AWS customers creating their first account or looking to expand their AWS footprint. You'll leave with a clear roadmap for building a robust, scalable, and secure AWS Cloud Foundation.

title: Cloud-native Java on Amazon EKS
abstract: Learn how to build cloud-native Java applications based on best practices, and discover ways you can optimize application performance for  fast startup and efficient resource usage in containerized environments. In this builders' session, gain hands-on experience you will learn how to reduce memory overhead, lower cold start latency, and achieve sub-second startup times when building Java applications on Amazon EKS. You will also learn how to use Amazon Bedrock to analyze profiling and thread dump data to uncover performance patterns and generate optimization insights.

title: CMT: High-performance NLP & geospatial analysis with Redshift
abstract: This session explores how Cambridge Mobile Telematics (CMT) uses Amazon Redshift for large-scale geospatial and text data analysis. We'll discuss why CMT chose AWS and Redshift based on scalability and integration needs, highlighting how Redshift's geospatial solution using H3 functions enable efficient processing of billions of location records. The presentation demonstrates CMT's use of Redshift's NLP capabilities, featuring QEv2 and Vega for advanced ad-hoc reporting. Finally, we examine how Redshift's architecture delivers the optimal price-performance balance for CMT's demanding data operations.

title: COBOL to cloud: Accelerated refactoring with AWS Transform agentic AI
abstract: Experience the power of AWS Transform in this hands-on workshop. See how agentic AI revolutionizes mainframe modernization, cutting transformation timelines from years to months while minimizing risk. Work with AI-powered features that analyze complex mainframe codebases, extract business rules, generate documentation and transform COBOL into modern, maintainable Java .Through guided exercises, you’ll explore AWS Transform’s tools including automated code analysis, business rule extraction, decomposition, and AI-assisted refactoring. Learn proven techniques for testing, validating, and deploying your modernized applications. Walk away with hands-on experience in creating cloud-native applications that maintain functional equivalence while unlocking the full potential of AWS services.

title: Cochlear enhances contact center observability with Amazon Connect
abstract: Real-time visibility of contact center operations and customer interactions is critical to delivering excellent customer service. In this session, hear from Cochlear — the global leader in implantable hearing solutions — on how you can leverage Amazon Connect to observe and manage end-to-end customer experience operations, from forecasting contacts, to planning workforce schedules, to delivering human agent coaching, and beyond. Learn how Amazon Connect puts the power of AI in your hands to deliver end-to-end observability in your contact center.

title: Code completion to agents: The evolution of development
abstract: AI-powered coding agents are one of the most promising applications of generative AI. In this talk we will start from their humble beginnings as inline code completion tools and explain their evolution into sophisticated autonomous coding agents. Throughout the talk, we will ground our discussion in empirical evidence, presenting evaluations from public benchmarks that demonstrate the progressive improvements in each evolutionary stage. By walking through concrete examples and real-world applications, attendees will gain a comprehensive understanding of the current state of AI-powered development tools and insights into future directions in this rapidly advancing field.

title: Coding an MCP server for Amazon Aurora
abstract: Do you want to build an MCP server for your application running on Amazon Aurora where you control the access without handing full control to an LLM and the AI agents simply call it? In this code talk, learn about MCP servers, how they can help you, and key considerations to ensure you can safely and predictably enable LLMs to call it. See live coding firsthand and learn the code required to build a MCP that is designed to meet your requirements. Discover how you can integrate AI agents with MCP servers while ensuring secure database access.

title: Collaborate at scale: Architecting multi-agent systems with AgentCore
abstract: Many production AI applications require specialized agents working together: from agentic RAG systems that iteratively refine searches to enterprise workflows that decompose complex tasks. In this chalk talk, we'll explore proven multi-agent design patterns using AgentCore: hierarchical (orchestrator routing to specialists), collaborative (agents contributing complementary expertise), competitive (multiple agents proposing solutions), and peer-to-peer (resilient handoffs between agents). Through practical examples like multi-step research workflows and agentic RAG implementations, you'll learn how AgentCore handles complex multi-agent systems and state management while maintaining observability, security, latency, cost, and accuracy in production deployments.

title: Combat financial document fraud with a multi-agent system
abstract: Financial institutions face mounting pressure to combat increasingly sophisticated fraud attempts more efficiently. In this workshop, you will build a fraud detection system leveraging multiple AI agents using the Strands Agents SDK to detect fraud in financial documents. Dive deep into a multi-agent architecture where specialized AI agents work together to compare metadata across documents, detect AI-generated forgeries, validate regional formatting, match documents against legitimate document patterns, and cross-reference documents with public sources. Learn to deploy a multi-agent assistant supporting investigators through each step of the document verification process.

title: Commonwealth Bank of Australia reimagines modernization via agentic AI
abstract: Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA) revolutionizes legacy modernization using AWS Bedrock's agentic AI architecture. Their groundbreaking solution slashes application assessment time from 6 weeks to under 1 hour and reduces overall modernization cycles from 16 weeks to just 1 week. Through specialized AI agents, CBA automatically analyzes legacy code, detects vulnerabilities, and orchestrates complex transformations while maintaining strict banking compliance. Multi-agent workflows handle security assessments, cloud readiness analysis, and automated network flow implementations, enabling transformation of monolithic systems into cloud-native applications with unprecedented speed and precision.

title: Compact yet powerful: Exploring model distillation with AWS Trainium
abstract: In this builder's session, dive into the practical implementation of model distillation techniques using AWS Trainium instances and the Neuron SDK. Learn how to compress large language models into smaller, efficient versions while maintaining performance and accuracy. Through hands-on exercises, you will set up and optimize your environment for AWS Trainium, implement knowledge distillation using Neuron SDK, learn best practices for teacher-student model architecture design, and measure and compare model performance before and after distillation. This session is ideal for ML practitioners and developers who want to deploy efficient AI models at scale. Participants should have basic experience with PyTorch.

title: Compile blazing-fast MCP servers in Rust
abstract: Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers are commonly written in Python and JavaScript, producing applications that need npm, uv, and Docker to run. But what if you could compile your MCP server into a standalone binary without worrying about dependencies? This session explores the Rust MCP SDK, demonstrating how to build blazing-fast MCP servers that run anywhere. Learn how to transform your MCP implementations into optimized Rust solutions.

title: Compute innovation with the AWS Nitro System
abstract: Overview of AWS Nitro system and new compute innovations fueled by Nitro e.g. multi-host for smaller metal sizes, reduced blast radius, higher performance, how Nitro has helped us in accelerating the pace of innovation and deliver flex instances. Dive deep into Gen8 Intel/AMD instances.

title: Connecting Context to Performance: Real-World Enterprise Observability  (sponsored by Splunk)
abstract: Enterprises today run a complex mix of AWS, multicloud, hybrid environments, distributed offices, and legacy systems. Each creates visibility gaps making it harder to deliver reliable, high-performing digital services. In this session, learn how Splunk and Cisco are working together to simplify observability across the real-world enterprise. We’ll explore how organizations can cut through complexity, connect business context to technical performance, and build holistic visibility that spans infrastructure, applications, networks, and user experience. You’ll hear about recent innovations and get a look at what’s next as we continue to deliver new ways to manage complexity and improve resiliency at scale. This presentation is brought to you by Splunk, an AWS Partner.

title: Connecting Infor CloudSuite to AWS Services
abstract: Infor CloudSuite customers can extend their ERP capabilities by integrating with AWS-native services. This chalk talk walks through real integration patterns using Infor ION and AWS building blocks such as API Gateway, EventBridge, Lambda, and Kinesis. Learn how to enable real-time event processing, self-service analytics with QuickSight, and API-based business process automation. Ideal for architects and developers modernizing Infor ERP systems, this session highlights best practices and success stories using AWS for scalable, compliant ERP integration.

title: Connect to VPC resources with PrivateLink and VPC Lattice
abstract:
Amazon VPC Lattice is designed to simplify service-to-service connectivity at scale across accounts and VPCs with built-in layer 7 routing and policy . Similarly, AWS PrivateLink is designed to make it easier to connect services and resources across different AWS accounts and VPCs to simplify your network architectures. Recently we added capabilities to PrivateLink and VPC Lattice to simplify access to non-HTTP services helps further by eliminating the need of deploying network load balancers in the target VPCs.
We will explore which use cases can be addressed with this feature and discuss how these can be implemented with either PrivateLink or VPC Lattice.

title: Continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) for AWS
abstract: AWS provides one place where you can plan work, collaborate on code, and build, test, and deploy applications with continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) tools. In this session, learn about creating complete CI/CD pipelines using infrastructure as code on AWS.

title: Control humanoid robots and drones with voice and Agentic AI
abstract: Voice control in robotics has traditionally required intricate coordination between speech recognition, natural language processing, and response generation. This session demonstrates a project developed together with the Hong Kong Institute of Information Technology (HKIIT), showing how Agentic AI and speech-to-speech streaming can simplify voice control for humanoid robots, robot dogs, and drones. The presentation explores practical AWS-based architectures designed for efficient command processing, intent recognition, and robot control systems. Through live demonstrations, learn how to minimize latency while maintaining precision across diverse environments. Discover patterns for handling continuous speech input and coordinating responsive robot behavior in real-world scenarios.

title: Correlating compliance signals across AWS
abstract: Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) teams face the challenge of correlating compliance signals scattered across multiple locations both inside and outside of AWS. This interactive chalk talk explores how you can use the new zero-ETL in Amazon OpenSearch Service to eliminate data silos and enable comprehensive governance observability across your organization. You will learn about designing correlation workflows that directly query data from Amazon S3, including on-premises  and multi-cloud environments, without data movement or duplication. Walk away with actionable insights on real-world governance challenges including audit trail correlation, compliance violation detection, and security posture assessment

title: Cost-efficient AI model scaling with Amazon EKS on SageMaker HyperPod
abstract: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod accelerates AI model development by eliminating the undifferentiated heavy lifting involved in building and maintaining compute clusters powered by thousands of accelerators. Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) provides enhanced scalability and resiliency tooling to scale AI/ML workloads. Experience the hands-on setup of Kubernetes environments optimized for AI model development workloads in HyperPod. You'll use Amazon EKS alongside HyperPod task governance to implement robust resource allocation strategies that maximize NVIDIA GPU or AWS Trainium utilization, and leverage HyperPod observability capabilities to track EKS cluster and model development metrics in real-time, receive alerts when performance deteriorates, and automatically remediate issues using pre-defined policies.

title: Cost optimization for Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: Developers love building on powerful, serverless Amazon DynamoDB, and as their production tables grow in size and traffic, they want to discover what mechanisms and optimizations can be applied to reduce costs. Cost optimization can be done both in the design phase and during operations. In this chalk talk, learn how to model and measure costs and discover cost optimization tools that can help you along the way.

title: Cost Optimize your .NET workloads on AWS
abstract: Are you looking for better performance and lower cost for your .NET workloads? Learn how to accelerate migration of your .NET workloads from VMware or Windows to Linux on AWS, including the AWS Graviton processor. We will also show you how Amazon Q developer can assist you in your .NET workload migration to Graviton. Finally, this session will equip you with the best practices for benchmarking workloads and analyzing price performance gains from using on AWS.

title: Cracking the SMB Code: AI Sales That Redefine Travel Growth (sponsored by ZS)
abstract: The next big growth story in travel isn’t loyalty points or perks—it’s small and midsize businesses. Agile, underserved, and ready to spend, SMBs are tough to reach with traditional sales. In this session, United Airlines, AWS, and ZS reveal how an AI-led, digital-first Small Business Demand Center (SBDC) on AWS is transforming engagement. Explore day-in-the-life flows, the reference architecture powering them, and the operating model driving adoption. With real-world examples from United’s leadership, you’ll leave with a blueprint to personalize at scale, unlock an underpenetrated segment, and capture durable revenue growth. Join us to crack the SMB code. This presentation is brought to you by ZS, an AWS Partner.

title: Create advanced self-service experiences with Amazon Connect
abstract: Attend this hands-on workshop to learn how to effectively leverage Agentic AI in your self-service applications. This session will focus on building common self-service use cases with Amazon Q in Connect through the voice and chat channels including resolving personalized customer questions, fulfilling complex customer transactions, blend with structured AI where needed, and intelligently escalate to human agents. Through practical demonstrations and guided exercises, participants will gain hands-on experience implementing Amazon Q in Connect, learning best practices for prompt engineering, knowledge base integration, and creating seamless customer interactions.

title: Create an AWS DevOps AI Agent with the Strands Agents SDK
abstract: Build a comprehensive multi-agent AWS management system using the Strands Agents SDK and Amazon Bedrock. You will progress from creating specialized agents for different operational domains—including coding, monitoring, research, and resource management—to building a sophisticated multi-agent orchestrator that can handle complex requests like "Deploy a web application that displays our user data from DynamoDB with proper monitoring in place." Transform your manual, error-prone operational processes into an intelligent, conversational interface that reduces deployment time from hours to minutes while maintaining enterprise-grade reliability and security standards. Transform your manual, error-prone operational processes into an intelligent, conversational interface that reduces deployment time from hours to minutes while maintaining enterprise-grade reliability and security standards.

title: Create an intelligent banking agent using Aurora DSQL & MCP
abstract: Model Context Protocol (MCP) enables AI agents to communicate with data systems to retrieve data and perform tasks. Amazon Aurora DSQL is a serverless, highly-available relational database that enables multi-Region active-active architectures, making it perfect to support financial industry use cases, which require the highest levels of resilience and accuracy. In this session, you will build a banking AI agent application, allowing end users to fetch account balances, pay bills, and transfer money using natural language prompts, and leverage MCP to interact with a banking data set stored in Aurora DSQL. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Create a secure card management platform with AWS Payment Cryptography
abstract: Learn how to build a secure, PCI-DSS compliant card management platform using the AWS Payment Cryptography Service across multiple AWS Regions. Explore HSM-backed cryptographic operations for payment card data, reducing compliance scope and operational overhead. See demonstrations of key exchange between HSM vendors and AWS, implementation of P2PE, crypto material generation, and transaction authorization. Discover patterns for secure API design, localized deployment for data sovereignty, and disaster recovery. Ideal for financial institutions, payment processors, and enterprises, this session shows how to leverage AWS's global infrastructure to build secure, scalable card management solutions that meet stringent security requirements.

title: Create custom mainframe modernization with AWS and AWS partners
abstract: Master custom mainframe modernization with composable architecture. See how enterprise leaders are accelerating their modernization journeys by integrating specialized partner tools directly into AWS workflows. Two industry pioneers will demonstrate how they built tailored solutions to address their unique modernization challenges, dramatically accelerating timelines while reducing risk. Learn how this composable approach enables customized solutions for even the most complex mainframe environments, and discover how to craft your optimized modernization workflow using AWS integrated with trusted partner solutions.

title: Create hyper-personalized voice interactions with Amazon Nova Sonic
abstract: We've all experienced it—that moment when an AI assistant creates more problems than it solves because of its robotic responses and lack of contextual awareness. It operates in a vacuum, making customer experiences less than delightful. In this session, you will learn how to create meaningful and hyper-personalized customer experiences with Amazon Nova Sonic and design patterns to enable new use cases. You will discover how Amazon Nova Sonic's tool use and function calling capabilities enable integration with external APIs and internal and external data sources to provide context that makes for delightful voice-based customer interactions.

title: Create secure, production-ready code with Amazon Q Developer
abstract: In this workshop session, gain hands-on experience using Amazon Q Developer to create secure, production-ready code. Use agentic coding experience to automate unit tests, optimize code, and scan for vulnerabilities, and discover how Amazon Q Developer suggests remediations that help fix your code instantaneously. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Create voice-first applications with Amazon Nova Sonic
abstract: Amazon Nova Sonic is a speech-to-speech model built for real-time, human-like voice conversations. In this session, you'll learn how to build Voice-AI agents with advanced capabilities (such as paralinguistic detection, controllability, barge-in, and agent integrations), all while leveraging expanded language support and regional coverage to serve global audiences. AWS experts will demonstrate practical implementation strategies using the Bidirectional Stream API and share integration patterns with open-source frameworks such as LiveKit and Pipecat and AWS services to build end-to-end voice solutions. We'll explore architectural considerations for optimizing latency, cost, and performance scaling, and discuss best practices for designing voice experiences.

title: Create your own AI sidekick: a hands-on agent building workshop
abstract: Ever wanted your own agent? Using Strands, you'll build a personalized AI agent that can tackle tasks your way. This workshop goes beyond basic prompts to create an agent with personality and purpose. Through hands-on coding with Kiro you'll bring your AI assistant to life. Perfect for developers curious about practical agent development.

title: Creating multi-tenant data lakehouses for agentic SaaS environments
abstract: Data is king in agentic environments. Now, as we look at what it means to build multi-tenant agents, we must introduce tenant context into our overall agent data strategy. How data is onboarded, how it’s surfaced, how it’s secured—these are all factors that require specific multi-tenant strategies and constructs. This workshop explores how you'll implement a scalable multi-tenant agentic data platform using AWS SageMaker lakehouse architecture, highlighting multi-tenant strategies that shape data ingestion, isolation, and access controls. Additionally, you'll design secure multi-tenant data access patterns for your agentic SaaS application.

title: Crowning the Kiro code champions
abstract: The Kiro code challenge was a roaring success, with re:Invent attendees showcasing their creativity and coding prowess. Contestants used Kiro to design, build, and deploy innovative  applications. Join us as we unveil the top submissions and award the grand prize winners! From efficiency-boosting automations to delightful mini-apps, these champions have proved the power of Kiro. Prepare to be inspired as we celebrate the winners

title: Customer Insights: Scaling Real-World AI with AMD on AWS (sponsored by AMD)
abstract: Join a dynamic customer panel to hear how leading organizations are accelerating real-world AI workloads using AMD powered solutions on AWS. From generative AI and large language models to recommendation systems, panelists will share firsthand experiences deploying AMD’s latest technology in production. Learn how they’ve optimized performance, reduced costs, and scaled AI across their businesses. Whether you're exploring CPU-based inference or building next-gen platforms, this session offers practical insights and proven strategies from those already delivering results. This presentation is brought to you by AMD, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Customer Insights: Scaling Real-World AI with AMD on AWS (sponsored by AMD)

title: Customer Services Reinvention powered by AWS (sponsored by Accenture)
abstract: At Grupo Werthein in Latin America, Accenture are reinventing Customer Service with Generative AI powered by AWS. Our transformation enables up to 90% resolution through digital channels, delivering humanized and personalized customer interactions. By operating a cost-efficient, scalable technology ecosystem across all transformed digital touchpoints, we ensure continuous improvement, smarter processes, and seamless experiences. This reinvention not only enhances customer satisfaction but also drives operational efficiency and business value. AWS empowers us to reimagine the future of customer care — intelligent, efficient, and customer-first. This presentation is brought to you by Accenture, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Customer Services Reinvention powered by AWS (sponsored by Accenture)

title: Customer Story: AI Adoption with Salesforce & Amazon Bedrock (sponsored by Salesforce)
abstract: Learn how regulated industries use Anthropic on Amazon Bedrock in Agentforce to deploy secure, compliant AI agents, spotlighting our joint customer’s scale success. This presentation is brought to you by Salesforce, an AWS Partner.

title: Customize Amazon Nova in Amazon SageMaker AI for your business needs
abstract: Learn to build AI your way with customization techniques available on Amazon Nova. Discover flexible options to create tailored AI solutions, regardless of technical expertise. We'll present techniques to align model responses with your preferences, adapt models for specific tasks, or continuously train models on your proprietary data. See how you can leverage your business expertise and proprietary data to customize Nova models on Amazon SageMaker AI for your unique use cases. Join us to understand how Nova is making it possible to create AI that truly works for your business.

title: Customize Amazon Nova models for Agentic AI with SageMaker & Bedrock
abstract: This workshop covers advanced fine-tuning techniques like Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) and Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) using Amazon Nova recipes and Amazon SageMaker AI. Attendees will get hands-on experience with fine tuning, evaluate model performance with automated quantitative and qualitative evaluations, such as LLM-as-a-judge, deploy the models to Bedrock for integration into agentic applications using Strands SDK, and select appropriate fine-tuning strategies based on use case requirements

title: Customize Amazon Nova models for enhanced tool calling
abstract: Learn how to leverage Amazon SageMaker's training jobs with recipes to fine-tune Nova models using Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) and Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) techniques and seamlessly deploy them in Amazon Bedrock. This session demonstrates how to fine-tune Nova models for advanced tool-calling capabilities, enabling intelligent agents that can autonomously execute workflows by interfacing with multiple AWS services, custom APIs, and internal tools. Learn how to customize, evaluate, and deploy Nova models for production-ready agentic systems that can handle multi-step business processes while maintaining reliability and control.

title: Customize foundation models using Amazon SageMaker AI
abstract: Learn how to customize foundation models for your specific business needs. In this chalk talk, we'll explore different approaches including supervised fine-tuning, reinforcement fine-tuning, and model distillation. Discover when to use each method and how they complement each other. We'll demonstrate customization strategies using models like GPT-OSS and Amazon Nova, sharing best practices and decision frameworks. Perfect for technical decision-makers and practitioners looking to optimize foundation models for their unique use cases.

title: Customize GPT-OSS models on Amazon SageMaker AI for improved accuracy
abstract: Learn to customize OpenAI GPT-OSS models for your specific business requirements using Amazon SageMaker AI through Amazon SageMaker HyperPod recipes and open-source Hugging Face libraries. This session explores the solution architecture and provides a step-by-step demonstration of training workflows for multilingual reasoning tasks with SageMaker AI. It highlights built-in monitoring and evaluation with managed MLflow and showcases easy deployment to SageMaker inference endpoints. Join us to understand how this approach enables secure, scalable, and cost-effective adoption of GPT-OSS models for enterprise applications.

title: Customize & scale foundation models using Amazon SageMaker AI
abstract: Foundation models are able to solve a wide array of tasks, however to solve most tasks effectively, these models require some form of customization. In this session, you’ll learn about how you can get started with advanced customization of foundation models using SageMaker AI, while optimizing cost and performance. You’ll learn how you can use SageMaker AI for advanced techniques such as parameter-efficient fine-tuning, direct preference optimization, and reinforcement fine-tuning, for both proprietary as well as publicly available foundation models. You’ll walk away understanding how to use SageMaker AI to get the most value from your AI investments.

title: Customizing Llama Models for Code (sponsored by Meta)
abstract: This session delves into fine-tuning Llama models specifically for code generation and understanding tasks. Attendees will learn about the unique challenges and techniques involved in adapting language models to programming languages, including data preparation, model training, and deployment strategies. The session empowers developers to build customized, high-performance AI tools that enhance coding productivity and accuracy. This presentation is brought to you by Meta, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Customizing Llama Models for Code (sponsored by Meta)

title: Cut Costs with Aurora PostgreSQL & Babelfish
abstract: Ready to reduce database licensing costs as you begin your AWS journey? Discover how Babelfish for Aurora PostgreSQL revolutionizes the database modernization process by enabling SQL Server workloads to run with minimal code changes. We'll demonstrate how Babelfish understands T-SQL and SQL Server protocols, allowing your applications to connect seamlessly while you benefit from PostgreSQL's performance and cost advantages. Through detailed case studies, you'll see how new AWS customers achieved 70% or higher cost reduction while maintaining application functionality and performance. Learn practical assessment steps, migration approaches, and compatibility considerations essential for success.

title: Cyber Resilience on AWS, designing security and recovery strategies
abstract:
Cyber resilience is the ability of an organization to continuously deliver the intended outcome despite adverse cyber events. It has an overlap with disaster recovery where both cyber resilience and disaster recovery involve plans and actions to restore normal operations after an incident. Cyber resilience includes disaster recovery as part of its broader strategy.
There are multiple key themes when it comes to designing for cyber resilience:
- Protect: Proactive measures taken to safeguard systems, networks, and data.
- Prepare: Activities to ensure an organization can effectively respond to and recover from a cyber incident.
- Recover: Actions taken to restore systems, networks, and data to their normal state after a cyber incident.

title: Data analytics for financial organizations with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: In this hands-on workshop, learn how financial institutions can create value using Amazon SageMaker to build, scale, and govern end-to-end data analytics and ML workflows. Work with a banking usecase, covering customer segmentation, fraud detection, churn prediction, personalized communication and document processing. Experience how data analysts, data engineers and data scientists collaborate on one platform using purpose-built tools and integrated workflows.

title: Data architecture for multicloud environments
abstract: Organizations operating in multicloud environments with distributed data face challenges such as fragmented data governance, maintaining data lineage and slow deployment of data-driven projects. This interactive chalk talk explores architectural patterns for teams managing distributed data in multicloud environments. We will dive deep into how capabilities such as decentralized data architectures and federated queries can help you design for domain-oriented ownership across cloud providers. You will learn practical approaches to building Data Mesh architecture and deciding when to use federated queries and materialized views.

title: Databases made effortless so agents and developers can change the world
abstract: From startups to global enterprises, AWS Databases has been the trusted foundation powering innovative applications for nearly two decades. Join G2 Krishnamoorthy, VP of AWS Database Services, as he presents our mission to transform how you manage your data. Discover our vision where database management becomes effortless, delivering robust performance, seamless scale, and comprehensive security. Learn how AWS Databases integrates with AI agents to reduce operational complexity while enabling a new generation of AI-native applications that will advance your business capabilities.

title: Data-driven contact centers: Maximizing Amazon Connect analytics
abstract: In today's contact centers, organizations have access to extensive analytics and AI insights but often struggle to convert this data into meaningful business outcomes. Amazon Connect's analytics capabilities enable organizations to transform their operations through data lake analytics, driving improvements in customer experience, agent performance, and operational efficiency. This session explores practical implementations like journey analysis, sentiment coaching, and agent well-being initiatives, helping organizations bridge the gap between data collection and valuable business results that reduce costs and enhance customer satisfaction.

title: Data-Driven EC2 Optimization: Efficiency, Metrics, and Sustainability
abstract: It's easier to improve what is measured — and even easier when you're tracking the relevant metrics. This chalk talk explores how to drive meaningful compute optimization across Amazon EC2 workloads using data, not guesswork. We'll walk through a practical, scenario-based approach to analyzing workload metrics, selecting the right instance types, and tuning capacity to match application demands. Using real-world data, we'll demonstrate how to evaluate price-performance, rightsize fleets, and make informed trade-offs—whether your focus is FinOps, efficiency, or sustainability. Attendees will leave with a practical methodology they can apply immediately, along with AWS-native tooling options and real-world examples.

title: Data Engineering on AWS
abstract: This bootcamp teaches comprehensive Data engineering on AWS. Learn to design and implement data lakes, warehouses, and both batch and streaming pipelines. Practice using AWS services for data orchestration, transformation, and security. Gain hands-on experience with Amazon Redshift Serverless, open table formats, and streaming analytics. Ideal for data professionals building scalable, secure data solutions. Also covers optimization, monitoring, and compliance topics.

title: Data Harmony: AWS AI Agents for Clinical Integration
abstract: The healthcare industry faces unprecedented challenges in integrating disparate data sources, each with unique schemas and privacy requirements. This session explores cutting-edge approaches to harmonizing these datasets using AWS' latest agentic AI and machine learning capabilities. Learn how agents can actively map, standardize, and integrate complex clinical data while maintaining privacy, accelerating drug development and enhancing care plans. Through case studies and examples, see how agentic AI identifies patterns, suggests data relationships, and adapts to new schemas in real-time, transforming fragmented healthcare data into actionable insights. Ideal for data scientists, IT professionals, and pharmaceutical researchers working with complex clinical datasets.

title: Data modeling core concepts for Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: Join this session to learn the core concepts of Amazon DynamoDB data modeling. Explore best practices for common access patterns used by DynamoDB customers for applications that need consistent, fast performance at any scale. Developers experienced with DynamoDB can learn best practices and trade-offs to make when deciding on single-table and multi-table designs, indexing strategies, and more.

title: Data perimeter challenge
abstract: In this hands-on session, learn to build robust data perimeter controls using AWS policy-as-code patterns. You'll write and deploy service control policies (SCPs), resource control policies (RCPs), and VPC endpoint policies to protect sensitive data across accounts. Through hands-on labs, you'll implement guardrails using AWS CDK/CloudFormation, create automated policy validation pipelines, and test security configurations using custom assessment tools. Learn practical techniques for restricting data access to trusted identities and networks, and leave with reusable code templates to strengthen your organization's security posture.

title: Data Processing architectures for building AI solutions
abstract: Ready to transform your data infrastructure for the AI era? Join us to learn how to revolutionize your data platforms with cutting-edge AI solutions on Amazon EMR. Discover how to leverage EMR to build robust, scalable infrastructure that enables enterprises to develop and deploy AI agents at scale. We'll dive deep into proven migration strategies for running massive data workloads while optimizing cost-efficiency and security, explore architectural patterns that power successful data-driven AI initiatives, and share critical considerations from enterprises who've completed similar modernization efforts. Whether you're beginning your data platform modernization journey or optimizing existing implementations, this session delivers actionable strategies to accelerate your organization's path to AI-powered data excellence.

title: Data protection and resilience with AWS Storage
abstract: Data continues to be one of the world’s most valuable resources. Data protection and resilience are critical to business success, helping to keep workflows running and allow business recovery from data loss events such as unplanned outages, natural disasters, and ransomware. Join this session to dive deep on how AWS storage offers organizations defense-in-depth data protection and resilience for application data across recovery point and time objectives, helping to mitigate risks with immutable solutions, restore testing, policy-based access controls, encryption, and auditing and reporting.

title: Data protection & application recovery strategies for ransomware
abstract: Ransomware events continue to dominate the headlines. These business interruptions occur when threat actors gain unauthorized access to critical business data and then encrypt it. They then demand a ransom in order for organizations to regain access to the affected data. Without proper data protection techniques, an organization might fail to recover from a ransomware event. In this chalk talk, learn about data protection mechanisms you can use to protect your business-critical data on AWS against ransomware events. Also, discover first-response strategies you can use to rapidly restore your critical data during a ransomware event.

title: Data protection strategies for AI data foundation
abstract: Build robust security frameworks for AI implementations through hands-on coding. We'll implement data protection patterns, secure prompt handling, and PII detection. Code along as we create privacy-preserving pipelines in SageMaker, configure IAM policies for model access control, and automate compliance checks with AWS Config. Develop defenses against prompt injection attacks, implement differential privacy techniques, and build CloudTrail audit trails. Leave with production-ready code templates for governance guardrails and technical safeguards that protect sensitive data throughout the AI lifecycle while enabling innovation and maintaining trust in your AI applications.

title: Debug Lambda functions deployed in cloud like never before
abstract: Discover AWS Lambda's groundbreaking remote debugging capability, allowing developers to debug functions deployed in AWS cloud from local IDE for the first time. Learn how to set breakpoints, step through code line-by-line, inspect variables, and analyze call stacks in live Lambda functions. Experience practical debugging techniques for complex serverless scenarios with minimal setup and performance impact. Whether you're new to Lambda or an experienced developer, this session will transform your debugging workflow, dramatically reducing troubleshooting time and improving development efficiency.

title: Debug LLM bottlenecks with NVIDIA Nsight
abstract: Large Language Models (LLM) often underperform due to hidden bottlenecks in inference pipelines. This hands-on workshop teaches you to leverage NVIDIA Nsight to identify and resolve real performance issues in LLM deployments on NVIDIA GPU-powered EC2 instances. Through practical exercises, you'll learn to interpret profiling data, pinpoint memory constraints, optimize tensor operations, and improve throughput. We'll cover common LLM bottlenecks like attention mechanisms, token generation loops, and batch processing inefficiencies. Attendees will gain actionable skills to diagnose production issues, reduce latency, and maximize hardware utilization for cost-effective LLM serving at scale.

title: Debug, trace, improve: Observability for agentic applications
abstract: When AI agents fail in production, how do you find the cause? In this interactive chalk talk, we'll explore the observability challenges unique to agentic systems and dive into practical solutions using AgentCore Observability. Leveraging OpenTelemetry traces, structured logging, and CloudWatch dashboards, we'll show how to identify bottlenecks, troubleshoot tool errors, and effectively perform RCA by capturing user context. We'll collaboratively work through real-world scenarios—from tracing complex reasoning chains to identifying tool execution failures—and discuss strategies for creating meaningful alerts and evaluation pipelines. Bring your production challenges as we build a shared understanding of agent observability at scale.

title: Decomposing monolithic databases with generative AI
abstract: Discover how generative AI can accelerate the decomposition of monolithic databases into modern, distributed architectures. In the cloud-centered era, traditional monolithic databases increasingly hinder performance, resilience, and agility as applications grow in complexity. Join this chalk talk to explore AI-driven strategies for analyzing and breaking down data domains, implementing event-driven architectures, and leveraging AWS managed services like Amazon Aurora, Amazon ElastiCache, and Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Bedrock. Learn practical techniques for using AI tools to identify dependencies, suggest optimization patterns, and guide your database modernization journey.

title: Decoupling your data-driven applications with Amazon EventBridge Pipes
abstract: Decoupling services is one of the largest advantages of adopting a modern event-driven architecture, which can improve development agility and operational resilience. In this builders' session, see how different services or even different applications can respond in real time to changes in an Amazon DynamoDB table using Amazon EventBridge Pipes and event buses. Learn to reduce coupling by prioritizing configuration over code, serverless over provisioned services, and generic over service-specific communication. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Deep dive into advanced database performance monitoring
abstract: This interactive chalk talk equips database engineers with advanced troubleshooting expertise through real-world problem-solving scenarios for Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL and touch on other database engines. Participants will learn how to dissect real production issues using Amazon CloudWatch Database Insights, with a focus on three critical areas: leveraging DB Load charts to identify resource bottlenecks, analyzing lock trees to resolve deadlocks, and interpreting execution plans to optimize query performance. The discussion will cover advanced correlation techniques between database load dimensions, wait events, and SQL patterns. We will also demonstrate how to navigate from fleet-level anomalies to query-level root causes.

title: Deep dive into advanced routing policy with AWS Cloud WAN
abstract: Looking to establish AWS Cloud WAN as your global networking backbone? In this session, we will dive deep into the latest innovations of Cloud WAN, enabling you to take full control of your global routing destiny. Learn how to implement advanced routing controls while scaling your global network footprint.

title: Deep dive into Amazon Aurora and its innovations
abstract: With an innovative architecture that decouples compute from storage and advanced features like Amazon Aurora Global Database and low-latency read replicas, Aurora reimagines what it means to be a relational database. Aurora is a built-for-the-cloud, serverless relational database service that delivers unparalleled performance and availability at global scale for MySQL,  PostgreSQL, and DSQL. In this session, dive deep into new features – and Aurora’s most popular offerings including serverless, I/O-Optimized, zero-ETL integrations, MCP integration, and generative AI support for vector search and storage. Also learn about the groundbreaking Aurora DSQL engine.

title: Deep dive into Amazon Aurora DSQL and its architecture
abstract: Amazon Aurora DSQL is a serverless, distributed SQL database that uses decades of Amazon innovation and operational excellence. Join this session to dive into the design and key innovative technologies that make Aurora DSQL the ideal choice for new applications and applications which require the highest level of resilience. Learn how active-active architecture in Aurora DSQL delivers single- and multi-Region resiliency and virtually unlimited scale.

title: Deep dive into Amazon DocumentDB and its innovations
abstract: Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) is a serverless, fully managed, MongoDB API-compatible document database service. In this session, take a deep dive into the most exciting new features Amazon DocumentDB offers including serverless, enhanced compression, performance upgrades, and the latest query APIs. Learn how the implementation of these features in your organization can improve resilience, performance, and the effectiveness of your applications.

title: Deep dive into Amazon ECS resilience and availability
abstract: Every application architecture relies on underlying infrastructure, and many choose Amazon ECS as the foundation to build upon. Do you know how Amazon ECS is built? What design considerations were taken while building the service? How Amazon ECS can help you minimize an outage? In this session, learn how Amazon ECS can help you address your requirements for running resilient and reliable applications in the cloud. Dive deep into how Amazon ECS service architecture, design, and operational practices provide a secure and resilient foundation for your applications.

title: Deep dive into databases zero-ETL integrations
abstract: In this session, learn how AWS zero-ETL integrations remove the need to manage complex data movement pipelines across multiple source database engines and targets so data engineers, architects, & DBAs can eliminate maintenance overhead while ensuring near real-time data availability for analytics & ML workloads. Examine the underlying architecture and how it works for the supported zero-ETL integrations between Amazon Aurora, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon RDS sources to Amazon Redshift, Amazon SageMaker, and Amazon OpenSearch Service targets - all without traditional ETL complexity. Dive into the data movement options, tunable settings, and how to monitor ongoing data movement.

title: Deep dive into data processing in SageMaker Unified Studio
abstract: Join us for an interactive chalk talk demonstrating how to transform complex data processing workflows into manageable, secure, and scalable solutions in Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. We'll explore building a robust data lake foundation, enabling self-service analytics through visual ETL tools, and implementing comprehensive data governance. Whether you're a data engineer scaling operations, a data analyst seeking self-service capabilities, or a business leader concerned with data security, you'll discover how SageMaker Unified Studio can streamline your journey from data to actionable insights.

title: Deep Dive into Deloitte's Amazon Neptune GenAI Security Intelligence Center
abstract: To adapt to an ever-changing threat landscape, effective cybersecurity must align policy interpretation, operational enforcement, and real-time metrics in a continuous feedback loop. Generative AI has a large role to play in retrieving relevant data and coordinating and adapting this complex task across a disparate set of tools and information sources. In this session you will learn about different options for developing GraphRAG capabilities using Amazon Neptune that supply highly relevant connected data to agentic workflows, and how Deloitte used the AWS GraphRAG Toolkit to build a Security Intelligence Center that produces predictive security guidance based on timely organizational context.

title: Deep dive into private DNS with Route 53: From basics to scale
abstract: Explore private DNS management using Amazon Route 53. In this chalk talk, attendees will discover two key areas: Route 53 Profiles for streamlined DNS management at scale, and best practices for implementing inbound resolver endpoints through forwarding and delegation patterns. Through interactive discussion and real-world examples, participants will learn common architectural patterns and receive practical guidance for building reliable private DNS solutions. Whether managing private DNS for a single VPC or implementing enterprise-wide DNS architectures, attendees will gain valuable insights into Route 53 capabilities for private DNS management.

title: Deep Dive into the AWS Nitro System
abstract: The AWS Nitro System is a rich collection of building block technologies including hardware offload and security components built by AWS that are powering the recent and future generations of Amazon EC2 instances with an ever-broadening selection of compute, storage, memory, and networking options. In this session, dive deep into the AWS Nitro System, review its design and architecture, explore new innovations in the Nitro platform, and see how it has made the seemingly impossible possible.

title: Deep dive on Amazon S3
abstract: Amazon S3 operates at massive scale, serving hundreds of millions of transactions per second across more than 100 data centers and tens of millions of drives. In this session, we'll explore how S3 achieves 99.99% availability and strong read-after-write consistency while gracefully handling constant failures at every level—from drive sectors to entire facilities. Join us to learn about the architectural principles and engineering decisions that enable one of the world's largest storage systems to maintain data integrity and availability at scale.

title: Deep dive on AWS hybrid and edge networking architectures
abstract: Whether you're using AWS Outposts or AWS Local Zones to extend an AWS Region, networking is central—spanning connectivity back to the Region, Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) design, and resiliency across environments. This chalk talk covers patterns such as private vs. public connectivity, service link and on-premises connectivity, and designing resilient Multi-Availability Zone architecture across Outposts and Local Zones. We highlight how second-generation AWS Outposts advances networking with a dedicated networking rack that delivers enhanced scalability, high throughput, and accelerated networking for ultra-low latency workloads, including resilient intra- and inter-VPC communication.

title: Defend against downtime using fault isolation boundaries
abstract: Building an application to recover from common failure modes aligned to AWS fault isolation boundaries can help you meet your availability goals. In this chalk talk, we'll share how to use Application Recovery Controller (ARC) to recover your applications from impairments within an AWS Availability Zone and an AWS Region. You'll leave with an understanding of how ARC works, as well as key take-ways to incorporate into your architecture.

title: Delighting Slack users safely and quickly with Amazon Nova and Bedrock
abstract: Serving millions of users daily while adhering to strict compliance and reliability requirements makes delivery of high-scale AI services even more challenging. In this session, you'll discover how Slack integrated generative AI features to help users find and read information faster, exploring the architectural decisions they made to meet increasing demands while continuing to develop rich functions that help users save time daily. Learn how model flexibility on Amazon Bedrock and the accelerated performance of Amazon Nova at a low cost helped Slack grow exponentially in two years while maintaining security and reliability.

title: Deliver a smarter, faster, and a more accurate agentic RAG system
abstract: ​​Learn new approaches to building faster, more precise agentic RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) systems using the Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases, AgentCore, and Strands Agents features. We will dive deep into new agentic retrieval patterns across multiple knowledge bases, including best practices and RAG evaluation. You will learn best practices for building agentic RAG systems where agents will orchestrate retrieval based on context and user needs. Utilizing these advanced techniques, agents can personalize results, improving user satisfaction and reducing effort.

title: Deliver GenAI Mobile Apps and Models at scale: A Testing Architecture
abstract: How do you deliver GenAI features that work reliably on millions of real devices and deploy the models behind them? In this chalk talk, discover the techniques for benchmarking AI mobile apps on real iOS and Android devices, differences with emulators/simulators, and use of Generative AI driven test platforms to accelerate testing with an example from the Amazon Retail team. Learn how Qualcomm AI Hub does on‑device AI, optimizing, compiling, and testing models across CPU/GPU/NPU targets with physical device validation at scale using AWS Device Farm.

title: Democratize Data: Bundesliga Real-time Insights Without Writing any SQL
abstract: Building production-grade Text2SQL systems reveals challenges that demos never show. This interactive chalk talk shares hard-won lessons from implementing GenAI-powered data analytics at scale, using German football as our proving ground. Journey from prototype to production through critical architectural decisions: real-time data ingestion, domain-specific prompt engineering, latency optimization, and cost management. Learn practical approaches to accuracy evaluation and security guardrails that keep GenAI applications reliable and focused. Relevant to any industry, these battle-tested patterns will accelerate your data democratization initiatives.

title: Democratizing Whirlpool's Virtual Product Development with AWS
abstract: Discover how Whirlpool leverages AWS to democratize Virtual Product Development and speed up design decisions. By running cloud-based cost and performance simulations, Whirlpool generates training data to build explainable machine learning models with Amazon SageMaker, deployed through a modular front-end on AWS Elastic Beanstalk. These tools empower enterprise-wide stakeholders to quickly explore trade-offs and perform multi-objective optimizations using Genetic Algorithms. This session highlights the journey from siloed tools to a unified cloud ecosystem, enabling faster, smarter product architecture choices and driving measurable improvements in cost, performance, and time-to-market.

title: Demystify attestation: Cryptographically verify execution environment
abstract: Highly sensitive workloads often rely on cryptographic proof about the code, config and other aspects of the execution environment before unsealing code, data to be processed. In this code talk we will see examples of cryptographic attestation using AWS Nitro Enclaves, NitroTPM and Amazon EC2 Instance Identification document. We will also visit common scenarios where this is useful in multi party computation setups for data analytics, Generative AI.

title: Demystifying Aurora DSQL transactions and concurrency control
abstract: Join this session to learn about Amazon Aurora DSQL's optimistic concurrency control (OCC). Explore building an application to understand the impact of OCC on your relational workloads, how it differs from traditional databases, and how to achieve the desired semantics in DSQL's OCC model.

title: Demystifying the shared security model on Amazon ECS
abstract: In this session, we'll dive deep into the shared security model for containerized workloads running on Amazon ECS. Learn what AWS is responsible for, and what you are responsible for and dive into tips and best practices on how to reduce the operational overhead to secure your workloads running on Amazon ECS. This session equips you with the knowledge to build and maintain secure, resilient containerized applications.

title: Deploy Agentic AI Application with Strands and MCP on Amazon EKS
abstract: Build an enterprise-grade financial analysis platform by integrating Strands Agents and MCP on Amazon EKS. Learn to deploy and configure MCP servers, set up Strands Agents, and integrate financial data within a containerized environment. Experience hands-on implementation of scalable AI applications combining natural language processing with advanced tool invocation capabilities.

title: Deploy Amazon EKS workloads with ArgoCD and GitOps
abstract: GitOps has become a buzzword in the Kubernetes world, promising a simpler way to manage clusters through Git-based workflows. But what is it actually like to get started? In this lightning talk, I’ll walk through my first attempt at deploying applications on Amazon EKS using ArgoCD. I’ll highlight what worked smoothly, where I stumbled, and the key insights I gained along the way. This isn’t a production war story - it’s a builder’s perspective on learning a new approach. If you’re curious about GitOps on AWS, this session will help you see both the potential and the pitfalls.

title: Deploy and Fine-Tune Nemotron Models on AWS SageMaker and Bedrock: Hands-On Lab (sponsored by NVIDIA)
abstract: Learn to deploy, fine-tune, and experiment with Nemotron models using SageMaker and Bedrock. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Deploy and Fine-Tune Nemotron Models on AWS SageMaker and Bedrock: Hands-On Lab (sponsored by NVIDIA)

title: Deploy and manage blockchain nodes on AWS
abstract: In this session, learn how to deploy self-managed blockchain nodes on AWS using Amazon EC2 and AWS Blockchain Node Runners, an open source initiative. We will whiteboard a sample solution and dive deep into each component of the solution covering instance type selection, choosing storage options based on requirements, blockchain node provisioning, snapshot management, and patching. Leave this session equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to deploy, scale, optimize for data transfer and availability, and upgrade blockchain nodes on AWS.

title: Deploy and use an open source Digital Asset Management platform
abstract: Visual Asset Management System (VAMS) is a purpose-built, AWS native solution for the management and distribution of 3D assets for Spatial technologies. VAMS offers a simplified solution for organizations to ingest, store, and manage visual assets in the cloud, which empowers any user with a web browser to create and consume visual applications. By the end of this workshop you will learn: 1\How to install VAMS to your AWS Account. 2\How to create VAMS assets, pipelines, and workflows. 3\How to use VAMS assets in your end applications.

title: Deploy artificial intelligence architectures in regulated industries
abstract: Generative AI empowers leaders to re:imagine how technology is used to elevate mission outcomes. This chalk talk explores the best practices to deploy Amazon NOVA, Anthropic, Meta, and custom FM’s in regulated environments with Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SagemakerAI(v2) in FedRAMP High or DoD SRG IL4/5 sovereign environments. The talk will explain how to use Amazon Bedrock Guardrails to prevent undesirable outcomes, review architectural best-practice patterns for experimentation, testing, and deploying FMs using in production environments, and an update on the AWS GovCloud (US) AI strategy based on common GenAI use cases that improve mission success while promoting cost efficiency.

title: Deploy infrastructure with speed and safety using AWS CloudFormation
abstract: In this hands-on workshop workshop, learn how to develop and deploy AWS CloudFormation templates using the latest validation and troubleshooting tools. Discover how to catch errors early with the new CloudFormation capabilities in the AWS IDE plugin, enforce best practices with CloudFormation Guard, and leverage new features in change sets for pre-deployment validation. Master troubleshooting techniques using the AWS Console's failure detection capabilities, timeline views, and root cause analysis. You'll also explore how AI assistance can accelerate template development, explain complex configurations, and guide you through common challenges. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Deploying for resilience: HA/DR strategies for AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones
abstract: Critical workloads at the edge demand robust high-availability and disaster recovery strategies. In this chalk talk, learn how to plan and implement resilient deployments using AWS hybrid cloud and edge computing services. We'll examine how to architect edge infrastructure using AWS Local Zones and AWS Outposts, covering key aspects of networking, compute, and storage redundancy. Through real customer examples and reference architectures, we'll explore deployment patterns and best practices for maintaining business continuity across failure modes. Join us to learn practical strategies for achieving your RPO/RTO objectives with edge deployments.

title: Deploying Intelligent Agent Systems with MCP
abstract: This session guides  participants through a hands-on workshop on how to build, deploy, and  integrate AI Agents to effectively communicate with one another to solve  a number of business problems across a vast set of domains. Participants  will learn how to deploy intelligent agent systems using the Generative  AI Application Builder on AWS, which leverages the Strands Agents SDK and  Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. The session will also address some of the  challenges in running AI Agents in production along with exploring  methodologies for improving interoperability using standardized protocols  such as MCP and A2A.

title: Deploying LLMs at scale with vLLM on AWS AI chips
abstract: In this interactive chalk talk, we'll collaboratively explore how to optimize LLM serving using vLLM on AWS Trainium and Inferentia chips. Through whiteboarding and hands-on discussion, we'll architect efficient deployment patterns, tackle common performance bottlenecks, and design scalable serving configurations. We'll work through real-world scenarios, examining code examples and configuration best practices. Bring your questions and challenges - we'll solve them together while building a deep understanding of vLLM's capabilities on AWS AI chips.

title: Deploy LLMs at scale with vLLM Deep Learning Containers and AI agents
abstract: Struggling with LLM deployment complexity? Join this session to learn how vLLM optimized AWS Deep Learning Containers revolutionize the way we deploy large language models like Open AI GPT-OSS-120B on Amazon EKS. Learn how these purpose-built containers simplify complex setups, optimize GPU utilization, and leverage EFA networking for distributed inference. Through live demonstrations, you'll learn to leverage vLLM DLCs with FSx Lustre and EKS for production-ready AI infrastructure and customize them with AI agents. Leave with practical insights on security, performance tuning, and cost optimization that you can implement immediately and deploy LLMs at industrial-scale effortlessly.

title: Deploy multi-agent AI on Amazon EKS
abstract: Agentic AI is revolutionizing businesses by enabling autonomous reasoning and decision making to accomplish complex tasks. To deploy these agentic AI workloads, organizations need a foundation that is scalable, cost-efficient, and portable. In this builders session, discover how to deploy scalable multi-agent AI systems on Amazon EKS. You will learn how to configure multi-agent communication using the A2A (Agent2Agent) protocol. By the end, you’ll have practical experience running multi-agent AI applications on Amazon EKS.

title: Derisk your mainframe exit through mainframe refactoring with agentic AI
abstract: Discover how two industry giants modernized their core business applications using AWS Transform. A leading institution implemented a mainframe modernization factory, reducing modernization time and increasing test coverage of modernized applications, while another transformed critical systems to meet their technology needs within months. Learn how these leaders mastered parallel modernization at scale using automation and agentic AI. See how AWS Transform's agentic AI capabilities, from code analysis to intelligent refactoring, drove game-changing results. Get practical insights for large-scale refactoring from organizations that have successfully transformed millions of lines of mission-critical code.

title: Design a multi-expert system for fraud investigation with AI agents
abstract: In this chalk talk, learn how to design a multi-expert AI system for fraud investigations. Discover the essential building blocks of an AI agent network using Amazon Bedrock and Amazon ECS. Together, we'll explore how specialized AI agents handle different investigation aspects, from merchant risk analysis to public search. We'll sketch out the orchestration patterns between custom and open-source Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, design agent communication flows, and address critical considerations like security, scalability, and cost optimization. You'll gain practical insights into implementing generative AI solutions that can transform your fraud investigation workflows.

title: Design and deploy custom guardrails for AI applications
abstract: Implementing guardrails for large language models (LLMs) requires balancing performance with responsible AI practices. This interactive chalk talk explores approaches for designing safety filters and use case-specific controls while optimizing for accuracy, latency, and cost. Through a real-world AI use case example, learn how to architect guardrails that align with your quality requirements and discover patterns for dynamic implementation in your generative AI platform. Walk away with practical strategies for integrating these controls into your existing AI workflows and evaluation methods for measuring their effectiveness.

title: Design and Implement Agentic AI Observability with OpenSearch
abstract: This chalk talk covers how Amazon OpenSearch Service enables intelligent, autonomous observability. Developers and architects will learn to implement autonomous monitoring workflows that combine real-time analytics with Amazon Q and Amazon Bedrock to create self-learning systems. Explore building sophisticated observability patterns using OpenSearch for automated root cause analysis, intelligent alert correlation, and predictive insights. We'll demonstrate practical implementations including standardized data collection with OpenTelemetry, zero-ETL integration with Amazon S3, Amazon CloudWatch, and autonomous monitoring workflows. Learn to configure agentic AI frameworks for natural language exploration, automated insight generation, and intelligent alert routing across hybrid environments. You'll learn to transform traditional monitoring into automated, AI-powered observability.

title: Design authentication, authorization, and logging logic in Agentic AI apps
abstract: This hands-on workshop addresses the critical challenge of managing identities and permissions for generative AI agents. Learn to implement user and machine authentication, along with fine-grained authorization mechanisms, tailored for AI agents, tools, and LLMs. Explore consent management and permission delegation in AI contexts. Participants will gain practical experience using AWS's latest services, including Strands SDK, Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Identity, Amazon Cognito for identity management, and Amazon Verified Permissions for authorization decisions. By the end, you'll have the skills to enhance security and compliance in your AI operations using AWS's cutting-edge identity and access management solutions.

title: Design effective Amazon CloudWatch dashboards and alarms
abstract: Learn how to build actionable dashboards that simplify operational complexity. This session will use demos to explore capabilities in Amazon CloudWatch dashboards and alarms, to help you design appropriate visibility and actions for your workloads. This session will start with how we decide what to observe, from SLOs, to customer experience, to infrastructure perspective. We will look at using Amazon CloudWatch to reduce noise, cognitive load during incidents and helping teams quickly identify what matters for your workloads. This is an interactive session, so bring your questions about your own dashboards and alarms to share.

title: Designing local Generative AI inference with AWS IoT Greengrass
abstract: While running inference in the cloud is a common and effective approach for Generative AI, some use cases demand local execution. This session explores how to design and operate local inference architectures using AWS IoT Greengrass. Through a live demo using a robotic arm, attendees compare cloud-based and local inference in practice, examining trade-offs in latency, connectivity, and model update frequency. The talk also presents a practical approach for delivering and updating models at the edge to support the reliable, ongoing use of Generative AI in real-world environments.

title: Designing mission critical applications with serverless services
abstract: In this session, learn how to design mission-critical systems that process millions of transactions daily, on serverless services. Beginning with a legacy system, we'll decompose a monolith and discuss key serverless patterns to help accelerate modernization efforts. This session highlights a transformational journey and the adoption of services like AWS Lambda, AWS Step Functions, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS), and Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS), enabling scalable and resilient processing.

title: Designing resilient Serverless Applications
abstract: Reliability is critical in serverless applications, and resilience requires thoughtful architecture. In this session, discover how to design for resilience at every layer of your application. We'll walk through practical strategies for improving reliability within a single region using synchronous, asynchronous, and polling patterns. Explore disaster recovery techniques to keep your applications running—even during major outages.

title: Designing web architectures on AWS at scale
abstract: What do you do when your monolith becomes unmaintainable? How do you handle authentication across dozens of micro-frontends? These aren't just theoretical questions but daily challenges web developers and architects face. Join us for an interactive session where we'll whiteboard real solutions to real problems. We'll break down complex architectures into understandable patterns, explore caching strategies that actually work, and share stories of both successes and failures from global AWS implementations.

title: Designing with Agents: A Playbook for Enterprise Engineering Leaders (sponsored by Windsurf)
abstract: Enterprises are asking not “if” but “how” to integrate agents into their software delivery pipelines. Drawing from Cognition’s work with Fortune 500 engineering teams, Russell Kaplan, President of Cognition, will share a practical playbook for senior technical leaders: when to delegate to autonomous agents like Devin, how to govern human-in-the-loop workflows in IDEs like Windsurf, and how to measure ROI beyond productivity metrics. This session balances inspiration with actionable guidance, equipping attendees with strategies to future-proof their engineering organizations while avoiding common pitfalls. This presentation is brought to you by Windsurf, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Advancing Behavioral Health Analytics with Integrated Cloud Services (sponsored by Deloitte)
Designing with Agents: A Playbook for Enterprise Engineering Leaders (sponsored by Windsurf)

speakers.companyName: Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Services
speakers.globalCompany: Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Services

title: Design multi-modal customer journeys with Amazon Connect
abstract: Learn how to build advanced customer experiences in Amazon Connect that seamlessly integrate voice, digital, and IoT interactions. Discover practical techniques for processing IoT signals as contact triggers, implementing device-aware routing, and designing context-rich agent interfaces. Through real-world examples, you'll learn patterns for extending Connect's capabilities into the IoT ecosystem to create next-generation customer service solutions.

title: Design multi-region resilience strategies on Amazon EKS
abstract: Join this session to learn how to design highly available, resilient Amazon EKS deployments that span multiple AWS regions. This chalktalk explores architectural patterns for robust multi-region Amazon EKS workloads, including network connectivity models, cross-region replication strategies, and automated failover mechanisms. We'll demonstrate how to leverage GitOps, AWS Global Accelerator, Route 53, and EKS features to create seamless global application experiences while maintaining regional isolation for compliance and fault tolerance.

title: Design patterns for multicloud observability
abstract: Multicloud environments present unique observability challenges such as enabling end-to-end visibility of distributed applications and dealing with fragmented tools. This session explores three proven architectural patterns: the centralized collector hub model, federated telemetry mesh, and event-driven correlation framework. We'll demonstrate how these patterns solve common challenges like metric normalization, distributed tracing, and root cause analysis. Learn practical implementation strategies for each pattern, including data pipeline design and scaling considerations. Walk away with blueprints for implementing these patterns using open source or cloud-native services, understanding trade-offs, and knowing how to choose the right approach based on your organization's scale and complexity.

title: Detect and mitigating hallucinations: A hands-on responsible AI workshop
abstract: Organizations deploying foundation model (FM)-powered applications face challenges in reducing hallucinations and reasoning errors. When FMs encounter ambiguous queries or multi-step instructions, they may guess, extrapolate, or conflate information, leading to unreliable outputs. This session presents a comprehensive hallucination and model reasoning toolbox to mitigate unreliable or inaccurate outputs. Learn how to build architectures that combine detection methods, use built-in safeguards from Amazon Bedrock Guardrails, develop custom guardrails, evaluate the effectiveness of the techniques, and integrate with broader AI systems including Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines and agentic AI. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Detecting falls in aged care with a minimum lovable product
abstract: Defining a Minimum Lovable Product (MLP) is challenging, especially when priorities are constantly being shifted during the product-market fit stage of a startup. Understanding end-user personas is critical to this process. This session explores the key decisions made while building an early-stage startup that provides fall detection and notifications for people primarily in the aged care sector. the session'll cover MVP vs MLP, the solution architecture, do you need batch or real time querying? Challenges around implementing real-time alerting, data partitioning approaches, and other tradeoffs involved in capturing and analyzing data from IoT sensors installed in the home or aged.

title: Detection Engineering at Scale: Building High-Fidelity Security Operations (sponsored by Datadog)
abstract: Security teams face an exponential growth in telemetry data across AWS services, third-party tools, and hybrid infrastructure.
