The challenge isn't just detecting threats—it's finding the real incidents among millions of daily events without overwhelming your SOC team. Join Riot games and Datadog subject matter experts as we explore battle-tested principles for building effective detection systems at scale. Drawing from real-world implementations at enterprises like Riot Games, we'll demonstrate how to leverage AWS native services alongside Datadog's security platform to create high-fidelity detection rules that actually work. This presentation is brought to you by Datadog, an AWS Partner.

title: Develop AI Agents and Flow Apps on Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio
abstract: AI application development using SageMaker Unified Studio's dual capabilities: interactive chat agents and visual workflow builder. Learn to implement knowledge bases, guardrails, and custom UIs for conversational applications, while creating sophisticated decision-making flows with conditional logic and intelligent request routing. Practice building both agent-based systems and multi-path workflows that combine knowledge bases with LLM capabilities. Ideal for developers creating production-grade AI applications.

title: Develop AI Agents faster with Amazon SageMaker Studio and AgentCore
abstract: Perfect for both newcomers and experienced practitioners looking to accelerate their AI agent development journey, this sessions will teach you to build and deploy AI agents using Amazon SageMaker Studio and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. In this breakout session, you'll learn how to integrate enterprise data, train custom models, and deploy production-ready agents. We'll demonstrate how to streamline the entire machine learning lifecycle, from data preparation to deployment.

title: Develop AI Agents faster with Amazon SageMaker AI & Bedrock AgentCore
abstract: Amazon SageMaker AI provides purpose-built capabilities to create a reliable path to production for AI agents. With SageMaker FMOps and Bedrock AgentCore, standardize and automate processes to move agents from prototype to production with reliability, observability, and governance at scale. Design, evaluate, deploy, and govern agents that combine foundation models with reasoning, planning, and tool use. Learn how to leverage SageMaker Pipelines to orchestrate workflows for model deployment, manage MLflow to track experiments across prompt strategies and agent configurations, and use Model Registry to enable compliant versioning. Discover practical patterns for bringing AI agents into production—quickly and responsibly.

title: Develop AWS CDK resources to deploy your applications on AWS
abstract: In this workshop, learn how to build and deploy applications using infrastructure as code with AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK). Create resources using AWS CDK, and learn maintenance and operations tips. In addition, get an introduction to building your own constructs. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Developer Experience Economics: Moving Past Productivity Metrics
abstract: Measuring the value of software development has challenged organizations for decades. This session shares insights to Amazon's approach of understanding the impact of developer experience and tooling. Learn how to apply these insights to your own team to go beyond lines of code and bring a more strategic level of thinking to your improvements to developer experience.

title: Developing a cost allocation strategy with AWS tooling
abstract: In this chalk talk, learn how to approach tooling selection, taxonomy, and account structure to support your business's cost allocation goals. We'll cover chargebacks, showbacks, how to control cost visibility, and best practices that support automation. Join us to discuss how to approach tool selection for different use cases and discover resources you can use to streamline your cost allocation!

title: Developing end-to-end SLM pipelines from the cloud to the edge
abstract: This session presents a comprehensive approach to deploying small language models (SLMs) to AWS Local Zones and AWS Outposts using Amazon SageMaker and Amazon EKS. We’ll demonstrate how to deliver domain-specific, fine-tuned SLMs from AWS Regions to edge locations for low-latency inference. You’ll learn how to build edge-optimized delivery pipelines, automate containerized model distribution, and manage model lifecycles across hybrid infrastructure using orchestration platforms. You will gain practical understanding of building robust AI deployment architectures that leverage both cloud scalability and edge proximity. You will walk away with insights into the architectural decisions needed for edge AI initiatives and implementation best practices for production-grade SLM deployments.

title: Developing Generative AI Applications on AWS
abstract: This course teaches software developers to build custom AI solutions using Amazon Bedrock programmatically. Master RAG implementation with Knowledge Bases, AI agents development, and foundation model APIs. Practice hands-on prompt engineering, implement Bedrock Guardrails for responsible AI, and design secure architectural patterns for business applications. Learn to optimize model responses while maintaining security and performance standards.

title: Developing Serverless Applications Locally with AWS and LocalStack (sponsored by LocalStack)
abstract: Developing serverless applications presents unique challenges for developers. Tools that simplify the developer workflow–like local testing, breakpoints, and single-step debugging–have historically been either unavailable or complex to implement. Join this lightning talk to learn how to simplify local testing, integrate debugging, and ship robust serverless applications with confidence. LocalStack Co-Founder and CTO Waldemar Hummer will be joined by AWS Serverless Product Lead Shridhar Pandey for a deep dive into the tools and best practices available to help developers build, test, and ship serverless applications faster and with greater confidence. This presentation is brought to you by LocalStack, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Developing Serverless Applications Locally with AWS and LocalStack (sponsored by LocalStack)

title: Developing Unit Cost Metrics with Cloud Intelligence Dashboards
abstract: In this builders' session, you will learn how to attribute cloud expenses to specific teams and business units, driving smarter resource allocation. Discover how the Cloud Intelligence Dashboards (powered by Amazon Quicksight) combine advanced observability capabilities with FinOps best practices to create measurable business unit costs. Gain skills to provide customized insights to the different stakeholders in the organization, enhance accountability, and convert cloud spending into actionable insights.

title: Develop richer, contextual workflows with Model Context Protocol (MCP)
abstract: Model Context Protocol standardizes the way LLMs integrate with various data soueces, eliminating the need to write complex, custom integration code. In this chalk talk, we'll explore how MCPs enable AI tools like Kiro to understand your codebase, connect to external tools, access data sources, and execute multifaceted development tasks. We'll demonstrate how to configure MCP servers with granular controls, ensuring alignment with your organization's security policies. Learn to craft powerful, context-aware development environments that safely boost innovation.

title: Develop with natural language and agentic AI in Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio
abstract: Dive into modern approaches to data engineering and machine learning using natural language and agentic AI assistance. We'll walk through practical examples that show how conversational AI and agents can streamline the development of data and ML workflows within Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. You'll leave with the technical know-how you need to automate data engineering tasks and streamline ML development without writing code.

title: DevOps Meets Broadcast: Build Your Own Multi-Camera Broadcast Solution
abstract: Experience the future of live sports broadcasting in this hands-on workshop. Learn to orchestrate multi-camera productions in the cloud using AWS Media Services and AI-assisted tools. Practice implementing DevOps principles in broadcast workflows while building a complete live production system. The session covers signal routing, NDI Discovery, transport protocols, and cloud production tools. You'll work with real-world scenarios to create, automate, and optimize live content delivery, gaining practical skills applicable across broadcasting, sports, and digital media industries.

title: Digital sovereignty and data residency with AWS
abstract: Countries around the world are increasingly introducing or updating data residency and digital sovereignty laws that require at least one copy, or sometimes all data, to be stored or processed in a specific geographic or sovereign location that introduces new challenges for customers. This session explores how AWS services at the edge, including AWS Dedicated Local Zones, AWS Local Zones, and AWS Outposts can help you with your digital sovereignty use cases. We’ll examine best practices for data residency, security controls, and operational consistency across deployments at the edge.

title: Digital transformation excellence: From vision to victory
abstract: Discover how industry leaders are accelerating their cloud journey beyond migration and modernization to achieve complete digital transformation. This session showcases real-world success stories demonstrating the strategic use of the right accelerators—tools, services, solutions, training, investment or guidance—at precisely the right moments in their transformation journey to unlock business value and achieve operational excellence.

title: Disagree in Commits: The Performance Improvements That Cut Costs by a Third
abstract: When paths diverge in open source, innovation often follows. Join Corey Quinn and Madelyn Olson as they dive into how Amazon ElastiCache for Valkey cut prices by up to 33% while simultaneously improving both performance and reliability through community-driven development. You'll discover how open governance enables optimization decisions that benefit all users, why performance improvements and stability aren't mutually exclusive, and what it really takes to create a seamless migration path at scale. Whether you're currently running Redis, evaluating alternatives, or simply interested in how open-source economics can benefit cloud customers, you'll leave with practical insights on reducing infrastructure costs without compromising on reliability.

title: Disaster Recovery (DR) with AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery Service
abstract: Scaling your disaster recovery (DR) strategy when you're working with environments that contain databases, directory services, and ERP solutions isn't easy.  In this session, we'll go over best practices for scaling your testing and application recovery capabilities, and show you how to get more out of your DR environments with AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery.

title: Discover and secure non-human identities (sponsored by Okta)
abstract: As the identity landscape expands to include non-human identities (NHIs) like service accounts and AI agents, new security risks have emerged. This session will show you how to protect these high-risk assets. First, you'll learn how Identity Security Posture Management (ISPM) can reveal security blind spots related to NHIs. Next, we'll demonstrate how to use Okta Privileged Access (OPA) to secure SaaS service accounts by automating credential rotation and applying dedicated security controls. Finally, we'll show you how to create a certification campaign with Okta Identity Governance (OIG) to reduce ongoing risk and ensure proper governance. This presentation is brought to you by Okta, an AWS Partner.

title: Distributed inference on AWS: Deep dive into inference optimizations
abstract: As Large Language Models (LLMs) become integral to applications, optimizing inference performance is paramount, especially at scale. This session delves into cutting-edge techniques, research and frameworks that enhance LLM serving efficiency, focusing on KV-cache management, PagedAttention mechanisms, and disaggregated serving architectures. We will cover best practices for self-managed inference on AWS: use cases with architecture diagrams, deep dive into how ML inference works on accelerated compute, and common patterns of optimizations in the field. Attendees will gain a comprehensive understanding of the current landscape and future directions in inference optimization, with the knowledge to implement these advancements in distributed systems.

title: Distributed training at scale with Slurm on Amazon SageMaker HyperPod
abstract: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod offers advanced training tools to accelerate scalable, reliable, and secure AI model development. In this hands-on session, learn how to orchestrate distributed training using a Slurm-based cluster. Experience how Slurm integrates with parallel file systems (Amazon FSx for Lustre), NVIDIA GPUs/AWS Trainium, Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA), and diverse ML frameworks to train a LLM on representative datasets. Learn to leverage SageMaker HyperPod flexible training plans to reserve compute capacity in advance, providing cost efficiency and capacity assurance. Lastly, discover how to utilize the latest model training tools to troubleshoot convergence issues and optimize model performance.

title: Distributed vs. Centralized inspection: The ultimate debate
abstract: Join network security experts to break down AWS security best practices, pros & cons of centralized inspection versus decentralized inspection. Deep dive into the latest launches for AWS Network Firewall, Transit Gateway, and other network and security services, and how these can simplify and streamline deployments.

title: Ditch your old SRE playbook: AI SRE for root cause in minutes (sponsored by Resolve AI)
abstract: When the pager goes off, engineers face a wall of noise: logs, metrics, traces, configs, code, and fractured tribal knowledge. Traditional observability adds data but rarely a path to resolution, leaving teams with heavy cognitive load and little context of the whole production system. In this session, see how AI SRE agents cut through the chaos by reasoning across every source, using tools like humans, testing hypotheses, surfacing evidence-backed root causes in minutes, and learning from every interaction. Learn what it takes to make multi-agent AI SRE production-ready, and how enterprises use Resolve AI to put machines on-call for humans. This presentation is brought to you by Resolve AI, an AWS Partner.

title: Dive deep into Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: This session provides a deep dive into Amazon DynamoDB and shares insights into how DynamoDB is architected and how it’s able to deliver the scalability and response times that customers have come to expect. DynamoDB is used by over one million AWS customers, and powers hundreds of applications that exceed half a million requests per second. In this talk we explore the architecture of DynamoDB, and of several specific features. You will understand how we architected DynamoDB to deliver predictable low latency at any scale, and how best to develop your own applications to delight your customers.

title: Dive deep into Amazon DynamoDB using design puzzles
abstract: In this chalk talk, dive deep into how Amazon DynamoDB works at scale by collaboratively solving a few design puzzles that may seem simple but are actually complex. Learn how you can look beyond the obvious solution to find a more effective and scalable one with an understanding of how DynamoDB operates.

title: Dive into Poolside: AI Models for Today’s Enterprise Software Teams (sponsored by poolside)
abstract: poolside’s AI model works where developers work: directly with your enterprise codebase, in your environment, without exposing sensitive data. This session begins with an overview of poolside’s architecture and security model, followed by a technical walkthrough and demo of core use cases—writing and reviewing code, generating tests, integrating with CI/CD, and accelerating iteration with trusted outputs. Attendees will see how poolside’s model applies to real-world enterprise workflows, delivering improvements in productivity, code quality, and development speed. This presentation is brought to you by poolside, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Dive into Poolside: AI Models for Today’s Enterprise Software Teams (sponsored by poolside)
Dive into Poolside: AI Models for Today’s Enterprise Software Teams (sponsored by poolside)

title: DNS unleashed: Unlocking the full potential of Amazon Route 53
abstract: In this hands-on session, dive deep into Amazon Route 53 core features, including profiles for streamlined management, resolvers for DNS forwarding, Application Recovery Controller (ARC) for resilience, DNS Firewall for enhanced security, and robust query logging for visibility and compliance. Through practical exercises and real-world scenarios, gain actionable skills to optimize DNS performance, secure your environments, and troubleshoot with confidence. Whether you are new to Amazon Route 53 or looking to level up, this session equips you with the tools to help become an expert on modern DNS management.

title: Documents to decisions: AI-powered underwriting with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: In this session, participants will learn to build an AI-powered document processing solution that transforms complex underwriting workflows using AWS. Explore how to leverage services and tools like Amazon Bedrock, Bedrock Data Automation, and Strands Agents SDK, as well as models like Amazon Nova and Anthropic Claude, to automatically extract, organize, and analyze information from complex documents across insurance lines. By the end of this session, you'll have created an interactive underwriting assistant that automatically synthesizes risk assessments, detects inconsistencies, and even takes actions—enabling underwriting teams to focus on risk assessment rather than manual document processing.

title: Domain driven microservices design with Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q
abstract: Defining the right service boundaries is a persistent challenge in microservice architecture. This session demonstrates how Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q can assist in domain-driven design by analyzing existing codebases to uncover natural domain boundaries. The chalk talk will include a live implementation showcasing how these tools detect domain relationships, propose service splits, and apply suitable design patterns to ensure business logic integrity. Attendees will gain a practical, AI-powered approach to architecting well-aligned microservices using Amazon Q and Bedrock to drive scalable, maintainable designs.

title: Do's and don'ts for mission-critical workloads in financial services
abstract: Attendees will gain practical insights into avoiding common architectural pitfalls that can lead to service disruptions and performance degradations in mission-critical AWS environments. Learn battle-tested strategies for implementing effective observability, automated recovery mechanisms, and controlled deployment practices that maintain system reliability while ensuring continuous improvement. Discover how to properly implement multi-region resilience patterns, manage complex dependencies, and establish operational runbooks that are optimized for high-stress incidents. Walk away with a clear framework for evaluating architectural decisions through the lens of reliability engineering principles, enabling you to balance innovation velocity with the stability requirements of your most critical workloads.

title: Downtime prevention with the Resilience Lifecycle Framework
abstract: With most system failures stemming from human error, code deployment issues, and misconfigured systems, it's important to have a framework in place to proactively mitigate risks, practice resilience plans, and prevent the repeat of operational incidents. In this chalk talk you'll learn how to apply the AWS Resilience Lifecycle Framework, a holistic approach based on years of working with customers and internal teams, that captures resilience best practices. You'll leave with practical strategies for setting objectives, designing for resilience, resilience testing, conducting operational readiness reviews, and incident analysis reporting to strengthen the resilience posture of your critical workloads.

title: DraftKings & MongoDB: Supercharging Engineering with AI (sponsored by MongoDB)
abstract: What if your engineering team could innovate faster, build smarter, and spend less time on manual tasks? Join us as DraftKings shares how they're leveraging MongoDB Atlas and AI to transform their engineering workflows. You'll learn how they're using real-time data to automate processes, accelerate development, and get to market faster. Walk away with practical lessons for revolutionizing your own team's productivity. This presentation is brought to you by MongoDB, an AWS Partner.

title: DraftKings: Scaling to 1M operations/min on Aurora during Super Bowl
abstract: Discover how DraftKings leverages Amazon Aurora to handle massive transaction volumes during major sporting events for high-stakes sports betting. Join DraftKings to explore the architectural decisions and technical innovations that enable processing of one million financial operations per minute with sub-millisecond latency during peak events like the Super Bowl. Learn how using Aurora, DraftKings can seamlessly scale its financial ledger system, ensure data consistency, and deliver uninterrupted service during moments when millions of users place simultaneous bets.

title: Drive operational excellence for modern applications
abstract: Modern applications built with microservices, containers, and serverless require advanced observability practices. This session showcases how CloudWatch capabilities—spanning Logs Insights, Container Insights, Lambda Insights, Database Insights, and Application Signals—empower DevOps teams to monitor and optimize distributed applications effectively. Attendees will explore strategies for implementing observability in these modern architectures. Participants will learn to leverage these tools for continuous deployments, synthetic testing, and real-time performance optimization in modern application environments, enabling faster innovation cycles while maintaining reliability at scale.

title: Drive Supply Chain Innovation Using AWS Cloud and AI Solutions
abstract: As supply chains grow increasingly complex, companies are using the cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and internet of things (IoT) to gain better, faster insights and reduce costs. Hear how Sysco, the global leader in foodservice distribution, executed a strategic cloud migration to enhance scalability, improve warehouse efficiency, and develop a foundation to accelerate AI use cases. You will also learn how McDonald's, one of the world’s largest restaurant chains, built innovative AI-powered solutions to improve supply chain traceability and automate inventory tracking.

title: Drive trusted AI outcomes with governance and accurate data (sponsored by IBM)
abstract: Learn how to power accurate and trusted agents at scale with AI-ready data and governance. This presentation is brought to you by IBM, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Drive trusted AI outcomes with governance and accurate data (sponsored by IBM)

title: Driving AI Innovation at the Enterprise Level with MDB Atlas (sponsored by MongoDB)
abstract: Achieve breakthroughs in AI innovation with the right data foundation. MongoDB Atlas on AWS seamlessly unifies siloed enterprise data into an Operational Data Layer (ODL), making it actionable and secure. With built-in features like search, vector search, and VoyageAI-driven embeddings, Atlas accelerates the creation of AI solutions while removing complexity. Discover how businesses are driving transformation at scale with a streamlined approach to data and innovation. This presentation is brought to you by MongoDB, an AWS Partner.

title: Driving Autonomous Operations with Data Sharing and Agentic AI
abstract: Agentic AI is essential for autonomous decision-making in industrial operations. These systems require complete and reliable data from both internal operations and external supply chain processes to function effectively. In this Chalk Talk, learn about the fundamentals and applications of agentic systems in manufacturing operations and see how AWS helps with efficient data access along the value chain to improve the quality of autonomous processes. Learn how data spaces, EDI, and native AWS services such as Amazon SageMaker provide established means for governed, cross-company data sharing at scale.

title: Driving Intelligent Project Portfolio Visibility with AWS + Smartsheet (sponsored by Smartsheet)
abstract: Imagine a world where you can identify and mitigate risk across thousands of projects effortlessly. True visibility means anticipating what’s next—risks, dependencies, and delivery challenges. In this session, learn how Smartsheet and AWS deliver intelligent portfolio visibility, dynamic work orchestration, and confident decision-making at enterprise scale—going beyond static dashboards to transform how you manage work. This presentation is brought to you by Smartsheet, an AWS Partner.

title: Driving modernization using Mphasis’ Agentic AI framework (sponsored by Mphasis)
abstract: Mphasis’ Agentic AI framework is redefining enterprise modernization by orchestrating intelligent agents across the software lifecycle. Built on AWS and powered by NeoZeta™, NeoCrux™, and NeoSaba™, Mphasis is revolutionizing enterprise modernization. NeoZeta™ accelerates legacy transformation through AI-driven code analysis and knowledge graph generation. NeoCrux™ enhances developer productivity with forward engineering, CI/CD integration, and GenAI-assisted coding. NeoSaba™ empowers product owners with agile artifact generation and compliance automation. Built on AWS and integrated with Bedrock and LLM Ops, this framework ensures scalable, secure, and responsible AI adoption. Join us to explore how Mphasis and AWS are shaping the future. This presentation is brought to you by Mphasis, an AWS Partner.

title: Driving Profitable Growth with Generative AI: From Prompt to Product
abstract: Generative AI is the largest disruption to software company business models since the emergence of SaaS. In this session we'll cover best practices software companies use to take AI-native products from pilot to production, including identifying use cases that drive business value, features that accelerate adoption and pricing strategies that result in profitable growth

title: Driving Resilience with Assurance and Visibility from Edge to Cloud (sponsored by Cisco)
abstract: In today’s complex digital environments, traditional monitoring leaves critical gaps—especially across third-party, SaaS, and cloud networks. This session shows how the integration of Splunk’s real-time observability with ThousandEyes’ end-to-end assurance eliminates blind spots and empowers Ops teams to move from reactive to proactive. See how this unified approach accelerates root cause analysis, reduces downtime, and keeps digital experiences resilient—no matter where issues arise. This presentation is brought to you by Cisco, an AWS Partner.

title: DynamoDB zero-trust architecture: Advanced access controls
abstract: In this session, learn how to implement comprehensive zero-trust security architectures for Amazon DynamoDB applications. Explore advanced IAM policy design, attribute-based access control, and integration with enterprise identity systems. Deep dive into fine-grained permissions, dynamic policy evaluation, and automated compliance monitoring. Also, discover real-world patterns for multi-tenant applications, data isolation strategies, and audit logging. This session is essential for enterprises implementing zero-trust security models requiring granular access control, continuous verification, and comprehensive security monitoring while maintaining application performance and developer productivity.

title: Easily port .NET applications to Linux with AWS Transform for .NET
abstract: In this workshop, gain hands-on experience porting a .NET Framework application to cross-platform .NET. Use AWS Transform for .NET, a modernization service powered by agentic AI that significantly reduces the time to migrate applications from Windows Server to Linux. Learn how migrating to Linux helps you avoid additional licensing fees and gain performance and security benefits.

title: EC2 Fleet: Your Swiss Army Knife for Large-Scale Compute Orchestration
abstract: Dive deep into advanced EC2 Fleet configurations in this technical session. We'll examine complex architectural patterns using instance weighting for optimal compute capacity distribution, implementation of hybrid capacity models combining On-Demand and Spot instances, and sophisticated capacity reservation strategies. Through code-heavy demonstrations, we'll explore programmatic fleet management, custom weighting algorithms, capacity block integration for GPU workloads, and advanced monitoring solutions. You'll walk away knowing how to implement complex capacity management patterns and architect enterprise-scale solutions using EC2 Fleet's advanced APIs and configuration options.

title: EC2 Flex instances: Get latest generation performance at lower costs
abstract: EC2 Flex instances provide the easiest way to get latest generation performance at lower costs for a majority of your workloads. In this session, we will dive deep into the Flex instances, what workloads are most suitable for Flex, how they are designed, ways customers can adopt and monitor the performance experience.

title: Edge AI in Real-World Solutions using AWS SageMaker, Greengrass and Bedrock (sponsored by Qualcomm)
abstract: Join us to learn how deploying AI in physical systems can offer speed, efficiency and cost savings. We’ll explore a real-world use case of defect detection in manufacturing to show how Edge AI can be applied from incident alert to diagnosis. Walk through practical applications of AWS SageMaker models running on edge devices based on Qualcomm® Dragonwing™ processors and how you can integrate AWS IoT Greengrass and Amazon Bedrock for a host of triggered actions and recommendations. We’ll also show how you can transform legacy devices by adding intelligence and connecting them to the cloud, including how you can use Qualcomm AI Hub and Edge Impulse with AWS solutions to optimize, deploy and maintain your Edge AI implementations. This presentation is brought to you by Qualcomm, an AWS Partner.

title: Effective strategies for testing serverless event-driven applications
abstract: Elevate your automated testing skills for serverless and event-driven applications in this highly anticipated, interactive chalk talk. Explore strategies and best practices through code samples and whiteboard demos. Learn techniques like emulation, mocking, and testing in the cloud. Discuss using cutting-edge tools like Generative AI and new AWS Lambda developer experience features to increase efficiency. Gain insights into common structures and patterns that make your tests effective, useful, and easy to understand. Leave equipped with practical knowledge to future-proof your cloud-native applications by implementing robust automated testing.

title: Efficient AI model customization for agentic workflows
abstract: Join us to learn a practical and cost-effective way to customize AI models using spectrum-aware fine-tuning and fully managed training experience provided by Amazon SageMaker training jobs. We'll demonstrate how this method precisely updates only the most important parts of an AI model, making the process faster and more affordable than traditional approaches. Through real-world examples, we'll show how to train language models for high-accuracy task completion and decision-making in agentic workflows. This session will provide you with hands-on knowledge to make your AI training more efficient, helping you save both time and money while building more capable AI agents.

title: Elastic Load Balancing cookbook: Advanced recipes for ALB and NLB
abstract: Join this interactive chalk talk and deep dive into Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) best practices focused on optimizing application performance. Explore strategic decisions for choosing between Application Load Balancer (ALB) and Network Load Balancer (NLB) implementations, while exploring cost optimization strategies and performance-tuning techniques. In this session, discover how to architect resilient load balancing solutions that scale effortlessly, optimize traffic distribution across Availability Zones (AZs), and leverage advanced routing features. Through real-world case studies of high-traffic systems and emerging microservices deployment patterns, participants will explore how recent ELB innovations are transforming cloud architectures. Bring your challenges – let's solve them together.

title: Elevate application and generative AI observability
abstract: This session demonstrates how to leverage Amazon CloudWatch's comprehensive observability capabilities for both traditional applications and generative AI workloads. Customers building generative AI-powered workloads face challenges in understanding end-user outcomes, AI performance, health, accuracy, and quality issues at scale. Whether you're dealing with high latency, excessive token consumption, or unexpected errors, Amazon CloudWatch's pre-built dashboards provide comprehensive monitoring capabilities and insights into end-user outcomes, AI performance, health, and accuracy. Learn how observability can help bring reliability across your entire application stack.

title: Elevate Multi-Tenant SaaS Operations: DevOps Strategy with Kubernetes
abstract: Is your SaaS platform ready to scale from hundreds to thousands of customers while maintaining operational efficiency? Join this hands-on builders session to create a production-grade DevOps strategy using Kubernetes, addressing the challenges of managing multiple environments while onboarding tenants across different tiers. Working directly with an AWS expert, you'll implement automated tenant management and progressive release strategies using tools like Argo Workflows, Flux, and Helm. Learn how platform engineering can help you overcome SaaS DevOps complexities, reduce operational overhead, and safely test your new features with early adopter customers.

title: Elevate Streaming Quality with AI: Prime Video's Innovative Approach
abstract: Learn how Prime Video leverages AI to transform global streaming experiences. We'll demonstrate our innovative use of generative AI to enhance quality for premium content like NBA and NFL games. Explore our cutting-edge AI system for artwork and quality moderation, built on AWS services including Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q. Discover how these solutions maintain exceptional quality of experience across millions of concurrent streams worldwide.

title: Elevating application reliability
abstract: Discover how to build and maintain resilient infrastructure using AWS native services, including Amazon CloudWatch, AWS Systems Manager, and AWS CloudTrail. We'll demonstrate automatic anomaly detection and preventive measures implementation. Explore robust logging architectures for rapid incident investigation and continuous operational visibility. Learn to use generative AI for accelerated incident analysis and automated response playbooks. Whether dealing with infrastructure failures, security incidents, or performance degradation, you'll gain practical architectures and implementation patterns to enhance your organization's resilience and minimize recovery time. Walk away with actionable strategies for maintaining operational excellence at scale.

title: Embedded Software Development in the Agentic AI Era
abstract: Experience a transformed embedded software development process, with AI agents that automatically scan for new requirements, proactively propose code changes and tests to meet the requirements, and automated CI pipelines with virtualized hardware environemnts to validate the changes. In this session we will create a new feature to an automotive instrument cluster, implement it live, and go into depth on each of the elements that accelerate the process with all code available to download to replicate the process yourself.

title: Empower development teams with AI-driven automation
abstract: In this hands-on session, attendees will explore how AI can transform a software development team’s work. Attendees will learn how AI agents integrate seamlessly with existing tools and workflows, leveraging deep contextual understanding to tackle challenges like technical debt, performance optimization, and operational campaigns. We'll cover the key features that enable transparent collaboration, continuous learning, and adaptive automation. Attendees will leave with an understanding of how AI-driven development tools can revolutionize the software delivery lifecycle. Whether you're a developer, engineering manager, or technology leader, this session will show you the future of autonomous software development.

title: Empowering communities - create fun events on AWS services
abstract: Currently, the community has around 10 different processes involving inputs across more than 7 data platforms for the creation and management of events. The goal is to automate processes such as giveaways, messaging, and games to reduce licensing and operational costs. the session aim to leverage AWS innovation to simplify and enhance community management in Brasília. By uniting local processes with scalable cloud services, the session empower enthusiasts to organise meetups, Community Days, and events with speed, security, and accessibility. AWS User Groups are community-led groups where builders meet to discuss the latest in AWS Cloud, learn new skills from.

title: Empowering innovation with integrity—Responsible AI for a smarter, safer future (sponsored by Kyndryl)
abstract: Kyndryl will share insights on Security and Trust in AI. In today’s fast-paced digital world, powered by generative AI, protecting data and ensuring ethical use is vital. Effective governance enables privacy, security, and AI optimization. Companies must promote responsible data usage, respect rights, and support ethical AI. Ensuring secure, compliant, and unbiased AI agents is key. Kyndryl excels in offensive security, cloud and AI protection, regulatory readiness, and risk mitigation. We provide expert consulting, implementation, and ongoing support across AWS-enabled platforms to help customers achieve operational excellence and build trust. This presentation is brought to you by Kyndryl, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Empowering innovation with integrity—Responsible AI for a smarter, safer future (sponsored by Kyndryl)

speakers.jobTitle: Security & Resilience Global Consult @ GTM leader
speakers.globalJobtitle: Security & Resilience Global Consult @ GTM leader

title: Empowering SMBs: Streamlined Security & Resilience Automation on AWS
abstract: Discover how SMBs can implement robust security and resilience strategies using AWS' powerful automation capabilities. This interactive session showcases practical approaches to enhance your security posture while ensuring business continuity. Learn to leverage AWS Security and Resilience suite of services to create streamlined security monitoring, proactive threat protection, and reliable recovery workflows. Bring your questions as we collaboratively design solutions that maximize your security confidence and operational resilience—all optimized for business and ready to grow without expanding IT teams.

title: Enabling AI innovation with Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio
abstract: Many enterprises want to build a culture of AI innovation and manage it at scale. Learn how a leading financial institution implemented a unified data and AI platform with built-in governance to solve this challenge. Using the next generation of Amazon SageMaker, their petabyte-scale solution enables users to discover and access data in a cloud-native marketplace then build  in a unified data and AI development environment. This session is ideal for data and platform leaders looking to balance self-service capabilities with robust governance to enable AI initiatives.

title: Enabling government to streamline and ensure healthcare coverage with data
abstract: Covered California serves nearly 14 million residents, where success depends on data — verified, analyzed, and activated at scale. In this session, learn how Covered California uses AWS to power identity verification with AI/ML, automate call center operations with agentic technologies, and build data pipelines that pinpoint citizens and residents most at risk of losing healthcare coverage. Attendees will walk away with a blueprint for using Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL, Databricks on AWS, Amazon Connect, and AI/ML services to turn complex, regulated datasets into actionable insights. The session highlights architectures, automation approaches, and lessons learned to help government leaders unlock data as the enabler of secure, citizen-focused innovation.

title: Enabling secure AI Agent access with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Identity
abstract: Learn how to implement robust access controls for AI agents in modern applications using AWS services. This session covers essential patterns for AI agent authentication and authorization using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Identity.  We'll demonstrate practical architectures that help ensure AI agents operate securely within defined boundaries while maintaining full visibility across your AWS environment.

title: End-to-End Automotive Simulation: From Design to Analysis on AWS
abstract: Traditional automotive CFD workflows face challenges with complex multi-platform environments and data management. Watch a live demonstration of an end-to-end aerodynamic simulation workflow using AWS Research and Engineering Studio. See how Windows-based design tools connect seamlessly with Linux HPC resources through AWS Parallel Computing Service, all sharing data via FSx for NetApp ONTAP. Experience how this integrated environment accelerates automotive design cycles by eliminating platform barriers and infrastructure complexity. Learn how to implement similar workflows for your engineering teams.

title: End-to-end foundation model lifecycle on AWS Trainium
abstract: Dive into the journey of a foundation model on AWS Trainium, from distributed training to fine-tuning and deployment. This talk showcases how to optimize each of these stages using Neuron SDK. We'll demonstrate the use of the Neuron Profiler to pinpoint bottlenecks and guide you through writing and integrating Neuron Kernel Interface (NKI) kernels to achieve peak performance. Explore real-world examples of how organizations are leveraging these techniques to accelerate their AI workloads and reduce costs.

title: Energy HPC Orchestrator: A Cloud Native HPC Workflows Management Application
abstract: The Energy HPC Orchestrator (EHO) is a transformative platform revolutionizing energy High Performance Computing applications, particularly in seismic imaging and reservoir simulations. This collaborative initiative by AWS, developed with industry leaders like Shell and Occidental, creates an open marketplace for operators, software providers, and academia. EHO enables delivery of innovative seismic processing and state-of-the-art HPC algorithms while focusing on interoperability, scalability, and cost efficiency. The platform provides pre-optimized cloud native HPC templates and fosters a competitive environment that drives innovation. Through this ecosystem, partners can concentrate on developing their unique technologies while leveraging optimized infrastructure and workflows.

title: Engineering for 90% accuracy in real-world agentic AI applications
abstract: Reliability has been a bottleneck to production-grade agents. While many agentic AI applications are able to deliver greater than 90% accuracy in benchmarks and evaluations, implementing agents that deliver this accuracy consistently in real-world environments has been a challenge. Learn how the Amazon Nova engineering team has approached this challenge to deliver accuracy and end-to-end reliability for real-world browser interaction use cases. You will also get to engage with fellow builders on how they are approaching reliability issues in their agentic AI implementations.

title: Engineering Intelligence: Multi-Agent AI Systems for Industrials
abstract: Join us for this expert level talk where we will dive deep into implementing scalable multi-agent AI architectures. Learn from real world implementations by AWS partners as we showcase how to build and orchestrate intelligent systems using Amazon Bedrock, enhanced with MCP, Strands Agents SDK, and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. This technical session will explore repeatable multi-agent patterns for process optimization and role specific task distribution, enabling you to enhance your software solutions or consulting practice. Discover architectural best practices and POC to production implementation strategies that you can apply to create sophisticated AI systems for your customers. Perfect for partners, architects and developers looking to leverage multi-agent frameworks in production environments.

title: Enhance and Scale Agents with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
abstract: Experience end-to-end deployment of AI agents using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Learn to prepare agents for production, create IAM roles, and deploy to a fully managed, scalable environment. Gain hands-on experience with AgentCore's key benefits, including simplified deployment, automatic scaling, built-in security, cost optimization, and operational excellence features. Ideal for developers transitioning from AI experimentation to production-ready agent deployments.

title: Enhance customer service efficiency with AI-powered email workflows
abstract: Discover how to build intelligent email processing systems in Amazon Connect using AI-powered intent detection. This session will show you how to develop solutions that automatically classify customer emails, extract key information, and generate pre-populated cases using natural language processing. You'll learn practical techniques for email categorization, entity extraction, smart routing, and handling ambiguous communications through confidence scoring. Leave with the knowledge to implement advanced email triage systems that significantly improve your customer service workflow efficiency.

title: Enhance GenAI Outcomes in Telecom with Domain Specific Fine-Tuning
abstract: Leading CSPs, such as e&, Omantel, BT, and SKT, are adopting domain-specific language models for autonomous operations and better customer experience. AWS helps telcos standardize network data from multiple vendors, integrate it through MCP servers, and apply preprocessing for fine-tuning. Bi-lingual foundation models are customized for telecom tasks and deployed via AWS Strands for topology discovery, root cause analysis, incident fixes, and CX chatbots. SKT achieved 58% better 5G issue detection, while other providers use AWS to build SLMs that transform network operations and customer engagement—while maintaining transparency and operational control.

title: Enhance legacy applications with modern gen AI features
abstract: In this hands-on workshop, learn how to architect and implement AI capabilities into existing applications through event-driven architectures. You'll establish a data pipeline for change data capture, create near real-time embeddings for a RAG knowledge base, and build an AI-powered chatbot. The workshop will demonstrate how to integrate MCP servers to enable system connections and natural language automation capabilities, allowing your solution to bridge multiple tools through AI-assisted workflows.

title: Enhance your Amazon EKS development workflow with MCP
abstract: Dive into the power of Model Context Protocol (MCP) to enhance your development workflow on Amazon EKS. In this hands-on session, developers and platform engineers will learn to leverage generative AI capabilities and agent-based tools to streamline common platform tasks, automate workflows, and boost productivity. Experience autonomous agents executing complex operations, intelligent code assistance, and advanced prompt engineering techniques. Gain practical experience in intergrating Amazon Q CLI into your existing Kubernetes development processes, to make platform management more efficient and intuitive.

title: Enhance your applications with Amazon QuickSight embedded analytics
abstract: Unleash data’s true potential with Amazon Q in QuickSight. In this session, discover how conversational AI can build dashboards in minutes, not hours. Explore how business users can create interactive data stories and presentations in seconds to drive decisions and distill key insights from data not shown in dashboards with the data Q&A experience and executive summaries. Hear from AWS customers on how they empowered their workforce with Generative BI and eliminated manual reporting bottlenecks, unlocked deeper insights, and gained a competitive edge with Amazon QuickSight.

title: Enhancing container security with Amazon ECR
abstract: Discover how Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) helps organizations strengthen their container security posture through automated security controls and seamless integrations. This lightning talk demonstrates Amazon ECR's security capabilities that enable organizations to ensure container image integrity throughout their deployment pipeline. Through practical examples, learn how Amazon ECR helps implement security best practices while reducing operational overhead. Whether you're running containers on Amazon EKS, Amazon ECS, or in hybrid environments, see how Amazon ECR's security features can help protect your containerized workloads.

title: Enhancing public sector efficiency with Agentic AI
abstract: Government agencies face challenges in delivering a unified service experience to their citizens. This session demonstrates how Agentic AI and AWS can help to deliver a highly-connected service experience in the public sector leveraging technologies such as the Strands Agents framework and the Model Context Protocol (MCP). In this workshop, attendees will build an Agent supporting a self-service experience enabling the navigation of local government programs, robust qualification checks, and an application filing experience. Join us as we spark ideas that will help you transform service delivery for your citizens in an safe, efficient, and equitable way.

title: Enhancing security visibility: building scalable log analytics
abstract: Unlock the power of centralized security monitoring in AWS by learning how to effectively integrate Amazon CloudWatch logs, Amazon OpenSearch and AWS CloudTrail. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll demonstrate scalable solutions for comprehensive log analysis and real-time threat detection. Discover practical techniques for creating custom security dashboards, implementing automated alerting, and establishing compliance monitoring workflows. Through live examples, we'll show you how to build a robust security observability framework that scales with your organization's needs. Perfect for security professionals seeking to enhance their cloud security posture.

title: Enterprise AI applications with Amazon Nova understanding models
abstract: This workshop will get attendees hands-on with the capabilities of Nova understanding models and learn how Nova models integrate with key Bedrock features like Model Distillation, Knowledge Bases, and Bedrock Guardrails. Attendees will have the opportunity to engage in exercises using the Console and Converse API for text, image, and video understanding tasks.

title: Enterprise AI Without the Chaos: A New Path to Secure, Compliant Applications  (sponsored by Docker)
abstract: AI innovation is exploding, but the abundance of tools and models often leaves developers overwhelmed and enterprises at risk. Moving from experimentation to production requires more than speed, it demands security, scalability, and compliance. This session shows how cloud-native practices with Docker and AWS provide a clear path forward. Learn how familiar workflows can cut through the noise, accelerate deployment, and align with enterprise standards. Leave with a blueprint for building AI applications that are robust, modular, and enterprise-ready. This presentation is brought to you by Docker, an AWS Partner.

title: Enterprise CI/CD: Advanced patterns for resilient deployments
abstract: Advanced architectural patterns enable resilient, enterprise-grade CI/CD pipelines through progressive delivery strategies. The implementation covers automated canary analysis, multi-region blue-green deployments, and self-healing pipelines with automated rollbacks. Technical examples demonstrate mapping business requirements to pipeline-as-code, event-driven orchestration, and policy-as-code security enforcement. The architecture incorporates observability patterns, distributed tracing across deployment stages, and automated failure analysis for complex deployment scenarios at scale.

title: Enterprise-scale App Modernization with Agentic AI through TSRI's JANUS Studio (sponsored by TSRI)
abstract: JANUS Studio’s Composite AI-driven capabilities revolutionize mainframe and legacy systems modernization. Proven automated application transformation reduces technical debt, lowers TCO & delivers massive ROI. Rapidly migrate apps, databases & user interfaces to modern languages in cloud-native architectures. Enable innovation, while maintaining security & compliance standards. And, leverage advanced refactoring & rearchitecting rules for strategic containerization, event-driven orchestration, database schema transformation & cloud-based microservices integration. See real-world examples of mission-critical workloads successfully migrated to AWS across the Public & Private sectors. This presentation is brought to you by TSRI, an AWS Partner.

title: Enterprise-scale ETL optimization for Apache Spark
abstract: Unlock the full potential of your ETL workflows by mastering Apache Spark optimization techniques in AWS Glue, Amazon EMR, and Amazon SageMaker. This session demonstrates advanced strategies for accelerating data processing, including Spark configuration tuning, partition management, and memory optimization. Learn to leverage AWS native integration with Spark to implement parallel processing, caching strategies, and efficient data shuffling techniques. Discover how to monitor performance metrics and identify bottlenecks in a visual studio. Expert advice to help you implement these optimizations in real-world scenarios, resulting in significantly faster ETL processing times.

title: Enterprise software licensing and optimization on AWS
abstract: This breakout session dives into licensing commercial software on AWS, with a focus on Microsoft workloads. Join our Microsoft Optimization and Licensing Assessment (OLA) specialists to explore the best practices for navigating licensing complexities in the cloud while maximizing cost-efficiency. Learn about fully-funded OLA offerings for on-premises workloads, cloud to AWS migrations, existing EC2 deployments, and the new self-serve AWS Transform Assessments. Discover how these assessments provide valuable insights and right-sizing recommendations across multiple services such as Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2).

title: Epic journey: Navigating the AI-powered SDLC from backlog to production
abstract: Developers, join an epic journey as we follow a humble backlog item through the winding path of the software development lifecycle from user story to deployment. Most developers spend less than an hour per day writing code. So why do focus so much attention on using AI to write code faster? In this session you will learn how Amazon Q Developer can help you with every stage of the SDLC.

title: Essentials for migrating from Oracle to Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL
abstract: Migrating from Oracle to Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition can be a transformative journey, offering significant cost savings and performance benefits. However, this transition requires careful planning and execution. In this chalk talk, discover the essential things you need to know to ensure a smooth and successful migration from Oracle to Aurora PostgreSQL and the optimal architectures to enable such a migration. Learn best practices and pitfalls to avoid from our seasoned experts, who have helped many customers walk this path.

title: Establish a secure AWS foundation with AWS Control Tower
abstract: Organizations operating in the cloud want to be able to move quickly while remaining secure. In this workshop, you will learn how AWS Control Tower provides the capabilities to simplify the building, management, and governance of a multi-account AWS environment. Gain hands-on experience with using AWS Control Tower, including enrolling accounts, automating account customization, and establishing security controls.

title: Establishing effective cost governance
abstract: In this chalk talk, we'll explore strategies and tools for robust cost governance that scale with your business. Learn how to design and enforce financial guardrails, implement proactive cost controls, and establish effective FinOps practices across your AWS environment. We'll discuss key governance mechanisms including policy management, budget controls, and anomaly detection, while also addressing considerations for multi-account environments using AWS Organizations.

title: Estimating workload costs using AWS Pricing Calculator
abstract: Before migrating or building workloads on the cloud, you want to quickly evaluate options and understand the cost impact of different engineering choices. In this interactive session, learn how to approach cost estimation on AWS, best practices for using the AWS Pricing Calculator to strengthen your forecasting, and strategies to drive a cost aware culture by shifting left.

title: Evaluating AI agents: real-world lessons from Amazon's agent systems
abstract: Roll up your sleeves for this interactive session where we'll whiteboard Amazon's frameworks for evaluating complex AI agents in production. Through collaborative discussion and real-world examples from our shopping, seller support, and advertising agents, we'll break down how to measure AI performance beyond traditional metrics. We'll sketch out approaches for assessing language model reasoning, tool usage, and memory management. Bring your questions as we dive deep into practical evaluation methods and share lessons learned from implementing human-in-the-loop processes. This technical session includes hands-on architecture discussions and group problem-solving.

title: Evaluating architectural trade-offs: Cloud patterns for flexibility
abstract: Transform traditional lock-in concerns into strategic architectural decisions using practical evaluation frameworks. Learn how organizations leverage proven analysis tools to assess switching costs against unique service capabilities. Explore patterns for determining when AWS-native services provide the best value versus when portability matters most. Through real-world examples, discover how to make pragmatic architectural choices that maximize business impact. Gain actionable strategies for balancing strategic flexibility with AWS-optimized patterns.

title: Evaluating the right model for video intelligence
abstract: This session provides a comprehensive framework for model selection in video intelligence applications, focusing on horizontal use cases like video search, content analysis, and automated tagging. We’ll dive into the capabilities, trade-offs, and optimal applications of different multimodal models available on Amazon Bedrock, including Amazon Nova models, Anthropic Claude models, and multimodal embedding models. We'll provide guidance on how to evaluate models for specific video tasks and strategies for rapid prototyping that lead to production-ready solutions. The session emphasizes practical model evaluation techniques, helping teams move beyond trial-and-error approaches to systematic model selection that aligns with business requirements and technical constraints.

title: EverCommerce’s Secret to AI-Ready, Multi-Brand Data (sponsored by Fivetran)
abstract:
EverCommerce, a parent company of 50+ independently operated brands, began their data journey with decentralized, brand-specific analytics. As the demand for cross-brand visibility and AI-powered use cases grew, they leveraged Fivetran as the foundation of a major re-platforming effort - shifting from fragmented AWS infrastructure to a centralized Amazon S3 data lake architecture. 

In this session, discover how EverCommerce consolidated siloed systems, standardized marketing data across brands, and reduced manual effort of onboarding new brands with Fivetran’s automated data movement. Learn how this unified data foundation now enables AI workloads like predictive analytics and intelligent personalization across the organization. This presentation is brought to you by Fivetran, an AWS Partner.

session.title: EverCommerce’s Secret to AI-Ready, Multi-Brand Data (sponsored by Fivetran)

title: Everything you've wanted to know about performance on EC2 instances
abstract: Getting the best compute performance is a bit of an art, and knowing about low level details can help a lot. This code talk covers all the details you've always wanted to know about, such as memory topology, how to get access to hardware counters, how to take into account the side-effects of hyperthreading, and how to properly run performance tests and optimize your latency.

title: Evolve Amazon DynamoDB data models with no application impact
abstract: Master advanced techniques for evolving Amazon DynamoDB data models without application interruption. Learn versioning strategies, backward compatibility patterns, and migration approaches for production applications. In this chalk talk, architect a solution that covers attribute addition/removal, data type changes, and index modifications while maintaining 24/7 availability. Interactively, you will explore real-world migration scenarios, rollback strategies, and handling distributed application dependencies. The best practices covered in this session are essential for teams managing large-scale DynamoDB applications requiring continuous evolution while serving millions of requests.

title: Expand Agent Capabilities with AgentCore Gateway and Tools
abstract: Build more capable agents in less time by integrating the tools they need to act. In this workshop, you’ll get hands-on with Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Gateway to quickly convert internal APIs and Lambda functions into agent-ready tools, while also adding AWS-built capabilities like secure web browsing and code execution with just a few lines of code. Learn to manage tool discovery, authentication, and invocation through a unified, composable interface. Whether you’re connecting SaaS systems or enabling document analysis, you’ll leave with practical skills to make your agents faster, smarter, and production-ready.

title: Expand Amazon WorkSpaces monitoring capabilities with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Leverage the power of AI with Amazon WorkSpaces to ennhance observability, optimize cloud desktop performance, and accelerate time-to-resolution. This session provides attendees with hands-on experience using Amazon Bedrock agentic AI to automate Amazon WorkSpaces and Amazon CloudWatch to obtain and analyze important metrics and logs. Key session topics include an WorkSpaces portfolio overview, automation with Amazon Bedrock, and hands-on exercises using CloudWatch. Join us for this interactive and informative session to elevate your organization's EUC strategy and gain skills needed to empower your workforce and drive success in the digital age. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Expanding agentic AI: Accelerate, optimize and scale generative AI
abstract: Agentic AI introduces a new layer of intelligence: systems that don’t just predict, but act. AWS Partners play a critical role in helping customers build, integrate and scale agentic workflows. Join us as we walk through a few of the most prevelant agentic use cases from 2025 and into 2026 looking at how partners are accelerating agentic AI with AWS.

title: Expedite model loading times in Kubernetes using kro & ACK
abstract: LLM models cause significant inference latency on EKS/GPUs due to slow loading. The Storage>Network>CPU>PCIe>GPU data path bottlenecks loading latency. In this session learn how different AWS storage solutions enable direct, optimized model loading to GPU memory. We compare Amazon S3 (object), Amazon EFS (shared), and Amazon FSx for Lustre (high-performance for local GPU disk caching) in expediting data delivery. Using Kubernetes Resource Orchestrator (kro) and AWS Controllers for Kubernetes (ACK) simplifies resource provisioning and it streamlines managing these optimized storage solutions . Learn to diagnose bottlenecks, select optimal storage, and implement advanced strategies for rapid LLM inference on Amazon EKS.

title: Experience T-Mobile's Digital Commerce in Action
abstract: Join this technical deep-dive revealing how T-Mobile built their mission-critical platform that handles 200 million daily transactions across 130+ million subscribers with zero-downtime. Discover the serverless-first architecture powering the _T-Mobile website_, T-Life, and 8,000 retail locations that automatically scales from baseline to major device launches and other holiday events. Learn the secrets behind active-active deployment that achieved 99.99% availability through chaos engineering and intelligent failover mechanisms. Uncover how T-Mobile's AI-powered operations reduced MTTR by using machine learning automation that predicts capacity needs and optimizes resource allocation. Walk away with battle-tested architectural patterns for security, scaling, and resiliency.

title: Explore Advanced features of Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL
abstract: This lab explores Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL's advanced features: Cluster Cache Management (CCM) and Query Plan Management (QPM). With PostgreSQL becoming a critical  database to modern enterprise data and AI workflows, learn to implement these features for real-world scenarios like banking, and analytics applications. Practice configuring CCM for optimal failover performance and QPM for consistent query execution. Ideal for developers and database administrators managing high-availability applications requiring consistent performance.

title: Explore AI customization techniques with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Learn how companies are transforming generic foundation models into powerful, cost-effective solutions tailored to their specific business needs. We'll explore fine-tuning, custom model import, model distillation, and recent customization capabilities that help you build custom AI solutions tailored to your use case. Discover technical implementation details, best practices, and business scenarios where each technique excels, along with inference options in Amazon Bedrock. Through real-world benchmarks, see how these approaches drive better performance. Leave with actionable knowledge to select and implement the right customization strategy for your use cases.

title: Explore what’s new in data and AI governance with SageMaker Catalog
abstract: Join this session to learn about the latest capabilities in Amazon SageMaker Catalog that help organizations govern data and AI more effectively. We will walk through new features that make it easier to discover, govern, and securely share structured and unstructured data, models, business intelligence dashboards, and applications. You’ll hear how customers are using these capabilities to improve data discovery and access, streamline compliance, and support AI initiatives.

title: Explore zero-downtime deployment strategies for production LLMs
abstract: In the rapidly evolving LLM landscape, safely upgrading production AI systems can present unique challenges. AI models can have subtle reasoning shifts, different response styles, and prompt compatibility issues. Explore implementing two proven deployment strategies for Amazon Bedrock applications: blue-green deployment (maintaining two identical environments, instantly switching 100% of traffic between old and new models) and canary deployment (gradually routing small percentages of users to new models while monitoring performance). Learn practical architectures for progressive rollouts, evaluation frameworks to detect semantic regressions, controlled traffic-shifting techniques, and automated guardrails that enable enterprises to adopt new model capabilities without disrupting user experience.

title: Exploring dual pathways to agentic commerce with AWS and Stripe (sponsored by Stripe)
abstract: The retail environment is changing with the emergence of gen AI–powered agents—intelligent storefronts that discover, recommend, and transact on behalf of shoppers. In this new era of agentic commerce, two pathways are taking shape: business to agent (B2A), where external answer engines connect customers with products, and agent to consumer (A2C), where retailers deploy custom on-site agents using solutions such as AWS’s gen AI stack. In both journeys, trust and simplicity at checkout are key. Discover how AWS and Stripe allow for real-time transaction analytics, automated fraud detection, and tailored payment solutions—helping retailers convert product discovery into revenue while simplifying operations and boosting conversion rates. This presentation is brought to you by Stripe, an AWS Partner.

title: Exploring hybrid quantum-classical computing with Amazon Braket
abstract: Hybrid algorithms, combining quantum and classical compute resources, are widely believed to be promising candidates for the first demonstrations of useful applications of quantum computers. Linear systems of equations, which play an important role in science and technology, are one such area where hybrid algorithms have been explored. In this workshop, learn how to use Amazon Braket Hybrid Jobs to implement the Variational Quantum Linear Solver algorithm to solve linear systems of equations on real quantum computers. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Exploring Multi-tenant Cost Allocation for Container Workloads
abstract: Dive into advanced techniques for cost allocation and observability across AWS containerized workloads. Learn how to leverage the power of AWS Split Cost Allocation Data feature for Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS. We'll guide you through best practices for tagging, labeling, and analyzing spend to enhance cost visibility and accountability across your container environments. You'll also get hands-on experience with Amazon Managed Grafana, creating dynamic dashboards to visualize and monitor your containerized workloads in real-time.

title: Exploring the Spectrum of Architecture Patterns for 3D Rendering
abstract: Navigate AWS's comprehensive suite of rendering solutions for spatial computing applications. From GPU-powered EC2 G instances to EC2 Mac 3D reconstructions, distributed rendering with Deadline Cloud, and real-time streaming via GameLift Streams, discover the optimal path for your 3D content delivery needs. Learn architecture patterns, cost optimization strategies, and best practices through practical examples. Whether you're building games, architectural visualizations, or AR/VR experiences, understand how to leverage AWS services to scale your rendering pipeline effectively.

title: Extend Amazon EKS clusters for on-premises and edge use cases
abstract: Dive deep into strategies for modernizing distributed applications with Amazon EKS across AWS Regions, AWS Local Zones, and AWS Outposts. This chalk talk demonstrates how EKS delivers a consistent experience across these deployment options, minimizing latency and enabling data residency. Through a real-world scenario, we'll deploy an application to an EKS cluster, showcasing seamless integration across distributed environments while maintaining a unified control plane. By exploring practical use cases and best practices, you'll gain actionable insights into architecting resilient and scalable applications. This session follows AWS Well-Architected Framework principles, helping you optimize your AWS deployments for consistency and security.

title: Extending governance across clouds
abstract: Building effective governance across multiple clouds? Learn how to architect AWS foundations while adapting to different cloud providers' organizational models. This session compares and contrasts management and governance approaches across major cloud providers, with special focus on AWS best practices. Explore similarities and differences in identity management, resource organization, and access controls. Discover practical strategies for implementing consistent security policies, cost management, and compliance controls. Learn how to handle cross-cloud resource tagging, billing structures, and operational monitoring. Walk away with actionable insights for designing your AWS foundation while maintaining effective multi-cloud governance

title: Extend Kiro with MCP support for richer context
abstract: Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open protocol that standardizes how AI models can, in a secure and structured way, access external tools, data sources, and APIs. Join this session to  learn best practices on how to securely implement MCP server-based tools to enhance development workflows with richer context in order to help developers complete coding tasks efficiently. We'll also cover relevant use cases and discuss the tradeoffs between using RAG verus MCP.

title: Fast and compliant CI/CD pipelines in the financial industry (sponsored by Octopus Deploy)
abstract: With digital transformations, cloud migrations, and evolving regulations, financial institutions must deliver faster, manage increasing complexity, and stay compliant. Octopus Deploy helps organizations streamline delivery, secure deployments, and embrace innovation without compromising compliance. In this lightning talk, you’ll see how Octopus enables powerful pipelines that accelerate development and automate repeatable workflows across hybrid and multi-cloud environments. Built-in governance provides auditability, security, and role-based access controls tailored for regulated industries. Learn how financial services teams use Octopus Deploy to move quickly while keeping compliance front and center. This presentation is brought to you by Octopus Deploy, an AWS Partner.

title: Fast and easy bulk operations with Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: In this session, we’ll walk through patterns for executing fast, safe, cost-aware bulk operations in Amazon DynamoDB using AWS Glue, Spark SQL, and open source tooling that hides the complexity. We’ll demonstrate how to find, filter, diff, load, and update billions of items in parallel. You will also experience how lightweight AI can make bulk work more powerful and user-friendly. Come away with reusable patterns, insights from real-world workloads, and tools that simplify DynamoDB bulk processing.

title: Fast-Track Modernization and Transformation with Nutanix and AWS (sponsored by Nutanix)
abstract: Ready to move to the cloud in hours instead of months or years—while reducing costs and improving effectiveness? Join us to hear how leading organizations are accelerating cloud migration and modernization with AWS and Nutanix for future innovation – with speed, simplicity, and efficiency. Learn how you can unlock a true hybrid cloud with seamless AWS integration, unified management from edge to core to cloud, and world-class disaster recovery. Don’t miss seeing how customers are modernizing apps with AI, Kubernetes, and database services with less risk. Discover the template for hybrid cloud success that delivers results across clouds. This presentation is brought to you by Nutanix, an AWS Partner.

title: Fast Track to Growth: Leveraging Partner Programs & AWS Marketplace for success
abstract: Join AWS leaders Julia Chen, VP, Partner Core, and Matt Yanchyshyn, VP, AWS Marketplace & Partner Services, to explore how AWS is transforming partner success through profitable programs and product innovation from AWS Marketplace and Partner Services. Learn how AWS can fast-track your business growth through enhanced incentives, AI-driven automation, and global reach. Explore new features enabling faster time-to-value, including automated specialization validation, simplified contract management, and enhanced AWS Marketplace capabilities. Whether you're focused on migration acceleration, generative AI adoption, or expanding globally, you'll walk away with a plan to scale efficiently while increasing profitability. This session is intended for AWS Partners.

title: Fast-track to insights: AWS-SAP data strategy
abstract: This lightning talk showcases AWS and SAP's innovative solution for enterprise data integration challenges. Learn how to enable bi-directional data access between SAP and AWS environments, eliminating complex ETL pipelines while maintaining business context. Through customer examples, we'll demonstrate how to enable seamless integration between SAP and Amazon SageMaker for all your data, analytics and AI needs.

title: Fast-track your VMware to AWS migration with AWS Transform
abstract: Transform your VMware workloads into cloud-native solutions with AWS Transform's AI-powered migration capabilities. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to accelerate infrastructure modernization while reducing complexity and costs. Participants will gain practical experience using agentic AI for automated discovery, dependency mapping, and infrastructure conversion. Learn to leverage AWS Modernization Pathways for streamlined migration planning and implementation, following architectural best practices. Leave equipped to modernize legacy VMware environments into optimized cloud-native architectures, maximizing your AWS investment while minimizing migration risks.

title: Feature flags at scale: Advanced deployment patterns on AWS
abstract: Explore advanced architectural patterns for implementing feature flags at enterprise scale on AWS. Learn how to design systems that decouple deployment from feature releases, enabling independent control of user experience without impacting continuous deployment. Examine scalable architectures for progressive delivery, including dark launches and canary deployments. Master implementation patterns for robust security controls and comprehensive observability. This expert-level session provides detailed strategies for achieving true agility by separating feature rollout decisions from code deployments, allowing teams to deploy frequently while controlling feature availability.

title: Fidelity Investments: Text-to-SQL for data analytics at enterprise scale
