abstract: Learn how Fidelity Institutional (FI) developed and implemented a sophisticated Text-to-SQL generative AI solution that enables non-technical domain experts to interact with complex structured data using natural language. Dive deep into the architecture and technical implementation details of a system that handles complex database schemas, multiple table relationships, and generates complex SQL queries. We’ll cover advanced topics including natural language understanding optimization, query re-write, vector search, SQL generation strategies, query safety mechanisms, and performance tuning for large-scale structured data operations. Discover the validation frameworks, monitoring systems, and API design patterns that make this solution robust and reusable.

title: Fidelity's AI-powered support analysis system
abstract: Explore how Fidelity uses Amazon Bedrock and AI to gain insights from AWS support data. We'll show how they combined DynamoDB, EventBridge, Lambda, and OpenSearch with generative AI to analyze support cases and system health data. Learn the technical details and benefits of using AI to improve cloud operations reliability.

title: File storage for high-performance workloads
abstract: Join us for a comprehensive deep dive into Amazon FSx for Lustre high-performance, distributed, file storage for demanding workloads. We'll dive deep into performance capabilities, scaling characteristics, throughput, IOPS capabilities, concurrent client limits, I/O pattern handling, balancing performance and cost with intelligent tiering. We’ll discuss optimization strategies including capacity planning, and architectures for persistent and ephemeral workloads. This advanced-level session is best suited for solutions architects, HPC engineers, and gen AI architects designing high-performance distributed computing environments.

title: Financial services LLMOps: Scaling pilots to production
abstract: Scaling generative AI from pilots to production using pre-trained or fine-tuned models requires sophisticated operational infrastructure beyond traditional MLOps approaches. Financial institutions face challenges with reliable model drift detection, prompt governance, multi-model orchestration, and regulatory compliance at scale. Discover practical approaches to implementing a scalable LLMOps platform that accelerates deployment while maintaining security and compliance standards. We'll examine architectural patterns for monitoring large language model (LLM) performance, managing prompt templates, implementing automated testing pipelines, and establishing governance frameworks for responsible AI. Explore challenges including cost optimization, model versioning, observability across multi-agent systems, and incident response strategies for generative AI applications.

title: Financial services multi-Region design patterns and best practices
abstract: Explore proven architectural patterns and design principles for building resilient multi-Region deployments for financial services on AWS. Gain practical insights into leveraging specialized AWS services like Amazon Application Recovery Controller, Amazon Aurora DSQL, and Amazon DynamoDB Multi-Region strong consistency to build robust global solutions. Walk away with a comprehensive understanding of the tradeoffs involved in multi-Region deployments and the ability to make informed architectural decisions that balance reliability, performance, and cost for your organization's specific requirements.

title: Fine-tune Hugging Face LLMs on AWS Trainium with Amazon Sagemaker
abstract: Large language models (LLMs) demonstrate exceptional performance across many general-purpose applications due to their extensive pretraining on a wide variety of datasets. While these models often offer strong baseline performance without additional specialized training, organizations frequently enhance model efficacy through fine-tuning on targeted task-specific or domain-specific datasets. This builders session provides comprehensive instruction on leveraging Amazon SageMaker's capabilities to fine-tune pretrained Hugging Face LLMs utilizing AWS Trainium and the Optimum Neuron library. Participants will gain practical expertise in both the fine-tuning process and subsequent deployment of optimized models for inference workloads.

title: Fine-tuning models for accuracy and latency at Robinhood Markets
abstract: Discover how Robinhood enhanced their AI performance using Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock to optimize large language models (LLMs). This solution achieved 80% lower latency on key agentic tasks while scaling to millions of tokens per minute. Learn practical techniques for fine-tuning foundation models with Amazon SageMaker and implementing high-performing inference on Amazon Bedrock. This session covers model selection, optimization strategies, and deployment best practices for teams looking to improve their AI applications on AWS.

title: FinOps 3.0: Cost Intelligence for the AI Era (sponsored by DoiT)
abstract: FinOps has evolved from visibility to optimization and now to action. As AI workloads introduce new cost complexities, organizations can no longer afford analysis paralysis or endless dashboards. It is time for FinOps 3.0: a shift where cost intelligence is embedded directly into engineering workflows, insights are contextual and role specific, and automation becomes a trusted ally rather than a leap of faith. This session explores how to apply lessons from Kubernetes cost management to today’s AI challenges and provides a practical roadmap to help teams innovate faster, smarter, and more sustainably in the cloud. This presentation is brought to you by DoiT, an AWS Partner.

session.title: FinOps 3.0: Cost Intelligence for the AI Era (sponsored by DoiT)

title: FinOps+: A New Era of Accelerating Value (sponsored by Kion)
abstract:
FinOps is evolving and AI is accelerating the shift. As organizations face increasing complexity, traditional FinOps approaches are no longer enough. We are entering a new era of FinOps; one that requires automation, governance & scale.
FinOps+ introduces an AI-powered approach that unifies CloudOps, emphasizes automation and expands into holistic spend management within a single platform. This talk will show how AI-driven FinOps and proactive governance can transform the way teams manage technology, enabling smarter decisions, streamlined operations & accelerated value.
Whether you’re beginning your FinOps journey or looking to scale, you’ll leave with a clear vision for how to move beyond traditional practices into the future of FinOps. This presentation is brought to you by Kion, an AWS Partner.

session.title: FinOps+: A New Era of Accelerating Value (sponsored by Kion)

title: FINRA: Accelerate Massive Data Processing with NVIDIA on AWS EMR (sponsored by NVIDIA)
abstract: Over the past five years, FINRA built and optimized a large financial services database. FINRA runs at massive size and scale, consuming more than 600 petabytes of storage as it pieces together trillion events each day from market exchanges and broker-dealers. Learn how FINRA took their architecture to the next level with NVIDIA accelerated compute for a cost-efficient solution. Explore the architectural patterns and AWS services used, including Amazon EMR, AWS EKS, and learn how FINRA improved performance and reduced costs with NVIDIA GPUs. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.

title: FIS: High-performance instant payment processing at massive scale
abstract: New instant payment schemes like FedNow, TCH RTP, and crypto stablecoins promise unprecedented efficiency, affordability, and convenience, but they impose strict performance requirements, such as 99.99% uptime, high resiliency, and seamless integration with a wide variety of on-premises core banking platforms. Attendees of this session will learn how FIS built a cloud-native money-movement solution using services including Amazon EKS, Amazon Aurora, Amazon MSK, and Amazon CloudWatch to enable real-time interbank payments through a common unified API. We’ll explore how FIS’s solution achieves payments orchestration at massive scale while providing granular observability and centralized data persistence and processing.

services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)

title: Fit for purpose AI-led transformation (sponsored by Tata Consultancy Services)
abstract: A hospitality services leader avoided this fate by focusing on fit for purpose use cases and testing available foundation models with help from trusted partners at TCS and AWS. In this session, learn how the company has scaled AI across front-end customer services—contact center, cancellations, and conversions—with the help of TCS in determining when to build or buy in the rapidly changing AI market. Attendees will learn how the organization partnered with TCS for scoping front and back-end AI pilots, identifying fit for purpose use cases to prioritize, and what guardrails TCS and AWS helped implement across customer-facing services. This presentation is brought to you by Tata Consultancy Services, an AWS Partner.

title: Flawless AI: Visual dubbing at scale with Amazon S3
abstract: Flawless AI's groundbreaking use of Amazon S3 for visual AI dubbing demonstrates the transformative potential of cloud storage in media and entertainment. You’ll gain insights into architecting petabyte-scale video processing pipelines, innovative metadata tagging for AI training, and leveraging Mountpoint for Amazon S3 for high-performance workloads. This session showcases how AWS enables the creation of scalable SaaS platforms that revolutionize traditional processes, allowing direct movie editing through cloud-native architecture. Whether you're working in media processing, AI/ML training, or next-generation SaaS development, you'll learn how Flawless AI leverages AWS solutions to change global content creation and distribution, helping you push the boundaries of what's possible with cloud storage.

title: Fortifying encryption in transit: speed, security and AWS Nitro Power
abstract: Secure data in transit across AWS without compromising performance or agility. This session covers practical encryption implementation using AWS Nitro built-in protection, TLS encryption, SSH hardening, IPSec with AWS Site-to-Site VPN, and MACSec on AWS Direct Connect. Learn proven techniques for layering these methods while maintaining optimal performance. Through real-world configurations and implementation approaches, participants will explore current best practices and emerging post-quantum encryption standards. By session’s end, take away actionable implementation guides for establishing fortified transit encryption.

title: Fortifying the cloud: Meta's journey implementing AWS data perimeters
abstract: Join Meta's cloud security engineers to learn how they built and deployed data perimeter controls at scale using AWS IAM. We'll dive into code examples and infrastructure-as-code templates showing how to implement preventive guardrails using Service Control Policies (SCPs), Resource Control Policies (RCPs), and other AWS security services. Through technical demonstrations, you'll learn how to programmatically restrict data access to trusted identities and networks. Walk away with practical code patterns and architectural solutions to implement similar controls in your own environment.

title: Fostering a Resilient Incident Response Culture
abstract: Discover how to combine human expertise with intelligent automation in security incident response. Learn how AWS Security Incident Response, auto-triaging capabilities, and generative AI work together to augment—not replace—your team's decision-making. We'll explore how integrating AWS Security Incident Response and generative AI into your workflows can reduce alert fatigue, accelerate accurate incident classification, and enable responders to focus on critical analysis. See how leading organizations balance automation with human oversight, creating more efficient and resilient incident response processes while maintaining the crucial elements of human judgment and institutional knowledge. Uncover practical strategies for integrating AI-driven insights with human expertise in your incident response culture.

title: From Agentic AI Demos to ROI: Path to Production With Confluent + AWS (sponsored by Confluent)
abstract: Most enterprises are stuck in AI pilot purgatory—impressive demos, no ROI. Garther predicts that by 2028 80% of successful GenAI apps will run on existing data platforms, yet many still treat AI as “magic” exempt from existing data challenges. This session shows why batch pipelines kill model value and how Confluent’s data streaming platform and Streaming Agents, AWS Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, and MCP Servers unlock scalable multi-agents systems that monitor business events and instantly act or trigger real-time automation. Leave with practical frameworks to cut through hype and build AI architectures that drive measurable revenue and tangible business outcomes. This presentation is brought to you by Confluent, an AWS Partner.

title: From AI Promise to KPI Impact: Connected Agents & Orchestration (sponsored by Workato)
abstract:
Enterprise success hinges on KPIs buried in complex, cross-functional processes. Yet most AI agents today lack the enterprise context to deliver meaningful impact, leaving teams stuck playing defense.

With AI agents delivered through AWS Bedrock, Workato brings the orchestration and enterprise context required to turn promise into KPI impact. Capabilities like IDP, decision models, data pipeline workflows, enterprise MCP, and agentic collaboration unite on Workato’s platform—empowering context-powered agents that shift teams from defense to offense and drive measurable business outcomes. This presentation is brought to you by Workato, an AWS Partner.

session.title: From AI Promise to KPI Impact: Connected Agents & Orchestration (sponsored by Workato)

title: From AI tools to AI teammates: Building an AI strategy for your SDLC
abstract: The promise of AI in software development is clear - faster delivery, fewer incidents, and teams focused on innovation rather than toil. But how do you move beyond isolated AI tools to a coordinated workforce of AI agents that truly transform your SDLC? This chalk talk explores the practical realities of adopting Agentic AI across your development lifecycle, from proof-of-concept to production-scale transformation. We will walk through the cultural, technological and practical insights needed to build an AI-augmented SDLC that delivers measurable business value while bringing your teams along on the journey.

title: From Alert to Resolution: Supercharge AWS Ops with the Agentic AI SRE (sponsored by NeuBird AI)
abstract: Modern AWS environments generate massive volumes of telemetry, yet incident diagnosis remains highly manual. Learn how enterprises are leveraging secure agentic AI to investigate incidents in real time, and turn CloudWatch and observability data from Datadog, Dynatrace and others into actionable fixes. Powered by Amazon Bedrock, NeuBird’s Hawkeye correlates signals across tools instantly, identifies root causes, and provides remediation within minutes, reducing MTTR by up to 90%. Join the session to see how enterprises adopt agentic AI to operationalize observability data and improve service reliability. Walk away with practical insights into building Agentic workflows that integrate seamlessly into AWS operations. This presentation is brought to you by NeuBird AI, an AWS Partner.

session.title: From Alert to Resolution: Supercharge AWS Ops with the Agentic AI SRE (sponsored by NeuBird AI)

title: From Backup to Live Data: Protecting and Unleashing Your Cloud Data (sponsored by Eon)
abstract: The massive scale of modern cloud data and its growing value for analytics and AI require a new approach to protection and access. Traditional backup methods fail to handle vast workloads like S3 and DynamoDB, creating costly, inaccessible silos. In this session, learn how to implement a cloud-native platform that provides hyper-scale protection and automates operations. This intelligent storage tier also transforms your data into a live, queryable data lake, instantly available for analytics and AI, all while lowering your TCO. This presentation is brought to you by Eon, an AWS Partner.

title: From Browser to Prompt: Building Infra for the Agentic Internet (sponsored by Kong)
abstract: The prompt is the new browser. It’s no secret that AI agents will transform how people interact with information and services, but what’s often overlooked is how agents can only thrive on the right foundation. Agents demand a new layer of connectivity, control, and security. Join Kong co-founder and CTO Marco Palladino as he explores how agents are becoming the new backbone of the internet — and what builders can do to get ready for it. This presentation is brought to you by Kong, an AWS Partner.

title: From Bytes to Bench: Best practices for life science research agents
abstract: Learn how to build and deploy AI agents for life science research. AI research agents speed up scientific discovery by planning research tasks, interacting with domain-specific tools and data, and generating detailed research reports. This hands-on workshop will cover current best practices for building AI research agents and tools. Through interactive demonstrations and hands-on exercises, you'll learn how to use AWS services like Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and open source frameworks like Strands Agents to deploy AI research teams securely and at scale. Then, you'll experiment with scientific tools and databases to answer your own research questions. Whether you’re hunting for the next blockbuster drug or pushing the boundaries of basic research, you’ll leave equipped with practical skills to accelerate your scientific pipeline.

title: From Cloud Modernization to Autonomous Enterprise: The Next Frontier (sponsored by Genpact)
abstract: Enterprises are moving beyond cloud migration toward a future defined AI-driven autonomy. This session explores why modernization across infrastructure, applications, and data is critical to unlock AI’s full potential. Panelists will share real-world examples of predictive, self-healing, and AI-orchestrated operations, and discuss the mindset shift required for CIOs and technology leaders to achieve success. Attendees will learn how cloud-native architectures, AI agents, and intelligent workflows are converging to create autonomous enterprises. By building modernization as the foundation, organizations can enhance efficiency, break down silos, and accelerate innovation, positioning themselves to thrive in an AI-powered future. This presentation is brought to you by Genpact, an AWS Partner.

title: From Cloud to AI  Securing the New Cloud Attack Surface (sponsored by Wiz)
abstract: AI adoption marks the next generation of cloud innovation and it’s reshaping the attack surface. Shadow AI projects, new control planes, and sensitive data pipelines are converging with traditional cloud misconfigurations and identity gaps. This session shows how Wiz helps organizations secure both cloud and AI by surfacing risks in context from S3 pipelines to SageMaker models and unifying ASM and AI-SPM to give teams the visibility, context, and confidence to act. This presentation is brought to you by Wiz, an AWS Partner.

title: From code to cloud: Accelerate application development with Amazon ECS
abstract: This session explores the latest innovations to build applications on Amazon ECS. Covering the latest development tools, pipeline integrations, deployment strategies, and observability tools. You'll discover how these advancements eliminate traditional bottlenecks in containerized application development. We'll demonstrate practical techniques to accelerate your development workflow, reduce operational overhead, and improve application reliability. Whether you're building microservices or monolithic applications, you'll leave with actionable strategies to speed up your cloud development process using the newest ECS capabilities.

title: From Code to Cloud: Building Enterprise AppSec with AWS
abstract: Building comprehensive application security programs requires the right tools, processes, and expertise. This session provides a practical roadmap for establishing and scaling AppSec programs using AWS services and AI-powered security capabilities. Learn to create shift-left security strategies with Amazon Q Developer's generative AI for automatic vulnerability detection through SCA, SAST, and intelligent code reviews. Learn how Amazon Inspector extends security coverage with continuous vulnerability management at enterprise scale. Hear about the AWS Guardians program that accelerates AppSec maturity through expert guidance and proven frameworks. See real-world examples of sustainable programs that reduce security debt while maintaining development velocity.

title: From code to cloud: enhancing visibility across the SDLC with AWS
abstract: In this workshop you will dive deep into using Amazon Q for helping create code and review for security issues directly in the IDE, as well as using the new Amazon Inspector code security features to connect to the code repository and perform security scan the source code for potential security issues, gaining a strong grounding in early feedback loops to empower developers to improve code quality earlier in the software development lifecycle using Q Developer to implement secure by design principles.

title: From Code to Market: Build and Launch AI Agents on AWS Marketplace
abstract: Creating AI agents is just the beginning – ISVs face the greater challenge of monetizing them effectively. In this CodeTalk you will learn how to implement metering APIs, manage licensing, and navigate ISV-specific requirements using two deployment approaches: containers based agents with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore running in customer environments, and API-based agents hosted by ISVs. Join this session to accelerate your AI solutions from development to revenue-generating products in AWS Marketplace.

title: From collecting tools to an autonomous SOC (sponsored by SentinelOne)
abstract: The vision of an autonomous SOC feels unattainable amid a federated array of security tools. This session demonstrates a practical path forward, focused on outcomes. The key is not to replace tools, but to unify them with an AI-powered platform that automates detection and response to empower security teams in unprecedented ways. Through a real-world demonstration of SentinelOne's Athena release, see how to transform siloed data into the foundation for an autonomous security posture. Learn how to advance SOC maturity and achieve superior security outcomes across your AWS environment. This presentation is brought to you by SentinelOne, an AWS Partner.

title: From concept to campaign: Building marketing agents with AgentCore
abstract: Marketing teams require AI agents capable of orchestrating complex campaigns with enterprise controls. This session explores Epsilon's production-ready multi-agent system built with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore for intelligent marketing campaigns. Learn to implement secure agent collaboration using AgentCore Runtime for parallel execution, Gateway for controlled data access, and Identity for granular permissions. We'll cover architectural patterns for asynchronous workflows, demonstrate personalized content generation with brand consistency, and explore real-time campaign monitoring through AgentCore Observability. You'll gain proven patterns for building autonomous marketing agents that execute multistep workflows, scale to thousands of concurrent campaigns, and maintain complete auditability.

title: From concept to production: Build with spec-driven development and Kiro
abstract: Join us for an exciting live coding session where we'll demonstrate the power of spec-driven development using Kiro, the AI IDE that's transforming how we build applications. Watch as we take a simple prompt and transform it into a fully functional application through Kiro's structured approach. You'll see firsthand how Kiro converts requirements into clear specifications, system designs, and discrete tasks while maintaining robust engineering practices.

title: From Confidently Wrong to Enterprise-Ready AI (sponsored by PromptQL)
abstract: AI’s biggest flaw isn’t hallucination—it’s being confidently wrong. In the enterprise, even rare high-confidence errors force costly verification and erode trust. By separating plan generation from execution, surfacing confidence scores, and letting AI abstain when uncertain, organizations can achieve predictable, auditable, and trusted outcomes. The impact is real: a 50% reduction in time-to-value, 2x customer growth, 50% fewer new analyst hires, and a 95% faster customer integration cycle. This session explores how accuracy-first design creates trusted AI that delivers lasting business impact. This presentation is brought to you by PromptQL, an AWS Partner.

session.title: From Confidently Wrong to Enterprise-Ready AI (sponsored by PromptQL)

title: From data center to the cloud: Translating network architecture to AWS
abstract: Bridge your traditional networking expertise to AWS cloud architecture. This session helps network professionals translate their knowledge of VRFs, BGP, MPLS, and DNS into cloud-native solutions using Amazon VPC, AWS Transit Gateway, AWS Cloud WAN, and Amazon Route 53. Discover how to leverage AWS's global backbone to reimagine conventional network designs. Learn to implement enterprise-grade segmentation, routing, and DNS architectures in the cloud while maintaining the same level of control as your on-premises infrastructure —only faster, more scalable, and more flexible. Perfect for seasoned network engineers ready to extend their expertise to AWS network.

title: From Data Chaos to AI Magic: Supercharging Customer Experience (sponsored by Treasure Data)
abstract: Every legendary customer experience starts with clean, connected data, and AI is only as powerful as the data behind it. In this session, discover how an AI-first, data-trust approach can turn marketing and CX teams into “superhumans.” Learn practical strategies for unifying fragmented customer data, ensuring quality at scale, and activating real-time personalization through AI Agents. See how trusted data plus predictive and generative AI can anticipate needs, deliver precision targeting, and orchestrate journeys instantly. Leave with an actionable blueprint to harness AI that’s accurate, scalable, and transformative, all without writing a single line of code. This presentation is brought to you by Treasure Data, an AWS Partner.

title: From Data to Action: Agentic-Powered Humanitarian Response (sponsored by Cloudera)
abstract:
Discover how Cloudera's "Data Anywhere for AI Everywhere" vision powers MercyCORE—an agentic AI platform developed with Mercy Corps, a global humanitarian aid organization, to revolutionize crisis response.
MercyCORE enables real-time access to diverse data sources, from news and social media to custom streams. Crisis responders can dynamically configure new information sources on-the-fly, while natural language interaction democratizes data science and accelerates decision-making.
This breakthrough delivers mission-critical insights where needed most, enabling faster, more effective humanitarian aid in rapidly evolving emergencies. Learn how to leverage AI agents for meaningful impact This presentation is brought to you by Cloudera, an AWS Partner.

session.title: From Data to Action: Agentic-Powered Humanitarian Response (sponsored by Cloudera)

title: From Data to Decisions: Agentic AI for Security and Observability (sponsored by Elastic)
abstract: Elastic's Search AI Platform leverages the same data foundation that monitors your infrastructure and application performance to simultaneously detect and respond to security threats. In this session, we'll demonstrate how Elastic leverages built-in Agentic AI to accelerate both operational and security investigations. Attendees will see examples of correlating performance anomalies with lateral movement patterns and navigating resolution using ES|QL for grounding, while leveraging built-in automation to scale efficiency. The outcome is AI-driven collaboration between SRE, Ops, and Security teams, turning fragmented investigations into unified response and defense. This presentation is brought to you by Elastic, an AWS Partner.

title: From Documents to Decisions: Unleashing AI-Powered Business Automation
abstract: Discover how SMBs are transforming document-heavy processes using AWS AI services. Learn from AArete’s success story as they share how combining Amazon Textract, Amazon Bedrock, and Bedrock Data Automation helped extract insights from documents and revolutionize workflows. We’ll dive deep into implementation patterns, share best practices from dozens of customer engagements, and explore how Agentic AI can automate complex business processes - from intelligent routing and approvals to automated vendor onboarding and compliance checks. See how AWS’s comprehensive solution helps SMBs unlock new levels of operational efficiency, fault tolerance, and cost optimizations.

title: From downtime to uptime: Mastering application recovery on AWS
abstract: Master the latest features of Amazon Application Recovery Controller (ARC) for enhancing application resilience on AWS. Through hands-on exercises, learn to implement automated recovery workflows, test recovery plans, and monitor recovery operations at scale. Build practical skills in architecting and managing recovery solutions that align with enterprise resilience requirements. This workshop provides cloud architects and DevOps engineers with proven patterns for ensuring business continuity through sophisticated recovery architectures.

title: From EC2 to EKS: Tipalti’s transformation to Windows containers on AWS
abstract: Is your Windows applications constrained by scaling limitations and complex operations? Discover how Tipalti transformed their traditional Windows application into a modern, containerized solution. Learn how to overcome process management challenges, implement auto-scaling, and achieve up to a 50% performance improvement. We'll walk through the implementation of Windows containers, logging solutions, and operational enhancements. Through Tipalti's transformation experience, key technical decisions, and lessons learned, you'll gain practical knowledge for modernizing your Windows applications.

title: From fragile to agile: Transforming monoliths with cell architecture
abstract: Explore how to transform a monolithic application into cell-based architecture using AWS services. Learn proven strategies for decomposing single-instance-per-tenant applications that face cascading failures, performance bottlenecks, and scaling limitations. In this interactive session, we'll examine architectural patterns for incremental migration while maintaining business continuity. Through collaborative discussion and architectural diagrams, we'll cover decoupling storage, database, and compute components, implementing request routing, and cell sharding. Drawing from real-world implementations, we'll demonstrate deploying your first migrated cell and share best practices to avoid common pitfalls.

title: From fragmented to unified platform: Rocket Companies data and AI journey
abstract: Enterprises seek to unify data access across the organization, safeguard sensitive client information, and scale MLOps efficiently. Learn how Rocket Companies addressed these challenges by building a unified data and AI platform on AWS. Discover how Rocket leveraged Amazon SageMaker for machine learning workflows, integrated with custom Amazon EKS applications and CI/CD pipelines, and implemented MLflow for model governance. See how Amazon DataZone can support secure enterprise-wide metadata management. Join this session to explore architectural patterns for data democratization, combined with MLOps excellence, showcasing practical solutions that streamline data and machine learning workflows while maintaining security controls.

title: From Ground to Cloud: CAE Innovates with AWS & Red Hat (sponsored by Red Hat)
abstract: CAE is leading the transformation of aviation training by embracing a hybrid cloud strategy with Red Hat technologies on AWS. As an industry leader, CAE leverages Red Hat OpenShift Service on AWS (ROSA), Ansible Automation Platform, and RHEL to right-size its infrastructure, optimize costs, and accelerate innovation — all while meeting strict regulatory standards. This session showcases how CAE maintains its leadership by delivering new services faster, automating global operations, and enabling business growth with agility and resilience. Learn how CAE, AWS, and Red Hat drive sustained competitive advantage in a complex, global industry. This presentation is brought to you by Red Hat, an AWS Partner.

title: From Hours to Minutes: Crafting Bite-Sized Video Stories with AWS
abstract: Automatically transforming long-form videos into shorter segments requires careful architectural decisions around processing, analysis, and content integrity. This advanced session explores building modular pipelines that handle speech-to-text processing, content analysis, intelligent summarization, and audio synthesis. The discussion demonstrates how to combine Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Nova models, and Amazon Polly to build powerful AI tools that address real-world challenges in maintaining contextual integrity while preserving the essential meaning of the original content.

title: From ideas to impact: Architecting with cloud best practices
abstract: 2025 marks the 10-year anniversary of the AWS Well-Architected Framework, Cloud Adoption Framework, and AWS Cloud Operating Model. Learn how these foundational frameworks evolved through customer feedback and real-world learnings from thousands of organizations. What began as structured guidance has matured into dynamic insights for optimizing cloud environments. Discover how this continuous feedback drives innovation across architecture reviews, operations, and remediation. Learn practical strategies for applying these unified best practices to accelerate cloud transformation.

title: From idea to impact: Harness AI agents and tools in AWS Marketplace
abstract: In this lightning talk we show practical approaches for integrating AI agents and tools into your existing workflows, helping you boost productivity and innovation. We review real world applications and best practices for agent integration, focusing on security, scalability, and implementation strategies. You'll gain insights into how you can find and leverage ready-to-use third-party tools and agents to accelerate and streamline your AI initiatives.

title: From idea to instant production readiness: building AI agents on Cloudflare (sponsored by Cloudflare)
abstract:
Everything we learned from running 20% of the internet-yours by default. Go from idea to production readiness instantly.
Join David Liu (AI specialist) as he reveals how Cloudflare's developer platform eliminates infrastructure provisioning and management for developers.  How Cloudflare has both stateful and ephemeral compute specifically designed to run your AI agents. Discover how the platform's intelligent auto-scaling handles traffic spikes and failures, ensuring you only pay for actual compute time and not wait time.
Learn how companies are deploying once and running their applications better than anybody else on Cloudflare's globally distributed serverless platform. This presentation is brought to you by Cloudflare, an AWS Partner.

title: From Kitchen to Cloud: How Brinker Dishes Out Data-Driven Success (sponsored by Teradata)
abstract: Diners have endless options, so restaurants need more than great food to stand out—they need smart data. Brinker International (NYSE: EAT), the powerhouse behind 1,650+ Chili’s Grill & Bar and Maggiano’s Little Italy locations worldwide, is serving up success with a bold recipe: advanced analytics at scale. Discover how Brinker works with Teradata Vantage on AWS to transform their data game—processing over 500,000 daily queries and blending a rich mix of AI and machine learning to optimize operations, elevate labor resourcing, and supercharge guest satisfaction. Get a taste of how cloud innovation takes Brinker from insights to impact—fast. This presentation is brought to you by Teradata, an AWS Partner.

title: From KPIs to action: close the business objectives loop with AI agents
abstract: What if you could turn your KPIs from something you track in the rear-view mirror into targets your supply chain management systems automatically drive your business toward? Join this session to learn how AI agents make this possible. We’ll show you how to use agentic technology to automate the process of detecting deviations from plan and immediately figuring out why they are happening and what to do about it.

title: From Lab to Market - AstraZeneca's Enterprise-Wide AI Success Story
abstract: AstraZeneca is on a mission to deliver 20 life-changing medicines by 2030, and is leveraging agentic AI technology to make it happen. The company has implemented AI solutions throughout their organization, revolutionizing their data management and analysis capabilities. Through their innovative approach of using modular, multi-agent AI systems, AstraZeneca has deployed multiple AI tools into production across multiple business units. During this presentation, we'll dive into how the company is implementing AI solutions in both their clinical development and commercial divisions to achieve tangible outcomes. Additionally, we'll explore how AstraZeneca is utilizing AWS technologies to create a scalable infrastructure that can readily incorporate future technological advancements.

title: From Laptop to Scale: A UnicornVibe AI Agent Journey
abstract: You know that feeling when your AI agent works perfectly on your laptop... until you try to show it to anyone else? Follow the journey of UnicornVibes, an AI event planning startup, as they scale from prototype to viral success. Learn the crucial differences between making LLM calls and building production-ready agents, complete with messaging tool integration, authentication, and observability. Watch their system evolve to handle explosive growth with features that amplify success instead of crashing under pressure. Perfect for developers with cool AI ideas ready to reach real users - no prior agent experience required!

title: From Legacy to Lakehouse: Proven Best Practices for Data Warehouse Migration (sponsored by Databricks)
abstract: Legacy data warehouses often slow innovation with outdated code, silos, and costly migrations. In this session, we’ll share proven best practices to modernize with confidence. Learn how to profile and assess source systems, convert legacy SQL at scale with automation, and validate data integrity to avoid surprises. We’ll cover an end-to-end process—from discovery through reconciliation—that reduces risk, improves predictability, and accelerates migration timelines by up to 50%. Whether you’re moving one system or many, you’ll leave with practical tactics to streamline your journey to a modern lakehouse. This presentation is brought to you by Databricks, an AWS Partner.

title: From manual to AI: Transforming Brazil's national exam at scale
abstract: Learn how Brazil's national exam system leveraged AWS AI services to revolutionize educational assessment at scale. This chalk talk explores the practical challenges and solutions in building an AI-powered evaluation system that handles millions of Portuguese language assessments. Discover architectural patterns for implementing bias-free scoring, managing multi-model orchestration, and ensuring real-time processing at national scale. We'll dive deep into the technical decisions that enabled 78% cost reduction and 5.2x productivity gains. You'll leave with actionable strategies for deploying large-scale AI systems, handling language complexity, and maintaining high availability during peak demands.

title: From monolith to microservices: Migrate and modernize with Amazon EKS
abstract: Organizations face the challenge of migrating legacy applications and modernizing them for cloud-native architectures. This session will cover how to leverage Amazon EKS Hybrid Nodes to transform legacy workloads into cloud-native architectures. Learn to evaluate your current stack, identify transformation opportunities, and implement effective modernization strategies. We'll explore tools and best practices to containerize applications, embrace microservices, and harness Kubernetes power. Discover how Amazon EKS enables seamless migration paths and running containerized workloads across on-premises and cloud environments. This approach reduces operational burden, cuts costs, and accelerates innovation—no matter where you are in your migration and modernization journey.

title: From Motion to Meaning: AI-Powered Human Movement Analysis on AWS
abstract: By leveraging machine learning and generative AI, the gaming, music, and healthcare industries can access unprecedented insights into human movement. In this session, we'll explore compelling use cases where move.ai and VueMotion are using AWS services to capture and generate human movement data, which is then used downstream to create character animations and athletics analysis. We will showcase how captured human movement data can be analyzed using AWS tools and services to provide insights for sport and healthcare experts. Join us as we uncover the transformative potential of this cutting-edge technology.

title: From On-Prem to On-Point: Safelite's AWS Cloud Observability Journey (sponsored by SolarWinds)
abstract: During this session, learn how SolarWinds, in partnership with TBA from Safelite, helped the automotive services provider transform its complex IT operations. By implementing SolarWinds Observability, Safelite gained comprehensive digital asset visibility, replaced outdated monitoring tools, and reduced costs. The switch facilitated a smooth migration to AWS and enabled the creation of a technology operations center. As a result, Safelite shifted from reactive IT support to a proactive model, enhancing business value and operational efficiency. This presentation is brought to you by SolarWinds, an AWS Partner.

session.title: From On-Prem to On-Point: Safelite's AWS Cloud Observability Journey (sponsored by SolarWinds)

title: From Pods to Gateway API: Container Networking Mysteries Solved!
abstract: Join this interactive chalk talk where we'll solve container networking mysteries through real-world scenarios. Starting with the "Pod-to-Pod Mystery," we'll trace packets through AWS container services, demystifying how Amazon VPC CNI enhances performance and security. Through hands-on troubleshooting, you'll master IP management, security group configurations, and advanced load balancing patterns with AWS Load Balancer Controller. We'll explore modern service networking with Gateway API and VPC Lattice integration, covering migration strategies and implementation patterns. Leave with practical solutions for your current challenges and architectural insights for future container deployments. Bring your questions for interactive problem-solving discussions.

title: From principles to practice: Scaling AI responsibly with Indeed
abstract: Building trusted AI applications requires balancing innovation speed with risk management across an increasingly complex set of responsible AI dimensions, including privacy, security, robustness, fairness, safety, transparency, and explainability. Join this session to learn about the AWS Responsible AI Best Practices Framework, and discover how Indeed has built an intelligent risk management platform that enables rapid product development while protecting millions of job seekers using Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock. Walk away with actionable strategies for implementing responsible AI practices in your own applications.

title: From Print to AI: The Economist's Digital Evolution with AWS Architecture
abstract: Discover how The Economist transformed its historic legacy into a cutting-edge AI powerhouse. This presentation reveals how the prestigious media group successfully integrated GenAI and ML technologies through strategic alignment of teams, workflows, and infrastructure. Learn their blueprint for secure data architecture and AI implementation using AWS SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock. Featuring live demonstrations, examine real-world applications, from sophisticated recommendation systems to advanced predictive analytics, demonstrating how traditional media can evolve in the AI era.

title: From prompt to production: On-brand marketing images with Amazon Nova
abstract: Ad and marketing teams are racing to harness text-to-image models, but creating high-quality, on-brand visuals at production scale has remained unsolved. Until now. Generating marketing images isn’t just about automation; it’s about balancing speed, creative fidelity, and brand alignment—which has never before been explored in a scalable, production-ready workflow with agents. In this breakout session, discover the challenges of bringing text-to-image into real-world campaigns and the breakthrough that makes it possible. Join this session to learn how to create scalable, robust, and brand-aligned agentic workflows using Nova Canvas and Nova Pro, and see how AI can supercharge your creative pipeline.

title: From Punch Cards to Pair Programming and Beyond: The Future of Copilot (sponsored by GitHub)
abstract: In this session, we look at the history of tools for boosting developer productivity from punch cards through IDEs and into AI Pair Programming. GitHub Copilot Code completions started the revolution in 2021, but that already feels like the Stone Age! As autonomous agentic workloads grow in popularity, this session will help guide where Copilot is headed and what should you be doing to prepare yourself for the (imminent) future of Agentic Software Delivery. This presentation is brought to you by GitHub, an AWS Partner.

title: From punched cards to AI: The developer’s new mindset
abstract: Developer evolution is ongoing - from punched cards to cloud-native apps, each wave has reshaped how the team build. Today, AI introduces a new shift: vibe coding for rapid prototyping, and spec-first development for scalable, maintainable systems. This session takes a step back to explore the broader transformation journey and how developers can confidently navigate the current AI wave. the team’ll focus on the spec-first mindset and the growing importance of soft skills in human-AI collaboration. A short demo using Kiro learn how to illustrate practical strategies and workflows that help developers adapt, communicate, and thrive.

title: From Reactive to Proactive: Infrastructure governance by design
abstract: Many organizations struggle to maintain consistent security controls across their cloud infrastructure as they scale, often discovering compliance violations only after resources are deployed. This reactive approach leads to security gaps, compliance issues, and costly remediation efforts. This code talk will discuss security best practices using AWS CloudFormation Hooks and AWS CloudFormation Guard, demonstrating how to prevent non-compliant infrastructure deployments before they occur. You will learn how to write CloudFormation Guard domain-specific language (DSL) rules for static template validation and integrate them with CloudFormation Hooks, including managed hooks, to enforce security standards proactively across your organization.

title: From reflection to action: Agentic AI for mission impact
abstract: Nonprofits operate under unique budgetary and resource constraints. Agentic AI can help nonprofit leaders and technologists transcend traditional resource limitations, enhance decision-making, and amplify social impact. This chalk talk explores agentic AI workflows for streamlining administrative tasks, enhancing fundraising, improving donor engagement, optimizing volunteer management, and personalizing member communication. Through real-world use cases, we'll analyze the immediate benefits and long-term strategic advantages of responsible AI implementation in nonprofit settings. Gain practical insights, and design patterns and architectural blueprints to scale your mission. Leave equipped with tools and best practices to leverage AI for maximizing your organization's efficiency, impact, and member trust.

title: From serverful to serverless Java
abstract: In this workshop, learn how to bring your traditional Java Spring application to AWS Lambda with minimal effort and iteratively apply optimizations to get the best out of your serverless Java experience. Find out how to improve the performance of your application with AWS Lambda SnapStart and GraalVM native images. Then, learn how to write new applications with Spring Cloud Function and use Amazon Q Developer to quickly generate the code. Leave this workshop knowing how to make well-informed decisions when modernizing enterprise Java applications with AWS Lambda. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: From SIEM to SOC: Building AI-Native Security in the Cloud with AWS (sponsored by CrowdStrike)
abstract: According to the CrowdStrike 2025 Threat Hunting Report, cloud intrusions surged 136% in the first half of 2025 (compared to all of 2024) and adversaries are rapidly sharpening their tactics in the cloud, making visibility into cloud events a non-negotiable for security teams. With Falcon Next-Gen SIEM and Falcon Cloud Security, you can quickly onboard essential data from AWS CloudTrail, Security Hub, and Guard Duty with a single click to detect and respond to cloud threats at speed. Join this session to discover how AWS and CrowdStrike are revolutionizing defenses with AI, leveling the playing field for SOC teams against today's sophisticated threats. This presentation is brought to you by CrowdStrike, an AWS Partner.

title: From Static to Dynamic: Modernizing AWS Access Management
abstract: Building a robust AWS identity foundation requires moving beyond static credentials. This session deep dives into proven patterns for implementing dynamic, temporary access across your AWS organization. We'll explore real-world challenges of access key dependencies and share practical approaches to transition towards ephemeral credentials using IAM roles, IAM Identity Center, and SAML federation. Through practical examples and lessons learned, discover how to implement secure authentication patterns that scale while reducing operational overhead. Walk away with actionable strategies to strengthen your identity perimeter and modernize your access management approach.

title: From threat to threat intel: 360 degrees of DDOS
abstract: Discover how AWS protects web applications at scale by analyzing billions of data points to detect attacks and automatically update defenses. Through real-world case studies, learn how CloudFront, ELB, Shield, and WAF use machine learning to distinguish legitimate traffic from malicious requests while maintaining performance. See how AWS’s global threat monitoring network delivers real-time DDoS protection, ensuring business continuity and resilient web delivery. Walk away with actionable insights to safeguard your applications against sophisticated threats.

title: From triggers to thinking: Building event-driven AI on AWS
abstract: AI systems are moving beyond static responses into adaptive, context-aware behaviors. In this session, learn how Model Context Protocol (MCP) extends event-driven design into AI workflows on AWS. Explore architecture patterns, integration strategies, and real-world examples to see how applications can move from simple triggers to intelligent, real-time responses. Leave with practical guidance for combining event-driven architecture and MCP to design resilient, AI-driven systems.

title: From Trigger to Execution: The Journey of Events in AWS Lambda
abstract: Dive deep into AWS Lambda's event processing ecosystem. We'll explore diverse event sources including queuing (SQS), streaming (Kinesis, DynamoDB Streams), and private sources (EventBridge Pipes, Kafka). Uncover Lambda's sophisticated message buffering and synchronous invocation mechanisms. Learn how Lambda ensures high availability through static stability and rapid AZ failover, and manages backpressure to prevent system overload. We'll examine Lambda destinations for advanced event routing and error handling. By mastering these concepts, you'll optimize your serverless architectures for reliability, performance, and scalability. Join us to unlock the full potential of event-driven computing with AWS Lambda, from trigger to execution and beyond.

title: From UX to AX: MCP Servers for AI Shopping Agents
abstract: The retail industry faces transformation as AI shopping agents emerge. Just as user experience (UX) optimization became essential for human shoppers, retailers must now prepare for Agent Experience (AX) optimization—designing for AI agents that autonomously navigate marketplaces. This talk examines leveraging Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers on AWS to position retailers advantageously in agent-driven commerce. MCP servers establish standardized communication frameworks enabling AI agents to seamlessly access product information, inventory, and pricing data. We present actionable approaches for deploying MCP server architecture, empowering retailers to lead in automated commerce while preserving exceptional customer experiences during this transition.

title: From vibe coding to vibe modernizing with AWS AI services
abstract: In this hands-on builders session, learn how to modernize legacy apps using Amazon Bedrock and Kiro. Step through techniques to tackle tightly coupled code, hidden dependencies, poor documentation, and data migration. Explore how AI can accelerate transformation while maintaining compliance and data integrity. Move from “vibe coding” to “vibe modernizing."

title: From VSAM to DynamoDB: Reimagining mainframe data for the cloud
abstract: Transform mainframe VSAM KSDS data structures into cloud-native architectures using Amazon developer tools and Amazon DynamoDB. This hands-on builder session explores two modernization paths: complete reimagination for tech-debt-free implementations and incremental augmentation for data analytics or new channels and functions. Learn to identify access patterns, strategically denormalize data for improved performance, and overcome common mainframe data format challenges. Experience the architectural benefits of DynamoDB including cost efficiency through on-demand pricing, elastic scalability, multi-AZ high availability, and built-in data integrity. Gain practical skills in schema design and optimization techniques that bridge legacy systems with modern cloud databases for enhanced business agility.

title: From Windows to Linux: .NET application modernization
abstract: Porting and upgrades of .NET applications running on Windows servers to Linux can deliver cost savings and enhance security and compliance, but the modernization process can be long and laborious. This interactive chalk talk explores strategies for porting server-side components of a .NET application within days by refactoring using AWS Transform. The session includes codebase analysis, code decomposition into buildable units, transformation plan creation, and execution of key transformation tasks with approval from the developer.

title: From Zero to Millions: Building Real-Time Applications at Scale
abstract: Discover how to scale real-time applications to millions of users with modern event-driven architectures. Learn essential strategies for managing high-volume connection requests, implementing effective filtering patterns, and handling event distribution at scale. We'll explore integration patterns for event processing, practical solutions for GenAI applications, and optimization techniques for operating at production scale. Join us to understand connection rate management, filtering strategies, and real-world architectural patterns for building highly scalable real-time applications.

title: From Zero to SaaS: When Vibe Coding Meets Production
abstract: Vibe coding is fun and fast, but can leave hidden gaps when building production SaaS. In this hands-on builder session, step into the role of an AWS developer tasked with readying a vibe coded SaaS application for go-live. Discover the holes in code that the LLMs often miss. Then learn rules, and smarter prompts to productionize the codebase to attain robust security and scalability. Learn powerful strategies and practical SaaS patterns as you wrangle tenant context and IAM policies. Leave with sharper SaaS instincts, improved AI assistant skills, and a clear view of where “vibe” falls short for production SaaS apps.

title: Frontier Model Safety in Practice: Amazon Nova Risk Evaluation
abstract: Amazon’s Frontier Model Safety Framework establishes rigorous protocols for evaluating and mitigating critical, high-risk capabilities in frontier-scale AI models—those with exceptional scale or versatility—that might pose severe public safety hazards. This framework mandates assessments targeting three core domains: Chemical, Biological, Radiological & Nuclear weapons proliferation; Offensive Cyber Operations; and Automated AI R&D. Evaluations combine automated, reproducible benchmarks with expert red-teaming and uplift studies, supported by third-party audits, to determine if models exceed critical safety thresholds. In this context, we present the first comprehensive safety evaluation of Amazon’s Nova Premier, a frontier-scale foundation model capable of processing text, images, and video.

title: Full Speed Ahead: Securing Innovation with Trend (sponsored by Trend Micro)
abstract: Luxury, performance, and innovation define this global automotive leader, and now these same principles guide its approach to cloud security. Facing unique challenges in managing risk and maintaining a strong security posture at scale, the company is unifying cloud risk visibility and runtime protection into a comprehensive security strategy. To meet these demands with limited resources, it is consolidating tools and streamlining operations. Trend is helping the organization gain real-time insight, reduce complexity, and improve resilience. In this session, learn how an industry icon is optimizing resources, enhancing protection, and driving security forward with an approach built for modern enterprises. This presentation is brought to you by Trend Micro, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Full Speed Ahead: Securing Innovation with Trend (sponsored by Trend Micro)

title: Full-stack SQL Server modernization on AWS
abstract: Discover how to revolutionize database modernization by automating the migration of SQL Server workloads to open source databases. This session demonstrates real-world transformation scenarios, showcasing automated schema conversion, query optimization, and migration pathways to Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL.Learn how to reduce licensing costs, improve performance, and eliminate vendor lock-in while maintaining business continuity. We'll explore best practices for assessment, planning, and execution, plus hands-on examples of complex workload migrations. Perfect for architects, DBAs, and developers looking to modernize legacy SQL Server environments and embrace cloud-native, cost-effective open source database solutions.

title: Full stack web apps on EC2: Using Elastic Beanstalk with Amazon Q
abstract: Onboarding web applications to AWS is easy with Elastic Beanstalk. Learn how AWS Elastic Beanstalk simplifies deployment and maintenance of full stack web applications on EC2 with automated infrastructure provisioning. See how Amazon Q accelerates development by providing contextual CLI commands, troubleshooting guidance, and best practices recommendations. We'll discuss configurable auto-scaling to handle traffic spikes while optimizing costs. Perfect for developers starting their cloud journey, this session shows how Elastic Beanstalk with Amazon Q's AI capabilities streamlines the path from traditional hosting to modern cloud architecture. Can we change this intro to: Onboarding web applications to the cloud can be complex.

title: Function calling vs agents: Choose the right AI approach
abstract: As AI applications grow more complex, understanding when to use function calling versus agents in AWS becomes critical. This session breaks down the key differences, real-world use cases, and architectural considerations for each approach. Learn how to match the complexity of your AI solution with the right tools, whether you're building simple data integrations or orchestrating dynamic, multi-step workflows. the team'll also explore the emerging role of multi-agent systems and how they scale intelligent automation.

title: Fundamentals to scale Kubernetes across your organization
abstract: Ready to get hands-on with Amazon EKS? This modular workshop begins with Kubernetes fundamentals and lets you choose topics that match your interests including generative AI, observability, networking, security, and more. You can learn how to optimize scaling with Karpenter, automate day-to-day operations with EKS Auto Mode, troubleshoot real-world issues, and extend clusters on-premises with EKS Hybrid Nodes. Get hands-on building resilient, production-grade clusters on Amazon EKS following industry best practices and explore the latest Amazon EKS features, choosing only the modules that matter most to you.

title: Gaining insights from your data lake with Amazon S3 Metadata
abstract: Explore the comprehensive capabilities of Amazon S3 Metadata for both new and historical objects in your S3 buckets. Learn to configure and query journal and live inventory tables, stored as Apache Iceberg tables in your AWS-managed table bucket. Through practical exercises, write SQL queries using Amazon Athena to track near real-time changes and analyze your full bucket contents. Gain hands-on experience using S3 Metadata for comprehensive data discovery and management, regardless of object age or quantity.

title: Game Dev on AWS: Your Studio Architecture Questions Answered
abstract: Join AWS experts for an interactive deep-dive into game development architecture patterns using the Cloud Game Development Toolkit. We'll start with a brief overview of  common studio infrastructure challenges, then open the floor for your specific questions about Perforce migrations, build pipeline optimization, and multi-region  deployments. Bring your real-world scenarios - whether you're migrating from on-premises, scaling globally, or optimizing costs. This whiteboarding session will  tackle your unique challenges with proven AWS solutions and community-driven insights from the open-source toolkit.

title: Game on: build a retro adventure game in 120 minutes
abstract: Escape the conference hustle! Join us for a fun-filled session where you'll create your own retro-style adventure game. Whether you're a coding novice or seasoned dev, you'll leave with a playable game and plenty of laughs. We'll use modern developer tools like Kiro to make game development a breeze. Bring your imagination and a laptop!

title: Gen AI economics: Maximizing value while protecting the purse
abstract: In an era where generative AI revolutionizes public service delivery, agencies must strike a delicate balance between harnessing its transformative potential and upholding their fiscal responsibilities to taxpayers. This session provides a comprehensive blueprint for implementing cost-effective generative AI solutions in the public sector. We will demystify pricing models for AWS generative AI services, Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Q Developer & Amazon Q Business. Attendees will gain practical knowledge on strategic cost optimization techniques specific to foundation models, including effective prompt engineering, token usage management, and intelligent throughput planning that can dramatically reduce "dollars per inference" while maintaining service quality.

title: GenAI game coach: Real-time gameplay feedback
abstract: What if your gameplay footage could talk back and tell you how to improve? In this Dev Chat, I’ll walk through how I built a lightweight GenAI-powered system that watches short clips of your gameplay and gives real-time coaching feedback in natural language. No SDKs, no engine mods, just video, voice, and AWS. Using a combination of Amazon Rekognition for visual cues, Amazon Transcribe for in-game voice analysis, and Amazon Bedrock for feedback generation, this system turns raw gameplay into structured insights. You’ll learn how to combine multimodal data (frames, audio, context) and prompt engineering to build an interactive review.

title: GenAI, Hold the Waste: How H2O Fixed Its Storage Bottleneck (sponsored by Datafy)
abstract: Generative AI demands fast, flexible, and cost-efficient infrastructure. In this joint session, H2O.ai shares how they support rapid growth in AI workloads by leveraging Datafy’s autonomous storage scaling. As customer adoption of GenAI surged, so did block storage needs, along with cost and complexity. Learn how Datafy helped H2O.ai slash EBS waste, maintain performance, and scale seamlessly, all with zero downtime and near-instant deployment. Walk away with practical insights into architecting a resilient storage layer that adapts to unpredictable GenAI workloads without overprovisioning or firefighting. This presentation is brought to you by Datafy, an AWS Partner.

session.title: GenAI, Hold the Waste: How H2O Fixed Its Storage Bottleneck (sponsored by Datafy)

title: GenAI in Private Equity: Moving from Pilots to Performance (sponsored by PwC)
abstract: Private equity firms are entering a new era where generative AI is no longer experimental—it’s essential to value creation. In this session, explore how leading firms are scaling GenAI strategies in partnership with PwC and AWS. Learn how AI is transforming investment decisions, from smarter sourcing and due diligence to portfolio company optimization. We’ll share real-world use cases in forecasting, contract analysis, and customer engagement, plus examples of measurable business outcomes. The session also covers key considerations for responsible AI adoption, including governance, risk, and compliance frameworks tailored to the private equity landscape. This presentation is brought to you by PwC, an AWS Partner.

session.title: GenAI in Private Equity: Moving from Pilots to Performance (sponsored by PwC)

title: Gen AI in Security Assurance and Compliance: From Strategy to Daily Operations
abstract: Discover how GenAI is transforming security assurance and compliance operations in today's complex regulatory landscape. Learn practical strategies for integrating GenAI to convert manual-intensive compliance processes into streamlined, insights-driven workflows. We'll explore how GenAI can analyze compliance artifacts, map regulatory frameworks, and generate targeted response strategies while maintaining appropriate controls. Through the PACE framework (Purpose, Autonomy, Competency, Excellence), understand how to build a culture of responsible GenAI adoption. See real-world examples of achieving tangible improvements in both efficiency and quality while managing adoption risks through structured validation processes. Leave with actionable insights to enhance your organization's security and compliance operations.

title: GenAI-Powered Contextual Security Analysis & Remediation
abstract: For ISVs, managing security and costs in multi-tenant environments is complex: threats can spread across boundaries, cost attribution becomes unclear, and understanding true impact radius is challenging. This technical session demonstrates how to overcome these challenges by mapping tenant infrastructure relationships using Amazon Neptune and OpenSearch. Watch how graph-based architecture with GenAI integration provides deep contextual understanding of cross-tenant dependencies. Learn patterns for security analysis and cost attribution that reduce operational risks in multi-tenant environments.

title: Gen AI Security Testing & Protection Strategies [AWS Partners only]
abstract: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Develop robust generative AI security strategies through hands-on testing. Practice red teaming with an LLM, implement data protection controls, and secure agent workflows. Learn to protect both individual models and multi-component AI systems effectively. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: GenAI Storyboarding: From Sketch to 3D Scene with GenAI on AWS
abstract: Artist controlled AI content creation for visual storytelling. Learn how to transform initial sketches into concept-ready storyboards using Amazon Bedrock's generative AI capabilities. Walk through a workflow that maintains artistic control while leveraging AI: sketch compositions, generate style-consistent 2D assets, convert images to 3D models, and compose dynamic scenes. See how this integrated pipeline enables rapid iteration for film pre-visualization, game level design, and UI prototyping. Discover techniques for maintaining visual coherence across generated assets, controlling camera movements, and sequencing shot — turning the unpredictability of AI into a reliable creative tool for professional workflows.

title: Generative AI, agents, MCP, and the future of AI-powered software development
abstract: Follow along as we uncover the powerful forces shaping the future of AI coding. From the emergence of intelligent agents to Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, we'll explore the latest advancements and real-world use cases that are redefining what's possible for developer productivity and creativity. By the end, you'll feel empowered to embrace the magic of AI, no matter how daunting the technology may seem.

title: Generative AI Architecture Rodeo
abstract: Ready for a high stakes architectural challenge? The challenge: design a production ready system using AWS Generative AI services to ingest and process millions of multilingual documents spanning invoices, purchase orders, financial statements and more. Your solution must minimize hallucinations, meet strict privacy requirements, and deliver an end-to-end pipeline for validation and processing by integrating with various enterprise systems. Learn how to boost inference, enforce governance, ensure resiliency, and optimize costs in globally compliant architectures. Teams will be formed onsite, where AWS Subject matter experts will guide you through a gamified live challenge to design and build solutions where trade-offs deciding the ultimate Rodeo championship team.

title: Generative AI for Executives
abstract: This course guides business leaders in implementing generative AI within their organizations. Learn to identify valuable use cases across industries, understand implementation strategies, and manage organizational change. Focus on responsible AI adoption, covering essential concepts, risk management, and practical steps for getting started. Discover how to drive business value through AI while managing people, process, and technology transformations effectively. Ideal for leaders driving AI initiatives.

title: Generative AI strategy: accelerating path to production
abstract: Learn how to scale generative AI experiments into production-ready solutions. This session provides a strategic and technical framework for accelerating AI deployment while managing risks and maintaining governance. We'll cover practical approaches to align AI initiatives with business goals, establish evaluation criteria, and build effective teams. Through real-world examples, discover proven methods for fast-tracking implementation while ensuring security and quality. Gain actionable strategies for overcoming deployment challenges and creating repeatable processes that reduce time-to-value. Ideal for technology leaders focused on maximizing AI investments and driving enterprise adoption.

title: Generative and Agentic AI on Amazon EKS
abstract: AI is creating new opportunities, and organizations need speed-to-market, scalability, performance, and cost efficiency to bring ideas to life. Amazon EKS provides the trusted and flexible foundation for your AI journey as you build new experiences using AI inference, agents, and model fine-tuning. In this session, we will cover recent innovations in Amazon EKS that empower you with the latest AI capabilities and we will share real-world architectures, best practices, and examples to leave you equipped with the information you need to accelerate your AI initiatives.

title: Geo-fencing & real-time geospatial alerts with ElastiCache Valkey
abstract: In this builders' session, you will create a high-performance, real-time, geospatial alerting pipeline using Amazon ElastiCache for Valkey. This architecture pattern is tailored for dynamic applications like ridesharing, logistics, and fleet management. While Valkey's geospatial features are well-documented, this session goes beyond basic usage by demonstrating how to integrate real-time geospatial queries with event-driven workflows, addressing the complexities of large-scale geofencing in modern applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Getting hands on with zero-ETL and data federation
abstract: Zero-ETL integration and query federation capabilities with the next generation of Amazon SageMaker lets you spend less time on undifferentiated heavy lifting and more time building data products. In this workshop, we will get hands on with building Zero-ETL pipelines and federate queries with Amazon SageMaker Catalog and the AWS lakehouse architecture. This session will give you real, practical experience with streamlining data ingestion and querying external data sources, showing how these techniques allow you to accelerate your time to insights.

title: Getting started with Serverless using AI assistance
abstract: Serverless applications are built using many services, often with common architectural patterns. Wouldn't it be faster to get started with serverless if you had an AI assistant to apply patterns and best practices to build production-ready code? In this workshop, you will create a serverless application with authentication, create and run tests, set up observability, and have the option to configure a CI/CD pipeline. Along the way, your AI assistant will help review and explain code, look up configuration settings, and create tests. To complete this workshop, you must bring your laptop.

title: Global GenAI trends and learnings at re:Invent
abstract: [This session is conducted in Japanese] Generative AI technology is advancing at an astonishingly fast pace globally and many customers are exploring innovation with it. In that time, re:Invent is one of the best way to find out insights and chances to your next innovation. This session provides you preliminary knowledge to make your understanding more deeper to up-coming service launches, exciting customer stories and your chances to the future. We will share you global customer stories, common challenges and key points of recent service launches. Please join this session and be prepared for up-coming re:Invent!

title: Global Growth: A Framework for Expanding into New Regions
abstract: International growth is a top priority for ISVs, but meeting sovereignty requirements while expanding globally is challenging. In this session we focus on technical and operational considerations when expanding to new AWS Regions such as the upcoming AWS European Sovereign Cloud and Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. We will discuss navigating API parity differences, data residency requirements, generative AI options, SaaS delivery models, and more. This session will help you develop a structured approach to regional expansion while maintaining compliance and meeting customer requirements.

title: Global infrastructure for foundation model inference (sponsored by Baseten)
abstract: How do you go from state-of-the-art foundation model to a globally available usage-based API? This session provides an overview of the roadmap and architecture from model performance optimization to multi-region GPU-based infrastructure setup to the precise mechanics of request prioritization, token accounting, and rate limiting. Building on an inference stack that includes technologies like NVIDIA Dynamo, TensorRT-LLM, and Amazon EKS, we'll trace the path from model weights to a robust production service. This presentation is brought to you by Baseten, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Global infrastructure for foundation model inference (sponsored by Baseten)

title: Global Resilient Apps: Guide to Multi-AZ/Region Architecture with ELB
abstract: Learn advanced techniques for building globally distributed, highly available applications using Elastic Load Balancing (ELB). Through demonstrations and real-world use cases, you will learn essential patterns for multi-Availability Zone configurations, multi-Region deployments, and comprehensive disaster recovery solutions. The session covers optimizing global application performance using ELB and Amazon Route 53 to create resilient, globally accessible applications. Gain practical insights into implementing robust architectures and learn best practices for scaling, monitoring, and managing these complex systems, equipping yourself with the knowledge to build and maintain world-class, fault-tolerant solutions.

title: Global tourism brand transforms customer service with Amazon Connect
abstract: Looking to modernize your customer journey? Join this session to learn how TUI Group, one of the world's leading tourism organizations, harnessed the power of AI through cloud migration - successfully onboarding 10,000 agents and retail staff to Amazon Connect across 12 European markets in 8 languages. Discover how they improved the customer and agent experience with conversational IVR, bots at the same time as reducing operating expenses by 10%. Hear about proven AI and modernization success stories along with best practices on cloud migration for customer service.

title: Go from idea to deployment faster with Amazon Q Developer
abstract: Building software at scale doesn't always require developers to work across multiple tools, technologies, processes and stakeholders in order to collaborate effectively as they plan, write, and ship code. In this session we explore Amazon Q Developer's third-party integrations with GitHub and Gitlab that help streamline the developer experience with a single unified solution. Learn how you can automate routine tasks, assign your backlog to Q Developer, and eliminate context switching.

title: Go-to-market in today's political climate: a policy and AWS Marketplace overview
abstract: New political scenarios have created waves in public sector IT. This session will feature a public policy update on the White House's AI Action Plan and other initiatives that create opportunities for public sector partners. We will deep dive into AWS Marketplace as a contracting mechanism with which to achieve efficiency and cost savings across the public sector.

title: Governance and administrative controls with Amazon Q Business
abstract:
