As organizations increasingly leverage conversational AI, the need for robust administrative controls and governance has become paramount.
This hands-on workshop will guide you through setting up Amazon Q Business for your organization and leveraging its administrative controls. You'll explore user roles, permissions, guardrails, policies, and topic controls to govern application behavior, content, security, and compliance at scale. By the end, you'll have practical skills to effectively manage and deploy Amazon Q Business within your enterprise.

title: Governance that Enables Innovation at Scale feat. Eli Lilly
abstract: As enterprises expand their cloud footprint, they want to set up flexible and secure cloud environments that can easily adapt to business processes. By modernizing cloud governance with AWS Control Tower, customers can experiment, innovate, and scale more quickly in a secure and resilient manner. Learn how Eli Lilly, an American medicine company, successfully modernized their governance structure by migrating to AWS Control Tower with zero downtime for critical workloads. Learn how they implemented controls to meet compliance requirements and integrated Account Factory for Terraform to automate provisioning, enhance agility, improve security posture, and innovate faster, so they can focus on improving lives and communities.

title: GPU resource optimization on AWS: MIG, KAI, and Run:AI scheduling strategies
abstract: Discover advanced strategies for maximizing GPU utilization on AWS using NVIDIA MIG, KAI Scheduler, and Run:AI. Learn how to implement hard partitioning with MIG for guaranteed QoS, alongside intelligent scheduling with KAI and Run:AI for optimal resource allocation. This session demonstrates configuring these technologies on Amazon EKS, comparing performance characteristics, and implementing hybrid approaches. Walk away with architectural patterns for GPU sharing that balance isolation, utilization, and cost across multi-tenant ML workloads.

title: Graph Computations - Can we have best of two worlds: OLAP and OLTP?
abstract: Graph computations are a natural way of representing sparse relations and continue to gain attention, especially as knowledge graphs become central to generative AI applications. Can a single engine achieve analytical throughput and transactional consistency without fundamental performance penalties? Using Amazon Neptune Analytics architecture, explore tradeoffs of different graph representations and indexing strategies informed by high performance computing research, examining how performance varies under different workloads. We will discuss the space and time tradeoffs required for efficient cloud resource utilization, and present results that combine indexing efficiency, data locality, and parallel execution strategies.

title: Growing Pains to Growing Gains: AI for Every Data Stage
abstract: This chalk talk will chart the evolution of data platforms, from the nascent stages of a small five-person business to the complexities of an enterprise with over 500 employees. We'll whiteboard how AWS AI services can be strategically integrated at each growth phase, enabling data optimization, process automation, and deeper insights. Come learn how to move from data challenges to data advantages, seeing how AI plays a pivotal role in extracting more value from your evolving data architecture for sustainable scaling.

title: Grupo Tress Internacional's .NET modernization with AWS Transform
abstract: Looking to modernize your .NET applications? Learn how Grupo Tress Internacional used AWS Transform to reduce modernization effort by 70% while migrating from .NET Framework to .NET 8. This session demonstrates practical strategies for containerization and serverless using Amazon ECS, AWS Fargate and AWS Lambda, implementing DevOps methodologies, and empowering developers with generative AI tools to accelerate innovation.

title: HA and DR design patterns for Amazon RDS for SQL Server and Oracle
abstract: Explore high availability (HA) and disaster recovery  (DR) design patterns for SQL Server and Oracle databases on Amazon RDS. In  this session, learn about the features offered by Amazon RDS for business  continuity, including Multi-AZ deployments, read replicas, and  cross-region replication. Discover the customizations that Amazon RDS  Custom enables for HA and DR while also allowing you to bring your own  license (BYOL) for SQL Server. Also learn how globally resilient solutions  architected with RDS and RDS Custom minimize downtime and meet stringent  business continuity requirements for mission-critical workloads.

title: Handle scaling with AWS Lambda
abstract: Learn how serverless workloads can handle spikes in this interactive session on AWS Lambda scaling. Learn best practices to generate high throughput using load testing tools and analyze scaling behavior with CloudWatch metrics. Explore real-world use cases, covering potential pitfalls like cold starts, concurrency limits, and upstream/downstream bottlenecks. Leave with a tested approach to verify application scaling, even at high throughput levels. Gain confidence that your applications can truly scale on demand.

title: Hands-on AWS WAF: Troubleshooting attack scenarios
abstract: Suspicious of an activity spike? Seeing odd traffic patterns? Introduced a new AWS WAF rule and want to make sure it is operating as it should? Join this session for a walkthrough of a day in the life of a security engineer operating AWS WAF, reviewing dashboards, exploring data in the logs, and building new dashboard widgets to make your life easier. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Hands-on multi-tenant agents: Inside tenant-aware agentic systems
abstract: Multi-tenancy can have a profound impact on the design, implementation, and behavior of GenAI agents. The presence of tenant context can influence the memory, tools, actions, and workflows that are employed by agents. In this workshop, we’ll build tenant aware agents that uses a combination of mechanisms, applying multi-tenant strategies to integrations with RAG, MCP servers, and other agent constructs. It will also examine a range of additional multi-tenant agent considerations, including tenant isolation, multi-agent systems, and the implementation of non-deterministic agentic experiences. Finally, the workshop will demonstrate how instrument and aggregate multi-tenant GenAI usage and cost per tenant metrics.

title: Harnessing AI and Zero Trust to Drive Secure Digital Transformation (sponsored by Zscaler)
abstract: Join Zscaler CEO Jay Chaudhry as he explores how AI and machine learning are revolutionizing cybersecurity, from accelerating threat detection to enhancing predictive risk management. Learn about the role of Zero Trust architecture in reducing attack risks and enabling automation across users, workloads, devices, and partners. Gain insights into overcoming organizational inertia to successfully lead a secure digital transformation, combining AI-driven innovation with the power of the Zero Trust Exchange. This presentation is brought to you by Zscaler, an AWS Partner.

title: Harnessing analytics for humans and AI
abstract: Emerging trends, ranging from Open Table Formats (OTF) to agentic infrastructure, are rapidly changing how humans and applications interact with analytics to drive mission-critical business decisions. Join Mai-Lan Tomsen Bukovec, VP of AWS Technology, to explore emerging trends, the evolution of analytics engines and applications, and how to future-proof your data foundation for the rapidly changing landscape of analytics at scale. Learn how AWS is transforming data and analytics services to lead in optimized data storage, querying, streaming, processing, and governance - for both human users and agentic infrastructure.

title: Healthcare Transformed: Reimagining the Future with Generative AI (sponsored by PwC)
abstract: Join a panel discussion hosted by PwC, featuring three Chief Information Officers from leading healthcare systems, as they explore the future of healthcare in a financially strained and rapidly evolving landscape. Discover how organizations are leveraging generative AI and secure, cloud-native platforms to boost productivity, reduce operational costs, and empower their clinical, operational, and research teams. Learn how to scale AI responsibly across complex enterprises, transform care delivery, and drive innovation with measurable outcomes. This presentation is brought to you by PwC, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Healthcare Transformed: Reimagining the Future with Generative AI (sponsored by PwC)
Healthcare Transformed: Reimagining the Future with Generative AI (sponsored by PwC)
Healthcare Transformed: Reimagining the Future with Generative AI (sponsored by PwC)

title: Hesitate and You’re History: Why You Need Agentic AI Right Now (sponsored by Qlik)
abstract: Agentic AI is no longer hype — it’s the next battleground for growth. Winning means the ability to create autonomous, goal-oriented systems and wield data effectively. Companies that execute will outpace the competition; those that don’t will be left behind explaining why they hesitated ... if they’re around at all. Join Ingersoll Rand to discover how they’re using Qlik® to accelerate insights, sharpen AI-driven decisions, and increase productivity — delivering real competitive advantage today while fulfilling their strategic vision of tomorrow’s AI-powered analytics. This presentation is brought to you by Qlik, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Hesitate and You’re History: Why You Need Agentic AI Right Now (sponsored by Qlik)
Hesitate and You’re History: Why You Need Agentic AI Right Now (sponsored by Qlik)

speakers.globalJobtitle: General Manager, Qlik AI and Analytics

title: High-Impact Results Through Co-Innovation with AWS & SAP Business AI (sponsored by SAP)
abstract: See how enterprises are achieving measurable business results with generative AI solutions built on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) and powered by AWS. Explore high-impact use cases—from optimizing supply chains and forecasting financial performance to strengthening operational resilience and deploying intelligent AI agents that work seamlessly across business processes. Discover how to combine trusted SAP data with AWS GenAI services and tap into the expertise of a broad partner ecosystem to accelerate solution development, reduce risk, and deliver greater business impact This presentation is brought to you by SAP, an AWS Partner.

session.title: High-Impact Results Through Co-Innovation with AWS & SAP Business AI (sponsored by SAP)

title: High Performance Computing for Mission-Ready Federal Workloads
abstract: From advanced simulations to real-time analytics, High Performance Computing (HPC) is driving faster, more informed decision-making across defense and federal agencies. This session explores how AWS enables agencies to rapidly deploy scalable HPC environments that meet mission demands—while ensuring security and compliance with frameworks like NIST SP 800-223. We’ll walk through architectural patterns, performance optimization techniques, and examples of mission-ready HPC workflows. Learn how to accelerate research, modeling, and simulation with the flexibility of the cloud, all while safeguarding sensitive workloads. Whether supporting R&D, operations, or data-intensive missions, HPC on AWS helps agencies move at the speed of need.

title: High-performance storage for AI/ML, analytics, and HPC workloads
abstract: AWS storage services can act as a powerful, cost-effective foundation for the most demanding high-performance workload, from genomics analysis to media rendering and real-time analytics. In this session, explore storage options that are suitable for numerous architectures, data types, and organizational requirements and that can accelerate your most performance-critical applications to speed up time to insights and time to market. From data ingestion to processing and storage, learn advanced techniques and best practices for achieving peak performance at scale for your most demanding workloads.

title: How Adobe & Salesforce Enable Sustainability initiatives with AWS CCFT
abstract: Join technical leaders from Adobe and Salesforce as they reveal how AWS's Customer Carbon Footprint Tool supports their environmental initiatives. This session explores innovative approaches to cloud optimization and sustainability reporting, showcasing real-world architectures that prioritize sustainability. Learn how these organizations leverage AWS's Customer Carbon Footprint Tool to achieve ambitious environmental goals while maintaining operational excellence. Discover actionable strategies for implementing comprehensive carbon reporting and advancing your organization's sustainability journey through cloud innovation.

title: How AI is impacting the software development lifecycle
abstract: The AI-Driven Software Development Lifecycle (AI-DLC) is a revolutionary approach that empowers developers to harness the transformative power of AI in software development. Unlike traditional methods, AI-DLC places AI at the forefront, driving workflows, decomposing tasks, and generating recommendations. This AI-led paradigm enables faster decision-making, seamless task execution, and continuous adaptability, while maintaining human oversight and control. In this chalk talk, we'll explore the key principles and core framework of AI-DLC, demonstrating how it can help organizations deliver complex, high-quality software faster than ever before. Attendees will gain insights into the future of software development and how to successfully navigate the AI-driven era.

title: How AI is rewriting the contact center play book (sponsored by Zendesk)
abstract: Contact centers are at the front line of customer experience but too often, they’re weighed down by complexity, siloed tools, and reactive service models. In this lightning talk, we’ll show how Zendesk, running on AWS, is helping enterprises reimagine the contact center as an intelligent, proactive engine for customer loyalty. You’ll learn how AI and automation can deflect up to 60% of inquiries, empower agents with real-time insights, and scale seamlessly for unpredictable spikes in demand. Discover what’s possible when CX meets cloud scale where faster resolutions, happier customers, and stronger loyalty aren’t just goals, but everyday outcomes. This presentation is brought to you by Zendesk, an AWS Partner.

title: How Allianz designed AIOps at enterprise scale
abstract: Deploying applications that utilize large language models (LLMs) at enterprise scale presents unique challenges beyond traditional MLOps. In this session, aimed at developers and data scientists, learn how Allianz built a comprehensive AIOps framework for bringing AI-powered solutions to production. Discover how they leveraged Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, and open-source solutions to create an ecosystem serving a wide range of user groups. Explore architectural patterns for ensuring consistency, security, and governance across AI implementations while enabling rapid deployment of new use cases. Gain insights into managing end-to-end LLM applications within complex organizational structures, balancing innovation with compliance in highly regulated environments.

title: How Amazon Ads uses AWS to democratize ad creation
abstract: Media advertisers see up to 25% higher engagement when delivering custom creative to relevant audiences, yet producing quality video ads traditionally requires weeks of expensive and specialized expertise.** **Discover how Amazon Ads is transforming the creative process by automating and enhancing the generation of multi-format ads to businesses regardless of their size or creative expertise. Explore how Amazon Bedrock, custom-built ML models, GPUs, and model evaluations are used to orchestrate and generate compelling ad creatives into full video productions with professional voiceovers from conversational natural language, while reducing creative development time.

title: How Amazon EC2 improves the customer experience with Live Migration
abstract: Live Migration (LM) is foundational technology of Amazon EC2. It is used to rescue customer instance off degraded hosts, optimize the placement of instances to reduce the risk of correlated failures at the host/rack/DC level, optimize costs by improving the utilization of the hosts, optimizing the performance of the instance with heat management for example Aurora Serverles v2. This talk provides an overview how LM is used and implemented in AWS and how EC2 innovates in software and hardware to continously improve the customer's experience.

title: How Amazon Game Studios builds a data foundation for AI/ML on AWS
abstract: Join us as we present Amazon Game Studios' transformative approach to game data infrastructure through their proprietary Data Forge platform. We'll show how this comprehensive solution integrates sophisticated data pipelines with MLOps capabilities, processing 5+ PB of game data across titles like Lost Ark. You'll see how the hub-and-spoke Redshift architecture enables efficient analytics while the unified ML environment has reduced model production time by 80%. We'll illustrate the complete data flow—from Kinesis ingestion through S3 storage to Redshift clusters—alongside the SageMaker-powered ML lifecycle that dramatically improves collaboration between data scientists and game developers throughout development and live service phases

title: How Amazon is migrating 1000’s of applications to new AWS regions
abstract: In this session we'll share learnings and best practices from Amazon’s largest cross region migration to date with 1000’s of services migrating across AWS regions. We’ll share our strategy and tools for migrations at scale and cover details on how we have automated common migration tasks for compute and storage replication. The session will cover how awe have simplified developer effort for migrations with CI/CD pipeline analysis and the tools we’ve implemented using Amazon Q Developer and the AWS CDK to remove region dependencies and deploy infrastructure as code where resources have been manually configured.

title: How Amazon Teams Use AI Assistants to Accelerate Development
abstract: Learn how Amazon developers achieve real productivity gains using Amazon Q Developer, an AI-powered coding assistant. This code talk demonstrates proven techniques for accelerating development workflows using Prompt-Driven Development and Agent Scripts. Through live examples, learn how development teams cut feature development time from weeks to days while maintaining code quality. Discover practical strategies for leveraging these patterns in both familiar and new codebases.

title: How Amazon uses AI and Automated Reasoning to detect hallucinations
abstract: With the launch of Automated Reasoning checks (ARc) in Amazon Bedrock Guardrails, AWS is the first major cloud provider to integrate automated reasoning in their generative AI offerings thus spearheading the push into neurosymbolic AI. In this 500-level session focused on ARc, join AWS experts for a deep dive into how automated reasoning techniques help verify AI model outputs. We will use practical examples to explain the underlying mathematical and scientific foundations, and to discuss strategies for setting up effective guardrails.

title: How Arrivia Stopped a Data Theft Ring with Teramind (sponsored by Teramind)
abstract: A routine productivity audit at Arrivia exposed a sophisticated insider stealing customer data during night shifts, building databases for potential sale. Traditional security measures could detect suspicious access patterns, but couldn't prove intent or methodology. The breakthrough came through Teramind’s behavioral analytics and comprehensive investigation features, which revealed the employee's sophisticated cover-up techniques. See how Teramind’s AI-powered technology transformed Arrivia's security posture and operations based on accurate workforce engagement data. Learn implementation strategies for insider threat detection and building trust through transparent monitoring policies. This presentation is brought to you by Teramind, an AWS Partner.

title: How Baker Hughes is Driving Energy Innovation with AWS AI (sponsored by Baker Hughes)
abstract: In this session, discover how Baker Hughes is turning generative AI into real-world impact for energy customers. Explore use cases with large language models and conversational AI to optimize production. Learn about customer pilots leveraging AgenticAI-powered intelligent agents to drive autonomous decision-making in the field. This is not theory—it’s action leadership. Attendees will gain insight into how AWS technologies like Bedrock and EnergyAgents are enabling scalable, intelligent solutions across the energy value chain. This presentation is brought to you by Baker Hughes, an AWS Partner.

session.title: How Baker Hughes is Driving Energy Innovation with AWS AI (sponsored by Baker Hughes)

title: How Cathay Transformed DevSecOps with AI: A 75% Faster Security Story
abstract: Learn how Cathay Pacific Airways  partnered with AWS ProServe to revolutionize their DevSecOps approach, moving  beyond basic security scanning to create a comprehensive shift-left  security-first culture. By implementing AI-powered security champions, defensive  coding patterns & anti-patterns, AppSec-as-Code libraries as knowledge  base, customized AppSec scanning rules and RAG-based Agentic AI assistant,  they achieved remarkable results: 50% cost reduction, 75% faster  vulnerability remediation, and 70% improvement in developer security  capabilities. Discover how this Fortune 500 airline transformed 1,000+  developers into security-conscious practitioners while managing 4,000+ annual  deployments.

title: How Cires21 revolutionized advanced video workflows using AI on AWS
abstract: This session explores how Cires21's MediaCopilot SaaS solution, built on AWS, uses AI and automation to simplify operations like highlight generation, multilingual subtitling, and automated clipping. By abstracting technical complexities, the platform allows teams to focus on content creation rather than infrastructure. Through AWS's scalable architecture, MediaCopilot empowers SMBs in diverse sectors to enhance customer engagement, training, and communications with professional-quality video content, addressing key challenges of resource limitations and quick deployment without specialized staff or substantial investment.

title: How CloudFront Handles Black Friday-Scale Retail at the Edge
abstract: When millions of shoppers flood the internet during Black Friday and Cyber Monday, Amazon CloudFront is at the edge making sure every request gets through - fast, secure, and at scale. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll discuss how CloudFront handles internet-scale traffic: from request routing to caching strategies and edge compute. We’ll break down real-world architectures, share battle-tested patterns, and answer your toughest questions about building for massive global events.

title: How customers build AI at scale with AWS AI infrastructure
abstract: Join industry leaders as they share their experiences scaling AI initiatives using AWS AI infrastructures. AWS customers will present their journeys demonstrating how they optimized their AI workloads across training and inference for maximum performance and cost efficiency. Discover real-world architectures, implementation strategies, and lessons learned from organizations deploying large language models, reasoning systems, and multimodal applications at scale. Learn practical approaches to selecting and leveraging the right AI infrastructure for your AI workloads while managing costs effectively.

title: How Enterprises are Pioneering Innovation and DevOps (sponsored by Harness, Inc)
abstract: To keep up to date with today's rapidly evolving financial landscape, Harness customers decided to move to a cloud-first strategy. Led by Nick Durkin, Field CTO at Harness, this session will explore how companies leverage Harness's comprehensive software delivery platform to revolutionize its development processes, and AWS to achieve their goal of becoming a cloud-first leading financial company. This presentation is brought to you by Harness, Inc, an AWS Partner.

title: How Event Driven Architectures Go Wrong  and How to Fix them
abstract: Event-driven architectures enable speed and agility for distributed cloud applications; however, this also means there's the risk of shipping bad ideas fast without governance. Fortunately, the same agility allows for quick fixes. Attend this chalk talk to learn common event-driven pitfalls, including YOLO events, god events, observability soup, event loops, exposing monoliths, state corruption, and surprise bills. Explore strategies and techniques teams can implement to avoid these pitfalls and reap the full benefits of event-driven architectures.

title: How High-Performing Teams Connect Observability to Business Growth (sponsored by Coralogix)
abstract: High-performing engineering teams don’t stop at collecting logs and metrics. They turn observability into a competitive advantage. In this session, we’ll explore a four-stage maturity model that shows how organizations evolve from capturing telemetry to making business-critical decisions. You’ll learn how leading teams define SLOs, tie reliability to customer experience, and connect technical signals directly to revenue and growth. Whether you’re an engineer optimizing uptime or a leader shaping product strategy, you’ll walk away with a clear framework to align engineering performance with business outcomes. This presentation is brought to you by Coralogix, an AWS Partner.

title: How Netflix Connects Product Experiments to its AWS Bill
abstract: How do you measure the cost of innovation? At Netflix, a "winning" A/B test can create hidden cloud infrastructure costs that offset its business value. This session details our strategy for connecting product experiments to their infrastructure costs. We'll share our framework for identifying an experiment's impact on our cloud systems and show how we translate that impact into a projected AWS cost. Learn how this enables our teams to make smarter, more cost-aware product decisions at scale.

title: How Netflix Shapes our Fleet for Efficiency and Reliability
abstract: Netflix's strategy for optimizing its cloud architecture for efficiency and reliability. Placement of workloads on price-optimal hardware by automatically modeling capacity requirements and understanding AWS hardware performance and pricing. The talk will also cover a continuous optimization loop that monitors and reshapes the fleet to maintain business outcomes as load patterns change. Finally, it will touch upon managing traffic demand and compute supply to ensure availability during unexpected load shifts.

title: How Nissan Accelerated Software-Defined Vehicle Development with AWS
abstract: Discover how Nissan built a comprehensive SDV ecosystem and reduced software testing time by 75%, combining advanced software development environments, robust data platforms, and scalable EE architecture all powered by AWS. We'll explore how the implementation of AWS Generative AI capabilities, test automation, and custom engineering workbenches has enabled Nissan to decouple service development from vehicle development cycles, allowing for more frequent and agile service releases.

title: How Prime Video balanced innovation and reliability for live sports
abstract: Discover how Prime Video transformed its change control strategy to support 24/7 global live sports broadcasts while maintaining operational reliability. Learn to implement dynamic, risk-aware controls that replace rigid deployment freezes. Explore techniques for identifying resilient services, building programmable safety nets with AWS services, and encouraging test automation. Gain practical insights into balancing deployment velocity with operational safety, applicable to any organization managing mission-critical workloads in a rapidly changing environment.

title: How Priority Pass migrated their global-scale website
abstract: Discover how Priority Pass, the world's largest independent airport lounge access program, successfully migrated their high-traffic website to AWS Amplify. This session explores the journey of modernizing a legacy platform serving millions of global travelers into a scalable, serverless architecture. Learn how the team leveraged AWS Amplify's full-stack capabilities to implement CI/CD pipelines, robust authentication, and dynamic content delivery while maintaining seamless performance across multiple regions. This session will explore the technical challenges faced, architectural decisions made, and benefits realized from this large-scale migration. Attendees will gain practical insights for planning their own enterprise-level AWS Amplify implementation.

title: How Samsung optimized 1.2 PB on Amazon DynamoDB with zero downtime
abstract: Join Samsung Cloud to learn how they successfully implemented a massive-scale table optimization, handling 1.2 PB on Amazon DynamoDB with zero downtime. Follow the innovative journey behind Samsung Internet's tab sync feature, showcasing how the team developed an in-house solution to handle complex data transfer achieving substantial cost savings without third-party dependencies. *Learn how this implementation resulted in the creation of a new standard framework that now serves as Samsung's blueprint for future data management initiatives.* Gain practical insights into building scalable solutions through deep service domain understanding and discover actionable strategies to tackle similar challenges in your organization.

title: How Samsung Uses AI Agents to Optimize Infrastructure at Scale  (sponsored by Cast AI)
abstract: Samsung runs Kubernetes at massive scale on Amazon EKS. In this session, Samsung engineers will share how they built and deployed Cast AI’s application performance automation platform that continuously optimize their cloud infrastructure in real time. You’ll learn how automation is driving down operational overhead, improving application efficiency, and significantly reducing costs across thousands of Samsung’s workloads. This talk offers a behind-the-scenes look at how one of the world’s most innovative companies uses AI to make Kubernetes smarter, faster, and more efficient.  This presentation is brought to you by Cast AI, an AWS Partner.

session.title: How Samsung Uses AI Agents to Optimize Infrastructure at Scale  (sponsored by Cast AI)

title: How SAS and Freshworks Power Real-Time Personalization at Extreme Scale  (sponsored by ScyllaDB)
abstract: Learn how SAS and Freshworks built real-time data infrastructure that satisfies critical scaling requirements – from “big game” traffic spikes to hypergrowth demands. Brian Jones discusses how SAS designed their SAS 360 Match real-time ad decisioning architecture, which combines intelligent decision logic with high-speed delivery pipelines. He covers the architectural choices, including how cloud-native components and horizontally scalable data layers enable sub-second responsiveness, fault tolerance, and campaign optimization at scale. Additionally, Sreedhar Gade shares how Freshworks redesigned their AI-powered business software architecture to support 10X growth while achieving 95% latency reduction and significant cost savings. This presentation is brought to you by ScyllaDB, an AWS Partner.

session.title: How SAS and Freshworks Power Real-Time Personalization at Extreme Scale  (sponsored by ScyllaDB)
How SAS and Freshworks Power Real-Time Personalization at Extreme Scale  (sponsored by ScyllaDB)

title: How Security Maturity Enables Your Cryptographic Agility Playbook
abstract: Learn how organizational culture and robust security practices create a foundation for successful cryptographic transitions. This session demonstrates how enterprises can leverage existing TLS 1.3 migration experiences as a blueprint for post-quantum readiness. Discover practical mechanisms for establishing crypto-governance, building cross-functional partnerships, and creating repeatable migration patterns using AWS services like Private CA and KMS. Through real-world examples, explore how security culture mechanisms enable seamless cryptographic updates, setting your organization up for future quantum-safe transformations.

title: How Sophos modernizes security data at scale with Cribl and AWS (sponsored by Cribl)
abstract: Sophos, a British cybersecurity company, faced exponential growth and complexity in its internal security environment—processing terabytes of log and security telemetry daily. In this session, Chris O’Brien, VP of Security Operations, shares how Sophos used Cribl and AWS to cut costs by filtering data at the source, normalizing and routing heterogeneous logs, and accelerating SIEM migration from months to weeks. The team leveraged Cribl to centralize logging and migrate data off of legacy infrastructure for greater flexibility and simplified compliance. Learn how the Sophos team tackles massive telemetry data growth to meet compliance requirements and future-proof their security data operations. This presentation is brought to you by Cribl, an AWS Partner.

title: How Stripe built a foundation model for fraud detection on AWS
abstract: Financial institutions face growing challenges detecting sophisticated fraud patterns within real-time transactions. Learn how Stripe tackled this challenge by developing a transformer-based foundation model on AWS. We’ll explore how they leveraged Amazon EKS with GPU instances and Amazon SageMaker to train models on billions of transactions, improving card testing attack detection from 59% to 97%. Discover their approach to treating transactions as language, creating semantic embeddings that capture relationships between transactions in a vector space. See how this sequence-based analysis enables detection of fraud patterns in real-time, even within high-volume merchant transactions.

title: How TE Connectivity Transforms Product Engineering with Agentic AI
abstract: Join to learn how TE Connectivity's agentic AI platform accelerates product development while optimizing costs. The platform unifies 500,000+ documents and 2 million engineering data points through a conversational interface, powered by Amazon Bedrock with RAG architecture. Agentic workflows enable engineers to synthesize documents, interpret code and design specifications, translate content, compare technical specifications, and generate compliance drafts autonomously. In three months, TE Connectivity processed 2.5 million documents and onboarded 40,000 engineers. Through optimized agentic architecture and precise model tuning, TE Connectivity delivers gen AI capabilities while maintaining low operational costs and securely scaling expertise across global teams.

title: How to optimize AWS storage for generative AI and ML workloads
abstract: Scaling deep learning programs into production often comes with its challenges, and you can’t have high-quality data modeling if your storage isn’t optimized for performance scalability. Getting this wrong can lead to unexpected cost and performance issues. In this interactive chalk talk, get answers to your questions related to selecting and optimizing storage for AI and ML workloads so you can build better, innovate faster, and deploy at scale.

title: How to uplevel your DevSecOps practice with agentic AI (sponsored by GitLab)
abstract: While AI code generators have succeeded in helping developers generate more code, developers report that they still spend only 21% on building applications. Amazon Q combined with the GitLab DevSecOps platform can help change that by offering agentic AI workflow automation across the entire software development lifecycle. Join us to hear from technical leaders at GitLab and AWS about insights and best practices on how software development teams can adopt agentic AI in their organizations to improve developer productivity while also meeting IT security and compliance requirements. This presentation is brought to you by GitLab, an AWS Partner.

session.title: How to uplevel your DevSecOps practice with agentic AI (sponsored by GitLab)

title: How Toyota Built an AI Platform that Revolutionizes the Dealer Experience
abstract: In this session, Toyota Connected North America and Toyota Enterprise AI showcase how they transformed dealer operations using Amazon Bedrock and Claude to create an intelligent assistant that answers complex vehicle questions in seconds. The system now serves 2,300+ dealerships with instant, accurate vehicle expertise and handles 7,000+ monthly dealer interactions across multiple Toyota models and years, leveraging Amazon Bedrock, OpenSearch Serverless, and Amazon EKS for enterprise-scale performance.

title: How well do you know EC2?
abstract: Many organizations deploy Amazon EC2 instances without fully leveraging available optimization opportunities. EC2 offers over 850 instance types across six categories: general purpose, compute optimized, memory optimized, storage optimized, accelerated computing, and high-performance computing. Most instances run on the AWS Nitro System, which delivers enhanced performance through dedicated hardware for compute, storage, and networking functions. This session explores EC2's breadth, from processor architectures including Intel, AMD, and AWS Graviton processors that deliver up to 40% better price performance, to purchase options like Spot Instances offering up to 90% savings and Savings Plans for predictable workloads. Discover practical strategies for matching workloads to optimal instance configurations and purchasing models.

title: How Yahoo! Finance built research multi-agent systems with Gen AI
abstract: Learn how Yahoo! Finance architected multi-agent systems to transform financial research and analysis using generative AI. Discover their implementation of Model Context Protocol (MCP) for efficient agent collaboration, integration of structured/unstructured data processing, and video analysis through tool/API calling. Get practical guidance from their production deployment and insights for scaling agent architectures. For data scientists and architects building enterprise AI solutions.

title: How Zydus implemented regulated DR on AWS
abstract: This session explores Zydus Lifesciences' cloud-driven disaster recovery strategy for safeguarding Terabytes of regulated data across 10+ critical pharma applications. The session details how Zydus achieved a less than 15 minutes of RPO and less than 2 hours of RTO across main Data Center and multiple Plant locations and reduced DR costs by 55% and increased the resiliency of critical Pharma Applications while meeting strict regulatory requirements. We will cover in-depth technical & Network architecture covering AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery (DRS), Elastic Block Storage, Direct Connect & Transit Gateway AWS services.

title: HPC at Scale: From Robot Learning to Scientific Insights on AWS
abstract: High-performance computing on AWS is driving advances from AI-driven robotics to large-scale industrial simulations. This session explores how AWS Batch with SageMaker Training scales generative AI models that teach robots complex skills, and how AWS Parallel Computing Service powers HPC workloads like energy modeling and scientific research. You will also hear directly from customers who showcase real-world use cases with AWS HPC services, providing an in-depth view of how innovation is being enabled across robotics, energy, and beyond.

title: HPC infrastructure for Financial Services using AWS Batch and AWS CDK
abstract: Take your HPC infrastructure as code skills to the next level with AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK). In this Builders Session you'll use CDK to implement an HPC architecture using AWS Batch and run a sample Financial Services "Risk Analysis Grid" workload. This session is for experienced HPC practitioners beginning their AWS infrastructure as code journey, and AWS builders who are new to HPC and AWS Batch.

title: HPC Made Easy: AWS PCS for AI & Scientific Computing
abstract: Discover how AWS Parallel Computing Service eliminates the undifferentiated heavy lifting of cluster management for both HPC and AI workloads. This workshop walks through creating, configuring, and using fully-managed compute environments with minimal setup time. Learn practical job submission techniques, resource optimization strategies, and gain hands-on experience with PCS's intuitive interfaces. We'll showcase select new capabilities that further streamline workflows. Ideal for researchers and engineers seeking to accelerate computation without infrastructure complexity.

title: HPC Sustainability by Design: Optimizing for Planet and Performance
abstract: Master the art of building sustainable HPC clusters on AWS that optimize both performance and environmental impact. This session demonstrates how to architect energy-efficient HPC workloads using Graviton-based instances and AWS Well-Architected Framework's Sustainability Pillar principles. Through practical examples from science and engineering domains, learn proven strategies to reduce carbon footprint while maintaining computational power. Walk away with actionable insights to implement green computing practices in your HPC infrastructure, and drive meaningful environmental improvements across your organization's high-performance workloads.

title: Human Agency in AI: Balancing Automation, Oversight, and Innovation (sponsored by Boomi)
abstract: As AI-driven automation transforms organizations, a balance between efficiency, control, and human agency is essential. This panel will explore how Boomi’s AI-powered integration and automation solutions—including the Boomi Agent Control Tower—enable enterprises to automate intelligently while ensuring governance and transparency. Experts will discuss best practices for leveraging AI responsibly, maintaining compliance, and fostering collaboration between AI and human decision-makers. Attendees will gain insights into how Boomi’s advancements help organizations scale AI-driven innovation without compromising control, security, or human agency in an increasingly digital landscape. This presentation is brought to you by Boomi, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Human Agency in AI: Balancing Automation, Oversight, and Innovation (sponsored by Boomi)
Human Agency in AI: Balancing Automation, Oversight, and Innovation (sponsored by Boomi)

title: Human-Centric AI: Avoiding the High Cost of Getting It Wrong in IT (sponsored by NinjaOne)
abstract: AI isn’t a silver bullet — it’s a strategic investment for IT. To truly unlock its potential in reducing costs, easing burnout, and improving security, IT organizations should adopt AI thoughtfully, with people at the center of their approach. Done right, AI enhances teams and operations — it doesn’t replace them. Too often, hasty adoption leads to wasted time, broken trust, and poor outcomes. In this session, NinjaOne Field CTO Jeff Hunter explores the real costs of bad AI and outlines a smarter, human-centric path forward — one that integrates AI into everyday IT workflows to elevate teams and deliver stronger business outcomes. This presentation is brought to you by NinjaOne, an AWS Partner.

title: Human Meets Microservice: Zero Trust with AWS Networking Services
abstract: In today's evolving security landscape, organizations need secure access without complex VPN overhead. Zero Trust provides the new baseline. This hands-on session teaches you to enable identity-aware, least-privilege access for both human users and microservices using AWS Verified Access and Amazon VPC Lattice. You'll configure secure access from remote users to internal applications with Verified Access. Then build service-to-service communication across VPCs using VPC Lattice. Discover how to connect users and services—securely, efficiently, and without compromise. Whether you're responsible for secure remote access or service mesh connectivity, this session provides the practical knowledge to implement these solutions in your own environment. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Hybrid connectivity at scale: A deep dive into AWS Direct Connect
abstract: Unlock the full potential of AWS Direct Connect in this advanced technical deep dive. In this session, explore both dedicated and hosted connections, Virtual Interfaces (VIFs), and BGP routing optimization for predictable bandwidth and reduced data transfer costs. Learn from experts about complex architectures including Direct Connect Gateway for multi-Region connectivity, LAG configurations for redundancy, and capabilities such as AWS Direct Connect SiteLink. After diving into advanced features like MACsec encryption and cross-connect processes, attendees will gain insights into troubleshooting methodologies, performance optimization, and integration patterns with AWS Transit Gateway and AWS Cloud WAN.

title: Hybrid Foundations to Cloud Innovation Transforming IBM i/AIX Workloads with AWS (sponsored by Lightedge)
abstract: IBM i and AIX continue to power mission-critical workloads across industries. While their reliability often keeps things running, that stability can mask growing risks, including escalating maintenance costs, unsupported OS versions, and limited integration with cloud-native applications. In this session, hear how enterprises tackle these challenges with a phased modernization strategy that rehosts IBM workloads in a hybrid cloud environment. Learn how they established secure, low-latency AWS connectivity, integrated IBM business logic with cloud-native services, and more. Review proven frameworks, architectural insights, and modernization strategies to reduce risk, accelerate cloud adoption, and maximize the value of your infrastructure. This presentation is brought to you by Lightedge, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Hybrid Foundations to Cloud Innovation Transforming IBM i/AIX Workloads with AWS (sponsored by Lightedge)

title: Hybrid Science: AI + Physics Simulations for Climate & Automotive Engineering
abstract: This chalk talk explores architectures that couple AI with physics-based simulations across climate science, weather forecasting, and automotive engineering. We'll examine how AWS technologies such as AWS Batch enable efficient workflows where numerical simulation outputs train AI models, which then feed downstream simulation tools. Through interactive discussion, we'll demonstrate real-world patterns for  computational efficiency and workflow orchestration. Learn practical approaches for implementing these hybrid pipelines – from using simulation-generated weather data to train AI models for rapid forecasting to computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations for AI-assisted intelligent aerodynamic surface design.

title: IAM Access Analyzer Deep Dive: From Configuration to Remediation
abstract: Dive deep into IAM Access Analyzer in this interactive code talk focused on enhancing your AWS security posture. Watch and code along as we explore the automated reasoning powers of the three key analyzers: Unused Access, External Access, and Internal Access. Through live coding demonstrations, you'll learn how to configure each analyzer and interpret their findings. We'll guide you through actionable recommendations and specific remediation steps for common issues identified by these tools, showing the actual code implementation. By the end of this code talk, you'll be equipped with the knowledge to effectively implement IAM Access Analyzer in your own environment, enabling you to proactively identify and address potential security risks, optimize access management, and maintain a robust security stance in your AWS infrastructure.

title: IAM Access Analyzer from Research Paper to Reality
abstract: Discover how IAM Access Analyzer evolved from theoretical research into a practical service through a deep examination of its foundational paper on stratified predicate abstraction. Through live analysis of the paper that powers Access Analyzer's external access findings, you'll learn techniques for understanding complex technical publications, from quick assessment to deep comprehension. Whether you're curious about Access Analyzer's inner workings or looking to dive into research publications, you'll leave equipped to bridge the gap between academic theory and practical applications.

title: IAM Analytics: Automate & Visualize
abstract: In this Workshop, learn to create an automated pipeline that optimizes AWS IAM roles using CloudTrail, Athena, Lambda, DynamoDB, and IAM. We'll address the common challenge of overly permissive roles in AWS environments, especially after migrations or when establishing cloud foundations after a POC. You'll build a workflow that analyzes CloudTrail logs using Athena queries, processes results with Lambda, stores data in DynamoDB, and automatically adjusts IAM permissions. You'll also create a QuickSight dashboard to visualize permissions usage patterns with GenBI. This hands-on experience will equip you with skills to enhance security and efficiency in your AWS account management.

title: Iceland.co.uk: Boosting sales with hyper-personalized recommendations
abstract: Iceland.co.uk: Boosting sales with hyper-personalized recommendations ** In the rapidly evolving retail landscape, data-driven insights have become a pivotal force in enhancing customer experiences. By leveraging comprehensive customer data, businesses can deliver highly targeted shopping experiences that boost customer engagement and revenue performance. Using a combination of Amazon S3, DocumentDB, Athena and Personalise, Iceland utilized detailed transactional and behavioural data to create personalized shopping basket recommendations, leading to a notable increase in basket size. This approach focused on analysing customer shopping behaviours and preferences to tailor product suggestions, thereby optimizing the shopping experience through data-driven personalization.

title: I didn't know AWS SAM could do that
abstract: Discover the hidden potential of AWS SAM for local serverless development. This technical deep-dive showcases how SAM transcends deployment to become your indispensable local development companion. You'll explore advanced techniques for testing AWS Lambda functions, Amazon API Gateway, and event sources on your laptop without cloud deployment. Experience how Amazon Q enhances the SAM experience, accelerating development cycles and enabling sophisticated local debugging. Learn how these powerful capabilities can dramatically reduce development time and cloud costs while improving the robustness of your serverless applications.

title: I didn't know AWS WAF did this
abstract: Think AWS WAF is just for blocking SQL injection and XSS? Think again. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive into creative, real-world use cases - from deploying honeypots and shedding traffic, to stopping account fraud and mitigating DDoS at scale. We'll explore advanced configurations, walk through customer-tested patterns, and whiteboard strategies that make WAF a powerful tool in your security arsenal. Bring your questions and experiences - we're here to break the "WAF does that?" moments together.

title: Illumina DRAGEN pipelines on F2 instances with Nextflow & AWS Batch
abstract: Navigate the critical transition from F1 to F2 instances for Illumina DRAGEN genomics pipelines as F1's end-of-life approaches in December 2025. This session demonstrates optimal configuration of DRAGEN pipelines using Nextflow and AWS Batch, focusing on performance optimization and monitoring strategies. Learn practical solutions for common debugging challenges and gain insights from a real-world biopharma migration case study. Whether you're new to DRAGEN or planning an F1 to F2 migration, discover best practices for implementing these complex genomics workflows. Ideal for bioinformaticians, life sciences developers, and IT infrastructure owners.

title: Implement Agentic AI at the edge for industrial automation
abstract: Manufacturing and industrial operations demand real-time, intelligent decision-making in low-connectivity environments. This code talk demonstrates how to deploy SmolVLMs (small vision language models) and AI agents to automate site operations using AWS Outposts and Strands Agents. The solution enables on-premises, multilingual interaction with safety protocols, documentation, and equipment data to enhance the productivity and safety of frontline workers. You’ll learn how to combine edge infrastructure, publicly available models, and agent frameworks to deliver context-aware, resilient AI for industrial automation.

title: Implement data pipelines for analytics using SageMaker Unified Studio
abstract: Breaking down data silos and unifying data across numerous data sources is a challenging task. AWS is changing the future of analytics with zero-ETL data integration and query federation across different sources, services, applications, and multi-cloud environments. Join us to dive deep into how AWS zero-ETL approaches can help you simplify your data integration landscape.  Find out how you can perform analytics and machine learning without moving or transforming your data.

title: Implement distributed inference with Amazon ECS
abstract: As AI applications move from proof-of-concept to production, teams need robust, scalable infrastructure to serve compute-intensive inference workloads. This chalk talk demystifies running inference on ECS by treating AI agents and model servers as the containerized applications they fundamentally are. We'll explore practical deployment patterns for popular frameworks like vLLM, Ray Serve, and NVIDIA Triton Inference Server. You'll learn to leverage ECS's native capabilities for building production-ready inference infrastructure that scales reliably and integrates seamlessly with AWS services. We'll tackle real-world challenges including model loading, GPU resource management, and traffic handling—the operational realities every production inference deployment must address.

title: Implement hybrid search with Aurora PostgreSQL for MCP retrieval
abstract: Model Context Protocol (MCP) shifts the focus from relevance-based retrieval (RAG) to structured, queryable, and context-rich inputs for foundation models. In this session, learn how to build a hybrid search solution using pgvector, PostgreSQL full-text search, and query filters in Aurora PostgreSQL - all geared toward enabling MCP-style interactions. We'll walk through implementing weighted hybrid search combining vectors, SQL filters, and reranking, enabling LLMs to retrieve specific context slices based on time, persona, or operational context. Gain practical experience and ready-to-use templates for implementing hybrid search in your MCP-compatible generative AI applications, enabling more accurate and contextually aware AI interactions.

title: Implementing Advanced Data Protection Controls
abstract: Protect sensitive data throughout its lifecycle in this hands-on workshop focused on securing data in transit and at rest. Build a real-time TLS monitoring system using CloudTrail and CloudWatch to detect outdated protocols with automated alerts—preparing for future protocol deprecations beyond TLS 1.2. Implement automated discovery of sensitive information with Macie, configure S3 encryption, and establish key rotation with KMS and Secrets Manager. Through practical exercises simulating real-world scenarios, you'll develop immediately applicable skills to detect, classify, and secure sensitive information across your AWS environment while satisfying both security best practices and compliance requirements.

title: Implementing advanced Serverless resilience: A practitioner's guide
abstract: While serverless platforms provide built-in reliability features, achieving true resilience requires intentional architectural choices. At scale, we must go beyond service features and implement proven architectural patterns for distributed systems. We'll explore cell-based architectures that contain failure impact, domain-driven design for clear bounded contexts, and recovery mechanisms including event replay and automated remediation. Multi-region deployment strategies enable geographic redundancy and seamless failover. Join us to learn practical techniques for implementing serverless systems that maintain operations across regional failures and recover automatically from unexpected conditions.

title: Implementing agentic AI solutions on-premises and at the edge
abstract: As governments and standards bodies develop data protection and privacy regulations, organizations increasingly need to combine the use of generative AI tooling in the cloud with regulated data that needs to remain on-premises to meet data residency requirements. In this workshop, learn how to extend Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to hybrid and edge services like AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones to build distributed agentic applications using Model Context Protocol (MCP) and agent-to-agent (A2A) communication with on-premises data for improved model outcomes. Get hands-on with hybrid agentic AI using Amazon Bedrock and Strands Agents while exploring AWS hybrid and edge services.

title: Implementing Automated Security Controls for Zero-Day Defense
abstract: Manual security responses to vulnerabilities across cloud environments create operational bottlenecks and increase risk exposure in today's evolving threat landscape. Learn how to strengthen your security posture by combining vulnerability management with automated risk controls using Amazon Inspector, AWS Systems Manager, and AWS Security Hub. We'll demonstrate effective response strategies for zero-day vulnerabilities across Amazon EC2 instances and AWS Regions, implementing automated compliance monitoring and continuous control validation through infrastructure and policy as code.

title: Implementing generative and agentic AI in multicloud environments
abstract: Organizations implementing AI across multiple cloud providers face challenges such as secure deployment, management of AI agents, and enabling their builders to quickly innovate by leveraging models of their choice. In this chalk talk, we'll explore practical approaches to building secure, enterprise-grade generative AI solutions in multicloud environments. We will dive deep into orchestration of generative AI workflows and demonstrate Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) patterns that securely access data spread across different cloud providers. We'll walk through establishing Model Context Protocol (MCP) agent security models, optimizing data accessibility, and maintaining governance across cloud providers.

title: Implementing Human-in-the-Loop Controls for Multi-Agent AI Systems
abstract: While AI agents offer powerful automation capabilities, many critical business workflows require human oversight and approval. This 20-minute lightning talk demonstrates practical patterns for integrating human-in-the-loop (HITL) controls within multi-agent AI systems. Learn how to design asynchronous agent workflows that incorporate human decision points using serverless architectures. We'll explore real-world examples showing when and how to implement HITL effectively while maintaining system reliability and scalability. Walk away with actionable patterns for building AI agent systems that balance automation with appropriate human oversight.

title: Implementing observability at scale: A blueprint for success
abstract: Achieving comprehensive observability to ensure optimal performance, reliability, and user experience is crucial for businesses. In this session, we will explore best practices for collecting and analyzing metrics, traces, and logs across your AWS environments. Discover techniques for streamlining agent management, optimizing alerting, and enabling cross-account observability. Learn how to reduce operational overhead while gaining deeper visibility into your applications' performance and health in a cost-optimized manner.

title: Implementing security best practices for serverless applications
abstract: Discover how to maximize security in serverless architectures while maintaining developer velocity. This session explores enterprise-proven security best practices across the serverless application lifecycle, from development to production. Learn how to leverage AWS's built-in security features, implement effective security controls, and establish proper guardrails without hampering innovation. Drawing from real customer experiences, we'll demonstrate practical approaches to strengthen your security posture while enabling developers to build and deploy with confidence

title: Implement Low-code Agentic Finance Analytics for SAP
abstract: In this hands-on lab, you will learn to automate SAP financial data processing and create dynamic dashboards using low-code, agent-based AI solutions through Amazon Q Business. You will begin by integrating MCP servers  with SAP S/4HANA using a standard plugin within Amazon Q Business. Then, you will setup real-time cash flow analysis, daily cash reporting, and account settlement automation, and test the analytics by comparing real-time data against daily batch reconciliation reports. You will gain knowledge on using fully managed, low-code tools to enhance SAP business processes.

title: Implement Modern Data Architectures with Amazon SageMaker Lakehouse
abstract: Discover SageMaker Lakehouse's unified approach to data management across S3 data lakes, Redshift warehouses, and third-party sources. Master both federated and managed catalogs while working with diverse enterprise datasets. Practice hands-on integration of multiple storage types (S3, RMS), implement cross-engine querying, and explore unified data access patterns. Perfect for data architects building modern, scalable analytics environments.

title: Implement RAG while meeting data residency requirements
abstract: As governments develop data protection and privacy regulations, organizations increasingly need to leverage generative AI with regulated data that need to remain on-premises to meet data sovereignty requirements. This session explores how to implement Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with on-premises and edge data. Learn how to extend Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones for a hybrid RAG architecture, or build a local RAG architecture for more stringent data residency requirements. Discover the latest techniques like reranker models to improve precision without increasing model size, reduce inference cost, and enforce more governance and control over prompt outcomes.

title: Implement secure automated workflows with AWS Systems Manager
abstract: IT operations teams face challenges in manually managing security incidents and access controls across their AWS infrastructure, leading to slow response times and potential compliance risks. This session shows how AWS Systems Manager enables you to build automated responses to security and operational incidents. You'll learn to create secure workflows that integrate with your existing tools while maintaining detailed audit trails. We'll demonstrate how to implement controlled emergency access procedures and show how Systems Manager's permission model ensures security compliance. Through practical examples, you'll see how to develop automated runbooks that reduce remediation time and maintain governance. Whether you're managing a small AWS deployment or a complex enterprise environment, you'll learn how to build a framework that balances operational efficiency with security controls.

title: Implement Secure & Scalable Admin Controls in Amazon QuickSight
abstract: Join us to explore Amazon QuickSight's enterprise governance capabilities. Learn to implement robust controls while scaling BI across your organization. We'll cover identity management, resource monitoring, and compliance features, focusing on role-based access, quota management, and audit trails. Discover how to structure organizational hierarchies, manage costs, and automate security controls. Through practical examples, see how to balance security with operational efficiency. Perfect for platform owners and administrators seeking to establish comprehensive governance frameworks.

title: Improve DevEx for GenAI Deployments: Dynatrace + Amazon Bedrock (sponsored by Dynatrace)
abstract: Delivering GenAI applications at scale requires powerful infrastructure, Cloud Platform Monitoring, and a developer experience that makes building, testing, and running AI seamless. In this session, Dynatrace and AWS will show how Amazon Bedrock and Dynatrace AI Observability and Agentic AI empower developers to confidently plan, deploy, and observe GenAI applications. You’ll learn how to streamline debugging, monitor performance, control costs, and apply governance without slowing innovation. Gain practical, developer-centric strategies to reduce risk, accelerate delivery, and maximize the impact of your AI investments. This presentation is brought to you by Dynatrace, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Improve DevEx for GenAI Deployments: Dynatrace + Amazon Bedrock (sponsored by Dynatrace)
Automated cloud security remediation with agentic workflows (sponsored by Dynatrace)
Improve DevEx for GenAI Deployments: Dynatrace + Amazon Bedrock (sponsored by Dynatrace)
Automated cloud security remediation with agentic workflows (sponsored by Dynatrace)
Improve DevEx for GenAI Deployments: Dynatrace + Amazon Bedrock (sponsored by Dynatrace)

title: Improve Manufacturing Production Planning with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: For manufacturers, delivery of product components or ingredients is critical to meet production schedules. Learn how to mitigate supply chain disruptions with AI-driven analysis to process data from disparate sources dynamically, enabling real-time adjustments to the production plan with agentic workflows. This workshop will demonstrate how leveraging Amazon SageMaker can accelerate the development of AI-powered supply chain management to transform potential catastrophic supply chain disruptions into a manageable operational challenges, minimizing financial impact and maintaining business continuity.

title: Improve quality and speed across the SDLC with Atlassian Rovo Dev (sponsored by Atlassian)
abstract: Atlassian Rovo Dev, an AI-powered solution, transforms the software development lifecycle (SDLC) by automating repetitive tasks and boosting productivity. This talk explores how Rovo Dev agents streamline every SDLC phase—from planning to deployment—so developers can focus on innovation. Discover how Rovo Dev’s integration and intelligent automation help teams deliver high-quality software faster, reduce bottlenecks, and uphold engineering standards with ease. This presentation is brought to you by Atlassian, an AWS Partner.

title: Improve self-managed database performance and agility with Amazon FSx
abstract: Learn how Amazon FSx can modernize Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle DB, SAP HANA and others by supercharging performance and improving data protection and resilience. Learn how to choose the right FSx service (FSx for NetApp ONTAP, FSx for OpenZFS, and FSx for Windows File Server) to optimize the TCO of your database environments. We will review practical migration strategies and best practices for resilience including how to protect with replication with the ability to recover in minutes. This session is ideal for anyone who is migrating from on premises and wants to learn the latest in database performance tuning and high availability.

services: Amazon FSx for Windows File Server

title: Improving Availability with EC2 Best Practices for Application Monitoring
abstract: Organizations running critical applications on Amazon EC2 need to detect application-level issues before they impact users. This session demonstrates EC2 best practices for monitoring of application health, faster detection of failures, and automation of recovery actions. Attendees will learn how to advance beyond basic infrastructure monitoring to detect complex issues that can impact application performance and availability. Through demonstrations and architectural discussions, the session will cover configuring advanced monitoring checks, integrating them with auto-scaling solutions, and implementing automated recovery mechanisms.

title: Improving citizens customer experience
abstract: Explore how state and local governments can revolutionize citizen interactions through AI-driven modernization. This interactive chalk talk demonstrates how organizations can leverage data platforms, machine learning, and generative AI to create personalized, responsive citizen experiences. Learn proven architectures and implementation strategies for common government scenarios, from permit processing to public service delivery. Discover flexible frameworks that adapt to evolving data requirements and citizen needs. Walk away with actionable insights to transform your agency's citizen engagement through cutting-edge technology while maintaining security and compliance.

title: Improving multimedia analytics with customized Amazon Nova models
abstract: Transform your multimedia analysis performance and capabilities by customizing Amazon Nova foundation models. This hands-on builder session, designed for experienced practitioners, explores advanced Nova customization techniques for enterprise-scale multimedia workloads. You'll learn practical strategies for model optimization, cost management, and implementing efficient workflows to handle complex multimedia analysis tasks. Our AWS experts will guide you through real-world examples of Nova customization that have helped organizations achieve significant improvement in processing efficiency.

title: Incorporating generative AI in the CI/CD pipeline
abstract: In this chalk talk, learn how Amazon Q Developer’s agentic capabilities in Gitlab Duo and GitHub is transforming the developer experience by speeding up a range of tasks that support you as you research how to get started, evaluate system design, build secure and scalable applications, upgrade existing applications, and optimize application performance. Gain insights into how Amazon Q Developer capabilities for building, testing, reviewing, and transforming applications faster and more easily frees you up to focus on experimentation and innovation

title: Increase your database agility with Amazon FSx
abstract: Get hands-on experience optimizing self-managed Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and MySQL databases on Amazon EC2 using Amazon FSx. Learn how FSx's advanced features transform database operations through snapshots, cloning, backup, and replication. Discover techniques to reduce RPO/RTO from hours to seconds and implement robust business continuity strategies. Practice using zero-space cloning to create instant, isolated database environments for streamlined development cycles without additional storage overhead. This workshop is ideal for architects, administrators, and engineers seeking to enhance their cloud database management capabilities.

services: Amazon FSx for Windows File Server

title: Indeed's migration to Amazon S3 Tables
abstract: Discover how Indeed is actively modernizing their data infrastructure with Amazon S3 Tables through an ambitious 80PB data lake transformation. Follow their ongoing journey as they migrate 12,000+ tables from Hive to S3 Tables and learn how they're tackling complex migration challenges while already realizing significant cost benefits. You'll get answers to common concerns about large-scale data modernization, supported by early results. You'll gain practical insights for making strategic decisions about your data infrastructure, whether you're planning a similar transformation or evaluating your data management options. Learn from Indeed's experiences as they progress through this major modernization initiative.

title: Inference on AWS Trainium and Amazon EKS using vLLM
abstract: Join us for a immersive, hands-on workshop to learn to deploy and optimize large language models (LLMs) for scalable inference at enterprise scale. Participants will learn to orchestrate distributed LLM serving with vLLM on Amazon EKS, enabling robust, flexible, and highly available deployments. This session demonstrates how to utilize AWS Trainium hardware within EKS to maximize throughput and cost efficiency, leveraging Kubernetes-native features for automated scaling, resource management, and seamless integration with AWS services. You'll gain hands-on experience using observability tools like CloudWatch Container Insights or the open telemetry stack, along with AWS Neuron tools to effectively monitor inference workloads.

title: Infrastructure Automation with Amazon Q CLI and EC2 Image Builder
abstract: Speed up EC2 Image Builder pipeline development with Amazon Q CLI's AI capabilities. Through hands-on exercises, create sophisticated infrastructure code using intelligent automation. Starting with Amazon Q CLI's enhanced agentic experience that can read and write files locally, query AWS resources, and automatically debug issues, you'll build sophisticated image pipelines that leverage the latest EC2 Image Builder innovations. The session showcases how Q CLI integrates with Systems Manager Parameter Store for dynamic configuration management, while utilizing EC2 Image Builder's customizable image workflows to modify build and test phases for industry-specific requirements

title: Infrastructure protection at scale with AWS Security, ft. Block, Inc.
abstract: Learn best practices from AWS and Block's Network Security team on how to architect a robust network security strategy using AWS Network Firewall, AWS WAF and other security services to protect large-scale infrastructure. This session explores real implementation patterns to protect egress and ingress, covers architectural decisions, and lessons learned while building advanced security controls.

title: Innovating with AWS Confidential Computing: An Integrated Approach
abstract: Confidential computing enables customers to protect code and data from unauthorized access during processing.  This session explores AWS's innovation on confidential computing capabilities including the AWS Nitro System, AWS Nitro Enclaves, and the Nitro Trusted Platform Module.  Learn how Nitro System capabilities can be used to meet evolving data protection challenges, such as confidential inferencing. The session will cover concepts that range from isolation from cloud operators to leveraging cryptographic capabilities on CPU, GPU, and AI accelerator-based instances for applications handling highly sensitive data such as personally identifiable information, financial assets, medical information, intellectual property, and AI data.

title: Innovation in Identity Security: how we protect the cloud and help you do it too
abstract: At AWS, identity is foundational to cloud security, both in how we protect the platform itself and in how we enable customers to secure what they build. In this session, we'll share the approaches and mechanisms AWS uses to strengthen identity across the stack: from secure-by-design development and automated policy controls to tools that detect auth issues and support data perimeter adoption. You'll also learn about our latest innovations in access management, data perimeters, machine identity, agentic identity, and how these capabilities are shaping the future of identity security. Discover how we're raising the bar for identity security, and how you can apply these same strategies and new capabilities in your environment.

title: Innovation Sandbox on AWS: Automating Temporary Cloud Environments
abstract: Cloud administrators face challenges in efficiently managing temporary sandbox environments while maintaining security and cost control. Innovation Sandbox on AWS addresses this by automating the deployment and management of short-lived sandbox environments. It implements service control policies, spend controls, and account recycling mechanisms, saving weeks of administration time. This solution enhances operational efficiency, establishes cost governance, and empowers teams to experiment and innovate on AWS within controlled, standardized environments. Whether you're running GenAI experiments, managing student labs, or developer environments, learn how this solution can streamline your sandbox operations.

title: Innovations  in Infrastructure Protection to strengthen your network
abstract: In this session, learn about new capabilities in infrastructure protection services like AWS Network Firewall, Amazon Route 53 DNS Firewall, AWS WAF, and AWS Shield, to simplify your application protection, streamline robust egress protections and gain insight into your network. Dive deep into how new visibility investments can give insight  into misconfigurations, possible threats, and proactive identification of network configuration issues.

title: Innovations in SQL Analytics: What's new in Amazon Redshift and Amazon Athena
abstract: Learn how AWS is enhancing its SQL analytics offerings with new capabilities in Amazon Redshift and Amazon Athena. Discover how Redshift's AI-powered data warehousing capabilities are enabling customers to modernize their analytics workloads with enhanced performance and cost optimization. Explore Athena's latest features for interactively querying data directly in their Amazon S3 data lakes. This session showcases new features and real-world examples of how organizations are using these services to accelerate business insights while optimizing costs.

title: Inside Alight’s AI-driven Expansion to Cloudera on AWS (sponsored by Cloudera)
abstract: Learn from Alight, the employee benefits leader and AI innovator. Find out how they migrated to AWS quickly, enabled new AI use cases across the organization – and manage ongoing costs by using AI to optimize their lakehouse architecture and automate critical tasks This presentation is brought to you by Cloudera, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Inside Alight’s AI-driven Expansion to Cloudera on AWS (sponsored by Cloudera)

title: Inside Poolside’s Model Factory: Building Better Models Faster (sponsored by poolside)
abstract: Step inside poolside’s Model Factory—an integrated framework for turning raw data into production-ready foundation models. From automated pipelines and distributed training to reinforcement learning and scalable inference, discover how the Model Factory streamlines the entire lifecycle. Attendees will gain insights into building reproducible, enterprise-grade AI systems that combine speed, automation, and innovation. This presentation is brought to you by poolside, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Inside Poolside’s Model Factory: Building Better Models Faster (sponsored by poolside)

title: Inside S3: Lessons from exabyte-scale data lake modernization
abstract: Amazon S3 internally processes hundreds of petabytes daily across microservices, generating millions of logs. This session chronicles S3's journey from basic log analysis to a modern Apache Iceberg-based data lake. We’ll explore key architectural transitions: replacing legacy processing with SQL capabilities, migrating from unstructured text to Iceberg tables, and implementing enhanced ingestion engines.
