Discover our decision-making process for format selection, backward compatibility, and maintaining operations during complex migrations. Gain practical insights for your own data modernization projects, from technology selection to managing legacy constraints while ensuring business continuity throughout transformational changes.

title: Inside the Attack Chain: Emerging Threat Actor Tactics and Techniques
abstract: Get up to speed on emerging threat actor tactics and techniques across the attack chain. In this session, we'll expound upon methods of Initial Access, Persistence, Defense Evasion, Lateral Movement, and Impact. You'll gain practical knowledge of specific configurations to detect and mitigate these threats, and learn common misconfigurations to avoid.

title: Instrument Your Serverless Apps for Full Visibility [AWS Partners only]
abstract: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Gain comprehensive visibility across your entire serverless architecture. Learn to monitor AWS Lambda, API Gateway, and supporting services through hands-on exercises. Practice implementing end-to-end observability using CloudWatch and X-Ray for complete application awareness. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Integrate and orchestrate data workflows with AWS Glue & managed Apache Airflow
abstract: Elevate your data integration and workflow orchestration capabilities in this hands-on session with AWS Glue and Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (MWAA). Learn to easily build ETL pipelines across data lakes, warehouses and databases with Glue, and orchestrate end-to-end data processing workflows across distributed systems with automated DAGs for data ingestion, transformation, and consumption.

services: Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (Amazon MWAA)

title: Integrate any agent framework with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
abstract: Bring your existing agents to AWS with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Whether you've built custom agents or use frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, CrewAI, or LlamaIndex, this session shows how to run them on secure, scalable AWS infrastructure without rewriting your logic. Discover how AgentCore's API-based orchestration integrates external agent frameworks and services, centralizing tooling, observability, memory, and security. Learn from real customer implementations and explore practical patterns for connecting distributed agents across environments, clouds, and organizational boundaries using Gateway, Runtime, and Identity components.

title: Integrated AI Agents & Code Assistants with MCP & AWS
abstract: Model Context Protocol (MCP) is the foundation for building AI Agents and Code Assistants that are connected to your data, infrastructure, and services. Whether you are building AI for enterprise use cases or writing code that will run on AWS, MCP is the way to bring together intelligence and integration. This session will teach you what MCP is and the ways you can build MCP servers & clients with AWS. We will cover how to use AWS-related MCP servers in your code assistants as well as how to integrate MCP-powered AI Agents with your AWS data & servers.

title: Integrated AI Agents: Moving Beyond Summarization to Automation (sponsored by DevRev)
abstract: Every leader knows that AI matters, but we're all still learning exactly how. Siloed business data has been the main obstacle - but no more. Learn how DevRev solves this problem, unifying existing structured data like tickets, backlogs, and CRMs with unstructured data like emails, chats, and documents into an AI-native Knowledge Graph, powering integrated AI agents that create, read, update, and delete, not simply summarize. The result? Happier customers, empowered employees, and finally, ROI from AI. This presentation is brought to you by DevRev, an AWS Partner.

title: Integrate serverless applications with AWS storage services
abstract: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You can integrate it with Amazon EFS and Amazon S3 for data persistence, enabling increased application availability beyond one Region for business continuity and disaster recovery. In this workshop, learn to build your serverless AI applications with persistent data in Amazon S3 and Amazon EFS. Additionally, explore how to deploy a stateful web application onto a multi-AZ Amazon EKS cluster to demonstrate regional availability and perform failover and failback for multi-Region disaster recovery.

title: Integrating virtual try-on into your ecommerce platforms
abstract: Create immersive shopping experiences by visualizing products in context with virtual try-on capabilities in Amazon Nova Canvas.  Whether it's clothing naturally draped on a shopper or furniture intelligently placed in a room, Amazon Nova Canvas creates realistic visualizations while preserving important details. This session will cover techniques and implementation recommendations to build the most engaging experience for your customers.

title: Integration patterns for distributed systems
abstract: Today's applications are interconnected: they expose APIs, publish events, call third-party services, and externalize states. They must therefore address the fundamental challenges of distributed systems, such as out-of-order delivery, retries, idempotence, and partial failures. To address these challenges, architects must carefully evaluate integration options while considering how to manage complex system interactions. In this session, learn about common design trade-offs for distributed systems and how to navigate them with design patterns, illustrated by examples.

title: Integration patterns for multi-tenant systems
abstract: Today's SaaS applications are interconnected: they expose APIs, publish events, call third-party services, and externalize states. Adding multi-tenancy to these integrations introduces new challenges. How do builders ensure tenant performance and data isolation whilst sharing resources? In this session, learn about common design trade-offs for multi-tenant integrations and how to navigate them with design patterns, illustrated by examples.

title: Integration to impact: Accelerate AWS Partner revenue measurement
abstract: Discover how AWS Partners implement revenue measurement capabilities that allow partners to track and measure aggregated service consumption and automate revenue attribution by solutions and service engagements. In this session, partners will gain integration blueprints for solution deployments and customer engagements, with examples of how this data enhances the collaboration between AWS and partners. Technical and business leaders are invited to join us to learn how successful partners are leveraging measurement insights to create data-driven strategies, maximize partnership value, and drive joint customer success.

title: Intelligent automation for managing cloud governance and compliance
abstract: Manually processing and correlating compliance data can lead to delayed response times and missed security insights. Learn how to create smart workflows that analyze data from AWS compliance tools, including AWS Config, AWS Security Hub, and AWS Audit Manager, to provide context-aware insights for efficient policy enforcement and risk management. Through hands-on exercises, build an automated solution that processes compliance queries and implements interfaces for complex governance investigations. Leave with a practical solution for automating compliance monitoring and enabling proactive risk management on AWS.

title: Intelligent Document Processing at Scale Using Bedrock
abstract: Learn how Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) can embed intelligent document processing (IDP) into multi-tenant SaaS applications using AWS Step Functions, Lambda, and Amazon Bedrock Data Automation. This session shows how to build scalable, event driven document workflows that support up to 10,000 parallel executions while ensuring tenant isolation. Explore architectural patterns that use serverless services to extract structured data from PDFs, automate data entry, and build customizable extraction frameworks with consumption based pricing and efficient scaling. Walk away with reusable templates and patterns to quickly embed IDP capabilities that reduce manual work and help differentiate SaaS offerings.

title: Intelligent Document Processing with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: This lab teaches building an end-to-end Intelligent Document Processing (IDP) solution for invoice analysis. Learn to extract data using Amazon Textract, store information in Amazon S3 and Amazon DynamoDB, and generate insights using Amazon Bedrock's Large Language Models (LLMs). Practice implementing automated document processing workflows combining structured data extraction with AI-powered analysis. Ideal for developers building automated document processing systems using Generative AI.

title: Intelligently automating cloud operations
abstract: Join this workshop to learn how to use AWS Health, AWS Trusted Advisor, and AWS generative AI and machine learning services to intelligently automate cloud operations. Also learn how to use Amazon EventBridge and AWS Lambda to create automations that organizations can use to optimize their cloud infrastructure, improve efficiency, and reduce operational costs. This workshop is designed for cloud administrators, DevOps engineers, site reliability engineers, and IT professionals who are responsible for managing and optimizing cloud operations. You must bring your laptop to participate

title: Intelligent Operations: AI driven Modernization and Incident Response
abstract: Transform your operational excellence journey and learn how GenAI agents can modernization your legacy applications and improve incident management. We'll establish the foundation by deploying a representative three-tier application architecture, then enhance it with Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers and intelligent agents. You'll configure both read-only and write-enabled agent capabilities, setting up the observability framework that enables AI-driven insights into your application's behavior and performance metrics. Key Takeaways: Hands-on experience with MCP server configuration and agentic observability Practical application of Amazon Q Transform  AI-driven incident detection and automated response systems Integrating GenAI agents into existing operational workflows

title: Intelligent Outage Management Using Automated Reasoning and AI (sponsored by PwC)
abstract: Learn how automated verification techniques are transforming outage management. This solution reduces response times by delivering accurate, real-time ETA updates for customer service tickets while validating AI-generated outage classifications to ensure reliability. It incorporates standardized protocols aligned with regulatory guidelines and maintains compliance with NERC and FERC requirements. The result: faster, more consistent, and trustworthy outage resolution that enhances both customer experience and operational efficiency. This presentation is brought to you by PwC, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Intelligent Outage Management Using Automated Reasoning and AI (sponsored by PwC)

title: Intelligent Security Operations with AWS: AI-Powered Incident Response
abstract: Join us for this hands-on workshop where partners will discover how to leverage AWS security automation using Amazon Bedrock Agents. Learn how to build an autonomous AI system that integrates with AWS Security Hub and AWS Security Incident Response service to detect and remediate security issues through natural language interactions. Perfect for AWS Partners looking to enhance their security offerings, you'll explore architectural patterns and implementation strategies for high-sensitivity security workflows. Discover how to make complex security management as simple as having a conversation while understanding the critical trust boundaries and tradeoffs in security environments.

title: Intelligent security: Protection at scale from development to production
abstract: How should your security practice adjust to handle the increasing volume of solutions your builders are creating with the help of AI? What should you do as threat actors leverage the very same tooling to reduce the cost of their attacks? Join AWS VP & CISO, Amy Herzog as she explores the answer to these questions. You’ll learn about the architectural choices and technical tradeoffs you will face as you adapt how you approach security in your business. Using real-world examples, Amy will share the strategies you need to implement AI-powered, automated protections at scale in your environment.

title: Intelligent vs. Knowledgeable Models through the Lens of Data (sponsored by Bright Data)
abstract: Intelligence vs. knowledge is a vital consideration for current AI models. While these models possess the intelligence to solve complex, PhD-level mathematical problems, they require more extensive knowledge to enhance real-world applicability. For instance, despite their advanced calculation abilities, they may not be aware of current market prices for items like Nike shoes. To bridge this gap, models must access real-time data and information. By doing so, they can incorporate accurate, timely details into their mathematical frameworks, improving both their decision-making capabilities and practical implementation across various domains. This synergy between intelligence and knowledge will redefine AI's potential. This presentation is brought to you by Bright Data, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Intelligent vs. Knowledgeable Models through the Lens of Data (sponsored by Bright Data)

title: Inter-Agent Systems with Strands Agents, Amazon Bedrock, MCP, and A2A
abstract: In this session you will build AI Agents in Python using Amazon Bedrock & the open source Strands Agents framework, connect these agents to data using MCP, and connect multiple agents together using A2A. You will learn about the architecture of inter-agent systems and when/how to use MCP and A2A for interoperability. This will be a hands-on coding exercise with no prior AI Agent programming experience needed.

title: Introducing AI driven development lifecycle (AI-DLC)
abstract: The AI-Driven Development Life Cycle (AI-DLC) represents a transformative approach to software engineering that positions AI as a central collaborator throughout the development process. Unlike traditional AI-assisted development methods, AI-DLC reimagines the entire software lifecycle through two key dimensions: AI-powered execution with human oversight and dynamic team collaboration. The methodology operates in three phases - Inception, Construction, and Operations - where AI initiates workflows while maintaining persistent context across all stages. This innovative approach delivers significant benefits including increased velocity, enhanced quality, improved market responsiveness, and better developer experience, all while ensuring critical human oversight and collaboration.

title: Introducing Spending Limits for Amazon Braket
abstract: Manage your quantum computing workloads with Amazon Braket's new spending limits feature. This session demonstrates how to set device-specific spending thresholds with customizable time periods to prevent unexpected charges. Learn how spending limits integrate with your quantum workflows, including task creation and queue management. We'll showcase the Amazon Braket management console experience and API functionality that lets you monitor spending in real-time. Whether you're a researcher managing grant budgets or an enterprise controlling departmental expenses, discover how spending limits provide the financial guardrails needed for confident quantum exploration.

title: I Put an Agent in a Biscuit
abstract: What happens when an AI agent leaves the GPU and has to survive in a biscuit-sized wearable microcontroller? This session explores Biscuit: a tiny device that streams compressed audio over BLE to a mobile relay app, connecting to a secure OAuth cloud agent that triggers real-world actions. Built in days using multiple agents, spec-driven development, and meta prompting, it pushed technical boundaries while actually working. Learn how to stream custom IMA-ADPCM audio from MCUs, implement minimal protocols for reliability, and connect to secure cloud agents. See how a hardware agent wearable evolved from prototype to testable product in a week.

title: It's About Time! Improving Distributed Systems with Amazon Time Sync
abstract: Keeping track of the order of events in distributed systems is one of the most fundamental and important problems in computer science. In 2023, we improved the Amazon Time Sync Service to microsecond-level clock accuracy so we, and our customers, can use wall-clock time in applications including databases, AI/ML, financial services, broadcast/media, telecommunications, and more to improve both the performance and resiliency of our systems and applications. We will be sharing how with real-world examples of AWS services now leveraging this capability, as well as direct customer references who are using precision time to build their next generation applications.

title: ITTI's Cross-Company Data Mesh Blueprint with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: This session shares the journey of implementing a hybrid Data Mesh architecture within a multi-company holding, balancing centralization and decentralization needs. We will cover how our hybrid approach leverages Amazon EMR on EKS for data lake ingestion and Amazon SageMaker to enable self-service data discovery, data product subscription, and consumption, allowing companies within the group to autonomously explore, access, and utilize data products while maintaining centralized governance. Through ITTI - Grupo Vázquez's real-world experience, attendees will learn how this hybrid data mesh architecture successfully addresses diverse data domains, varying governance requirements, and rapid value delivery needs.

title: Java Modernization and Performance Optimization GameDay
abstract: Take on an interactive GameDay challenge where you’ll compete, learn, and collaborate with other participants while experiencing the power of generative AI-assisted application modernization in this hands-on workshop. Learn how Amazon Q Developer streamlines Java application modernization through automated code analysis and guided migration paths, helping developers confidently upgrade from Java 8 to Java 21. The workshop includes deploying test environments using CloudFormation, comparing performance across different instances, and leveraging Amazon Q’s contextual code recommendations. Participants will conduct performance benchmarking, analyze cost implications, and learn best practices for AI-assisted development while experiencing zero-migration effort deployment across platforms. You’ll walk away with knowledge on how to optimize your Java workloads. Requires laptop to participate.

title: JPMC and Amazon Advanced Solutions Lab drive quantum R&D on Braket
abstract: The study introduces qReduMIS, a quantum-informed reduction algorithm for solving maximum independent set problems. This hybrid quantum-classical framework combines traditional kernelization techniques with quantum computing insights. The quantum computer serves as a co-processor, identifying vertices likely to be in large independent sets, which helps optimize the reduction process. Testing on Rydberg quantum hardware through Amazon Braket, using up to 231 qubits, demonstrated that qReduMIS can address performance limitations in both classical and quantum solvers. The framework can be implemented on various quantum platforms, including superconducting qubits and trapped ions, with potential for future enhancements.

title: Kiro and Amazon Bedrock: Unlock AI Agents for Your Legacy Apps
abstract: Are your legacy applications holding you back from AI-driven workflows? In this live-coding session, discover how Kiro and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Gateway bridge the gap between traditional business systems and modern AI agents without touching existing code. We'll demonstrate how to make REST APIs instantly accessible to AI agents using Kiro's vibe coding approach to naturally understand your intent alongside AgentCore Gateway's integration framework and Model Context Protocol (MCP). Watch practical examples of transforming a real legacy application into an AI-enabled system, showing how Kiro and AgentCore work together to modernize your infrastructure with zero modifications to original codebases.

title: Kiro in action: Red Team tactics at scale
abstract: In this session we'll show how Kiro helps Red Teamers build the tools they need to move faster and smarter in the cloud. If you’ve ever struggled to get visibility across dozens of AWS accounts or needed to quickly generate recon scripts, Kiro can help you automate and accelerate that process. We'll go beyond prompt engineering and dive into context engineering and spec-driven development, showing how to use spec files to build a custom pentesting toolkit. Through real examples like mapping IAM escalation paths and extracting secrets, you’ll walk away with a practical

title: Kiro: Your agentic IDE for spec-driven development
abstract: In this session, learn how Kiro is helping you go from idea to production faster with spec-driven development. Learn how to delagate and automate development tasks using Kiro's agent hooks, multimodal agent chat and MCP support. We'll show you how Kiro’s agents challenge you to think beyond the code and work alongside you to solve hard engineering problems with confidence.

title: Knowledge Graphs for AI and Intelligent Systems (sponsored by Neo4j)
abstract: Enterprise-grade AI needs a unified data strategy for accurate, reliable results. Learn how knowledge graphs bridge the gap between how the real world operates and how companies actually store and organize data - transforming data into knowledge. See how Agentic GraphRAG (retrieval-augmented generation with knowledge graphs) drives real success: Learn how companies like AbbVie have deployed GenAI to build chatbots grounded in knowledge graphs, improving productivity and trust, while a major gaming company achieved 10x faster insights. We’ll share real examples and practical steps for successful GenAI deployment. This presentation is brought to you by Neo4j, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Knowledge Graphs for AI and Intelligent Systems (sponsored by Neo4j)

title: Known Unknowns: Bayesian Multi-Path Framework for Uncertainty in LLMs
abstract: This session presents a novel Bayesian framework for quantifying uncertainty in enterprise large language models through multi-perspective reasoning. We demonstrate how combining Bradley-Terry probability models with PageRank algorithms enables systematic decomposition of epistemic and aleatoric uncertainty patterns. Our approach automatically triggers appropriate enhancement strategies—retrieval augmentation, tool calling, or foundation model responses—based on uncertainty thresholds. Our approach transforms uncertainty from a limitation into actionable intelligence, enabling data-driven decisions about model customization and knowledge integration. Discover how enterprises can use uncertainty patterns to optimize retrieval strategies, reduce computational costs, and improve model reliability in mission-critical applications. Attendees receive practical implementation guidance for production deployments.

title: Koch Industries' data migration success with AWS Countdown Premium
abstract: See how Koch Industries used AWS Countdown Premium to successfully modernize their legacy data systems. We'll demonstrate how moving to cloud-native technologies improved performance, reduced costs, and enhanced data security. This session shows practical steps for updating older data systems to support AI/ML initiatives and innovation.

title: kro: Simplifying Kubernetes Resource Orchestration
abstract: Discover kro, the open source tool revolutionizing Kubernetes resource management through configuration-based orchestration. Learn how this vendor-neutral solution eliminates custom coding needs through Simple Schema and CEL expressions, making complex resource dependencies manageable for teams of all sizes. We'll demonstrate how kro transforms Kubernetes into a centralized platform that accelerates developer velocity, improves fleet management and streamlines infrastructure deployment while maintaining organizational best practices and governance.

title: Kubernetes simplified: Get hands-on with Amazon EKS Auto Mode
abstract: Join this hands-on workshop to learn how Amazon EKS Auto Mode simplifies Kubernetes management. You'll receive step-by-step guidance on how to launch pre-configured clusters without manual setup and leverage automated compute provisioning and scaling. Through hands-on labs, you will work with integrated networking and storage capabilities while learning to deploy sample applications in just a few steps. Discover how EKS Auto Mode simplifies critical operational tasks like upgrades, patching, and production workload scaling, reducing operational overhead and allowing you to focus on innovation rather than infrastructure management.

title: Kuiper: Building a Low Earth Orbit Satellite Network on AWS
abstract: Join us as we explore the cutting-edge Kuiper internet service, designed to deliver low-latency, high-bandwidth connectivity to customers worldwide. Kuiper has harnessed the power of AWS Regions and the global backbone, unlocking unique capabilities to meet the demanding telco and networking requirements of this ambitious project. In this session, we'll dive into the innovative Kuiper architecture, its seamless integration with AWS infrastructure, and the intricate details involved in building a truly global network � spanning both space and the ground. Discover how AWS empowers Kuiper to revolutionize global connectivity, bringing the world closer together.

title: Lamborghini’s AI Journey: Data-Driven Innovation with Deloitte & AWS (sponsored by Deloitte)
abstract: Deloitte supported Lamborghini in its transformation towards a data-driven enterprise by designing and implementing a scalable AWS-based Data Platform architecture. The solution enables efficient data management, supports rapid deployment of advanced use cases, AI and GEN AI use cases, while leveraging existing assets to ensure business continuity. This session will showcase how the Deloitte-AWS alliance helped Lamborghini reduce time-to-insight, ensure high data governance standards, and accelerate innovation in the luxury automotive sector. This presentation is brought to you by Deloitte, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Lamborghini’s AI Journey: Data-Driven Innovation with Deloitte & AWS (sponsored by Deloitte)

title: Landing Zone: Deploy Smarter with AI
abstract: How can AI simplify your Landing Zone deployment? Transform your Landing Zone Accelerator deployment process with the power of generative AI. In this hands-on workshop, explore an AI-powered automation tool that converts high-level design requirements into validated LZA configurations in minutes. Experience how AI automates config file generation, performs intelligent validation checks, and simplifies Landing Zone deployment across multiple accounts. Learn to dramatically reduce manual effort while maintaining deployment consistency. Gain practical insights and skills to apply these concepts in your own environment. Perfect for architects and developers looking to accelerate multi-account deployments. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Large-scale software deployments: Inside Amazon S3’s release pipeline
abstract: Want to learn how Amazon S3, one of the world's largest distributed systems, manages software deployments at scale? This session reveals practical insights into our deployment tools, feature flag strategies, and progressive rollout techniques that enable reliable updates at massive scale. We'll share real-world lessons learned from critical deployments, including how we handle rollbacks, manage dependencies, and monitor service health during updates. Whether you're scaling your own deployment pipeline or interested in cloud infrastructure operations, you'll gain valuable strategies for building robust deployment processes that minimize risk while maximizing reliability.

title: Last HSM Standing: Zettle by PayPal’s move to AWS Payment Cryptography
abstract: Join Zettle by Paypal as they reveal how one of Europe's most innovative point-of-sale vendors is using AWS Payment Cryptography to retire their last on-premise hardware. Learn how they successfully migrated real-time transaction volumes in multiple geographies while maintaining PCI PIN & PCI P2PE compliance, increasing resiliency, and reducing infrastructure costs.

title: Lead resilient security teams through psychological safety
abstract: What makes security teams excel? This lightning talk explores four key psychological safety elements that strengthen security operations. Learn practical ways to help your team feel secure being themselves, learning openly, contributing ideas, and challenging the status quo. Walk away with actionable steps to build trust and improve team performance.

title: Learn from "Innovations with AWS" pioneers
abstract: [This session is conducted in Japanese] Forerunning customers have been trying innovations with AWS that bring launching cutting-edge products, brand-new customer experiences, improved operational excellences, etc. Customers who are hungry to innovate something important, can learn from pioneers who had achieved various aspects of innovation. In this session, you can get an overview of latest and remarkable customer's success story from Japanese customers. It's not only fun learning customer stories but also helpful to your next steps. By this session, you can prepare expected challenges and important considerations. That will contribute to reduce ambiguity of your challenges to innovation and your success.

title: Learn how Riskspan is transforming private credit market using GenAI
abstract: RiskSpan is transforming private credit markets through innovative platform powered by AWS Generative AI and Bedrock. Riskspan's GenAI powered tool automatically models financial transactions directly from documents, extracting and processing critical data to generate precise valuation and risk metrics. This comprehensive approach not only standardizes procedures but also significantly enhances risk management capabilities across portfolios. Join us to explore how Riskspan's solution, powered by AWS GenAI and Bedrock, is driving the critical needs for transparency and accessibility in a $14 trillion market with $9 trillion growth potential from underrepresented regions.

title: Learnings from developers adopting AWS Graviton at scale
abstract: AWS Graviton processors are AWS designed CPU to enable the best price performance for a wide variety of workloads on AWS including, but not limited to application servers, microservices, open source-based databases and in-memory caches, gaming, high performance computing, and machine learning. In this chalk talk, engage directly with AWS specialists that help customers on a daily basis with their adoption journey, from workload selection to running at scale in production. We'll discuss AWS Graviton use cases, best practices, performance, and customer success stories.

title: Learn multi-tier application architectures on Amazon ECS
abstract: In this workshop, gain practical experience in deploying, scaling, and observing a complex multi-tier application on Amazon ECS. Explore common best practices on how to operate and manage containerized applications that can be translated into any environment. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Learn new development skills with Kiro
abstract: Discover Kiro, your IDE build from the ground-up to seamlessly integrate AI agents into the development workflow. In this builder’s session, explore how to use Kiro as your intelligent partner - helping to understand complex codebases, crystalize detailed requirements, and deliver quality solutions at unprecedented speed. You will iterate with Kiro to finalize your detailed design, before using Kiro to orchestrate AI agents and implement a fully working solution – all while maintaining complete control throughout the development process. You must bring a laptop to participate in this session.

title: Leaving no operational issues behind
abstract: In cloud operations, incident response time is critical. While logs data contain the truth about what happened, finding the right signals among millions of events can be like finding a needle in a haystack. Enter Amazon Q CLI with MCP server - transforming how we analyze CloudTrail logs and operational data through natural language queries. Learn how to leverage Amazon CloudWatch investigations with intelligent log analysis to reduce troubleshooting time and pinpoint root causes faster.

title: Let's maximize your learnings at re:Invent!
abstract: [This session is conducted in Japanese] AWS re:Invent is our biggest, boldest, most comprehensive AWS event of the year, where the global cloud community unites to build the future. Building your optimized schedule that fits your learning needs is important to maximize your experiences at re:Invent. In this session, you can get new insights from 2 guest speakers who have much experience to re:Invent both of Technology focused and Business focused. You can get a chance to rebuild your plans to the event in consideration of experienced attendees plans through this session. Let's learn everything from up-coming re:Invent!

title: Level Up Your Asset Pipeline: AI-Powered 3D Model Generation at Scale
abstract: Transform game and media development with AWS-powered 3D asset creation at scale. This session explores building 3D model generation pipelines using Amazon Bedrock's generative AI with open-source technologies (Step1X-3D, Microsoft Trellis, TripoSR) on AWS infrastructure. Learn architectural patterns using EC2, Lambda, and S3 for text-to-image and image-to-3D workflows that convert concept descriptions or images into ready to use assets. Discover how to implement, integrate, and cost-optimize for cloud workloads and game engines. Designed for technical directors, cloud architects, game/media developers, engineering managers, and students seeking to democratize 3D content creation and accelerate development cycles

title: Level Up Your Bot Defense for Mobile Apps with AWS WAF SDK
abstract: In this session, we’ll dive into advanced bot mitigation using the AWS WAF SDK and label evaluations. Learn how to go beyond basic rule-based blocking to implement dynamic, data-driven defenses that adapt to evolving threats. We’ll explore programmatically managing WAF rules, leveraging labels for granular request inspection, and integrating SDK workflows to automate threat response. Through real-world scenarios, you’ll see how to distinguish legitimate traffic from sophisticated bots, reduce false positives, and maintain application performance. Bring your questions and learn how to implement scalable, intelligent bot protection at the edge.

title: Level Up Your Serverless: The Powertools for AWS Lambda Workshop
abstract:
The definitive Powertools for AWS Lambda workshop evolves! This refreshed session dives into advanced techniques and patterns for your Serverless workloads.

Through hands-on exercises, you'll learn to implement cost-effective observability, build failure-resilient functions and APIs - all while dramatically reducing boilerplate code. We will guide you through both established best practices and cutting-edge techniques to improve your Serverless applications' reliability and maintainability.

Choose your language (Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, .NET, or Java) for personalized learning. Whether new to Powertools or exploring advanced features, this workshop delivers immediate value for your Serverless development journey.

title: Leverage Auto Scaling to proactively scale and optimize EC2 workloads
abstract: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups help you take advantage of the elasticity benefits that are built-in to AWS. With more responsive and proactive scaling, you run only the required number of instances at any time of the day, reducing the cost of overprovisioned EC2 instances. In this workshop, learn how to take advantage of the latest innovations from EC2 Auto Scaling to improve your application availability at lower costs. Discover how to use a combination of predictive scaling, dynamic scaling, and warm pool features to automatically launch and terminate capacity with changing demands. Requires laptop to participate.

title: Leverage Graph Insights to Turbocharge Amazon Q (sponsored by Securiti AI)
abstract: Unlocking AI's full potential requires securing your enterprise data. This session introduces a unique graph-based data intelligence solution that works across all data sources to extract data access insights and create comprehensive Data+AI mapping. Learn how to reliably prevent unintended data access and accelerate your rollout of Q. We will show you how to leverage Amazon Q’s native security controls to mitigate emerging AI risks, such as prompt injections, and improve the efficacy of AI responses by eliminating redundant, obsolete, and trivial data. This presentation is brought to you by Securiti AI, an AWS Partner.

title: Leverage observability to build responsible AI applications
abstract: As AI adoption accelerates, maintaining effective oversight of machine learning systems becomes crucial. This lightning talk explores how CloudWatch enables responsible AI observability through Amazon Bedrock. Learn practical approaches to monitor model performance, track usage patterns and gain insights into emerging safety concerns, detect hallucinations, misuse and harmful content using native integrations between CloudWatch and Bedrock.

title: Leverage your own IP to enhance creative control
abstract: Discover how to elevate your visual storytelling by fine-tuning Amazon Nova with your unique IP. While prompt engineering offers basic control, achieving professional-grade character consistency requires deeper model adaptation. In this session, we present an end-to-end approach to customizing Amazon Nova Canvas in Amazon Bedrock. Our solution covers the complete workflow: from character extraction and training data preparation to model fine-tuning and responsible AI-driven inference at scale. This workflow enables rapid creation of high-fidelity imagery, allowing artists and creative teams to transform weeks of work into hours without compromising creative vision or IP integrity.

title: Leveraging MCP Servers for SAP Observability, Security & Integration
abstract: Learn how to modernize SAP workloads using Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. This chalk talk explores how MCP provides context-aware middleware bridging SAP and cloud services, enabling SAP-aware monitoring, contextual security, and streamlined OData integration with AWS. Through examples, attendees will gain practical implementation patterns for their SAP landscape. Ideal for solution architects and technical teams working with SAP systems.

title: Leveraging Structured and Unstructured Data for Complete Insights
abstract: Learn how to extract valuable insights by combining structured and unstructured data sources. We'll explore methods for integrating database information with unstructured content from social media, customer feedback, and IoT devices. Discover how natural language processing and machine learning can convert raw data into actionable intelligence. Through case studies, see how leading companies leverage these techniques for competitive advantage. Take away a practical framework for implementing a comprehensive data strategy that enables data-driven innovation and agile decision-making across your organization.

title: Licensing management and optimization on AWS with generative AI
abstract: Join this interactive chalk talk to see a demo of new features coming to AWS License Manager: AI-powered Global Licensing Insights and Licensing Agent. In this session we will also discuss Microsoft licensing best practices and collect feedback from customers and partners using AWS License Manager or other software asset management tools.

title: Light qubits in the AWS network
abstract: For many customers, the word qubit suggests impossibly sophisticated computing circuits operating at near zero temperatures in a steampunk-looking contraption. However, photonic qubits are made out of laser light, work at room temperature, and travel through the same fibers as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) or Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) data. In this session, discover how these flying qubits can work together with existing AWS infrastructure. You will learn how to deliver enhanced security, distributed clock signals, and provide the foundation for a quantum-enabled cloud.

title: Live hallucination detection in prod with LaunchDarkly’s AI Configs (sponsored by LaunchDarkly)
abstract: When bringing generative AI applications to production, accuracy is key. LaunchDarkly's AI Configs give you the flexibility to change your generative AI applications at runtime, so you can measure model performance more effectively in a real-world setting. In this session, we'll walk through a simplified RAG implementation of an insurance chatbot using an Amazon Bedrock knowledge base. You'll see a demo of how this chatbot uses LaunchDarkly AI Evals to detect hallucinations in production. We'll also cover how to collect metrics such as latency and cost, and discuss strategies for building guardrail logic directly into your runtime configuration. This presentation is brought to you by LaunchDarkly, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Live hallucination detection in prod with LaunchDarkly’s AI Configs (sponsored by LaunchDarkly)
Live hallucination detection in prod with LaunchDarkly’s AI Configs (sponsored by LaunchDarkly)

title: LLMOps with Amazon SageMaker AI: Fine-tune and deploy an LLM for ESG
abstract: Build a production-ready LLMOps platform that automates the complete LLM lifecycle from data preprocessing to deployment. This hands-on session demonstrates enterprise-grade infrastructure using Amazon SageMaker AI, MLflow, and event-driven architecture for an ESG use case. You'll see the platform in action, configure automated pipelines, trigger fine-tuning jobs, and watch models flow from training to production endpoints with built-in governance and monitoring. Perfect for ML engineers and data scientists building scalable, automated LLM operations who will walk away with an LLMOps reference architecture and infrastructure-as-code they can adapt for their own domain-specific use-cases and deploy into their organizations. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: LLMs Reflecting on Reasoning: A Probabilistic VC-Theory Approach
abstract: As LLMs tackle increasingly complex reasoning tasks, can they accurately evaluate their own reasoning quality? We introduce a novel theoretical framework extending classical VC-dimension to probabilistic models through two measures—Probabilistic VC (PVC) and Calibration-aware PVC (C-PVC)—that quantify a model's ability to generalize and assign meaningful confidence. Our benchmark demonstrates important patterns: models trained with reinforcement learning often display high pattern recognition but poor calibration. These findings provide practitioners with practical metrics to assess model reliability and insights into how different training approaches affect self-reflection capabilities—critical knowledge for deploying trustworthy AI systems that can monitor their own reasoning processes.

title: Logistics Agility: AWS Success Story
abstract: Logistics Agility: AWS Success Story ** Learn how this global logistics leader achieved 30% reduction in IT costs while boosting operational agility across 30 countries. Session will reveal the technical decisions that this new to AWS customer has taken that led to significant business value, including slashing environment provisioning time from weeks to hours and attaining 99.99% uptime for critical applications. Gain deep technical design insights into unique multi-cloud architecture, automated infrastructure and disaster recovery strategies implemented. Ideal for CIOs and IT leaders new to AWS, this session also offers valuable insights on building a compelling business case for cloud migration, navigating challenges, and driving innovation.

title: London Stock Exchange Group's transformation journey
abstract: London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) navigated significant hurdles in their digital transformation journey, including legacy processes, tight timelines, scalability issues, organizational silos, and operational friction. In this session, LSEG will reveal how they conquered these challenges to accelerate cloud value realization and maintain their competitive edge. Learn about their strategic architecture decisions, migration framework, and modernization approach that drove success. Discover how they developed end-to-end solutions to scale repeatable patterns, fostering a new cloud-fluent culture. Join us for firsthand insights into LSEG's transformation journey that you can apply to your own organization.

title: Low-cost logging and observability with Amazon OpenSearch Service
abstract: In this session, you will engage in a hands-on experience building a cost-efficient, enterprise logging and observability solution for large volumes of data with Amazon OpenSearch Service. You will leverage storage tiering, OR1 instance types, zero-ETL and query acceleration techniques to drive cost efficiencies and performance.

title: Low-latency SLM deployment: Optimizing inference on AWS Hybrid and Edge services
abstract: This hands-on workshop demonstrates a fully local deployment approach for running Small Language Models (SLMs) at the edge using AWS Local Zones and AWS Outposts. The implementation focuses on achieving low-latency inference and enabling data sovereignty compliance through Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) applications within local infrastructure. Using Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances and publicly available models, you will learn how to deploy, optimize, and manage SLMs in edge environments, ensuring the RAG system and language model operate locally to meet strict latency and data residency requirements for production scenarios.

title: LSEG: Transforming market intelligence at massive scale
abstract: London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) processes over 220 billion market data updates daily across 575+ global exchanges, forming the backbone of global financial markets. Learn how LSEG built their Matrix Signals Platform—a serverless architecture that detects patterns and anomalies across billions of messages. Explore their historical data migration to Amazon S3, development of a cloud-native real-time market data delivery platform, and implementation of sophisticated analytics with AWS Glue, Amazon Athena, and Amazon Bedrock. Discover how LSEG overcame cost-optimization challenges at petabyte scale, maintained consistency across 34 sites, and achieved a 5x cost reduction while improving anomaly detection from days to minutes.

title: Machine Learning Engineering on AWS
abstract: This  bootcamp teaches professionals to build, deploy, and manage scalable ML solutions. Using services like Amazon SageMaker and Amazon EMR, participants learn data processing, model development, and production deployment. Covers ML fundamentals, algorithm selection, pipeline design, CI/CD implementation, security measures, and model monitoring. Combines theory with hands-on labs for creating robust, production-ready ML applications on AWS.

title: Make Attackers Cry: Outsmart Them With Deception (sponsored by Fastly)
abstract: Cyber attacks are conducted by humans, not machines, and we can apply principles about the ways humans behave to fight back. Deception involves the subtle and strategic redirection of potential attackers with carefully crafted misinformation or simulated behaviors. It introduces confusion, friction, and frustration for cyber attackers, which often leads them to stop their attacks and move on to easier targets. Join this session to learn about how to turn the tables on attackers by using their own curiosity and persistence against them. You’ll learn how to bolster your security and fuel more intelligent and adaptive security measures. This presentation is brought to you by Fastly, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Make Attackers Cry: Outsmart Them With Deception (sponsored by Fastly)
Make Attackers Cry: Outsmart Them With Deception (sponsored by Fastly)

title: Making Level 4 Autonomous Networks a reality with British Telecom
abstract: BT is partnering with AWS to create a fully autonomous "Dark NOC" by integrating AI/ML, generative AI, and Agentic AI. Moving from traditional telecom to software-driven operations, BT has implemented GenAI-driven AIOps solutions that reduce costs and improve customer experience. The system uses AWS's agentic AI with autonomous agents and Amazon Sagemaker ML models to enable intelligent monitoring, automated network management, and advanced diagnostics. These AI agents proactively handle network issues and identify customer impacts, advancing BT's goal of zero-touch network operations.

title: Making your Amazon Aurora cluster more resilient
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a cloud-native relational database with unparalleled high performance and availability at global scale. Hundreds of thousands of organizations trust Aurora for their workloads today. In this chalk talk, learn about features such as Aurora Global Database and Amazon RDS Proxy, and discover best practices to achieve high availability for your Aurora MySQL and Aurora PostgreSQL database clusters. The talk includes a whiteboarding session on high availability and disaster recovery solutions to help you maximize your application’s resilience.

title: Managing Amazon EC2 capacity and availability
abstract: Amazon EC2 offers a variety of capacity usage and reservation models, so you can choose the right combination for your workload and budget. These include capacity reservations, On-Demand Instances, Amazon EC2 Capacity Blocks for ML, and more. Join this session to learn how to combine these models in a way that's best for your business. You'll walk away with knowledge on how to manage your capacity to improve utilization and availability.

title: Managing AWS Lambda runtime upgrades at scale
abstract: Attend this chalk talk to learn how to safely manage AWS Lambda runtimes as your organization's serverless footprint grows. Understand runtime core concepts and learn new strategies for managing runtime upgrades across your organization. Through whiteboard examples and conversations, we will show you how you can customize your deprecation schedule, build runtime version upgrade prompts into your pipelines, and use new AI features to help plan the work required for runtime upgrades. Leave equipped with practical skills to streamline your runtime management processes.

title: Managing Bots vs Humans with CloudFront and AWS WAF
abstract: Bots are getting smarter - your defenses should too. Learn how to build intelligent bot detection and deliver content securely using AWS WAF and Amazon CloudFront. In this live coding session, we’ll show you how to treat bots and humans differently (in a good way), serving optimized content to each without compromising performance or security. You'll explore WAF’s bot control, real-time request handling with CloudFront Functions, and clever tricks like request/response manipulation. Plus, we’ll show you how to monitor everything with CloudWatch. Walk away with code, patterns, and a smarter way to manage bots - because not all traffic deserves VIP access.

title: Manchester Airports Group: Scaling operations with Agentic AI & MCP
abstract: Airport operations demand 24/7 workforce coordination across thousands of employees managing critical safety functions. Dive deep into how Manchester Airports Group built an AI-enabled Digital Colleague Workplace using Model Context Protocol agentic Amazon Bedrock AgentCore architecture and Amazon Bedrock foundation models. Examine advanced implementation patterns including transparent AI disclosure and compliance mechanisms for high-risk employment scenarios. This serverless solution processes text/speech interactions with 80%+ accuracy in absence data capture, automatically validating requests and posting to rostering systems while reducing operational costs across multiple locations.

title: Map your VMware workloads migration and modernization journey to AWS
abstract: Every VMware workload is unique. From distinct requirements, dependencies, licensing needs, and business goals, your workloads require tailored migration and modernization strategies. In this interactive session, you'll discover how to match migration approaches, from lift-and-shift to full cloud-native transformation. Learn how to tap into new innovations including generative AI tools that accelerate your migration and minimize risk. We'll cover best practices, licensing considerations, and strategic frameworks to help optimize your investments in time, talent, and costs. You'll learn to make informed decisions that align with your business objectives and technical constraints, building resilient, scalable cloud architectures.

title: Master AI model development with Amazon SageMaker AI
abstract: Unlock the full potential of AI model customization with Amazon SageMaker AI. This session explores SageMaker AI's comprehensive model development tools, highlighting how it caters to any use case - from hands-on compute control to fully managed solutions. Dive into key features like Amazon Nova customization, end to end development with HyperPod, and flexible development environments. Listen to our customers share their journey, demonstrating how SageMaker AI accelerates AI innovation while optimizing resource utilization.

title: Mastercard: How to protect sensitive data in real-time applications
abstract: Mastercard deploys real-time payment processing systems globally requiring the highest level of protection for sensitive data. Learn how they’re using confidential computing as part of their modernized event-based systems to reduce data encryption latency from milliseconds to microseconds while simplifying operations and lowering costs compared to traditional hardware security modules. In this talk, Mastercard will share how they met their security, performance, and operational requirements and what they learned along the way. AWS specialists will also dive deep into how AWS Nitro Enclaves confidential compute capability supports such solutions.

title: Master distributed transactions: Orchestration with AWS Step Functions
abstract: In this hands-on session, dive into implementing distributed transactions using AWS Step Functions. You'll build a payment processing workflow using saga pattern that orchestrates multiple serverless microservices. Learn to handle both successful transactions and rollback scenarios while maintaining data consistency. Through guided exercises, you'll implement compensation mechanisms, handle partial failures, and monitor transaction flows across distributed services. You'll leave with practical experience in building resilient distributed systems and understanding how to observe and troubleshoot saga patterns on AWS.

title: Master identity-first security with Amazon EKS Auto Mode
abstract: Is your Amazon EKS environment following security best practices? This session shows you how to implement granular access controls using AWS native capabilities, building on the strong security foundation that EKS Auto Mode provides. Through interactive discussion and whiteboarding, examine sophisticated approaches to user access management, from enterprise identity integration through AWS IAM Identity Center to RBAC and ABAC policies. Discover how EKS Auto Mode simplifies pod identity management while maintaining strict security boundaries. Walk through real-world examples of implementing least-privilege security across your Kubernetes landscape.

title: Mastering agent authentication: Hands-on with AgentCore Identity
abstract: Get hands-on implementing secure authentication and access management for AI agents using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Identity. In this builder's session, you'll practice configuring agent identities, implementing OAuth-based tool access, and setting up secure agent access. AWS experts will help you to integrate AgentCore Identity with your existing identity providers, set up credential providers for resource access, and implement on-behalf-of flows for agent-to-service authentication. You'll leave with practical experience in implementing enterprise-grade security controls that enable your agents to securely access AWS services and third-party tools while maintaining proper authentication boundaries.

title: Mastering agentic prompt engineering
abstract: Dive into the art of prompt engineering and discover how to harness the full potential of Amazon Q Developer, AWS's cutting-edge generative AI service. Learn techniques to craft compelling prompts that yield remarkable software development task execution and  maximize the value of your agentic AI development experience.

title: Mastering AI agents in enterprises: Best practices with AgentCore
abstract: As organizations scale AI agent development, robust enterprise architecture patterns become essential. In this advanced session, we'll explore how AgentCore enables teams to build modular systems using their preferred frameworks while sharing tools through MCP gateways. Learn about A2A collaboration, shared memory, identity-based access controls, and integrated observability. Discover practical strategies for secure runtime deployment, standardized tool integration, evaluation frameworks, and end-to-end monitoring. Leave with actionable insights to build secure, scalable agent infrastructures that balance centralized governance with team autonomy.

title: Mastering automated, zero-downtime software deployments
abstract: Unlock the power of seamless, risk-free deployments with this insightful chalk talk. Discover how to leverage AWS services like AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS AppConfig to automate safe, hands-off deployments to Amazon EC2, Amazon ECS, and AWS Lambda across multiple accounts and Regions at scale. Explore zero-downtime deployment strategies and learn best practices for reducing risk when deploying to AWS. Whether you’re a seasoned DevOps professional or just starting your cloud journey, this talk equips you with the tools and techniques to streamline your deployment processes, ensuring reliability and minimizing disruptions.

title: Mastering data chaos: Enterprise-scale catalogs for financial services
abstract: Financial institutions face overwhelming data complexity—managing thousands of tables, complex role hierarchies, and global access controls. Explore the challenges of managing data catalogs at scale in financial services, from usability and discoverability to data feed industrialization for generative AI. We'll share best practices, proven reference architectures, and lessons learned from the industry. Learn how to design a Catalog Manager service, a centralized proxy layer for AWS catalog operations that abstracts technical complexity through a self-service interface. Join this session to discover concrete strategies for streamlining data discovery and governance at enterprise scale.

title: Mastering data transformations with Amazon Athena
abstract: Learn best practices for transforming data in Amazon S3 using SQL with Amazon Athena. Through practical examples, this session will demonstrate how to use Athena’s CTAS functionality to efficiently convert raw data into optimized table formats in S3 Tables, handle different file formats across disparate sources, and combine data from multiple tables. Whether you're migrating existing data to S3 Tables or creating new analytical datasets, you'll learn the technical approaches to make the most of Athena's serverless SQL engine to transform your data in your data lake.

title: Mastering EC2 Image Builder: From Basics to Advanced Techniques
abstract: join this hands-on builders session where you'll transform from Image Builder novice to power user in just 60 minutes. In this interactive session, you'll work alongside AWS experts to build a complete image automation pipeline that addresses real-world enterprise challenges. Starting with the fundamentals, you'll quickly progress to advanced techniques including multi-account distribution, custom component development, and CI/CD integration.

title: Mastering feature flags: Faster releases and rapid recovery
abstract: Feature flags have evolved beyond simple on/off switches for software releases. This code-focused session demonstrates advanced feature flagging techniques through real implementation examples and production code samples. See how Amazon leverages feature flags at scale using AWS AppConfig, with detailed code walkthroughs that showcase powerful use cases beyond basic feature releases. The session includes practical code examples for accelerating releases and reducing mean time to recovery (MTTR), enabling attendees to implement these patterns in their own tech stacks immediately.

title: Mastering Fluent-bit: Performance at Scale
abstract: Discover how to unlock the full potential of Fluent-bit, the open source logging and metrics router. In this technical session, we'll explore advanced customization techniques to optimize your logging pipeline. Learn hands-on strategies for fine-tuning Fluent-bit configurations, including buffer optimization, worker threading, and memory management. We'll demonstrate real-world examples of performance tuning, showing you how to maximize throughput while minimizing resource usage.

title: Mastering foundation model customization with Amazon SageMaker AI
abstract: Transform general-purpose AI models into powerful, specialized solutions in this hands-on workshop. Learn practical techniques from continuous pre-training to fine-tuning to model distillation that deliver higher accuracy and cost savings. Through guided exercises, you'll master model selection, customization with your data, and deployment optimization. See how organizations across industries are building specialized AI applications that outperform basic prompt engineering. Perfect for data scientists and ML engineers ready to build production-grade AI solutions. Leave with immediately applicable skills to implement these approaches in your projects.

title: Mastering LLM inference on Amazon  SageMaker AI
abstract: Master Large Language Model (LLM) inference optimization on Amazon SageMaker through real-world architectural patterns. This technical session shows ML engineers and architects how to optimize performance and costs using quantization, batching strategies, and GPU/Inferentia hardware selection. Learn to build reliable production deployments leveraging real-time and batch inference, multi-model endpoints, and auto-scaling configurations. Explore practical solutions for cold start mitigation, performance monitoring, and cost-effective scaling. Whether deploying foundation models or fine-tuned variants, gain actionable insights from production examples.

title: Mastering materialized views: tips for fast, low-latency queries in Redshift
abstract: Join us for an interactive deep-dive into materialized views in Amazon Redshift, where we'll unravel sophisticated techniques and cutting-edge feature enhancements to turbocharge query processing. You'll learn to identify optimal query patterns, master advanced refresh strategies, decode the intricate compute and storage mechanics of materialized views, and develop powerful mental models for slashing query latency in large-scale data environments.

title: Mastering model choice: The 3-step Amazon Bedrock advantage
abstract: Unlock the full potential of Amazon Bedrock by learning how to choose the perfect foundation models for your unique use cases. This session reveals a powerful three-step framework used by industry leaders to navigate Amazon Bedrock's expansive model portfolio. Discover how to identify ideal model candidates, conduct rigorous data-driven evaluations, and optimize for production through strategic combinations and fine-tuning. We'll share real-world examples, practical evaluation techniques, and expert strategies for balancing performance, cost, and latency. Leave empowered to make informed decisions that maximize your AI investments and drive innovation.

title: Mastering Root Cause Analysis: Rebuilding trust after outages
abstract: Investigating outages is tough, but effectively explaining them to customers is an even bigger challenge. Root Cause Analysis (RCA) documents often represent the single opportunity to rebuild trust by demonstrating understanding, establishing ownership, and presenting a plan to address shortfalls. Drawing from more than a decade of experience in crafting effective RCAs, learn practical strategies for navigating complexity, bespoke software, and internal jargon while maintaining transparency. Whether you are an ISV or SaaS provider, discover techniques to create insightful RCAs that explain what happened, why it happened, and outline solid remediation plans.

title: Mastering VMware to EC2 Migration
abstract: Discover how to streamline your VMware to EC2 migrations using AWS Application Discovery Service (ADS) and Migration Hub Orchestrator integrated with AWS Application Migration Service (MGN). In this session, we'll demonstrate how these powerful tools work together to automate your migration journey, from initial discovery to cutover. Learn best practices for accelerating large-scale migrations, reducing manual efforts, and minimizing human errors through automated workflows. We'll showcase real-world examples of how organizations have successfully migrated their VMware workloads to AWS using these services, and share practical tips for achieving faster, more reliable migrations.

title: Master KRMOps: Declarative resource management with Amazon EKS and kro
abstract: Managing cloud resources and applications in Kubernetes environments often leads to complex, fragmented deployment processes that hinder operational efficiency. Attend this advanced session to discover how to unify cloud resource management using Kubernetes Resource Model Operations (KRMOps) with kro and AWS Controllers for Kubernetes (ACK). Learn how to leverage these tools to package applications and cloud resource dependencies into cohesive deployable units using the KRMOps. You will gain practical experience in implementing declarative AWS resource management, automating dependency resolution, and enabling self-healing infrastructure - essential skills required for running large-scale Amazon EKS deployments for data and AI.

title: Master post-training workflows for foundation models on AWS Trainium
abstract: In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive deep into advanced post-training techniques for large language models using AWS Trainium. Together, we'll architect solutions for supervised fine-tuning, knowledge distillation, and reinforcement learning, addressing real-world challenges in adapting trillion-parameter models. We'll collaboratively design efficient workflows, optimize for Trainium's unique capabilities, and tackle common bottlenecks. Bring your specific use cases – we'll work through them, sharing best practices and performance tips. Leave with practical architectures and implementation strategies to immediately enhance your foundation model workflows on AWS.

title: Master your AWS carbon impact with the Customer Carbon Footprint Tool
abstract: Learn how to estimate your carbon footprint using AWS services with the Customer Carbon Footprint Tool. You will hear about the latest features launched, including Scope 3, and how improved reporting can help you meet your environmental targets.

title: Maximize AI-powered customer outreach with Amazon Connect
abstract: In this session, learn how to design intelligent outreach campaigns in Amazon Connect that transform customer engagement. Through real-world examples, discover how to create event-triggered, personalized customer interactions using AI. You'll learn practical strategies for implementing automated campaigns that enhance customer engagement while reducing operational costs and improving efficiency.

title: Maximize Amazon Q Business impact with Amazon Q Apps
abstract: In this session, learn how Amazon Q Apps empowers every employee to quickly turn their ideas into generative AI–powered apps to streamline tasks and boost individual and team productivity. Explore how these secure and customized apps are built on top of your enterprise knowledge with Amazon Q Business.

title: Maximize Productivity with the Amazon Q Developer CLI Agent (sponsored by Pluralsight)
abstract: Explore the different ways that the Amazon Q Developer CLI agent can be used to save time and effort when working in the command line. This session delivers practical strategies for anyone aiming to integrate the Amazon Q Developer CLI Agent into their workflows. Learn from real-world examples and demos that showcase how to maximize productivity when interacting with AWS services, using the AWS CLI, and SDKs from the command line. This presentation is brought to you by Pluralsight, an AWS Partner.

title: Maximize ROI: How Octus migrated CreditAI from Azure to Amazon Bedrock
abstract: This session reveals how Octus migrated CreditAI to Amazon Bedrock. We will detail Octus' journey from managing multiple cloud providers and costly GPU instances to implementing a streamlined architecture using Amazon Bedrock, AWS Fargate, and Amazon OpenSearch. Learn how Octus achieved zero downtime while reducing costs, improving scalability to handle millions of documents, and enhancing response quality. Discover practical strategies for consolidating AI operations and leveraging AWS to deliver powerful, conversational intelligence at enterprise scale.

title: Maximize the value of cold data with Amazon S3 Glacier storage classes
abstract: The data world has massive amounts of cold data, but with advanced analytics and increased demand for machine learning, it could be put to work at any time. In this session, learn how to use Amazon S3 Glacier storage classes to modernize your data archive and cost-effectively store long-term data without worrying about expensive tape drives or off-premises archival data. Discover the options for ingesting and restoring your data at petabyte scale while taking into consideration cost and retrieval performance.

services: Amazon Simple Storage Service Glacier (Amazon S3 Glacier)

title: Maximizing block storage performance for high-intensity workloads
abstract: Amazon EBS handles over 140 trillion I/O operations daily. Performance matters, a lot, but it’s not just about average performance—it’s about stable ultra-low latency that minimizes outliers or tail latency. io2 Block Express volumes are designed for that purpose with consistent sub-millisecond latency and 99.999% durability for critical applications such as SAP HANA, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, and more. Learn about how its performance characteristics optimize compute utilization, leading to cost efficiency and the success of many performance-demanding use cases. Explore how the expanded support for Multi-Attach NVMe Reservations, Amazon EC2 Nitro instances, and Amazon RDS drives new innovations and architecture enhancements.

title: Maximizing customer outcomes: AWS Partner Led Customer Success
abstract: As customer needs become more sophisticated, especially with the increased adoption of AI, and the range of AWS services continues to expand, partners play an increasingly critical role in ensuring successful outcomes and value realization for our customers. Through our new Partner Led Customer Success initiatives, we're equipping you with the mechanisms needed to systematically drive value realization. Whether you're supporting customers in their early AI experiments or guiding large-scale deployments, this session will preview the actionable frameworks and best practices we will share to enhance your customer success capabilities and deliver lasting value in partnership with AWS.

title: Maximizing EC2 Local NVMe Storage: Enhanced NVMe Metrics and K8s Integration
abstract: Discover how to leverage the full potential of the latest high performance Nitro SSDs in EC2 storage-optimized instances for data-intensive workloads. This technical session also explores new capabilities for monitoring and managing NVMe instance storage on EC2. Learn how to leverage enhanced performance metrics including latency, IOPS, and throughput statistics to optimize and troubleshoot data-intensive workloads on Nitro-based instances. We'll also demonstrate the new AWS Local Instance Storage (LIS) CSI driver that enables simplified management of NVMe volumes in Amazon EKS environments. You'll learn best practices for monitoring storage performance and integrating the LIS CSI driver in containerized applications.

title: Maximizing EC2 Performance: A Hands-on Guide to Instance Optimization
abstract: In this Code Talk, we'll explore advanced techniques for extracting optimal performance from Amazon EC2 instances through hands-on demonstrations and real-world examples. Watch as we implement systematic workload analysis using native AWS tools including CloudWatch and APerf, showing you how to measure and interpret key performance indicators across instance types. Through live coding, we'll demonstrate how to optimize application code for different programming languages to fully leverage EC2 capabilities. You'll leave with a better understanding of how to match instances to specific workload patterns, equipped with concrete methods to fine-tune your EC2 instances and applications for maximum performance and cost-effectiveness.

title: Maximizing uptime: Itaú’s mission-critical mainframe migration to AWS
abstract: Dive deep into Itaú Bank's implementation for migrating core banking authorization from mainframe to AWS, targeting 1,000 TPS per account with sub-100ms latency. As one of Latin America's largest banks serving 98 million clients and processing 100 million daily transactions, Itaú will share advanced Amazon DynamoDB optimization strategies, partitioning patterns, and anti-patterns. Learn practical solutions for managing concurrent transactions through exclusive threading models, cell-based architecture with account sharding, and distributed consistency approaches for high-volume financial workloads. We'll examine techniques for maintaining 99.99% uptime while ensuring transaction accuracy and balance consistency, and explore parallel system validation strategies for seamless migration execution.

title: MCP Server for Amazon S3 Tables: AI-powered data operations
abstract: Explore how the Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server transforms S3 Tables management through AI-assisted operations. This chalk talk demonstrates building intelligent agents that leverage MCP Server's contextual understanding to automate table creation, schema management, and data operations using natural language interactions. Learn advanced patterns for integrating AI assistants with S3 Tables, implementing secure permission frameworks, and orchestrating complex data workflows through the MCP protocol.

title: Measure what matters: Web & API optimization with Amazon CloudFront
abstract: How fast is your content really reaching your users? In this session, we explore how to measure the real-world performance of web applications & APIs delivered via Amazon CloudFront. Learn how to combine server-side metrics (from CloudFront) with client-side telemetry (e.g. Core Web Vitals, CMCD, Server-Timing) for a complete view of performance. We will discuss benchmarking, troubleshooting, and alerting strategies — and leave with actionable patterns you can apply.

title: Measuring AI Impact with Amazon Q Developer and Jellyfish
abstract: Development leaders are struggling to show the impact of AI in software development. No single tool, such as Amazon Q Developer, can give the full picture. In this session hear from Genesys about their journey to measure the impact of AI and how the integration of Amazon Q Developer metrics into the Jellyfish platform gave them the visibility they needed. Attendees will learn about ways that AI Impacts software development, how the ingestion of Q Developer metrics into Jellyfish can shed light on those impacts over time and how a customer took that information and was able to tell the story of the impact of AI on their Development process.

title: Meet ultra-low latency and high throughput needs with AWS Outposts
abstract: This session dives deep into the new category of accelerated networking Amazon EC2 instances on AWS Outposts, purpose-built for modernizing ultra-low latency and high-throughput mission-critical workloads such as core trading systems of financial exchanges, real-time market data distribution, telecom 5G infrastructure, and media distribution. Discover how bare metal networking works and how precision time protocol, L2 multicast, and other innovative features deliver the performance required by some of the most demanding on-premises workloads. Learn how to design and architect for continued operations under various disconnection scenarios to uphold the highest level of resiliency.

title: Memory Design for AI Agents (sponsored by MongoDB)
abstract: Memory transforms AI agents into intelligent systems that learn, adapt, maintain context, and personalize experiences. In this hands-on workshop, you'll learn about different types of agentic memory and their design patterns. Through guided coding exercises, you will implement these patterns to create a personal assistant agent that remembers past interactions, extracts insights, and uses them to personalize its responses. We provide all resources, including a Jupyter Notebook template with pseudocode that you'll replace with working code during the session. This presentation is brought to you by MongoDB, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Memory Design for AI Agents (sponsored by MongoDB)
Memory Design for AI Agents (sponsored by MongoDB)

title: Metadata Intelligence: The Key to Trusted and Smart Agentic AI Systems
abstract: This advanced chalk talk dissects how metadata intelligence creates enterprise-grade trustworthy agentic AI systems. We'll whiteboard the architecture that enables runtime verification for LLM outputs using multidimensional metadata: context enrichment, data lineage tracking, quality attestation, and domain-specific knowledge graphs. Through technical demonstrations, we'll implement a planning agent that leverages metadata to orchestrate complex task decomposition with verifiable reasoning chains. You'll experience how metadata framework enables Amazon Bedrock, SageMaker, OpenSearch, and Redshift to implement guardrails for hallucination detection, bias mitigation, and compliance verification at scale. Bring your toughest metadata challenges for interactive problem-solving.

title: Microseconds matter: Architect ultra-low latency trading platforms
