abstract: Digital asset trading platforms demand high performance, ultra-low latency, and high availability infrastructure to address the 24/7 operational model of cryptocurrency exchanges and market makers. In this interactive session, we will live architect strategies to build solutions for high-frequency trading applications. Dive deep into best practices such as distributed state machines, and multi-AZ designs that improve scalability and high availability. Learn how to leverage differentiated capabilities such as Amazon EC2 Cluster Placement Groups and Amazon Time Sync Service’s PTP Hardware Clocks to fulfill your low latency requirements on AWS.

title: Migrate and Modernize Legacy Workflows to Intelligent Agents
abstract: Modernize your enterprise clients' legacy workflows into intelligent, AI-powered solutions with AWS's innovative Move to AI pathway methodology. This technical session explores how to leverage Model Context Protocol (MCP) and generative AI  including AWS Transform to overcome the limitations of rigid, rule-based systems. Learn to build specialized offerings that modernize on-premises workflows into context-aware agents, creating new revenue streams through industry-specific accelerators. Discover how to help clients reduce operational costs, accelerate time-to-market, and gain competitive advantage by bridging traditional systems with cloud-native AI capabilities. Position yourself as a digital transformation leader in the AI-driven enterprise landscape.

title: Migrate and modernize VMware and Java workloads with on-premises dependencies
abstract: During cloud migration, certain workloads must stay on-premises or at the edge due to latency-sensitive application interdependencies, data residency requirements, or local data processing needs. This workshop guides you through migrating VMware and Java applications to AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones while modernizing them through containerization. You will initialize AWS Application Migration Service, set up post-launch actions, containerize applications using AWS Systems Manager Automation documents, pull container images from Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR), and deploy containerized applications to AWS Outposts. Leave this workshop with practical skills in migrating legacy applications.

title: Migrate faster, safer: AWS Data Transfer Terminal deep dive
abstract: Discover how AWS Data Transfer Terminal is transforming large-scale data migrations in this dynamic lightning talk. Through 100 Gbps fiber optic connections, secure private facilities, and customer-controlled devices, Data Transfer Terminal delivers unprecedented efficiency and security for your most demanding data transfer needs. Through real-world case studies and comparisons with existing AWS transfer services, you'll learn how Data Transfer Terminal can advance your enterprise data migration strategy, enabling faster, more secure, and scalable transfers.

title: Migrate from VMWare to AWS: Cloud Operations Best Practices
abstract: Planning to migrate your VMware workloads to AWS? This interactive session will equip you with strategies to streamline operations and maximize the benefits of Amazon Elastic VMware Service (Amazon EVS) using AWS Cloud Operation services. Learn how to leverage tools like AWS Organizations, CloudTrail, Config, CloudWatch, and Systems Manager to automate routine tasks, enhance visibility, implement robust governance, and accelerate your migration timeline. Walk away with actionable insights to not only ease your migration journey but also to operate your workloads more effectively, securely, and cost-efficiently in the AWS cloud. Whether you're planning a migration or looking to optimize existing EVS deployments, this session will provide valuable strategies to elevate your cloud operations.

title: Migrate generative AI workloads to Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Learn from a customer's real-world experience migrating production GenAI workloads to Amazon Bedrock. This session covers essential migration strategies including model selection criteria, prompt optimization techniques, implementing guardrails, and responsible AI practices. Discover how to build evaluation frameworks, resilient model routing, and a scalable GenAI development platform that accelerates product delivery while maintaining enterprise security standards. We'll share practical insights on achieving model interoperability, optimizing cost-performance trade-offs, and establishing best practices that enable teams to innovate quickly without compromising reliability, compliance, or responsible AI requirements.

title: Migrate, modernize, and move your business into the AI era
abstract: Legacy systems shouldn't hold back your AI ambitions. Join Dr. Asa Kalavade to see how AWS is making migration and modernization simpler and faster with agentic AI, building on nearly two decades of enterprise experience. Learn how we're using AI to build domain-specific agents that continuously learn, streamlining and accelerating transformations like never before. Recognizing the collaborative nature of transformation projects, see how we're building a new composable experience integrating first and third-party agents. Through customer success stories and interactive fireside chats with customers and partners, you'll learn proven approaches to accelerate your enterprise AI transformation.

title: Migrate the Well-Architected way [AWS Partners only]
abstract: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Learn to optimize large-scale migrations using AWS Application Migration Service (MGN) aligned with Well-Architected best practices. Gain hands-on experience implementing improvements across all Well-Architected pillars. Practice using various AWS services to enhance your migration projects and optimize outcomes. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Migrating 1,600+ Daily Image Builds to AWS (sponsored by Chainguard)
abstract: Building and testing container images at scale is a challenge for any engineering organization. At Chainguard, the build system is responsible for producing and validating more than 1,600 secure images every day, making it one of the most critical parts of the business. In this session, learn why Chainguard chose to migrate its image build system to AWS, the architectural approach behind the migration, and the challenges solved along the way. Gain practical insights you can apply to your own large-scale migrations of build and test infrastructure on AWS. This presentation is brought to you by Chainguard, an AWS Partner.

title: Migrating to Amazon API Gateway
abstract: Join this session to understand how customers are successfully migrating from existing API platforms to Amazon API Gateway while achieving cost savings, improving security posture and performance. In this session, we will explore proven real-world migration strategies and how to overcome challenges like licensing, authentication, rate limiting and more. We will discuss how tools like AWS Lambda, AWS WAF and OpenAPI specifications are key to a successful migration. Whether you’re planning to migrate from a legacy API provider, or optimize existing APIs, you will understand patterns to accelerate your API Gateway adoption.

title: Migrating your VMware workloads with on-premises dependencies
abstract: While most VMware workloads can be easily migrated to the cloud, some need to stay on-premises due to application interdependencies, data residency requirements, or timeline constraints. Join this session to learn how AWS hybrid and edge services like AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones allow you to migrate in place and modernize at your own pace. Dive deep on various migration pathways with Outposts and Local Zones and the migration tools and programs that you can use to simplify and accelerate transition to the cloud.

title: Migration & Modernization: How AWS Partners help customers transform
abstract: Hear how AWS Partners are making impact supporting customers on their digital transformation journeys. This session highlights customer success stories where partners have used AWS Partner Programs to accelerate change.

title: Mission-critical security: How U.S. Army secures comms with AWS Wickr
abstract: Seamless and secure collaboration is central to operational success. Join this session to discover how the U.S. Army uses AWS Wickr to protect critical communications between various units, mission partners, and citizens. You’ll learn how your organization can deploy the end-to-end encrypted communication capabilities, data residency controls, and administrative features AWS Wickr provides to protect messages and files, manage users and policies, and retain conversations in a data store of your choice to meet regulatory needs.

title: Model governance at scale with SageMaker AI
abstract: Join us to learn how organizations across industries - from finance to healthcare - are building powerful, specialized AI applications using these techniques. Whether you're looking to create domain-specific chatbots, improve content analysis, or develop custom AI solutions, you'll leave with practical skills to implement these approaches in your own projects. This session is ideal for data scientists, ML engineers, and technical practitioners who want to move beyond prompt engineering to build more powerful and efficient AI solutions.

title: Modern batch analytics: Building advanced pipelines with S3 Tables
abstract: This expert-level workshop demonstrates how to use S3 Tables to build sophisticated batch processing pipelines for transactional datalakes built on Apache Iceberg. Learn advanced techniques for processing and storing data in Amazon S3 Tables while leveraging AWS analytics services. Learn to orchestrate complex data workflows using AWS Glue, security with AWS Lake Formation, ad-hoc SQL query with AWS Athena and Amazon Redshift, powerful visualizations using Amazon QuickSight and conversational interaction with Amazon Q with MCP server for S3 Tables. Knowledge of Apache Iceberg and AWS analytics services is highly recommended. Participants must bring a laptop for this session.

title: Modernize AD integrations with AWS Managed Microsoft AD Hybrid Edition
abstract: Discover powerful new capabilities of AWS Managed Microsoft AD Hybrid Edition in this hands-on workshop. Learn to seamlessly extend your on-premises Active Directory environment while simplifying complex directory management. Learn how to migrate and integrate your AD dependent workloads on AWS, enable native AWS service integration with services such as Amazon RDS, enable LDAPS with AWS Private CA, and implement automated workforce identity management using the AWS Directory Service Data API. Perfect for infrastructure architects and cloud administrators looking to modernize their directory services while maintaining existing AD investments. Leave with practical knowledge to streamline your AWS migration journey.

title: Modernize Apple platform development with AWS and EC2 Mac
abstract: EC2 Mac instances allow you to run on-demand macOS workloads in the cloud and extend the flexibility, scalability, and cost benefits of AWS to all Apple developers. In this session, you will learn about Apple application development in the cloud using EC2 Mac instances. We will share the latest features and advancements for EC2 Mac and how customers are benefiting from them. You will also hear firsthand from a customer on how they have optmized their Apple development worklfow and benefited from Apple application development in the cloud.

title: Modernize CI/CD with GitHub and AWS CodePipeline
abstract: In this workshop, learn how to build modern continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines using GitHub and AWS CodePipeline through the AWS Management Console. Learn how to work with monorepos and branching strategies. Explore advanced features such as automatic rollbacks, pipeline parameters, stage level conditions, and concurrent execution modes to improve your pipeline performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Modernize containers for AI agents using AgentCore Gateway
abstract: In this session, learn how to transform your existing containerized applications into powerful components of modern AI-powered workflows. We'll demonstrate how AgentCore Gateway acts as a bridge, enabling your Amazon EKS-based microservices to seamlessly interact with AI agents without requiring substantial refactoring or rebuilding. Through practical examples and a live demonstration, we'll explore a key modernization pattern that allows organizations to leverage their existing container investments while participating in the emerging landscape of agentic systems. You'll see firsthand how AgentCore Gateway can expose your microservice interfaces, making them instantly accessible to AI agents and enabling participation in complex, automated workflows.

title: Modernize legacy ABAP code with Q Developer
abstract: Dive deep into AWS generative AI services and learn how to apply them to your SAP modernization project.  In this session, we will cover use-cases to move to an S/4HANA clean-core by automatically converting or replacing legacy ABAP code.

title: Modernize managed file transfer workflows with event-driven SFTP
abstract: Managing file transfers can come at a high cost as you maintain infrastructure, licensing, resources, and adherence to regulatory and business requirements. In this session, learn how AWS Transfer Family provides fully managed, highly available file transfers over protocols including SFTP, and how to implement this at scale using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform. Learn how enterprises have transformed their MFT infrastructure into an event-driven architecture to reduce operational overhead. Additionally, we'll dive into how you can automate an intelligent data pipeline to process and deliver incoming data while maintaining security and compliance.

title: Modernize monoliths to microservices with generative AI
abstract: Legacy monolithic codebases trap organizations in technical debt and slow innovation. Generative AI tools, including Amazon Q and AWS Transform, accelerate modernization through automated dependency analysis, code refactoring, and microservices migration. Practical patterns enable business continuity while transforming monoliths into scalable cloud-native services. Architects and developers will learn proven techniques for automated code analysis, strategic refactoring, and systematic migration to microservices architecture.

title: Modernize .NET Framework workloads with containers and AWS Transform
abstract: Unlock agility within your organization by accelerating the transformation of legacy monolithic applications to modern container-based architectures. In this hands-on workshop, you will modernize a .NET Framework using AWS Transform and Amazon Q. Once modernized, learn how to deploy and scale the containerized workload on Amazon ECS. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Modernize your analytics and AI for SAP with AWS
abstract: Implementing a modern data strategy and unlocking business value from the Generative AI are paramount to most companies' digital transformation goals. This session will walk SAP customers through multiple approaches for adopting a modern data strategy on AWS and building a strong data foundation for AI. We will cover native AWS services, SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP BTP, solutions from top ISV partners.

title: Modernize your contact center agent workspace with Amazon Connect
abstract: Learn how to enhance agent productivity using Amazon Connect's latest workspace customization features. In this hands-on session, you'll build practical solutions that surface contextual information and streamline agent workflows across different customer engagement scenarios. Leave with a functional suite of workspace customizations that improve agent efficiency and create consistent customer service experiences.

title: Modernize your data warehouse by moving to Amazon Redshift
abstract: Are you spending too much time on data warehouse management tasks like hardware provisioning, software patching, and performance tuning and not enough time building your applications and innovating with data? Tens of thousands of customers rely on AWS Analytics every day to run and scale analytics in seconds on all their data without managing data warehouse infrastructure. In this session, you’ll learn best practices and proven strategies for modernizing your data warehouse, helping your build powerful analytics and machine learning applications that operate at scale while keeping costs low.

title: Modernizing DMV Systems with AWS Transform: Idemia's .NET Success Story
abstract: Discover how Idemia, a provider of identity solutions serving 48 Department of Motor Vehicles (DMVs) across the United States, successfully modernized their legacy .NET Framework applications using AWS Transform. This session explores how the company addressed 25 years of technical debt through composable transformations, seamlessly integrating partner tools while leveraging existing knowledge bases for a customized modernization approach. We'll showcase how AWS Transform's composable architecture enabled Idemia to modernize their mission-critical applications while maintaining business continuity and reducing transformation risks.

title: Modernizing Document Processing
abstract: Oldcastle, a major building materials company, revolutionized document processing by replacing manual methods with an automated system using AWS Bedrock and Amazon Textract. This scalable solution handles hundreds of thousands of monthly documents across multiple facilities. The architecture combines Amazon SES, S3 events, Textract, and Bedrock to process shipping receipts and invoices with minimal human input. The system manages complex document variations without custom coding, extracts data intelligently, and integrates with enterprise systems, delivering significant cost savings and operational efficiency.

title: Modernizing enterprise systems with event-driven AI
abstract: Transform traditional enterprise workflows into intelligent, automated operations using modern event-driven architecture and AI capabilities. This session demonstrates how to evolve monolithic systems into scalable, cloud-native solutions that leverage AI agents for near real-time decision making and automated processing. Through practical examples of business process modernization, we'll show how combining AWS services creates resilient, intelligent systems that reduce operational overhead while improving response times.

title: Modernizing Global Payment Processing: Moving from Mainframe to AWS
abstract: Learn how Global Payments is transforming its 40-year-old mainframe system into a modern AWS cloud platform. This major financial services company, which processes credit cards for over 600 million cardholders worldwide, is using enhanced support and monitoring tools to ensure a reliable transition to cloud-based processing.

title: Modernizing Java applications with generative AI
abstract: In this session, use Amazon Q Developer's transformation capabilities to modernize a Java application. Learn how Amazon Q Developer can leverage generative AI to automate common language upgrade tasks like updating your code, conducting unit tests, and verifying deployment readiness. Save days' or even months' worth of the undifferentiated work involved in moving from older language versions.

title: Modernizing KYC process using Agentic AI (sponsored by Capgemini)
abstract: Crédit Agricole CIB launched a renewed focus on automation through its AI Factory with strategic support from CACIB Consulting. The Know Your Customer (KYC) process was identified as the initial priority workstream. KYC solution built on agentic architecture offers a sophisticated, modular, and scalable approach to automating compliance workflows, particularly for corporate clients operating across multiple jurisdictions. This system comprises specialized agents, each handling a distinct task, and delivering key benefits: scalability across geographies, adaptability to evolving regulations, efficiency through orchestration and micro-tasking, and transparency via traceable agent roles—making it a robust solution for modern KYC compliance.​ This presentation is brought to you by Capgemini, an AWS Partner.

title: Modernizing Legacy Systems: Boeing's PLM Cloud Transformation
abstract: Learn how Boeing transformed a complex, bureaucratic product lifecycle management (PLM) system into an agile, cost-effective powerhouse. In this talk, we'll explore how leveraging cloud technologies and embracing DevOps practices led to breakthrough improvements, including 95% faster deployments, 40% cost reduction, and enhanced global collaboration. We'll dive into the challenges of migrating critical systems, the innovative solutions implemented, and the outcomes realized. This journey demonstrates how large, established companies are revolutionizing their operations, boosting efficiency, and driving innovation by embracing AWS and modern development practices.

title: Modernizing Mercedes-Benz’s Global Ordering System with Gen AI (sponsored by Capgemini)
abstract: Join Mercedes-Benz to learn about how they are transforming their global vehicle ordering system by migrating mainframe-based infrastructure to AWS and accelerating modernization with Generative AI. Their approach blends replatforming with AWS GenAI-driven code transformation, enabling AI agents to streamline architecture, development, and testing. This modernization secures business continuity, strengthens security, and boosts agility, resulting in a scalable, future-ready IT landscape. Supported by a robust cloud ecosystem focused on security and developer enablement, Mercedes-Benz’s journey offers valuable insights and best practices for successful application modernization and risk reduction. This presentation is brought to you by Capgemini, an AWS Partner.

title: Modernizing monoliths: The path to architectural freedom
abstract: Witness the transformation of a rigid monolith into a clean architecture that seamlessly runs across Lambda functions, ECS clusters, and EKS pods. Through live demonstrations, you'll explore the evolution from architectural simplicity to sophisticated flexibility, showing how each stage addresses specific challenges while enabling new deployment patterns. Learn how thoughtful architectural decisions create truly adaptable applications that leverage AWS's full capabilities while maintaining deployment freedom.

title: Modernizing Operational Technology for AI-power Manufacturing
abstract: In this session, discover best practices for modernizing manufacturing applications - such as SCADA, Historian, and MES - and integrating Operational Technology data into an Industrial Data Fabric. Through reference architectures and a live demonstration, we will show examples of how to accelerate data ingestion and contextualization in order to deploy a breadth of analytics and agentic capabilities to deliver outcomes such as improved process quality, cost productivity, and machine reliability.

title: Modernizing Serverless Applications with Event-Driven Architectures
abstract: REST APIs and synchronous workflows have long been a popular choice for building applications, due to their familiarity and straightforward implementation. However, as applications evolve to handle increasing complexity, modern architectural patterns offer new opportunities to enhance performance, resilience, and scalability. In this interactive chalk talk, join an open conversation on embracing asynchronous workflows and event-driven architectures as a natural evolution for modern applications. We'll walk through reimagining a traditional synchronous API-driven e-commerce solution as a decoupled, asynchronous, event-driven system. You’ll also experience a live demo of a retail application built with this architecture.

title: Modernizing Wealth Management with Cloud + AI Use Cases (sponsored by Incedo Inc)
abstract: Wealth management firms are striving to deliver faster, more personalized client outcomes while overcoming legacy constraints and regulatory complexity. In this session, a leading Wealth Management firm, together with Incedo, will share real-world examples of how cloud and AI are driving advisor productivity and accelerating speed-to-market. From modern data platforms to AI-powered insights and intelligent automation, learn how innovative use cases are helping firms reduce operational friction, enhance client engagement, and launch new products faster — paving the way for future-ready wealth management. This presentation is brought to you by Incedo Inc, an AWS Partner.

title: Modernizing Your Desktop Infrastructure: A Guide to WorkSpaces Migration
abstract: Modernizing virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) while maximizing return on investments is a challenge for many organizations. In this session, you’ll receive practical guidance for migrating from on-premises or EC2-based VDI to Amazon WorkSpaces. We’ll explore new WorkSpaces capabilities like Managed Instances which enables you to "lift & shift" your on-prek workloads to the cloud while maintaining current workflows and continuing to use existing VDI management software. We'll also highlight our specturm of offerings and provide recommendation on when to pick which service. You’ll leave understanding how to plan and execute a successful VDI migration that increases agility, reduces costs, and takes advantage of AWS's 99.9% uptime guarantee.

title: Modern Secrets: A Journey from Legacy Systems to AI-Ready Security
abstract: Learn from Acquia's journey from complex legacy systems to cutting-edge secrets management with AWS Secrets Manager. Discover how Acquia revolutionized its security infrastructure, mastering multi-tenant isolation and achieving zero-downtime migration across hundreds of services. This is a potential blueprint for your modern security architecture. Perfect for forward-thinking architects and security leaders, you'll get exclusive insights into Acquia's transformation and how Acquia leveraged its relationship with AWS to drive its roadmap for Agentic AI integration and improved security via automated secrets rotation. This is valuable glimpse into large-scale and seamless secrets management.

title: Modern SFTP: Deploy AWS Transfer Family, Identity, and Automation
abstract: Learn to build enterprise-grade file transfer solutions using AWS Transfer Family with automated workflows and Infrastructure as Code using Terraform. This session covers building secure SFTP servers, integrating with enterprise identity providers like Okta and Azure AD, and automating file processing workflows such as security scanning with GuardDuty. Perfect for organizations looking to modernize their managed file transfer systems while maintaining security and compliance. Walk away with practical templates and patterns for implementing enterprise-grade file transfer solutions.

title: Modern workload identity management strategies
abstract: Discover the comprehensive landscape of workload identity management on AWS and learn how to choose the right strategy for your specific needs. From IAM roles for AWS services to service mesh authentication, certificate-based solutions, and modern approaches like SPIFFE/SPIRE integration, this session explores proven patterns for securing service-to-service communications. Learn how to implement these strategies across containers, serverless functions, and hybrid environments while maintaining security at scale. We'll examine real customer examples of how organizations successfully navigate workload identity challenges using AWS native services, focusing on automated credential management, fine-grained access controls, and operational efficiency.

title: Monetizing agentic AI solutions: A Partner's guide for AI agents & tools
abstract: Learn how AWS Partners can unlock new revenue streams by bringing their agentic AI solutions to market through the AWS AI Agents & Tools Marketplace, where customers discover, evaluate, and deploy AI solutions with confidence. This session covers packaging AI agents, specialized tools, and professional services for enterprise buyers, best practices for marketplace positioning and go-to-market strategies, and includes a demonstration of deploying AI solutions on Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Attendees will discover how to position their solutions for seamless deployment into customers' AWS environments and leave with actionable insights to accelerate their AI solution monetization and effectively reach enterprise customers through AWS's trusted marketplace ecosystem.

title: Monitor the quality and accuracy of your generative AI workloads
abstract: Join this live coding session to learn how Amazon CloudWatch enables AI observability and troubleshooting. We'll build agentic applications using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Amazon EKS with Strands Agent SDK, automatically instrumented through AWS Distro for OpenTelemetry (ADOT). Learn how to visualize agent and model telemetry in CloudWatch's generative AI dashboard, and troubleshoot common challenges like latency, errors, throttling, and token usage. Leave with practical skills to build and maintain reliable AI applications.

title: Monolith to microservices with AWS Modernization pathways
abstract: In this workshop, learn how to use AWS modernization pathways to transform a monolithic workload into a loosely coupled, distributed microservices architecture. Follow a real-world migration scenario, starting with migrating your application, and apply AWS modernization pathways such as Move to Containers, Move to Managed Database, Move to Open Source, Move to Cloud-Native, and Move to AI. Discover how AWS services like Amazon RDS, AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway and Amazon Q enable each pathway. By the end of the session, you will gain practical experience and understand how to modernize your workloads using AWS services and modernization pathways.

title: Moody’s: Architecting a multi-agent system on AWS
abstract: Financial institutions need to orchestrate specialized analysis across diverse domains while maintaining regulatory compliance and performance at scale. Learn how Moody's built their Research Assistant using domain agents for ratings, climate, and economics; task agents for KYC screening and company credit assessment; and workflow agents for sales and marketing and portfolio monitoring with early warning signals on Amazon Bedrock. Explore architectural patterns for multi-agent coordination using Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL, AWS Lambda, and Amazon ECS that accelerated insights by 60% and reduced task completion by 30%. Discover approaches to agent specialization and knowledge retrieval that ensure compliance while processing complex financial datasets.

title: Motability Operations' unified backup strategy: From fragmented to fortified
abstract: Discover how Motability Operations, the UK's largest accessible vehicle leasing organization, transformed their fragmented backup environment into a unified, ransomware-resilient architecture using AWS Backup. Learn about their implementation of a distributed, multi-account strategy aligned with the 3-2-1-0 resilience framework, incorporating automated daily restore testing and ransomware scanning. This session explores how they achieved continuous validation of critical data, ensuring clean recovery points are always available to meet strict RTO and RPO targets. Gain insights into evolving from basic backup processes to assured recovery capabilities that protect against modern ransomware threats.

title: Move and improve at scale using AWS Transform
abstract: Perfect the server migration lifecycle with AWS Transform in this technical deep dive. Explore how its AI-powered agent automates and optimizes your migration journey, from intelligent discovery of your on-premises estate to AI-generated wave planning and network architecture. Through hands-on exercises, learn to leverage generative AI capabilities for automated Infrastructure as Code creation and network translation. Experience real-world server migrations and leave with practical knowledge of modern, AI-enhanced migration techniques that minimize business disruption during your AWS journey.

title: Move fast & don't break things: Maintaining software excellence as you adopt AI (sponsored by Cortex)
abstract: As engineering teams lean on AI assistants to write more code and automate more of the SDLC, new risks arise. Vulnerabilities, secret leaks, and quality regressions can creep in faster than humans can catch them. This talk explores how to prepare your organization for AI adoption by strengthening the engineering excellence foundations that matter in an AI-first world, like software ownership, testing, service catalogs, and vulnerability management. With the right culture and controls, teams can capture the speed of AI while preserving the security, reliability, and quality customers expect. This presentation is brought to you by Cortex, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Move fast & don't break things: Maintaining software excellence as you adopt AI (sponsored by Cortex)

title: Moving AWS Accounts seamlessly at scale
abstract: Mergers and acquisitions,divestitures, and other business transitions often require organizations to migrate AWS accounts securely and precisely to prevent operational disruptions and address security gaps. Multi-account best practices can help you migrate AWS accounts like a maestro during business changes and transitions. You can simplify scaling of your workloads and promote agility while saving time and mitigating risks. Learn how you can assess dependencies and perform additional checks to execute a quick, secure, and efficient migration.

title: Moving data to Amazon S3 to enable Amazon Bedrock gen AI workflows
abstract: Set up efficient data pipelines from on-premises systems, other clouds, and third-party sources to Amazon S3 using AWS Storage Gateway, DataSync, and Transfer Family. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to integrate migrated data with Amazon Bedrock for generative AI processing and analysis. Practice configuring data movement services, establishing secure transfer patterns, and implementing gen AI workflows. Learn to build scalable data lakes that support advanced AI applications, focusing on real-world migration scenarios and data processing requirements.

title: Moving to Valkey without downtime
abstract: Join us for an in-depth exploration of Valkey, an open source in-memory datastore project under the Linux Foundation, and discover how this high-performance key-value database is revolutionizing the way we approach data storage and management. From the core engine to the modules and client libraries, we'll delve into the architecture and features that make Valkey an attractive alternative to traditional in-memory implementations and provide migration strategies from Redis to Valkey. We'll provide a step-by-step guide on how to seamlessly transition your existing workloads to Valkey, leveraging the compatibility and benefits that this new database offers.

title: Multi-account and multi-region deployments at scale
abstract: Many AWS customers are implementing multi-account strategies to more easily manage their cloud infrastructure and improve their security and compliance postures. In this chalk talk, learn about various options for deploying resources into multiple accounts and AWS regions using various tools.

title: Multi-agent collaboration for optimized advertising performance
abstract: Companies struggle to scale their operations and drive better performance across increasingly complex, multi-channel advertising campaigns while maintaining control and governance over AI-powered automation. This chalk talk demonstrates how organizations can use agent-driven processes using Strands Agents and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to automate and augment complex workflows beyond content generation. Learn to automate workflows, complement planning, optimize budget allocation, and drive better campaign outcomes. We’ll explore how Amazon Bedrock can improve return on ad spend using multi-agent collaboration to orchestrate and optimize campaigns, proactively monitor and detect underperformance, and provide solutions such as bid adjustments, creative refreshes, or audience pivots.

title: Multi-Agent Collaboration with Amazon Bedrock Agentcore for Advanced SecOps
abstract: In this code talk session, we'll explore how multi-agent collaboration powered by Amazon Bedrock Agentcore transforms security and vulnerability management for SecOps teams. We'll demonstrate how specialized agents working in concert can automate vulnerability assessment and building remediation patches using AgenticAI. Through practical code examples, we'll show how to architect a resilient security system where agents share context on vulnerabilities, identified servers that are potentially impacted and create remediation artifacts to deploy the changes. Join us to learn how this approach reduces response times, improves threat intelligence, and creates a more robust security posture through intelligent agent orchestration.

title: Multi-Agent Data Pipelines: Shaping the Future of Analytics
abstract: In this session, attendees will learn to build a domain-aware data preprocessing pipeline using Amazon Bedrock’s multi-agent framework. Specialized agents for tasks like classification and metadata extraction automate processing of diverse data, accelerating analytics and generative AI pipelines for marketing, reporting, and other SMB use cases. This approach matters in 2025 as SMBs face growing data variety and urgency for insight; it shapes the future by enabling lean teams to deliver rapid, accurate business intelligence. By automating end-to-end data workflows, SMBs can boost decision making and generative AI success

title: Multi-agent financial fraud detection with Amazon Nova Models
abstract: Master advanced AI system architecture by building a comprehensive financial fraud investigation platform using Amazon Nova's multi-agent orchestration capabilities. This workshop teaches participants to design sophisticated workflows where Nova Premier coordinates specialized agents: Nova Pro analyzes documents and transaction patterns, Nova Lite monitors real-time activities, and Nova Sonic conducts voice-based customer verification. Using synthetic financial data, participants create working systems for transaction analysis, identity verification, risk scoring, and automated case management. The session covers agent coordination strategies, model distillation for creating specialized fraud detection models, and performance optimization methods delivering immediate ROI for financial compliance operations.

title: Multi-Agent Systems: Build, Evaluate, Observe with Strands Agents
abstract: In this hands-on builder session, create a multi-agent AI system using AWS Strands Agents with minimal code. Master the critical observe-evaluate-improve-iterate cycle using OpenTelemetry to gain visibility into agent behavior, evaluate performance, and continuously refine your AI systems. This iterative approach enables businesses to deploy AI confidently without specialized expertise. Leave with practical skills to build, assess, and enhance production-grade AI agents that solve real business problems while maintaining complete visibility into their operations. Perfect for organizations seeking to implement effective AI solutions with sustainable improvement processes.

title: Multicloud architectures: Solutions and design patterns
abstract: Enterprise adoption of multicloud strategies continues to surge, presenting unique challenges in managing complex environments across diverse platforms. This chalk talk explores practical architectural patterns for streamlining multicloud operations. Learn how AWS's comprehensive toolkit—including Systems Manager, CloudWatch, and Security Lake—enables organizations to build resilient, scalable multicloud architectures. Discover tested approaches to simplify monitoring, security, and management across multicloud environments. Gain practical insights into designing architectures that maintain consistency and control across platforms.

title: Multi-Cloud Container Migrations: Amazon CodeCatalyst for Balanced Workloads.
abstract: Utilize AWS CodeCatalyst to create a seamless deployment of Container Compute resources in AWS, enabling a multi-cloud deployment that meets your DR and cost needs. Utilizing AWS CodeCatalyst, ECR, S3, and ECS/Fargate, you can deploy containers across multiple clouds, migrating to take advantage of AWS' multiple Regions and container offerings.

title: Multicloud data movement best practices with AWS DataSync
abstract: Learn how to perform multicloud data transfers using AWS DataSync. This chalk talk provides the expertise to leverage AWS DataSync as a powerful data transfer solution, allowing you to efficiently migrate and synchronize data between Amazon S3 compatible storage on other clouds and AWS storage services. AWS experts guide you through the DataSync Enhanced mode tasks without agents, when to use Basic mode transfers with agents, best practices, endpoint connectivity, and cloud-specific nuances. Harness the ability to move your object data at scale, securely transferring it to cost-efficient AWS storage classes.

title: Multicloud & hybrid node operation at scale is easier than you think
abstract: Modern enterprises face significant challenges in managing compute resources across multiple cloud environments and on-premises infrastructure, often resulting in operational complexity and inconsistent controls. Join this interactive chalk talk to discover practical solutions for streamlining your operations at scale. We'll explore how AWS Systems Manager, Amazon CloudWatch, and other services can efficiently handle fleet-wide operations including patching, application deployment, incident resolution, and access control management. These services help thousands of customers operate millions of resources across their distributed compute landscape, reducing operational overhead while maintaining security and compliance.

title: Multicloud networking best practices
abstract: Organizations with multicloud environments face networking challenges such as the overhead of maintaining different networking constructs per cloud and fragmented security policies creating blind spots. In this chalk talk, we will explore multicloud networking approaches across public, private, and managed connectivity options. We will dive deep into design patterns such as distributed network overlay model, multi-region transit hub architecture, and network policy orchestration. You'll gain practical blueprints for unified IP space management, automated policy propagation, and resilient connectivity patterns between clouds.

title: Multicloud security best practices
abstract: Organizations operating in multicloud environments face challenges with distributed data security, identity management, and continuous monitoring. In this session, we will explore approaches to address multicloud security, aligned with NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), an industry standard, focused on protect, detect, and respond functions. We will dive deep into security visibility via centralized logging, encryption and privacy enforcement, and centralized federation. You will learn specific architectural patterns that will help address multicloud security and identity challenges.

title: Multilingual Contact Center with Amazon Connect
abstract: Get hands-on experience building a real-time voice translation solution using Amazon Connect and AWS AI services. In this workshop, you'll configure speech recognition, implement machine translation, and set up voice synthesis to enable multilingual customer conversations allowing agents to communicate with customers in their preferred languages without the need for language proficiency or additional staffing. Through guided exercises, you'll create a complete contact center solution that allows agents to communicate with customers across language barriers. Bring your laptop to follow along. Ideal for developers and solutions architects.

title: Multimodal Video Understanding AI at Scale with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Bring next-level video intelligence to your workflows using multimodal video understanding models in Amazon Bedrock to index and search through your video content by understanding video holistically like humans. Start by using the multimodal embedding model Marengo on Bedrock to embed entire video libraries. Then, store these embeddings on S3 Vectors for faster and efficient vector search and retrieval. Lastly, use video language model Pegasus to perform video analysis at scale for better video understanding.

title: Multi-protocol data access in FSx for NetApp ONTAP scale-out file systems
abstract: This technical workshop provides deep-dive implementation of multi-protocol access using Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP scale-out file systems. Through hands-on configuration exercises, set up an FSx for ONTAP file system to enable simultaneous file access from Linux and Windows environments. Apply advanced techniques for performance optimization, granular permission management, and complex multi-protocol scenario troubleshooting. Practice architectural patterns that address cross-platform authentication, file locking, and security mapping challenges. This expert-level session targets storage administrators and architects working with heterogeneous environments. Prior ONTAP experience recommended.

title: Multi-Region disaster recovery & resilience testing (feat. Fidelity)
abstract: Explore how AWS innovations are revolutionizing disaster recovery (DR) strategies for enterprise-scale organizations. Managing thousands of applications across AWS Regions demands sophisticated DR capabilities that have historically required complex and resource-intensive custom development. Learn how Fidelity transformed DR for 8,500 mission-critical applications by using the multi-Region recovery orchestration, live dashboards, and reporting capabilities of Amazon Application Recovery Controller's Region switch feature. Combined with AWS Fault Injection Service, Fidelity also validates their recovery procedures under realistic conditions to bolster confidence in their DR plan. Discover how AWS enables enterprises to modernize their infrastructure operations, improve compliance, and enhance business continuity for mission-critical applications.

title: Multi-Region strong consistency with Amazon DynamoDB global tables
abstract: Join this session to learn how multi-Region strong consistency mode for Amazon DynamoDB global tables helps you build highly resilient applications across Regions. Explore the advantages of this innovative functionality, learn how to identify which use cases will benefit most, and discover how to choose the optimal global tables mode for your workloads. Deep dive on how AWS built DynamoDB global tables with multi-Region strong consistency and see a practical demo of the feature. Leave this session ready to leverage multi-Region strong consistency with your applications.

title: Multi-Tenant AI Cost Control
abstract: SaaS providers struggle with unpredictable AI costs and inability to attribute shared foundation model usage per customer. This workshop demonstrates how ISVs can build cost-controlled AI features using Amazon Bedrock Application Inference Profiles, AWS Budgets, and Cost Explorer. Learn to implement per-tenant usage boundaries, accurate billing attribution, and consumption alerts when multiple customers share models. Attendees will build a multi-tenant architecture with granular cost tracking, automated threshold alerts, and detailed usage analytics—enabling transparent customer billing and predictable AI operational costs for SaaS platforms.

title: Multi-Tenant ETL: Consolidate SaaS Data
abstract: Unlock the power of your clients' data through efficient multi-tenant consolidation. Learn to build a robust ETL pipeline using AWS Lambda, Step Functions, and EventBridge, transforming distributed SQL databases into a unified data foundation. This workshop guides you through creating a secure, scalable solution that enables advanced analytics and Generative AI applications. Ideal for data professionals seeking to drive innovation through consolidated SaaS data, you'll master techniques for data extraction, parallel processing, and automated scheduling. Join us to elevate your data strategy and unlock new business insights.

title: Multi-tenant multicloud SaaS using Kubernetes, feat. Adobe
abstract: Organizations often adopt a multicloud container strategy to meet latency, regulatory, and customer requirements. Adobe operates 500+ clusters across multicloud and on-premises environments, powering 4,000+ production services. In this session, we dive deep into Adobe's journey with fleet management of their multicloud Kubernetes clusters. Learn how Adobe solved challenges such as standardization of cluster lifecycle management, inter-cluster networking, security policies, and multi-tenancy across cloud providers. Adobe will share their approach, design patterns, and practices based on a declarative, GitOps-based solution with Cluster API and Argo, tenant isolation with Open Policy Agent (OPA), and fleet-wide optimization techniques.

title: Navigate the cloud compute landscape with Amazon ECS
abstract: Amazon ECS offers multiple compute options that enable architects to optimize for performance, cost, and operational requirements. This session provides a comprehensive guide to the Amazon EC2 and serverless based compute offerings for Amazon ECS. We'll dive into the technical architecture, operational models, and cost implications of each compute type through real world scenarios. You'll learn the inflection points when matching compute options to specific application patterns including batch processing, web services, and data intensive workloads.

title: Navigating API modernization on AWS
abstract: Navigate AWS API architecture choices with confidence in this interactive session. Through collaborative discussion and whiteboarding, we'll explore key options for modernizing APIs on AWS, including API Gateway REST vs HTTP APIs, AppSync with GraphQL, Lambda integration patterns, and Step Functions. Together, we'll analyze real-world scenarios to understand which solutions best fit different use cases and requirements. Learn practical evaluation criteria for selecting optimal API architectures and gain insights into various integration patterns. Whether you're starting a new project or modernizing existing APIs, you'll leave with clear decision-making frameworks to guide your architectural choices.

title: Navigating multi-Region AWS database choices for financial services
abstract: Financial institutions operate mission-critical systems across multiple regions to meet strict resilience and regulatory requirements. In this chalk talk, we'll examine AWS's expanded multi-region database portfolio through the lens of financial services workloads. Together, we'll compare Amazon DynamoDB Global Tables (both consistency modes), Amazon Aurora Global Database, and Amazon Aurora DSQL. Using real-world scenarios, you’ll learn how each solution approaches data consistency in- and cross-Region, and the associated failover mechanics. Gain practical insights for matching these solutions to your specific application needs and resilience requirements.

title: Navigating the future: Solutions architecture in the age of AI
abstract: AI is dramatically accelerating technological evolution, with new architectural primitives emerging monthly. This unprecedented pace transforms the Solutions Architect (SA) role from system designer to change navigator. Learn how SAs deliver value by enabling and de-risking rapid transformation while maintaining architectural stability. Discover strategies for developing new capabilities while preserving foundational expertise. This session explores how to guide organizations through an accelerating technology landscape where managing change has become the primary architectural challenge.

title: Navigating the multicloud journey: essential foundations for success
abstract: Is your organization operating in a multicloud environment? Drawing from thousands of executive and builder engagements, we will cut through the noise with practical guidance to help you succeed with your multicloud strategy. In this session, we will describe the AWS multicloud approach that aims to help you build multicloud capabilities across People, Process and Technology pillars. You will learn how to build a business case-driven multicloud strategy, establishing centralized management and oversight of your multicloud environment and architectural best practices for multicloud.

title: .NET cloud journey: Migration & modernization strategies
abstract: Join this interactive chalk talk to explore proven strategies for migrating and modernizing .NET applications on AWS. We'll sketch architectural patterns ranging from Windows rehosting to cloud-native transformations using containers and serverless. Navigate the AWS service landscape for different .NET workloads through real-world examples that balance performance, scalability, and cost. Come prepared with your questions — we'll collaboratively design AWS architectures based on your requirements.

title: Networking and observability strategies for Kubernetes
abstract: Join this session to explore advanced networking and observability capabilities in Amazon EKS, from securing multi-tenant environments to gaining deep visibility into cluster traffic patterns. We'll share comprehensive strategies for implementing layered network security controls at both infrastructure and application layers which enable granular traffic observability and optimize network performance across distributed workloads. Learn best practices for fine-grained access control, efficient traffic monitoring, and automated policy enforcement. Finally, discover how to leverage Amazon EKS' integration with AWS services to build robust, observable, and secure Kubernetes environments while maintaining operational efficiency.

title: Network observability in AWS: Picking the right tool for the job
abstract: AWS offers a rich network observability toolbox, including Amazon CloudWatch Network Synthetic Monitor, Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor, Amazon VPC Reachability Analyzer, Amazon VPC Flow Logs and the latest Amazon CloudWatch Network Flow Monitor. Yet, many teams struggle to know which tool to grab when latency spikes, packets vanish, or hybrid links fluctuate. In this interactive chalk talk, AWS networking specialists map the most common real-world scenarios to the most effective observability service, explaining when, where, why, and how to use each tool for the right job.

title: Networks at scale and how to automate operations
abstract: Join us in this Code Talk to explore how to leverage AWS Serverless services to automate AWS networking operations across multiple AWS accounts. In this session, we will showcase AWS Cloud WAN to walk through building a global network using policy-as-code. Learn how to automate the connection and validation of VPCs and hybrid environments, while ensuring architecture security and standards are met without any manual intervention. By the end of the session, attendees will build a solution that can help reduce manual operations, enforce standardization, and efficiently manage networking infrastructure at scale.

title: Network security architecture: Deployment patterns for firewalls in AWS
abstract: Join this interactive chalk talk to explore firewall deployment patterns for AWS environments. In this session, discover east/west and north/south scenarios using AWS Network Firewall and Gateway Load Balancer. Through collaborative discussion and Q&A, participants will dive into optimal approaches for centralized and distributed inspection models across multi-VPC architectures. Share your challenges, learn from others, and explore real-world examples in this peer-driven problem-solving discussion of effective network security patterns.

title: Neurosymbolic AI integration in LLMs to enhance reasoning
abstract: This session explores the integration of Neurosymbolic AI with Large Language Models (LLMs), demonstrating how formal verification techniques can enhance model reasoning capabilities beyond traditional training approaches. Drawing from recent implementations, we'll examine how incorporating formal mathematical proofs and verification during model training can improve performance not only in mathematical reasoning but also in adjacent domains like coding and agentic tasks. The presentation will cover practical approaches to neural-symbolic integration across different training stages - pre-training, supervised fine-tuning, and reinforcement learning. Technical challenges and solutions in scaling AR verification for LLM training will be addressed.

title: Neurosymbolic AI: Logic-Enhanced Neural Networks at Amazon Scale
abstract: Neurosymbolic AI combines neural networks' pattern recognition with symbolic systems' logical reasoning capabilities. This hybrid approach creates more robust, transparent, and explainable AI systems while reducing costs. In this talk, we'll explore key symbolic tools including SMT solvers and Lean theorem provers, demonstrating how they integrate with neural architectures. Drawing from Amazon's production experience, we'll examine real-world implementations in Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Guardrails Automated Reasoning Checks. Attendees will learn practical techniques for building neurosymbolic systems, understand when to apply these approaches, and discover how symbolic reasoning enhances AI reliability in enterprise applications.

title: New Era of Platform Engineering – Agentic AI-Powered Self-Service  (sponsored by SoftServe)
abstract: AI in industries requires modernization. What about using AI for modernization itself? In this session you’ll dive deeper in a platform engineering concept and learn about its missing component – Agentic AI. You’ll see how Agentic Platform Engineering supercharges cloud transformation and application modernization. Finally, you’ll see the demo of self-service powered by AI agents, MCP servers, Amazon Q and Amazon Bedrock. This presentation is brought to you by SoftServe, an AWS Partner.

session.title: New Era of Platform Engineering – Agentic AI-Powered Self-Service  (sponsored by SoftServe)

title: New York Times: Best practices for migration to Amazon FSx for ONTAP
abstract: Learn and benefit from the New York Times successful FSx for ONTAP migration while understanding how to optimize the cost and performance of FSx for ONTAP for your workload. A New York Times storage architect will discuss best practices and field proven techniques for migrating your data to Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP. Discover time saving tips on how to increase scale, performance, and resilience by migrating to Amazon FSx for ONTAP. You’ll learn how to configure and optimize your FSx for NetApp deployment with high availability, ransomware protection, snapshots, auto-tiering and more.

title: Next-gen agentic SaaS: Transforming to an agent-powered experience
abstract: The move to Agentic AI is having a profound impact on SaaS providers. For many, this will have a transformative effect on their business and architecture. This workshop will take an end-to-end pass through an agentic modernization, extracting functionality from an application and moving it into intelligent agents. We’ll look at how these new agents integrate into with the other moving parts of your system, using tenant-aware MCP severs, intelligent workflows, and so on. The goal here is to illustrate the fundamental strategies and approaches that can be used to transform existing SaaS solutions into multi-tenant, agent-enabled environments.

title: Next-gen AI: Scaling distributed GPU inference with NVIDIA on AWS
abstract: Discover how to achieve massive inference scaling through GPU disaggregation on AWS. Learn architectural patterns for splitting model inference across multiple NVIDIA GPUs, delivering significantly higher throughput for AI workloads. This session demonstrates implementing distributed inference using Amazon EKS and NVIDIA Dynamo framework with vLLM and TensorRT-LLM as backends, on GPU-powered EC2 instances. Walk away with practical design patterns for cost-effective, high-performance AI inference architectures powered by AWS and NVIDIA technology.

title: Next-Gen Analytics & AI with SAP Business Data Cloud on AWS (sponsored by SAP)
abstract: In today's data-driven world, businesses struggle with fragmented data across disparate systems, hindering effective decision-making and initiatives. Come hear about why SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) on AWS as a powerful combination for building a unified and intelligent data foundation. We'll explore how SAP BDC addresses data silos by centralizing SAP and third-party data into curated "Data Products", readily consumable for analytics and AI. Learn about SAP BDC Intelligent Applications and how to extend them with SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). This presentation is brought to you by SAP, an AWS Partner.

title: Next-Generation Data Management — Insights at Scale with Agentic AI in Pharma (sponsored by ZS)
abstract: Pharmaceutical companies are under pressure to move from data overload to trusted, actionable insights. This session explores how Agentic AI is transforming pharma data and analytics — tackling structured data challenges, integrating technologies end to end, and reimagining how insights flow across the enterprise. Learn how combining AI for data and data for AI enables governed analytics at scale, unlocks hidden value, and delivers efficiency and trust. We’ll show how reasoning agents are shaping the future of insight consumption in R&D, commercial, and beyond. This presentation is brought to you by ZS, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Next-Generation Data Management — Insights at Scale with Agentic AI in Pharma (sponsored by ZS)

title: Next generation etcd for Amazon EKS
abstract: Amazon EKS has reimagined its etcd architecture to enable Kubernetes clusters with high availability, durability and performance, even at 100K nodes. In this session, we examine how offloading etcd's traditional Raft consensus algorithm to a robust log replication service improved our resiliency and scalability story. We'll dive into challenges faced by a traditional quorum-based database, exploring theoretical/practical constraints of performing consensus, and explain how offloading consensus eliminates trade-offs. We also cover how we achieved a fully in-memory store and key-space partitioning to enable high-throughput Kubernetes. Attendees will gain practical insights into distributed consensus and challenges of operating databases at hyperscale.

title: Next-Gen Logistics with GenAI
abstract: Join this session to see how generative AI and open protocols revolutionize logistics operations. Through demonstrations, learn to implement Amazon Bedrock with MCP for enhanced supply chain visibility and automation. Discover architectural patterns that blend AI capabilities with open standards while maintaining security and operational efficiency.

title: Next-gen SAP security analytics powered by AWS
abstract: Learn how to transform SAP ERP security with an Agentic AI solution that processes daily logs into OCSF-compliant security data with 99.9% accuracy at terabyte scale. Implement a multi-agent system using AWS Strands SDK and experience how Swarm Intelligence algorithms with Amazon Security Lake enable real-time threat detection. Deploy a multi-account architecture integrating SAP LogServ, staging, and Security Lake, while using Amazon Q for natural language security analytics. Set up automated cross-account governance with AWS Control Tower. Take home enterprise-ready CDK implementation code and deployment automation scripts. Ideal for security architects, cloud engineers, and SAP administrators.

title: Next-Gen SOC: Agentic SOC analyst with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: SOC teams are often overwhelmed by the volume and complexity of security alerts, leading to slow response times and analyst fatigue. This workshop demonstrates how to automate repetitive SOC tasks—such as reviewing findings, analyzing incident details, and assigning ownership to respective teams—using Amazon Bedrock agents, Knowledge Base, GuardDuty and Security Hub. Attendees will build a GenAI-driven solution that streamlines SOC I actions, enabling our SOC analysts to focus on higher level analysis, leading to faster triage and escalation. Learn how to deploy scalable automation that empowers security teams to focus on critical threats and accelerate incident resolution.

title: Next level patient experiences with Amazon Connect powered by Kyndryl (sponsored by Kyndryl)
abstract: The contact center represents a crucial interface in healthcare delivery, where superior self-service capabilities and automation can substantially enhance patient and member satisfaction and retention. Kyndryl and Amazon Web Services (AWS) present an innovative solution through Amazon Connect, enabling healthcare institutions to deliver seamless support experiences, increase satisfaction levels, and optimize operational efficiency. This presentation is brought to you by Kyndryl, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Next level patient experiences with Amazon Connect powered by Kyndryl (sponsored by Kyndryl)

title: Nextworld Revolutionizes ERP: Supply Chain powered by Sagemaker AutoML
abstract: Traditional machine learning has long supported business decision-making, but it's historically been the domain of data scientists, long development cycles, and significant financial investment to deploy and maintain models. In this session, learn how Nextworld, a no-code enterprise application platform leverages integrates Amazon SageMaker AutoML into its Artificial Intelligence Toolkit to revolutionize ERP industry by implementing supply chain optimization, cash flow prediction by creating LLMs within minutes, eventually building a solution within hours, achieving a 90-95% reduction in time, with the added benefit of democratizing the work across more business oriented, non-technical roles.

title: NLP to SQL: Data Access with Amazon Nova
abstract: Discover how Amazon Nova transforms database interactions through Natural Language Processing to SQL translation, enabling non-technical users to access critical business data without SQL expertise. This session explores practical implementations, showcasing how organizations can democratize data access while maintaining precision and security. Learn how to empower users with natural language queries, reduce technical bottlenecks, and foster a data-driven culture. We'll cover implementation strategies, real-world applications, and best practices for leveraging Amazon Nova to streamline database interactions across your organization

title: Novartis's next-gen clinical platform enables AI drug development
abstract: Dive deep into how Novartis architected their regulated NextGen clinical trial data platform using AWS services including Amazon S3, Databricks on AWS, Amazon Sagemaker, and AWS RDS. Explore their AWS-based clinical landscape, implementation of data lake patterns, and legacy system modernization approach. Learn how they built secure, traceable data backbone powering AI/GenAI innovations in protocol design, trial performance management, and clinical document generation, while maintaining regulatory compliance. Learn how this architecture enables clean data flow and rapid decision-making across drug development workflows.

title: NVIDIA Run:ai and Amazon SageMaker HyperPod Integration for Distributed Training (sponsored by NVIDIA)
abstract: This session explores how Run:ai integrates with Amazon SageMaker HyperPod to simplify and scale large AI training workloads. SageMaker HyperPod provides robust clusters for resilient, distributed training, while Run:ai adds centralized GPU management, job scheduling, quota enforcement, and dynamic hybrid-cloud bursting. The integration allows organizations to seamlessly run, shift, and resume workloads across on-premises and cloud resources, improving GPU utilization and resilience. Attendees will see real-world scenarios—such as multi-cluster training, elastic PyTorch jobs, inference, and Jupyter development—that demonstrate streamlined, efficient, and flexible AI infrastructure management with this combined solution. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.

title: Observability for AI Agents and Traditional Workloads
abstract: Modern applications combine AI agents with traditional software components, creating hybrid systems requiring unified monitoring. This session demonstrates using Amazon CloudWatch to observe your complete application stack—from AI agent decision-making and behavior patterns to traditional infrastructure metrics like CPU and memory usage. Learn practical techniques for tracking AI agent performance alongside existing application monitoring, correlating issues between AI components and traditional services, and using Amazon CloudWatch's search capabilities to identify problems quickly. We'll show how customers use Amazon CloudWatch Application Signals to maintain reliability when AI agents interact with conventional workloads, streamlining troubleshooting across hybrid environments.

title: Observability for Reliable Agentic AI with Strands SDK & OpenTelemetry
abstract: Reliable agentic AI requires robust observability. In this hands-on session, learn how to instrument and monitor AI systems using OpenTelemetry with AWS native tools and open-source solutions. Explore real-world implementations using Strands SDK, diagnostic methodologies for typical use cases, and strategies for continuous improvement. Join us for a gamified experience troubleshooting an agentic application, and leave with practical skills to implement observability at scale.

title: Observability: The open source way
abstract: Many AWS customers adopt open source observability tools, but managing and scaling them can be difficult due to rapid changes and operational overhead. In this hands-on workshop, discover how AWS fully managed services for Prometheus, OpenSearch, and Grafana simplify observability while maintaining the flexibility of open source. You will deploy a sample application and use OpenTelemetry for instrumentation to collect, store, analyze, and visualize observability data. Gain practical experience building cost-effective, scalable observability solutions using familiar tools�without the burden of infrastructure management. Leave with the skills to streamline observability and improve visibility into your applications using AWS managed services.

services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)

title: Onboarding and optimizing AI/ML workloads with Amazon S3 & Amazon EKS
abstract: Join this workshop to learn about a solution to onboard and optimize distributed ML training workloads that use Amazon S3. Learn how to use the power of Amazon S3 as scalable storage for different types of ML training workloads, and harness the orchestration capabilities of Amazon EKS. Discover how these services, coupled with the Mountpoint for Amazon S3 CSI driver, enable Kubernetes applications to access S3 objects through a file system interface. Also, for PyTorch workloads, explore the efficient data loading and model checkpointing capabilities of the S3 Connector for PyTorch.

title: Operating Apache Kafka and Apache Flink at scale
abstract: Enterprises use Apache Kafka and Apache Flink for an increasing number of mission-critical use-cases, real-time analytics, application messaging, and machine learning. As this usage grows in size and scale, so does the criticality, scale, and cost of managing the Kafka and Flink clusters. Learn how customers can achieve the same or higher availability and durability of their growing clusters, both at lower unit costs and with operational simplicity with Amazon MSK (Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka), and Amazon MSF (Managed Streaming for Apache Flink).

services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)

title: Operating AWS Lambda functions at scale
abstract: Unlock the full potential of AWS Lambda as you scale across multiple accounts! In this chalk talk, discover effective strategies for runtime management and learn how generative AI accelerates operational excellence. We'll showcase comprehensive observability implementation using AWS Powertools for Lambda and share proven patterns for optimizing application performance. Through interactive discussions, we'll explore how cold starts, concurrency limits, and service dependencies influence scaling behavior. You'll gain confidence in architecting serverless workloads that scale reliably and efficiently.

title: Operating large-scale enterprise workloads with Amazon EBS and EBS Snapshots
abstract: Many enterprises are running their business-critical production workloads in multiple AWS Regions using Amazon EBS for block storage and EBS snapshots for data protection. With block storage, operating at scale can mean different things, including delivering high IOPS or I/O bandwidth to applications, managing and monitoring millions of volumes, or protecting petabytes of data with stringent RPO and RTO requirements. In this talk, learn best practices for scaling and managing your Amazon EBS environment with cloud-native tools and techniques to help keep costs down while meeting your business needs.

title: Operational excellence: Building resilient systems
abstract: This chalk talk explores the critical relationship between operational practices and system resilience. Examine how fundamental elements like logging, health checks, and deployment strategies impact application reliability on AWS. Through real-world scenarios, discover common operational pitfalls that compromise system availability and learn practical solutions aligned with Well-Architected principles. Learn proven approaches to strengthen architecture resilience and elevate operational excellence. This interactive session provides architects and operators with actionable patterns for building and maintaining robust cloud systems.

title: Operationalizing MCP for Agentic AI in Utilities with Bedrock AgentCore
abstract: With MCP adoption accelerating in energy and utilities, the next step is operationalizing it for agentic AI. This chalk talk outlines an MCP-based reference architecture on AWS's serverless stack, demonstrating how to structure data domains (AMI, SCADA, assets, and tariffs) with partitioning, schema versioning, and robust governance. We'll explore Amazon Bedrock AgentCore role: its Gateway converts APIs into MCP tools, its Runtime hosts long-running agents with isolation, and its Identity service enforces scoped delegation across systems. This framework offers utilities a practical, production-grade blueprint for exposing critical data and tools as MCP tools while safely integrating emerging agent ecosystems.

title: Optimize agentic AI apps with semantic caching
abstract: Multi-agent AI systems now orchestrate complex workflows requiring frequent foundation model calls. In this session, learn how you can reduce latencies to single-digit milliseconds from single-digit seconds in agentic AI applications using semantic caching, while also reducing the cost incurred from your foundation models for production workloads. By implementing semantic caching in agentic architectures like RAG-powered assistants and autonomous agents, customers can create performant and cost-effective production-scale agentic AI systems.

title: Optimize AI infrastructure performance with SageMaker HyperPod
abstract: Join us in this interactive session where we'll explore how to efficiently manage your AI infrastructure to maximize compute performance while optimizing costs. We will discuss how to leverage SageMaker AI high-performance compute to accelerate model training and inference and SageMaker HyperPod's task governance tools to streamline workflow management and resource allocation. You'll learn observability best practices to gain visibility into cluster performance and identify optimization opportunities, and strategies to gain the visibility and control needed to fine-tune your cluster performance for large-scale AI model development.

title: Optimize analytics workloads on Amazon EKS for performance and cost
abstract: The analytics landscape is undergoing a shift as global data volumes grow at unprecedented rates. This rapid growth, combined with rising demand for real-time analytics, is driving organizations to modernize and optimize their data processing and analytics workloads. Amazon EKS delivers cost-performance and scalability making it the best place to run these workloads. In this workshop, you gain hands-on experience on how to optimize Amazon EKS for Spark workloads using different Karpenter configurations, Spot and Graviton Instances, and NVMe volumes. You will also explore observability best practices and granular cost visualization per job.

title: Optimize AWS Backup using AI evaluation and Well-Architected best practices
abstract: Learn to enhance your AWS Backup implementation using the AWS Backup Evaluator Solution, an AI agent that synthesizes data from multiple sources, including AWS Backup Audit Manager. Through hands-on exercises, use Amazon Q to assess your backup environment against the Well-Architected AWS Backup lens, generating actionable recommendations. Create a unified view of your backup landscape to identify optimization opportunities, strengthen compliance, and improve your backup strategy. Build practical solutions for AI-driven backup evaluation that align with AWS best practices while enhancing efficiency and resilience.

title: Optimize AWS Costs: Developer Tools and Techniques
abstract: As cloud applications grow in complexity, optimizing costs becomes crucial for developers. This session explores AWS-native tools and coding practices that reduce expenses without compromising performance or scalability. Learn to identify resource inefficiencies using AI-powered recommendations and cost analysis tools. Discover how to implement cost-aware architectures across compute, serverless, and observability services. The presentation covers practical techniques for identifying and automating optimization practise using Amazon Q Developer. Developers will gain actionable insights to build cost-efficient applications and optimize cloud spending.

title: Optimize back-office operations with gen AI-powered Amazon Connect
abstract: Learn how to build intelligent workflows that bridge customer interactions with back-office operations using generative AI capabilities in Amazon Connect. Discover practical techniques for automating case management, streamlining tasks, and generating AI-powered responses and resolution guides. You will explore automatic field population, case summarization, and next-best-action recommendations, helping you modernize operations and reduce resolution times across your organization.

title: Optimize contact center deployment with change management strategies
