abstract: Join this session to learn how to elevate operational efficiency in your contact center using Amazon Connect. We'll focus on industry-leading practices for change management and automated CI/CD workflows to master change control, asset versioning, and automated deployment of Amazon Connect resources. We'll cover strategies to streamline release cycles, minimize risk, and drive rapid innovation in both B2B and B2C environments. You'll also learn how to maintain a secure, resilient, and scalable architecture and walk away with the knowledge to optimize operational overhead and achieve seamless efficiency in your Amazon Connect implementation.

title: Optimize contact center staffing using AI-powered assistants
abstract: Discover how to automate contact center agent staffing exceptions and call-outs within Amazon Connect workforce planning using an intelligent MCP scheduling server. This hands-on session will show you how to create a system that processes natural language notifications, calculates staffing impacts through Athena SQL queries, and execute real-time schedule adjustments across skill groups. You'll implement advanced algorithms that assess staffing gaps, trigger proactive coverage changes, and alert managers with data-driven recommendations when automation limits are reached. Learn practical techniques that improve forecast accuracy, reduce understaffing, and enhance SLA compliance through automated workforce optimization.

title: Optimize Cost and Performance in Amazon OpenSearch Service
abstract: Join us to learn Amazon OpenSearch Service cost optimization and performance improvement strategies. Discover how organizations reduce costs using tiered storage strategies and automated lifecycle management. Learn how Cluster Insights and Query Insights enable automated health monitoring and query optimization, while Workload Management delivers efficient multi-tenant resource allocation. Developers and architects will learn practical approaches for implementing zero-ETL integration, optimizing queries, and right-sizing deployments. We'll demonstrate automated configuration testing and dynamic parameter adjustment for optimal performance. You'll learn to implement cost-effective data retention, efficient index management, and automated optimization workflows for large-scale analytics or managing multi-tenant deployments.

title: Optimize cost & performance in Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: Cost and performance are top of mind for customers, and these topics go hand in hand. In this chalk talk, learn how to deploy a performant and cost-effective Amazon RDS for SQL Server solution that fits your needs. Explore RDS monitoring tools and native SQL Server features that can be leveraged to pinpoint query inefficiencies, optimize workloads, and right-size your database instances for both cost and peak performance.

title: Optimize customer conversations in your IVR with Amazon Connect
abstract: Discover how to set up effective interactive voice response (IVR) experiences in Amazon Connect by combining structured and unstructured conversation designs. Through hands-on exercises, learn when to use structured pathways for specific outcomes versus unstructured approaches for handling ambiguous inquiries. You'll gain practical knowledge to implement the right IVR strategy based on your business requirements and customer needs.

title: Optimize data processing with built-in AWS Step Functions features
abstract: In this chalk talk, learn how to optimize your serverless data processing workflows at scale. Dive into utilizing AWS Step Functions and its features, including service integration patterns and Distributed Map state. Review common applications and examples of these features to understand when to use them, and learn how they can help you save processing time, resources, and money. Gain insights on how to efficiently orchestrate and parallelize your data processing pipelines using powerful Step Functions capabilities.

title: Optimize GenAI inference and model performance on Amazon EKS
abstract: Explore proven strategies for optimizing LLM loading times and inference performance on Amazon EKS. This chalk talk dives into critical infrastructure decisions, comparing storage solutions such as Amazon S3, EFS/FSx, and EBS for minimal model loading latency. Learn practical patterns for distributed inference, efficient GPU scheduling, and networking optimizations for cross-AZ communication. We'll demonstrate how to leverage EKS features and open-source tools to build high-performance GenAI infrastructure. Join us to discover best practices for architecting production-ready LLM deployments that balance performance, cost, and operational efficiency.

title: Optimize mission critical workloads with CloudWatch MCP & Amazon Q CLI
abstract: Amazon CloudWatch (CW) Model Context Protocol (MCP) server and Amazon Q CLI transforms mission critical workload operations and incident management.Simplify maintenance by providing integrated observability and natural language  command generation, turning complex procedures into simple tasks. Convert automated routine operations through Q CLI's ability to translate conversational  requests into precise AWS commands, eliminating repetitive work. Accelerate root-cause analysis and reduce resolution times by delivering contextual monitoring data directly within client environments, while Q CLI enables rapid remediation through conversational troubleshooting commands for mission critical workloads and AWS infrastructure issues.

title: Optimize .NET Price-Performance with Graviton using AWS Transform
abstract: Master the migration of .NET Framework applications to AWS Graviton to achieve up to 40% better price performance for your .NET workloads. In this hands-on workshop, learn to leverage AWS Transform for efficient porting of Windows-based .NET applications to Linux on Graviton. Experience the migration steps, including code analysis, automated transformations, and CI/CD pipeline adaptations. This workshop is recommended for .NET developers and solutions architects modernizing their Windows-based .NET workloads to gain Graviton's price-performance benefits. Walk away from this workshop equipped with production-ready skills to accelerate your .NET modernization journey. Requires laptop to participate.

title: Optimize Network and EBS intensive workloads on Amazon EC2 instances
abstract: EC2 network & EBS (Elastic Block Storage) optimized instances offer customers the highest, most consistent, network and EBS performance in the cloud. Join us to learn how EC2 customers leverage the full potential of these instances to optimize the price-performance of network-intensive workloads such as security & network virtual appliances, and EBS-intensive workloads such as SQL, NoSQL, and in-memory databases. In this technical session, you will gain valuable insights about the new Graviton and Intel EC2 instance types offered in these families, and the latest instance networking and EBS technologies you should leverage to optimize your workload on EC2!

title: Optimize open weight models for low-latency, cost-effective AI apps
abstract: Open-weight models deliver performance comparable to proprietary alternatives while offering extensive customization control. Organizations can fine-tune these models for specific tasks or domains, process sensitive data locally, and scale efficiently at lower latency and cost. However, maximizing these benefits requires strategic decisions—poor choices waste resources and compromise results. This session provides a practical framework for using open-weight models in Amazon Bedrock. Learn to evaluate model performance for your use cases, optimize fine-tuning while preserving quality, and identify deployment patterns that balance cost and latency. We'll demonstrate optimization techniques and architect solutions for real-world workloads, including agentic applications.

title: Optimize performance and cost for archival data in Amazon S3
abstract: Amazon S3 storage classes deliver the best price-performance object storage and are uniquely architected to deliver industry-leading functionality. In this chalk talk, learn how to analyze data access frequencies with native S3 tools, optimize archival storage using the S3 Glacier storage classes, and automate storage cost savings with S3 Lifecycle policies and S3 Intelligent-Tiering. Also explore how to get the best price-performance and integrate data restore processes into applications when designing and implementing archival restore workflows for data in the S3 Glacier storage classes, including through the use of S3 Batch Operations to make restores even faster and S3 Event Notifications to increase process efficiency.

title: Optimize software and AI Agent procurement with AWS Marketplace
abstract: Transform your software and AI agent procurement with the governance and reporting capabilities of AWS Marketplace. In this session, learn how to visualize your software deployment footprint, distribute licenses efficiently, and gain visibility into spend and usage using the out-of-box tools and built-in features of AWS Marketplace. Discover how leading enterprises are accelerating cloud procurement through efficient use of Private Marketplace, Purchase Orders, Single Pane of Glass dashboard, and our new AI Agents and Tools solution category. See practical strategies for implementing software governance that reduces administrative overhead and enables procurement at scale.

title: Optimize user productivity with Amazon Bedrock and Amazon WorkSpaces
abstract: Manual data entry is time-consuming, error-prone, and prevents employees for working on high value initiatives. In this hands-on session, learn how to eliminate repetitive data entry workflows by combining Bedrock's capability with WorkSpaces. Build intelligent automation that can read data from various sources (PDFs, spreadsheets, databases) and automatically populate forms in any streamed application�from ERP systems to CRM platforms, healthcare applications to financial software. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Optimize your Amazon Aurora resources to reduce costs
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a cloud-native managed relational database that lets you create, manage, and scale your database resources with ease. In this chalk talk, dive deep into Aurora cost components and see how you can use cost-focused features and tooling to optimize costs for your workload without sacrificing performance or scale. Also learn how the Amazon Aurora I/O-Optimized configuration can help you achieve cost savings for your I/O-intensive workloads.

title: Optimize your Amazon ECS workloads for performance and cost
abstract: Amazon ECS powers mission critical workloads worldwide, offering multiple ways to run containers efficiently and cost effectively. In this chalk talk you will learn practical strategies to reduce your ECS spend while maintaining performance and reliability. Explore how to choose the right compute options including AWS Graviton, Spot Instances and other pricing models to match your workload needs. Discover how to right size tasks using AWS Compute Optimizer and implement dynamic scaling with Amazon Application Auto Scaling.

title: Optimizing Amazon EKS costs through workload analysis and observability
abstract: While scaling with Karpenter, Spot instances, and Graviton processors are well-known cost-saving solutions for Amazon EKS, their effective implementation at scale demands thorough workload understanding. This presentation introduces a data-driven framework for optimizing EKS costs in production environments. Through detailed workload analysis and comprehensive monitoring, you'll learn how to select and implement the most suitable cost-optimization strategies for your specific workloads. We'll share a proven planning process to maximize cost savings while maintaining performance, supported by real-world examples and practical implementation guidelines.

title: Optimizing Apache Spark workloads with AWS  Data Processing
abstract: Enterprises aim to build comprehensive data platforms that serve their data engineering divisions. Discover how the Amazon EMR runtime for Apache Spark, delivers out-of-the-box peak performance with Amazon EMR Serverless. Learn how to simplify infrastructure complexities, scale swiftly, and build highly-performant Spark applications with Amazon EMR Serverless, and bring the optimization, reliability and performance of Spark to big data.

title: Optimizing compute for performance and scale with Amazon ECS
abstract: Optimizing compute resources is crucial for maximizing the efficiency and performance of containerized workloads. In this builders’ session, explore how to build compute platforms for Amazon ECS that scale instantly, are resilient to failures and can be optimized for cost. Whether you're new to Amazon ECS or running production workloads, this session offers valuable insights to enhance your container infrastructure. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Optimizing EC2: Hands-On Strategies for Cost-Effective Performance
abstract: Discover practical techniques to extract optimal performance from Amazon EC2 instances in this technical workshop. Learn systematic approaches to workload analysis, focusing on key performance indicators and resource utilization patterns. Through guided exercises, explore how different application architectures influence instance behavior, and master the art of measuring price-performance ratios. Gain hands-on experience with performance testing tools, learn to interpret benchmarking results, and develop strategies for identifying performance bottlenecks. Leave with actionable methods to select and optimize EC2 instances for your specific workload requirements.

title: Optimizing for high performance with Amazon ElastiCache Serverless
abstract: Learn how to build highly scalable, high-performance applications with Amazon ElastiCache Serverless. View how ElastiCache Serverless works behind the scenes and dive deeper into the metrics to help you identify and debug application performance issues. This session will help you to build effective applications using ElastiCache Serverless and to leverage the design of the service to your advantage.

title: Optimizing GenAI performance with Amazon CloudWatch
abstract: Monitoring agentic workloads is critical to optimize cost, performance and accuracy of your applications. Amazon CloudWatch offers powerful capabilities to monitor your GenAI workloads. With built-in functionality to collect signals from your agentic applications built using a variety of frameworks, such as Langchain, Strands, and CrewAI, Amazon CloudWatch helps solve your observability needs. With simple configurations, you can setup monitoring for your agentic workloads to optimize performance and efficiency. In this hands-on session, you will learn about creating agents using different frameworks, and how you can easily setup monitoring for those agents to achieve optimal performance.

title: Optimizing generative AI workloads for sustainability and cost
abstract: Learn how to build efficient generative AI solutions using AWS services like SageMaker and Bedrock. We'll explore practical optimization techniques including quantization and pruning, along with cost-saving infrastructure features such as spot instances and intelligent storage tiering. Discover how to leverage AWS's native capabilities to create high-performance AI solutions that are both environmentally conscious and budget-friendly.

title: Optimizing Kafka workloads with AWS Lambda
abstract: Many development teams rely on Apache Kafka for streaming data across a variety of business-critical applications. AWS Lambda integrates natively with Apache Kafka, offering a serverless approach to event-driven data processing. In this chalk talk, we'll dive into architectural considerations and design patterns for scaling Kafka workloads with AWS Lambda. We'll explore how to optimize performance for both ordered and unordered workloads, and how to apply parallel processing strategies when working with varying Kafka topic partition counts. This session includes an interactive whiteboarding discussion and a review of a reference architecture used to improve throughput and efficiency in production environments.

title: Optimizing price performance with enhanced Amazon EBS gp3 volumes
abstract: Amazon EBS General-Purpose (gp3) volumes are the foundation for a wide range of workloads, including dev/test environments, low-latency databases, and analytics pipelines. In this session, learn how to leverage the latest gp3 enhancements to unlock higher performance requirements of your applications. Dive into the decoupled performance model of gp3 and how to dynamically tune throughput and IOPS based on workload patterns to achieve optimal results. Explore techniques for migrating from gp2 to gp3 at scale, integrating volume resizing into infrastructure automation pipelines, and monitoring I/O utilization to guide continuous optimization. Leave with practical strategies to modernize your block storage infrastructure and reduce costs without compromising performance or agility.

title: Optimizing resources at scale with AWS Compute Optimizer
abstract: Discover how to maximize infrastructure efficiency with AWS Compute Optimizer. In this session, you'll learn practical strategies to rightsize your AWS resources to reduce costs and improve performance. We'll demonstrate how to leverage AWS Compute Optimizer's recommendations to optimize your resources without extensive engineering effort. You'll gain insights into managing optimization at scale across your fleet and measuring the tangible impact of your optimization initiatives. Join us to unlock the full potential of your AWS resources and drive meaningful cost savings for your organization.

title: Optimizing storage costs for Amazon EVS with FSx for ONTAP (sponsored by NetApp)
abstract: VMware users navigating cloud migration face challenges such as high TCO, complex data migration, and inconsistent hybrid cloud operations. Amazon Elastic VMware Service (EVS) offers a seamless path to migrate VMware workloads to AWS without replatforming or refactoring. When your Amazon EVS data is stored on Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP, you have opened a new range of possibilities for enterprise data management. Your data can seamlessly migrate from on-premises to cloud. You can protect your data with Autonomous Ransomware Protection. And you can optimize your storage utilization with enterprise storage features normally found from on-premises solutions.  This presentation is brought to you by NetApp, an AWS Partner.

title: Optimizing storage for your containers and Amazon EKS applications
abstract: Scaling deep learning programs into production often comes with its challenges, and you can’t have high-quality data modeling if your storage isn’t optimized for performance scalability. Getting this wrong can lead to unexpected costs and performance issues. In this interactive chalk talk, get answers to your questions related to selecting and optimizing storage for AI and ML workloads so you can build better, innovate faster, and deploy at scale.

title: Optimizing throughput performance using Mountpoint for Amazon S3
abstract: Explore how to accelerate data operations and reduce costs using open source tools like Mountpoint for Amazon S3 and the Mountpoint CSI driver. Share experiences with AWS experts as we discuss customer implementations and performance optimization strategies. Learn configuration best practices for maximizing throughput, from multi-threaded operations to efficient container storage access patterns. Bring your throughput challenges to this technical discussion as we examine real customer success stories, compare different S3 connector options, and design efficient data access solutions for your specific workload requirements.

title: Optimizing your Amazon ECS application networking strategy
abstract: Building secure and resilient networks for Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate has never been easier. In this chalk talk, learn about connecting microservices with AWS' native application networking tools, including Amazon ECS Service Connect and Amazon VPC Lattice. Dive deep into service discovery, routing, load balancing, authorization and encryption. Learn how to decipher the feature set of each service and learn which one is suitable for your use case.

title: Oracle Database@AWS: supercharge your workloads with Oracle Exadata (sponsored by Oracle)
abstract: Oracle Database@AWS is a revolutionary offering that puts Oracle Exadata hardware inside AWS data centers for low-latency, high-speed access to applications in AWS. Listen to experts from Oracle and Amazon describe how these cloud providers work together to bring the unparalleled performance and reliability of OCI database services directly into your Amazon network and the AWS Management Console, enabling you to migrate and run your Oracle-based enterprise workloads in AWS. You'll hear about lessons learned from working with our launch customers, best practices for getting the most out of the service, and tips on getting started implementing Oracle Database@AWS in your AWS environment. This presentation is brought to you by Oracle, an AWS Partner.

title: Orchestrating with Apache Airflow, MWAA, and SageMaker Unified Studio
abstract: Organizations looking to orchestrate ETL data pipelines on AWS need tools that meet their requirements. In this chalk talk, learn about the pros and cons of orchestrating ETL pipelines with Apache Airflow running on Amazon MWAA. Discover how visual interfaces in Amazon SageMaker make it easier than ever to design the DAG workflow of your dreams.

services: Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (Amazon MWAA)

title: Orchestration meets choreography: Building event-driven architectures
abstract: Master advanced patterns for building hybrid orchestration-choreography architectures from the ground up. Implement orchestration collectors using EventBridge and Step Functions for coordinated workflows, while creating choreographed microservices with Lambda and SQS for autonomous operations. Build sophisticated event-driven systems that intelligently balance centralized control with distributed autonomy. Gain expert-level insights into pattern selection, implementation strategies, and debugging techniques for complex distributed systems.

title: Origin management for multi-region applications with Amazon CloudFront
abstract: In this session, you'll learn comprehensive origin management with Amazon CloudFront to build secure, resilient content delivery systems. We will cover automatic failover mechanisms with CloudFront and Route53, configure granular origin routing with CloudFront Functions, and secure origins using S3 with Origin Access Control (OAC) and VPC private origins for enhanced security. We'll explore integrating on-premises infrastructure through AWS Direct Connect for hybrid architectures, and deploy Origin Shield to further optimize cache performance and reduce origin load.

title: Paper to production: Hosting LLMs on Amazon EKS using NVIDIA GPUs
abstract: Learn how to deploy and operate large language models (LLMs) on Amazon EKS in this practical workshop. You will set up NVIDIA GPU support for inference using Mistral-7B, implement efficient model serving with vLLM's PagedAttention, and scale distributed workloads using Ray Serve. Experience high-performance model storage with FSx for Lustre while implementing comprehensive observability using NVIDIA DCGM and  Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus and Grafana to monitor both infrastructure and model performance. You'll discover how Amazon EKS simplifies running LLM workloads at scale. Ideal for ML Engineers and DevOps professionals with basic Kubernetes knowledge, looking to operationalize LLMs.

title: Patterns for multiple AWS organizations for mergers and divestitures
abstract: Here we explore the lessons learned where customers have acquired more than one AWS organizations through acquisitions or conversely, customers who have divested a part of their business. This interactive session will go over use cases including merging AWS organizations, managing multiple AWS organizations, and splitting AWS organizations.

title: Patterns for session state management in Serverless applications
abstract: Explore architectural patterns for effectively managing state in serverless applications. We'll address the challenges of stateless architectures and present practical solutions using external databases, in-memory caches, and serverless-optimized storage. Learn trade-offs between different approaches, considering performance, scalability, and cost. You'll discover strategies for maintaining consistency across multiple serverless functions in microservices architectures. Leave with a comprehensive understanding of designing efficient and resilient stateful serverless applications.

title: Performance engineering on Neuron: How to optimize your LLM with NKI
abstract: Trying to eek out every ounce of performance of your LLM? Trying to speed up inference or understand what is going on inside a language model? In this session, you will learn how to profile a model on AWS purpose built accelerators and build a custom kernel to achieve better performance.

title: Performance meets pragmatism: Cost-optimized agents with AgentCore
abstract: As you scale agents across teams and use cases, managing cost becomes essential. In this chalk talk, we’ll share strategies for building cost-efficient and performant agent systems using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Learn to optimize concurrency, use asynchronous workflows, control execution time, and implement tool-caching and load-shedding patterns. We’ll cover pricing-aware architectural choices across Runtime, Gateway, and Memory—and how to reduce reprocessing, idle sessions, and over-fetching. You’ll leave with real-world tactics for minimizing cost without sacrificing experience or safety.

title: Performance tuning for streaming Ingestion into Apache Iceberg
abstract: Unlock the power of real-time data streaming into Apache Iceberg with advanced performance tuning techniques. In today's data-driven landscape, immediate insights are critical for fraud detection, IoT monitoring, and dynamic business intelligence. This session explores optimizing streaming ingestion through Apache Kafka and Apache Flink. Learn to maximize throughput by fine-tuning partition strategies, selecting optimal compression codecs, batching techniques, and optimizing checkpointing strategies. Discover how to prevent small file proliferation, reduce network overhead, and maintain low-latency data ingestion at scale, transforming raw streaming data into actionable intelligence with unprecedented efficiency.

title: Perform live migrations to Amazon DocumentDB
abstract: Migrating mission-critical applications with minimal downtime can be complex and challenging. In this chalk talk, learn how you can plan and implement a live migration of your document database workloads to Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) with minimal to no disruption to your operations. The talk covers proven strategies and best practices that can help you seamlessly transition your applications while maintaining high availability. Discover the key steps, considerations, and techniques for a successful live migration to Amazon DocumentDB.

title: Perform vector search on your Amazon DynamoDB data using zero-ETL
abstract: In this workshop, learn how to set up Amazon DynamoDB zero-ETL integration with Amazon OpenSearch Service to add generative AI experiences to your DynamoDB-based applications. Create a pipeline from a DynamoDB table to OpenSearch Service, create an Amazon Bedrock ML connector in OpenSearch Service, and query Amazon Bedrock using OpenSearch Service as a vector store. Discover best practices to use your differentiated data stored in DynamoDB to support context-aware reasoning applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Personalize customer interactions with AI agents in Amazon Connect
abstract: Join us to explore cutting-edge AI implementations in Amazon Connect that reduce costs while enhancing customer satisfaction. Learn to design effective AI interactions that improve self-service completion rates and reduce agent call times, all while maintaining natural conversations and personalized experiences. Architect solutions that balance automation with human support, covering model selection, deployment strategies, and performance measurements. Together, we'll focus on ROI metrics to achieve the optimal blend of AI and human support in your contact center operations.

title: Petco unlocks agentic AI-powered customer service with Amazon Connect
abstract: As customers gravitate towards easy-to-use, self-guided customer service channels, how can your business meet this need in a personalized and efficient way? Join this session to hear from Petco on how it is deploying intelligent, AI-enabled omnichannel experiences using Amazon Connect, helping customers to quickly resolve issues on their own. Walk away with best practices for creating self-service experiences that effectively resolve customer needs from the very first contact.

title: Pipeline architectures: Balancing centralization and team autonomy
abstract: Centralized pipelines enhance standardization and compliance oversight, while decentralized approaches enable team autonomy - but how do you achieve both? Explore architectural patterns for implementing effective security controls and governance across hybrid models that balance organizational control with developer agility. Through real-world examples, learn strategies for security gates, compliance monitoring, and risk management that scale across pipeline architectures. Discover how different architectural decisions impact DORA metrics to improve deployment frequency, lead time, reliability, and incident recovery.

title: Plan a flawless migration to Amazon WorkSpaces using Amazon Q
abstract: When planning a cloud desktop migration, the resource discovery process can be labor-intensive and inneficient. By utilizing Amazon Q to analyse environmental data, you can quickly produce a comprehensive list of solution requirements including compute, networking rules, and application requirements. In this session, you will learn how to use Amazon Q to expediate the discovery process and then create a cloud desktop migration design, plan, and automated WorkSpaces build. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Plan and execute PostgreSQL version upgrades for Aurora & Amazon RDS
abstract: Navigating PostgreSQL major version upgrades in Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition and Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL environments requires careful planning and understanding of available options. This session provides a comprehensive guide to upgrade paths, covering both in-place and replication-based strategies. We'll explore critical considerations for minimizing downtime, handling compatibility issues, and leveraging AWS tools for smooth upgrades. Learn more about long-term support and RDS Extended Support offerings, helping you make informed decisions for your database upgrade strategy. Whether you are managing a single instance or a fleet of databases, discover best practices for successful major version upgrades.

title: Platform engineering: From developer success to business value
abstract: Dive into platform engineering in this interactive session. We'll explore real-world challenges and practical solutions for building effective internal platforms that support developers and meet organizational goals. Through collaborative discussion and sketching, we'll examine ways to enhance developer experience, reduce complexity, and create measurable business impact. Key topics include organizing platform teams, standardizing workflows, and tracking success metrics. Whether you're new to platform engineering or refining existing systems, you'll gain valuable insights from peers and contribute your own experiences. Join us to collaboratively tackle common hurdles and design strategies that foster innovation and operational excellence in your organization's platform journey.

title: Platform engineering: How to build a developer platform on Amazon EKS
abstract: Development teams struggle with inconsistent and fragmented tooling as well as complex provisioning processes. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to build an internal developer platform (IDP) centralizing capabilities while enabling developer self-service. You’ll create a unified developer portal with Backstage for service discovery and golden paths; deploy infrastructure-as-code templates using Crossplane for standardized AWS resource provisioning; enforce security-by-default with Kyverno policies for namespace isolation and network controls; and establish data-driven KPIs to measure platform adoption and delivery metrics. We'll use AWS services including Amazon EKS and demonstrate practical patterns for namespace-as-a-service, policy-as-code, and GitOps workflows.

title: PostgreSQL performance: Real-world workload tuning
abstract: PostgreSQL performance isn’t magic—it’s engineering. In this code talk, we dive deep into practical tuning techniques to avoid common pitfalls that silently degrade performance by improving an underperforming PostgreSQL database workload. Learn how excessive indexes hurt write throughput, why HOT updates fail, and how vacuum behavior can stall your system. We’ll demonstrate how to use Query Plan Management (QPM) and pg_hint_plan for plan stability and decode wait events to uncover hidden bottlenecks. With real SQL examples and system insights, this session equips you to tune PostgreSQL for predictable, high-performance workloads.

title: Powering Enterprise AI: Architecting and Governing Agents at Iberdrola on AWS
abstract: Iberdrola leverages AWS to deploy Claude 4 AI agents that enhance operational efficiency through compressed decision cycles. The implementation focuses on three use cases demonstrating the design of domain-specific agents with comprehensive telemetry and safe scalability. Their approach transforms experimental prompts into reliable services through robust governance that balances innovation with risk management. Performance metrics directly connect agent activities to business outcomes. Iberdrola's vision includes developing an enterprise Agent Hub - a marketplace for teams to share and reuse certified AI agents. This platform will serve as a strategic asset, enabling Iberdrola to maximize AI benefits across its operations.

title: Powering real-time apps and analytics with Redis 8 + RDI (sponsored by Redis)
abstract: Redis 8 delivers breakthrough performance: up to 87% lower latency, 2X throughput, up to 18% faster replication, and delivery of up to 16X more query processing power with Redis Query Engine. Add to that 8 more data structures, including vector sets, JSON, time series, and five probabilistic structures, like Bloom filter, cuckoo filter, count-min sketch, top-k, and t-digest, and you have the recipe for fast apps fast. Join us to learn how Redis 8 and Redis Data Integration (RDI) work together to form the low-latency hub for real-time apps. This presentation is brought to you by Redis, an AWS Partner.

title: Powering SRE Transformation for a Telco Major (sponsored by Tech Mahindra)
abstract: The Telco major, in collaboration with Tech Mahindra and AWS, embarked on a strategic Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) transformation to enhance customer experience across legacy systems, modern apps, and hybrid environments. By adopting SLOs, error budgets, automation, observability, and AI-driven insights, the initiative modernized operations and reduced outages by 25%, improved incident response by 25%, and cut manual effort by 20%. Leveraging AWS services and Tech Mahindra’s platform engineering, the teams introduced continuous verification, chaos engineering, and cultural change—enabling a scalable, resilient, and future-ready SRE model. This presentation is brought to you by Tech Mahindra, an AWS Partner.

title: Powering the Future of Battle Royale — EA’s Apex Legends & Amazon GameLift
abstract: Technical leaders from Electronic Arts share the story behind one of the most significant backend transformations in modern online gaming: the migration of EA’s Apex Legends to Amazon GameLift. EA’s move to Amazon GameLift represents a major shift in how large-scale multiplayer games are built, deployed, and operated. This session will dive deep into the motivations, challenges, and solutions that drove the transition. Attendees will gain insights into real-world cloud migration at scale, learn best practices for live service architecture, and explore how EA and AWS are shaping the next generation of infrastructure to deliver reliable experiences for players worldwide.

title: Powering your Agentic AI experience with AWS Streaming and Messaging
abstract: Organizations are accelerating innovation with generative AI and agentic AI use cases. This session explores how AWS streaming and messaging services such as Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka, Kinesis Data Streams, Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink, and Amazon SQS build intelligent, responsive applications. Discover how streaming supports real-time data ingestion and processing, while messaging ensures reliable coordination between AI agents, orchestrates workflows, and delivers critical information at scale. Learn architectural patterns that highlight how a unified approach acts on data as fast as needed, providing the reliability and scale to grow for your next generation of AI.

services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)

title: Powering your success through AWS Infrastructure innovations
abstract: Discover how AWS Networking delivers on five critical outcomes: availability, performance, scalability, agility, and cost. Come and learn about continual infrastructure advancements in datacenter technologies, and how we integrate lessons from our GenAI scaling journey. As one of the world's top network device makers, we've applied these innovations to make all workloads - including AI/ML - faster and more reliable. In this session, you will learn how the AWS backbone is more reliable from transformative cloud infrastructure innovations, giving your workloads competitive advantages in today's evolving technological landscape.

title: Power multi-agent AI systems that truly transform enterprise workflows (sponsored by IBM)
abstract: Explore how organizations are overcoming integration challenges to build trusted AI agents. This presentation is brought to you by IBM, an AWS Partner.

title: Power streaming analytics on AWS with AI-driven insights
abstract: Learn how to build a modern, streaming analytics solution for real-time data processing and power it with agentic AI capabilities to analyze events and extract patterns for actionable responses. This session will provide a hands-on experience on building a streaming solution using Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka for real-time data ingestion. Using Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink for complex event processing, and Amazon Bedrock Agents to take immediate action. Further evolve this solution to demonstrate the integration with Amazon S3 Tables for deeper analysis.

services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)

title: Practical Applications of Edge Compute in Amazon CloudFront
abstract: Edge compute is a practical way to build faster, smarter applications. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive into how Amazon CloudFront empowers developers to run custom logic at the edge using CloudFront Functions, Lambda@Edge, and the Key Value Store. We'll explore real-world use cases, architectural patterns, and recent feature launches that unlock powerful personalization, performance optimization, and cost efficiency. Come ready to whiteboard, ask questions, and discover how to push intelligence closer to your users.

title: Preemptive Recovery: A New Playbook for Cloud Resilience (sponsored by Rubrik)
abstract: Cloud snapshots are not built for cyber recovery. They’re for "oops" moments, not for when your admin credentials are compromised. Modern attackers know this; they hunt for your snapshots and backups first, aiming to delete them to ensure you can't recover. That requires a new playbook. This session introduces preemptive recovery: a strategy to shift from reactive scrambling to proactive readiness. Join us to learn how to move from hoping you can recover to knowing you will. This presentation is brought to you by Rubrik, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Preemptive Recovery: A New Playbook for Cloud Resilience (sponsored by Rubrik)

title: Prepare for your Next AWS Certification Exam [Exam Prep]
abstract: Learn how to prepare for your next AWS Certification exam with the Exam Prep team. In this 45-minute session, the team will walk you through the 4-step plan to prepare for AWS Certification exams and introduce you to the official materials available in AWS Skill Builder. Search the re:Invent catalog for Exam Prep sessions for foundational, associate, and professional-level exams.

title: Presidio Resonate: AI Agents Orchestrating Multimodal Data at Scale (sponsored by Presidio)
abstract: Enterprises are awash in unstructured data—video, audio, text, and images—spread across siloed systems. Presidio Resonate changes the game. Built on AWS, Resonate is an AI-native, agent-driven platform that ingests, normalizes, and links data across modalities in real time. Using graph-based reasoning and LLM-powered workflows, it transforms scattered assets into orchestrated intelligence ready for action. In this session, see how sports, media, finance, and public sector organizations are using Resonate to accelerate content packaging, surface hidden insights, and deliver personalized experiences—at scale. Learn how to break down data silos, boost operational speed, and unlock new value from your content. This presentation is brought to you by Presidio, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Presidio Resonate: AI Agents Orchestrating Multimodal Data at Scale (sponsored by Presidio)

speakers.jobTitle: Industry Principal, Media Entertainment and Sports
speakers.globalJobtitle: Industry Principal, Media Entertainment and Sports

title: Privacy-enhanced ML and GenAI for AdTechs with AWS Clean Rooms
abstract: Delivering relevant ads to consumers and understanding return on advertising spend historically involved sharing data in ways that posed privacy concerns. Explore how organizations can generate insights with their partners without sharing underlying data with AWS Clean Rooms. Learn how to use AWS Clean Rooms ML to train models and run inference for use cases including lookalike modeling and fine tuning foundation models without sharing raw data or model weights. Discover how to apply privacy-enhancing controls to enable AI data collaboration for brand standard adherence, personalized GenAI recommendations, RTB optimization, and more while mitigating privacy concerns in multiparty ML workflows.

title: Privacy-enhanced multi-party analytics with AWS Clean Rooms: Setup to insights
abstract: Companies across multiple industries increasingly look to complement their data with external partners’ data to build a complete view of their business while protecting sensitive consumer information. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how AWS Clean Rooms enables secure data collaboration between multiple parties without sharing raw data. You will learn how to set up a Clean Rooms collaboration, configure privacy-enhancing controls, and perform multi-party analytics using collective datasets. Through real-world examples, attendees will learn enterprise-grade patterns for secure data partnerships that drive business value and generate unique insights about advertising campaigns, investment decisions, research and development, and more.

title: Privacy-preserving AI primitives: Building blocks for regulated industries
abstract: Regulated industries face unique challenges in adopting AI while maintaining compliance. Explore four fundamental privacy-preserving primitives that unlock AWS AI capabilities: encryption with AWS KMS, confidential computing with AWS Nitro System, federated learning, and cryptographic computing. Through industry case studies, examine real-world implementations, architectural considerations, and performance trade-offs. Learn to evaluate these essential primitives against specific regulatory requirements and design solutions that maintain data sovereignty while leveraging cloud scalability. Gain actionable strategies for implementing privacy-preserving AI in regulated environments.

title: Processing payments with real-time serverless architectures
abstract: Traditional batch processes often introduce significant processing delays and lack the resilience demanded by modern business operations. In this session, we will demonstrate how adopting an event-driven paradigm can fundamentally remove the constraints and limitations inherent in traditional batch processing, enabling near real-time data processing and enhanced operational efficiency. Learn practical strategies and architectural patterns to transform your legacy batch workflows into agile, event-driven systems.

title: Production-ready Serverless: mastering Powertools for AWS Lambda
abstract: Discover how Powertools for AWS Lambda transforms Lambda development by implementing critical best practices at scale. This chalk talk demonstrates practical techniques beyond observability, including event schema validation, dynamic routing mechanisms, and feature flag implementations. We'll explore parameter resolution, idempotency controls, and batch processing patterns for building reliable functions. Learn how to enforce strong typing with event source data models while implementing resilient error handling flows. Build Lambda functions that reduce boilerplate while aligning with Well-Architected principles. Bring your questions as we collaboratively design serverless solutions that are observable, maintainable, and optimized for enterprise requirements using this open source toolkit.

title: Production Trino: Robust Interactive Workloads at Scale
abstract: Trino has emerged as a powerful distributed SQL engine for big data analytics, enabling fast, interactive querying across diverse data sources. This session explores how to build and optimize Trino clusters for production workloads at scale. We'll dive deep into key features like fault-tolerant execution and efficient caching strategies, addressing implementation challenges and real-world configurations. Beyond these core topics, we'll discuss broader considerations for running Trino in production environments. You'll gain practical insights for operating mission-critical Trino workloads on AWS, with a focus on achieving reliability and performance at scale.

title: Prompting the future: How the public sector turns barriers into breakthroughs
abstract: Public sector organizations face unique challenges in digital transformation, from strict security requirements to complex regulatory compliance. But cloud technology is paving new paths for government agencies and public institutions. Discover practical approaches to secure migration and modernization, and the management of classified and regulated workloads. Through real-world examples, explore how organizations are leveraging high-performance computing and implementing AI solutions to advance their missions. In this session, you'll learn technical insights for advancing your organization's cloud journey, regardless of where you're starting.

title: Protecting block storage at scale with native encryption and EBS Snapshots
abstract: With more than 500 million Amazon EBS volumes created daily, protecting them against threat events requires native encryption for data at rest and in transit. This session explores how EBS integrates with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) for key policies, automatic rotation, and cross-account controls. Learn how to launch hundreds of EC2 instances and EBS volumes with speed and predictability from EBS Snapshots and automate backup, replication, and disaster recovery using Data Lifecycle Manager. We’ll also cover snapshot consistency, incremental storage efficiency, and restore performance to help secure sensitive workloads, ensure compliance, and accelerate EC2 instance startup times.

title: Protecting FSx for NetApp ONTAP data from ransomware
abstract: Organizations need advanced data protection strategies as ransomware events become more frequent and sophisticated. Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP delivers advanced capabilities to strengthen data resilience through NetApp's Autonomous Ransomware Protection (ARP). This intelligent monitoring system detects unusual file system activity and automatically creates protective snapshots when anomalous behavior occurs. Combined with NetApp ONTAP SnapLock WORM technology and volume replication, ARP provides comprehensive protection for SMB and NFS file shares. This session covers how to protect your file data to plan for rapid responses to ransomware events, helping you maintain business continuity and minimize operational disruption.

title: Protecting web apps & APIs with AI and an as-a-Service approach (sponsored by Check Point Software)
abstract: Modern apps demand protection that matches cloud speed. In this session, learn best practices of implementing prevention-first security powered by AI engines to protect AWS-hosted web apps and APIs. This approach adapts to zero-day security issues in real time, and can simplify operations and keep latency low across a global footprint. You’ll see how organizations around the globe have hardened web and API traffic without heavy tuning. You will see a demonstration of WAF-as-a-Service that demonstrates AWS-native deployment through Marketplace, showing integrations to deliver unified policy, visibility, and faster, safer adoption. This presentation is brought to you by Check Point Software, an AWS Partner.

title: Protecting  Your Infrastructure with Amazon Threat Intelligence
abstract: Come see how AWS Security processes 5 billion events per second to transparently protect all AWS customers. Learn how AWS builds and  leverages threat intelligence so customers can protect their infrastructure  through three key components: MadPot threat disruption system, Amazon Threat  Intelligence, and active threat defense architecture. We'll deep dive into  our data architectures used to analyze against incoming security data, our  threat intelligence capabilities and how they are integrated into AWS  security services. Discover how to maximize these intelligence-driven  services within your own security operations and improve your cloud security  posture.

title: Protect privacy in GenAI applications using AWS Confidential computing
abstract: Data privacy in generative AI applications includes protecting highly sensitive data in prompts, augmented data sources and model weights among other things. In this workshop you will build three generative AI sample application stacks after identifying the attack surfaces for common scenarios like inferencing, knowledge augmentation. You will mitigate the associated threats as part of the design using AWS Confidential Computing features of Amazon EC2 that align with secure approach to generative AI with AWS . You will use open source language models as well as Amazon Bedrock as part of this workshop.

title: Protect your data with AWS Backup: overview, use cases and what's new
abstract: AWS Backup helps over 140,000 customers protect more than 2.9 exabytes of application data across AWS services. It offers policy-based data protection, streamlining backup management, enhancing security controls, and simplifying compliance reporting. In this session, you'll learn how to use AWS Backup, hear what's new, and discover practical implementation strategies. Plus, hear directly from customers about their real-world experiences using AWS Backup to protect mission-critical workloads and maintain business continuity. Whether you're new to AWS Backup or a seasoned user, this session will provide valuable insights into protecting your AWS environment.

title: Putting AI at the core of transformation (sponsored by Infosys)
abstract: As enterprises progress on their digital transformation journeys, the next step is to pivot towards an AI-centered approach. This session will explore strategies and best practices for integrating AI responsibly into existing transformation initiatives, ensuring that AI becomes a core component of business processes and decision-making. This presentation is brought to you by Infosys, an AWS Partner.

title: Put your data to work for Agentic AI with AWS storage
abstract: Agentic AI systems require storage that delivers persistent memory, real-time decisions, and seamless multi-agent collaboration. AWS offers the most comprehensive storage portfolio to support these needs, including high-speed services like S3 Express One Zone, storage for compute intensive agent workflows using FSx for Lustre, and scalable vector storage and query with S3 Vectors. With the new MCP Server for S3, agents can query context-rich data using natural language without complex code. This session explores how to architect agentic AI with purpose-built AWS storage and integrations with Amazon Bedrock and OpenSearch Service, enabling intelligent agents to operate continuously while simplifying infrastructure and accelerating production deployment.

title: PwC & BMO: AI in Risk & Finance - Elevating MD&A to Treasury Insights (sponsored by PwC)
abstract: Join PwC and BMO for a live dive into BMO’s Risk and Finance AI journey, where a core team harnesses cutting-edge technology to illuminate risk and reporting. Early builds leveraged AWS Bedrock to automate MD&A summarization and content generation, turning dense management discussion into clear, decision-ready insights. As the program evolved, new use cases emerged: precise meeting note capture and summarization, and generative AI that describes and proposes changes to treasury risk modelling. Attendees will see how ongoing model evolution can be understood, tracked, and governed, enabling faster decisions, stronger risk transparency, and practical lessons for financial institutions navigating AI adoption today. This presentation is brought to you by PwC, an AWS Partner.

title: Quantum Computing: Accelerating Pharma Innovation
abstract: Discover how quantum computing is transforming pharmaceutical development and healthcare today. This session demonstrates practical quantum optimization using QAOA through MATLAB and Amazon Braket integration. Explore real-world breakthroughs in pharmaceutical production optimization and cancer diagnostic acceleration. You'll learn how cloud-based quantum computing solves previously intractable computational challenges, see live demonstrations, and gain actionable insights for implementing quantum solutions in your organization. Whether you're in pharma research, healthcare tech, or industrial optimization, leave with practical steps to leverage these cutting-edge capabilities in your existing workflows. See how accessible quantum computing delivers measurable impact now—not years from now.

title: Quantum Computing with Amazon Braket: From Exploration to Enterprise
abstract: Join us to explore the emerging field of quantum computing through Amazon Braket. This session outlines AWS's quantum strategy and latest service capabilities, demonstrating how organizations can begin experimenting with quantum algorithms alongside classical computing workloads. Senior technical and business leaders will gain a clear understanding of current quantum capabilities, experimental approaches, and how future quantum computers will integrate with HPC systems.

title: Quantum Solutions Driving Enterprise Value: From Security to Finance
abstract: Join us to learn how industry leaders are researching and developing quantum applications with Q-CTRL and Amazon Braket. We will show you how Accenture Federal Services improved the performance of quantum algorithms for network anomaly detection by 3x using QCTRL’s Fire Opal optimizer. Discover how hybrid approaches that combine quantum and classical computing on AWS can be applied to use cases in cybersecurity, finance, or materials science. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn how your organization can get ready for quantum computing with Q-CTRL and Amazon Braket.

title: Quick catch up to GenAI on AWS
abstract: [This session is conducted in Japanese] As always AWS does, we are focusing on evolving rapidly our Generative AI related services based on customer's feedbacks. But sometimes, customer gave us feedbacks like "It's tough to catch up since new services and capabilities are come up one after another". In this session, we'll show you an up-to-dated overview of Generative AI related services offered by AWS. Through this session you can get quick summary to wide variety set of services that are useful to build Generative AI enabled applications. It's also helpful for better understanding to newly launched services and functionalities.

title: RAG is Dead: Long Live Intelligent Retrieval-Augmented Generation (sponsored by Pinecone)
abstract: The early days of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) are over. Naive RAG approaches (simple vector lookups fed to a LLM) are not enough to deliver accurate, scalable, and context-rich AI experiences. In this session you’ll learn how leading teams are pushing beyond basic document search to build agentic RAG pipelines that incorporate multi-step reasoning, dynamic namespace selection, metadata-aware retrieval, evaluation and more. We’ll dive into patterns like hybrid search, context re-ranking, document/query expansion and feedback loops for continuous quality improvement.  This presentation is brought to you by Pinecone, an AWS Partner.

session.title: RAG is Dead: Long Live Intelligent Retrieval-Augmented Generation (sponsored by Pinecone)

title: RAG vs MCP: Making the right choice for enterprises
abstract: As generative AI adoption accelerates, architects face a critical question: should they rely on Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to ground LLM responses or embrace the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for richer tool integration and orchestration? This session provides a practical decision framework for selecting the right approach, or combining both for your enterprise workloads. We will dive deep into RAG architectures on AWS, and explore MCP concepts for enabling secure, structured interactions between models and external tools. Through real-world patterns and live demos, you’ll learn when RAG alone is sufficient, when MCP offers a better fit, and how to design hybrid.

title: Rapidly accelerate product development and launches with AI
abstract: Consumer expectations are rapidly evolving, requiring brands and retailers to develop and launch innovative, new products quickly. In this session, you’ll learn how to use artificial intelligence (AI) to accelerate prototype development, create compelling content, and rapidly scale product launches, significantly reducing time-to-market and costs. VF Corporation will share how they are reinventing go-to-market with generative AI, embedding it across brands to accelerate product launches, streamline global content creation, and drive unprecedented speed, efficiency, and creativity. Fanatics Collectibles will showcase how they are using specialized AI agents to create engaging, high quality trading cards in minutes instead of days.

title: Rapidly build and scale real-world AI agents with AgentCore & Strands
abstract: Looking to build powerful AI agents that scale with enterprise-grade reliability? In this hands-on workshop, you’ll use the Strands SDK to develop agents quickly, then deploy them using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore’s secure, serverless runtime with built-in session isolation. Expand agent functionality through Gateway-powered tools like Bedrock Browser and Code Interpreter. Implement contextual memory for personalized experiences, manage authentication with AgentCore Identity, and gain deep operational insights through AgentCore Observability. You'll leave this session equipped to build, launch, and scale production-grade AI agents faster — all with minimal infrastructure needed and maximum flexibility.

title: Rapid prototyping: Leveraging Kiro and Amazon Q Developer CLI
abstract: Gain hands-on experience building functional prototypes using proven AWS techniques. Learn to leverage Kiro and Amazon Q Developer CLI to rapidly transform ideas into working solutions while validating technical approaches. Master effective prompt engineering and spec-driven development practices. Explore how to combine generative AI capabilities with AWS services for accelerated iteration and refinement. This workshop equips architects and developers with practical skills for rapid, AI-assisted prototyping on AWS.

title: Ready your enterprise for agents with AI-driven modernization (sponsored by IBM)
abstract: Build resilient, scalable foundations for AI agents and overcome integration & usability challenges. This presentation is brought to you by IBM, an AWS Partner.

title: Real-time AI inference patterns: Lessons from production game workloads
abstract: Discover practical patterns for real-time AI inference through a production case study. When Jam & Tea Studios shipped one of the first AI-native games on Steam, they faced unique challenges: reducing inference costs 1000x during development, achieving low latency response times for multiplayer sessions, and building testing frameworks for non-deterministic AI behavior. Learn their architectural approaches for fusing traditional application logic with ML systems, techniques for managing hallucinations as features not bugs, and in-production tools for debugging AI behavior. This technical deep dive covers lessons applicable to any interactive AI system where response speed and cost efficiency determine user experience.

title: Real-time for the real world with AWS AppSync Events
abstract: Join this hands-on builders session where you'll implement real-time features using AWS AppSync Events. In this session, you'll build a real-time application incorporating in-app notifications and live updates. With guidance from AWS experts at your table, you'll configure WebSocket connections and implement data persistence strategies. Working in small groups, you'll get personalized assistance as you experiment with the provided code samples. By the end of this 60-minute session, you'll have hands-on experience building real-time features that you can apply to your own applications. Bring your laptop and come ready to code!

title: Real-time insights for smart manufacturing with AWS Serverless
abstract: Manufacturing facilities need instant access to operational data for smarter decision-making. This serverless solution leverages AWS Lambda, Amazon Timestream, and Amazon S3 to deliver real-time, multilingual safety protocols and technical insights to the factory floor. This architecture eliminates infrastructure overhead while enabling immediate analysis of production data, helping manufacturers optimize operations and maintain safety compliance through data-driven insights.

title: Real-time Patient and Revenue Cycle Insights with Gen AI
abstract: Discover how Huron is using generative AI to transform patient satisfaction and revenue cycle analytics. Harnessing the power of AWS Bedrock, Amazon Nova LLM, and Amazon Redshift in diverse areas of healthcare analytics, Huron is achieving 90% accuracy in real-time sentiment analysis and proactively diagnosing opportunities for revenue cycle improvement. Learn how their solution drives hospital revenue through improved funding and staff coaching, successfully scaling to over 100 healthcare providers. Discover practical insights for integrating AWS AI services to transform patient experience measurement and achieve immediate business impact in healthcare operations.

title: re:Architecture Rodeo - Migration Showdown
abstract: The challenge: Develop a comprehensive migration strategy to decompose a complex legacy .NET application with a SQL Server backend into modular, service-oriented components  Your team must maintain 99.99% availability during migration while modernizing the application architecture and optimizing costs. Learn how to approach database migration, application refactoring, and hybrid connectivity patterns in high-stakes scenarios. Teams will be formed onsite and will be guided by AWS subject matter experts in a gamified live challenge where trade-offs and Well-Architected principles determine the winning solution. Expect fast-paced collaboration, diverse strategies, and practical modernization patterns you can take back to your own organization plus the thrill of breaking the monolith Rodeo-style.

title: re:Architecture Rodeo - Real-Time Data and Analytics Showdown
abstract: Your task for the Architecture challenge: Design and implement a data engineering pipeline that ingests petabytes of batch and real-time data from both structured and unstructured data sources. Develop a data lakehouse architecture which could act as a source for machine learning and reporting systems for making data-driven business decisions. Minimize data duplication and at the same time provide governance around data quality and security. Teams will be formed onsite, then guided by AWS subject matter experts compete in a gamified challenge where trade-offs decide success. Compete, showcase strategies, and leave with prizes and proven patterns for real-time analytics at scale.

title: re:Architecture Rodeo - Resilience Challenge
abstract: Ready for a high-availability challenge? Your solution must minimize global latency, enable seamless automatic failover, and meet surge capacity needs while leveraging AWS global infrastructure services. Learn how to apply multi-region design strategies, optimize for resilience, and balance trade-offs in performance and cost. Teams will be formed onsite, where AWS subject matter experts guide you in a gamified live challenge where architectural decisions are put to the test. Compete to present and defend your solutions, explore diverse approaches, and walk away with proven patterns and some exclusive Rodeo swag.

title: Reclaiming Clinical Time: How Veradigm Uses AI to Transform Workflows
abstract: Discover how Veradigm's Practice Fusion EHR leverages AWS' purpose-built Healthcare AI services—AWS HealthLake, AWS HealthScribe, and Amazon Bedrock—to reduce administrative burden and reclaim valuable clinical time. This session highlights a real-world implementation where ambient clinical documentation powered by AWS HealthScribe seamlessly integrates with AWS HealthLake FHIR datastore and Amazon Bedrock's generative AI capabilities to streamline workflows at the point of care. Learn how these integrated healthcare AI solutions enable health tech organizations to accelerate patient care innovation by eliminating the complexity of building and maintaining foundational data and AI infrastructure.

title: Re-defining customer experiences with SAP and Pan-Amazon Services
abstract: The SAP landscape is changing— with customers not just asking “How can you help us migrate and run our SAP applications in the cloud?”, but instead: “How can you help us transform our business and better serve our customers?”. Join this session to learn how industry leaders are combining SAP modernization with Amazon's extensive portfolio to revolutionize customer experiences. You'll hear how customers are redefining purchasing through Amazon.com and Alexa integration. Discover how Pan-Amazon services like Amazon Business, Prime, and Multi-Channel Fulfillment can help deliver exceptional customer experiences alongside SAP.

title: Redefining database scale for agentic AI workloads with TiDB (sponsored by TiDB powered by PingCAP)
abstract: As agentic AI workloads redefine application demands, traditional databases falter under the immense scale of managing both structured data and vector embeddings. This session explores how TiDB's distributed SQL database provides a unified, highly-scalable solution. Learn how TiDB seamlessly integrates with AWS services like Amazon Bedrock and S3, allowing you to bring AI functions directly to your data. Discover how its powerful real-time analytics and integrated vector search and GraphRAG capabilities eliminate data pipeline complexities, enabling developers to build powerful, real-time GenAI applications with unparalleled efficiency. Join us to see how TiDB future-proofs your data infrastructure for the AI era.  This presentation is brought to you by TiDB powered by PingCAP, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Redefining database scale for agentic AI workloads with TiDB (sponsored by TiDB powered by PingCAP)

title: Redefining Operations: Caterpillar's Geospatial Intelligence Solution
abstract: Discover how Caterpillar's innovative GIS solution is revolutionizing construction and mining operations through advanced geospatial intelligence. By integrating real-time data from 20,000+ connected assets, this cloud-native platform delivers terrain modeling with 2-centimeter precision. The system combines sensor data, from ground elevation to equipment activity, with drone-generated surface scans, enabling data-driven decisions that optimize operations and enhance safety. This scalable solution minimizes infrastructure overhead while ensuring robust security and compliance. Learn how this intelligent ecosystem helps customers reduce rework, improve resource utilization, and gain competitive advantage in the heavy equipment industry.

title: Redefining service excellence: Canada Life’s AI-powered contact center
abstract: Join this session to discover how Canada Life transformed its contact center by moving from a fragmented, manual system to a cloud-based, AI-powered solution using Amazon Connect. This shift enabled seamless multi-channel engagement enabling customer interaction through their preferred channel, simplified authentication, and empowered agents with real-time tools and unified interfaces—resulting in streamlined operations, reduced complexity, faster resolutions and thus reduced operational costs and significantly improved customer satisfaction.

title: Red teaming LLMs: Defence techniques for generative AI applications
abstract: In this session, we’ll explore adversarial and “red team” testing for LLM-powered applications—covering prompt injection attacks, toxic output generation, training data poisoning, model exfiltration, and other emerging threats. Attendees will deep dive into real attack demonstrations, such as jailbreaking an AI assistant, and hands-on threat modeling exercises. We’ll also highlight how AWS services and features (Amazon Bedrock Guardrails, content moderation APIs, and logging/monitoring tools) help defend against these vulnerabilities. Participants will leave with a clear strategy for hardening generative AI apps against abuse and insights into conducting security assessments on AI systems.

title: Red teaming your generative AI and MCP applications at scale
abstract: Step into the shoes of an AI-powered red team adversary in the GenAI Red Team Challenge. In this intensive workshop, you'll deploy a AI security agent to orchestrate sophisticated threat chains against Model Context Protocol (MCP) applications, systematically discovering vulnerabilities. Master countermeasures from prompt templating and guardrails to OAuth-enhanced MCP security configurations that prevent unauthorized access. This hands-on, gamified experience helps you think like a threat actor and equips you with practical skills in automated vulnerability testing and risk mitigation against common MITRE and OWASP vulnerabilities for LLM-based applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Red Team vs Blue Team: Securing AI Agents
abstract: AI agents represent the next evolution of APIs, bringing new security challenges and attack vectors. This session examines real-world adversarial threats including prompt injection, tool abuse, and agent-to-agent escalation. Learn defensive strategies using rate limiting, encrypted endpoints, and Amazon Bedrock Guardrails. The session demonstrates how to build secure-by-default agents using Infrastructure as Code, enforcing deterministic behavior and Zero Trust principles. Essential knowledge for teams deploying autonomous agents in production environments.

title: Reduce development cycles with Amazon Q Developer and GitHub
abstract: Learn how combining GitHub with Amazon Q Developer can maximize development efficiency. In this builder session, learn how to automatically build features, implement bug fixes, increase test coverage, generate documentation and provide immediate feedback on code quality. Join this talk to learn how GitHub with Q Developer can take your development processes to the next level.

title: Reducing downtime: Build resilient architectures with Amazon ECS
abstract: In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive deep into proven strategies for building resilient applications using Amazon ECS. We will walk through real-world scenarios across the entire technology stack - from infrastructure and networking to operations and application layers. Through these practical examples, you will learn patterns to improve the resilience of your containerized workloads. By the end of the session, you will have actionable insights to enhance fault tolerance, reduce system downtime, and maintain business continuity in your Amazon ECS deployments.

title: Refactoring Java applications to serverless
abstract: In this chalk talk, you will learn how to modernize enterprise Java architectures using serverless technologies. You will explore the transformation of three common enterprise patterns: scheduled job processing using Amazon EventBridge Scheduler with AWS Lambda, synchronous API handling through Amazon API Gateway with Lambda, and asynchronous task processing via Amazon SQS with Lambda. Along the way you will learn how to structure your Serverless Java project, including strategies for seperating business logic across Lambda functions and how to leverage Spring, Quarkus and Micronaut framework support.

title: Refactoring post-migration: API-first and event-driven architectures
abstract: Explore architectural strategies for refactoring legacy systems post-migration using API-first and event-driven design principles. Learn how to leverage Amazon API Gateway, EventBridge, and Q Developer to create loosely coupled services. Examine patterns for using generative AI to accelerate interface extraction, OpenAPI contract generation, and event flow design. Through financial and logistics case studies, discover how these architectural approaches enhance release velocity and system flexibility. Gain practical patterns for implementing scalable, asynchronous processing in your post-migration modernization efforts.

title: Refine customer journeys with predictive routing in Amazon Connect
abstract: Learn how to enhance customer experiences using AI-powered attribute routing in Amazon Connect. This session covers how to combine customer attributes with predictive modeling to intelligently match customers with the best-suited agents before conversations begin. Through practical examples, discover how machine learning techniques can reduce handle times, improve first-contact resolution, and create predictive customer journeys that boost satisfaction and loyalty.

title: Reimagine enterprise productivity with Amazon Q Business
abstract: Generative AI is reshaping how we interact with information and tackle complex tasks. Discover how Amazon Q Business enables you to rapidly deploy an AI-powered assistant that answers questions, generates summaries, creates content, and automates tasks—all using your enterprise data and systems. In this session, we'll explore the key features of Q Business and showcase real-world examples of how it's revolutionizing productivity and decision-making for Amazonians across various roles and departments. Learn about the benefits, best practices, and potential use cases that can be applied to your own organization.

title: Reimagine your mainframe applications using AWS Transform's AI agent
abstract: Transform mainframe applications into powerful cloud-native services in this workshop. Go beyond simple migration, harnessing AWS Transform's AI capabilities alongside developer tools to reimagine critical systems. Work with a specialized AI agent to tackle COBOL codebases and decode embedded business logic. Through practical exercises, you'll use agentic AI to break down monolithic applications into microservices, preserving relevant business rules. Experience the generation of well-structured, maintainable Java code optimized for the cloud. Practice proven techniques for successful modernization: validating transformed applications and maintaining required business logic integrity. Leave this session ready to deliver a winning transformation, armed with experience and practical knowledge.

title: Reimagining AWS operations with autonomous AI agents
abstract: AI agents can take on routine operational tasks and reduce manual effort. This session explores how autonomous agents monitor, analyze, and respond to AWS workloads in real time. Learn design patterns, integration strategies, and guardrails to ensure reliability while accelerating operations with AI.

title: Reimagining Cloud Security with Agentic AI (sponsored by CrowdStrike)
abstract: The age of AI has changed the rules of the game. According to the CrowdStrike 2025 Threat Hunting Report, enterprising adversaries are using generative AI (GenAI) to enhance their operations, underscoring the critical need for innovative defensive strategies. This session explores modern cloud attack tactics and how agentic AI empowers defenders to prioritize risk and respond to attacks with speed and precision. We’ll examine the limits of traditional approaches, share insights into emerging cloud security trends, and show how AWS and CrowdStrike are bridging the gap with AI-powered defenses to level the playing field for security teams. This presentation is brought to you by CrowdStrike, an AWS Partner.

title: Reimagining Healthcare Access with Amazon One's Biometric Innovation
abstract: Discover how healthcare leaders are leveraging Amazon One's biometric technology to revolutionize patient check-in and staff authentication. This innovation creates friction-free experiences that improve operational efficiency throughout healthcare organizations. Industry executives will share how the technology enhances security and accuracy while allowing staff to focus on high-value patient care. Join us to learn from these leaders about their implementation journey and how Amazon One can transform your organization's daily operations.

title: Reimagining incident response with MCP on AWS
abstract: Enhance incident response with MCP-powered agents that understand your AWS platform context. In this session, you’ll learn how to build agents correlating symptoms across services, suggesting likely root causes, and automating initial remediation steps using Amazon EventBridge, AWS Lambda, and Amazon Bedrock.
