Discover how these agents deliver precise, real-time context to responders, enabling faster, more informed decision-making. Leave with proven patterns and a clear blueprint to dramatically reduce mean time to resolution (MTTR) in your AWS environments.

title: Reimagining life sciences supply chain with agentic-AI (sponsored by IBM)
abstract: Balancing quality sourcing, regulatory compliance, and cost efficiency are critical life sciences companies. Use AWS AI/ML and agentic AI to continuously monitor and optimize sourcing and procurement. This presentation is brought to you by IBM, an AWS Partner.

title: Reimagining Public Sector with AWS Partner generative AI solutions
abstract: Generative AI is reshaping how public sector organizations deliver on their missions. In this session, discover practical approaches to adopting GenAI securely and effectively, guided by solutions from AWS Partners. We’ll explore four key pathways: weaving AI securely into your organization, preventing data loss with trusted controls, accelerating adoption through embedded AI, and solving complex business problems with partner-built solutions. Whether you’re just getting started or looking to scale, you’ll gain a roadmap for harnessing generative AI to drive impact across your agency or institution.

title: Reimagining SIEM architecture using AWS S3 Buckets (sponsored by Vega)
abstract: Traditional SIEM architectures tightly coupled data storage and threat detection, often leading to high costs, slower queries, and limited flexibility. In this session, learn how to reimagine your SIEM design by decoupling detection from storage using Amazon S3. Discover how to keep AWS-native logs in S3 while centralizing additional telemetry, such as endpoint detection and response (EDR) events, in the same buckets. Explore how this approach improves incident response readiness, enables faster queries at lower cost, and supports threat hunting and detection across diverse data sources without moving logs outside AWS. This presentation is brought to you by Vega, an AWS Partner.

title: Reimagining Software Development and DevOps with Agentic AI (sponsored by GitHub)
abstract: We are infusing Agentic AI into the entire Software Development Lifecycle from brainstorming new ideas, implementing a plan, crafting new code, reviewing code reviews, releasing software, and bringing insights back to the development team. See how GitHub Copilot is being reimagined through this entire lifecycle to boost productivity across teams. This presentation is brought to you by GitHub, an AWS Partner.

title: Reimagining software with Bedrock agent powered middlewares (sponsored by Cybage Software)
abstract: If you ship software - as an enterprise or ISV, you are likely investing in reimagining your platform. Softwares need to embed agents not as bolt-ons but as fundamental building blocks of their platform. Leveraging AWS Bedrock, AgentCore, and MCP, Cybage is helping clients move from traditional generative chat to autonomous agents that actually work. Come see us cover real-world challenges such as long vs short term agent memory management, latency, and verifiable accuracy as we work towards moving humans out of the loop in 2026 powered by native AWS tooling. This presentation is brought to you by Cybage Software, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Reimagining software with Bedrock agent powered middlewares (sponsored by Cybage Software)

speakers.globalJobtitle: Vice President, Cloud, Data, and AI Practice

title: Reinforce large policy based authorization systems with Cedar Analysis
abstract: Cedar is a powerful open source solution for creating large-scale policy-based authorization systems. As policy systems expand, opportunities arise to enhance traditional testing approaches, addressing nuanced scenarios like Shadowed Permits, Impossible Conditions, Forbid Overrides, and Complete Denials. Customers seek robust assurance that access to their data remains secure and well-managed my policy changes are needed.

title: Reinventing credit origination process through AI (sponsored by Cloudera)
abstract: Credit is still a very laborious process in financial institutions. Join this session to hear from Cloudera industry expert Adrien Chenallier how firms can integrate reasoning models with agentic patterns to reach a credit decision efficiently. We will focus on ensuring compliance and implementing strategies to ensure potential errors are flagged for escalation, which is critical for financial institutions and other highly regulated industries managing sensitive data. This presentation is brought to you by Cloudera, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Reinventing credit origination process through AI (sponsored by Cloudera)

title: Reinventing Pharma Document Workflows to Unlock Value at Scale with Agentic AI (sponsored by ZS)
abstract: In pharma, document authoring isn’t just paperwork — it’s central to compliance, growth, and speed to market. From regulatory submissions to CMC and clinical content, authoring consumes vast resources. This session reveals how Agentic AI reimagines pharma document workflows: unlocking unstructured data, enabling intelligent authoring, and integrating compliance checks seamlessly. See how enterprises can cut cycle times, improve quality, and capture new growth by moving from manual writing to agent-led, value-driven authoring at scale. This presentation is brought to you by ZS, an AWS Partner.

title: Reinventing software development with AI agent
abstract: The rise of AI coding and autonomous agents is transforming how developers work - enhancing productivity, improving flow state, and making development more intuitive. While simple code completion tools have existed for years, today's agentic capabilities act as collaborative partners throughout the entire development lifecycle. Through real-world examples, we'll show how these AI tools and autonomous agents bring structure and engineering maturity to development, turning prototypes into production-ready applications while keeping developers in control. You'll learn how leading teams are using these capabilities to accelerate development cycles, reduce cognitive overhead, and focus on solving meaningful problems - fundamentally changing how we build software.

title: Reinventing the Retail Edge with YUM! Brands, AWS & Spectro Cloud (sponsored by Spectro Cloud)
abstract:
Innovation in global restaurants now goes beyond the menu. For YUM! Brands—parent of Taco Bell, KFC, Pizza Hut, and Habit Burger—digital experiences are key to customer satisfaction and operational excellence. But delivering these consistently across thousands of stores demands a new kind of architecture: modular, portable, and built edge-to-cloud.
In this joint session, leaders from YUM! Brands, AWS, and Spectro Cloud will share how they’re deploying next-gen edge platforms to support AI/ML workloads, boost uptime, and drive agility. Learn how AWS and Spectro Cloud enable centralized management, and scalable, production-grade infrastructure to bring innovation closer to customers—whether in retail, industrial, or remote settings. This presentation is brought to you by Spectro Cloud, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Reinventing the Retail Edge with YUM! Brands, AWS & Spectro Cloud (sponsored by Spectro Cloud)

speakers.jobTitle: Vice President, Global Reliability & Engineering Ops
speakers.globalJobtitle: Vice President, Global Reliability & Engineering Ops

title: Reinvent your DevOps workflows using Kiro
abstract: In this session, explore how Kiro's intelligent automation streamlines incident response, accelerates troubleshooting, and simplifies system maintenance. Through real-world examples, learn how teams reduce resolution times and enhance operational efficiency. Discover practical strategies for implementing AI-assisted DevOps practices that scale with your organization's needs.

title: Reliable AI at Scale: How Data + AI Observability Powers AI Products with AWS (sponsored by Monte Carlo)
abstract: AI success depends on trust. Yet too often, broken data, drifting models, and unpredictable failures undermine adoption and stall ROI. In this session, Peter Milligan, Head of Product Management at Monte Carlo, will share how companies like Fox, Nasdaq, American Airlines and others are partnering with AWS and Monte Carlo to deliver reliable, production-ready AI at scale. Discover how unified observability across data pipelines, models, and AI agents enables teams to detect and resolve issues faster, safeguard customer trust, and unlock real business impact. This presentation is brought to you by Monte Carlo, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Reliable AI at Scale: How Data + AI Observability Powers AI Products with AWS (sponsored by Monte Carlo)

title: Remote Access Patterns: AWS Verified Access and Client VPN
abstract: While traditional VPNs struggle to meet modern security demands, organizations need evolving remote access solutions. This interactive session demonstrates how AWS Verified Access and Client VPN address diverse enterprise application access patterns. Explore application-level versus network-level access approaches, covering AWS Verified Access's policy-based controls and new Connectivity Client for non-HTTP applications, alongside Client VPN's network connectivity and concurrent connection features. Learn about designing robust remote access solutions for your entire environment - from legacy systems to modern web applications. Gain knowledge about practical strategies for implementing seamless, secure access to your AWS resources.

title: Remove bottlenecks with an intelligent Amazon WorkSpaces dashboard
abstract: When faced with managing large, complex, multi-service environments, IT teams don't have time to manually troubleshoot problems and provision users. Now, you can build an Amazon WorkSpaces dashboard (powered by Amazon Bedrock) to automate environment analysis, troubleshoot issues with context-aware AI assistance, and accelerate provisioniong with natural language and AI-driven workflows. Through live demonstration and deployment blueprints, workshop attendees will learn how to build an intelligent dashboad that improves solution admin efficiency and time to issue resolution. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Resilience of AWS Cloud: Design patterns for availability
abstract: Explore how AWS Regions are designed and operated to achieve resilience beyond traditional data centers. Learn key architectural patterns that AWS services use to maintain operations through disruptions. Discover how service teams ensure continuous availability through sophisticated design principles and operational practices. Gain insights into the foundational patterns that enable mission-critical workloads to maintain availability at scale.

title: Resilience testing and AWS Lambda actions under the hood
abstract: As use of serverless technology grows, the resilience testing (also known as chaos engineering) for serverless becomes even more crucial for ensuring reliable and available applications. Join us as we demo new capabilities for testing the resilience of AWS Lambda-based workloads, and unpack how these faults were built and run under the hood. You'll also leave with valuable lessons gleaned from our customers' experiences with modern serverless applications.

title: Resilient and resourceful: Balance compute resiliency and costs
abstract: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling helps you maintain application availability and automatically add or remove Amazon EC2 instances using scaling policies that you define. In this chalk talk, dive deep into Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling innovations and best practices designed to increase the resiliency of your applications while meeting your cost-efficiency objectives. Learn how your deployment patterns and tools such as Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling instance maintenance policy and instance refresh rollback can help you achieve the exact balance of healthy compute capacity needed.

title: Rethinking DevSecOps with Platform Engineering That Actually Works
abstract: Many DevSecOps initiatives create bottlenecks despite promising faster, more secure delivery. In this interactive chalk talk, we'll collaboratively design a scalable DevSecOps blueprint that moves beyond checkbox compliance to enhance both security and velocity. Using real-world examples, we'll explore the DevOps-to-DevSecOps evolution, examine AWS's internal approach to security requirements, and uncover effective platform engineering patterns. You'll leave with a practical roadmap for making security a "paved road" and clear steps to launch your security platform initiatives—without getting bogged down in unnecessary complexity.

title: Revealing the northern lights: Amazon Aurora security deep dive
abstract: Researchers at the DEF CON 33 security conference shared that Amazon RDS successfully defended against their novel attack, despite the underlying open source database engine not releasing patches at the time. This is the result of years of consistent investment in security and isolation, enabling customers to focus on their applications instead of managing databases. We dive deep into the engineering and layered security architecture for Amazon Aurora, examining how multiple complementary layers including encryption, network controls, granular permissions, AWS IAM, active defense, and Amazon GuardDuty work together to protect customers' data from the infrastructure through the application interface.

title: Revolutionize customer care with data-driven generative AI
abstract: Imagine a world where every customer call is answered instantly, issues are resolved swiftly without any human intervention, and the entire experience feels personal and seamless. In this builders’ session, develop a fully automated generative AI assistant using Amazon ElastiCache, to provide an unparalleled customer experience at high speed. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Revolutionize media production: Field-ready cloud solutions
abstract: In this fast-paced session, discover how Amazon MGM Studios revolutionizes remote media production through an innovative collaboration with AWS and Rivian. We'll demonstrate our "Media to Cloud from Anywhere" solution, which combines Rivian's electric vehicles with AWS cloud services to transform daily footage uploads. In just 15 minutes, learn how this sustainable approach achieves 3x faster transfer speeds while significantly reducing carbon emissions. See real-world examples of how Digital Imaging Technicians use this system to streamline production workflows, and walk away with insights into the future of eco-friendly content creation.

title: Revolutionize public sector data governance with unified analytics
abstract: In this interactive chalk talk, discover how to strengthen data governance in regulated environments using Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. Learn practical strategies for building a unified data foundation that helps government organizations make data-driven decisions while maintaining compliance. We will set up domain structures, create centralized repositories, track lineage, and implement secure data sharing protocols that help reduce organizational silos. This session shows you how Amazon SageMaker can help streamline collaboration, optimize storage efficiency, and speed up model deployment in public sector environments. You'll gain actionable insights into establishing robust data governance frameworks that support both innovation and compliance requirements.

title: Revolutionize shopping: Inside Amazon's AI-powered 'Buy for Me' experience
abstract: Join this interactive session where we'll dive deep into the architecture of "Buy for Me," Amazon's autonomous shopping AI agent. Using whiteboard diagrams and real-world examples, we'll explore how we built and deployed this customer-facing solution using Amazon Bedrock, Titan, and Claude models. Through collaborative discussion, we'll break down our system design, integration patterns, and reliability strategies. Bring your questions as we sketch out autonomous purchasing workflows and quality assurance frameworks. This technical session includes hands-on architecture discussions and practical insights from our production implementation.

title: Revolutionizing Audi's Welding Inspection System through AI
abstract: Learn how Audi implemented an AI-powered quality control system, transforming a traditional welding inspection processes. The system analyzes 1.5 million weld points across 300 vehicles per shift, expanding upon previous manual ultrasound inspections that covered only 5,000 points per vehicle. This AI integration enables production staff to focus on addressing potential anomalies, significantly enhancing quality monitoring efficiency. Following its success, Volkswagen Group is expanding this technology across multiple sites, including Audi Brussels, VW Emden, and Audi Ingolstadt. The implementation process includes site-specific AI model retraining to accommodate varying welding parameters, demonstrating a scalable approach to manufacturing quality control optimization.

title: Revolutionizing multimodal data search with Amazon Q Business
abstract: Today’s enterprises deal with data in various formats, including audio, image, video, and text, scattered across different documents. Searching through this diverse content to find useful information is a significant challenge. This workshop explores how Amazon Q Business transforms the way enterprises search and discover data across multiple formats. By utilizing cutting-edge artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, Amazon Q Business helps enterprises navigate their content seamlessly. Find out how this powerful tool accelerates real-world use cases by making it easier to extract actionable insights from multimodal datasets.

title: Revolutionizing multimodal data search with Amazon Q Business
abstract: Today’s enterprises deal with data in various formats, including audio, image, video, and text, scattered across different documents. Searching through this diverse content to find useful information is a significant challenge. This workshop explores how Amazon Q Business transforms the way enterprises search and discover data across multiple formats. By utilizing cutting-edge artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, Amazon Q Business helps enterprises navigate their content seamlessly. Find out how this powerful tool accelerates real-world use cases by making it easier to extract actionable insights from multimodal datasets. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Ripple: Building an intelligent, multi-agent system for 24/7 operations
abstract: Financial institutions face challenges analyzing massive log volumes, requiring hours or days of manual review for critical incidents. Learn how Ripple is building an automated, multi-agent system using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and the Strands Agents framework to process 30-50GB of daily logs in minutes. Explore architectural patterns for integrating Amazon CloudWatch, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3, and Amazon OpenSearch to correlate log entries with codebase sections. Discover approaches for designing specialized agents that create conversational user interfaces for guided investigations. See how this system transforms blockchain operations and walk away with strategies for implementing a scalable foundation for building multi-agent applications.

title: Rivian & MongoDB: Powering the Future of Autonomous Driving (sponsored by MongoDB)
abstract: The future of transportation is here, and it’s powered by AI. Hear from Rivian on how they're building their autonomous driving platform with MongoDB Atlas and AWS. We'll show you how a unified data platform handles the massive scale—from millions of vectors today to a billion tomorrow. Discover the technical decisions and trust-building moments that led them to choose a single database platform to unlock the future of self-driving. This presentation is brought to you by MongoDB, an AWS Partner.

title: Robo-Reviewer: Building AI Video Evaluators with Bedrock
abstract: Video evaluation has traditionally been time-consuming, resource-intensive, and subjective. In this hands-on workshop, master the creation of an automated evaluation system using Amazon Bedrock. You'll build a complete pipeline that generates scenario-specific video prompts, crafts detailed assessment criteria through automated Q&A pairs, and implements objective quality evaluations using foundation models as intelligent judges. Learn to replace subjective human assessment with consistent, scalable automated metrics. Leave with a functional prototype capable of producing comprehensive evaluations of video content across diverse scenarios, powered by Bedrock's suite of foundation models.

title: Robust network security with perimeter protection and zero trust
abstract: Learn about comprehensive network security on AWS, focusing on integrating Amazon CloudFront, AWS WAF, Network Firewall, and Verified Access (AVA) for zero-trust architecture. Discover how AVA implements access controls for both HTTPS and non-HTTPS applications, providing secure workforce access. Through real-world examples and design patterns, learn AWS-recommended practices for application security and service integration. Gain practical insights for implementing zero-trust frameworks and enhancing organizational network security on AWS.

title: Rovio’s GenAI Journey: Game Asset Creation with AWS AI Stack
abstract: Explore how Rovio, the creator of Angry Birds, is reimagining game asset creation using AWS’s generative AI services. Learn how they built a custom image generation pipeline using SageMaker Training Jobs, EC2 g6e instances, and SageMaker Endpoints to accelerate content creation while preserving brand identity. The session will also highlight how Rovio uses Amazon Bedrock and Claude in adjacent creative workflows. With real examples from Angry Birds Dream Blast, discover how Rovio balances creative control, scalability, and production efficiency using a multi-service GenAI approach.

title: Run and Scale Agentic AI Applications in Production (sponsored by HashiCorp)
abstract: Scalable, reliable agentic AI applications need infrastructure that can build, deploy, and manage through a single, repeatable workflow. This session demonstrates how to use HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP) Terraform chain dependent infrastructure stages, keep post-run automations in Terraform, and bring unmanaged AWS resources under control using Stacks, Actions and Search & Import. We’ll also cover how, when Kubernetes is the application platform, HCP Vault fits seamlessly into workflows to strengthen security. Expect practical patterns you can apply to run agentic AI with confidence, safeguard sensitive data, and scale operations on AWS without unnecessary complexity. This presentation is brought to you by HashiCorp, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Run and Scale Agentic AI Applications in Production (sponsored by HashiCorp)
