session.title: Run and Scale Agentic AI Applications in Production (sponsored by HashiCorp)

title: Running compute efficient workloads on Amazon EKS Auto Mode
abstract: Amazon EKS Auto Mode, powered by open source Karpenter, simplifies infrastructure management while optimizing compute resources. Karpenter provisions Amazon EC2 Instances based on the requirements of your workload. In this hands-on workshop, you’ll gain practical experience in advanced workload scheduling, continually compute optimization with Karpenter consolidation, explore AWS Graviton and AWS spare capacity through Amazon EC2 Spot Instances. Whether you’re new to EKS Auto Mode, or an experienced operator you’ll learn best practices for running efficient workloads on Amazon EKS while simplifying Kubernetes cluster management.

title: Run real-time advertising workloads with unmatched cost-performance on AWS
abstract: Advertising technology (AdTech) companies need to buy, serve, and measure hundreds of billions of ads per day at single-digit millisecond latency. In this session, explore best practices and learnings for AdTech using purpose-built services. Discover how AWS can reduce cost and improve performance for scaled real-time advertising workloads. Learn how AWS helps customers move faster and spend less with the broadest set of solutions to migrate real-time advertising workloads, expand into new markets, and improve development velocity with cloud-native best practices and architectures. Hear AWS AdTech experts share customer stories and pitfalls to avoid when running ad platforms at scale.

title: Runtime + AI: Reinventing Cloud Security on AWS (sponsored by Upwind Security, Inc.)
abstract: Cloud adoption and AI innovation are accelerating risk in ways posture tools alone can’t solve. In this session, we’ll show how a runtime security fabric extends AWS-native services like Bedrock to secure AI workloads, unify posture management, and deliver real-time defense. Attendees will learn how combining DSPM, CSPM, and runtime insights helps reduce noise, prioritize what matters, and strengthen their AWS environments. The result is faster remediation, lower costs, and a security foundation built for the scale and speed of cloud-native and AI applications. This presentation is brought to you by Upwind Security, Inc., an AWS Partner.

session.title: Runtime + AI: Reinventing Cloud Security on AWS (sponsored by Upwind Security, Inc.)

title: SaaS Anywhere meets GenAI: Building distributed AI multi-tenant environments
abstract: Traditional SaaS models give providers complete infrastructure control, but many tenants now require AI solutions deployed within their own environments for enhanced data security and compliance. This hands-on workshop teaches participants how to implement "SaaS Anywhere" architectures for GenAI applications across diverse deployment scenarios—from fully provider-hosted to entirely tenant-controlled environments. Participants will learn practical deployment patterns and address key challenges including tenant lifecycle management, maintaining observability across distributed deployments, and ensuring system reliability. The workshop provides actionable strategies for SaaS providers who need to accommodate tenants requiring greater control over their data and compute resources.

title: Safeguard your generative AI applications with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails
abstract: Customize safeguards specific to your generative AI applications with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails while using any model in or outside of Bedrock. This interactive session will help you build safe and robust AI applications with the required safety controls towards content moderation, prompt attack protection, topic classification, PII redaction, and more. Learn how you can tailor these safeguards specific to your application and iterate as your requirements evolve, while providing a consistent and seamless experience. Join us as we will discuss real-world examples of you can use Bedrock Guardrails to achieve your goals with code samples and Q&A.

title: Safer, simpler, faster upgrades with managed blue/green deployments
abstract: Blue/green deployments for Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS simplify the process of upgrading and performing maintenance on your databases. In this chalk talk, you will architect a blue/green database upgrade solution to support major or minor engine version upgrades and perform schema changes with minimal and predictable downtime. Active participation is encouraged as you architect a solution to meet your requirements. In open discussion, learn the trade-offs involved in database management when using blue/green deployments and how to design the most effective upgrade solution to meet your needs.

title: Sandbox Magic: No Spells Required
abstract: Join us to discover Innovation Sandbox on AWS, a new solution designed to democratize cloud experimentation while maintaining control over resources and costs. Perfect for new AWS customers looking to build cloud competency, this session demonstrates how to create cost controlled, time-bound sandbox environments for your teams. Through live demonstrations, you'll learn how to deploy and configure the Innovation Sandbox solution using AWS Solutions Library templates, set up governance guardrails with customizable approval workflows, implement automated cost controls and account lifecycle management.

title: SAP analytics modernization: Zero ETL to AI-driven insights with AWS
abstract: Discover how to empower business users with real-time insights from SAP and non-SAP data without expensive ETL pipelines. This hands-on workshop teaches you to leverage a modern, cost-effective architecture that puts trustworthy data in users' hands. Key objectives include mastering AWS Glue SAP OData ZeroETL, harnessing Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio's Generative AI features, creating AI-driven business scenarios with Amazon QuickSight, and accelerating insight generation. You'll implement a flexible, scalable analytics solution that integrates SAP and non-SAP data. Ideal for business users, analysts, data engineers, and IT leaders seeking to unlock SAP data potential and leverage Generative AI technology.

title: SAP modernization at an Australian steel manufacturer (sponsored by Capgemini)
abstract: Our client faced inefficiencies and high costs due to a fragmented ERP landscape across SAP ECC instances on-prem and in Azure. Upgrades were complex, and lack of standardisation hindered agility. Under budget constraints, the CIO sought a cost-effective, multi-cloud transformation. Capgemini led a strategic SAP modernization aligned with RISE with SAP on AWS, consolidating workloads and securing partner funding to reduce costs. The solution balanced architectural complexity and hyperscaler dependencies. Outcomes included a self-funded model, reduced infrastructure costs, improved performance, and standardized processes. This enabled the client to shift investment from ERP maintenance to innovation and customer-focused initiatives. This presentation is brought to you by Capgemini, an AWS Partner.

title: SAP workloads on memory optimized EC2 instances
abstract: Traditional on-premises SAP HANA deployments require extensive planning and often force compromises between cost, time, and reliability. In this session, learn how EC2's memory optimized (R, X, U) instances eliminate these trade-offs, enabling rapid deployment of resilient SAP HANA infrastructure. SAP will share their experience managing thousands of systems through RISE with SAP on AWS, and you'll discover how our latest high memory instances can transform your SAP workload management.

title: Scalable and resilient distributed AI with Ray on SageMaker HyperPod
abstract: Join us to learn how to leverage Ray jobs on SageMaker HyperPod to build resilient, distributed AI workloads. Ray offers a unified programming model that allows you to seamlessly scale applications from a single machine to a distributed cluster while SageMaker HyperPod offers a resilient infrastructure. In this session, we will demonstrate the steps involved in running Ray jobs on HyperPod for handling dynamic workloads, maintaining high availability, and providing seamless recovery from node failures. We will go over the architecture and the process of creating a SageMaker HyperPod cluster, installing the KubeRay operator, and deploying a Ray training job.

title: Scale AI and agentic workflows with Amazon SageMaker AI
abstract: Are you looking for best practices to operate generative AI and agentic workflows at scale? Learn how to leverage Amazon SageMaker AI to accelerate model and AI agent development responsibly with comprehensive governance, observability, and control for reliable, cost-efficient systems in production. Discover how to use SageMaker HyperPod to deploy foundation models, implement model governance with Model Registry, and create repeatable and auditable AI workflows with SageMaker Pipelines, as well as leverage SageMaker AI Partner Apps like Comet ML, Fiddler, and Deepchecks for experiment management, observability, monitoring, and guardrails for responsible agent behavior.

title: Scale and Optimize your Solutions Globally with AWS Expansion Programs
abstract: This comprehensive session reveals how to build, scale, and optimize your software solutions globally through powerful integrations. Through technical deep-dives and real-world case studies, AWS ISV builders will share practical insights on Navigating regional compliance and regulatory requirements, implementing market-specific customizations, optimizing costs across different geographical deployments, Building resilient multi-region architectures. Whether you're a startup planning your first international move or an established ISV expanding into new markets, discover how AWS's Global Passport Program provides the tools, resources, and expertise to support your global growth journey while maintaining operational excellence and innovation at scale

title: Scale applications with Amazon EKS and AI-driven insights
abstract: This session explores how we leveraged Amazon EKS, Amazon S3, and Amazon SageMaker to build a resilient, AI-powered healthcare platform for remote patient monitoring. I’ll share how we migrated from Amazon ECS to Amazon EKS to achieve high availability, integrated ML models for personalized interventions, and optimized cloud costs by 20%. Attendees will gain practical insights into designing fault-tolerant microservices, applying AI in production, and enhancing developer productivity through automation pipelines - all grounded in real-world lessons from healthcare technology deployment at scale.

title: Scale & automate patching with AI-powered visualization
abstract: Monitoring patching compliance can be manual and time intensive. Discover how to streamline patch management using AWS Systems Manager and Amazon Q in this hands-on workshop. You will learn how to deploy automated patching solutions, configure compliance reporting, and simplify the creation of dynamic visualizations using natural language queries with Amazon Q. Through guided exercises in a live AWS environment, attendees will establish a patch baseline configuration, patch window scheduling, and real-time compliance monitoring. This workshop addresses key operational challenges including resource efficiency, compliance management, and infrastructure visibility.

title: Scale Customer Engagement with WhatsApp Business on AWS (sponsored by Meta)
abstract: Customers already rely on WhatsApp every day—now your business can meet them there. In this session, Meta and AWS leaders share how enterprises can quickly and securely set up WhatsApp Business through AWS End User Messaging. Learn how Delhivery, a leading logistics provider in India, uses WhatsApp to deliver time-sensitive updates that improve customer experience and trust. Attendees will leave with practical insights into how messaging can streamline operations, enhance engagement, and unlock new business value. This presentation is brought to you by Meta, an AWS Partner.

title: Scale intelligent analytics with Amazon Redshift multi-cluster architectures
abstract: Discover how to architect scalable, intelligent analytics solutions using Amazon Redshift's multi-cluster capabilities and serverless offerings. Through real-world examples learn to design cost-effective analytics systems that meet enterprise demands for performance, security, and compliance. Explore Redshift Serverless leverages ML to automatically provision and scale resources while enabling seamless data sharing across your organization. Master best practices for implementing multi-warehouse architectures, data mesh patterns, and SQL analytics optimization.

title: Scale modernization with agentic AI featuring Thomson Reuters
abstract: Join Thomson Reuters to discover how they leveraged agentic AI service to revolutionize their .NET modernization journey. In this session you will learn how they leveraged AWS Transform for .NET to modernize 5M lines of code monthly, achieving a 4x acceleration in development velocity. Learn how they reduced application transformation time from months to a single sprint while cutting operating costs by 30%. This session demonstrates practical implementation of parallel modernization at scale, featuring both web and IDE experiences, and shares insights on using AI-powered agents to dramatically reduce technical debt while maintaining security and performance.

title: Scale, optimize, and upgrade your Kubernetes cluster with Karpenter
abstract: Dive deep into Karpenter, the CNCF open-source project that serves as a flexibile, high-performance Kubernetes cluster autoscaler built with AWS. This advanced chalk talk explores Karpenter's scaling algorithms, and sophisticated node provisioning strategies. Learn how to implement complex scheduling constraints, optimize node selection using custom provisioners, and architect automated node upgrade strategies. We will examine use cases including multi-architecture workloads, spot instance handling, and performance tuning. Ideal for experienced Kubernetes operators and platform engineers.

title: Scale security monitoring using AWS CloudTrail with generative AI
abstract: This interactive chalk talk explores building enterprise-scale security monitoring using AWS CloudTrail. Participants will discuss how to design comprehensive security architectures that leverage VPC endpoint network events, AI-powered natural language queries, and unified compliance dashboards. The discussion covers practical challenges in filtering massive event volumes, correlating network and API activities across multi-account environments, and automating incident response. Attendees will share real-world security scenarios while the presenter diagrams solutions using enhanced filtering and generative AI features. Teams will leave with actionable strategies to transform raw event data into security intelligence that scales.

title: Scale Security Operations with AWS Security Incident Response Service
abstract: Ready to modernise your incident response? Learn how Infor accelerated their security operations using AWS Security Incident Response service. Through Infor's implementation journey, learn how to automate investigation and remediation while maintaining consistency at scale. We'll cover service integration with Security Hub and GuardDuty, automated playbook execution, and cross-account coordination. SOC teams will learn practical strategies for implementing automated workflows for containment and forensics collection. Walk away with implementation patterns to reduce response times while maintaining audit controls across your AWS environment.

title: Scale Trusted AI Adoption with Salesforce and AWS (sponsored by Salesforce)
abstract: Unlock powerful multi-agent workflows with Agentforce and AWS. Learn how to deploy Anthropic models on Amazon Bedrock to ensure compliant, secure AI adoption at enterprise scale. This presentation is brought to you by Salesforce, an AWS Partner.

title: Scale VMware migrations with Cloud Migration Factory & AWS Transform
abstract: Large-scale VMware migrations can be complex, but organizations require streamlined approaches to achieve their digital transformation goals. Learn to break free from resource-intensive migration processes and get hands-on experience on how you can automate your VMware migrations using AWS Transform and Cloud Migration Factory on AWS. In this workshop, you will learn by doing using proven patterns for automating discovery, testing, and cutover processes that can reduce manual effort by up to 90%. We'll explore real-world automation frameworks that simplified change control and enabled migration at scale while maintaining strict compliance standards. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Scale your contact center with Amazon Connect global telephony
abstract: In this chalk talk, discover how to leverage Amazon Connect's telephony network to build and scale your global contact center operations. Learn practical migration patterns for voice architecture, cost-effective transfer configurations between business units, and advanced in-app calling capabilities. You'll gain strategies for implementing a streamlined, worldwide contact center architecture that maximizes operational efficiency using the advanced telephony features of Amazon Connect.

title: Scaling Agentic AI in Multi-Tenant SaaS Environments
abstract: ISVs are often trapped in long development cycles to take agentic AI from concept to production due to complex multi-tenant requirements for LLM selection and SaaS integrations. Rapid model releases and evolving tools (via MCP) compound these difficulties. This chalk talk presents real-world insights from leading ISVs who successfully deployed agentic AI with model/tool flexibility serving thousands of customers and integrating with hundreds of SaaS partners. We’ll examine critical architectural decisions for building scalable and adaptable, yet opinionated solutions that satisfy diverse SaaS consumer and partner requirements, and share proven strategies to overcome multi-tenant deployment obstacles.

title: Scaling agent tools with AgentCore Gateway for enterprises
abstract: Unlock AI agent potential with this advanced session on scaling tools using AgentCore Gateway. Learn to build and manage secure, production-ready agent tool environments. We'll cover multi-tenant architecture, deployment strategies, and integration patterns for agentic tools. Explore zero-code MCP tools creation with intelligent tool discovery. You'll gain insights on security controls, monitoring, and performance optimization for enterprise-scale agent tool ecosystems.

title: Scaling AI Supply Chains: Search to Consumer-Driven Demand
abstract: Master architectures that leverage Agentic AI to bridge B2B and DTC supply chains through consumer-driven demand in this interactive chalk talk. We'll whiteboard autonomous agent systems processing 10K+ vector search queries per second for intelligent product discovery and hyper-personalization. Explore how to architect knowledge graphs connecting 1M+ relationships where agents transform customer signals into predictive inventory optimization with 95% accuracy. Tackle scaling challenges across neural search, agent-based demand sensing, and omnichannel fulfillment that deliver 60% faster product discovery and 50% reduced planning time. Prerequisites: AI/ML architecture experience, supply chain knowledge.

title: Scaling AI with confidence: From proof of concept to production (sponsored by Dynatrace)
abstract: From a proof of concept to scaling AI for top U.K. insurance brands, CDL’s journey highlights the challenges of deploying AI at scale while staying compliant, cost-effective, and trustworthy. This session covers their use of observability to track performance and risks, building guardrails for safe AI outputs, and strategies to scale without compromising cost, quality, or governance. Learn key lessons about the people and processes behind successful AI adoption. If you’re looking for practical insights to turn AI ideas into real impact, don’t miss this session.  This presentation is brought to you by Dynatrace, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Scaling AI with confidence: From proof of concept to production (sponsored by Dynatrace)
Scaling AI with confidence: From proof of concept to production (sponsored by Dynatrace)
Scaling AI with confidence: From proof of concept to production (sponsored by Dynatrace)

title: Scaling Amazon Redshift with a multi-warehouse architecture
abstract: Enterprise analytics platforms are undergoing a major transformation—from centralized, overloaded data warehouses to federated, governed, GenAI-ready multi-warehouse architectures. In this session, you’ll learn how to design your data warehouse architecture to scale with your business needs. We’ll explore the end-to-end architectural evolution from a monolithic Redshift cluster to a modern multi-warehouse architecture and the best practices to deploy them in a cost-effective manner.

title: Scaling Compliance Controls and Risk Assessment
abstract: Implementing effective data privacy controls and maintaining compliance with evolving regulations are key challenges in distributed technology landscapes. By using AWS Config as a source of resource metadata, organizations can have compliance monitoring, change tracking, and visibility into resource relationships across accounts and AWS Regions. Learn how to assess risk and enable AWS policies to integrate with AWS Audit Manager for evidence collection. The session equips risk owners and technical teams with practical tools for privacy management, compliance automation, and audit documentation, delivering immediate value for securing sensitive data environments.

title: Scaling Data Transformation w/ dbt & Nasdaq: Unlocking Ent Power Global Mkts (sponsored by dbt Labs)
abstract: As organizations expand into new markets, scaling data transformation capabilities while maintaining consistency and best practices becomes critical. In this session, Nasdaq shares how it is partnering with dbt to deliver enterprise-grade transformation tooling to their customers through an OEM approach. By embedding dbt Enterprise alongside Nasdaq’s library of best practices, macros, and reusable pipeline templates, customers can accelerate their data initiatives and build their own transformation workflows with confidence. Drawing from data mesh concepts, this joint presentation will showcase how clients can leverage standardized contracts and pipelines while tailoring solutions to their unique needs This presentation is brought to you by dbt Labs, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Scaling Data Transformation w/ dbt & Nasdaq: Unlocking Ent Power Global Mkts (sponsored by dbt Labs)

title: Scaling document intelligence: Advanced patterns with Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Enterprise document processing at scale requires robust patterns that handle diverse formats, ensure data quality, and maintain cost efficiency. This session explores advanced architectural patterns using Amazon Bedrock Data Automation for processing structured and unstructured documents across multiple domains. Learn how event-driven architectures can orchestrate document workflows, implement error handling and retry mechanisms, and optimize for cost and performance. Discover patterns for handling sensitive data, ensuring compliance, and building resilient pipelines that scale from thousands to millions of documents. Walk away with practical blueprints for enterprise document intelligence solutions.

title: Scaling enterprise data operations with Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio
abstract: Financial institutions struggle to manage, govern, and consume data access for operations across multiple business units. In this chalk talk, explore how Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio enables enterprise-scale data operations across multi-account environments. Learn practical approaches to implementing automated data governance frameworks while enabling secure access for hundreds of users across business units. Together, we'll design proven architectures for domain structures, metadata management, and compliance-driven approval workflows. Discover strategies for streamlining subscription workflows and managing cross-account access patterns that accelerate data exploration without compromising security standards.

title: Scaling foundation model inference on Amazon SageMaker AI
abstract: Learn how to optimize and deploy popular open-source models like Qwen3, GPT-OSS, and Llama4 using advanced inference engines such as vLLM on SageMaker. We'll explore key features including bidirectional streaming for audio and text applications, and share proven optimization techniques for inferencing. Through live demos, learn to boost performance with KV caching, intelligent routing, and autoscaling to maintain stability under varying loads. We'll demonstrate solutions for building Agentic workflows with SageMaker AI, LangChain, and AgentCore integration and share best practices helping you confidently move from prototype to trusted AI experiences that delight users.

title: Scaling GenAI on AWS Without Breaking the Bank through FinOps (sponsored by IBM Cloudability)
abstract: Generative AI is transforming industries—and AWS managed services are accelerating that shift—but these workloads can also be some of the most expensive and unpredictable to run. In this session, we’ll break down GenAI into four deployment modes and dive into key AWS services like Amazon Bedrock, SageMaker, and GPU-powered EC2 families, explaining how customers are charged and where the biggest savings lie. Drawing on real-world customer lessons, you’ll learn how to apply FinOps principles to boost GPU utilization, forecast spend, implement chargeback models, and track unit cost metrics—ensuring AWS GenAI workloads remain scalable and financially sustainable This presentation is brought to you by IBM Cloudability, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Scaling GenAI on AWS Without Breaking the Bank through FinOps (sponsored by IBM Cloudability)
Scaling GenAI on AWS Without Breaking the Bank through FinOps (sponsored by IBM Cloudability)

title: Scaling Global Energy Transformation: Kraken's AI-Powered Journey on AWS
abstract: Kraken Technologies, a subsidiary of Octopus Energy Group, has leveraged AWS to become one of the fastest-growing software platforms in the energy sector, currently serving 70 million consumers across 35 companies. This session will showcase how Kraken's cloud-native architecture on AWS has enabled rapid scaling and innovation. We'll dive into Kraken's pioneering use of generative AI, including their proprietary 'Magic Ink' system built on AWS services, like Amazon Transcribe and Amazon Comprehend, which now handles 50% of customer emails with an 80% satisfaction rate.

title: Scaling instantly to 1000 GPUs for Serverless AI inference (sponsored by Modal)
abstract: If you’re deploying generative AI models, you need a lot of GPU compute. But GPUs are expensive and production inference can be volatile. How can you maximize cost efficiency while also meeting customer demand? In this session, learn how Modal built a Rust-based container stack from scratch that can spin thousands of GPUs up and down in seconds. By leveraging AWS’s compute and storage products, Modal's platform is able to bring instant, flexible GPU access to ML engineers at companies big and small. This presentation is brought to you by Modal, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Scaling instantly to 1000 GPUs for Serverless AI inference (sponsored by Modal)

title: Scaling MONOPOLY GO! to 10M daily players with DynamoDB & ElastiCache
abstract: Curious how to scale a global gaming phenomenon with minimal to no resources? In this session, join Scopely to learn how they used Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon ElastiCache Serverless to power MONOPOLY GO!'s rapid growth, handling an incredible 2.1 million writes per second at peak traffic. Learn the architectural patterns and optimization strategies that enabled seamless matchmaking, friend discovery, and real-time gameplay for millions of concurrent users. Explore practical insights on managing unpredictable traffic spikes, reducing operational complexity, and achieving cost savings through serverless technologies.

title: Scaling multi-agent architectures: Patterns for mission-critical AI
abstract: Explore architectural patterns for building scalable, production-grade multi-agent AI systems on AWS. Learn to leverage Amazon Bedrock, DynamoDB, and Lambda to create robust agent architectures suitable for enterprise environments. Examine implementation strategies for agent specialization, efficient knowledge retrieval, and consensus mechanisms. Through practical examples using the Strands Agent SDK and MCP servers with Bedrock AgentCore, gain insights into key architectural decisions and trade-offs for successful multi-agent deployments. This session provides concrete guidance for architecting mission-critical AI systems at scale.

title: Scaling multi-tenant SaaS: Cell-based architecture patterns
abstract: Cell-based architectures provide optimal balance between complexity, efficiency, and flexibility in multi-tenant environments. Master the implementation of cell-based design patterns for SaaS workloads through hands-on exercises. Learn advanced techniques for provisioning, configuration, routing, and dynamic tenant sharding strategies. Discover how this architectural approach enhances SaaS solution tiering, scaling, and resilience. This expert-level workshop provides deep technical insight into building enterprise-grade multi-tenant architectures.

title: Scaling Multi-Tenant SaaS Delivery with Amazon CloudFront
abstract: Managing thousands of SaaS customer domains doesn’t have to be complex. In this session, discover how Amazon CloudFront SaaS Manager lets you deliver multi-tenant applications with speed, security - reducing operational overhead. See how to enforce security policies across every tenant, automate SSL/TLS provisioning with AWS Certificate Manager, and deliver branded, low-latency experiences worldwide. Hear from SalesForce on how they deliver secure, low-latency content globally, all managed through a single unified interface serving massive SaaS customer bases with speed, reliability, and efficiency.

title: Scaling Observability for the AI Era: From GPUs to LLMs (sponsored by Chronosphere)
abstract: AI workloads generate unbounded telemetry – spiky inference, massive GPU fleets, and complex orchestration pipelines. Observability strategies that worked for cloud-native applications often collapse under this scale, forcing teams into costly trade-offs between fidelity, performance, and spend. In this session, we’ll explore how observability needs evolve across the AI ecosystem – from GPU providers to LLM builders, AI-native platforms, and feature adopters. Attendees will learn practical strategies for ensuring reliability, controlling costs, and maintaining visibility across diverse AI infrastructures. This presentation is brought to you by Chronosphere, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Scaling Observability for the AI Era: From GPUs to LLMs (sponsored by Chronosphere)

title: Scaling observability with generative AI: Building automated patterns
abstract: Master the architecture of comprehensive observability solutions that scale across distributed systems using AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch. Learn practical patterns for implementing generative AI-powered instrumentation, machine learning-based anomaly detection, and multi-tenant cost allocation. Build hands-on experience with observability-as-code practices using Amazon Q for intelligent recommendations and automated implementation. Discover how to maintain operational excellence while accelerating observability adoption through AI assistance.

title: Scaling open source observability stack feat. Warner Bros Discovery
abstract: Organizations using open source observability software often face challenges in managing complex underlying infrastructure. In this session, discover how to leverage AWS managed open-source services including Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus, Amazon OpenSearch Service, Amazon Managed Grafana, and OpenTelemetry to solve these obstacles effectively. You will learn how Warner Bros. Discovery implemented open source observability using modern architectural patterns for ingesting and processing telemetry data at scale, while maintaining security, and cost efficiency to accelerate incident response.

title: Scaling Pinterest: Iceberg solutions for petabyte-scale challenges
abstract: Pinterest's management of petabyte-scale data lakes serving 500M+ users showcases innovative solutions for critical data challenges using Apache Iceberg on Amazon S3. You’ll learn practical strategies to optimize storage costs, enhance query performance, and maintaining data integrity at massive scale. See how Pinterest achieved breakthrough results, including significant error reduction through user agent-based access control and hash-based location patterns. These solutions demonstrate tangible business impact through substantial cost savings and performance improvements, making it essential for organizations managing large-scale data operations.

title: Scaling SaaS applications with cell-based architectures
abstract: Cell-based architectures offer a scalable, modular, and resilient foundation for modern web applications using repeatable deployment units to achieve scale while meeting security isolation. In this session, we will describe design patterns, tenant scaling, and inter/intra cell networking for SaaS delivery. Architects will gain actionable insights on cell routing, sizing, deployment, observability, and disaster recovery strategies.

title: Scaling Serverless with platform engineering: A blueprint for success
abstract: As serverless adoption grows, teams need consistent patterns for security, observability, governance, and CI/CD to avoid duplicating efforts and architectural inconsistencies.This session explores serverless platform engineering through a lens of architectural blueprints: a structured approach that promotes consistency while empowering teams to focus on core business value. Learn what constitutes a practical serverless blueprint, technically and culturally, and how Agentic AI assistants are transforming platform operations. Leave with actionable insights for scaling serverless adoption across your organization.

title: Scaling support, compliance, & productivity with conversational AI at Coinbase
abstract: Discover how Coinbase transformed customer support, compliance automation, and employee productivity using a unified AI platform powered by Amazon Bedrock. This multi-layered system integrates knowledge bases, real-time tool execution, and domain-specific AI agents to handle tens of thousands of interactions monthly. The platform enables fully agentic customer support, compliance and other productivity workflows, optimizes manual reviews, and improves productivity with intelligent task routing and seamless integration with Coinbase's tools. We'll examine its automated testing, performance metrics, and robust security measures, ensuring scalable and reliable operations.

title: Scaling to 1000s of containers in minutes with Amazon ECS
abstract: Effective autoscaling is critical for optimizing Amazon ECS cost and performance across your containerized workloads. This session explores comprehensive scaling strategies covering both at the application and compute layer. We'll examine application autoscaling techniques including target tracking policies, custom metric definitions, step scaling configurations, and predictive scaling capabilities. On the infrastructure side, you'll learn to leverage capacity providers and cluster autoscaling to dynamically manage compute resources. You'll discover how to implement scaling architectures that automatically respond to demand fluctuations while maintaining optimal resource utilization and minimizing costs across your containerized application portfolio.

title: Seamless and scalable creative and product visual generation
abstract: Amazon Nova Canvas and Nova Reel offer powerful image and video generation capabilities for enterprises needing scalable, personalized content while maintaining brand consistency. This chalk talk explores practical implementation architectures leveraging Nova Canvas' fine-tuning and virtual try-on features alongside Nova Reel's multi-shot video capabilities. We'll discuss AWS service integration patterns, cost optimization for high-volume production, and best practices to maintain safety, as well as host a Q&A to address your specific challenges. Through advertising, marketing, and retail use cases, discover how organizations accelerate creative workflows while maintaining quality.

title: Seamless file storage migration from on-premises to AWS
abstract: Learn how Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP and Amazon FSx for Windows fully managed file storage eliminates operational overhead while providing the scalability and reliability you need for file sharing, mission-critical databases, and high-performance computing. Through real-world examples, you'll explore proven approaches for migrating and optimizing various workloads—from user file shares and enterprise databases like Oracle, SAP, and SQL Server, to demanding AI/ML and electronic design automation workflows. Join us to understand how you can reduce costs, improve operational efficiency, and accelerate innovation by leveraging cloud-native file storage services that integrate seamlessly with your existing applications and tools.

title: Seamlessly Connect On-Premises to AWS
abstract: Learn how to bridge your on-premises infrastructure with AWS using VPN, Transit Gateway, and Direct Connect in this hands-on workshop. We guide you through the essentials of hybrid cloud networking, from secure VPN setup to scalable connectivity with Transit Gateway and high-performance links with Direct Connect. Discover best practices, architecture patterns, and troubleshooting tips to ensure seamless, secure, and reliable connections between your data center and AWS. Perfect for new AWS customers, this session will empower you to design and implement hybrid network solutions tailored to your organizational needs.

title: Seamless Network-based Fraud Protection for FinTech & Digital Business (sponsored by Vonage, Part of Ericsson)
abstract: Online fraud is no longer isolated — it’s industrialized, scalable, and relentless. From synthetic identities and account takeovers to payment scams and traffic pumping, today’s attacks are powered by crime-as-a-service tools that evolve faster than traditional defenses. FinTechs and Digital Businesses are under pressure to meet strict compliance requirements while delivering seamless, user-friendly experiences — yet every additional security check risks customer churn. The cost of failure is staggering: direct losses, missed revenue, and significant erosion of brand trust. This talk explores how mobile network intelligence adds an invisible, real-time layer of fraud protection, building brand trust while improving customer experiences This presentation is brought to you by Vonage, Part of Ericsson, an AWS Partner.

title: Secure AI Agent Access for Workflows on AWS Bedrock with 1Password (sponsored by 1PASSWORD)
abstract: As organizations develop AI agents, many are defaulting to using hardcoded credentials or long-lived secrets in order to enable workflows. With limited traceability, there’s no visibility into who or what accessed a secret, creating vulnerability and compliance risks. In this session, you’ll learn how to provide secure access to sensitive resources, such as APIs, databases, SaaS systems, and more, to AI agents running on AWS Bedrock. You’ll see how 1Password can act as a single-source-of-truth to deliver identity-aware, session-scoped, and policy-enforced secrets access for agents in AWS environments. With this approach, you can ensure secure, compliant, and scalable AI deployments. This presentation is brought to you by 1PASSWORD, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Secure AI Agent Access for Workflows on AWS Bedrock with 1Password (sponsored by 1PASSWORD)

title: Secure AI Agents Delivering Efficiency in Regulated Industries
abstract: Regulated industries demand more than AI deployment—they require secure, efficient, and measurable outcomes. Holland Casino modernized cloud operations with a multi-agent system using AWS Strands Agents SDK, orchestrating agents for security, cost optimization, and operations support with fine-grained permissions. Sicoob, Brazil’s largest credit union, transformed operations with AI agents and digital employees: achieving 80%+ case resolution, cutting document processing time by 25%, deploying 80 digital employees to save 440,000 hours and R$23M, and automating 85% of credit operations. In this session, you’ll learn how organizations securely scale AI to cut costs, streamline compliance, and modernize operations.

title: Secure Amazon ECS observability with CDK and Grafana
abstract: Observability is critical for running secure workloads. This session shows how to combine the AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK), Grafana, and OpenTelemetry to build an observability solution for Amazon ECS. Learn practical methods to detect anomalies, strengthen security posture, and improve developer productivity.

title: Secure and build apps in minutes with Amazon Verified Permissions
abstract: Learn how to implement robust  API authorization in applications within minutes using the new Amazon  Verified Permissions Express Toolkit. Move beyond complex, embedded  authorization logic that becomes unmanageable over time. In this hands-on  session, you'll build a secure API layer using policy-based authorization,  separating security concerns from business logic. By the end of this session,  you'll understand how to define fine-grained permissions using Cedar  policies, integrate with identity providers, and enforce consistent  authorization across your express.js application —all while writing minimal  code. Bring your laptop to participate.

title: Secure, Easy and Performant VPC Resource Connectivity with Tailscale (sponsored by Tailscale)
abstract: Connecting to private subnet resources inside a VPC is often complex, requiring VPNs, bastion hosts, or custom networking. In this lightning talk, we’ll show how Tailscale simplifies secure access to VPC resources with minimal setup. Learn how developers and services can connect to everything from AWS RDS to Lambda functions and beyond inside private VPC subnets without opening inbound security group rules or managing security infrastructure. We’ll cover how Tailscale leverages WireGuard®, identity-aware access, and standard AWS services to make connectivity both performant and secure - so you can focus on building, not networking. This presentation is brought to you by Tailscale, an AWS Partner.

title: Secure Generative AI using trusted execution environments
abstract: There are numerous implications to data privacy and intellectual property security in generative AI applications, here we will focus on solving for some of those using trusted executions environments (TREs). In this builders session you will create a TRE using an Amazon EC2 instance with NitroTPM enabled and run an LLM in it. Further you will configure a LLM Chat web application to cryptographically attest to the TRE. You will further learn about sealing, unsealing sensitive artifacts to the TRE.

title: Secure in milliseconds: Visa's AI-powered fraud defense on AWS
abstract: Discover how Visa revolutionized real-time payment security by leveraging AWS services, including AWS Nitro Enclaves, Amazon EKS, and Amazon MemoryDB, for their Visa Protect solution. This session explores Visa's journey to a rapidly scalable, cloud-based fraud detection solution. Learn how Visa processes massive volumes of sensitive financial data with ultra-low latency while maintaining stringent security standards. We'll dive into the multi-region architecture, real-time AI/ML fraud detection on Amazon EKS, and compute-level isolation that allowed Visa to achieve sub-250 millisecond fraud detection latency and 99.99% availability. Join us to uncover the blueprint for secure, AI-driven payment risk scoring.

title: Securely extend Amazon Q Business applications using APIs.
abstract: In this chalk talk we will explore the infrastructure necessary for building a customized, end-to-end application that uses Amazon Q Business. Learn how to authenticate a user via an identity provider, exchange identity tokens with AWS IAM Identity Center to obtain identity-aware credentials, and interact securely with the Amazon Q Business APIs.

title: Securely monetize your data with Amazon Redshift
abstract: Transform your payment data from cost center to revenue driver through advanced AWS analytics with Amazon Redshift and AI services. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how payment processors can build sophisticated data monetization platforms to generate new revenue streams while maintaining PCI DSS compliance

title: Secure user code execution with AWS Lambda for SaaS platforms
abstract: Modern SaaS platforms increasingly allow customers to upload custom code snippets for platform customization, but executing untrusted code presents significant security challenges. Join this interactive session to explore architectural patterns for secure code execution using AWS Lambda. We'll examine how Lambda's isolation mechanisms and ephemeral runtime environment create robust security boundaries for untrusted code. Through collaborative whiteboarding, we'll design solutions covering invocation patterns, multi-tenant isolation models, security controls, and operational best practices. Bring your architecture challenges as we dive deep into compute isolation, IAM configurations, and sandbox implementation techniques for building secure, scalable code execution environments.

title: Secure your cloud networks with Amazon VPC Block Public Access
abstract: In this workshop, explore how the security feature Amazon VPC Block Public Access (BPA) controls internet access to VPC resources across AWS accounts. Through five hands-on labs, participants will learn how to implement and manage BPA's bidirectional and ingress-only modes, create strategic exceptions, and analyze network traffic. The course progresses from basic connectivity to advanced BPA configurations, teaching security analysts and network engineers how to effectively balance network accessibility with robust security measures. By the end, you will perfect skills in VPC BPA implementation for enhanced cloud network protection.

title: Secure your data in a BYOD world with WorkSpaces secure browser and AppStream
abstract: Monitoring and protecting sensitive enterprise data is getting harder: web-delivered applications have become prime exfiltration targets across industries like FSI, healthcare, and support operations as hybrid work and BYOD broaden access paths and complicate control. With Amazon WorkSpaces Secure Browser as a secure, isolated browser and Amazon AppStream 2.0 for pixel-streamed application delivery, AWS helps keep your data in the cloud and enforce tight control, while allowing your end users the freedom to work from anywhere using any device. In this session, you will learn how to provision and configure these services as modern security solutions for your organization.

title: Securing Agentic AI: OWASP, MAESTRO, and Real-World Defense Strategies
abstract: Explore the latest in Agentic AI security with OWASP's updated Threats and Mitigations Guide and Agentic Security Initiative. We will also explore MAESTRO, a specialized threat modeling approach for AI systems, offering a layered methodology to identify and mitigate risks throughout the AI lifecycle. Through a real-world case study, we'll demonstrate security best practices for agentic AI, including robust governance, continuous monitoring, and least-privilege access. Learn how to confidently deploy autonomous AI agents while minimizing risks. Gain practical insights for building secure, trustworthy, and resilient agentic AI applications that can transform industries safely.

title: Securing AI Agents: SailPoint's Journey with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
abstract: As enterprises rapidly adopt AI agents, managing agent identities across environments becomes a critical challenge. SailPoint, a leading identity security ISV serving 85% of Fortune 500 companies, is leveraging Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to transform their product into a comprehenhensive AI agent governance solution. This session demonstrates how SailPoint built a scalable security control plane for AI agent management, addressing enterprise-grade discovery, permissions, and audit requirements. ISVs will learn implementation patterns, API integration strategies, and architectural best practices for enhancing their products with robust AI agent governance capabilities using AgentCore, enabling secure AI adoption at scale.

title: Securing AI Agents: The Future of Identity & Access Control (sponsored by WorkOS)
abstract: As AI agents transform enterprise software, securing them with robust identity and access management is critical. Traditional models of authentication and authorization often fail when agents act across multiple systems and data sources. Drawing on WorkOS’s experience with SaaS and AI companies, this session explores risks of unchecked agent behavior, compliance challenges, and the need for first-class agent identities. We’ll discuss emerging approaches such as persona shadowing, delegation chains, capability tokens, and human-in-the-loop escalation, alongside evolving standards like OAuth, OIDC for Agents, GNAP, and verifiable credentials. Attendees will gain practical frameworks and insight for building safer, scalable agentic systems. This presentation is brought to you by WorkOS, an AWS Partner.

title: Securing AI agent workflows: Identity patterns in AgentCore
abstract: As generative AI agents take on more complex tasks, the need for secure, contextual identity becomes critical. In this chalk talk, dive into Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Identity, the foundational building block that enables secure, auditable, and role-aware execution for AI agents. We'll sketch out real-world scenarios and work together to solve common identity challenges in AI agent applications. We'll explore modeling agent personas, architecting secure authentication flows, and integrating with existing identity systems. Attendees will leave with a reference architecture and best practices for embedding identity into their agent-based applications.

title: Securing Amazon ECS workloads with application-aware networking
abstract: In this workshop, learn how to build, secure and monitor networking traffic for containerized microservices. Dive deep into service-to-service communication patterns with both Amazon ECS Service Connect and Amazon VPC Lattice. You will also learn how to encrypt data using end to end TLS as well as how to restrict user access. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Securing Amazon Q Business applications with APIs
abstract: Learn how to securely extend Amazon Q Business applications using APIs. In this workshop, build a single-page web application along with the infrastructure necessary for user authentication via an identity provider. The application will exchange identity tokens with AWS IAM Identity Center to obtain identity-aware AWS Signature V4 credentials. These credentials will then be used to securely interact with the Amazon Q Business APIs. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Securing and observing Amazon EKS clusters
abstract: In this hands-on session, explore how to automate the identification, analysis, and mitigation of risks in Amazon EKS clusters. Learn how to implement robust security controls—including role-based access control (RBAC), EKS Pod Identity, and service accounts—to apply least-privilege access and secure workload isolation. Discover how to use AWS CloudTrail and Amazon CloudWatch to gain deep visibility into EKS cluster activities, enabling real-time monitoring and automated risk detection. You will learn the skills to automate risk management processes, helping your Kubernetes workloads remain resilient against evolving threats.

title: Securing and optimizing your software supply chain with Amazon ECR
abstract: Raise the bar on your software supply chain security with AWS. In this chalk talk, we will discuss DevOps security best-practices, threat detection and incident response for containers, and how to leverage AWS security services including Amazon ECR, Amazon GuardDuty, and Amazon Inspector to protect your Amazon EKS workloads. Discover how you can ensure CVE patching while optimizing storage to accelerate image delivery through seamless integration with open-source tools for publishing and deploying containerized workloads at scale. Learn how to efficiently streamline your software supply chain while mitigating risks.

title: Securing data for your AI workloads with tokenization (sponsored by Capital One)
abstract: Enterprises often withhold sensitive data from AI models due to risk, which can result in limited business insights. This session explores how tokenization can address this challenge by securing training and response data, which renders the data useless to unauthorized access and potential exposure while preserving its analytical value. Attendees will gain insights from Capital One’s large-scale tokenization implementation, along with actionable strategies, architectural patterns, and implementation blueprints for applying tokenization within complex AWS environments. You'll leave with actionable guidance for securing diverse AI-driven use cases at scale. This presentation is brought to you by Capital One, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Securing data for your AI workloads with tokenization (sponsored by Capital One)
Securing data for your AI workloads with tokenization (sponsored by Capital One)

title: Securing Data Lakes: From Ingestion to AI Analysis
abstract: Data lakes require comprehensive security controls throughout their lifecycle, particularly for AI/ML workloads. This session provides hands-on experience implementing end-to-end security for AWS data lake architectures. Learn to configure secure data ingestion patterns, implement automated classification, and establish dynamic, fine-grained access controls. Through practical exercises, discover how to implement data lake security controls that enable innovation while maintaining appropriate governance.

title: Securing event-driven architectures: from sync to async security
abstract: The shift from synchronous to asynchronous communication fundamentally transforms security requirements. Learn how to protect event buses from common attacks such as poison pill messages, denial of wallet attacks or message replay exploits. Through live coding, we'll demonstrate how to secure decoupled producers and consumers while maintaining confidentiality, integrity and availability of our event driven systems. You will leave with a comprehensive framework for building secure and resilient event-driven architectures using AWS services.

title: Securing Generative AI agents using AWS Well-Architected Framework
abstract: This advanced lab teaches developers to build secure generative AI agent solutions using Amazon Bedrock Agents, following AWS Well-Architected Framework's Generative AI Lens. Learn to implement endpoint security, monitor agent interactions with CloudWatch, and control agent permissions. Implement security controls, monitoring, and safeguard agents against unauthorized actions. Ideal for developers wanting to build secure AI agent implementations.

title: Securing IoT Workloads with AWS IoT Lens and AWS Security Reference Architecture
abstract: Today’s industrial environments are enabling new levels of connectivity, automation, efficiency, and real-time data insights. However, this increased connectivity also introduces significant security challenges. Unaddressed security concerns can expose vulnerabilities and slow down companies looking to accelerate digital transformation leveraging IoT and Cloud. This chalk talk explores relevant techniques, architecture patterns, best practices and AWS security services for securing complex OT/IT environments, IoT devices, edge and cloud using the AWS Well Architected IoT Lens and AWS Security Reference Architecture (SRA).

title: Securing the AI Era: From Hype to Real-World Defense (sponsored by Zscaler)
abstract: As organizations race to embrace AI, the question is no longer if AI will transform security and business operations, but how leaders can harness it responsibly and effectively. This session explores the latest attacker innovations powered by AI, and the defensive strategies security teams must adopt to stay ahead. You’ll gain insight into the real-world challenges enterprises face in managing AI risk, balancing productivity with protection, and ensuring trust in rapidly evolving systems. Through practical examples and forward-looking analysis, we’ll cut through the hype to reveal the tangible ways AI is reshaping cybersecurity and enterprise resilience. This presentation is brought to you by Zscaler, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Securing the AI Era: From Hype to Real-World Defense (sponsored by Zscaler)

title: Securing your network perimeter through observability
abstract: Enhance your AWS security posture by monitoring  Amazon VPC activity using AWS CloudTrail and Amazon CloudWatch. In this hands-on workshop, build a comprehensive security monitoring solution for your VPC perimeter. Learn to capture and analyze VPC activity, then create powerful dashboards, metrics, and alerts for deep visibility into activity patterns. Gain practical knowledge in setting up automated security controls, creating custom metrics for activity analysis, and implementing alert mechanisms to detect potential risks using AWS native services. Walk away with the skills to strengthen your cloud security through improved observability and proactive monitoring.

title: Security Compliance & Hardening with EC2 Image Builder
abstract: Discover how to leverage EC2 Image Builder to create secure, compliant, and hardened AMIs. Learn to automate security baseline implementation, including CIS benchmarks. We'll demonstrate building compliance checks into Image Builder pipelines, integrating vulnerability scanning, and implementing automated testing for regulatory standards.

title: Security posture and exposure management using AWS security services
abstract: Join this hands-on deep dive to learn how AWS Security Hub and Amazon Inspector can work together to help you strengthen your security posture and streamline security operations across your entire AWS environment. We'll show you how AWS Security Hub performs security best practice checks, aggregates alerts, supports automated remediation, and provides a comprehensive view of your security state in AWS. Explore how Amazon Inspector continually scans Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2), AWS Lambda functions, and container workloads for software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure.

title: See The Future of Cloud Defense: Agentic Cloud Security (sponsored by Sysdig)
abstract: With too much data, too little context, and not enough time, cloud security leaders and practitioners struggle to identify and resolve real business risk. Agentic AI is changing the game. Intelligent agents that think, reason, and act on your behalf take on the complexity so you can focus on what really matters. In this talk, see how Sysdig Sage™ helps secure your AWS cloud like an AI-powered teammate that reasons about business context to drive better outcomes. You'll get a firsthand look at how Sysdig accelerates risk identification and remediation, with a live demo of agentic cloud security in action. This presentation is brought to you by Sysdig, an AWS Partner.

title: Select and launch the right instance for your workload and budget
abstract: This session covers the latest compute innovations such as the new generation of Amazon EC2 instances powered by custom Intel Xeon Scalable processors (Granite Rapids), AMD EPYC processors (Turin), and AWS Graviton. Learn how to determine which instance is best for your specific use case and budget.

title: Serverless cost optimization: More from every invoke
abstract:
"In this interactive chalk talk, we'll dive deep into practical strategies for optimizing AWS Lambda and AWS Step Function costs while maintaining performance. We'll explore how processor architecture selection, memory configuration, and execution patterns can significantly reduce costs.

Join us to learn how to leverage event filtering, implement effective batching strategies, optimize the Init phase, and architect cost-effective workflows using Step Functions. Bring your questions as we'll dedicate ample time to addressing your specific serverless cost optimization challenges."

title: Serverless data processing with AWS Lambda and Apache Kafka
abstract: Learn how to easily process data on an Apache Kafka stream using AWS Lambda in this hands-on Builders Session. You will use Lambda's built-in support for Kafka as an event source to process streaming analytics data and publish it to a live dashboard. Learn practical skills for tuning data processing workloads across Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK) and self-managed Kafka clusters. Understand how to effectively handle errors and automatically retry failed jobs. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Serverless Observability: Best Practices for AWS Distributed Systems
abstract: Want better visibility into your distributed serverless systems? In this chalk talk we'll demonstrate practical solutions for common observability challenges in distributed serverless applications. We'll tackle common pain points like request tracking across services, performance optimization, and error correlation. Through a retail application example, you'll learn how to implement comprehensive tracking across AWS serverless services, enabling you to maintain reliable and performant applications.

title: Serverless Optimization: Balancing Cost, Throughput & Latency
abstract: While serverless architectures can be optimized for cost, throughput, latency, and reliability, it is not possible to optimize for all factors simultaneously. Organizations must prioritize based on workload requirements. This session provides guidance on key decisions, such as selecting the right compute options and choosing between message and stream processing. Learn about cell-based architectures and how to identify critical, latency-sensitive components. Discover practical approaches for building serverless systems that balance competing demands while maintaining operational excellence

title: Serverless patterns for large-scale applications with AWS Lambda
abstract: In this code talk, learn how to manage large-scale serverless architectures. As Lambda functions multiply, organizations struggle with project organization, code reusability, dependency management, and maintaining consistent deployments across environments. See a live coding session on how to organize multi-function codebases, implement cross-function reuse, and establish standardized deployment pipelines. Leave this talk with battle-tested techniques to immediately improve your team’s serverless development practices and confidently scale your Lambda applications.

title: Serverlesspresso: Build an event-driven application from the ground up
abstract: In this workshop, build a fully event-driven, serverless coffee-ordering web application using AWS Lambda, Amazon EventBridge, AWS Step Functions, and more. Learn to design scalable architectures through orchestration and choreography as you simulate customers placing orders and baristas managing them in real time. Discover best practices for integrating serverless services and handling real-world workflow challenges. This session is ideal to deepen your understanding of event-driven serverless design on AWS. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: ServiceNow and AWS: Powering AI-driven workflows on the cloud built to scale (sponsored by ServiceNow)
abstract: Learn how ServiceNow and AWS help enterprises transform with AI-driven workflows at scale. Running ServiceNow on AWS enables performance, compliance, and residency while maximizing AWS investments. See how AWS Bedrock, SageMaker, IoT, and Security Hub integrate with ServiceNow’s AI Agent Fabric and AI Control Tower to orchestrate intelligent, governed agents across the enterprise. We’ll share real-world customer examples, co-developed solutions, and AWS Marketplace integrations that accelerate time-to-value. Discover how this partnership delivers innovation, efficiency, and resilience—helping organizations move faster, lower costs, and unlock new opportunities. This presentation is brought to you by ServiceNow, an AWS Partner.

session.title: ServiceNow and AWS: Powering AI-driven workflows on the cloud built to scale (sponsored by ServiceNow)

speakers.jobTitle: AVP, Global Head of AWS Business, ServiceNow

session.title: ServiceNow and AWS: Powering AI-driven workflows on the cloud built to scale (sponsored by ServiceNow)

title: Service-oriented builders guide to agentic AI: Insights from WEX
abstract: Large language models and agentic tools have reached enterprise viability, with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) principles providing the foundation for robust agentic systems. This session examines which SOA design principles translate directly to generative AI implementations and which require rethinking for agent orchestration and nondeterministic behaviors. Learn architectural patterns for secure AI service integration, tools for enterprise-scale agent deployment, and techniques for building agents that work seamlessly with existing ecosystems. WEX demonstrates how extending SOA into the agentic domain enables generative AI solutions to deliver enterprise-grade operational support at scale. Gain practical insights into combining SOA best practices with modern AI architecture requirements.

title: Shared responsibility: leadership lessons from active defense of the cloud
abstract: Navigating uncharted waters in AWS security demands more than technical expertise—it requires masterful leadership in high-stakes environments. Join us to explore critical lessons learned while building a threat detection and response organization at scale. Learn concrete strategies for fostering psychological safety while maintaining high standards, balancing experimentation with risk management, and evolving from technical expert to transformational leader. Discover practical approaches to metrics design, delegation in technical domains, and creating a culture of ownership. Whether you're scaling a security program or leading technical teams, these battle-tested insights will help you navigate the complex intersection of people, technology, and security leadership.

title: Shell's HPC Evolution: Accelerating Seismic Processing with AWS GPU Innovation
abstract: Explore Shell's transformative journey in hybrid HPC computing, combining on-premises systems with AWS GPU capabilities for seismic processing and AI applications. The evolution from CPU-based processing to advanced GPU implementations represents a critical advancement in energy sector computing. Learn how this hybrid approach achieved 3-5x project acceleration while maintaining cost efficiency, including migration of Shell's processing code to AWS, implementation of GPU-based Full-Waveform Inversion workflows, and significant cost reductions in non-EC2 services. Gain insights into the latest developments in capacity block services, transitions to H200 GPUs, and the future of energy sector HPC through Amazon Parallel Computing Service and Energy HPC Orchestrator platforms.

title: Shuffle, Scale, Succeed: Optimizing Spark Performance on Amazon EKS
abstract: Running Apache Spark on Amazon EKS delivers scalability, but poor defaults can drive up costs and slow pipelines. This ChalkTalk highlights the top Spark performance challenges and production-proven fixes. Learn how Apache Iceberg reduces query times with metadata pruning, how DataFusion Comet accelerates Spark SQL by ~2.4x, and how Gluten with Velox delivers up to 3x gains. We will compare Comet and Gluten, demonstrate Apache Celeborn for remote shuffle scaling, and share EKS optimizations including custom batch schedulers, dynamic scaling with Karpenter, and Spark DRA. Data teams will receive a practical playbook on implementing faster and more cost-effective Spark workloads.

title: Simplified Data Lake Access with AWS Identity Center
abstract: AWS Trusted Identity Propagation simplifies data access  management in large organizations by seamlessly integrating with enterprise  identity providers like Okta and Azure AD. It eliminates complex AWS role  configurations while providing granular control down to table and column  levels across major AWS data tools including Athena, EMR, and Redshift. This  centralized solution maintains detailed access logs for compliance and audit  purposes, reducing time spent on access management and enhancing data protection.  Organizations can maintain clear visibility of data usage patterns—all  managed from a single location. The result is a streamlined approach that  maintains strong security controls while simplifying administration across  AWS services.

title: Simplify Amazon WorkSpaces management through automation
abstract: Amazon WorkSpaces provides a number of automation capabilities that help administrators maximize efficiency and productivity when managing their virtual desktop environments. In this hands-on builders� session, you will learn how to optimize management of WorkSpaces Family services at scale with scripts and other workflows. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Simplify backup for stateful Amazon EKS workloads
abstract: Protecting persistent data in Amazon EKS environments presents unique challenges. This lightning talk demonstrates practical approaches for backing up stateful workloads using AWS services. Learn how to configure backup policies for persistent storage used by containerized applications, automate protection schedules, and establish efficient restoration workflows. Discover strategies to enhance data protection and simplify management while maintaining a fully AWS-native infrastructure. This demonstration is ideal for teams looking to optimize their Amazon EKS backup strategies using AWS services.

title: Simplify cloud infrastructure creation with the AWS CDK
abstract: AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) is an open source software development framework for defining cloud infrastructure in code and provisioning it through AWS CloudFormation. In this chalk talk, we’ll explore AWS CDK and how it can simplify infrastructure creation. Through code examples and diagrams, see how AWS CDK lets you use familiar programming languages for declarative infrastructure definition. Learn about the levels of the CDK constructs and how to use powerful higher-level abstractions to provision complex application architecture.

title: Simplify development workflows with agentic capabilities
abstract: Amazon Q Developer's agentic coding experience transforms how developers build software. By using natural language understanding, Q Developer can intelligently perform multi-step tasks that go beyond code generation with minimal human intervention by automatically reading project files to build context, generating code diffs, and running shell commands. Join this session to discover how the new agentic coding experience helps developers go from planning to getting new features in front of customers even faster.

title: Simplify discovery and deployment of software with AWS Marketplace
abstract: Discover how AWS Marketplace simplifies access to third-party software and tools across your entire infrastructure. In this session, explore the diverse delivery methods AWS Marketplace offers, including SaaS solutions, Amazon Machine Images (AMIs), containerized applications, and API-based agents. Learn how to efficiently discover products available globally, select flexible pricing models that fit your needs, and streamline spend management across your organization. See firsthand how AWS Marketplace accelerates your modernization and migration initiatives by providing enterprise-ready solutions exactly where and when you need them.

title: Simplify fraud investigation with Strands Agents and Amazon Nova Sonic
abstract: Fraud detection is evolving with AI agents and voice interfaces to make investigation more intuitive and effective. This session demonstrates how financial institutions can leverage AI agents to autonomously analyze complex fraud patterns while streamlining user interactions through voice interfaces. Explore how Strands Agents simplifies building voice-based detection solutions to identify fraudulent activities and fraud rings through pattern recognition and relationship mapping using Amazon Neptune and Amazon Nova Sonic. Attendees will learn how AI agents can break down complex workflows, access fraud detection tools, and adapt their actions based on context and memory.

title: Simplifying data interoperability with the lakehouse architecture on AWS
abstract: Apache Iceberg is designed for interoperability across compute engines without the need for data duplication or format conversions. Amazon SageMaker's lakehouse architecture simplifies data interoperability through its shared metadata capabilities and support for the REST API specification. The lakehouse architecture delivers the flexibility to access and query your data, stored across Amazon S3 data lakes and Amazon Redshift. In this session, we will explore how Amazon S3 Tables and  Apache Iceberg come together to build an open lakehouse architecture that seamlessly works with multiple compute engines on AWS.

title: Simplifying multicloud developer experience, feat. Macquarie
abstract: Developing applications across multiple clouds creates unique challenges: fragmented tooling across cloud providers and complex environment-specific configurations. Macquarie Group simplified their developer experience by creating a Developer Environments as Code platform that provides a unified development experience across all cloud environments. This internal solution combines enterprise security and developer flexibility, enabling teams to use their preferred IDEs while maintaining organizational standards. Additionally, it reduces environment setup from days to minutes and ensures consistent deployments across multicloud environments.

title: Simplifying Multi-Tenant SaaS Delivery with CloudFront
abstract: Join this hands-on workshop to master Amazon CloudFront SaaS Manager, the fully managed solution for multi-tenant CDN operations. You�ll configure and deploy SaaS-enabled distributions, onboard and isolate tenants, and apply custom domain mappings - all through guided labs. Learn to automate tenant provisioning, enforce security controls, and monitor performance and usage metrics in real time. By the end of the session, you�ll have practical experience streamlining your SaaS delivery workflows and accelerating application rollout. Bring your laptop and get ready to build!

title: Simplifying orchestrations with JSONata and AWS Step Functions
abstract: Learn how to transform your workflows with AWS Step Functions and JSONata. This session demonstrates how to simplify your orchestrations and perform sophisticated data transformations directly within your state machines without additional AWS Lambda functions or compute resources. Through live examples, discover how this approach reduces costs and optimizes resource utilization.

title: Simplifying security and operations through smart resource tracking
abstract: In today's growing AWS environments, organizations need to maintain clear visibility and control over their cloud resources. This session demonstrates how to gain deeper visibility into your AWS environments by combining AWS CloudTrail Lake event enrichment with strategic resource tagging. Through guided exercises, learn how to implement automated workflows and meaningful dashboards that enhance security investigations and compliance auditing. Discover practical techniques for improving resource management across your organization.

title: Simplify secure file sharing with Transfer Family no-code web apps
abstract: Traditional file transfer solutions often require complex client software, custom scripts, or technical expertise, creating barriers for business users who need to share data. Learn how AWS Transfer Family's web apps enable secure, browser-based file transfers that automatically trigger your data processing workflows. In this session, we'll show you how to build automated pipelines that process files as soon as they're uploaded, while maintaining enterprise-grade security through flexible authentication options for internal and external users. You'll discover how to use Transfer Family web apps to streamline file ingestion, kick off data validations, and orchestrate downstream processing... starting with a simple drag-and-drop interface for your end users.

title: Simplify serverless testing using Amazon Q Developer
abstract: In this builders' session, discover how Amazon Q Developer streamlines testing for serverless workflows. Starting with an AWS Step Functions state machine and storage integration, use agentic AI and specification-driven development to generate unit and integration tests. Explore validation of input and output payloads, error handling, and state transitions, all guided by Amazon Q Developer. You'll leave with a tested workflow and a repeatable approach for scaling best practices across serverless applications.

title: Simplify Tenant Authorization with Cedar and Amazon Verified Permissions
abstract: Enterprise customers demand customizable authorization controls in multi-tenant SaaS applications, making tenant isolation and security policies a critical challenge for ISVs. Learn how ISVs implement fine-grained authorization while maintaining a unified codebase using Cedar policies and Amazon Verified Permissions. Working directly with an AWS expert, you'll build tenant-aware authorization supporting complex enterprise requirements - like custom roles, delegated administration, and tenant-specific security policies - all while keeping authorization logic separate from application code.

title: Simplify your Kubernetes journey with Amazon EKS
abstract: Kubernetes is a powerful abstraction for scheduling workloads across compute, networking, and storage resources. However, managing multiple clusters and scaling applications across environments presents challenges. Cluster and node management, workload promotions, and dependency orchestration often require installing and configuring different open source components, resulting in bespoke platform layers that customers own and operate. In this session, learn how you can leverage Amazon EKS Auto Mode and advanced platform engineering features for end-to-end Kubernetes management.
