It's now easier than ever to get started with Kubernetes on AWS and you can focus on building applications rather than infrastructure management.

title: Siteimprove: Revolutionizing Brand Consistency with AI and Amazon Nova
abstract: Discover how SiteImprove, a leader in web compliance monitoring, successfully scaled their AI-driven WCAG accessibility assessment solution using Amazon Nova and Bedrock features. This session walks you through SiteImprove's journey from concept to production, revealing how they navigated key decisions, leveraged the GenAI Innovation Center, and achieved 95% accuracy while reducing costs by 25%. Learn valuable best practices for project planning, resource optimization, and bringing GenAI applications to life on AWS. Walk away with clear, actionable insights to help you confidently implement and scale your own GenAI solutions, regardless of your current AWS experience level.

title: Slack securely powers internal AI dev tools with Bedrock and Strands
abstract: Slack drove 86% developer adoption across 1,000+ engineers by tackling AI operational complexity head-on. Learn how they built resilient infrastructure with Claude models on Amazon Bedrock and integrated Strands Agents to eliminate toil, scale model lifecycle management, and enforce reliability automatically. Strands Agents handle deployments, surface anomalies, trigger rollbacks, and continuously optimize pipelines, freeing engineers to focus on product work while Claude Code complements with autonomous code generation, issue triage, and self-healing playbooks. Slack also utilizes Bedrock features like prompt caching, Knowledge Bases and Guardrails to help turn security and compliance into advantages while shrinking the mean time to resolution.

title: Slash costs & get AI-ready with RDS for SQL Server & Oracle workloads
abstract: Discover how leading enterprises are leveraging 15+ years of Amazon RDS operational excellence to power their SQL Server and Oracle databases in the cloud, achieving substantial cost reductions while positioning themselves for AI innovation. In this session, explore features across Amazon RDS for SQL Server and Oracle that help reduce license spend, enhance scalability, and streamline database management. Learn how integrations with the latest AWS analytics and AI services can help you accelerate AI adoption. Through real-world cost optimization techniques and architectural best practices, learn how organizations are reducing operational overhead while maintaining enterprise security and performance.

title: Slickdeals' AI-powered deal discovery with Amazon Sagemaker
abstract: Discover how SlickDeals transformed from a heuristics-based platform to an AI-powered deal discovery engine using Amazon SageMaker. Learn how this e-commerce leader, which has saved shoppers over $10 billion, implemented five critical ML use cases including content summarization, deal personalization, and intelligent recommendations. We'll dive into their journey of modernizing their search and personalization algorithms, achieving enhanced user experiences for millions of shoppers. Join us to explore their ML implementation strategy, current results, and future optimization plans for peak shopping periods.

title: Smart agents meet documents: Building next-gen IDP architectures
abstract: Discover how agentic AI accelerates intelligent document processing. Build powerful autonomous systems that understand and extract data from complex documents using Bedrock Data Automation (BDA), Strands Agents SDK, and Amazon Nova models. Through practical exercises, attendees will design AI agents capable of handling multi-format documents, making contextual decisions, and orchestrating end-to-end workflows. We'll cover key architectural patterns, integration strategies, and real-world implementation challenges for use-cases such as insurance claims processing, mortgage document analysis and more. Perfect for developers, architects, and product managers looking to transform their document processing capabilities with intelligent automation.

title: Smart Alerts, Smarter Workflows: The Amazon Connect Edge
abstract: Explore how to leverage Amazon Connect to trigger voice calls and alerts in response to specific critical events or actions, enabling automated emergency notifications or the integration of manual human steps within your business processes. Learn how to seamlessly incorporate Amazon Connect into your workflow automation and process management strategies and move fast to resolve issues during "moments of truth".

title: Smart Clinical Documentation: Kiro & AWS HealthScribe
abstract: Join us as we explore how Kiro transforms healthcare application development through AI-assisted coding. In this workshop, you'll learn how to enhance AWS HealthScribe's ambient clinical intelligence capabilities by building advanced features that streamline the documentation process for clinicians. You'll discover how Kiro's vibe coding approach allows developers to rapidly implement medical named entity recognition, customizable note formats, and audio-text correlation features. Through hands-on development, you'll experience how Kiro helps healthcare developers build sophisticated clinical documentation tools that save clinician time, improve accuracy, and enhance the patient-provider experience.

title: Smarter Agents, Better Insights: Contextual Memory in Action
abstract: Unlock the full potential of AI agents with AgentCore Memory. This hands-on workshop will teach you best practices for implementing short-term and long-term memory, enabling agents to maintain context, recall preferences, and learn from past interactions. You'll learn to structure and manage agent memories and use AgentCore Observability and OpenTelemetry-compatible tracing to monitor your agent. Leave with the skills to build and optimize AI agents that not only respond intelligently but also continuously improve through contextual awareness and data-driven insights. This session is perfect for builders looking to create more sophisticated, adaptive AI experiences.

title: Smart Machines: Maximizing Business Value with Generative AI
abstract: Join this interactive chalk talk to explore smart machine architectures that maximize business value from connected machines using IoT, generative AI, and third-party integrations. Through whiteboarding and live demonstrations, you'll explore how to implement generative AI-powered use cases for smart machines, including assisted diagnosis and troubleshooting, machine fleet analysis, automated diagnostic reports, and voice-enabled support. Bring your complex scenarios to collaborate with AWS Industrial IoT and Generative AI experts to create innovative solutions for your specific needs.

title: Smart Security for SMBs: Combining AWS Tools, MCP, and AI
abstract: Transform your SMB's security operations using the power of AWS tools, MCP, and AI-driven automation. This hands-on session demonstrates how small businesses can implement effective security practices without dedicated security teams. Learn to leverage Amazon Q Developer to guide implementation, suggest configurations, and maintain security best practices. Discover practical automation techniques that help your small team achieve enterprise-level security with SMB resources.

title: So Energy streamlines customer service with AI-powered automation
abstract: Legacy contact center solutions weren’t built for today’s customer expectations. Managing fragmented voice, chat, and email systems creates friction for administrators, agents, and customers alike. Join AWS and So Energy — a UK-based renewable energy provider — to learn how you can modernise ageing customer service experiences by consolidating disjointed channels into a single, unified application with Amazon Connect. Leveraging AI-powered automation and deep CRM integration, learn how So Energy agents gained a single view of the customer journey, enabling them to resolve issues faster and reduce manual effort — while customers enjoy a seamless, consistent experience across every channel.

title: Solution-based selling strategies in AWS Marketplace
abstract: Learn about new selling capabilities in AWS Marketplace. This session explores best practices for selling comprehensive solutions, including real-world patterns, contract structures, and technical considerations. Discover how to maximize your AWS Marketplace presence and streamline customer procurement through effective solution-based strategies.

title: Solve complex data and AI governance challenges with Amazon SageMaker Catalog
abstract: Learn how to enhance data discovery by automatically enriching data and metadata with business context using generative AI, making it easier to find, understand, and use data. Share data, AI models, prompts, and other generative AI assets with filtering by table and column names or business glossary terms. SageMaker Catalog establishes trust and drives transparency in data pipelines and AI projects with built-in model monitoring to detect bias, track lineage and report on how features contribute to your model predictions. Master the tools and techniques that will transform your approach to data governance, enabling secure, scalable, and AI-ready data solutions.

title: Solving private IPv4 exhaustion using AWS Cloud WAN and Amazon VPC Lattice
abstract: Enterprises face private IPv4 exhaustion due to limited address planning, architectural shifts, mergers, and IP-hungry technologies like containers. The result - restrictions to cloud scalability and new project deployment. In this session, learn how AWS solutions solve these challenges with a scalable and cost effective approach combining AWS Cloud WAN with service insertion, and Amazon VPC Lattice to centralize private NAT Gateways and AWS PrivateLink. With this setup, discover how to maximize IP space utilization, reduce costs, and simplify network management—offering a durable solution to support evolving infrastructure needs across distributed environments

title: Solving the Cloud Privilege Problem at Scale: A Fiserv Case Study (sponsored by Sonrai Security)
abstract: This session explores how Fiserv, a global leader in financial services technology, transformed its cloud identity security and governance strategy by deploying Sonrai's Cloud Permissions Firewall. Facing challenges across 900+ AWS accounts, including overprivileged identities, limited visibility into third-party access and fragmented tools, Fiserv required a scalable, proactive approach. Attendees will learn how automation, centralized dashboards, and advanced identity controls enabled Fiserv to remediate thousands of identity risks, achieve compliance readiness, and reduce operational risk. The case study demonstrates practical strategies for securing enterprise-scale cloud environments. This presentation is brought to you by Sonrai Security, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Solving the Cloud Privilege Problem at Scale: A Fiserv Case Study (sponsored by Sonrai Security)

title: Solving the Observability Mystery with AWS Step Functions
abstract: This session explores advanced observability techniques for AWS Step Functions. You'll learn effective patterns combining metrics, tracing, and composite alarms to gain comprehensive insights into your workflow executions. Drawing from real-world enterprise experiences, we'll share practical approaches that have proven effective in maintaining reliability at scale.

title: Spec-driven development: Shaping the next generation of AI software
abstract: When you’re working through a complex feature you need to make tradeoffs between requirements, system design, and implementations details before you deal with the nitty-gritty of writing the code. In this session, learn how spec-driven development can help you go from idea to production without sacrificing any of the crucial development details.

title: Spec-driven development with Kiro
abstract: Traditional AI coding assistants often struggle with complex project requirements. This talk introduces Kiro, an AI IDE that implements spec-driven development to address these challenges. Kiro guides users through a comprehensive process from requirements gathering through design and task implementation, all before generating code. Explore how this spec-driven approach establishes clear documentation and audit trails, and learn how your team can use Kiro to transform requirements into well-documented, maintainable code.

title: Speed to Impact: AI Factory in the Cloud with NVIDIA on AWS (sponsored by NVIDIA)
abstract: Developing and deploying mission-critical AI systems is increasingly complex and resource-intensive. This session demonstrates how organizations can accelerate AI development with turnkey, full-stack AI factories in the cloud—combining NVIDIA’s optimized hardware, software, and AI expertise with AWS’ scalable, co-engineered infrastructure. Attendees will hear customer success stories illustrating how this collaboration enables rapid, efficient delivery of advanced generative and Agentic AI applications by optimizing every infrastructure layer and leveraging best-in-class tools from both NVIDIA and AWS. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Speed to Impact: AI Factory in the Cloud with NVIDIA on AWS (sponsored by NVIDIA)

title: Speed up Apple application builds with CI/CD pipelines using EC2 Mac
abstract: In this session, learn how to streamline your CI/CD pipelines using Amazon EC2 Mac instances and cloud-based runners. We'll show how to create consistent, repeatable macOS build environments and integrate with tools like AWS CodeBuild, Bitrise, GitHub Actions, GitLab, or CircleCI. You'll hear firsthand from a customer how to reduce testing time and increase release velocity with parallel builds and flexible orchestration. Whether you build for iOS, macOS, visionOS, or other Apple platforms, this session helps you modernize CI/CD and ship faster with confidence.

title: Spreetail's AI Value Journey
abstract: Explore how Spreetail is transforming business operations through AI adoption, delivering over $50M in annual value across the enterprise. This executive session reveals our pragmatic approach to implementing AI solutions in merchandising, supply chain, and customer experience. Learn how we prioritize use cases, manage implementation risks, and build internal AI capabilities while ensuring ROI. We'll share our framework for measuring AI success, governance, and key insights from both wins and setbacks. Discover how we navigate vendor selection, data readiness, and change management to achieve measurable business outcomes. Perfect for leaders looking to move beyond AI pilots to enterprise-wide value creation.

title: SQL Server migration & modernization powered by generative AI
abstract: In this workshop, discover a comprehensive migration and modernization experience that guides you through the process of migrating your SQL Server database and application-associated embedded SQL code to PostgreSQL. The workshop uniquely incorporates Amazon Q Developer, an AWS generative AI augmented solution, to help alleviate labor-intensive tasks and accelerate the database migration process. You will gain practical migration and modernization experience with live applications while learning how to transform their database systems to Aurora PostgreSQL Serverless v2. While the workshop targets Aurora PostgreSQL, the mechanisms also broadly apply to migrating other commercial relational databases to open source relational databases.

title: Start building with Q Developer CLI: Serverless full-stack in action
abstract: Get hands-on with Amazon Q Developer CLI and learn how to build a serverless full-stack application from the ground up. This code-focused session is designed for builders new to AI coding assistants. Use natural language prompts to scaffold a web app, connect it to a serverless backend, and automate development tasks in your terminal. Watch real-time demos of multi-step workflows, context-aware suggestions, and live code edits that speed up how you build. You�ll leave with the skills and confidence to start building AI-assisted applications using AWS-native tools.

title: Startup to Scale: Powering Business Growth with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: Lightsail makes it simple to get started in the cloud with just a few clicks. Discover how it can support your business at any stage of growth. Whether you're launching your first cloud workload, migrating existing applications, or managing services for your customers, learn proven approaches for success. We'll explore how customers are using Lightsail today, including cost optimization and best practices for efficient scaling.

title: State of DevEx 2025: Navigating the AI Revolution and Developer Experience (sponsored by Atlassian)
abstract: In a year defined by economic pressure and rapid AI change, developer experience (DevEx) is more critical than ever. Join us as we unveil key insights from Atlassian’s State of DevEx 2025 Report, including how AI and AI agents are reshaping workflows, boosting collaboration, and freeing developers for higher-value work. We’ll explore critical challenges: a widening gap between leaders and developers, and rising inefficiencies costing 50% of devs 10+ hours each week. Walk away with fresh data and actionable ideas to elevate DevEx in your organization. This presentation is brought to you by Atlassian, an AWS Partner.

title: State of the Art: AWS data protection in 2025 (ft. Vanguard)
abstract: Join AWS Cryptography leaders for a comprehensive tour of 2025's groundbreaking security innovations. Discover the latest launches across Cloudfront, KMS, Private CA, and Secrets Manager, showcasing AWS's implementation of NIST-standardized post quantum cryptography. Learn how we're revolutionizing cloud security through quantum-resistant algorithms, advanced certificate management, and automated secrets handling. Get an inside look at Vanguards enterprise-wide PQC migration and how they made it a strategic business priority. See firsthand how AWS continues raising the bar on data protection for your most sensitive workloads.

title: State of the Edge:  Delivery of the web with CloudFront, WAF, and Shield
abstract:
As the internet evolves with new clients, protocols, and threats, leveraging global edge infrastructure has become critical for delivering exceptional user experiences. In this session, we'll examine the broader trajectory of the web, from the proliferation of mobile-first experiences to the rise of AI workloads  and emerging security threats. 
 Discover how Amazon CloudFront, AWS Global Accelerator, AWS WAF, and AWS Shield have integrated to address today's most pressing web performance and security challenges. Learn how to incorporate AWS Edge networking services as foundational components within modern web architectures and  how AWS is positioning its infrastructure to meet tomorrow's challenges.

title: Staying  Ahead:Smart Strategies for Effective Vulnerability Management
abstract: This session explores modern  vulnerability management strategies for cloud and development environments.  We'll demonstrate how to integrate automated scanning and continuous  monitoring for both AWS compute resources and Git code repositories. Learn  how to identify misconfigurations, unpatched software, and insecure code  dependencies before they become threats. Attendees will gain practical  insights into prioritizing and remediating vulnerabilities across  infrastructure and code, unifying security efforts from development to  deployment. Join us to discover actionable techniques for reducing risk and  strengthening your organization's security posture in today's dynamic,  cloud-native landscape.

title: Storage optimization by Apache Iceberg V3's Deletion Vectors
abstract: In modern data architectures, Apache Iceberg has become a popular table format for data lakes. Iceberg evolves at a rapid pace, and one of the recent key enhancements is Apache Iceberg V3 format. Apache Iceberg V3 format introduces Deletion Vectors, allowing you to reduce storage usage while optimizing workloads. This session dives deep into Deletion Vectors: why Deletion Vectors are introduced, how Deletion Vectors are designed, and their contribution in real-world scenarios. You'll learn how to optimize Iceberg table storage with Deletion Vectors in detail. You'll also learn migration strategies from Apache Iceberg V2 format.

title: StradVision's Vision AI journey with AWS
abstract: StradVision is a Vision AI startup offering ADAS/AV models for automotive companies such as BMW. So far, 3M+ vehicles from 13+ OEM have equipped with StradVision's Vision AI perception software. StradVision migrated 1PB+ data from on-prem to S3 through AWS Snowball, run data processing/labeling jobs on EKS/ECS, and training AI model by leveraging GPU instances on AWS. This reduced data processing time, improved latency for data labeling workloads, and accelerated AI model development pace.

title: Strands Agents: Building Fully Autonomous, Self-Improving AI Agents
abstract: Explore cutting edge AI with Strands Agents - autonomous systems that evolve and learn continuously. We'll demonstrate advanced agents that autonomously identify knowledge gaps, self-modify reasoning strategies, and dynamically build new tools. These systems learn from interactions, improving decision-making without human intervention while communicating through multiple protocols and real-time bi-directional streaming. Using Strands' model-driven approach, agents operate independently for extended periods, continuously enhancing effectiveness. Through real-world examples, see how self-improving agents transformed business processes by adapting to changing requirements automatically. Join us to challenge conventional thinking about agent limitations and reshape your approach to building truly autonomous AI systems.

title: Strategies to accelerate petabyte-scale migrations with AWS DataSync
abstract: Learn how to plan, build, and implement the migration of 10 petabytes of on-premises data with AWS DataSync. Through interactive discussion and whiteboarding, explore effective approaches for data categorization and creating transfer job manifests that map directly to cost-optimized S3 storage classes. Discover how this data migration architecture accelerates the migration of client data to Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP. This chalk talk provides practical insights and best practices for executing large-scale data migrations to AWS.

title: Strategy First: Empowering the Business to Lead in the AI Era (sponsored by Starburst)
abstract: Enterprises across industries—including regulated sectors like banking—are eager to realize AI’s promise, from insights to automation. Yet fragmented data, rigid governance, and the cost of innovation often create frustration. This session explores a bold shift: the business—not IT—will lead AI innovation. Success requires empowering teams to ideate freely, experiment rapidly, and unlock value at market pace. We’ll show how a modern data product strategy delivers access, trust, and agility while meeting governance needs. You’ll learn why experimentation is today’s strategic advantage and how to turn business curiosity into measurable competitive impact. This presentation is brought to you by Starburst, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Strategy First: Empowering the Business to Lead in the AI Era (sponsored by Starburst)

speakers.jobTitle: Head of Enterprise Data and Data Capabilities
speakers.globalJobtitle: Head of Enterprise Data and Data Capabilities

title: Stream 3D applications globally with Amazon GameLift Streams
abstract: Cloud-based streaming enables users to access graphically intensive applications without powerful local hardware. In this workshop, learn how to use Amazon GameLift Streams to deliver low-latency pixel streaming experiences to global audiences. Get hands-on experience building and deploying a React web application and serverless backend to stream 3D content directly to your end users.

title: Streaming at Scale: Advanced Media Delivery with Amazon CloudFront
abstract: Learn how Amazon CloudFront powers high-profile streaming events with low-latency, scalable delivery. Discover how to optimize caching using embedded POPs, reduce origin load with Origin Shield, and fine-tune streaming performance with advanced caching policies. We�ll also explore AWS Elemental MediaTailor for server-side ad insertion-enabling personalized ad delivery without client-side logic and ensuring smooth, consistent playback. Finally, dive into Media Quality-Aware Resiliency (MQAR) techniques that dynamically adjust to network conditions, maintaining high-quality viewing experiences for global audiences.

title: Streamline agent development using Amazon SageMaker AI with MLflow 3.0
abstract: Through guided exercises in SageMaker Unified Studio, you'll learn how to select the right foundation model for your use case, apply customization techniques using your own data, deploy and evaluate model performance, and optimize costs while maintaining accuracy.

title: Streamline AI model development lifecycle with Amazon SageMaker AI
abstract: Learn how Amazon SageMaker AI transforms model development with a unified environment for all your AI workloads - from interactive model development on IDEs to maximizing task and compute resource utilization across training and inference workloads. We'll demonstrate how to use SageMaker Studio as the familiar IDE to develop, submit, and monitor ML jobs, while leveraging the scalability and resiliency of HyperPod environment for computationally intensive tasks like training and deploying large foundation models. You will also learn how HyperPod task governance capability can help you automatically allocate compute resources based on task prioritization end-to-end through the model development lifecycle.

title: Streamline Amazon Connect management with agentic AI-powered controls
abstract: Learn how to streamline Amazon Connect management through natural language AI commands. This hands-on workshop demonstrates how to implement a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts simple spoken or written instructions into Amazon Connect API actions. You'll build a practical prototype that enables your team to adjust queue settings and operating hours through natural language, significantly reducing administrative complexity and training time.

title: Streamline Amazon EKS operations with Agentic AI
abstract: In this code talk, learn how to build agentic AI systems that automate Amazon EKS cluster management, from real-time issue diagnosis to guided remediation. Discover how to create agents that connect with AWS services through Model Context Protocol (MCP) to simplify operational tasks like incident response and debugging. The live coding demo showcases how agentic systems can leverage tribal knowledge within a company to provide contextual troubleshooting assistance and even auto remediation. Join us to discover best practices and tips for enhancing EKS operations with AI agents.

title: Streamline operations with automated health monitoring and response
abstract: Organizations face challenges in maintaining healthy infrastructure visibility and responding to incidents as their AWS environments grow more complex. In this chalk talk, learn to build comprehensive health monitoring and automated incident response using AWS Health, Amazon CloudWatch, and AWS CloudTrail. Get hands-on experience implementing Systems Manager Automation for remediation, creating effective monitoring patterns, and transforming metrics into actions. Leave with practical approaches for cross-account health dashboards, intelligent alerting, and automated response runbooks.

title: Streamline secure customer authentication with Amazon Connect
abstract: Learn how to build secure verification systems in Amazon Connect that work seamlessly across voice, chat, and digital channels. This session demonstrates how to implement authentication methods that enhance security while maintaining a smooth customer experience. You'll gain practical strategies for creating robust, cross-channel verification solutions that combine traditional and innovative authentication approaches to elevate both security and customer satisfaction.

title: Streamline web app deployment with gen AI and AWS Elastic Beanstalk
abstract: Elevate your web application deployment and migration skills with Amazon Elastic Beanstalk in this hands-on workshop. Discover how to harness genAI for deploying full-stack applications, encompassing frontend, backend, and database components. Gain hands-on experience with production-grade migration techniques using CLI tools for existing applications. You'll develop practical expertise in automated deployment strategies, monitoring solutions, and best practices for managing web applications at scale. Leave equipped with the knowledge to streamline your deployment processes, enhance application performance, and effectively manage complex web environments using Elastic Beanstalk's powerful features.

title: Streamlining Telecom Cybersecurity Operations with AWS Generative AI
abstract: Join us to learn how telecommunication providers streamline their cybersecurity operations. We'll provide a walk-through of an innovative solution using Amazon Bedrock Generative AI Agents that reduces security investigation time from hours to minutes when diagnosing application access blocks. Attendees will explore a real-world application of GenAI in SecDevOps and cybersecurity for telecommunications. We’ll illustrate how security teams can leverage Generative AI to gain significant operational improvements and minimize manual effort in resolving access issues. This lightning talk equips telecommunications organizations facing similar challenges with practical strategies for implementing Agentic AI-powered solutions in security operations for both customer-facing and internal IT networks.

title: Streamlining vLLM deployment for production with AWS DLCs on EKS
abstract: Struggling with large language model (LLM) deployment complexity? Join this session to learn how vLLM optimized AWS Deep Learning Containers revolutionize the way we deploy large language models like DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Qwen-32B on Amazon EKS. Learn how purpose-built containers simplify complex setups, optimize GPU utilization, and leverage EFA networking for distributed inference. Through live demonstrations, you'll learn to leverage vLLM DLCs with FSx Lustre and EKS for production-ready AI infrastructure. Leave with practical insights on security, performance tuning, and cost optimization that you can implement immediately. Join us to master enterprise-grade LLM deployment that scales effortlessly.

title: Strengthening security for Apache Spark workloads
abstract: Dive into data security with this session on implementing fine-grained access control for Apache Spark workloads in AWS. Through live whiteboarding and collaborative problem-solving, we'll explore architectural patterns for securing data across EMR and AWS Glue environments. Learn practical strategies for implementing column-level security, row-level filtering, and cross-account access controls using AWS native security services and best practices.

title: Strengthen your network security with generative AI
abstract: Transform how you manage network security using the power of generative AI. See how Amazon Q Developer helps you explore AWS Shield Network Security Director findings through natural language conversations. Learn to quickly identify misconfigured resources, understand security issues, and implement guided fixes across your AWS environment.

title: Stress test your services for resilience with AWS Game Day
abstract: Learn how to test your workloads, like AWS does, to build confidence in their resilience, validate expected capabilities, and discover how they perform under stress. More than just chaos engineering, we'll explore the type of tests AWS performs at scale, how they're coordinated across teams, and the tools we use. We'll share real world lessons learned and how you can apply these concepts and tools to your own resilience testing with AWS Game Day.

title: Structured Approach to AI coding with Spec-Driven Development on Kiro
abstract: This session demonstrates how Kiro brings discipline and clarity to AI-assisted software development, ensuring generated code aligns with intended functionality and architecture. Explore Kiro's innovative spec-driven development approach for AI coding. Learn how to leverage structured specifications as a single source of truth, contrasting with unstructured 'vibe coding'. Discover how Kiro uses AI to generate detailed requirements, design, and task documents, guiding AI agents in code creation. Experience a workflow that enhances collaboration, maintainability, and documentation accuracy.

title: Supercharge app intelligence using gen AI with Amazon DocumentDB
abstract: In this session, explore how you can use the generative AI capabilities of Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) to make your existing applications more powerful. See demos showcasing how easily you can implement semantic search, build chatbots, and execute ML predictions within Amazon DocumentDB.

title: Supercharge DevOps with AI-driven observability
abstract: Modern observability extends beyond logs and metrics to deliver understanding, context, and prediction. This session demonstrates how Generative AI transforms DevOps and SRE practices in CI/CD environments. Learn to build AI-enhanced observability systems using Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q that automatically explain failures, correlate events, and provide predictive recommendations. Explore techniques for creating AI agents that simulate scenarios and stress-test architectures, enabling proactive insights with clear traceability. Attendees will gain practical knowledge to enhance their automation and incident response capabilities through AI-driven observability.

title: Supercharge Lambda functions for security and performance
abstract: Transform your Lambda functions through this practical builder's session focused on modern security and performance optimization techniques. You'll work step-by-step to evolve a basic function into a robust, production-ready solution, implementing crucial security controls and performance enhancements using the latest AWS features. This practical experience goes beyond just "how" to make changes, delving into the "why" behind each best practice, ensuring you gain a deep understanding of serverless architecture principles. You'll leave with actionable insights to fine-tune your Lambda functions across security, performance, and cost dimensions, all grounded in real-world implementation.

title: Supercharge Lambda with Hono: The lightweight web framework
abstract: Enhance your Lambda development experience with Hono, a TypeScript-friendly framework that brings familiar web patterns to serverless functions. This lightweight framework enables clean, intuitive routing while leveraging Lambda's full scalability potential. This lightning talk demonstrates how Hono's unified router simplifies development, reduces cold-start times, and complements existing AWS tooling. Through live examples, you'll learn practical patterns for building maintainable, production-grade APIs that enhance developer experience without compromising performance.

title: Supercharge log analytics: OCSF meets generative AI
abstract: How do you turn diverse logging data into actionable AI insights? This session explores how OCSF enables unified logging across complex environments and powers next-generation generative AI analytics. Discover best practices for implementing OCSF, real-world benefits, and how to prepare your logging data for AI-powered analysis.

title: Supercharge ML and Inference on Apple Silicon with EC2 Mac
abstract: Take your machine learning workflows to the next level with EC2 Mac instances powered by Apple silicon. In this session, learn how to accelerate inference by tapping into the Apple Neural Engine (ANE) and Core ML framework. Discover how to efficiently deploy PyTorch and TensorFlow models, optimize for performance on M-series chips, and reduce development and operational costs. Whether you're building for iOS or scaling cloud-native ML, this session offers practical guidance for unlocking the full ML potential of Apple silicon�right from the cloud.

title: Supercharge Serverless APIs with Powertools for AWS Lambda
abstract: In this workshop, learn how to implement request and response validation, dynamic routing, exception handling, middleware and OpenAPI schema generation and Pub/Sub notifications with AppSync Events. This workshop starts with an existing application and progressively improve your API event handler using Powertools for AWS Lambda. To complete this workshop, you must bring your laptop.

title: Supercharge Serverless testing: Accelerate development with Amazon Q
abstract: Struggling with testing serverless applications? The highly distributed architecture and cloud-native services require a different approach to designing an effective test strategy. In this interactive code talk, we'll demonstrate how Amazon Q can transform your testing workflow across the serverless development lifecycle. You'll discover how to rapidly generate comprehensive test suites, automate user acceptance tests, and leverage past bugs to inform future test improvements. Through live coding demonstrations, learn practical techniques to reduce testing time while improving application quality.

title: Supercharge your data insights with the Cisco Data Fabric (sponsored by Splunk)
abstract: With the Splunk platform as its engine, the Cisco Data Fabric serves as a strategic foundation unifying machine data across your entire digital ecosystem. Discover how our AI-native platform transforms raw telemetry into actionable intelligence, enabling real-time insights across security, networking, and IT operations. Learn about comprehensive data management, federated search, and analytics capabilities, allowing you to access data wherever it resides. See how the Cisco Data Fabric serves as a foundation for building and fueling your next-generation AI models, driving operational excellence and digital resilience. Join us to revolutionize your data strategy. This presentation is brought to you by Splunk, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Supercharge your data insights with the Cisco Data Fabric (sponsored by Splunk)

title: Supercharge your Karpenter: Tactics for smarter K8s optimization (sponsored by Zesty)
abstract: Unlock the full potential of Karpenter to streamline Kubernetes cost optimization. Dive deep into advanced strategies beyond basic auto-scaling. Learn how to fine-tune Karpenter’s resource allocation, and use dynamic configuration strategies to adapt to real-world workloads. Discover best practices and see how multi-layer automation can complement Karpenter to drive even greater impact on performance, scalability, and Kubernetes efficiency. This presentation is brought to you by Zesty, an AWS Partner.

title: Supercharge your SaaS with agentic insights
abstract: SaaS is meant to be a data-driven model. The choices you make when architecting a multi-tenant system are driven by specific metrics, goals, and outcomes that are expected to enable growth, innovation, and efficiency. This builder session will look at how agents and GenAI can be used to enrich this metrics experience, exploring new techniques that can be used to capture, surface, and analyze the multi-tenant metrics. We’ll explore actionable insights like customer usage patterns, cost-per-tenant, and churn rate, giving you a clearer view into the data that can impact the success of your SaaS business.

title: Supercharge your well-architected reviews with AWS Generative AI
abstract: Learn how Koch Industries revolutionized their AWS Well-Architected reviews using generative AI. We'll demonstrate how combining Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Base and MCP automates architectural assessments that previously took weeks. Discover how to scale best practice reviews and optimize cloud workloads in minutes instead of days.

title: Sustainable and cost-efficient generative AI with agentic workflows
abstract: Building sustainable, cost-effective generative AI on AWS requires integrating agentic AI, efficient architecture, and cloud-native optimization. Agentic systems using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore employ contextual memory, asynchronous execution, and on-demand tool invocation to minimize compute waste. MCP enables secure connections between AI agents, AWS services, and custom tools. Efficiency increases through AWS's Trainium and Inferentia2 silicon (50% better performance per watt), Amazon SageMaker for scalable development, and optimization techniques like quantization and speculative decoding. Auto-scaling, batch processing, and spot instances prevent over-provisioning. Combined with CloudWatch and Cost Explorer monitoring, this approach delivers high-performance, low-carbon generative AI solutions.

title: Sustainable computing for climate solutions
abstract: High Performance Computing (HPC) is crucial for solving complex environmental challenges such as air pollution and extreme weather forecasting, yet HPC workloads are traditionally computationally intensive. This session explores patterns and key AWS services like AWS Batch, ParallelCluster, EC2 Spot Instances, Graviton processors, FSx for Lustre, and Cloudwatch that help optimize the balance between computational performance and environmental sustainability. Attendees will explore a real-world example of how researchers from University of Oxford are using sustainable HPC solutions for community air quality improvement through large-scale geospatial data processing and machine learning.

title: Swift for AI: Developing Agents and MCP-Compatible Tools
abstract: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) enables AI-native developer workflows across multiple programming languages. This session demonstrates how to leverage Swift in creating MCP-compatible tools and agents, integrating them with existing clients like the Amazon Q Developer CLI. The presentation covers defining tool schemas, handling invocations, and interacting with foundation models using the Swift MCP SDK and modern async patterns. Through practical examples, the session illustrates Swift's capabilities for constructing intelligent agents and tools, providing developers with powerful options for AI development.

title: Symbolic AI in the age of LLMs
abstract: While generative AI captures headlines, the untapped potential lies in combining it with decades-proven symbolic AI techniques. This session explores how organizations can leverage symbolic AI, such as ontologies and logic-based reasoning to build knowledge graphs and to enhance their AI capabilities. Dive deep into these topics to understand what ontologies look like, where semantics comes from, and what it means to build working knowledge graphs. Learn concrete strategies for defining and adopting ontologies and how to use reasoning for your benefit.

title: Symbolic Execution for Better Cloud Governance
abstract: Symbolic execution is an automated reasoning technique for analyzing all possible executions of a program. First invented in the 1970s, symbolic execution has found a modern application in AWS cloud governance. Given a control which assesses the security posture of cloud resources, symbolic execution gives us a way to analyze all possible resource configurations and their compliance state. Come learn how we use this technique inside AWS to accelerate the development and verification of cloud controls. See how we move beyond individual test cases to systematically explore every possible behavior of a cloud control.

title: Sysco's Digital Transformation: Platform Engineering with Amazon Q
abstract: Discover how you can combine platform engineering practices with Amazon Q Developer to revolutionize your organization's software delivery capabilities. In this session, you will learn how Sysco, a global food services distribution leader, transformed its platform engineering process and built a robust internal developer platform, enhancing self-service capabilities and the developer experience. Explore real-world implementation strategies and dive deep into enterprise-specific challenges: legacy modernization without specialized talent, AI assisted knowledge sharing, contextual code generation using existing APIs, and leveraging MCP for context and actions. You will leave understanding how to build a more efficient, standardized, developer-friendly environment with Amazon Q.

title: Tackling Anti-patterns with AI-Driven Development Lifecycle (AI-DLC)
abstract: In a world where developers grapple with legacy systems, shifting requirements, brittle architectures, and never-ending backlogs, the real bottleneck isn't coding, but decision-making, validation, and providing oversight to AI. The AI-Driven Development Lifecycle (AI-DLC) reimagines software engineering methodology. Through real-world examples and best practices, learn how to solve the hardest developer challenges by applying AI as a core collaborator in the SDLC. Discover how AI-DLC addresses common development anti-patterns and transforms your engineering practices.

title: Tag like a pro: Optimize multi-account resource tracking
abstract: Many organizations struggle with inconsistent tagging and poor resource visibility across their growing AWS footprint. In this chalk talk, explore advanced strategies to overcome these challenges using AWS Organizations, AWS Config, AWS Resource Explorer, and AWS Resource Groups. Learn to implement scalable, automated tagging solutions that enforce consistent policies and streamline governance across thousands of resources and multiple accounts. Our AWS experts will demonstrate real-world architectures for discovering untagged resources, organizing assets into applications, and improving overall resource management. Join us to address your specific challenges, gain insights from practical examples, and optimize your organization's approach to multi-account resource management.

title: Talk with your data: Approaches to natural language query for nonprofits
abstract: Many nonprofits' journeys with AI begins with unstructured data; however, more organizations are exploring use cases with structured data in databases and data warehouses. This session showcases two approaches for talking with your data using natural language query (NLQ) powered by Amazon Q for Business and Amazon Bedrock. Participants will get hands-on experience with the Amazon Q for Business integration with Amazon QuickSight for no-code NLQ and structured text-to-SQL capabilities in Bedrock knowledge bases to chat with data in AWS data stores. You'll discover how to harness the power of unstructured data to build the next generation of intelligent applications.

title: Tapping into the Power of Agentic AI: Driving Mission Success with NVIDIA & AWS (sponsored by NVIDIA)
abstract: Step into the future of autonomous systems with NVIDIA Agentic AI, where intelligent agents aren't just reactive, they're proactive, collaborators. In this session, discover how NVIDIA is harnessing the power of accelerated computing to build, train, and deploy agentic AI systems that reason, plan, and adapt in complex environments. Whether optimizing logistics, enhancing decision support, or enabling real-time simulations in digital twins, these AI agents are transforming how government and industry operate at the edge and in the cloud. Join us for a deep dive into use cases, cutting-edge architectures, and the tools that make scalable, secure agentic AI a reality today. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Tapping into the Power of Agentic AI: Driving Mission Success with NVIDIA & AWS (sponsored by NVIDIA)

title: Teaching your AI tools custom languages and libraries
abstract: Enterprises often develop custom libraries, tools, and domain-specific languages to power their operations. Integrating these proprietary assets within your AI tools can be a challenge. In this talk, I will share how to use Kiro, an agentic AI tool, to understand and work with custom libraries. I'll demonstrate the power of combining steering files and Model Context Protocol to teach Kiro new skills, establish best practices, and keep its knowledge up-to-date. Attendees will learn a repeatable approach to empower their AI tools to seamlessly work with the specialized services that drive their business

title: Telemetry forensics: Debugging event systems with metrics & traces
abstract: With high-throughput event-driven architectures, anomalies manifest as subtle shifts — throttled shards, cold starts, partial batch retries, or schema decode failures. This session guides you through debugging real-world streaming workloads built on AWS Lambda, Kinesis, SQS, Kafka or EventBridge. We'll analyze CloudWatch metrics, X-Ray traces, structured logs, and schema diffs to investigate scenarios like silent drops in throughput, poisoned events, and misrouted payloads. Learn how to correlate observations across services, identify system bottlenecks, and build observability into event-driven pipelines. If you love solving puzzles with graphs, this session is your crime scene!

title: Testing GuardDuty’s Runtime Detections:Hands-on with real world attack scenarios
abstract: Join this lightning talk to learn how to validate Amazon GuardDuty's runtime threat detection capabilities using test cases that reflect realworld threats. We'll demonstrate practical examples of executing controlled MITRE ATT&CK-mapped tests to verify GuardDuty's ability to detect common attack techniques, including execution, privilege escalation, persistence and impact. Through live demonstrations, discover how to safely simulate threats in your AWS environment, interpret GuardDuty's findings, and gain confidence in your security controls. Leave with practical knowledge to implement your own GuardDuty validation testing strategy using realistic test scenarios.

title: Test your web and mobile applications with AWS Device Farm
abstract: AWS Device Farm is an application testing service that helps you improve the quality of your web and mobile applications by testing them across an extensive range of desktop browsers and real mobile devices without having to provision and manage any testing infrastructure. This workshop provides hands-on guidance for software engineers, quality assurance engineers, software testers, platform engineers, and architects on how to get started using Device Farm to test your applications hosted in the AWS Cloud. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: The agent-enabled workplace: How AI assistants are transforming the way we work
abstract: The workplace is undergoing a fundamental shift as AI agents become integrated into our daily workflows. In this Innovation Talk, Dilip Kumar will explore how organizations can effectively implement AI assistants to enhance employee experience and productivity. Drawing from Amazon's experience with tools like Amazon Q Business and QuickSight, we'll examine real-world examples of AI transforming work patterns. Key principles for building effective AI assistants will be discussed, including leveraging enterprise data, balancing automation with human oversight, designing intuitive AI workspaces, and measuring productivity gains. Attendees will gain a practical framework for evaluating and implementing AI agents in their organizations, focusing on creating value while maintaining security and trust.

title: The AI Discussion Control Plane: How Your Agentic Team Redefines Ops (sponsored by Edge Delta)
abstract: Dashboards and alerts are outdated. The future is autonomous AI teammates, each fluent with expertise in a different role, working together to solve problems and self heal. In this session, we’ll introduce Discussion Control Plane: an environment where specialized AI agents collaborate through structured debate and MCP to interpret code, understand deployments, view logs, correlate metrics, trace distributed requests, and analyze security events. By partnering as real teammates, these agents surface richer context, resolve conflicts, and orchestrate actionable responses. Attendees will learn how this shift creates not just faster detection and resolution, but a way for the human-in-the-loop to uplevel. This presentation is brought to you by Edge Delta, an AWS Partner.

session.title: The AI Discussion Control Plane: How Your Agentic Team Redefines Ops (sponsored by Edge Delta)

title: The AI-Powered EHR: Elation Health on AWS & Snowflake (sponsored by Snowflake)
abstract: In the evolving landscape of healthcare, technology must empower caregivers. This session explores how AI agents are transforming primary care. Elation Health, a technology provider for physicians, is the first to embed AI-first capabilities directly into its core electronic health record (EHR) platform. You will discover how Elation Health built an innovative, AI-powered conversational assistant to help doctors accelerate clinical insights and reduce administrative burden. Learn how they leveraged the Snowflake AI Data Cloud on AWS to combine data and use Snowflake Cortex AI's native text-to-sql feature to allow physicians to ask complex patient questions in natural language, fundamentally changing how healthcare professionals work. This presentation is brought to you by Snowflake, an AWS Partner.

session.title: The AI-Powered EHR: Elation Health on AWS & Snowflake (sponsored by Snowflake)

title: The AI revolution in customer support: Building predictive service systems
abstract: Discover how AWS is using Generative AI to transform customer support from reactive to proactive. We'll show how large language models and AI agents are improving customer satisfaction and efficiency. Topics include smart case routing, context-aware support, early problem detection, and responsible AI use. We'll share real results and discuss balancing AI capabilities with human touch.

title: The Art of Managing Trade-Offs for your AWS Network Design
abstract: Every AWS network design decision involves careful trade-off considerations. In this session, master the art of making critical AWS network design decisions through real-world scenarios. Learn how to evaluate key trade-offs between centralized and distributed architectures while balancing security, performance, and cost requirements. Whether you're building a global network, managing multi-account environments, or implementing hybrid connectivity to on-premises locations, attendees will leave with actionable insights and practical decision-making tools to optimize network infrastructure architecture designs.

title: The AWS Security Incident Response Challenge: Defend the Cake!
abstract: Our precious Magic Unicorn Cake recipe is under threat from the notorious Grumpy Cats! In this high-stakes workshop, you'll step into the role of an AWS Security Engineer tasked with defending our digital delicacies. You'll implement real-time threat detection, configure security defenses, establish comprehensive monitoring, and create incident response processes. Through this immersive experience, you'll master the art of rapid security response while protecting our precious recipe vault from crafty cyber-cats. Join us to learn practical AWS security methodologies that translate directly to real-world scenarios observed by the AWS Customer Incident Response Team. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: The bill shock that taught me cost optimization
abstract: Serverless feels financially safe – you only pay for what you use, right? Wrong. Hidden costs lurk everywhere: cold starts, data transfer, inefficient functions, and more. This session reveals the serverless cost traps that catch even experienced developers and equips you with battle-tested strategies to avoid them. You'll learn monitoring techniques that prevent surprises, architectural choices that slash bills, and optimization patterns that keep your applications lean. Perfect for any developer who wants predictable serverless costs without sacrificing performance.

title: The Digital Supply Chain Is Broken. Can AI Fix It? (sponsored by Files.com)
abstract: Organizations are navigating increasingly complex digital supply chains, often relying on brittle patchworks of disconnected workflows. From data ingestion to delivery, teams face versioning challenges, security requirements, and constant pressure to operate at speed and scale — all while ensuring cost efficiency and compliance. The clear solution to shadow IT: move beyond file transfer to true file orchestration. In this session, Chief Strategy Officer Wade Callison shares strategies for optimizing AWS-based workflows to reduce friction, improve collaboration, and maximize cloud investments. Get actionable ideas to streamline your ecosystem, accelerate delivery, and prepare your organization for the next wave of innovation.  This presentation is brought to you by Files.com, an AWS Partner.

session.title: The Digital Supply Chain Is Broken. Can AI Fix It? (sponsored by Files.com)

title: The Federal Fast Lane: Deploying Mission Technology at Commercial Speed (sponsored by LMI)
abstract: Commercial innovation thrives on agility – cloud-native platforms, rapid iteration, and user-first design. Federal missions, however, demand assurance: security, compliance, and deployment in complex environments. In this Lightning Talk, Jared Summers and Alex Adamczyk share how agencies can leverage AWS and commercial-grade platforms to balance both speed and trust. They’ll outline strategies for scaling securely, navigating compliance hurdles, and accelerating adoption of AI and emerging technologies without compromising mission integrity. With real-world lessons from federal deployment, you’ll learn how to deliver innovation at commercial speed, mission-ready from day one. This presentation is brought to you by LMI, an AWS Partner.

title: The Frugal Architect GameDay: Building cost-aware architectures
abstract: Compete to implement cost efficiency improvements across multiple AWS services in this interactive GameDay. Tackle real-world challenges spanning compute, networking, storage, serverless, and observability domains while applying the Laws of the Frugal Architect. Transform high-cost infrastructure into efficient, sustainable architectures through practical quests involving Graviton processors, serverless optimizations, and database fine-tuning. Learn to reduce cloud unit costs and improve profitability without compromising service quality. Gain hands-on experience with production-ready solutions that align infrastructure costs to business objectives, making cost optimization a fundamental architectural requirement.

title: The Frugal Architect in a Chaotic World
abstract: In a world of runaway cloud bills and mounting tech debt, how do you build optimized systems that make sense? This session puts Werner Vogels Frugal Architect principles into practice using AWS Graviton, Amazon EC2 Spot, Karpenter, Generative AI, and open-source tools. See how we optimize a shopping cart with AI, then use flame graphs to trace improvements down to CPU cycles. It's not about cutting corners itis about engineering smarter. You will learn how to scale with Karpenter, optimize with Graviton, and analyze with AI + flame graphs, so you can build leaner, faster, and more cost-efficient systems by design.

title: The future is now: Unlocking AI's transformative power
abstract: Beyond efficiency gains and automation, AI is fundamentally reshaping how organizations create and deliver value. This session explores how leading organizations use generative AI and intelligent agents to unlock new business models and pioneer innovative customer experiences. Through real-world examples, learn how to democratize AI capabilities across your organization while ensuring responsible implementation through security and governance frameworks. Discover how to position your organization to lead in this new era of AI-driven innovation while maintaining trust and accessibility.

title: The future of AWS Serverless in 2025 and beyond
abstract: Discover how AWS Serverless services are evolving beyond traditional serverless computing to meet the demands of AI-native development. Learn how we're addressing key challenges around global deployment, performance optimization, and secure isolation while embracing the transformation brought by generative AI. See how developers can now focus on business logic through natural language prompts, making serverless development more intuitive and powerful than ever before.

title: The future of Kubernetes on AWS
abstract: Kubernetes has become a standard way for organizations looking to modernize their application portfolios. AWS developed Amazon EKS to make Kubernetes more accessible to organizations of all sizes, helping them focus on what matters most for their businesses. In this session, join Amazon EKS product leadership to learn about the latest innovations and strategies for building Kubernetes platforms and applications faster. Discover how various organizations use Amazon EKS to run their most demanding applications in the cloud, on premises, and at the edge.

title: The Future of Software Craft in the Age of AI (sponsored by Snyk)
abstract: Over the past few years, since the introduction of LLM-based coding assistants into software development workflows, the practice of software development has been experiencing a significant revolution. The age of AI is yet again reinventing what it means to be a software builder. The history of innovation has shown that these warnings are almost always exaggerated. What’s just as clearly true, however, is that roles will evolve as technologists move up the value chain and replace toilsome tasks with higher-productivity workflows. Join Snyk, the leader in AI Trust and Developer Security, for a wide-ranging discussion of the future of software development. This presentation is brought to you by Snyk, an AWS Partner.

title: The Great ReImagining: Thriving in the Age of AI Agents (sponsored by Kore.ai)
abstract: The emergence of Agentic AI is not just another technology trend; it's a fundamental shift in how businesses will operate and compete. This session is for the leaders, the strategists, and the innovators who need to prepare their organizations for what's next. We'll explore the strategic implications of a world where every employee has a team of AI agents, and every business process is orchestrated by a network of intelligent systems built on Kore.ai's platform and Amazon's cloud-native infrastructure. You'll leave with a clear understanding of the opportunities and threats, and a framework for leading your organization through this "Great Re:Imagining". This presentation is brought to you by Kore.ai, an AWS Partner.

session.title: The Great ReImagining: Thriving in the Age of AI Agents (sponsored by Kore.ai)

title: The hidden engineering behind foundation model building
abstract: Traditional foundation model training approaches require substantial manual interaction, little signal for improvement, and slow iteration times. To resolve these issues, we built the Model Factory, poolside’s internal systems framework for quickly training, scaling, and experimenting with novel foundation models. In this session, poolside will share their methodology and reasoning for building the Model Factory, along with Anthony Liguori who will share AWS innovation for large scale training and secure inference at scale.

title: The Kiro coding challenge
abstract: Join this workshop to participate in 20 increasingly complex coding challenges aided by Kiro, an agent-native IDE for spec-driven development. Discover how Kiro's spec-driven development, agent hooks, and multmodal agent chat can help you develop complete application and understand complex workflows and tasks more efficiently compared to manual coding alone. Learn about Kiro and how it can help you go from idea to production, faster. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: The magic behind Amazon GuardDuty Extended Threat Detection
abstract: Security teams face an ever-evolving landscape of threats, making it crucial to stay ahead with advanced detection capabilities. In this session, we'll peel back the layers of Amazon GuardDuty Extended Threat Detection to show you how it ingests and processes various security signals, and how protection plans work together to create a comprehensive security net. Through real-world scenarios, we'll demonstrate how actual threats were detected—from initial suspicious activity to final alert generation. Watch as we break down complex threat scenarios, examine expanded data sources, and reveal how sophisticated detection techniques identify threats that traditional methods might miss.

title: The Mirage of Benchmarks: Foundations of LLM Evaluation Reliability
abstract: Benchmarks drive LLM development decisions, yet their signals are fundamentally fragile due to theoretical limitations critical at scale. Current evaluation spans pointwise metrics, pairwise preferences (Arena, MT-Bench), and agentic evaluations, extending to multi-modal models and autonomous agents. Large-scale evaluation reveals scores shift with decoding parameters, prompt templates, seeds, and inference precision, showing evaluation signals lack mathematical stability. Public benchmarks suffer contamination and memorization that corrupt capability measurement, while pairwise methods inherit systematic biases. This talk examines evaluation paradigm limitations, explores contamination detection methods, and presents frameworks separating genuine capability from benchmark artifacts.

title: The New York Times: From Google Cloud Platform to AWS
abstract: Discover how The New York Times overhauled its gaming platform by migrating critical gaming workloads from Google Cloud Platform to Amazon Web Services. Learn why this media giant chose to make the switch and explore the best practices that ensured a seamless transition of some of the internet's most popular pages and games. We'll delve into the journey from Google's Datastore, App Engine, and GKE to Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service(EKS) and Amazon DynamoDB. Uncover how this strategic move not only modernized The Times' tech stack but also significantly enhanced performance, scalability, and operational efficiency.

title: The Next Frontier in Financial Systems: Transformer-based Foundation Models (sponsored by NVIDIA)
abstract: Transformer-based foundation models are revolutionizing payment systems by providing deep contextual understanding of sequential transaction data. In this session, NVIDIA, AWS, and Stripe experts explain how large-scale tabular foundation models are trained and deployed to detect fraud in real time, personalize customer experiences, and interpret complex transaction patterns. Attendees will learn about the cloud-based AI factories enabling scalable deployment, NVIDIA’s accelerated computing for efficient training and tuning, AWS’s secure and scalable cloud infrastructure, and Stripe’s real-world applications that use these innovations to deliver adaptive, secure financial services at global scale. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.

session.title: The Next Frontier in Financial Systems: Transformer-based Foundation Models (sponsored by NVIDIA)

title: The power of cloud network innovation
abstract: Journey through an evolution of AWS networking and discover how it continues to serve as the foundation for how AWS delivers on the promise of cloud computing. Join Prasad Kalyanaraman, VP, AWS Infrastructure Services, as he unveils innovative breakthroughs powering today's cloud infrastructure. Through customer examples and exclusive behind-the-scenes insights, learn how AWS transforms networking across every layer - from our global backbone to AI/ML-optimized data centers, advanced content delivery, enhanced perimeter protection and security, scalable VPC networking, and global connectivity solutions. Watch how these innovations enable customers to build the next generation of cloud applications and modern networks.

title: The Shapeshifting Application: Architecture That Transforms Across AWS
abstract: Imagine an application that changes its deployment form while maintaining its essential nature—a digital shapeshifter adapting to any AWS compute environment. This session unveils the architectural patterns enabling true deployment flexibility, transforming applications to flow seamlessly between Lambda functions, ECS containers, and EKS pods. Through practical demonstrations, discover design principles that separate business logic from infrastructure concerns, creating applications that leverage AWS's specialized services without becoming tightly coupled. Learn to craft adaptable applications that maintain their core functionality while thriving in any AWS compute environment.

title: The state of AI in software development: Insights across 400+ organizations (sponsored by Atlassian)
abstract: Headlines suggest AI is transforming software engineering overnight, but data from 400+ organizations shows a more nuanced reality. Join Justin Reock as he shares a data-driven “state of the union” on AI in engineering, combining large-scale benchmarks with stories from the field. He’ll cover the impact of AI, where adoption drives gains, and emerging trends such as differing effects on junior vs. senior developers, the role of structured rollouts, vendor comparisons, and the evolving definition of who counts as a developer. He’ll conclude with a practical framework to help leaders understand AI’s impact across organizations. This presentation is brought to you by Atlassian, an AWS Partner.

title: The Step Functions Workshop
abstract: Join this workshop to learn about the primary features of AWS Step Functions. Step Functions is a low-code visual workflow service that developers use to build distributed applications, automate IT and business processes, and build data and machine learning pipelines based on AWS services. This workshop contains a series of interactive modules that provide hands-on experience building resilient workflows in a workshop environment including newly launched features - JSONata and variables. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: The Trade Desk optimizes media buying and ad experiences with AI on AWS
abstract: The Trade Desk enables advertisers to identify premium inventory across the open internet, and deliver scalable ad quality insights for more effective media buying. In this breakout session, discover how The Trade Desk evaluated and applied Amazon Nova’s multimodal capabilities as part of a new feature focused on complexity scoring including advanced content detection. Learn how Nova helps handle the computational demands of complexity scoring, while integrating with existing containerized ML workloads. Explore how this capability enhances both publisher monetization and advertiser targeting opportunities within The Trade Desk platform.

title: The Value of AWS Certifications in Your Enterprise Strategy
abstract: Learn how incorporating AWS Certifications into your enterprise strategy can transform people, process, and technology. See how your business can realize the value of earning and preparing for AWS Certifications.

title: The Zero Migration Path from Data to Enterprise Agentic AI (sponsored by Trianz I Concierto)
abstract: Enterprise AI adoption faces significant barriers, with traditional approaches requiring long deployment cycles and achieving only 30% success rates. The primary bottleneck stems from data migration requirements that have high cost and time implications. This talk explores an alternative paradigm: federated intelligence architectures that eliminate data migration through connectivity and processing. We examine how federated data foundations, data marketplaces, conversational business intelligence, and pre-built agentic frameworks can reduce AI deployment timelines from years to weeks while maintaining security and governance. The session presents practical blueprints and implementation strategies for accelerating enterprise AI adoption. This presentation is brought to you by Trianz I Concierto, an AWS Partner.

title: Thinking Serverless
abstract: Serverless is more than just AWS Lambda. It's about learning to use a range of different services and techniques to solve a technical problem. How do you approach building a solution with a serverless mindset? In this chalk talk, learn how to tackle a business problem from a customer perspective by breaking down needs into serverless building blocks that work well together. Discover the power of distributed systems design and event-based architecture, and learn how easy it can be to turn a flowchart into a model for a serverless application.

title: Threat-Modeling-as-Code: Automating From Threat Statements to Attack Steps
abstract: Threat modeling adoption is growing, but teams hit a wall converting "what can go wrong" into actionable defense strategies due to insufficient time or knowledge. This code talk demonstrates how Threat-Modeling-as-Code solves this challenge. We'll step through setting up automated workflows that take the AWS Threat Technique Catalog, architecture diagrams, and threat statements as inputs, then convert them into attack steps with associated mitigation controls for your defense-in-depth strategy. You'll leave with a framework and actionable guidance including automation templates for making threat modeling a seamless part of your development process.

title: Threat modeling for AWS identity: From federation to resource access
abstract: Identity is key to a strong security foundation. In this interactive session, learn about threat modeling methodologies tailored for AWS IAM architectures and external identity providers. Explore strategies to systematically evaluate federation flows, assess trust boundaries, and implement defense-in-depth strategies to secure human and workload identity management at scale using Identity Provider conditional and risk-based authentication, IAM Identity Center, IAM policies, SCPs, RCPs, declarative policies, tags and multi-account models. Using common customer scenarios, discover techniques to strengthen your identity architecture and maintain continuous authentication and authorization controls.

title: Tips and tricks for successful transformation of your legacy .NET applications
abstract: Looking to make your .NET development faster and easier? Join this live coding session to see how AWS Transform for .NET and Kiro can make your daily coding much smoother! We'll take you through the whole process - starting with a legacy .NET Framework application and porting it into modern .NET using AWS Transform. Then, we'll use Kiro to complete final changes and leverage the latest .NET features. You'll see the entire end-to-end process of modernizing .NET applications, learning practical techniques to enhance your development productivity and efficiently upgrade your existing codebase.

title: Top 10 tips to improve query performance in Amazon Redshift
abstract: Are slow queries and unpredictable performance impacting your ability to uncover insights from your data? In this chalk talk, we will discuss best practices to improve query performance in Amazon Redshift. You will learn how to monitor your queries, identify bottlenecks in real-time, analyze query patterns, and explore practical techniques to optimize problematic queries and improve overall workload performance. Designed for database administrators, data engineers, and analytics leaders, this talk promises actionable strategies to elevate your data warehouse performance from inconsistent to exceptional, empowering you to unlock the full potential of your data analytics infrastructure.

title: Top Tips for Getting the Most Out of AWS CloudFormation
abstract: AWS CloudFormation helps you manage your AWS infrastructure as code, increasing automation and supporting infrastructure-as-code best practices. In this chalk talk, we dive deep into the topic of optimizing your experience with AWS CloudFormation. Learn about several more recently added capabilities and best practices designed to improve productivity and accelerate your dev/test cycle for rapid infrastructure-as-code development. Whether you're a seasoned DevOps professional or earlier in your AWS CloudFormation journey, this session will equip you with new tools and techniques to streamline your deployment processes.

title: Toss Securities’ AI Transformation with automated Super App Ops.
abstract: Toss, Korea’s leading fintech innovator, serves 25 million users through their super app, offering seamless money transfers, banking, and securities services. Toss Securities bridges time zones and languages with Earnings Call Reports, sharing investment wisdom in stories that cross generations and transcend languages. As the app’s services expand, managing the increasingly complex super app becomes challenging. This session will show how Toss integrates Nova models with MCP for device testing, moving beyond checklist-based methods to natural language and user experience-driven app test automation, and share their future roadmap.

title: Tracing the Untraceable: Full-Stack Observability for LLMs and Agents (sponsored by groundcover)
abstract:
In just a few years, LLMs have gone from research curiosities to the backbone of new software experiences. Organizations are rushing to productionize LLM workflows because of their immense value, but are doing so without any observability guardrails, introducing new layers of fragility and complexity such as performance volatility, quality drift, and security risks.
In this talk, we’ll discover how to instantly monitor and troubleshoot LLM applications with zero-instrumentation. Whether on commercial LLM stacks or AWS Bedrock - we’ll break out of the LLM blackbox and learn how to monitor token usage, response latency, data exposure prompts, and model execution failures. This presentation is brought to you by groundcover, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Tracing the Untraceable: Full-Stack Observability for LLMs and Agents (sponsored by groundcover)

title: Trading innovation: Jefferies' AI assistant on Amazon Bedrock
abstract: Explore Jefferies Equities' enterprise deployment of a generative AI trading assistant using Amazon Bedrock's Strands Agents framework. This lightning talk will showcase Jefferies’ technical architecture leveraging the Claude foundation model, Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools, and Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases for processing real-time trade and transactions data. We’ll demonstrate our serverless event-driven architecture for achieving lower latency response at scale. We'll also examine our implementation of semantic caching, knowledge bases, and prompt engineering techniques that enable autonomous data analysis capabilities. Attendees will walk away with actionable architectural patterns and best practices for enterprise-grade agentic AI deployment.

title: Traeger accelerates contact center agent productivity with agentic AI
abstract: Looking to learn how to transform customer insights into exceptional customer service experiences?
