Join this session to hear how Traeger Grills uses AI-powered Amazon Connect to drive automation, enabling agents and supervisors to focus on the human aspects of customer service. Learn how the agentic AI capabilities of Amazon Connect can help you streamline contact center workflows and automate routine actions, all while keeping the service experience top of mind.

title: Train high-performing AI models at scale on AWS
abstract: Training large AI models requires significant compute resources and can be time and cost intensive. In this session, learn to optimize and accelerate your model training workloads using AWS's purpose-built infrastructure and tools. We'll dive deep into leveraging services like Amazon SageMaker HyperPod for distributed training at scale and SageMaker fully managed training jobs for cost-effective ML acceleration. You'll learn to scale training across clusters using techniques like data and model parallelism, automated model tuning, and efficient checkpoint management. Through real customer examples, see how to reduce training time by up to 40%, optimize costs, and build high-performance training pipelines.

title: Train, Simulate, Deploy: Building NVIDIA-Powered Physical AI on AWS (sponsored by NVIDIA)
abstract: Physical AI is changing robotics by enabling systems to interact intelligently with the world, but development requires extensive compute, simulation, and deployment resources. This session shows how NVIDIA’s Isaac platform combined with AWS allows end-to-end implementation: robots are trained and validated in high-fidelity simulated environments using Amazon EC2 GPU instances, with large-scale workloads orchestrated via AWS Batch and Isaac Lab for parallel experiments. Attendees learn how this integrated solution accelerates development and deployment, offering safe, scalable, and cost-efficient workflows for advanced robotics applications. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Train, Simulate, Deploy: Building NVIDIA-Powered Physical AI on AWS (sponsored by NVIDIA)

title: Transform Business Intelligence with AI-powered Analytics
abstract: Discover how AI transforms traditional business intelligence through integrated analytics. Learn implementation strategies for combining machine learning, natural language processing, and automated insights. Explore architectural frameworks that enable real-time, adaptive BI systems responding to business needs. See case studies demonstrating how organizations achieve faster, more accurate decisions through comprehensive AI-powered data analysis.

title: Transform Business Tasks into AI Actions [AWS Partners only]
abstract: This bootcamp is for AWS Partners only. Learn to convert complex business processes into intelligent AI workflows using the Strands SDK and Model Context Protocol (MCP). Practice building agents that interact seamlessly with external tools and APIs through MCP. Gain hands-on experience developing multi-agent systems, implementing knowledge bases, and creating meta-tooling capabilities. Explore how to orchestrate sophisticated AI workflows that extend agent capabilities dynamically. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Transform cloud monitoring into natural conversations
abstract: AI-powered conversational interfaces are revolutionizing cloud monitoring. In this hands-on session, learn how to get insights from varied telemetry sources by interacting through natural language. Experience practical exercises that demonstrate how to interpret cloud data through simple questions rather than complex technical queries. Discover tools and techniques that help operations teams streamline their monitoring workflows and democratize cloud observability across a variety of personas in your organization.

title: Transform data into insights with AI-powered Amazon Connect
abstract: Join this session to learn how to create automated data stories that analyze performance trends, agent productivity, and customer satisfaction through natural language interactions using Amazon QuickSight's generative AI capabilities and a MCP server, such as CloudWatch. You'll discover how to implement AI-powered solutions for metric analysis, executive summaries, dynamic dashboards, and automated troubleshooting. Convert complex contact center data into actionable insights using conversational interfaces, enabling teams to quickly identify issues and optimize operations. This session is ideal for contact center managers, operations leaders, and developers seeking to leverage AI-powered analytics for enhanced customer service operations.

title: Transforming Additive Manufacturing with Agentic AI
abstract: Witness the convergence of agentic AI and additive manufacturing as autonomous systems reimagine design-to-production workflows. This session demonstrates how AWS-powered AI agents independently optimize 3D printing parameters, collaborate on complex part designs, and dynamically respond to material and equipment variations. We'll demonstrate practical examples where specialized agents work together to solve additive manufacturing challenges that previously require human expertise. Discover implementation guides and learn how self-directed AI improves print quality, reduces material waste, and increases production efficiency.

title: Transforming AI storage economics with Amazon S3 Vectors
abstract: Amazon S3 Vectors introduces native support for vector data in S3, allowing you to store, retrieve, and query vectors directly alongside objects and tables. In this session, explore how S3 Vectors complements high-performance vector databases, reducing storage and querying costs by up to 90% for infrequently queried workloads. Learn how to integrate S3 Vectors with Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases and OpenSearch Service for RAG and semantic search at reduced cost and complexity. We’ll cover architecture design, performance considerations, and how S3 Vectors supports scalable AI agent memory, multimodal retrieval, and real-time inference workflows—all with the durability and scale of S3.

title: Transforming Apache Kafka into a Scalable Message Queue
abstract: Event streaming in Apache Kafka is powerful, but sometimes a queue-based model is more suited for workloads where parallel consumption is more important than ordering. KIP-932 introduces share groups, a feature that allows consumers to cooperatively consume data from Kafka topics, akin to how message queues work. This enables per-message acknowledgment, retries, and load distribution without the complexities of partition management. Ideal for independent work items, this approach simplifies message handling and enhances scalability. Join us to learn how KIP-932 brings queuing semantics to Kafka, enabling more flexible, efficient processing in event-driven architectures.

title: Transforming Banking: NatWest's Journey to Enhanced Customer Experience (sponsored by Accenture)
abstract: NatWest Group is committed to delivering exceptional customer experiences through innovative technology solutions. In this session, NatWest leaders will share their journey of collaborating with AWS and Accenture to accelerate their data and AI transformation, leveraging AWS's cloud infrastructure to drive business growth, improve customer engagement, and simplify operations. This presentation is brought to you by Accenture, an AWS Partner.

title: Transforming contact centers in financial services with Amazon Connect
abstract: In financial services, balancing personalization with compliance and security presents unique challenges to delivering superior customer experiences. Zepz, the global payments group behind leading remittance brands WorldRemit and Sendwave, began their Amazon Connect journey in 2021. Operating in over 130 countries with 5,000+ money transfer corridors and facilitating more than $16 billion in transfers, Zepz has transformed their customer service operations. In this session, learn how they manage 20 million customer profiles while achieving impressive results: 30% contact deflection using generative AI, comprehensive analytics across all voice and chat interactions, case and ticket management, data-driven quality assurance, and modernized customer feedback systems.

title: Transforming Enterprise IT: CSL Behring's VMware and SAP Modernization
abstract: Explore CSL Behring's comprehensive transformation strategy focused on migrating complex VMware workloads and consolidating fragmented SAP systems to build a more agile and resilient foundation. Learn how CSL leveraged agentic AI with AWS Transform to reduce technical debt and licensing costs across 4000+ VMware servers, revolutionizing traditional migration approaches and accelerating discovery and planning processes by 10x. You'll also discover how CSL unified their fragmented ERP landscape and established enterprise-wide data standards through RISE with SAP on AWS. Gain technical guidance, get inspired with lessons learned, and walk away with actionable insights that you can use in your organization.

title: Transforming from SaaS to multi-tenant agentic SaaS
abstract: Existing SaaS providers must determine how and where agents best fit into their offerings. Getting there requires organizations to transform existing IP and functionality into agent-powered experiences. This breakout will dig into the details of this transformation, examining the patterns, strategies, and techniques that can be used to introduce agents into an existing multi-tenant system. We’ll focus heavily on identifying the target agents, digging into how/where they’re built and introduced, how they’re integrated, and so on. We’ll also dig into how multi-tenancy lands in new agents, integrating with MCP servers, using RAG, applying tenant isolation, supporting onboarding, and on on.

title: Transforming Healthcare Payor Operations: AWS-TriZetto Success Story
abstract: Discover how the strategic collaboration between AWS and TriZetto is transforming healthcare payor operations. Learn how we've successfully migrated major payors to AWS —including a prominent Midwest Blue Plan—executing complex migrations under tight deadlines. Explore how AWS services like EKS, EC2, and Lambda have optimized TriZetto's Facets and QNXT platforms, enabling processing speeds of 2.4M claims per hour, 40-50% reduction in IT costs, and 20-30% acceleration in time-to-market. Learn how we are reshaping the healthcare payor landscape without requiring capital investment or additional staffing from clients.

title: Transforming Integrated Diagnostics: Philips' AI Journey with AWS
abstract: Healthcare providers struggle with disconnected patient data sources across diagnostic platforms, hampering clinical decision-making. Philips addresses this through integrated cloud-based solutions in radiology, cardiology, and digital pathology, powered by AI capabilities. As digital pathology emerges as the next innovation frontier, cloud infrastructure becomes crucial for managing massive imaging datasets and enabling collaboration.Incorporating AWS HealthImaging and AWS generative AI tools, Philips has developed comprehensive digital pathology solutions that streamline workflows, enhance diagnostic accuracy, and enables global collaboration. The goal is to improve diagnosis and treatment planning through standardized DICOM implementation, AI-assisted analysis, and seamless data sharing across healthcare institutions worldwide.

title: Transforming Lincoln Financials' Gen-AI powered CX with AWS & Deloitte (sponsored by Deloitte)
abstract: Come learn how Lincoln Financial Group (LFG), in collaboration with Deloitte and Amazon Web Services (AWS), built a transformative Generative AI (GenAI)-driven customer experience. Leveraging AWS Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker, LFG tackled challenges around unstructured data and operational inefficiency. Discover how their GenAI-powered knowledge agent transformed client-facing interactions, enabling real-time responses for financial advisors and customers while reducing wait times. Join us to explore the implementation approach, advanced technical architecture, and game-changing business outcomes that are propelling LFG to the forefront of AI-driven enterprise innovation. This presentation is brought to you by Deloitte, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Transforming Lincoln Financials' Gen-AI powered CX with AWS & Deloitte (sponsored by Deloitte)
Transforming Lincoln Financials' Gen-AI powered CX with AWS & Deloitte (sponsored by Deloitte)

speakers.jobTitle: Divisional CIO, Head of AI & Corporate Technology
speakers.globalJobtitle: Divisional CIO, Head of AI & Corporate Technology

title: Transforming Manufacturing Operations with Agentic Edge Gateways
abstract: Join this session to learn about building agentic edge gateways for transforming manufacturing operations. We'll explore how to move beyond traditional rule-based automation toward more adaptive and intelligent operations. We will demonstrate how AWS IoT Greengrass, Amazon Bedrock, and opensource agent frameworks such as Model Context Protocol (MCP) work together to enable goal-driven behavior at the edge. This session will address three key applications of agentic edge gateways: autonomous decision support, collaborative intelligence, and predictive operations. Discover how these innovations enable manufacturers to achieve more flexible, responsive, and efficient operations.

title: Transforming Observability: Ripple’s Journey with Grafana on AWS (sponsored by Grafana Labs)
abstract: Discover how Ripple revolutionized their observability strategy by implementing Grafana on AWS. In this session, learn how Ripple consolidated multiple monitoring tools into a unified Grafana solution. Explore how this transformation delivered 77% cost savings while maintaining high performance for demanding workloads. See how Grafana’s seamless integration with AWS native services—including Amazon S3, Amazon CloudWatch Logs, and AWS CloudTrail—created a scalable, efficient observability platform. Gain insights into managing open source Prometheus and architecting an observability solution that scales with your business needs. This presentation is brought to you by Grafana Labs, an AWS Partner.

title: Transforming SAP with AWS AI services to drive innovation
abstract: As artificial intelligence continues to revolutionize enterprise operations, SAP customers are uniquely positioned to harness the power of AWS's cutting-edge generative AI capabilities. This session explores the transformative potential of integrating AWS's AI innovations with SAP ecosystems to drive unprecedented levels of efficiency, creativity, and user engagement.

title: Transforming Service Operations with IoT and Gen AI
abstract: In this hands-on session, learn to build an integrated solution that improves service operations using Internet of Things (IoT), generative AI, and workflow automation. You will create a system using AWS IoT, Amazon Bedrock, and Amazon Connect to detect problems in real-time, predict equipment failures, and automate service responses across multiple communication channels. By implementing these proactive service operations, you will reduce equipment downtime, decease technician dispatches, and deliver faster resolution times to customers. You will gain the practical knowledge needed to implement AI-driven, proactive service operations in your own environment.

title: Transforming Supply Chains with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore (sponsored by Fujitsu)
abstract: Supply chain management has become increasingly challenging in recent years, with rapidly changing requirements and limitations. Our SCM systems must evolve to meet this demanding environment. Learn how we applied Agentic and Autonomous AI agents, built leveraging the power of Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, to reimagine how supply chain teams can address this growing complexity and accelerate our customers’ ability to adapt in the ever more dynamic market. This presentation is brought to you by Fujitsu, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Transforming Supply Chains with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore (sponsored by Fujitsu)

title: Transform multimodal data with Amazon Bedrock Data automation
abstract: Transform unstructured, multimodal content (audio, documents, images, video) into rich enterprise insights using Bedrock Data Automation's unified API for intelligent document processing, media analysis, and conversation analytics. Learn to seamlessly ingest these insights into RAG workflows using Bedrock Knowledge Bases. Work with AWS experts to process multimodal content including video ads, call recordings, and complex documents, transforming data into valuable outputs. Discover how processed content powers high-performing generative AI applications with more accurate responses, and build an end-to-end content processing pipeline that enhances your AI applications.

title: Transitioning VMware workloads: VMC-A to AWS EVS
abstract: Ready to evolve your VMware strategy on AWS? Join this interactive chalk talk to explore migrating from VMware Cloud on AWS (VMC-A) to Amazon Elastic Virtualization Service (EVS). Through collaborative discussion and white boarding, discover the benefits, challenges, and best practices for this transition. Learn to assess your current VMC-A environment, plan your migration strategy, and leverage AWS tools to streamline the move. Share experiences with peers and AWS experts as you map out your path to EVS and develop a tailored roadmap for your organization.

title: Translating Security Metrics into Business Outcomes
abstract: Today CISOs face the challenge of translating complex security data into business value. This session reveals proven frameworks for transforming security metrics into strategic insights that drive boardroom decisions. Learn how leading organizations leverage AWS Security Hub, OpenSearch and Security Analytics and automation to build real-time risk dashboards that demonstrate security's business impact. Walk away with practical strategies for evolving your security program from operational metrics to business outcomes, enabling data-driven investment decisions and measurable risk reduction that resonates with executives.

title: Troubleshooting database performance issues at scale
abstract: Managing database fleets at scale means finding that one problematic instance among hundreds before it impacts customers. This lightning talk demonstrates how to rapidly identify and resolve performance bottlenecks across diverse Aurora and RDS database engines. Learn to leverage CloudWatch Database Insights for fleet-wide monitoring, SQL-level diagnostics with execution plans and lock analysis, and performance trend analysis. The session reveals practical techniques for correlating application signals with database metrics, analyzing slow queries, performance troubleshooting workflows.

title: Troubleshooting in the cloud with Amazon Q
abstract: Learn how to troubleshoot large-scale AWS environments by combining conventional techniques with cutting-edge generative AI technologies. We'll begin by examining time-tested troubleshooting methodologies and tools, including log and metrics analysis through Amazon CloudWatch, AWS Config, and AWS X-Ray. Then, through hands-on scenarios, you'll learn how Amazon Q transforms the troubleshooting experience by providing contextual AI-powered diagnostics tailored to your specific environment. Choose your preferred domain - networking, containers, databases, or serverless/DevOps - and work on triaging real-world issues using generative AI and best practices shared during the workshop. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Trust and Transparency: Implementing Scalable Data Lineage for AI/ML
abstract: In the age of AI, can you prove where your data came from, how it was transformed and its quality? Join us for an immersive workshop where you’ll master data lineage and quality in AWS. Get hands-on with Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio and the OpenLineage standard as you build transparent, traceable data pipelines that tell the complete story of your data’s journey. You’ll learn techniques for tracking data flow across complex workflows to support compliance, impact analysis, and troubleshooting. Walk away with practical strategies to implement enterprise-grade data lineage and quality that builds stakeholder confidence in your AI systems and data assets. Perfect for data engineers and architects who want to elevate their practices from a black box to a glass box of transparency and trust.

title: Turbocharge the mainframe to cloud journey with AWS Transform's agentic AI
abstract: Join two industry leaders as they share how they reimagined their mainframe-based mission-critical systems. Dive deep into their transformation journey, exploring crucial architectural decisions, risk mitigation strategies, and lessons learned. Discover how they leveraged AWS Transform's automated code analysis, documentation, and business rules extraction, paired with other AWS developer tools, to achieve efficiency gains in reverse engineering, forward engineering, and testing. Whether you're at that starting line or already moving through your modernization journey, this session offers valuable insights from organizations that have successfully accelerated from legacy systems with AWS Transform.

title: Turning Complexity into Effortless CX with Amazon Connect (sponsored by NTT DATA)
abstract: Discover how Amazon Connect, an AI-driven, composable, and industry-leading platform—paired with NTT DATA’s end-to-end lifecycle services’ balanced approach to AI innovation and human expertise—can unlock new levels of customer experience (CX), simplify complexity, and boost operational efficiency. NTT DATA leverages Amazon Connect to deliver flexible, composable CX solutions that scale with your business. This session will showcase real-world use cases where organizations have transformed their CX through intelligent automation, seamless integration, and AI-driven insights—equipping you with practical strategies to accelerate innovation, reduce costs, and deliver exceptional, personalized interactions at scale. This presentation is brought to you by NTT DATA, an AWS Partner.

title: Turn unstructured data in Amazon S3 into AI-ready assets with SageMaker Catalog
abstract: Unstructured data often holds untapped value, and Amazon SageMaker makes it possible to turn that data into insights and AI-ready assets. In this session, you'll learn how to bring unstructured data from Amazon S3 into SageMaker, create searchable assets, and build knowledge bases for Amazon Bedrock to improve retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) accuracy. Discover how teams can collaborate across roles, data users can self-serve to find and understand the right data, and governance ensures that the right people get the right access. Bayer will share how they use these capabilities to unlock unstructured data and accelerate research and innovation.

title: UCLA’s AI Assistant: Reimagining Student Success with Kyndryl & AWS (sponsored by Kyndryl)
abstract: UCLA partnered with Kyndryl and AWS to deploy a Generative AI assistant that transformed their MBA program operations—consolidating fragmented data across multiple platforms into a single, intelligent system that transformed the student journey - from enrollment through career placement - with personalized insights. The solution employs machine learning algorithms to deliver personalized guidance at scale, maintaining IS-3 security compliance while processing sensitive academic and career data. The result: streamlined operations, enhanced alumni engagement, and a replicable framework that's setting new industry standards for AI-powered student services. This presentation is brought to you by Kyndryl, an AWS Partner.

session.title: UCLA’s AI Assistant: Reimagining Student Success with Kyndryl & AWS (sponsored by Kyndryl)
UCLA’s AI Assistant: Reimagining Student Success with Kyndryl & AWS (sponsored by Kyndryl)

title: UC San Diego Health modernizes patient engagement with Amazon Connect
abstract: Healthcare organizations struggle with disconnected administrative systems and manual processes that create inefficient patient experiences and operational bottlenecks. Join UC San Diego Health to learn how they implemented an AI-powered patient engagement solution using Amazon Connect to address complex administrative processes through a unified patient engagement journey across the health system. We'll demonstrate the implementation of Amazon Connect with Epic EHR integration to enable self-service patient authentication and appointment information retrieval.

title: Understanding AWS Lambda event source mapping
abstract: Gain a deep understanding of how AWS Lambda uses event source mapping to retrieve items from streams and queues. Explore the inner workings of event source mapping and how its behavior differs across seven different streaming and queuing services, such as Amazon Kinesis and Amazon SQS. Leave this talk with practical insights into optimizing your serverless data pipelines by making the most of event source mapping's capabilities and service-specific nuances.

title: Understanding the deep security controls within Amazon Q Business
abstract: Generative AI applications have captured widespread attention; however, they have also introduced new security challenges, especially around the handling of customer data. Organizations want to ensure that their data remains safe and secure while working with foundation models (FMs) and don�t want to worry about their data being used to train an FM. Amazon Q Business provides comprehensive data protection and privacy. In this chalk talk, explore architectures and data flows while you learn about the security-related capabilities of Amazon Q Business.

title: Under the hood: Architecting Amazon EKS for scale and performance
abstract: Amazon EKS continues to push the boundaries of what's possible. Join this session to understand the engineering principles and design decisions that drive Amazon EKS's evolution to support massive scale while maintaining simplicity and reliability. We'll highlight key Kubernetes control plane performance improvements and storage layer optimizations made to support ultra-scale clusters of up to 100k nodes. We'll also share our approach to providing customers more flexibility and choice over their control plane's performance and capacity.

title: Under the hood with Amazon EBS: Achieving sub-millisecond latency at scale
abstract: Amazon EBS powers mission-critical applications with consistent sub-millisecond latency across millions of volumes. This session offers a behind-the-scenes look at the architectural innovations and engineering practices that make this possible. Learn how EBS leverages the AWS Nitro System, purpose-built hardware, and advanced I/O path optimizations to deliver reliable low-latency performance at hyperscale. Gain insights into how these capabilities translate into performance benefits for databases, analytics platforms, and latency-sensitive workloads.

title: Unified knowledge access: Bridging data with generative AI agents
abstract: As organizations mature their generative AI strategy, more complex use cases emerge. Originally focused on unstructured data, organizations now require structured data as a source of knowledge for AI applications. This session will showcase a method for storing and accessing structured and unstructured data in tandem through an AI agent. Learn how to put text data into a vector store and create a text-to-SQL system with advanced knowledge bases, then efficiently direct user questions using AI agents for a smooth user experience. This approach demonstrates how to leverage both structured and unstructured data sources to enhance the capabilities of generative AI systems in enterprise environments.

title: Unified Namespace: Simplifying Manufacturing Data Integration
abstract: A Unified Namespace (UNS) serves as a standardized architecture that connects disparate manufacturing systems, enabling seamless communication and real-time data integration across the factory floor. This session explores UNS implementation in manufacturing, focusing on three critical areas: desiging namespace hierarchies, establishing data flow patterns, and integrating existing systems. Using AWS IoT Core, Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK), AWS IoT SiteWise, and Amazon S3 Tables, we demonstrate proven solutions for data latency, scaling, and security challenges. Join us for an open discussion that will help shape your approach to UNS implementation.

title: Unify Data for a Strong AI Foundation with AWS & Salesforce (sponsored by Salesforce)
abstract: Unify data across AWS and within Salesforce without complex, costly replication, using Zero Copy data integration between Salesforce Data Cloud and AWS. This presentation is brought to you by Salesforce, an AWS Partner.

title: Unifying AI/ML operations with SageMaker HyperPod and Amazon EKS
abstract: As organizations scale AI/ML operations, they can leverage the optimized infrastructure of SageMaker HyperPod or build custom workflows on Amazon EKS. In this session, we'll demonstrate how these approaches represent complementary paths to AI success. While SageMaker HyperPod provides pre-configured, optimized environments for distributed training with seamless integration into the SageMaker ecosystem, Amazon EKS offers the flexibility to build custom AI/ML infrastructures with granular control. We'll explore real-world architectures showing how organizations can leverage both HyperPod's automated cluster management and optimized libraries alongside EKS's extensible Kubernetes foundation.

title: Unifying AWS observability, logs, and traces with Dynatrace (sponsored by Dynatrace)
abstract: Learn how Dynatrace Grail® and Davis® AI provide a unified approach to logs, metrics, and traces across Amazon Web Services. Eliminate monitoring silos, gain real-time insights, and speed up root-cause analysis with expert strategies for streamlined observability and enhanced AWS operations. This presentation is brought to you by Dynatrace, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Unifying AWS observability, logs, and traces with Dynatrace (sponsored by Dynatrace)

title: Unifying data platforms for generative AI-ready financial systems
abstract: Financial institutions are transforming fragmented data environments to enable generative AI capabilities across their technology landscape. In this chalk talk, we'll architect solutions that integrate existing AWS native and AWS partners data platform with AWS Glue Data Catalog, AWS Lake Formation, and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Together, we'll walk through patterns using Iceberg REST API to unify metadata federation and create seamless data views across systems. Attendees will leave with a better understanding of architectural patterns that transform fragmented data environments into an intelligent, unified platform ready for generative AI at scale.

title: Unifying Educational Content Analysis with Bedrock, Agents & Nova
abstract: Educational institutions face challenges extracting actionable insights from disparate lecture recordings, learning materials, and student-generated content. In this session, discover how to orchestrate coordinated, cross-modal analysis by leveraging multi-agent architectures with Amazon Strands SDK, powered by Amazon Bedrock and Nova models. Learn how specialized agents can collaboratively process and synthesize video, audio, and text data, unlocking deeper insights into student engagement and comprehension. Through real-world examples and step-by-step demonstrations, gain hands-on experience building unified, agentic AI solutions that transform your institution’s educational analytics.

title: United Airlines, Deloitte & AWS GenAI-Powered Mainframe Emulator (sponsored by Deloitte)
abstract: Through United Airlines’ MOSAIC initiative to retire its legacy mainframe, SHARES, and transition to cloud-native platforms, we are collaborating to help them modernize a critical mainframe application used by 55,000+ employees. The legacy tool “Green Screen” requires coded inputs and extensive training. To replace it, United is developing a Generative AI-powered interface, allowing agents to complete essential transactions using natural language. The new tool will serve as a backup when frontline systems go offline and be utilized as a primary interface in key operational scenarios. By making complex workflows accessible to all agent profiles, this solution can help enhance United’s efficiency, resilience, and customer service. This presentation is brought to you by Deloitte, an AWS Partner.

session.title: United Airlines, Deloitte & AWS GenAI-Powered Mainframe Emulator (sponsored by Deloitte)
United Airlines, Deloitte & AWS GenAI-Powered Mainframe Emulator (sponsored by Deloitte)

title: Universal connectivity with zero-ETL and AWS Glue
abstract: Learn how AWS can help you with data integration and preparing data for analytics, machine learning (ML) and generative AI workloads. Explore new capabilities that enable your users to have controlled access to all relevant data, easily build and maintain scalable and resilient data pipelines, and enhance decision-making quality, all with exceptional price performance.

title: Unleash Apache Kafka's elasticity and cost-efficiency with Amazon MSK
abstract: Learn how to quickly create a fully managed Apache Kafka cluster with Amazon MSK, and experience the auto-balancing simplicity of scaling your cluster to meet throughput demands. This session provides practical insights and hands-on experience to migrate your Apache Kafka cluster to Amazon MSK, optimize your Kafka deployments for different types of workloads, enabling you to make informed decisions for your streaming needs. By the end of this session, you'll build efficient and scalable data streaming solutions.

services: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK)

title: Unleashing AWS agility with Terraform
abstract: In this session, discover how to leverage Terraform to streamline infrastructure provisioning on AWS. Learn to define your desired AWS resource state using Terraform's human-readable configuration files, enabling consistent and repeatable deployments. Explore the power of Terraform modules for code reuse, organization, and maintainability. Understand how to structure your Terraform codebase into reusable modules, promoting collaboration and standardization across your organization. Unlock the full potential of Terraform on AWS, enabling you to build, change, and version your infrastructure with confidence, agility, and scalability.

title: Unleashing Generative AI for Amazon Ads at Scale
abstract: Discover how Amazon Ads harnesses the power of large language models (LLMs) to enhance shopper discovery and drive better outcomes for advertisers. This session explores the AWS-based machine learning infrastructure that fuels these innovations, including fine-tuning, model serving, and real-time inference at scale. Learn how we optimized cost, latency, and reliability to deliver LLM-powered solutions across the Amazon Ads ecosystem while maintaining the high performance our customers expect.

title: Unleashing Performance: How Intel Xeon 6 on AWS EC2 Is Redefining Compute & TCO (sponsored by Intel)
abstract:
Join Intel and AWS leadership for an exclusive deep dive into the transformative power of the latest generation of Intel Xeon 6-powered AWS EC2 instances. Discover how these cutting-edge compute platforms are delivering unprecedented performance, scalability, and total cost of ownership (TCO) benefits for enterprises running on AWS.
This session will showcase real-world success stories from our top customers who are harnessing the exclusive synergy of Intel and AWS to accelerate innovation, optimize workloads, and unlock new levels of efficiency. From high-performance computing to AI/ML and enterprise applications, learn how the newest EC2 instances are setting a new standard for cloud infrastructure.
Whether you're a CTO, cloud architect, or business leader, this session will equip you with insights to make smarter infrastructure decisions and stay ahead in a compute-driven world. Join us to unleash to power of compute on your cloud! This presentation is brought to you by Intel, an AWS Partner.

title: Unleash Rust's potential on AWS
abstract: Rust's safety, performance, and reliability make it an ideal choice for cloud applications on AWS. From Amazon Aurora DSQL to AWS Firecracker and AWS Bottlerocket, AWS has demonstrated Rust's capabilities in critical infrastructure. This session explores practical applications of Rust, demonstrating serverless implementations and concurrent processing patterns. Discover how Rust's memory safety and efficient abstractions enhance AWS applications. From AWS Lambda functions to distributed systems, learn to build high-performance solutions with Rust.

title: Unlock AI Innovation on AWS with Heroku (sponsored by Heroku from Salesforce)
abstract: Accelerate your AI application development on AWS with Heroku, a fully-managed cloud application AI PaaS. Learn how to easily integrate leading AI models and build intelligent workflows using your familiar languages, while gaining control over costs and customization. Discover how Heroku's streamlined infrastructure frees your team to focus on AI innovation and faster iteration on AWS, without the overhead of managing complex AI infrastructure. Join us to learn how you can empower your cloud-native applications with the potential of AI through Heroku's intuitive platform. This presentation is brought to you by Heroku from Salesforce, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Unlock AI Innovation on AWS with Heroku (sponsored by Heroku from Salesforce)

title: Unlock carbon & cost insights: Optimize spend and drive sustainability
abstract: Since the early days of cloud adoption, many AWS customers have developed FinOps best practices to manage and optimize costs. While the AWS Cost and Usage Reports (CUR) are commonly used, their usage data contains untapped insights. In this two-hour, hands-on workshop, you’ll learn how to query and analyze emissions and CUR data efficiently. We’ll introduce the Cloud Intelligence Dashboards and demonstrate how to customize them. Through practical examples and interactive exercises, you’ll learn to visualize cloud usage, uncover optimization opportunities, and make data-driven decisions that support both cost efficiency and sustainability goals.

title: Unlock contact center insights with Amazon Connect
abstract: Join this interactive session to master Amazon Connect's built-in reporting capabilities to extract valuable insights from your contact center data. Learn to analyze key performance indicators and visualize trends using native features, enabling data-driven decisions without external systems. You'll gain practical knowledge to optimize operations, enhance agent performance, and improve customer experiences through effective use of both historical and real-time reporting tools.

title: Unlock Cost Efficiency with AWS Graviton Savings Dashboard
abstract: The Graviton Savings Dashboard offers a comprehensive analysis of your compute usage, identifying prime candidates for Graviton migration. The Graviton Savings Dashboard now provides deeper analytics for workload modernization, helping customers maximize their migration investments. Organizations using Graviton continue to achieve up to 40% better price performance, with new features enabling granular workload analysis and simplified migration planning. Learn how to leverage advanced dashboard capabilities to accelerate your cost optimization journey, identify new optimization opportunities, and create data-driven migration strategies that deliver measurable business impact. This lightning talk demonstrates how to turn efficiency insights into actionable migration plans.

title: Unlock development value in the age of AI-driven strategies
abstract:
Development teams are under pressure to deliver more and faster but recent studies show developers report losing over 22% of their time to inefficiencies, leading to mediocre developer experience and costing enterprises millions in lost productivity and delayed innovation. With the introduction of developer focused AI tooling and autonomous AI agents the situation gets even more complex.
In this chalk talk we explore the value of a structured approach to showing the value of your development organization. Taking guidance from frameworks like DORA, SPACE and Amazons Cost To Serve - Software, this talk provides you with the insights you need to accelerate your journey to show the value of developer experience.

title: Unlock distributed GenAI inference with Amazon EKS Hybrid Nodes
abstract: Join this interactive chalk talk to explore how Amazon EKS Hybrid Nodes enables GenAI inference anywhere. We'll discuss reference architectures for adding on-prem GPUs to your compute capacity pool, and for running real-time data capture and processing at the edge. You'll learn how EKS Hybrid Nodes enables seamless integration between the cloud and your on-prem or edge environments. We’ll also explore a real-world scenario, showcasing how on-premises GPUs can be integrated into EKS clusters to accelerate GenAI inferencing.

title: Unlocking agentic AI access for microservices
abstract: Agentic AI is redefining system interactions, with autonomous agents planning, reasoning, and taking action by calling APIs directly. This session demonstrates how to make existing services agent-compatible using AgentCore Gateway on AWS. Learn to expose REST, GraphQL, and event-driven protocols as callable tools, enable secure LLM access, and implement schema-based discovery. Explore patterns for observability and multi-step workflow chaining that enable rapid agent integration without refactoring existing services. Discover practical approaches to transform existing APIs into agent-ready interfaces that scale.

title: Unlocking business value by integrating SAP and non-SAP data sources
abstract: Leading enterprises are gaining competitive advantage by seamlessly integrating their SAP and non-SAP data assets to drive actionable insights. This expert panel explores how industry leaders created an innovation platform to maximize the value of their enterprise data. They will share their experiences, best practices, and practical approaches for building a cohesive data strategy that transforms enterprise data into strategic business value.

title: Unlocking Business Value with Cloud Security (sponsored by Tenable)
abstract: Cloud security is more than a safeguard—it’s a business enabler. By reducing risk through misconfiguration fixes, privilege controls, and vulnerability management, organizations can protect critical assets and data. Continuous compliance monitoring simplifies meeting internal and external standards. Operational efficiency improves with automation, actionable insights, and integration into CI/CD pipelines. From securing AI workloads to enforcing least privilege and mitigating the blast radius of threats, our solution aligns cloud protection with the outcomes leaders care about most: reduced risk, stronger compliance, and optimized operations. This presentation is brought to you by Tenable, an AWS Partner.

title: Unlocking Enterprise Resilience: AI and Automation in Action (sponsored by PagerDuty)
abstract: Discover how NVIDIA and Okta are harnessing AI to redefine digital operations and reimagine incident management in the AI era. As enterprises embed AI to drive efficiency, innovation, and competitive advantage, the challenge becomes scaling it at the speed of change. With fewer humans in the loop, resilience strategies must adapt. Learn how incident management is evolving to rapidly detect, diagnose, and resolve issues within AI systems—preventing cascading failures across critical infrastructure and safeguarding customer experience and business continuity. See what it takes to thrive in a world where AI is both the engine and the environment of modern operations. This presentation is brought to you by PagerDuty, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Unlocking Enterprise Resilience: AI and Automation in Action (sponsored by PagerDuty)

title: Unlocking GenAI potential with automated modernization to AWS  (sponsored by Impetus Technologies, Inc.)
abstract: As a Premier AWS Consulting Partner and MAP-approved provider, Impetus leverages its expertise in data, cloud, and AI to help organizations modernize their ecosystems into scalable, GenAI-ready platforms. LeapLogic, Impetus’ data platform modernization solution, automates up to 95% of legacy workload transformation to an AWS-native stack, spanning data warehouse, ETL, Hadoop, analytics, orchestration, and BI workloads while reducing risk and manual effort. Join us to discover how Impetus' LeapLogic accelerates transformation with accuracy and reliability, sharing real-world success stories from Fortune 500 enterprises. Explore how automated modernization to AWS can become the catalyst for unlocking GenAI’s transformative potential.This presentation is brought to you by Impetus Technologies, Inc., an AWS Partner.

session.title: Unlocking GenAI potential with automated modernization to AWS  (sponsored by Impetus Technologies, Inc.)

title: Unlocking possibilities with AWS Compute
abstract: Join Willem Visser, Vice President of Amazon EC2 Core Platform, for an inside look at AWS's transformative compute innovations across instances, containers, and serverless technologies. Willem will explore how customer obsession led to implementing radical new ideas that revolutionized cloud computing, and will be joined by Barry Cooks, Vice President of Serverless Compute Services at AWS. Discover how AWS's comprehensive compute capabilities enable you to build, run, and scale breakthrough applications in the cloud and at the edge.

title: Unlocking Q Business embedded capabilities for your business solutions
abstract: Join this session to explore Q-ISV and Q Business embedded capabilities. We'll collaboratively diagram scalable architectures, authentication patterns, and data integration approaches. Learn to optimize embedded scenarios using APIs and SDKs while maintaining security and performance. Through hands-on discussion, we'll solve real implementation challenges and design solutions for various business scenarios. This session is ideal for architects, technical leaders, and developers seeking to enhance their applications with embedded capabilities.

title: Unlock Innovation: A Guide to AWS Partner Products in AWS Marketplace
abstract: Cloud marketplaces have become a preferred destination for software, services, and data procurement. AWS Partners offer solutions that are key to many organizations' cloud and digital strategies. Organizations are modernizing how they acquire, deploy, and govern these solutions through AWS Marketplace to accelerate innovation. In this session, AWS Marketplace experts will share how they have helped organizations transform the management of Partner solutions throughout their AWS innovation journeys. They will discuss specific examples of streamlining procurement, improving deployment efficiency, and enhancing governance practices.

title: Unlock intelligent AI with MCP powered agentic Neptune graph reasoning
abstract: In this hands-on workshop build  powerful generative AI applications by combining the capabilities of  Amazon Neptune, generative AI, LLMs, and Model Context Protocol (MCP).  Graph based agentic reasoning represents a breakthrough in empowering AI  systems to dynamically interact with the rich context and relationships in  an Amazon Neptune graph. This approach enables intelligent, flexible, and  scalable AI solutions that can extract valuable insights from complex,  interconnected data. Through guided exercises, you'll construct autonomous  AI workflows that extract actionable insights from complex graph  relationships and focus on building an agent that leverages public EDGAR  data to find investment analysis trends.

title: Unlock intelligent generative AI-powered email with Amazon Connect
abstract: Attend this hands-on workshop to explore how combining Amazon Connect email capabilities with generative AI can improve customer experience and drive operational efficiency. Through practical examples, learn to create intelligent workflows that automatically analyze emails, extract key information, and generate personalized responses. This session will demonstrate techniques for email categorization, entity extraction, and handling ambiguous communications through AI-powered email intent detection. Leave with hands-on experience creating email automation solutions that enhance both agent efficiency and customer satisfaction while improving service workflow efficiency.

title: Unlock interoperability: Build your first MCP server
abstract: Dive deep into the architecture behind Model Context Protocol (MCP) in this hands-on session. You'll construct a custom MCP server from the ground up, discovering how modern AI systems communicate. Using Kiro you'll learn the insider techniques for building robust, scalable model servers. Perfect for architects and developers ready to peek behind the AI curtain.

title: Unlock New Business by Removing Data Silos with Zero-Copy
abstract: Enterprises need to unify fragmented data to accelerate launch of AI applications, where some data reside in their AWS environments and some in their accounts in SaaS platforms. Leading ISVs, such as Salesforce, have partnered with AWS to solve this challenge for their customers by building Zero-Copy data federation between their SaaS platforms and end customers’ AWS data stores. Join us to explore how you can build such solutions using AWS services such as Amazon SageMaker Lakehouse, Amazon S3, AWS Glue, AWS Lake Formation, Amazon Redshift, and Apache Iceberg, while maintaining governance and real-time synchronization.

title: Unlock productivity: tools and techniques for developers
abstract: Discover how to transform your development workflow and become a productive developer on AWS. This session takes you through a day in the life of a modern application developer using AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, Amazon EventBridge, and AWS Step Functions. From AWS Management Console to IDE and IaC, this session showcases the latest developer experience tools and techniques for streamlining application development. Gain actionable insights to simplify your development lifecycle through initialization, build, test, deploy, monitor, and optimize. By the end of this session, you'll have a clear roadmap to deliver high-quality code faster.

title: Unlock sustainability insights: How AI enables AWS carbon management
abstract: Discover how AWS is revolutionizing sustainability analytics with the innovative iSDP initiative, which combines Amazon Bedrock's foundation models with our Sustainability Data Models. This session explores how iSDP is making complex sustainability data accessible and actionable for business users across organizations. Learn how non-technical stakeholders can leverage natural language queries to gain rapid insights from intricate datasets, uncover hidden patterns in resource utilization, and understand future sustainability trends. We'll showcase real-world use cases, discuss the impact on AWS' own sustainability goals, and explore the potential of AI-powered sustainability management across various industries.

title: Unlock the power of generative AI for better customer experiences
abstract: Generative AI is reshaping the way we interact with information and tackle complex tasks. Discover how Amazon Q Business' game-changing technology can revolutionize your customer interactions, streamline processes across applications, and deliver personalized experiences that set you apart from your competition. In this session, we'll discuss new Amazon Q Business features enhancing customer experiences and helping applicaitons stay ahead of the curve.

title: Unlock the power of Kiro steering: Your blueprint for scalable development
abstract: Transform your team's development experience with Kiro's powerful steering capabilities. Learn how to create and maintain steering files that act as your project's source of truth, ensuring every team member follows the same conventions for components, API endpoints, and tests. We'll demonstrate how this living documentation evolves alongside your codebase, capturing crucial decisions and patterns while reducing cognitive overhead. Say goodbye to repetitive explanations of coding standards and hello to consistent, automated code generation that perfectly aligns with your team's established workflows and best practices.

title: Unpredictable by Design: Finding Innovation with Generative AI (sponsored by Deloitte)
abstract: Great ideas are often a glitch in the system – a deviation from the plan.  Workflows, meetings, and even code are often designed to reward the predictable, silencing the very thinking that leads to real discovery.  This talk highlights using one system to challenge another—with Generative AI as the “translator” for unconventional thought—to create a space where atypical ideas are essential to creating and sustaining market value.  We’ll explore how AWS solutions can help identify the brilliant glitches in your own organization – inviting the voices you haven’t heard to build the future you haven’t yet imagined. This presentation is brought to you by Deloitte, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Accelerating Engineering: Cross-Industry HPC Cloud Transformations
Unpredictable by Design: Finding Innovation with Generative AI (sponsored by Deloitte)

title: Unveiling Amazon ECS workloads with AWS observability and agentic AI
abstract: As containerized workloads grow in complexity, traditional observability approaches struggle to keep pace. Discover how generative AI transforms Amazon ECS workload observability by turning overwhelming data into actionable insights. This chalk talk demonstrates Amazon CloudWatch Investigations' AI capabilities that automatically analyze container telemetry, generate root-cause hypotheses, and provide targeted remediation suggestions, dramatically reducing MTTR. We'll showcase seamless integration between CloudWatch Investigations, Container Insights, and Amazon Managed Prometheus, building unified solutions that transform reactive monitoring into proactive, intelligent observability of your workloads on Amazon ECS.

title: Upgrade Amazon DataZone to Amazon SageMaker Catalog for analytics and AI
abstract: This session is for Amazon DataZone users who want to get the most from their existing investment. Amazon SageMaker Catalog is built-on DataZone with broader analytics and AI capabilities, while preserving governance and continuity. We’ll walk through how to move curated assets, metadata, glossaries, and subscriptions into SageMaker Catalog while keeping both the DataZone and SageMaker portals available during rollout. You’ll learn practical upgrade patterns, key steps for a smooth transition, and see how customers are extending what they started in DataZone. This is more than an upgrade, it’s about continuing your DataZone journey in SageMaker Catalog with new opportunities for insight and innovation.

title: Use Amazon DynamoDB to enhance agentic AI workflows
abstract: Managing multiple AI agents in production can lead to data inconsistencies, security vulnerabilities, and system failures. Join us in this hands-on session where you will build an agent governance framework using Amazon DynamoDB. You will explore proven patterns for state management, audit logging, and policy enforcement. Learn practical approaches to implementing rate limiting, access controls, and real-time monitoring. You will walk away with practical strategies for monitoring agent behavior and maintaining system integrity in production environments. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Use an AI agent to launch your Aurora DSQL project with Amazon Q & MCP
abstract: In this chalk talk, learn how to enhance your Amazon Aurora DSQL development process using Amazon Q and Model Context Protocol (MCP). Explore business scenarios and architect design solutions that show how AI agents can launch Aurora DSQL clusters, design database schemas, and build database clients through natural language interactions. The talk includes a whiteboarding session on architectural patterns and decision points to get Aurora DSQL projects launched and running efficiently with conversational AI interfaces.

title: Use GraphRAG with Amazon Neptune to improve generative AI applications
abstract: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) applications use the power of generative AI to analyze private datasets. GraphRAG combines knowledge graphs with RAG to produce explainable responses that are grounded in the semantic relationships between concepts, entities, and the underlying content. In this builders' session, learn how to use the open source AWS GraphRAG Toolkit to transform unstructured and semi-structured data into a catalog of domain-specific GraphRAG tools that can be used in RAG applications and agentic workflows for tackling complex information tasks. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Use serverless knowledge graphs for hybrid search with Amazon Neptune
abstract: In this chalk talk, explore how to build a scalable serverless hybrid search application that combines vectors and graph data. Learn how this approach empowers you to leverage the benefits of vector-based search with the rich relationships defined in graphs to provide more comprehensive and explainable answers. Discover how to use Amazon Neptune Serverless to architect a hybrid search application and learn multiple approaches for combining vectors with graph data and the associated trade-offs. Leave this talk understanding the power of combining vectors and graph data to build scalable serverless hybrid search applications.

title: Use your FSx file data to build custom gen AI apps
abstract: Learn to use Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with your proprietary data and business context stored in Amazon S3 and Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP. This approach enables more relevant, context-specific, and accurate customer responses. Gain hands-on experience using AWS serverless services with FSx for ONTAP and Amazon Bedrock to enable automatic scaling, event-driven compute, and API interfaces for gen AI applications. Explore how enterprise customers leverage S3 and ONTAP file systems with Bedrock to transform corporate data into powerful gen AI solutions.

title: Using AI to bridge the multicloud skills gap in IT operations
abstract: Organizations with multicloud environments often face a skills gap related to running production-grade operations in multiple clouds. In this lightning talk, we will present a practical approach to addressing the skills gap using proven processes, automation, and agentic AI tools for IT operations. We will dive deep into how to support the multicloud operations team using capabilities and services such as Amazon Bedrock, Amazon DevOps Guru, Amazon CloudWatch, and AWS Systems Manager. We will demo this paradigm based on a typical workflow for managing an application in a multicloud environment.

title: Using AI to improve humanitarian workload resilience
abstract: Almost everyone has experienced a bad IT day, when systems fail in unpredictable ways. For organizations operating in a humanitarian crisis, contextual continuity is mission critical. In this code talk, we'll explore how generative AI can help build more resilient humanitarian systems. Drawing from Werner Vogels' wisdom that "everything fails, all the time, so plan for failure and nothing will fail", we'll demonstrate practical techniques for identifying and mitigating potential system failures. Through live coding, attendees will learn to leverage AI to anticipate and address vulnerabilities, ensuring more robust and reliable humanitarian technology.

title: Using Amazon Q to Cost Optimize Your Containerized Workloads
abstract: Are you looking to cost optimize your containerized workloads? Adopting Amazon EKS with Karpenter on AWS Graviton can help you get up to 40% better price performance. In this workshop, you�ll use Amazon Q to accelerate migrating an app running on x86 to Graviton. You'll start with local performance tests followed by the CI/CD pipeline modifications to build and deploy multi architecture application to EKS using Karpenter. With Amazon Q, you'll identify improvement opportunities to get better performance on Graviton. You�ll also dive deep into efficiently deploying your application to an EKS cluster using Karpenter. Requires laptop to participate.

title: Using Amazon S3 Batch Operations to operate on up to billions of objects
abstract: Learn how S3 Batch Operations enables you to manage massive-scale workloads of up to 20 billion objects through a single request. In this chalk talk, we’ll explore practical implementations of S3 Batch Operations, including copying objects between staging and production buckets, restoring archived backups from Amazon S3 Glacier storage classes, and verifying the content of stored datasets using the compute checksum operation. You’ll learn architectural best practices, performance optimization techniques, and the underlying mechanisms that make these large-scale operations possible. Join us to share your own use cases and learn how other customers are using S3 Batch Operations to solve complex data management challenges.

services: Amazon Simple Storage Service Glacier (Amazon S3 Glacier)

title: Using event-driven architectures to modernize legacy applications at scale
abstract: Want to modernize your monolithic applications but unsure where to start? Event-driven architecture (EDA) offers a powerful approach to decomposing complex systems into small, decoupled services that can scale independently.  In this session, learn about common design trade-offs for distributed systems and how to navigate them with design patterns, illustrated by real-world examples, learn how to apply integration patterns in complex use cases.

title: Using generative AI to accelerate database modernization with AWS DMS
abstract: Does the thought of modernizing your application and database architecture fill you with concern? In this code talk, learn how to overcome common migration issues and concerns that arise during modernization projects. See live coding examples to learn how to use generative AI and the AWS DMS Schema Conversion feature to successfully modernize your database.

title: Using generative AI to automate architectural guidance
abstract: AI-powered systems are revolutionizing how organizations develop and verify architectural guidance, replacing time-intensive manual processes. This chalk talk demonstrates how AI technologies generate strategic recommendations, design principles, and best practices at scale. Explore real-world patterns for AI-driven guidance systems, examining their benefits and limitations. Learn effective strategies for building knowledge bases, maintaining human oversight, ensuring accuracy, and addressing ethical considerations in AI-generated architectural guidance. Discover practical approaches to implementing automated guidance while maintaining governance and quality.

title: Using graphs over your data lake to power generative AI applications
abstract: In this session, learn about new Amazon Neptune capabilities for high-performance graph analytics and queries over data lakes to unlock the implicit and explicit relationships in your data, driving more accurate, trustworthy generative AI responses. We'll demonstrate building knowledge graphs from structured and unstructured data, combining graph algorithms (PageRank, Louvain clustering, path optimization) with semantic search, and executing Cypher queries on Parquet and Iceberg formats in Amazon S3. Through code samples and benchmarks, learn advanced architectures to use Neptune for multi-hop reasoning, entity linking, and context enrichment at scale. This session assumes familiarity with graph concepts and data lake architectures.

title: Using Strands to build fully autonomous, self-improving AI agents
abstract: Explore the cutting edge of AI with Strands Agents—autonomous systems that evolve and learn continuously. We'll demonstrate advanced agents that can identify knowledge gaps, self-modify reasoning strategies, and dynamically build tools. These systems learn from interactions, improving decision-making without human intervention while communicating through multiple protocols and real-time, bi-directional streaming. Using Strands' model-driven approach, agents operate independently for extended periods, continuously enhancing effectiveness. Through real-world examples, see how self-improving agents have transformed business processes by adapting to changing requirements automatically. Join us to challenge conventional thinking about agent limitations and reshape your approach to building truly autonomous AI systems.

title: Utilizing AWS GenAI to deliver enterprise data modernization in CommBank (sponsored by HCLTech)
abstract: Discover how HCLTech helped Commonwealth Bank of Australia achieve enterprise-wide digital transformation by migrating over 25PB data and approximately 66k jobs to AWS. This session will also showcase how HCLTech built multiple automation solutions on Amazon Bedrock, SageMaker, and HCLTech AI Force™ to drive over 30% productivity and efficiency during the delivery cycle. This presentation is brought to you by HCLTech, an AWS Partner.

title: Vector search with Amazon OpenSearch Service
abstract: With Amazon OpenSearch Service’s vector database capabilities you can implement Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with Large Language Models (LLMs). Join this session to build a RAG-based, contextually aware, conversational search solution using OpenSearch vector database for document embedding and LLM content generation with context.

title: Vibe coding production-ready containerized applications
abstract: In this session, explore how Amazon Q integrated with the Amazon ECS Model Context Protocol (MCP) server streamlines application development and cloud deployments. Participants will create production-ready, well-architected environments using natural language prompts—no manual configuration or lengthy IaC manual templates required. Experience how this groundbreaking integration automatically implements AWS best practices while accelerating deployment timelines. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Vibe data modeling with Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: In this session master practical Amazon DynamoDB data modeling through an innovative "vibe modeling" approach using Model Context Protocol (MCP). Learn to architect complex data models that use sophisticated techniques right inside an AI-powered IDE. Through guided exercises, optimize access patterns and leverage secondary indexes effectively. Build models by expressing application requirements in natural language, documented by AI to generate a DynamoDB data model for review. In this session, learn how AI-assisted database design can accelerate complex NoSQL modeling decisions. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Vibin' with Claude
abstract: Master the art of AI pair programming by building a complete application using Anthoropic Claude, with zero prior CDK knowledge. In this hands-on session, participants will learn advanced prompting techniques, MCP integration, and research tools to guide Claude through creating a production-ready serverless application. Starting with just a business requirement, you'll discover how to leverage Claude to build and deploy an application that includes multiple AWS services, and also how to handle complex tasks like AWS IAM permissions, environment configurations, and CI/CD pipelines. By the end, you'll have gained practical skills to help realize productivity gains in AWS development.

title: Video sampling & search using in-memory DBs & multimodal embeddings
abstract: Multimodal embeddings enable a wide range of video analysis capabilities, from content understanding and summarization to classification and recommendations. In this code talk, learn how to use smart sampling and video search, generating multimodal embeddings in Amazon Bedrock and using in-memory databases. See live coding examples to discover how to build delightful video experiences for your customers.

title: Virtualization Architecture Behind AgentCore's Runtime Security Model
abstract: Journey into the sophisticated virtualization architecture that powers AgentCore's runtime security model. This session examines the intricate mechanics of session isolation at the virtualization layer, exploring advanced techniques in compute and memory virtualization, virtual machine snapshot optimization, and virtual memory deduplication. Drawing from operating systems research and systems security principles, we'll demonstrate how these components work together to create robust security boundaries for agent workloads. Attendees will gain deep technical insights into the mathematical and systems-level concepts that position AWS at the forefront of secure agent runtime architectures, showcasing our industry-leading approach to securing code execution in agent environments.

title: Visualize and optimize spend using Amazon WorkSpaces dashboards
abstract: IT teams face constant pressure to reduce spend while maintaining an exceptional user experience. Unfortunately, they often lack the tools needed to identfiy opporunities for savings and quickly implement changes. In this hands-on session, attendees will build a WorkSpaces dashboard that allows them to easily visualize spend and resource utilization trends, and identify opportunities to right-size resources based on usage patterns and user needs. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Visualize data lake insights with S3 Tables and AWS analytics
abstract: Learn how to build powerful data visualization solutions using Amazon S3 Tables with AWS analytics services. S3 Tables bring fully managed Apache Iceberg tables to Amazon S3, making it easier to query and visualize open data in your data lake. Through interactive discussion and whiteboarding, explore how S3 Tables simplify data access and accelerate queries. See how to structure data for efficient analytics without additional metadata layers, and integrate with Amazon QuickSight and Grafana for rich dashboards. This chalk talk demonstrates practical patterns for implementing self-service analytics, optimizing query performance, and creating scalable visualization solutions.

title: vLLM on AWS: testing to production and everything in between
abstract: This session explores practical architectural patterns for deploying and scaling large language models (LLMs) in production environments. We'll walk through a comprehensive journey from initial testing to production deployment, covering essential steps including model evaluation with vLLM, performance benchmarking, and optimization techniques. Attendees will learn how to implement efficient autoscaling solutions using Ray and vLLM, compare different inference servers like Triton and vLLM, and understand their trade-offs. The session concludes with a deep dive into productionalization using AIBrix, providing attendees with actionable insights for building robust, scalable LLM infrastructures. Suitable for ML engineers and architects working on LLM deployments.

title: VMware to AWS modernization blueprint: Migrate, containerize, scale
abstract: Ready to move beyond VMware? This hands-on workshop delivers the technical blueprint to successfully migrate and modernize workloads on AWS. We'll take you through migrating an application from VMware to Amazon EC2 to containers. Starting with AWS Transform, you'll discover how to leverage agentic AI to migrate VMware workloads to AWS faster and at scale. Then, using Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS), you'll learn to containerize applications, implement microservices, and build scalable, resilient cloud-native solutions. With guidance from AWS experts who successfully helped VMware customers, this workshop help you reimagine your application architecture, optimize infrastructure, and accelerate innovation.

title: VMware to AWS Readiness: Foundational decisions before your migration
abstract: Join this interactive session to explore critical decisions that set successful VMware to AWS migrations apart. We'll examine how early choices across licensing optimization, operating models, technology architecture, and organizational readiness impact your migration timeline, costs, and long-term success. Discover how to assess your VMware environment comprehensively, identifying dependencies and business constraints that guide your cloud strategy. Learn a practical decision framework to build stakeholder alignment, ensure flexibility for future transformation, and avoid critical pitfalls in your migration. Regardless of your pathway to the cloud, this session will help you gain the strategic foundation essential for migration success.

title: Vodafone Romania BSS Modernization on AWS
abstract: Vodafone Romania's journey to modernize their BSS infrastructure showcases a strategic partnership with AWS and Amdocs. This chalk talk details the successful migration of Vodafone's legacy Amdocs BSS stack from on-premises to AWS, with Vodafone managing their own infrastructure. The phased approach began with Billing and Charging systems, followed by an integration layer, and ultimately encompassing Catalogue, CRM, and other critical applications. Despite initial challenges, the three-way collaboration between Vodafone, AWS, and Amdocs overcame numerous obstacles. This transformation highlights the scalability, flexibility, and cost-effectiveness of AWS for telecom operators modernizing their BSS ecosystems.

title: Voice AI restaurant ordering platform powered by Amazon Nova Sonic
abstract: Build a serverless voice AI restaurant ordering system that harnesses the power of Amazon Nova Sonic and key AWS services. Create an intuitive platform that processes natural voice commands using Amazon Bedrock's AI capabilities, while implementing secure user authentication with Amazon Cognito and robust frontend development through AWS Amplify. The architecture seamlessly integrates Amazon API Gateway, AWS Lambda, and Amazon DynamoDB to simulate real-world restaurant ordering system APIs. By session's end, you'll master the implementation of a functional voice-powered ordering solution using cutting-edge AI technology and serverless services.

title: Volkswagen Group's custom GenAI models for global brand consistency
abstract: Discover how Volkswagen Group, delivering 9.0 million vehicles annually across 115 global facilities, ensures brand consistency while scaling global marketing operations. Learn how VW transformed their marketing pipeline through two innovations: custom-finetuned image generation models creating on-brand visual content at scale, and pioneering work with Amazon Nova to automatically evaluate marketing assets against brand guidelines. As Nova's launch partner for customization, VW implemented preference tuning aligning AI with marketing experts' judgment. See how this intelligent system applies VW's unique brand standards across diverse markets, revolutionizing how a leading automaker maintains brand integrity while driving localized engagement.

title: Warner Music Group: Apache Iceberg on AWS & Snowflake (sponsored by Snowflake)
abstract: In the fast-paced world of music and entertainment, data is a critical asset. This session explores how Warner Music Group is using an open-source data format to drive innovation. Join Michael Jones, Director of Software Engineering at Warner Music Group, to learn how Apache Iceberg tables enable an interoperable data ecosystem that unifies first- and third-party sources. By pairing Iceberg with Snowflake’s innovations, Warner Music is unlocking deeper analytics today while also setting the stage for advanced machine learning and AI initiatives on AWS. This presentation is brought to you by Snowflake, an AWS Partner.

title: Weather emergency advisor with Amazon Bedrock and Location Service
abstract: Explore advanced architectural patterns for AI-powered emergency response systems using Amazon Bedrock and serverless technologies. Dive deep into building resilient, scalable, and secure platforms. Discuss sophisticated prompt engineering for emergency context understanding, multi-modal foundation model orchestration, and complex data ingestion for real-time feeds. Examine advanced caching and query optimization for location services and high-availability patterns for mission-critical systems. Through collaborative whiteboarding, address real-world challenges including data consistency, distributed state management, and fault-tolerant notifications. Bring complex architectural questions for in-depth technical discussions on building robust, mission-ready emergency response solutions that can save lives and mitigate disaster impacts.

title: Web3 + AI: Agents that mean business
abstract: AWS is accelerating Web3 development across diverse use cases, including AI agents entering the digital economy, through core infrastructure, specialized offerings, and partner solutions. Join AWS and Coinbase to dive deep into the fundamental building blocks and full-stack architecture where AI agents, powered by Amazon Bedrock, execute digital assets payments using open payment protocols over a public blockchain. To ensure transaction security, these agents are equipped with wallets built on AWS Nitro Enclaves. Join this session to learn how to leverage AWS and Coinbase technologies to shape the future of autonomous online payments.

title: What Database Would Your AI Agents Choose -  Escape the Frankenstack (sponsored by SingleStore)
abstract: Most AI agents run on a stitched-together mix of vector stores, search engines, OLAP systems, and pipelines. It works — until you need real-time reasoning, consistent multi-modal results, or to scale without latency. Hidden costs pile up: data movement, overhead, and specialized skills just to keep it running. In this lightning talk, we’ll share optimizations to the standard approach, highlight signs it’s breaking down, and reveal a unified design that starts from the agent’s needs. Learn how to unify structured, unstructured, and vector data to build and deploy agents faster — without the Frankenstack. This presentation is brought to you by SingleStore, an AWS Partner.

title: What's new in AWS cost Optimization
abstract: Discover the latest advancements in AWS cost optimization strategies and tools designed to help you operate cost-effectively while maintaining high performance. AWS continues to enhance its suite of management tools that monitor resource performance and costs, while providing recommendations for rightsizing and optimizing purchasing decisions. Join us to stay current with the latest best practices and tools for managing your AWS spending efficiently.

title: What's new in AWS Data Processing
abstract: Explore the latest advancements in AWS Analytics designed to transform your data processing landscape.
