This session unveils powerful new capabilities across key services, including Amazon EMR for scalable big data processing, AWS Glue for seamless data integration, Amazon Athena for optimized querying, and Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (MWAA) for workflow orchestration. Discover how these innovations can supercharge performance, optimize costs, and streamline your data ecosystem. Whether you're looking to enhance scalability, improve data integration, accelerate queries, or refine workflow management, join us to gain actionable insights that will position your organization at the forefront of data processing innovation.

title: What’s new in fullstack AWS app development
abstract: Web developers need to deliver differentiating experiences to more users faster than ever before. To build secure, reliable, and scalable applications at 10x speed requires solutions that empower developers to get started easily, ship quickly, and iterate rapidly. In this breakout, we'll share exciting updates on how AWS Amplify is evolving to meet the needs of modern 10x web developers.

title: What’s new in search, observability, and vector databases with OpenSearch
abstract: Discover the latest Amazon OpenSearch Service launches and capabilities that enable and quickly deploy agentic AI applications and vector search operations. Learn how new integrations with Amazon Q enable intelligent data discovery and automated insights, while enhanced Amazon S3 connectivity streamlines data management. This session showcases how our latest vector database optimizations accelerate AI/ML workloads for efficient development of agentic AI, semantic search, and recommendation systems. We'll demonstrate new cost optimization features and performance enhancements across all OpenSearch use cases, including significant updates to Observability. Whether you're building next-generation AI applications or scaling your existing search infrastructure, join us for a comprehensive update on new launches and releases that can transform your search and analytics capabilities.

title: What's new with Amazon EBS
abstract: Stay ahead with the cutting-edge capabilities of Amazon's robust block storage solution in Amazon EBS. Join this session for a comprehensive overview of the latest advancements and features in Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS). Learn about recent performance improvements, cost optimization strategies, new features that enhance data resiliency and storage efficiency, and practical insights for leveraging EBS in modern cloud environments. You will gain a deeper understanding of how to maximize the potential of Amazon EBS for your workloads.

title: What's new with Amazon QuickSight
abstract: Join this session to explore the latest innovations and features in Amazon Quicksight that are revolutionizing generative AI in BI. Expert presenters guide you through the exciting developments in Amazon QuickSight that are empowering organizations to establish robust enterprise Business Intelligence platforms.

title: What's new with Amazon S3
abstract: Amazon S3 consistently delivers new innovations to help you store, manage, analyze, and protect any amount of data for virtually any use case. Discover S3's latest breakthroughs including S3 Tables enhancements delivering fully managed Apache Iceberg support, S3 Vectors with native vector support at scale for AI applications, S3 Metadata for instant data discovery, and S3 Express One Zone's ultra-low latency performance. Learn how these innovations optimize for different data types and workloads, increase performance, simplify operations, and lower costs for analytics, AI/ML, and high-performance computing applications. This session provides implementation strategies, live demonstrations, and practical insights to immediately optimize your data architecture.

title: What's new with Amazon SageMaker in the era of unified data and AI
abstract: Learn the latest in data and AI development with the next generation of Amazon SageMaker. In this session, we'll cover new innovations that are transforming how enterprises build, deploy, and scale AI solutions. Dive deep into the features of SageMaker Unified Studio, discover the latest catalog capabilities, and see how our lakehouse architecture is breaking down silos between data, analytics, and AI. From streamlined development experiences to enterprise-grade governance, you'll discover why forward-looking organizations are making Amazon SageMaker their center for data, analytics, and AI.

title: What's New with AWS Cost Management
abstract: Join us and learn new features in the AWS Cloud Financial Management portfolio that can transform how your organizations analyze, plan, and manage your cloud spending. In this session, explore new advanced data analytics capabilities, enhanced cost allocation features, and improved reporting tools that enable deeper financial insights. Learn how AWS is expanding its FinOps toolset with new AI-powered solutions and sophisticated data management features to support your cloud financial maturity journey.

title: What's new with AWS File Storage
abstract: Amazon file storage services continue to deliver innovations to help enterprise customers and storage admins manage their file data more effectively. Dive into the latest capabilities designed to enhance file data accessibility and integration with modern cloud applications. Discover how shared file storage from Amazon EFS and Amazon FSx is evolving to meet the needs of compute-intensive and data-heavy workloads. Learn actionable insights on optimizing storage, improving data accessibility, and supporting growing enterprise application demands. Join us and move your business ahead with the cutting-edge capabilities of Amazon FSx and Amazon EFS.

title: What's new with AWS Lambda
abstract: Discover the latest innovations in AWS Lambda that go beyond traditional event-driven applications. In this lightning talk, we'll showcase the game-changing capabilities that we just launched at re:Invent. Learn how these features can accelerate your development process and scale your applications effortlessly. Whether you're building proof-of-concept or production-ready solutions, see how Lambda's simplicity and power can help you deliver faster results for web applications, AI solutions, and event processing workloads.

title: When security becomes fashionable: Gymshark's cloud security evolution
abstract: Learn how Gymshark protects its digital retail assets from emerging threats. We'll explore real-world attacks targeting e-commerce platforms, customer data, and intellectual property. Get practical insights on building a security strategy using Security Improvement Plans, AWS Backup, and modern access management to safeguard both creative and customer data.

title: Why customers choose AWS as their transformation partner for SAP
abstract: For decades, SAP has been the business process backbone for leading companies across nearly every industry,, and thousands of customers trust AWS for SAP. However, many customers who are still on-premises, and their impending SAP migration is part of a broader transformation they are undertaking– where SAP is a critical application, but just one of the components of something bigger. In this session, customers will walk through their cloud roadmaps, reflect on their ongoing journeys to RISE with SAP on AWS, and share how they are partnering with Amazon to chart the future for their organization.

title: Why Usage-Based Billing Must Be Treated as Infrastructure (sponsored by Metronome)
abstract: Monetization is now an infrastructure challenge. With usage-based, outcome-based, and hybrid pricing models, billing can’t go down—even if your product does. It underpins revenue, customer experience, and financial reporting. At scale, this means processing millions of interdependent events in real time with four-nines reliability, while ensuring changes cascade across pricing, credits, dashboards, and ledgers. This talk shares the infrastructure principles needed—scalability, reliability, modularity, orchestration, and extensibility—for billing at true scale. This presentation is brought to you by Metronome, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Why Usage-Based Billing Must Be Treated as Infrastructure (sponsored by Metronome)

title: Why Your Processor Matters for AI Inference and General Compute (sponsored by AMD)
abstract: Discover how AMD-powered EC2 instances unlock broader AI access while cutting compute and licensing costs. Learn which AI workloads thrive on CPU inference and how to select instances for optimal performance and efficiency. Join AMD and special guests for a fast-paced session packed with practical strategies to reinvest infrastructure savings into innovation and next-gen AI initiatives. This presentation is brought to you by AMD, an AWS Partner.

session.title: Why Your Processor Matters for AI Inference and General Compute (sponsored by AMD)

title: Winning the DDoS Battle with AWS WAF
abstract: Join this hands-on workshop to learn how to defend your web applications against DDoS attacks and malicious bots using AWS WAF and Amazon CloudFront. You'll build and deploy real-world protections - writing WAF rules to block bot traffic, mitigate volumetric attacks, and apply anti-DDoS resilience patterns at the edge. Walk through threat response strategies, configuration best practices, and monitoring techniques. This session is ideal for builders managing web apps, CDN architectures, and security controls. Bring your laptop - you�ll leave ready to fight back.

title: Work AI that Works: Real Stories & Outcomes of Agentic AI  (sponsored by Glean)
abstract: AI at scale means more than chatbots—it’s agentic platforms that automate end-to-end workflows, securely handle your data, and deliver measurable outcomes. Join Glean for a showcase of forward-thinking leaders who leverage Agentic AI to reshape operations, increase agility, and support strategic planning while maintaining security and compliance. Hear how real companies deploy Glean agents at scale to drive productivity, deliver valuable insights, and automate repetitive or time-consuming tasks. Attendees will learn actionable frameworks for executive buy-in, adoption, and compliance monitoring, and see why Glean is recognized by Gartner, IDC, and Forrester for real value delivered to technology leaders. This presentation is brought to you by Glean, an AWS Partner.

title: Working with S3 Metadata: From basic queries to custom metadata
abstract: Explore practical applications of S3 Metadata's live inventory and journal tables to enhance data discovery and management. Join this technical discussion to understand how these Apache Iceberg tables track object changes and provide current bucket snapshots. Learn to write effective SQL queries using Amazon Athena and other analytics tools, then dive into strategies for integrating your own custom metadata with S3 object attributes. Share your use cases as we examine patterns for combining standard object metadata with application-specific information to build comprehensive data insights. Discuss real-world scenarios for implementing metadata-driven workflows at scale.

title: Wrangling chaos: Atoms of emergence
abstract: Distributed systems are made up of protocols, requests, retries, and feedback loops that can lead to emergent behaviors and metastable failures—even at surprisingly small scales. Through dependent probability, simulation, control theory, and other modeling techniques, discover precisely how counter-intuitive behaviors emerge in websystems. Learn to build stable systems that can wrangle these behaviors in production environments.

title: Write Deploy and Monitor CloudFront Functions & Key Value Store
abstract: Get hands-on with the latest features of Amazon CloudFront Functions in this interactive builder session. You'll write and deploy real-time JavaScript powered by the Key Value Store, enabling ultra-low latency logic at the edge. Explore this year's newest capabilities, learn how to monitor and troubleshoot your functions in production, and harness Amazon Q Developer to accelerate development with AI-powered assistance. Bring your laptop and walk away with practical skills to build, deploy, and optimize edge compute solutions confidently

title: Write less code: Building applications with a serverless mindset
abstract: Building with a serverless mindset focuses on business value. You can derive more value by using built-in integrations between AWS services set up through configuration than by writing glue code. This hands-on session explores patterns for using direct service integrations using Amazon API Gateway, AWS Step Functions, and Amazon EventBridge. Discover the efficiency of utilizing configuration to streamline development tasks, and push the heavy lifting to AWS.

title: Your AI Agent Is Expensive and Wrong (Let's Fix Both) (sponsored by Databricks)
abstract: More than 80% of AI projects fail. The reason? Customers are not ready to put AI in production in areas where the Agent can cause reputational or financial harm. Agent Bricks solves this by automatically generating domain‑specific synthetic data and task‑aware benchmarks, then using those benchmarks to optimize the Agents for accuracy, latency and expense—eliminating the tedious trial‑and‑error cycle. In this session you’ll see how to design and scale multi‑agent systems that combine retrieval, reasoning, and generation to answer complex, enterprise‑grounded queries, while tracking experiments, fine‑tuning models, and building governed, repeatable workflows that can be deployed at scale on AWS. This presentation is brought to you by Databricks, an AWS Partner.

title: Your data is your moat: Integrating AWS-native tools into agents
abstract: Agents are only as useful as the tools they can access. This session will teach you how to extend your agents with first-party AWS tools such as Browser, Code Interpreter, and—most importantly—data access primitives like Aurora, Redshift, and vector-enabled S3. We’ll demonstrate how these services unlock enterprise use cases by giving agents secure, direct access to structured and semi-structured data. Learn how to register these tools with AgentCore Gateway, manage access through Identity, and invoke them via Runtime, all while maintaining compliance and observability. Join us for a deep dive into tool-enabled, data-rich agent design.

title: Zero to launch: Deploy AI agents with AgentCore Runtime and Identity
abstract: Transform your AI prototypes into secure, scalable enterprise applications. In this hands-on workshop you will learn to deploy enterprise-grade agents using AgentCore Runtime, seamlessly scaling from zero to thousands of concurrent sessions while maintaining complete session isolation, and AgentCore Identity to integrate with existing providers for authentication and access control. Through practical exercises, you'll build reliable and secure agents ready for large-scale deployment—all without the complexity of managing infrastructure or developing custom authentication systems.

title: Zero to production: Simplify AI deployments with Amazon EKS Auto Mode
abstract: Ready to run GenAI workloads on Kubernetes without the operational complexity? Join this chalk talk to learn how Amazon EKS Auto Mode simplifies the journey from concept to production for your GenAI projects. Through whiteboarding, we will explore real-world implementations for LLM inference, training pipelines, and RAG applications. Learn how EKS Auto Mode's built-in GPU support, automatic scaling, and managed infrastructure eliminate operational overhead, allowing teams to focus on innovation.

title: Zero-Training Visual Defect Detection Using Amazon Nova
abstract: Transform your visual quality inspection process using Amazon Nova generative AI models, with no extensive image training required. This workshop covers core prompting techniques for quality inspection, defect detection with overlay visualization, and end-to-end solution integration. We will also cover Amazon Bedrock Model Distillation for cost optimization and integration with AWS IoT Greengrass to support low-latency applications and shopfloor deployment. You will leave with practical skills to implement visual quality inspection immediately with no computer vision or data science expertise required. Participants are welcome to bring their own image dataset to test.

title: Zero Trust for Agentic Systems: Managing Non-Human Identities at Scale (sponsored by HashiCorp)
abstract: Agentic systems—AI-driven applications that autonomously act across services—are transforming enterprise workflows, but they also create a surge in non-human identities (NHIs) and secrets that expand the attack surface. In this session, we’ll explore a vulnerable agentic application scenario to illustrate the risks of static credentials, permissive access, and leaked secrets. We’ll then demonstrate how HashiCorp Vault and HCP Vault Radar enable a zero-trust architecture that mitigates these threats while preserving developer agility. Attendees will leave with practical strategies to secure agentic systems from development to production on AWS. This presentation is brought to you by HashiCorp, an AWS Partner.

Zero Trust for Agentic Systems: Managing Non-Human Identities at Scale (sponsored by HashiCorp)

title: Zoox: Building Machine Learning Infrastructure for Autonomous Vehicles
abstract: Discover how Zoox leverages AWS Machine Learning infrastructure to revolutionize autonomous vehicle development. Learn how we process thousands of multi-modal sequences daily using Amazon SageMaker HyperPod, SLURM, FSx, S3, and EKS in a streamlined machine learning environment that supports both rapid experimentation and production-scale training. We'll share how our integrated monitoring solution reduced manual analysis by 85% while scaling to support thousands of vehicle analysis use cases.
